full_review: Not happy with my black ink cartridge I got maybe 2 pages printed then that was it no more black ink !!!!!!! This did not even deserve a star

I only hope that this was a quality assurance rather than a deliberate change of Avery product specifications. I have used these protectors for a at least 5 years and they were perfect. Now, I can barely squeeze in a single page and it buckles up (see photos by other reviewers). My last order now goes into garbage, just as I am looking for an alternative product.

I generally don't review the things I buy but it is disappointing to receive an object with all the right parts just positioned wrong. The person that is welding the parts doesn't pay attention as to how the parts should be placed, rendering the piece useless. My sculpture had the card holder placed inverted so the cards would face the inside, where people cannot see them and read them. Also the part that held the pens was placed so that the pens were resting outside of the sculpture. It would be bad to give this as a present to a professional and not realize how bad it could look to the eyes of the pts. So be aware when you receive your product.

I'm giving a single star because I have to return them for the second time due to one of the four bins being broken. I'm extremely disappointed because the size and shape are exactly what I was looking for. I tried to contact IRIS but they haven't bothered to get back with me. I will find another product to meet my needs.

I read a couple other reviews on how they have a strong smell, figured I'd give them a shot anyways. They smell is horribly strong! They were individually wrapped inside the big pack that was also sealed. Not sure why they stink, if it's the glue adhesive or what. It is VERY noticeable though. They work well, but I will not be purchasing again just because of that.

When I purchased these, it was advertised as 2011, which I needed. However, when I received them, they were for 2012. They have no contact info listed and when I reviewed these the first time, it wasn't accepted. I guess they don't like negative feedback. Secondary, I haven't heard anything from them to replace .

I have a canon pixma TS3122, which the seller stated in product description would be compatible with this cartridge. I was excited since this would be a good deal cheaper and had great reviews from everyone. I did read another review with a printer similar to mine that said there would be an "out of ink message" but you could override it. My computer never sent that. The printer always read out of ink and would not receive the job. Sadly, I could not find a way to override this.
The star is black not blue as pictured! And the packaging is a mess.

Not sure what the other reviewers are looking at, but the yellow I received is single wall, non adhesive and thus totally useless. It is not the regular type of Dymo tape that produces (white) raised letters.........this does not on my M-22.

Might as well play with razor blades. This is ridiculous. Bent. Cheap. Thin. Not sanded on mesh edges. Waste of time waiting for it. Most organizers require a little sanding here and there, this is a piece of junk. I cannot believe anyone is keeping this item and giving it positive reviews. I couldn't even remove it from the plastic bag without encountering sharp, jagged edge. Unbelievable. Obviously there are no quality control inspections. Going back to my other brand. Or wood. Anything but this.

I ordered these because I thought they'd be cute to write thank you cards after getting married. AFTER filling them all out, i see that one of the designs has squares and lines across it and says "Shutterstock". This card company stole the image! It looks so tacky. I could have made tacky cards myself!!  Im beyond angry.  Not to mention, what a waste of my time and money!  If I could give this 0 stars, I absolutely would. DO NOT BUY THESE!
I've had this for over a month and it's still outgassing.  I also don't think the wrist support is quite supportive enough, however, I'd still give it 3 stars if it weren't for the smell.

Yes this gets the job done IF you know which side to print on, but that's not the issue. I read the other reviews about the paper curling but I still had to see for myself. This paper curled out the box and I don't want any feedback about humidity because I'm in Washington, DC and it's dead of Winter. This paper curled so bad my printer couldn't recognize there was paper in there, it kept telling me to load paper and when it finally went through it got jammed in my printer!  I printed one thing and wasted 3 sheets due to the paper jam. And it's not my printer. Beware, you've been warned. Wish I listened.
My mistake. It is 8.5x11 for $10.99. You can print that on your own. I thought it was a desk calendar. Again my mistake for not reading. Reviewing to help others.

Garbage pens. Dont write smooth, and rips paper when writing. Cant believe theae had positive reviews. Look like they were in storage for 20 years before being shipped as the labels are all browned. Do not buy.

I've owned several Palm devices over the years, and have been a loyal customer. I was excited to buy the TX, as it has a lot of the features I look for in a handheld. When it works, it is great -- wifi, Bluetooth, great resolution, etc. It really has a lot of nice features -- the two stars I give it are for those features. Unfortunately, the sub par construction of the unit itself makes owning it more hassle than it's worth.Over the last year, the device has had to be replaced under warranty for a faulty screen twice, and it's starting to develop the same problem again. It was also replaced once for a faulty memory card slot (that was on a replacement I'd just received). Each time, the device was replaced and not repaired, so in all I've had four TX's, and each of them have had significant problems. I think that's a fair sampling of the device to know problems are persistent and significant.The faulty screen issue is well known and has been experienced by several owners (a quick tour of Palm's help forums bear this out). It becomes horribly uncalibrated and no amount of software calibration can fix it. Replacing the device with the same model does no good, because the problem will just happen again.Never have I been told by Palm why the screen issue occurs, and obviously they don't do anything but replace it with another unit which is pretty much destined to develop the same problem.I can literally see bubbles just under the outer plastic of the screen on my current unit, and parts of the bottom of the screen are faded, not to mention the battery on my recently replaced device is already draining far too quickly. I've only had this latest replacement for about four months.Now that my device is no longer under warranty and is once again faulty, I'll be switching another manufacturer. I don't want to, as I have a lot of purchased software for the Palm OS, but I don't see another alternative.

This item did not work on my printer, and after installing this, I was no longer able to use my printer.  I think this messed up my printer.  HOWEVER, customer service here is responsive.  Unfortunately, I lost a printer from using this.  Based on the other positive reviews, I think the ink I received might have just been a faulty one .

I bought this chair 3-4 years ago to use as a cellist. As a tall person, it's often very hard to find a seating setup that gives me correct posture for playing, so the wide adjustability of this chair was very useful for me, as was its lightweight portability for gigs. But the chair has two fatal flaws. The first is that the seat cannot be level with the ground because of the way the metal frame underneath is made. For me, this resulted in consistently having a sore tailbone (!) after just 2-3 hours of practicing - no doubt also related to the very thin padding on the seat itself. The other fatal flaw is that the rubber pads that are used to keep the seat in place wear out within a matter of weeks, and as they wear out, the seat slowly tilts forward even more. They're also a pain to replace. I found that the seat was so slanted that my butt would start sliding off the chair if I was wearing dress pants - not great in the middle of an orchestra concert. If not for the slant and the cruddy rubber stoppers this would be a 4 or 5 star chair, but given the price and those two flaws, I can't really recommend it.

Do not do business with HP!!!  Purchased a new HP Photosmart Wireless e-ALL-IN-ONE C310 Series.  When I opened the box, the ink cartridges that were supposed to be included were not in the box.  I called HP (45-minute phone call), they said they would send the missing cartridges.  When I received the cartridges, there were only 4 cartridges, not 5.  Called HP (another 45 minute phone call), they said they would ship the 5th cartridge.  When I asked if it would be possible to ship Next Day, they said they would have to charge me.  After I explained how I have already been inconvenient, they agreed to ship Next Day.  Well, 2 business days later, I finally received the 5th cartridge.  I installed ink cartridges and error message.  Called HP, after I explained the situation for the 3rd time, the man without telling me he was going to put me on hold, placed me on hold for 23 MINUTES before he finally came back on the phone.  By then I was already on another phone trying to speak to a Supervisor.  The Supervisor told me that either the ink cartridges were damaged or the printer itself is damaged.  Told me that he is going to send me a return label for the printer and they would send me a refund check.  8 days later, no return label.  I called and spoke to a Case Manager, and they told me that they don't issue refund checks that the best they can do is replace with a REFURBISHED printer.  I called the Supervisor again, after explain my situation AGAIN, they place me on hold to for 45 minutes review my case file... never to return again.  Frustrated, I hung up.  Do not do business with HP!!!  Poor equipment, poor customer service, not worth it!

I got two of these. first one failed about 1/2 way through.  streaking, fading. Had to shake the cartridge to make it work.  Going to plug in the second one and use it. Fingers crossed that it goes until it is empty as I print a lot...  Contacted seller, will update when I hear back...OK  Update  2nd failed after 3 days, contacted seller and was issued a return label...  So the seller gets a good rating but the product gets big  thubs down.....

So this is a great product. I have used Palm for 10 years and agree with other glowing reviews above. Will spare you the rosy and get to the point. Palm is shipping this with TWO MAJOR software flaws:1) The Desktop Tasks app will not allow you to create tasks with no due date. It will force a due date of 12/31/2031. This a major known issue that Palm is sitting on for more than a year (I discovered this post-purchase on Palm support forum).2) The Handheld Tasks app does NOT allow you to "Show only Due items". This can become a big deal is you have tons of tasks set for the future, and have to scroll through all of them to find the important ones.By charging so much for this product, and  shipping with such fundamental flaws,  and not doing anything about it for over an year despite knowing about it, PALM IS INSULTING its loyal customers.If Palm support does not respond these issues actively, I will be returning my product. Afterall, Contacts and Tasks are the Bread and Butter of Palm.

There are things I like about this Ball Pen; the look, the brown colour is a little bit unconventional, its overall weight is ok and the ink itself flows smoothly but the 'grip' on this Ball Pen is the worst of any I have ever used.The end of the pen (the part I hold when writing) is polished metal and looks nice BUT is so super-polished it's like silk and my fingers slip down towards the nib when I try using it (and typically I grip tightly enough to cause a pressure bump to appear at the grip point on my middle finger fairly shortly after I start writing).If instead of being polished metal, the end of the pen had been made of the same brown lacquer utilised in the shaft of the pen then I would have had no problems as that material is comfortable to hold and gives a good grip, unfortunately, it's set too far back for my fingertips to hold in order to write normally or comfortably.In addition to this, and it's not so easy to tell from the photo, but the polished end is not simply tapered but subtly concave (it has an outwards curve from the shaft to the tip) which amplifies the awkwardness of gripping the silky smooth end of this pen when writing.Out of curiosity, I've just looked back at the many positive reviews and noticed they are mainly for either the Parker Fountain Pens or the Parker Rollerballs, (which Amazon have combined with this) and both of which have differently shaped gripping ends to this Parker Ball Pen.

I did not get even 200 pages out of these cartridges.I would normally have much more to write to support my review of a product but there is not much more to write about an ink cartridge.Either you get close to the expected yield or not.Price point is great but the yield makes this an absolute waste of your money.Disappointed!!!
Bite the bullet and get the L rated toner cartridge. I normally get approx. 6 months with the L rated larger size...with this standard size I barely got 6 weeks.

I bought this printer because of the good reviews, but I need to say this printer never worked. We could never get it set up to print wirelessly -- that claim is a joke -- and there is no support from Samsung in getting the printer set up. It does not -- as it claims -- work with OS 10.

This scale, with its price entry option, is an amazing thing on paper; however the implementation leaves much to be desired. First off opening the lid is truly a pain in the ass and it often takes acrobatics to get it open. And the suck doesn't end there... it will often times be off by as much as a half gram from one use to the next and for no good reason. And once it arrives on a weight it seems to float down or up by. 01 or .02 every 10 seconds or so. For these reasons I have to give it a one star rating... simply because a zero star rating is not possible!!!

I can't find anywhere else to get customer support, so I'm reporting my issue here as a 1 star review.  If E-Z Ink can help me get this resolved, I will adjust the review.  I purchased this toner cartridge for a Samsung M2885FW printer.  When I install it in the printer, the printer gives me an error message saying toner not compatible with printer.

Hello.I had no intention of reviewing this item, but I kept being asked. This is one of those Amazon purchases that just will sit in the corner unused until I have the energy to give it away or bring it to the dump. Just doesn't work for me. You have to push in these buttons at the joints of the "legs" to adjust. I find this physically difficult and sometimes painful. Just an awkward unworkable design for me. The mouse attachment is difficult to understand and has no useful instructions. Not at all pleased with this.

If you spend your $ solely based on the description of this printer, you are going to waste your $ 100%. First of all, my review is based on the equipments I use daily. I use 24 inch iMac from 2006 with Verizon Fios standard router. So, if one's using an Apple Extreme, the result may/may not vary. My network is always there with 2 iPhones, 1 iPad, and 2 Mac computers, and 1 Apple TV. Of course I have other wireless equipments that work flawlessly with Verizon network, however, every single time I press print from my iMac, it never delivers to the printer. I literally have to turn the printer on and off numerous times for a single page standard black and white print from this god forsaken printer. I used HP printers all my life and I have never gotten so frustrated with any other printer than this. My previous printer was an ethernet connection printer that worked faster even though the model was from 6 years ago.Dear HP, why do you have to screw up with this one? If firmware is the issue here, please fix this!!!

My first order never arrived & went back to Amazon which was strange, so I cannot review this specific color of ink, BUT the 2nd time around Kon-Peki Blue arrived on schedule and it is good stuff! Thanks.
Can't see what I write in any color marker I use. Terrible.... Zero stars if I could.

I'm giving this 5 stars because once you get it working it works great! For such a cheap price as well. Let me give you the run down and how I set it up.First of all. It is about impossible to set up without a computer despite the manual (which isn't included in the box) saying you can set it up using the WPS button on your router and on the machine. Despite trying many times, I could not get it to work. Perhaps it is just in my situation as my multiple routers in the house were not set up properly and I had to fix them so I could use this printer properly (my own fault/laziness).Once I gave up I connected it to a computer and downloaded the program off the HP website (its a Samsung/HP printer) I connected it with USB (included in the box and I tried and failed using the wireless option) which installed the drivers (unnecessary, I'll get to that in a bit) but more importantly assigned the credentials of the wireless network of my choosing to the printer.After that I was essentially done! Anyone connected to the router that the printer was connected to could see the printer and print from it. This works regardless of whether you're on the 5ghz band or the 2.4ghz band, though the printer itself connects to the 2.4ghz, you can discover it on either. We have many devices in our home. For mobile phones it works with or without the app. On iOS or Android you can, in any app, simply choose print functionality integrated right into the operating system. For Mac computers it was just as easy, literally just open a document and select print and it will find the printer. For windows there's an extra step necessary, you simply have to go to devices and printers and add it. Then it's ready to use. I installed the drivers on two of the computers in the house and left the rest without and see no difference in print quality, speed, or functionality.Lastly, we have three routers in the house. If you want the printer to be able to print across multiple routers you're going to have to have them set up as access points. Normally one can extend their wireless signal simply by having multiple routers connected and with the same credentials. However access points are slightly different in that the routers speak to each other and you only have one router handing out IP's. It's very easy to do. Just turning off two or so options on all but the main router and connecting the ethernet via the ethernet ports and not the internet one.Edit ———————————————————Fuser died at one month. Returning
Colors are NOT as shown in picture… I received darker colors - just like some of the other reviewers.

1 star for 1 marker!  "Sharpie Retractable Permanent Markers, Ultra-Fine Point, Blue, Box of 12"  "Includes: 12 Blue Sharpie permanent markers".  I got 1 marker loose in an unpadded plastic envelope.This is not just misleading, it is dishonest.
I rarely leave  negative reviews, but the assembly of this product is outrageous. I have assemble furniture that is less complicated.

I had high hopes for these phones (after all, I bought one for each room in my home), and as you can see from my star ratings on specific attributes, there's a lot to like about them:  attractive design, good features, intuitive functionality, and so far, no real problems on reliability.It's just using them as phones that reveals their weaknesses, and those come down to sound quality and comfort -- for me, the two most important characteristics in a telephone.I find the V-Techs unergonomic in the extreme, sort of like holding a brick against my ear (hard, flat).  And because of their iffy sound reproduction, I find myself reflexively pressing the receiver against my ear to hear the caller.  Not good for any extended period of time.I avoid that experience by using the speakerphone mode, which, according to my listeners, is quite bearable -- and no worse than hearing my voice in person.  But the big problem is the incoming signal:  I find the sound simply fades into nothingness for seconds at a time, something akin to a fading cell call.  Quite perplexing -- and annoying, since I need to ask callers to repeat themselves, repeatedly.I don't know what's up with that.  It's not the traditional problem associated with "talking over" someone, which with many wireless phones can result in signal canceling.  These lapses happen when I'm simply listening.  I'll probably call the company about it, but I'm guessing it's not my particular units (it happens with all the extensions, even the one with the base), but something intrinsic in the engineering.So yes, there's a lot to like with the V-Tech:  great range, decent battery life, integrated update capabilities (changing contact info on one extension, for example, shares it immediately throughout the system). But while I don't anticipate returning the phones (I'm a bit lazy and too willing sometimes to put up with stuff), I can't really recommend them.  I'm hoping that if/when I speak with the company, there will be some explanation and recourse.By the way, I do a lot of phone interviews in my line of work (writer), and for that, I have a wired headset by GN Netcom.  Now THAT is the way to talk on the phone.John Dallas BowersVillanova, PA
Incompatible. Instructions to override useless.  Sent back in recycle bag provided.  Printer manufacturers got you by the cajones.  I should give one star, but showed mercy.

I would give this item no stars if I could.  I had it for only two weeks when it started seperating at all the seams like it was slapped together with glue and even that not very well.  When I requested a replacement they said they only offered one if it was returned within 7 days.  Apparently they make sure their lousy workmanship will last just long enough to get you past the return period.  There are two many other products at better prices to waste your time with this kind of seller.

This product is completely misleading! Does not stick on the refrigerator whatsoever and that is the primary reason I bought this product. I am not sure why there are so many positive reviews since this does not even stick to the refrigerator. Save your money unless you just want a desk notepad.
Editing my review....3 out of 4 lids arrived broken and cracked. Terrible customer service from IRIS.On a positive note Amazon customer service was extremely helpful. Sent me a full replacement!!

I won't comment on the print capabilities of this printer as i am not an expert in that area by any means. As far as i know its fine in that area.What i WILL comment on is the wireless aspect of it, which is completely worthless. Constant re-installs of the software, and endless issues with the wireless connections. Honestly, by the time you take into account all the time you will spend messing with the settings and doing re-installs, you would have been better off going wired. If you change modems....you can bet on spending another hour trying to get the printer back online. This printer also has a known issue when tuning the power on and off:It causes certain modems to crash, requiring you to go re-boot your modem. Very ECO-friendly to make a printer that you have to leave on....The software that comes with the printer is also useless, as common help topics can't be found in the software, and clicking help simply takes you to a HP store. The interface for the printer is nothing to be proud of either....simple tasks are hard to find, and it refuses to let you save some options as default settings ( like printing in fast draft to save ink! ) so you have to go through several steps each time you want to print a page.This printer is just trash, and would never buy one again. I would give it ZERO stars if possible.HP, do your image a favor and stop selling this printer ASAP.

So we ordered 2set and one packet had all 60 stickers but the 2nd packet only had 40. We tried getting a hold of the seller and no response.. I mean the stickers are nice and good quality, but I needed all the stickers. I don’t like to get gypped.. so 2 stars for missing sticker and seller not replying
Sorry but this didn't work in my Epson printer. I've used other after market brands before that worked great as well as the Epson 127 cartridges. Gave it one star for timely shipping.

These labels are terrible! Cheap, thin, they wrinkle in the printer, they don't stick and the perforations do not tear cleanly. I purchased these in July and after using up my previous supply of awesome labels I got somewhere else I recently started using these.  What a disappointment!  Asked to return them for a refund and the seller refused saying the time had expired.  I see some positive reviews on here that are quite old... I suspect that  this seller sold a better quality label a couple of years ago and is now pawning off this garbage for the same price. Stay away from this seller, what a rip off!
I would of given it 5 stars but the fact that I had to cut each one out by hand after I realized that the die cut was not cut all the way through. This process took hours due to some details.

I was happy to have these cartridges on hand for when my ink ran out. I needed to finally replace the black ink and installed it only to see that the cartridge is defective and it prints with gaps across the page. I did an alignment on the printer to no avail. It prints well in the other colors, just not black. The instructions in the packaging leave me no way to get in touch with this seller since I purchased it more than 30 days ago. I’m hoping that perhaps the seller reads these reviews and will get in touch with me so I can change this review.

Just don't buy it!! This item comes rolled up in a tight cone. It does NOT lay flat. I tried taping the edges down and the tape won't hold. It is somewhat difficult to read through it, but that would not have been an issue for me if it had just lay flat. I have no idea how it got the other five star ratings. I hope my review doesn't get buried...$30 throw away...not worth trying to send back.

This review has nothing to do with the product. I ordered the product late October but have yet to see it. It was charged on my card by my bank 11/26/2013. CHECK CRD PURCHASE 11/25 AMAZON MKTPLACE PM AMZN.COM/BILL WA XXXXXXXXXXXXXX06 303329731080590 ?MCC=5942Here is the message from using the tracking number as of 12/31/2013.The supplier is C J Shop.

I should’ve read the reviews before I purchased!!I wanted the bold, black hanging folders shown and not these dark grayish folders that came.Even the box shows the true black folder.Pretty disappointing.They’re flimsy and thin, but that’s ok since they are made from recycled materials. I just got these so I’m not sure how durable they are yet.If you want true black folders, these are not it.

I placed the order based on reviewers reports. Unfortunately the cartridge I received proved to be of bad quality, Upon printing there are smudges along one side. to an extent that the printed material is unreadable. Placed it aside and ordered an original HP.

I have had this printer for a year and it works fine for me  It prints, scans, and copies, just like HP said it would.  So why the low rating?  Here's why.....1. I had Best Buy Geek Squad set it up for me when I purchased this printer with a new computer.  It took him over an hour to hook up the printer and had to call for help in doing so.  So I figure if it took him that lon, there is no chance a non tech person could do it.2. The printer ink is expensive.  I also heard HP is installing microchips on their ink cartiages so you can't refill them.  I think I will go with a Kodak printer next time.3.  When I scan, it took a while to figure out how to change the format from JPEG to PDF.  HP doesn't like to make things easy.4.  When I scan to PDF, it will only let you scan one page at a time.  So if you have a multi page document, it gives you a separate document for each page.  I did find a nice free program on the Cnet web site that merges your document together.  It is by Adolix.  It works great.  But beware, there is a different program that they say is free but puts a big watermark on each page.  You can only get the watermark off if you buy the program.  There is also a free service at [...]  I have tried that and it also works great.So in summary, I would certainly not buy this printer again.

I had to get rid of this printer as my use was not enough to keep up with the color cartridges which dry out at a fairly rapid rate. It prints OK. It might work out OK for someone who does a lot of color printing.

Having borrowed an 'ancient' Minolta negative scanner from work, I decided to buy myself one that would digitise 110 negatives.  I read the previous review about how easy it is to use, which is absolutely true, but I am so disappointed with the quality of the pictures.  At first I thought it was due to the age of the film (18+ years) but I compared a 35mm negative scan with one I had digitised on the scanner from work and the difference is very noticeable, even when using the highest quality settings.  You pay for what you get!  Now I am going to see how good they are at accepting returns, because I would rather pay more to preserve precious memories.

I bought this sharpener based on the stellar reviews. I am a teacher, and I counted on its durability to get me through the school year. It lasted two months and then quit working. The window has closed for return, so I am very disappointed.

I order a lot from Amazon and usually don't write reviews, but purchased this for my son heading off to college, liking the idea of everything being included.  Save your money by going to the Dollar Store!!  The organizer is so small and flimsy, the scissors are smaller than a children's scissors, everything is just cheap and flimsy.  Returning today.

This isn't a highlighter it's pretty much a crayon. It looks worse than a dried-out highlighter on paper, and leaves a residue on the paper like crayon wax. I'm so mad I bought these- I actually bought them from my college bookstore and I was so unpleasantly surprised I felt the need to find somewhere online to give them a bad review.They're horrible, don't buy them.

This is EXTREMELY flimsy. I’m not sure why it has so many good reviews. It has really nice wood touch to it, but the legs of the table are poor material and flimsy. You can’t write on or do much with it than just it holding the laptop.

The ink does not print in my Canon TR8520 PIXMA printer. It seems to be compatible, the tanks are full but nothing. At first I had some printing, then it decreased to spotty and now the page are blank. I have done maintenance and cleaning.  Maybe more stars for other printers but I would not recommend with a TR8520

Let me start with the printer would not be bad if I could’ve connected to wifi. From the time, I unpacked it, I had issues connecting. The instructions were horrible and calling tech support to help troubleshoot was no help at all! I purchased on 3/8 and I don’t print a lot however by 4/6 my red light came on stating toner end of life . On 4/6 I called complaining about this and there’s no way this toner should be at the end of its life. The person was supposed to send me replacement cartridge instead put an order for another printer. I had to send the old printer back, which I did on 4/7 and I was supposed to receive a new printer on  4/7. I still do not have my printer and called Amazon to cancel my order and refund me a full credit. I will be ordering another laser jet printer. It printed fine however I had to plug my usb cable from printer to my laptop every time I had to print and this was supposed to be wireless. Amazon was great but I’ll never order this brand again. I gave the rating because of issues with set up and tech support.

My password keeper was missing pages under the first tab (A-B). I counted all the pages--there are only 65 in my book. Each tab has 5 pages for logging website info. Since it is advertised as having 75 pages, I'm assuming I received a defective book. I have contacted the seller and will follow-up this review after I hear from the seller
If I could give this product negative stars I would. The boxes were flimsy and the tape came off the roll in pieces when it came off at all. Do not waste your money

I have loved most of my BIC pens, but not these. After only a few minutes of writing time, every one of the colors quit writing. Not out of ink, more like the ink is dried up. No amount of scribbling will restart the ink flow. And since they're not returnable, I'm out of luck. Good thing they weren't expensive pens. If I could give no stars, I would.
Should have read reviews more thoroughly.  Apparently this chair has a history of breaking armrests.

As a phone it is 4 stars and customer service is 5 stars! However the whole reason for buying the phone is the video and phone doorbell. That is why I give it 2 Stars. I can't tell if the person at my door is even male or female. Even and clear afternoon daylight. The quality of the photos is just terrible.Amazon won't let me add photos
I would give this product a no star rating if I could...  Never worked to begin with and then they wanted to charge me half of what it cost to return it!

UPDATE:  I've had this printer less than 2 years and it's belly up.  I rarely use the printer and haven't had any problems up until now.  Docking 4 stars because there is not any support for the printer.  Now I have a huge paper weight sitting on my craft desk. Canon has a serious ink cartridge problem. First there is very little difference in capacity between the 240 and the 240XL. I took one of each to Costco for a refill. After both were refilled I asked the technician to weigh both cartridges. The 240 weighed 39.3 grams and the 240XL weighed 40.5 grams. Not a significant difference. The cartridges have the very same dimensions. The other reviewers are exactly right, the document volume per cartridge sucks. The MX472 printer is a low end printer so if your printing volume is anything but light, do not buy this printer.
Even after reading the less than positive reviews, I ordered anyway. Had the same issues, only one of the cartridges worked in my printer! So I ended up paying double. Not worth the risk...

This review reflects my experience with Amazon.  I have owned the non-lip version of this mat for about 2 years and I think its the best mat I've used.  I decided to buy this one on Amazon because I wanted to protect my floor directly under my desk from my trampling feet while gaming.  I read several reviews about how it ships rolled up and is difficult to unroll.I decided to roll the dice and order it, because I am fairly certain most of the reviewers did not go to the ES Robbins site or youtube channels that state you should lay it flat for 24+ hours before using it.  I was happy to see that my mat arrived shipped flat, however it was in giant plastic...envelope?  that had many rips and tears.  My woes started when I saw that there was an orange tape used to seal the envelope.  The tape also was on the end of the lip and rear of the mat, because the envelope was clearly not large enough to house the entire mat and seal it.  The orange tape was very difficult to rip off and left tons of orange residue on the mat.  I spent about an hour with a roll of paper towels, GooGone, and soap/water removing all of the residue.  There is still slight bits of orange coloring around a few of the anchor bars, and I can only hope that my carpet doesn't get stains from it...  I wonder what person decided that sticky tape directly on a chair mat was a good idea, especially since its going to be on carpet 24/7...Again, I want to say that my review is from my experience with Amazon.  If you want to roll the dice, hope you don't have a similar experience as I did with Amazon shipping, otherwise I can safely recommend this brand from another retailer, depending on how their shipping is, or better yet if you can buy it from a store.

If I could rate it zero stars, I would.  Amazon won't let me do that, so here's a generous star for the worst technology product I've ever bought.

I bought this all-in-one with Amazon fulfillment of a NextGen order.  The unit I received may have been damaged: the box had at minimum been re-shipped several times.  Whatever the case, the device I received was deeply flawed and I had to return it.MAJOR PROBLEMS:This thing screams loudly while printing.  To say that it sounds like a cat is heat is insulting to cats, but the sound was a cross between that noise and your fire alarm going off.  Even after turning all the volume settings to "off" the screeching continued.  Not acceptable.Print quality is fair.  Note that this is an LCD printer, not a conventional laser printer, and it shows:  black print is OK but not saturated, and color print has a distinct grain, very much like photos reproduced in newspapers.  I ultimately bought the Canon MF8580 Cdw, which does a much better job of reproducing color print and photo images.DESIGN FLAWS/CONSIDERATIONS:Like all devices in this class, the Brother is heavy.  It can be muscled into place by one person, but hold out for a large person who enjoys the gym.The Brother will print envelopes and labels only using the straight-through feed, which necessitates dropping down the printer's back panel.  This isn't difficult in itself, but it does add another half-foot or so to the depth of the printer.  So don't believe the footprint dimensions stated on Amazon, and this may be an issue if you are trying to put the device on a standard desk or cubicle work surface.THE ONE REDEEMING GRACE:Amazon Prime was great about delivering on time and picking up the return from my home address, all with no additional charges.  If you are even vaguely considering ordering the Brother MFC9340CDW, go ahead and get Prime...it will pay for itself on the shipping and (I strongly suspect) eventual return of the item.THE BOTTOM LINE:If I could have granted zero stars,  I would have.  Save yourself some heartache (and backache) and steer clear of this one.

As other reviews have mentioned, EVEN AT THE LOWEST SETTING THIS CHAIR SITS WAY TOO HIGH!! Please understand that before you buy. If you are 7' or taller, this might not be a problem. I'm 6'1" and my feet do not touch the floor.There is a workaround. I removed the casters and replaced them with Reusable Sliders on the feet instead. This dropped the chair 1.5" so my feet could touch.The cushioning is rock hard, this might break in over time.On the positive side: It looks great. Sturdy construction. Easy enough to put together.

Well, it was a 4 star product for my use (slide scanning.) It did a pretty good job for the price. I will agree with others about the blue cast to the slide scans, but that was easily fixed in Photoshop. So, why the 1-star now? Because I can no longer use it. The hardware is fine. No broken parts. I took a 6 month break on scans, came back and my computer no longer "sees" the scanner when it's hooked up. The scanner is still powered, but is invisible and therefore inoperable. I pulled out my disc and the software no longer works. Still showed as "installed," but not workable. So using the disc, I unistalled with the intent to reinstall. The reinstall didn't work, as it needed the License Key, which I could not locate. I contacted the manufacturer. They instructed me to reinstall with the software download from their site. That install didn't work either. And after trying to contact them an additional 5 times, with no response, I came back here. So bummed.

I really want to like this pen, but cannot give it a good rating due to a design flaw. The front part, which houses the refill, should of had a screw mechanism. Instead, it's smooth. What happens is it eventually works itself loose and drops off. I've nearly lost this part about 3 times so far and feel it will eventually come apart when I'm not paying attention. I thought about super gluing it, but that's not an option if I need to replace the ink, which I will at some point. I love the look, the longevity of the ink and the comments I get from people about the pen, however the problem with the front part working loose is a major problem, hence my 2 star rating.

As the other reviewers note, the cross-hatch pattern inside is useless. The blue ink is too faint and the lines are too thin to offer any shred of "security". Shining a light through the envelope reveals what's inside. Staples knows how to do it right:https://smile.amazon.com/dp/B001MBK5UG/

Update #4 – I have had this chair for a little over 4 years.  I’m in the process of replacing it.  I lost 100+ pounds and for the past year I weighed 190 pounds.  The 4th piston I replaced is rated at 350 lbs and is still starting to give out.  The bottom cushion is completely flat.  In all fairness, I sit in the chair 8+ hours a day 6 days per week.  The headrest, which I rarely use, has been flimsy nearly the entire time I have owned the chair.  The bonded leather is starting to peel excessively from the seat cushion creating a daily mess on my floor.  The peeling leather is the final straw which is why I am now replacing this chair.  This would be a nice chair for someone who weighs no more than 200 pounds and who does not intend to sit in it 8+ hours/day.  It’s advertised for big and tall men.  The dimensions fit well for a 300 pound person, however, the pistons do NOT support a person weighing 300 pounds even though it is supposed to hold 350 pounds.  It’s been a comfortable chair but the cost and hassle of replacing the piston regularly should be considered if you plan to use this chair for many hours on end.Update #3 - I've gone through 3 pistons in 2 years after purchasing chair.  The piston is rated at 400 lbs and I've not exceeded 290 lbs in the 2 years I've used this chair.  The manufacturer replaced 2 pistons no charge.  I'm going to try purchasing another piston from another source.  It's not worth the hassle to keep going back to the manufacturer to get a free replacement I know is going to fail.  It's a challenge to replace the pistons.  You need a mini-sledge and a large pipe wrench to get the old pistons off.  I always use white grease on the cylinder ends which fit in the base and chair end.  It helps when removing worn out pistons.  At this point I would not buy this chair again and would not recommend it for anyone over 250 lbs.  If the 3rd party piston I paid $25 for works out, I might reconsider my opinion.  Other than the piston constantly wearing out every 6 - 8 months, the chair is really comfortable and the padding holds up really well.Update #2.  I've gone through 2 pistons 8 months.  The 2 pistons I've had did not hold 290 pounds.  The rest of the chair is fine, but worthless without a reliable piston.Update #1 -  4 months after purchase.  I sit in the chair 10+ hours/day for work. Piston is horrible!  I weigh 285.  The gas piston failed horribly after 3-1/2 months.  The manufacturer sent a replacement part no-charge promptly after I contacted them.  I'll see how long this piston lasts before passing final judgement.

Believe me, I am not especially picky. If something works, I'll work with it. I'm amused at reviews of items which express disappointment with something that never claimed to be what it wasn't. (Hand mixers that aren't stand mixers, etc.)But this piece of trash is a different matter entirely.Perhaps it works well after it is calibrated but BE ADVISED that you must calibrate it first! You need a 1000 gram item to do this. Sorry, I don't happen to have a 1000 gram item that fits on top of the tiny surface of this item. That's why I bought a scale - to weigh things.So, if you don't have a calibration weight, you are SOL.Regarding the small size of this item, normally I am a "small is beautiful" person, esp. for kitchen items (I have a tiny kitchen) but too small is too small, and this item is too small. You need a weight with a minimum surface area to balance bowls of flour, for example. This baby doesn't fit the bill.If all you want is a reasonably accurate kitchen scale, go elsewhere. I've learned my lesson: no calibration, and bigger than a postage stamp.

I bought two of these, and there were two problems.First, step 4 of the installation instructions, "Pull seal out of cartridge", shows (in a tiny drawing) something being pulled out of the end of the cartridge. There was nothing there to pull. However, I did remove a protective paper from the top of the cartridge. What good are incorrect installation instructions, I ask?Worse, the first one I installed created the gear grinding noise mentioned in other reviews here. Removing and re-installing several times had no effect, and I was unable to force the gears to turn with my fingers. It was just jammed. I tried my second cartridge and it worked without the noise. If you want to assume a 50% chance of receiving a dud, go ahead, it's your money. I won't be ordering this brand again, and I think Amazon should cease carrying it.

I thought, like many people, that trying a fountain pen might go some way to improving my awful handwriting. This one got good reviews so I went for it.I'm actually very disappointed with it. We purchased this Canon PIXMA MG2525 printer in March 2020. Our son 3rd grader was at home doing distance learning thanks to the pandemic, and our only home printer had just broken. We needed another printer quickly and inexpensively as our son needed to print all of his schoolwork at home daily. It's been okay, so-so quality, but got the job done. Until yesterday. Right in the middle of a print job, the printer stopped working completely. Yellow light flashing. Looked up the error code: Your printer needs repair.Attempted to call Canon today. You cannot get through to customer support unless you create an account online. Created an account, but cannot register my printers serial number as my printer was manufactured in Canada (we're in US)! Attempted to create an account on Canon Canada website, but cannot because I don't have a Canadian address. So, we're completely screwed because I cannot get through to customer service in either the US or Canada. Now my only option is to throw this printer in the trash after slightly more than 1 year of use. I rarely write reviews, but I'm writing this so that others considering purchasing this printer are aware. Buyer beware!! What a joke, Canon!

SHAME ON VTECH!!VTECH came up with an excellent idea and (a not so good solution) to communicating with visitors at your front door.  Not only can you talk to the person at the front door via the phone but you can see a photo and even a video of the person who comes calling.Here is the problem:As many other reviewers have mentioned, the video is very poor quality, Yes, you will be able to recognize someone you are familiar with, but that is about all.  VTECH should be ashamed of themselves for manufacturing a system with such a low quality camera.  The phone portion of the system is probably fine; it’s the video that needs to be overhauled. VTECH Please go back to the drawing board and redesign this video doorbell with a camera that is  capable of  capturing images that are of a quality  people are used to seeing in the  twenty first century.What you need to know:When I ordered this system I was WRONGLY under the impression the camera portion of the system could be powered exclusively using the wires from my existing doorbell.  That is not the case.  You do have the option of powering the camera with two AA batteries, but for best results it should be hard wired into an electrical outlet.  If you connect your existing door bell wires to the camera, the camera then becomes connected to your existing doorbell to allow the existing doorbell to chime along with the VTECH phone when someone pushes the doorbell button on the outside VTECH camera housing.Bottom Line:  IT IS REALLY SO SIMPLE, BUT VTECH GOT IT WRONG WITH THAT LOUSY CAMERA!!

I used Amazon to find Black and Color cartridges for my Desk Jet 932C printer. They offered Brian's Book Bazaar  for a place ink could be purchased. I ordered 4 HP 78XL ( large Size ) cartridges. I loaded the first one last Monday ( 2/11/13) and it printed very lightly. I tried two more of the cartridges today (2/15/13) only to find both of them to be empty as well. This is a rip off, if there is no good cartridges available for my print anymore, I expected to be told so and I would have looked into buying a new printer. But to rip me off for almost $200.00 for no ink. This is wrong. I will contact my CC company and dispute the charges, and I will be calling Amazon to fill them in on my poor experance with Brain's Book Bazaar. This is not the kind of service I ever receive when dealing with Amazon.I wish to update this review since I wrote this 11 days ago:Amazon contacted both Brian's Book Bazaar, and myself about the poor / no ink I receiced with my order. After talking with Brian by emails these last few days, I'm happy to say that I have been credited back to my Amazon card the cost of the 3 bad / empty cartridges and have seen the credit posted to my card. This is great customer service by both Brian, and Amazon. This has restored my faith in good old fashion C. S. whice is to often forgotten. Thank you Brian for your trust in my complaint and your quick respontance to this matter. I will again look to this company for my ink needs.Thank youJim Russo

**EDIT**After just over a year of owning this printer (2 weeks out of warranty) it appears to have stopped working properly.  It constantly reads cartridges as empty (even brand new ones), swaps colors, garbles text and images, loses network connection, prints blanks pages, reads as empty when plenty of paper is loaded locks up... the list of issues is almost endless.  I've tried every fix I know, and every one listed under HP support, and I simply can't get it to print properly.  Combined with the trouble I had with my initial purchase and setup this is simply one of the worst products I've ever bought.I've left my review below intact, but I certainly have new views on some of the praise I gave to HP.**/EDIT**There are a lot of good reviews for this product and a lot of bad reviews.  The truth seems to be somewhere in the middle.  Your individual experience will depend entirely on your circumstance.  I'm an IT admin who bought this product for my home, and I hope my review will help you decide if this device is right for you.PRINT & SCAN:++ This printer prints quickly and very well.  It has dedicated slots for photo paper, and picture quality is excellent.  The scanner is fast and also produces a high quality copy.+- The printer makes a small amount of noise, not too loud, but not whisper quiet.  I couldn't hear it outside of the room in which the printer was located, I don't believe most people would find it distracting.++ HP Software support is good and offers a wide variety of programs that work with this printer, you can use for manipulating photos, scanning and saving to your computer, etc.  I can't comment too much on this as I don't use any of their software, but I give a + for having so many options.-- The cartridges that come with this printer are, as other reviewers have stated, trial sized, and ran out for me after less than a dozen prints.  Replacements are very expensive.  This is, however, true of pretty much all modern printers.WIRELESS:++ The onscreen menu lets you set up this printer on your network without connecting it to a computer!  This was a huge plus for me, as I hate needing to 'wire' to 'wireless' printers for setup, especially if you ever need to tweak options (new password for example).  Being able to run through network setup right on the machine is excellent.+- Windows 7 requires installing software.  It would be nice if the device "just worked," but you DO have to install the drivers from the included CD for this printer to work on a windows machine.  However, the process is quick and fairly painless, and the printer worked immediately after installing the software.-- Mac devices (specifically airprint) were not straight forward!  This is a key point for a lot of people, especially since one of the biggest draws of this product is that it 'works' with airprint.I'm a network admin, but I'm running as basic a network as possible at home specifically to avoid conflicts and problems.  I don't want to bring my work home with me, so to speak.  My setup, modem and wireless adapter straight from the cable company, will be the same as 90% of users out there.  Even with this basic setup, and my experience, getting OSX, an iphone, and an ipad to work with this printer required 3 hours of tech support.  see below for some comments on what ended up working)SUPPORT:-- HP chat support was horrible.  At first, with the mac connection problems, I tried using HP's online 'chat' support.  Big mistake.  The people on the other end were rude, disconnected on me several times, and basically said that HP didn't support any apple products and that I should just return the device, which is simply not true (or helpful).  When I finally connected with someone over the phone I recommended that they review whoever is running that department.++ HP phone support was excellent.  I talked with a guy who worked with me for about 3 hours trying various possible solutions for getting this printer to work, and he was extremely helpful and patient throughout the process, even when he had to wait for me to disconnect this device or reboot that device.CONCLUSION:HP is a good name, and they make a solid product.  As a fairly cheap, 'air print capable' device, this printer does alright once you get it set up.  All modern inkjet printers are expensive to run, and all the companies will give you trial ink to start out.If you're running windows 7 you're all set.  Follow the setup instructions and you've got a great, wireless printer that is good to go.If you were buying this printer for the airprint, or if you happen to use a mac, either look elsewhere or be prepared for some serious setup times.  This won't always be true!  Depending on your individual setup you might get lucky and connect immediately, as some other reviewers have.  That's great!  I warn you to be prepared, though, in case it doesn't work out, because HP hasn't gotten their mac support working 100% yet, and you should be ready just in case.This is a solid printer when its working, and I'm glad I have it, but it won't be a simple plug-and-play option for everyone.  Unless you really needed airprint you're better off with another wireless printer, and if you really need airprint you're probably better off with a more expensive airprint option.NOTES ON AIRPRINT:What eventually worked for me was a combination of setting up a static IP address for the printer, making sure that IP had the correct ports being forwarded to it on the router, and then using one of HPs online services (that came on the CD) to make a few tweaks to permissions.  This device runs its own 'webpage' that you can access from your home network, and lets you change around various options (including what devices are allowed to print, and if any are blocked).  I had to use that page to tweak a lot of the options, in addition to the static IP and port forwarding on my router, to finally get airprint to work on this device.Unfortunately I can't give a perfect rundown on what worked because of how long it took to get things going, and how many different arrangements of options we tried.  As a starting point, if you can't get airprint working, make sure you set up a static IP for you printer, check online (or call HP) to find out what ports need to be forwarded, and, if that doesn't work, call their tech support and have them walk you through the same steps they did for me.

Trust me when I say, if you buy anything large and plastic, most of the time it will arrive to you with some part broken. However, the product may still be in a "usable" condition.Look at the pictures, read the reviews, and be warned that plastic products in large boxes have a very high chance to ship to you damaged.

My favorite stapler for many years has been the X-Acto Standup Stapler because it 1) stands up and stays put on my desk, 2) fits well in my hand, 3) is ergonomically the best stapler I have found so far, and 4) weighs less than half of the Bostitch Metal Executive Stand-Up Stapler.  But my X-Acto stapler started jamming after years of use, so based on the multiple 5 star reviews, I ordered this Bostitch stapler from Warehouse Deals.  When I received it, I initially tried to use it with Swingline staples.  It didn't work.  The instructions state to use Bostitch Standard staples so, thinking this was a case of "operator error", I ordered a box of those from Amazon.  Stapler STILL DOESN'T WORK, but now too much time has passed to return it.  And just where is the "staple supply indicator" that is advertised in the listing??  If it's that 1/16" diameter hole at the front left side of the "staple reservoir" then be still my heart!  And to top everything else off, even if it did work, it still wouldn't have the ergonomic design and easy stapling action that my old X-Acto does (and it never will.) Bostitch Premium Metal Executive Stand-Up Desktop Stapler, Chrome (B3000)

I have a TX that broke after 9 months, I sent it in for repair and began my nightmare dealing with Palm.  First they denied even having it, until I told them I had a Fed Ex record of it having been received and signed for by a Palm employee.  Their next effort to avoid responsibility was telling me that the repair center was moving, their customer support software is new, blah blah blah.  It has been two weeks and this is the first time they acknowledged they had the TX and where it was in the repair process.  The information on the Palm website says repairs are turned around in 5-7 business days, it will be more than three weeks before they get it back to me according to their latest estimate.  Between being shuffled from person to person, trying to get a straight answer out of them and Palm's complete and continual lack of concern for their customers, I have given up trying to deal with them.  I am filing a formal complaint with the Better Business Bureau, the Federal Trade Commission, and three other non governmental agencies.  I am writing this review in the hope that I can save at least one consumer the grief of dealing with Palm, take your business elsewhere!One more interesting tidbit, the email I received from Palm contained a warning that, among other things, I may not post the contents of the email.  Maybe it is just me, but if a company stands by it's product and support staff why would they put warnings in their email to customers.The information in my review is purely my opinion and based on my experience dealing with Palm.

We bought this printer 5 months ago reading all of the great reviews and the claim it can print an X number of pages on an ink cartridge saving us time and money.  This printer did neither!-First off, the printing quality is terrible, even out of the box.  I always got lines throught my pictures and nothing I did would make them go away.  MY 5 year old HP Printer sucked up alot of ink, but at least it gave me a good quality picture!-The 2 sided printing feature almost always never worked.-As of yesterday, my printer no longer works at all!  When I send out a test print page through my computer it will print just fine, but anything else it will print 1/3 of the way through, then take it upon itself to cancel my print jobs!  I can't print anything!!!  My parents bought the same exact printer and it went out with the same problems around the same time as mine.I do not know where people are getting all of these good reviews from, but this printer has not stacked up to it's good ratings and reviews since the moment I received it.  I will be calling Lexmark too see if I can get a full refund, and will never purchase another Lexmark printer again.

We have a LAMY Safari and got this because of videos and reviews on line but when we received it seemed cheaply made.  Plastic seemed cheap, the red piece at the end of the pen looked very cheaply made and everything about it looked like a mass produced toy.  We did not even ink it up and test it but found that it had previously been inked by someone else, there was a blue tinge to the feed mechanism.  So happy that returns are so extremely easy with Amazon which is all the more reason to get things through Amazon Prime.

Bought these for my Canon Pixma MP980 because i was trying to save some money. Thought that the 10 dollars between shipping and the price of the product was too good to be true, and it was. After receiving this product in very prompt fashion, I immediately installed them into my printer. As I was advised from a previous review i was careful as many had said that these cartridges tend to get ink everywhere, I was not disappointed as they made a mess of my hands and the counter top. After preforming a routine cleaning I discovered that the color cartridges were not working very well so I performed a deep clean on the printer head, and the color ink issue continued to get worse, to the point that now my printer does not even print a little color. I just hope that by using these 5 dollar ink cartridges I did not ruin my $200 printer. This product is worthless

I don't see how people are giving this 4 and 5 stars. I agree that the lead holder looks and feels great. It can use 2mm - 3mm lead, and is very versatile, but it CANT HOLD LEAD.I've never had a lead holder that with a little bit of pressure can push the lead back into the body. Its hold is so loose, even on 3mm lead, that you can't use traditional lead pointer sharpeners like the kum easypoint. Even the sharpener built into the cap turns the lead in place.I've never seen anything like this on another lead holders from brands like Alvin, or Staedler.

Please contact me LxTek.  I bought this product for my HP 3632 printer, it doesn't fit, and it has been 37 days so I am outside the 30 day return window.  Please help and make this right.  I will then remove my review.
Wrong item reviewed !! Disregard last review

The product itself is good. The board is nice, pen writes well and the magnets work fine. However, I have to give this item 1 star because of the way it was sent to me. When I received it, there were multiple scratches, dents and nicks in the corners and on the actual writing space. Can't distinguish if this is due to cheap quality that's susceptible to damage, or if it was just poorly handled during packaging. Either way, mine is not as nice and new as it should be.
These letters ARE NOT yellow. I saw another review that said opaque honey mustard..... honestly I can't think of a better term. Definitely sending them back.

The parts were not designed well, so they did not fit.  Several pieces were not cut properly so it was not possible to fully assemble.  Also, pieces were missing.  I had to make use of epoxy and drilling my own holes so it could not be assembled.  Save your money.  Only reason it got one star was that it was the lowest possible rating.

I don't use a printer often, but after only printing one picture to have the machine crap out on me is unsatisfactory. SO far the warranty process hasn't been too bad. The over the phone troubleshooting ended after "please unplug your machine wait 10 seconds and plug it back in." From there it was straight to "we will be sending you a replacement. It should arrive with in 2 - 3 business days." If it arrives and works out I will update my review.Update:  Anyone ever seen Office Space?Ok, so their exchange program was quick, tht was the good. Even though the ink in the old one wouldn't work in the new one, but they did send it with more ink. In printing 20 invasions for my daughters' birthday parties it misfed or jammed 12 times.  Then a month leather tried to print again and it said the ink was out.I went out and bought an HP OfficeJet.  Screw the hassle of this.
I can't understand the 4+ rating on this product.  I don't even print 50 pages per month - and this ran out in less than 3 weeks.  Total rip off.
I chose this one based on its price b/c I didn't want to spend too much for the sharpener ignoring other reviews but It failed to work after 2 light uses.

I purchased this printer 6/1/15.  Due to a family medical issue (and being a little intimidated about networking), I did not install it until 5/25/16 (yes, almost right to the date of my "limited 1-year warranty" expiring).  (I never buy overpriced "warranty extensions.")  I LOVED the printer.  Now, 9/16/16, I am having scanner problems with a "white line" BOTH when I use the ADF and the Flatbed. I have CLEANED everything they recommend  OVER and OVER.  A "Scanner Reset" has not worked.  Now I am waiting to see what Brother will offer.  This was NOT a Cheap printer (price-wise) but I purchased it based upon a colleague loving it and reviews being positive.  I certainly will write to the President of Brother if "Customer Service" cannot offer a reasonable solution.  Yes, I  have spent TONS on Xerox and other "BIG Company" printers--and was hoping THIS printer would be a "cost-effective" alternative.  The "Jury is still out."UPDATE:  10/7/2016 - I have Signature Proof My letter was received by the "Office of the President."  To date---NO RESPONSE---I think that speaks VOLUMES as to how they REALLY (care) (NOT!) about their Customers--despite what they "advertise!"
If I could rate a zero I would. The ink did not work so money wasted for nothing.

We bought the printer in 2010 based on good reviews and the length of warranty. The printer rarely prints a good page and we have done everything from replace the print heads, support calls, cleaning the print heads, and always prints streaky or blank spots on every page.  We recently just replaced all the cartridges at $70+ and still we couldnt get one page to print.This thing is a dud.

My first (and only) experience using Smartink was not impressive or acceptable. The results from Smartink ink, EZink, and Canon ink are shown in my photo in this review. The image reproduction speaks to some serious production and quality control with Smartink (I also reviewed EZink and they contacted me to say they are looking into the EZink color problem (illustrated in my photo) and EZink seems to be very interested in solving this problem). I hope Smartink will respond with a similar degree of customer service and desire to provide customer satisfaction .
As other reviewers noted, these leave messy blobs. I gave them away because I don't want to use them.

Unfortunately, I need to update my initially 5 star review. This product is nice in theory but either it's faulty or it's just poor quality. It keeps popping open without any reason for it. Sometimes it does it on it's own, and it does it every time I put it in my purse. The point is to protect my cards from fraud and to hold them secure in one place. This holder does neither as it leaves the cards open. They stay in the little pockets but that's little consolation.I received this product at e reduced price for my honest and unbiased opinion.
I recieved this pencil sharpener USED! I noticed most of the reviews are for colored pencils not this sharpener. I decided to try it even though it was obviously used and it worked horribly.

I am still out on if I like this overall...I have been using it to raise the level of my laptop on my coffee table but it still put my mouse too far away....and let me tell you about the mouse pad addition...This is why I am giving this 1 star.  The mouse pad does not attach properly.  It can not be tightened enough to keep it stable and it scratches the stand if you try to remove it.If it were stable and didn't scratch the stand, I might give this more stars, but as is, the design needs to be taken back to the drawing table.

I've used HP PHOTO PAPER for years (like the one I'm reviewing which is the GOOD STUFF)! THEN... the new and improved came out in the black boxes! I have been so disappointed! The brown and blacks in the prints come out smeared looking. The over all color and hues are different and the pictures just turn out awful! Even when I adjusted the settings on my HP printer like the instructions say, it still doesn't turn out right color-wise! My printer is an HP and when I've tried other brands of paper, its still not right. I found some of the old HP photo paper (like in the box of photo paper shown in the pink, blue and white), and the prints were beautiful so I know its not my printer. Why they changed the photo paper content, I'll never know (maybe save them some $$$?). I hope there are enough people complaining so that HP would return to the previous photo paper content. I print a lot of pictures and I like the pictures to turn out clear and crisp and with the right coloring and highlights, But its not happening with the new stuff! C'mon HP, BRING BACK YOUr OLD PAPER!!! Help us out Amazon!

I bought this gadget and it was excellent at the beginning. After a year of use and conveniently after the warranty was over, the touch screen went erratic. Touch on an area and it picks a different location, touch the same area and it picks an area even further away. Draw a straight line across the screen and it scatters short broken lines allover the screen facing all directions. An attempt to calibrate takes you on an infinite loop. Contacting customer service was so annoying as they told me I dropped the product or spilled fluids on it which never happened. I have searched online and discovered this is a common problem with Palm TX, in fact there's a company I found specializing in selling TX screens which should tell how common this problem is. None of the other software suggested to fix this problem solved mine. For anyone reading this review to consider whether or not to buy one, pay attention to those reviewing after over a year of use to make a better informed choice.

These are clearly factory rejects. I ignored the previous reviews for this product and I regret it. There is a faint red line down the right side of the pages which isn’t supposed to be there. At least the punched holes line up..

We've had this printer for over a year.  At first it connected to our computers and worked fine, but then began losing contact, and we constantly had  to uninstall it and re-install it to get it connected wirelessly.  We finally resorted to just physically connecting to it via USB and it works fine.  Also the color quality seems to be off.  Can't always see it, but sometimes when I print a news letter the color just wasn't "right."  TWO STARS ONLY

When I got this printer it was damaged. Well I sent it back and and reordered it again. Well guess what the second on had the same damage on it. The tape on the inside of the scanner was off on both printers and the quality of the printer was very low. So therefore that is why I gave it the ratings I did.

My company has purchased 4 of these printers so far. Their features and software package made them look very good on paper. For the first 3 months of their life they did very well. The wireless functionality was great, the scanning software was perfect....We've now had 2 go down. 1 reports jams constantly in spite of no jams that are visible from front or back. The other it looks like the plastic/foil wrap over the fuser roller is absolutely shredded. I sliced my finger open on it thinking it was some sort of foil wrapper that was caught inside the device.To be fair, 2 of them are still working fine. However they are both brand new and I have no trust that they will continue working well into the future. It's a shame because I've had great experiences with other Brother devices in the past.tl;dr: These printers have demonstrated a very low rate of reliability and I do not recommend buying them.

The packaging seems similar, perhaps that is why they sent the wrong item.  It shipped very fast.  I got it the next day with 2 day shipping selected. Bought it to do remote view . Not user friendly as no app and next worked for 8 months then , suddenly it goes out of connectivity .
