I think lot of reviews written by Freinds and family here !Two star as when you can connect reports are nice and easy to understand .
It should have a UV component mixed in so that the writing can be reviewed later while still hiding the original content from prying eyes.
If I could give 0 or negative stars I would.  This product is terrible!!  Very short print life, don't bother wasting the money you think you are saving here.

I bought this and as soon as i opened it up the ink came pouring out all over my table and my hands and carpet. So i asked for a refund and im only getting back $3.13!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!!? What a piece of junk these are, i don't know why anyone would write a good review on these.I wish i had thought about taking pictures of the mess

I should have read the reviews first, my bad.  It probably is good for writing, but not for a laptop.  The plastic surface is too slippery for a laptop, and there is not really an edge or raised perforation to keep the laptop from sliding off.  The image provided by the mfg of this product with a laptop looked like it was designed to accommodate the laptop, but it raises it too high which makes typing awkward and uncomfortable (at least for me anyway). Because the mfg not provided the photo of it being used as a laptop desk and promoted it for that use, I am giving it one star too many.  It may be good for writing, but that is not what I wanted.

I was disappointed with this printer; following setup it sporadically worked and required setup each time we attempted to print.  I am thankful I didn't spend a ton on it.  I should have taken heed to previous reviews about how poor of a printer it was.

When this file cabinet arrived, one of the interior guide rails was dislocated. This caused the cabinet to wobble like a balloon animal, and prevented any drawers from shutting all the way until I found the problem (by completely removing the top drawer) and fixed it. It was a fairly easy fix, which only makes me ask why they didn't do it before they shipped it.I would have considered the dislocated piece a small oversight, or maybe something that occurred during shipping, except the cabinet is also about 1/2 inch too short on one side at the bottom. Shipping didn't do that. Despite being on a flat-tile floor, it leans considerably, so it has to be propped up with a wooden splint. Fortunately I only planned to shut this in a closet anyway, so I don't have to look at it. I wasn't expecting this to be top-of-the-line, but for $200+ I do expect it to at least be square.I gave it 2 stars because it does function as a file cabinet, and it hasn't fallen apart. Yet.

As background:  Awhile back I bought the extra sturdy extra wide Pendaflex folders - the extra wide ones have been lasting fine and are doing what they need to do, but for some filing needs the extra wide pendaflexes take up too much room.  -So I bought the regular sized Pendaflexes, which is the item I am reviewing here.  Underscore:  the regular size pendaflexes are being used for LIGHT filing.  I still have extra wide pendaflexes for bulkier filing.Re this item, the regular pendaflexes:  On the very first day of use (less than an hour of use!) one paper side of one pendaflex gave out completely by simply tearing/falling apart at (and only at) both metal hanging parts.  See photos.  You can see there is hardly any wear anywhere on the folder except the tears where the pendaflex paper meets the metal on the one side.  The other side is fine.  The metal didn’t bend or break but the pendaflex paper simply tore off the metal hanging part (on only one side).  I hardly ever write one star reviews, but I hope the quality is better on the rest of the box.  If they all are defectively weak like this then they’re useless.  My husband says I can use moving tape to repair the pendaflex since the metal isn’t broken, so hopefully not a total loss.  Sad, these used to be great.  Generic probably no worse than this!  I must be getting old:  They don’t make ‘em like they used to!

I purchased this for my Samsung ML-2165W printer. It was leaking right out of the sealed package. There was toner on my printer, my scanner and my papers. Toner is persistent stuff. Amazon was wonderful, as usual, about taking it back. Having read the reviews on other refilled cartridges, I guess I'll have to make a point of buying a new cartridge.

The other reviewers who said that the product is flimsy are correct. They are very flimsy, all 3 of them - the sides and the interior divisions, which are basically useless. Other issues:- The medium box is supposedly for bras, but who would use this to store 7 bras? It takes up too much space in my drawer for that. It's just as easy to stack the bras together without the dividers. My husband uses this one to store his ties. He rolls them up and puts them into rows. It works ok, but because the interior dividers are not sturdy it doesn't do a great job of keeping them organized.- I'm not sure what the small box is for. Socks? Underwear? The size is strange and it doesn't seem to work for anything.- The largest box - the little areas are too small. Nothing fits into them, not even ties.I would not buy this again. It's a waste of money.

Fully agree with all the negative reviews here.  The feature set this printer provides would be great if it worked but this printer has never worked reliably for me from the day I bought it (for use with a Mac).  Despite being someone who routinely sets up computer hardware and software I have finally given in after tens of hours of trying to get this to work and will not buy another consumer-grade HP device again.Particular lowlights- print cartridges constantly jamming up and in the end failing completely- printer complaining about being out of paper when it was not - eventuallly the rollers failed completely after very light use- displays on the device are completely unclear (e.g. no proper system of menus)- no good manual- no good printer management software.  most devices nowadays come with a decent piece of software that can be used to manage the device - this does not- device constantly loses wireless connectivity on a network that is otherwise reliable

I was hopeful after reading positive reviews, but my HP Officejet now has a permanent "printer failure" error when the cartridges are loaded.  I have tried all HP troubleshooting and still have the error.  So, I have no functional printer after installing these replacement cartridges.

Bought this all in one printer at the suggestion of a Staples salesperson, and we loved it for the first 29 days.  On the 30th day, it began streaming blue ink across every printed page.  Called customer service, and they walked us thru a bunch of steps, including cleaning the printer head.  Nothing worked.  The blue ink is in globs on the paper, practically like paint.  Customer service offered to send me a new printer head in 2 days.  What am I supposed to do without a printer for 2 days?  I read the reviews on this printer, and clearly the printer head is a major problem that I am not ready to accept as a reoccurring problem.  I am going to take it back to Staples tomorrow, and demand that they accept it as a return.

I purchased this product to laminate my store signs and I'm sorry I wasted my money! Just as one other review stated, the paper is so difficult to peel off the back that it will utterly frustrate you to the point of messing up any quality printing you are trying to preserve. At first I thought maybe it was just the end of the roll that was sticking really bad so I rolled off pieces in 3 feet sections and tried it at least FOUR times before just counting my loss. This is JUNK,JUNK and did I mention... JUNK!! Here it is almost Christmas, I've wasted money on laminate that I can't use for anything because the backing paper won't come off, it has messed up previous printing that I had to do over (wasted laser ink & premium paper) and I still have to order a product to get my store signs done.I initially bought the product because of the Avery name and my past experience with other Avery products but this laminate is pure JUNK! They should stop selling it because you can't send it back to Amazon once you open the box and cut off the roll. So people, if you chose to buy this product anyway to save money (that's why it's so cheap) DON'T bother because you'll end up paying more in the long run! Just as I am very upset about this purchase, you will end up very unhappy as well because they have my money, I now own a box of JUNK that I don't even want to give it away to anyone based off what I just went through. Take my advice and keep looking for a better product!The other thing that pissed me off was the fact that I could not even give this review without checking at least one star when it did not deserve that! So my one star rating is really a ZERO STAR RATING! In my store, I'm always telling people... What you pay - what you got! Boy did I get it!!!
5 stars for Hardware - 3 stars for software and ultimately 2 for the fact i have to boot out of  Mac and into Windows

If I could give 0 stars I would. The black ink isn’t compatible with the printer. It’s like the printer knows it’s a off brand and won’t use it. Absolutely a waste of money DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY
Not a very good blade on the cutter. I wish I could of listen to the reviews. It does the job, but I've had better cutters in the past.

Was excited to receive this replacement lamp after it received decent reviews. It came unbroken in the package, however, the lens was smudged all over with what looked like glue on the outside AND inside of the lens.Also a large fingerprint inside of the lens. Seems like I may have received a used/returned lamp or that there was a manufacturing defect.

Got this printer two years ago.  The installation was NOT easy.  It took several hours of work to get it onto a simple WPA network with high signal strength.Once it was installed, it sort of worked, most of the time, kinda sorta, unless you actually wanted good looking output in which case you were out of luck.  Colors were frequently muddy and or streaked, and periodically the black printhead would simply stop working.  This turns out to be a VERY common problem -- google around a little and you will find LOTS of people asking why this printer has stopped printing in black.  There are several "fixes", including washing out the printhead.  This worked for me twice before the printer finally refused to print in black.I looked for a new printer, but did not even consider any HP models (they have AWFUL ratings on Amazon in any case).  I settled on an EPSON WorkForce 3520. Have only printed a few dozen sheets so far, but the output is excellent and the installation was wonderfully easy -- choose the network, enter the password, install the driver on all our computers, print.  No muss, no fuss, no bother.  Looks like it may be time to move on from HP ... sad.

Not sure why there are so many positive ratings for this product because they do not do the job. Pen skips on all types of paper surfaces. Either these overwhelmingly positive reviews are phony or the manufacturer has reduced quality to make more money.

I ordered these ink cartridges after reading a few good reviews. We have always used the original ones but I decided to try out these  this time. These are so bad that it is almost impossible to print anything. If I am able to print anything, then it is almost ineligible.Please do not buy these.....spend your money on a better quality product.

I read a few good reviews about this ink being used in the Canon TS9120, and decided to give it a try in mine. I was promptly disappointed. It appears that the black ink comes out smeared unless you print at the HIGHEST quality. The image with streaks across it is default print quality, and the one that looks decent is printed at HIGHEST quality, which I presume is more ink-consuming. The price is better than Canon ink but if I have to keep printing at the highest quality, it may have to be replaced much faster regardless of the XXL capacity of this ink.

I bought this printer in December last year and loved it.  It was a great printer and did everything it was supposed to.  However, even though I have not been through the first round of color cartridges yet, and it has started giving me a printhead error that I can not resolve. I can no longer print documents of any kind.  I researched online and found this set of disturbing reports that confirm it is a universal problem caused by a manufacturing defect:[...]I am waiting on my first replacement printhead but having previously owned both HP and Lexmark printers, I am very disappointed in the current quality of Lexmark products and will probably never buy one of their printers again.  When looking at the reviews here, most of the high star ones were written within the first six months of buying the printer.  The problems started for me right around the 6 month mark, so know what you are getting yourself into.

When I received the package, the box was sealed shut with tape, which was fairly normal, but the protective plastic covering INSIDE the box had already been cut open. Since I wasn't about to count the sheet protectors for 100, I didn't think about it further. Then I noticed that SOME of the sheet protectors were defective - they were cut about a quarter of an inch too small for regular 8.5x11 paper. Since this only appears to be a problem with some of them, it's clear that the product was tampered with beforehand.Since the majority of the reviews for this product are stellar, perhaps this was an isolated incident, but I certainly won't be ordering from this company again.

Like another reviewer stated, the printing on the metallic silver Dymo tape is faded in spots. I never had this issue using the white Dymo LetraTag tape.  I'm not happy that returns for this items aren't accepted unless the item is in "new, unused condition". How are we to know there's an issue with the item unless we've first tried it? Thumbs down from me for this product. Now, because I'll have to order another roll of white to get the printing results I expect from my LetraTag label printer, I'll end up paying over $9 to end up with one roll of usable tape.UPDATE 5/7/2020:  Ordered and quickly received a roll of Dymo WHITE LetraTag tape and printed 3 labels perfectly; no faded letters/numbers/symbols/borders.

Just received the cartridges today and packaging was great! I installed the cartridges and again everything went without a hitch, the printer accepted the cartridges as authentic HP cartridges. However when I did the print test page I realized the the light magenta and dark magenta either have the incorrect color of ink in them or they are simply not working. So bottom line nothing is printing with the correct color unless you want black! I guess I should have believed the other reviewers that had the same problem.
My third review - no response to the first two.  The order arrived with one handle / lid lock.  All I want is the missing lid lock.

The pen is okay. The customer service may be lacking. Not sure.The cartridge that came in my pen ran out of ink while writing upside down after writing a total of 18 mostly small words."I am now testing the fidelity of my fisher space pen. Trust without tests is useless. My handwriting [does not.]" faded out at 'does not.'Fresh out of the box and will no longer write at any angle (not even 270 with the butt of the pen at the origin.) Brilliant. 2 stars.
Garbage if I could give negativ stars I would. Who orders one pencil. This should state more clearly that only one pencil comes for the price of a pack. So mad.

I dislike writing negative reviews but this ink is plain right  HORRIBLE. Not even worth the price! I relied on it to use in the printer that prints office documents and the blacks won't print at all. All the font coloring had to change to blue or some other color before it could print. I am so disappointed in the manufactures. You could charge a little more but provide bearable quality. I do no recommend it at all.

To the reviewers who were able to connect a standard hose, you must have gotten the correct parts, and to most who cannot get the standard hose to fit, you got the wrong parts. This does not fit standard hoses (I have two different "standards", cannot get either to thread properly. I went to Home Depot for some kind of adapter. The employee looked at the end of the supplied hardware, and said the threads are "commercial threads", NOT garden hose threads. Well, he ended up giving me the wrong adapter (I needed female, bought male). I'm sure I can get it to work, but I do have to trek to Home Depot again. How can a company claim something works, without testing it out first?! I will go to the ends of the earth to try and reach this company and have them remedy this problem, with either compensation or the correct part(s). I will chime in again when if I can reach the company.UPDATE: This company was very helpful and did get the right part out to me. But this update is very late (that was almost a year ago). I'm writing in to say that the hose, as well as the gaskets attached to the drain, everything connected to these became brittle and literally have fallen apart in my hands. Now I just have the table, the very oxidated faucet, and bewilderment. I don't know what to do now except measure the drain hole and hope to find some ideas at Home Depot to fix this dilemma. I'll be contacting the company (or distributor) again. BTW: They are not Norwood, they are schooloutfitters.com.

This chair mat is supposed to be for high pile carpets, which I have and it does NOT stay in place. Every day I have to reposition it.  The little nubs on the bottom (which are supposed to hold it in place) are not long enough to hold to the high pile carpet. The nubs are short and completely rounded off. I would not purchase this again. The only reason I gave it a 2 star is because it is made of strong flexible plastic and I'm sure it will stand up to constant use- it just won't stay in place while you are using it.....

If they could make this table function a little bit better, it would be 5 stars.  It doesn't stay up, the pole that allows it to change heights doesn't work.  It constantly falls and no matter how tight I screw in the holding screw, it won't stay up.  The most frustrating part is that it swivels without a way to stop it from moving.  Every time you try to type on your laptop, it moves away from you, unless you hold the top in place.  Lastly, it will tip over unless your laptop is centered over the long part of the legs.  If it swivels in any direction, it will start to tip over.  Have fast reflexes to avoid breaking your computer.
It is missing the pages for 8/13/18 - 10/8/18. I gave it 2 stars, because I only paid $3.  You get what you pay for.
Submitting review to warn others that this thing is not magnetic. Too lazy to return a 5 dollar item, but dislike misrepresentation.

Out of four boxes that arrived lids are broken while double-boxed!! The support page is non-existent. You will be paying for four but gonna be able to use maybe two if lucky. The boxes are OK, not too sturdy and the lids are very flimsy. Not worth the money in my opinion for sure. I wish I paid attention to the reviews before the purchase, way too many negative ones in regards arriving broken.

I cannot give a good review - my printer has been so funky with these cartridges. No problems before using regular HP cartridges but ever since switching to these suckers every time I print a large print job (more than one page) it won't print color. It is driving me nuts - and I know I am not printing in "black and white" and I am DEFINITELY not out of color ink (since it hasn't hardly printed anything in color since putting in these cartridges)I figured there wasn't any problem with taking a chance since it is much cheaper....learn from my mistake and just stick to the regular HP cartridges, it ends up actually being cheaper in the end (since you don't first buy crappy cheap brand cartridges only to eventually go back to brand name)Ahhhh I feel better now. For some reason writing a crappy review helps alleviate the frustration pulsing through my body as I sit here and watch my printer finish printing a book in black and white that I actually need printed in color. Rant over.
This is so miss leading I should have read the reviews I normally do..$16 for one refill NOT A BOX FULL..THAT'S JUST RIDICULOUS!! If I could rate no stars I would...just stupid 🤦🤦🤦🤦🤦🤦

I like the printer. I like that it was easy to set up. It prints fine. But heres the reason it gets only 2 stars... The cartridges that came with it were half empty, ran out after printing about 30 color pages. That is how they come even when you buy them new. You have to buy 564xl to get a semi full cartridge. Do you believe that a company actually sells half empty ink cartridges, thats really bad business to me. NOw with that being said, I am currently researching what ink to actually buy as i have read that the ink cartridges hp says to use with it will not work. Some of the 564 / 564xl ink says not for use with photosmart plus, so im kinda lost right now. why do these companies make things so friggin complicated.

So I read the reviews about the network and thought it can’t be that bad but it is. It has an energy saving mode and switches off and everytime you want to print from your phone or laptop you have to scan the connect barcode. The whole point of wifi printing is to print from anywhere, but i would have to turn off energy saving mode , set up the wifi and then go back to what I was trying to print . It took up so much time I sent it back and got a brother. Spend the extra $50-$100 and get a printer that makes life easy. This was not worth the savings for all the extra work.

The eight year old hp printer I had  was a gem but began to show its age.  I replaced it with the photo smart, unfortunately, without seeing the bad reviews. The set up was easy although the entire table shakes as it gets ready.  The first day it s scanned, copied, and did an average job of printing photos.  Then, the scanner could no longer communicative with my computer.  After two sessions of 2 hours each, the technician gave up. He had been very condescending until he was chastened by not being able to fix the problem.  He promised a "Level Two Technician" would call the next day.  No call.  Another contact was made and a very pleasant woman tried for another two hours to solve the problem without success.  She was hampered by the first not leaving any notes of his failed attempt.  She finally threw in the towel and said it must be a problem with the computer and not the printer.  I gave up.  Fortunately, I have another scanner and will use the hp for copying and printing.

The shipping was faster than expected. However when they arrived, the bottom of the box was opened. Sand one of the pencils had a broken tip... Which isn't that big of a deal.... However, I rated these 2 stars because they don't color very well. Like they feel scratchy when using them... If that even makes any sense.Also they advertised that these are the Johanna Basford edition... Which you can see in the photos that is not the case.

Previously, I had used the Strathmore inkjet paper canvas coated 8.5 x 11 with beautiful results.  I used it to print out pictures of my acrylic paintings to sell as prints.  After reading reviews, I decided to try this brand for cheaper, it was on sale at the time.  The ink does not absorb very well, leaving a blotchy look all over especially on the black.  I have wasted ink, and have to wait another week to get my other canvas paper.  I will not buy this again.
The cartridges were not accepted by our printer.  I would give less than one star if possible.  The seller should have warned buyers about this.
I am filling my MAGI boxes to be sent to Honduras with them. Not able to over all rate since Iwill not see them being used.

EDIT 11/19/18  I returned the first order for reasons below.  Installed the second batch.  Less than half the ink is used and nothing but problems.  Glad I had a spare black back-up or I would be in real trouble.  The first half of ink life it is pretty good, they go downhill real quick.  I tried the back and forth rocking motion on each cylinder and that did no good.  USE AT YOUR OWN PERIL.EDIT 4/16/2018  I'm downgrading my review.  After using approx 60% of the ink in the black cartridge, I started getting smudging. Black only.  I ran through the Canon cleaning steps, but that did not solve the problem.  There are also some streaks on the left and right side of the printed paper.  I took out the cartridge and found lines etched in the blue roller that are very similar to the streaks.  I will try to contact seller and see if they will replace the bad black cartridgeThe odd thing about this is I had within a couple of hours previous ordered another black cartridge, since the others still have about 80%.  I canceled the order just now and I'm going to see if they will ship me outSo far so good.  The box looked and was labeled a bit differently, but when I looked closely it was properly identified.  Well packed with clear, easy to read instructions.  It was very simple to install and worked right the very first time.  There was no visual difference between what I installed and what I took out, except for the product name label.This is the first set of replacement cartridges I've ordered for this printer.  Have needed black only so far.  For that reason, I'm assigning only 4 stars.  I will return and change to 5 stars later if it continues to work this well and the other colors perform properly.

so, so. Amazon 4 color ones write better. these take 10 minutes to get started and after that it is hard to find angle where it writes good. the ends seem to be from hard dry material. it is just so soupdate 3/13/17 going down to 1 star as by now most of them are in the garbage even though they all still have liquid chalk in them, horrible tips are completely frayed and make them absolutely useless. The tips are horrible and disintegrate after mild use and become like q-tips - soft and very hard to write. Will never buy this brand again...

I purchased this in 2010 from another site but since I make almost all my purchases from Amazon I wanted to leave a review here.You can without a doubt expect to have print head problems (as other reviewers have reported). They sent me a new head a few months after I purchased the printer free of charge because it was such a wide-spread problem. The new head has seemed to work OK since then, so I might let it go if not for the other problems.From the beginning the printer has maintained an extremely unreliable network connection. My wife pretty much expects that if she wants to print something it won't come out. Usually we need to cycle the power by unplugging the power cord and then it will print. I thought maybe it was a WiFi problem so I connected it via Ethernet and still have the same issues. (By the way, I have a Samsung monochrome laser printer connected via Ethernet and it works 100% of the time, every time. No power cycle necessary!)Even if the network printing issue could be resolved there are still more problems. The one feature I really liked was the scan to email and scan to Flickr. I really liked it until the scanner started malfunctioning and producing lots of white dots and color blotches. And then the other day I could not get the scanner to scan to email any longer, even after cycling the power.At this point my printer is a nice looking but non-functional piece of plastic. I really liked the features and the design concept, and when it prints the quality of the photos look really good. But since none of the functions work reliably or well, you should run (not walk) away and buy another printer. In fact, I cannot think of a reason why I would risk any money on another printer made by Lexmark. If you are listening Lexmark, poor products kill brands! If you go under, you can partly blame this piece of junk.

I am hoping to get a new one and update this rating, but I bought this for my mom’s Birthday, and every time we tried to print something it would tell us the ink was empty. We tried using a new cartridge, but it said it again. The first time it even spit out crinkled up ink sheets. I really hope that once I repurchase, it will be a brand new well-working machine.

I would give it no Stars if I could. I can't get it to transfer to any type of material it looks to be just plain paper. I'm very upset but that's the risk I took. I should've known that there was a problem when in the instructions it had several misspellings and overall it didn't make sense. AVOID!!!!

Let me start out by stating that as far as speed and reliability when using ONLY there products this printer is great.  Their black ink is only $5 which is great deal for black ink.  Their color on the other hand for xl version is $60 when buying there brand.  Since this printer is a return ink program printer they don't want you buying remanufactured ink.  In fact they go on to say it could ruin your printer and that is why they discourage it.I have purchased remanufactured ink for printers of various manufactures and have never had issues until I bought one from Lexmark.  I've purchased remanufactured ink for hp, canon, Epson and dell and virtually flawless.  Now with this Lexmark my plan was to buy the genuine black for $5 and buy the color from a remanufactured ink company for 50% the cost of the genuine.  If I were going to print long lasting photographs I would always go with genuine no matter what do to the fact the generic could very well fade in time but I bought this printer primarily for uses other than printing photographs.  I have an Epson and a canon for those tasks.Suffice it to say I have been working with various remanufactured ink companies for over a year because unlike many other manufacturers Lexmark makes it virtually impossible to clone their ink.  Now I have found some companies that can do so with some success but the reason I am giving this printer two stars is because I have come to the conclusion that their practices when handling third party ink is very unethical indeed.For a cartridge to read the volume properly in their printer the remanufacturing plant must get the chip just right so it will reset the paper count internally which than tells their firmware to either fill up the ink level or to leave it at the level it was before replacing it.  What I have recently discovered after over a year of playing around is that Lexmark makes it very hard to reset the page count when using third party chips.  In fact if a third party chip is not perfect it will not reset.  I have worked with remanufactured ink companies and went through typical troubleshooting steps that help do this.  None of these worked such as reseating the ink cartridge, holding down the power for 15 seconds or unplugging from the power strip after turning off the printer for 15 minutes and replugging the printer back in.  Recently I even reset the page count with a genuine ink cartridge and than replaced it with the generic ink cartridge again but instead of keeping the condition the genuine cartridge set the volume to it reverted back to the last state the workable generic cartridge was in was by now practically empty.The reason I am giving two stars though is because when the ink level on the printer indicates very low which is shown by a red circle with a white x in it is because it will not properly distribute the ink from the cartridge in which it gives this indication despite the fact that their is plenty of that colors ink in the cartridge since the reason for the low volume reason was a failure for them to get the resetting procedure for this cartridge correct.Because they didn't Lexmark apparently starts capping off pours until it caps off the whole cartridge making it so no ink is dispersed from the cartridge it "thinks" is critically low even though the cartridge literally is full.This happens before the printer finally tells you that you need to change the cartridge. When I discovered this practice I was very disappointed with Lexmark.It maybe that all ink manufacturers now when showing ink levels to be critically low stop dispersing the ink properly on the piece of paper if it disperses any at all I don't know but I do know at least with the canon mx860 ink is dispersed weather generic or genuine until the cartridge actually says there is no ink to disperse but until that time even when it indicates critically low levels until it officially thinks it ran out it properly disperses the ink given that the physical ink and or pours on the inkhead are not damaged.For this reason I give this printer a one star.  I will never recommend a Lexmark again.  In fact I discovered that many of these printing companies that want you to return the ink cartridge to them after use will take out the core from the cartridge and recycle that themselves.  This is the procedure that remanufactured ink does but Lexmark tries to scare their customers into thinking that buying from these third party guys will ruin their printers and than these customers are convinced that these third party ink manufactures are to blame when things to go smoothly in regards to how it interacts with their printers when it is Lexmark who has put the printer together in such a way that it makes it very hard to clone and even when it can be read it is not always reset and when that happens when the icon shows critically low even when it is not the printer will not allow sufficient ink of that color it shows to be critically low to come out of the cartridge.Most people would not go through all these processes I have undertook in order to get to the bottom of why it has been such a headache to use generic ink cartridges with this printer.  In fact remanufactured ink companies told me Lexmark is the worst about this practice because they noticed how hp, canon and the rest were losing money because like me people would not want to pay for their high cost inks that come in pretty packages and seeing this Lexmark early on put on restrictions with their printer that highly discouraged the use of generic ink to the point where if the cartridge is not intentionally reviewed it will even give you a message that what you have is not a genuine cartridge and to please replace with a genuine and until you do the printer won't operate at all.In conclusion while other companies may soon be following Lexmark's lead in this department I blame Lexmark because it was first with them that this started happening and even when it is functional if the reset procedure failed even though the cartridge has good ink that is filled tot he top Lexmark will not make use of it but will stop it from printing that color when it decides it is critically low even though in reality it has plenty of ink to pull from and print decent pictures with that color.Lastly to polish it all off Lexmark will tell you that you have a 5 year warranty on these printers when purchased new however they will also tell you if you don't fill out some type of registration this nullifies the 5 year warranty and you are stuck with only a 90 day warranty.  From my experience I find that you can still get a replacement even if you didn't register however it is another scare tactic from Lexmark to force you to do what they want.  They control your ink and try to force you to register your product by threatening a reduced warranty if you don't.

In my opinion, this traveler's notebook is not leather as they described. It assuredly is not cowhide. It is lacking any and all smells that  leathers have. It is also accumulating a white film all over the cover, which is, again, concerning. This product may very well have ben worth $12 to some people, which was a sale on this particular traveler's noiebook, but the recent increase in price is unacceptable for what you get. There are many better options our there or you to consider . Thank you for reading my review, it could definitely save you ome time.Best,-J

They get 2 stars instead of 1 star because they work. However, if you want a real BOLD point pen, buy a Pilot G-2. The G-2's at 1.0mm are a much wider ink line then the Foray's supposed 1.2 mm line. The foray pens are not the "Bold Line"as advertised but are a "Fine Line" .7mm line. They are Not as advertised and Not what I wanted. I returned them.

I bought this based on good reviews by others. The cartridge came well packed but was a little difficult to install. I had to force it in. The problem is that when it printed the first page, the ink was not strong; it was as if I was printing on economode (which I was not). After ~300 pages, I now see blank spaces and the cartridge is running out of ink.  I am very disappointed.

We bought two, great deal and we liked how much the ink toners were ($5) as most reviewers liked.  But it did seem to good to be true.  We used it for about 4 months and then we started getting streaky printing and colours bled.  And then there is an issue with the printhead. We followed all of the instructions, replaced the printhead, deep clean the printhead and now the black does not even print.  I have looked online for possible solutions and there are a ton of people with the same issue.  And the Lexmark support staff are not helpful nor do they admit there is a chronic issue.  Thank you Lexmark, you have now made choosing a printer a lot simpler.
Would have rated a -10 if I could have!!! This product isn't worth a dollar - very flimsy and month, date, year wheels slip constantly. Probably wouldn't last a week.

This notebook is perfect size but the paper quality is not tomoe river paper like most of the midori inserts. I was disappointed to find this out and there was no reviews saying it was or wasn't. If you are looking for ok quality paper this is it but if you are looking for great quality paper for water colors and fountain pens don't buy this as ghosting is bad.
Read great reviews about this pen and bought the 12 pack, but was not happy with the ink flow. Will not use these pens. Delivery was prompt.

I read the reviews and thought, yes, it’s cardboard, I get it...what’s the bid deal? But oh my, this thing is a POS. The pictures show how it looks right after I assembled it. It’s already coming apart! Now had this been $10 (as it should be), I could deal with that but seriously?! And just forget about these stupid plastic sliders unless you want to tear up your cardboard partitions. So I gave up and threw those away. I was debating another one but not anymore!

This product arrived on time and in new condition. This is a full set of all glitter pens and that is a rare find. I gave them a fair chance by using them for a week or so before leaving a review. I won’t be using them anymore, and here’s why: 1. While I found a few pens that colored smoothly, many are difficult to use because the ink either won’t come out at all, or the ink only stubbornly comes out when forced. 2. The pens are numbered, but the numbers are tiny and clear. I can only see them if I have the pen under a light. Very straining on the eyes. 3. Even worse, many of the numbers are the same. For instance, there are 7 number 6’s. For as many pens that come with this set, the numbers only reach 24.

After 25 years for 2013 Mead removed the bottom corner page perforations.  Each week tear off the bottom corner 1/2 inch so your thumb quickly finds the current week's page.  But in 2013 the perforations are now gone.  So you have to find a scissors, cut the corner and it looks messy, uneven.  Or worse, new users don't know this handy way to find the current week.This has been my essential calendar for 25+ years, used to buy 2 in case I lost 1, WOULD GIVE IT 5 STARS EASILY, BUT Mead is TAKING AWAY A FEATURE AND BENEFIT FOR US USERS thus this complainers 1 or 2 stars.  Look, it's a great quality calendar.  Buy it.  Other reviews are accurate.  Tell Mead to PUT THE PERFORATIONS BACK.
The item is not at all as advertised. If I could have given zero stars I would have.

I don't even want to give this table one star.  It is very flimsy. My mother is bedridden and I bought this so she could feed herself. Well she can't do that because the table doesn't go far enough under the bed. It won't roll, you have to pick it up to move it.

This makes me mad. Keeps saying that the printer is not detected but it was detected 5 minutes ago! I have NEVER had so much trouble setting up a printer! I mean, I'm used to plug and go! I've been at this...installing and re-installing for 3 hours. Returning! Oh...Reviews said it didn't come with a cable so I bought an extra one and lo and behold, it comes with a cable!

Pros:Takes any orientation of the billHas a battery to be made portable.Security Features include Magnetic, Infrared, and UV. It might include others such as watermarks, size and Thread.Counts Bills and gives total summation despite the variety of bills inserted.Cons:Authentic Bills might be rejected (so you might have to flip the bill, and play with it: time consuming for old, wrinkled bills)Battery with Memory Loss (My unit has failed to work because it cannot be charged anymore).No replacement parts for sale, such as the battery and charger.Accepted Bills are tossed away, and if put on a counter (such as a Register) it will send them flying to the floor (think of a $100 BILL flying away at the right moment a customer opens the door and wind rushes in.Summary:For a business that handles big transactions quite frequently, this is quite your option to go for. It will pay-off by itself after catching 3 fake bills of $100. A business owner will immediately see the benefits outweighing  the costs. The plus side about this is that you can carry it to wherever your customer is and authenticate the bills without having the customer taking his/her eyes off the money. Time saver, big time.The only reason why i am giving 1 star is because my unit is basically a piece of junk without a working battery. Otherwise, its a great product that I would recommend. I guess i just happen to be very unlucky since nobody else had this problem. FML =(

I had to give 1 star in order to write review.In the keys with family. First day the stroller worked well. Had to push it with the little wheels in front up in air. Would not push through sand otherwise. The next day went to push stroller unto beach and the handle snapped where it was suppose to be locked, everything folded up and fell out. Non- repairable. We ended up using my granddaughter little red wagon with no issues.Not worth the money or aggravation.

It was a mess before I attempted removing the print-head...my advice is DO NOT LET THESE LITTLE MONSTERS IN YOUR LIFE!

I believe this caused my printer (Canon MP560) to be unusable -- it started displaying the B200 error (printer head error) after using these.  I gave it 2 stars because I'm not 100% certain it was due to these, however, it looks like others have had similar results.

Should have read the reviews. It does says that it is not ream wrapped. Unfortunately, they just send 2500 sheets in whatever box is handy. They do ALL arrive damaged around the edges. Don't buy this for any type of professional application. Maybe for kindergartners to play with or as scrap paper.

Just awful.  Should have paid attention to those reviews where cartridges leaked and created lines all over the copies.  First dozen copies were just fine.  After that cartridges leaked and made a mess of the copies.  A complete waste of money.  Not at all up to Amazon standards.  Recommend shopping elsewhere.  You'll save money and frustration in the long run.

Don’t understand why this product has such high ratings.  The material is so thin compared to my exiting ones bought from other vendors. Regret not to open the box before the return deadline, now I’m stick with it.

I bought this because of the "Plug and play. No software drivers to install" information on the website. It DOES NOT work by simply plugging in. If you do not have a CD drive to use the CD enclosed with the product (mine does not work), and download the software from Veho it does not install automatically, and when you do work out how to install it it takes over all the existing photos on your computer but still does not work with the scanner. When asked for a product key it said the one I entered from the disc enclosed with the scanner was "invalid", and wanted me to pay extra for a product key! When plugged in via the USB on my laptop I got the message that the scanner was not switched on. I re-packed it and sent it back the day it was delivered. I see that one star means "I hate it". If allowed I would not have given it any stars at all, but Amazon insist on a star rating. It is the worst piece of equipment I have encountered for years! The process of sending it back was fortunately much less stressful than trying to get it to do what it is supposed to do!

This roll arrived back in January so it is past the return time frame.  I just now went to use it, and the laminating material will not pull off of the paper backing!  It is defective! I highly suggest to not purchase this product! It seems like a great price, but I can't even use this at all.  If I could give it 0 stars I would!

The 2 stars are for the brush applicator - it’s very much preferable to the foam wedge applicator which is now the only applicator offered by PaperMate LiquidPaper.The other 3 stars are missing because this correction fluid is too thin to adequately cover Pilot G-2 pen writing - and multiple applications cause the ink to bleed through the paper.

I've had all 5 casters break, one at a time, replacing them with ones that the company was nice enough to send out to me.  But now everything else is falling apart.  The height adjustment doesn't work, and the leather at the front behind my knees is ripping away.  For a $250 chair this should not be happening, especially since I'm 130lbs under the weight limit on their website.I'm in contact with a very helpful customer service rep who is trying to get my problems sorted out, but I don't know if anything other than a new chair will be able to fix them.Based on my experiences so far I'd have to say avoid.  I bought this chair because of the good reviews, so maybe they were having some quality issues in the run that my chair was made.Update:  I've basically gotten a new chair.  New base and about a dozen new casters.  They still snap off from time to time but the company keeps sending me more so it's not as big of a problem, since I'm not out any more money.

I always read the reviews prior to buying, so I was quite disappointed when I came to use it.I`ve used various ones in the past but find this is not intuitive at all, no key to clearthe screen, anagrams seem to need every letter, i.e no spaces, so I`m unhappy with my purchase.

It is interesting that the best review are pushed to the top of the list.It's a constant battle with the ink in this printer. The cartridges dry up, they run out of ink quickly, there is always some kind of message telling me I need to buy ink. I print 5-10 pages in a week. Remember that printers are sold only to get you to purchase ink - that seems to be the case with this printer also.The wireless networking? I use a couple of Apple computers with this printer. Quite often the printer cannot be found and it takes 10 minutes of this and that to make it work. If my router loses power, for some reason the printer loses the router's password. This makes no sense at all since the printer is on a battery backup. Printing from the iPhone works most of the time.After the printer goes into sleep mode it takes a while for it to make a print.Print quality is fine.Update June of 2012 - The printer disconnects from the wireless router anytime the power flickers. Each time this happens I have to set the wireless networking up again. All of my computers store have the ability to store wireless networking information but this sorry printer does not. Oh, the printer is connected to a UPS. If the router were connected to a UPS this would not be an issue. There is no easy way of connecting my wireless router to a UPS. All of this reaffirms my theory that the goal of HP is to sell ink at very high prices. The printer may be rarely functional...just as long as they can sell you 2 milliliters of ink for $20.The printer takes 5 minutes to print one page at times. I send the print and it goes through this "preparing to print" ordeal. Nothing but a hassle.

I bought the 4-pack to store files. So far they seem great. The lid might not be as secure as i'd want it, but they stack onto each other well and seem very solidly built. I took off one star because one of the lids arrived with a shattered corner.Edit: Ordered another and 2 of the 4 lids and boxes, along with my hopes, are shattered. I'll be trying to send these back.

THE ABOVE AVERAGE/AVERAGE USER SHOULD STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.While the print quality is good and the design attractive, several serious cons exist:1. RELIABILITY: This prints and scans wirelessly great when it does...but that's ALMOST NEVER. My printer stays on strike.2. WIRELESS SET-UP: Constantly needs to be redone(which take hours), although this could be avoided by "changing your printers IP address". Do you know how to do that? Didn't think so.3. TONER: Limited Life and Expensive. Expect to spend $35-40 (high yield) each go.4. SCANNER: Scans documents as individual jpegs. As such, will need third-party software to convert and merge documents. Time consuming.5. GUIDED SOLUTIONS (accompanying troubleshooting software): USELESS.6. CUSTOMER SERVICE: The agents can be rude. All appeared to be frustrated and as lost as I. I found the user submitted solutions on the HP site to be effective and the most useful. Unfortunately, HP removed these pages when it redid its site.I should mention, I initially returned the product to Best-Buy after a month or so of owning it; it stopped working. I was issued another, and have had it for approx. 10 months. My review is primarily based on the replacement. I personally will not be buying another HP product. This has been a difficult print year.

These are not 13in wide folders. They will fit in my wife's desk drawer for hanging folders, but not for mine. At least, we can use these. I see one other customer wrote a review about these folders not being13 inches wide.

I ordered this scale for reloading thinking it would work well and seems to be well liked on the reviews. However I knew within 5 mins or so of use this wasn't the scale for me. First off...and the biggest issue was that I could not get it to calibrate. I powered it on, let it sit for a minute to "warm up" and then put an object of known weight on it and it read low. I used their calibration method in the manual and it still would not calibrate properly. Also another problem i ran into is that this only measures grains to the next full number...which is a huge problem for reloaders. Example: i need a 3.2 grain charge. It reads 3 grains or 4 grains...theres no tenths or hundredths place. I'm sure this scale would work ok for other things but for a reloader stay away.

This printer is basic but worked for me for years. Then I moved. HP now runs Samsung printer support. In setting up, I couldn't connect it to WiFi, so I bought a cable. It still didn't work, so I went online to the official HP site to download and reinstall the printer drivers. I did this multiple times and was consistently notified the file was out of date or corrupt. I went to HP online for support. HP does not recognize the serial number on this printer and its impossible to get options to contact them (so no phone number, no chat service) without a recognized serial number. I just rechecked the reviews and saw other people said the same thing. Basically, now I have to replace what should be a perfectly fine printer.

This has got to be the worst printer ever. Prints occasionally when it feels like it. Wireless is worthless. Cartridges are expensive and run out quickly. I fully regret giving away the cheap printer we replaced with this. It was far more reliable. Try something else.Oh and I wouldn't include this in the review but it's worth noting that it used to work with generic ink cartridges until a software update put a stop to that. That alone is a problem for me but the poor review is justified solely by the function of the printer with name brand cartridges.
Zero stars. Did not last a single wash.

Update: 1/2013I have now had this chair for around 13 months and I am downgrading my review to 1-star. I previously had problems with weak welds in the caster mounts causing chair to tip.  My chair has now developed a new wobble at the point where the base stem connects to the bottom of the chair. Again it looks like a weak weld gave out.  The wobble is very annoying.  This is simply poorly constructed made in china junk.  To reiterate I weigh 300 lbs and I am not doing gymnastics in the chair.  I have never had these problems with other office chairs which did not advertise being specifically designed for large and heavy people.In short, DON'T BUY THIS CHAIR!!Hope this helps someone else out.I gave this product 3 stars because the chair itself is very comfortable, but I encountered quality control issues with the base of the chair and the casters. The problem is that the welds which connect the caster receptacles to the actual base are weak and they break. The caster doesn't fall out but then the whole caster assembly can wobble inside the base. When weight is put on the chair the caster then slumps sideways. This leads to the chair tilting to whichever side the caster has slumped to. Also, any caster which is tilted tends not to roll correctly which means that a chair in this condition won't roll most of the time. This problem developed around 3-4 months after I purchased the product.(Just for the record I weigh around 295lbs. so I was not near the chair weight limit.)I solved this problem by replacing the entire base of the chair with a comparable base from the old chair I had been replacing. This was simpler than talking to customer service to get a replacement. Generally, in my opinion if I have to talk to customer service your product has already failed.Just for the record.. removing the base was extremely difficult and required serious work with a heavy hammer. (to be expected)Additionally, there is a design/quality issue with the base. The base is tubular steel and there are welds around the edges of each 'foot' where a caster assembly is attached.  These welds are very rough and when I was sitting in the chair with socks on everytime I moved my feet across the 'foot' the rough welding would tear at my socks. This is a minor usability issue, but I never had it happen with any other chair i've purchased.So make your choice.. but be warned.  I don't know whether they've fixed this issue or not.

I don't give reviews of product, this is my first. I was going to  buy a proper scales but when  the reviews for this were so  good I thought  I'd try it.Well those other must be getting stock from the factory door because I did't think there was any way to ship a .1g scale in the post and have it arrive working. I was correct. This thing is £1 pound shop rubbish.The minute it is on the digits jump around 100+grams each side of minus. When I put something on it anyway, it displays 0-Ld. No idea what that means. I'm a programmer and no combinations of  buttons will make it work. I  also bought a 50g weight thinking I would be able to calibrate it. Turns out you can only do  that with a 100g weight. Wouldn't help  here anyway as it cant even zero it self.I also  notice pattern with the good reviews. Really cheap crappy material. It's all paper, including the cover. The paper edges were folded when I got it, it already looks like it's been in my bag for days. I can't imagine what this will look like after I start using it. 2 stars for the large squares for writing in.

I am just glad I didnt pay a ton for these.  Sometimes you do get what you paid for.  Its not a horrible product though, for now its getting the job done. Not our favorite printer. i purchased based on ratings and so far we have blown through so much toner and the bypass tray misfeeds.

I have used Brother Printers for years and have noticed a steady decline in quality. This is the second 8710 I have owned.  The first one had a bad fuser.  The Printer indicated 60% fuser life left when it failed.  So I bought another, thinking I just had bad luck with this one.  Second  printer has the same issue after 52% fuser life left.  This appears to be a common problem if you look at other online sites.  Just look up the model number and the words "fuzzy printing". It turns out it was a design issue. Not sure if newer model numbers have the issue fixed or not.  Really hard to get a straight answer from Brother. I always use Brother toner cartridges and drum units.  Don't be fooled by the low price of a machine that you think can do it all.  I have yet to have one of these last more than 2 years.  We have several Brother printers in our office and are now beginning the process of reviewing other brands.

This lamination is horrid.  I just got off the phone with Avery customer care and instead of a refund, they are mailing me another roll. Cup holder on the right means very little room for your mouse.  Because of the angle, the second you let go to type, the mouse falls to the bottom of the screen.  The mouse issue was anticipated, so they added a very very uncomfortable lip to stop it from falling off the desktop completely.  This lip hurts to the point where you need a wrist cushion.  Once you add the wrist cushion, the bottom half of the extension is used up and the mouse is now half in the drink hole.  It comes with a FitDesk mousepad which is too big to actually fit on the product it comes with.  All in all, although they obviously planned this extension from the start (because they added receiving holes for it on the desktop that comes with the FitDesk 2.0), it doesn't appear much thought was put in to this it or how it would actually be used.This review was written while working on the otherwise excellent for the money Fitdesk 2.0.

I received two black cartridges.  Neither worked!  After reading a couple of customer reviews I tried clearing the contacts with an alcohol pad and the cartridge worked.  I will be reluctant to purchase these again.

I love that this desk mat came flat and it's thick! It's not the beveled edge - the rest of the mat has the normal bevel, which I wanted for carpet.  This is just a six inch area that curls under quite a bit more than the bevel. I won't return it as it would be a lot to repackage, awkward to carry, and get to the shipping store which is an hour away.I'll update my review to see how things go with it laying down and the sturdiness of the mat!Update:  I've been using the mat for a few days now and that edge isn't going to lay flat.  It's a defect.  Other than that one area, I'm pleased with the thickness and how smoothly my chair rolls over it.I did contact the maker and they emailed back that it's Amazon's problem as they distribute the mat.

A two month old doorstop! The Canon Pixma MG 2525 prints photographs out of alignment with their own Canon paper, according to "tech support" there is nothing you can do to adjust it, AND CANON TECH KNOWS IT!Please note this review IS NOT about picture quality. It is about the misalignment of margins THAT CANNOT BE CORRECTED! There is no comment or warning about this in the pre-sale promotion of this thing...  If you want to share photos that insult the person you're giving them to, that look like you were drunk when you printed them, by all means buy this. [See photos]After a delay  of a half hour of registration, bla bla bla and the tech support blaming everything from the format of the pictures to the alignment of the stars, the dude FINALLY admitted that BADLY OUT OF ALIGNMENT margins ON PHOTOGRAPHS  is the normal NORMAL FUNCTIONING of the unit.Also, the printer won't scan and I cannot screen capture my offline PC.So, Canon knows that this Pixma MG2525 prints photos with margins out of  alignment, there is nothing the  user can do, but they still promote the unit as printing photos.This if FRAUD pure and simple.I know most people scan reviews and don't pay much attention to  a single review. Being one of those people who don't normally post negative reviews, I am  doing this  for my own purposes. As I am disabled and I cannot return this via any shipping method, my two month old Canon Pixma MG2525 just sits here taking up space until I go back to shopping and re-use the space it is in with a printer that works [NOT Canon again!]I would NEVER put this nightmare onto another person. So this is less a negative review than a eulogy at a wake before I bury this box of crap in a trash can.

This was an unexpected fail to me as Magliner products are usually top notch. I'll give it 2 stars because build quality was great as I've come to expect from this brand.The issue is the product design itself. There are 2 ridge humps along the middle of the entire tongue plate. These are where your cargo rests. By being both much narrower than the whole plate footprint, and rounded, my boxes kept wanting to slide off and fall off both sides of the plate. It is completely unusable to me so I removed the whole thing. I may see if I can engineer a fix to salvage the poor design by bolting on some extra edge supports. For now I'd recommend most to avoid this.

At first these boxes seem to be the answer to organization. I would never recommend these file boxes to anyone. The latch in the front that is suppose to open and close the lid is plastic with a plastic bar. After I closed all 4 of them with many many documents, including tax returns, I could not get them open without a struggle, after several attempts the latch would work only once, which is pretty important. If any other buyers have the same problem, please take the time to write a review so other buyers are saved the hassle that I went through.

We employ about 15 or so of these in our organization, so we have a pretty large sample size of these, all obtained from Amazon at different time periods.  Let me start with the good things about this product line:-The scanning software is very easy for end-users, even inexperienced ones.-It has ISIS driver support for the scanner, which is important for some enterprise applications.-Typically prints very well and fast.-Price is very competitive.-Drivers/Firmware is easy to find on the support section of the website, this is an important feature for IT.Now onto the bad, which is the main reason that I'm dropping this from a would-be 5 star to 2:-There is a serious defect in these machines, which is the fuser assembly.  Today I am staring down the barrel of my 5th MFC (!!!) that is basically a paperweight now due to the fact that the fuser roller has crumpled and causes a jam on every single print. Note that most of these machines were less than a year old at the time of failure, and the rest less than 2 years old.-To add insult to injury, you can't buy the fuser or service information directly from Brother, they consider this to be "internal information". Only authorized servicers are allowed this information.-If you don't have authorized servicers in your area, which you likely won't unless you are in a big city, you will have to sort of guess at the part # and buy it online, where it is marked up to well over half the cost of the printer.Note: This flaw occurs across the 8710 and 8910 product lines, so be wary of either one.Anyway, the TL;DR - This is a good machine, aside from the one fatal flaw it has, which unfortunately is proving to be unusually common.  Go onto Brother's service locator site and make sure you have a servicer in your area if you plan to buy one, and if you don't, you better be buying a warranty, because you will need it.

The date stamp is a great idea, right?  Well the wheels to change the date on this stamp are very cheap and even though I have small hands, I can't spin the wheels without getting ink on my fingers. Also, this stamp is very small.I wish that I had ordered a larger stamp.  I was trying to save money, but this is going to be a frustration for a long time unless I break down and buy a better one.I hope my review helps you to avoid the mistake that I made.
