The beauty and simplicity of making manual drip coffee--whether Melita or Hario or Kalita or Timbuktu--is that the filter container sits directly on top of the cup or carafe that the coffee drips into. Raising the filter container to an inch or more above the vessel serves no discernible purpose and accomplishes absolutely nothing--save for allowing air to circulate around the coffee drops and heat to escape from the coffee. This product gets an extra star for its apparently ingenious marketing--the fact that they actually get people to pay $40.00 for a product that's worse than worthless--and to be proud of themselves for it.

Having given consideration that this scanner is significantly less expensive than other models, I have given it two stars instead of one.  It doesn't like to read smaller barcodes even when changing the setting specifically to the smaller barcode setting.  Which I didn't care for having to alternate between settings period.  You can either scan fast or small, not both.  Even fast isn't fast.  I used this for two days before I decided to cut my losses and order a different scanner.  I just couldn't let this device impede providing quick customer service.
Im giving a one star because its available.  This ink cartridge spilled all in my printer!  Broke it! Hate this!

This is a horrible product!!  Don’t waste your money.  The product is cheaply made!!  All it does it break the pencils!!!  I tried two different kinds of pencils, so it’s not because the pencils are cheaply made. To add insult to injury, I cannot get a brand new battery out of the machine.  I would have rated it a zero star but that wasn’t an option.  Going back!

Benefits:- It has a 360 rotation.- Heigh adjustable. I am able to work on my laptop on my single couch or sofa.- It has the little blockers from keeping your laptop from falling off.- The table itself doesn't look bad but all the other components are a downgrade.- The holders in order to tilt the table isn't too bad, in my oppinion.- As my laptop is 15.6 inches screen size, it fits just fine on the table with little more room for even a slightly bigger size of a laptop.Disadvantages:- Although it's a 360 rotation, I assumed the parts holding it has a great foundation to hold the laptop no matter what angle it may be (90 or 180). However, as my laptop weighs 5.95 pounds, when it's on a 90 degree angle, it will definently fall off and for a 180, it's a no brainer that it will fall. But I noticed that the closer the table is to where the wheels are facting, the sturdier the table will become. It might be my laptop's weight but i expected better. I can see improvements in this aspect.- For the heigh adjustable aspect, yes, it's good, however, it doesn't stay at the same heigh for long. The more you turn your table the more it will shrink all the way down to the pipes. I've done it a few times to back up my claim and trust me the screws to holding the height in place is tight enough.OVERALL:  The desktop isn't as great as it's described but I can see imporvements. If they make a new version of this table with improvements to the areas that needs tweaking, I can honestly say, this would be a great portable desk to purchase. But right now the portable desktop has some downsides so please consider purchasing this and keep to mind what you will be expecting. If this was helpful, please give me a helpful click as this review took me awhile lol.

It was really smaller than I thought it was gonna be that as of stencil and stickers and paper and a cute little dangle charm I wanted to give one stars but it is kind of cute I just thought it was going to be bigger it’s really small so I took a picture of my hand
I wish I had read the reviews. This is such a small stamp. With as much stamping I do it would be nice had it been bigger. I'm definitely tossing this to the side and finding a bigger one.
I would choose to have no stars if possible I received dried up markers 3 times

First, the product itself is nice (5 stars), no problem there.Second, this listing is the problem (1 star).  The dimensions listed in the title are incorrect.  These are not the 5" tall containers, they are the 2" tall ones.  It was odd that the containers had the actual size on the Sterilite sticker, then had an Amazon sticker affixed with the wrong size as well.Third, this listing is for ONE container, not a 6 pack as reflected in the Q&A section ($14+ for ONE container is ridiculous (1 star). That price is more in line with a 4 or 6 pack).  Amazon was great with the return as always (5 stars).

This review is based mostly on setup for Google Cloud Print for a Chromebook.  After several hours of Google searches, false starts, and support chats, I am finally printing via Google Cloud Print from my Chromebook and from Samsung Cloud Print on my Nexus phone.I am particularly aggravated because I chose this printer (over a Brother laser printer) because of the supposed "easy setup." What a joke.  No real instructions, just a DVD disc that I had no way to view. (Neither of my laptops has a DVD drive.) The brief directions for connection via smartphone did not get me anywhere (repeated connection error) either.The most important thing I learned is you must have an alternate method for connecting your printer to your WiFi network.  Chromebook alone is not going to do it.  Eventually I was able to install the necessary drivers on a second laptop and connect the printer to WiFi via USB.  That was the only way I could print on the first day.Several days later I was able to print wirelessly from the second laptop.  Then I finally figured out how to set up Google Cloud Print, which was a lot more convoluted than I expected it to be.  Hint: To figure out the Printer's IP address, push and hold the "WPS" until stuff starts blinking slowly and it will print out the confirmation page with the IP address listed.Anyway, it seems to print fine, but the power cord is very short and you have to extend the paper tray to print, so the small footprint is deceiving.Hmm. Two stars is sounding a little generous, but it does work now.

I used to buy ink from TonerKingdom. But they stopped selling the ink for my printer and I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg for the actual Lexmark ink, so I read the reviews and thought this could be a safe bet.No, it is not! It kept giving me errors. And once it stops with the errors and I'd try to calibrate it and clean the printhead, it wouldn't print a single thing. And then afterwards, it would pop up the errors again.This is by far not my first instance purchasing and installing non manufacturer ink, but this is definitely the worst!The only good part of this whole thing is that since it's fulfilled by Amazon I can get a full refund for this defective product.

Decided to try this for a two-sided presentation based on the product description that touts its rigidity and heft. Unfortunately, the paper is much less rigid than what the description denotes. Printing one side makes the paper curl dramatically (using a Canon Pixma and the settings the paper packaging recommends), and the second side smudges because of the curl.The image quality if you use the paper on one side only is quite acceptable, though the shape of the paper (no longer flat) makes it unsuitable for any kind of presentation. Their smooth matte finish is rather nice, and the product would go from one star for me to four or five if it were as robust as they claim.NB the Staples brand two-sided paper is about twice as expensive, but it is rigid enough to withstand print on both sides.

i have  had to rescind my earlier review.  its now october. i have had this  horrible phone  for 8 months  now!.  not only  does it  not hold a  charge anymore  its  impossible to  dial  any  numbers.  i have to redial  3-4 times  before it connectsa  because  the  numbers  do not register  when dialing. i wish i  could return  it.  it also is  not  good  for  hearing problems. its definitely  NOT clarity  in  calls.  i will be ditching this and getting  a  regular  v-teh. they  never have problems!

I chose this rating (two stars) because the cartridge was the correct one, but it was faulty.  When I printed anything it left huge ink smears all over the pages and never improved after several tries.  I am returning the cartridge.

Very disappointed!  I bought this primarily because it was inexpensive and had good customer reviews.However, I run Linux Mint on my two computers, and I wanted to connect this printer to my router via an Ethernet cable.  Specs said machine was "Linux compatible," so I was astonished to find that THERE IS NO ETHERNET PORT (only a USB port).I am sending this printer back because my primary computer has no free USB ports, and the printer does not seem to want to work through my USB hub.  Finally, instructions were even more minimal than I had expected.This machine may be OK in a USB setup with a sole computer, but clearly it is not useful for home networking unless one wants to use its wireless feature (which I do not).

With all the great reviews I read, I was really looking forward to making cards for my family and friends. Much to my dismay, almost the entire box of cardstock is bent and damaged. I did not pay for a box of cards that look like they’ve been dug out of a trash can and “regifted”.

Total waste of money.  So I basically had to "eat" the money I spent on the cartridge.  Totally false advertising.  If I could give this zero stars I would.

Both of the cartridges I received were very poor.  The first cartridge I only got about 1000 copies when it was rated at 2700.  The second cartridge gave all black copies and then I wiped it off and then I got about 300 to 400 copies and it did it again.  Would not purchased this brand again.

This is my first product review EVER! I didn't buy this printer through AMAZON, I bought it at a major office supply retail store locally. Doesn't matter where I bought it because it the product that I have a problem with.I will tell you why I personally can't recommend this printer.1. If you are on a tight budget, look at a different printer.  Yes, the printer itself is cheap, but that is the ruse.2. This printer has constant print problems where you have to clean and realign the print heads so much it eats up all your ink.  By the time it is functioning again, you are out at least a quarter of your color ink.3. To purchase replacement ink $58.00.4. I only get 100-150 pages per set of cartridges (if I'm lucky)... Do the math!If you are a nursing student.... check customer reviews on economy for the pages/cartridge.The only nice things I have to say about it is1. Easy set up2. Easy to useThat's it.

Like many reviewers I was happy when I first bought this in 2014. I am a small home based business and mostly print 10-20 color estimates per day. I wasn't wowed with the print quality but thought it was good enough. It's easy to use and scans well. Printing envelopes worked okay, but sometimes creases the envelope.About 6 months later the paper started coming out with imprints that looked like embossing. Online research showed there's a fuser problem. Brother support was good and swapped it out for a new printer. In 2015 the same thing happened again. This time they had me take it to a local repair shop (under warranty) and they replaced the fuser. Fast forward to 2016 and the same thing happened again but the warranty is expired.In the long haul, this Brother printer does not hold up. You may get a year out of it but be prepared to replace once the warranty is gone.Due to fuser problems I recently replaced with the HP M477fdw. Wow! What a difference. The print quality is much better. The speed and printing noise is better also. The HP starts printing immediately and the quality of prints is much more crisp and professional looking. I didn't know Brother was subpar until I saw what the HP can do!

I called the fine writing department at Parker. I told them that my pen wouldn't write. They told me that I needed to use my pen every day and to store it with the nip pointing up. That the holes in the cap expose the nib to air which dries the ink, but are there for safety reasons. That's fine. But when I pick up my Pilot fountain pen, it writes; even if it's been lying on my desk unused for a couple of days. The seller won't return my money. I was in an accident and out of commission for a while so returning this pen was not a priority during the return window. Too bad. It is such a good looking pen. Learn from my mistake. I should have believed the reviews. I am editing this review to add this: The fine writing dept. suggested soaking the nib for 24 hrs and then blowing air through it and then after reassembly, store it with the nib pointing upwards. This worked. But what a hassle! No wonder someone invented gel pens. Update #2: It has never worked even after soaking it again. My Pilot Lucina medium tip gets 5 stars. My Pilot Metropolitan fine nib, 4 stars because a fine nib from them is too fine. The Parker gets a don't buy from me so it drops to a 1 star. It sits on my desk to remind me that function beats form.

The reviews here are either raves or warnings. The warnings are right!Sure, it's easy to set up.  But so what!?The CLP-325 has a very basic flaw in the design: it jams continually. Particularly the first print of the morning, but also just at random. Then, pulling the paper out from the death grip of this machine is a long, agonizing process that runs the danger of damaging the drum, and getting seriously burnt as you do it. There are two internal unlocks to help dislodge paper jams - but neither of them are at the actual jam location on the drum itself. Avoid this product:  Samsung Color Laser Printer (CLP-325W)

Recently bought Pro901:This printer has flimsy construction.The print quality is good.  The scan and fax capabilities are limited to simplex originals... no duplex.I connect PC to printer via USB cable.  The printer regularly loses it's connection with the computer and the PC must be restarted to regain the connection.  This is a problem recognized by Lexmark... but they do not pay attention to customers who do not use network connection.I would not recommend this printer.Update:  I have had the Pro901 printer for just over a year now (barely out of warranty coverage) and have a more extreme comment than above.  I was on the rebound from HP... totally sworn off, due to customer service... so the Lexmark looked/sounded good.However, it cannot print accurate colors at all "anymore".  I even tried replacing the print head... to no avail.  I have used brand name ink the entire time I have owned the printer.Am currently in the process of replacing it with a highly rated Canon All-in-one (Canon recently added fax capability to all-in-ones).

Very Bad deserves no stars. I have scanned probably 35 or so photos, successfully. The real problem is the many printheads installed in this to keep it printing. Sucking up lots of money max page output is less the 50 pages.  and finally after the third printhead it would no longer function, Blank pages even after ten or more head cleanings, so fed up with this money waster, I just threw the piece of junk where it belonged . In the fricking trash. Useless for anything. Maybe some day HP will remember how a quality machine should perform, as a technician , I have not seen a good HP printer since 2000 , otherwise All printers they produced after that year are Money HOLES. Just Simply said JUNK.

I'm not one for leaving reviews, but this warrants it.  This was perfect for what I need.  I'll give you that sometimes oops happen in manufacturing. I only put my laptop and mouse on this.  Please do not purchase this.

When it does work (very rarely), it's extremely slow3. Print quality is mediocre at best.Spend your money on a Canon or Brother and don't waste any more of your valuable time considering this horrible product. Samsung Color Laser Printer (CLP-325W)

I read the reviews before purchasing this product. I should have heeded their advice. I purchased both 6 and 13 number stamper. The turn wheels are made of very cheap plastic. The first time I tried to change the number the rubber number band slipped between the edge. I had to reset it on the wheel track using a small screw driver. Turning the wheel to change numbers is difficult and you end up with ink on your fingertips and inside nails. Ink is very good, I still have it on my fingers after 3 days. I have purchased throwaway rubber gloves that I will wear when using these stampers.

We got the package on time, wanted it for project and this review is just after for the attempted first time use of the new cartridge. Cartridge is showing ink levels to 100%, but does not print any color except green. Red, yellow, blue - none of them are printing - only light green printed. Its a waste of time and money. Want refund for this product.

I tested this by putting something on it that I know weighs 14g. This scale said it weighed 0.2g! If I could give it zero stars I would. Completely useless. Returned it. How on earth has this got so many good reviews?!

I purchased 2 of these chairs - one for myself and one for my wife. My reason for buying was simple - the chair had everything I wanted: it was rated for our weight, had a head rest, padded arm rests, seeming well padded, and a decent price.After about a month of use, the cylinder on one became stuck in the up position. So, I wrote an email to the manufacturer explaining what had gone wrong and asking for the procedure on getting it fixed. What I received back was simply an email saying that they would take care of it and asking for my address. I assumed they were just going to ship me a new cylinder. What arrived was an entire lower assembly - cylinder, bracket, screws, the works! I was pretty pleased with that - the manufacturer couldn't be 100% sure what the problem was, so they just sent everything that possibly could be the problem. Nice.That was some time ago - about a year and a half ago. At first, I loved these chairs - they were wide enough that I fit well, comfortable, moved easily on the carpet; pretty much everything I wanted. However, my satisfaction with them hasn't lasted. Both chairs have developed multiple problems. One no longer rolls well (multiple casters frozen), leans to one side and doesn't adjust up or down very easily anymore. The other wobbles and no amount of tightening of screws will fix it - it seems to be inside the bracket that attaches to the chair itself. And the padding in both has flattened out and become uncomfortable. When I first received the chairs, I could sit in them for 7 or 8 hours at a stretch without a problem. Now, after about an hour, I'm uncomfortable and achy from lack of padding.I suppose I could contact customer service again, but to fix my problems they'd have to send 2 completely new chairs, which I doubt they'd be willing to do. And, in another year, I'd be right back where I am now. So, I'm going to move on, find a different set of chairs, and hope they last better than these did.

Having never before associated any toxic odor from Pelikan Ink, I have a difficult time believing this is one of their products.  I'm sorry I didn't really start using this till after the return date, or would have quickly returned the two bottles I purchased. I was a sucker for a too good a deal. The smell is downright sickening, and am surprised more than a few other reviews did not warn us all.

There is no pull tab for opening!  There's one pictured in the photo but the actual mailers I received don't have one. So it's a real bother for the recipient to open.  And the glue to seal it doesn't quite cover enough of the flap.  It'll work but I end up adding tape to seal it closed.If I didn't need these the day they arrived to send out a large mailing, I would've returned them for a refund.Depending on your use, these may work for you.  I was relying on the photo and description of a "tear tab for easy opening" because I am sending these out to paying clients and I really need good packaging.  Reading the reviews here, someone said there wasn't a strip under the tear tab.  What I received didn't have a tear tab at all, never mind a strip under it.It is white paperboard, which is easy to store and easy to address.  This packaging is a "C-" or a "D+" and I needed an "A."  Gotta spend more to get what I want.

I should have read the reviews before I bought it. My printer still shows 0% ink after installing a new cartridge. When I print in black & white it won’t print anything, just a blank page. I should have spent the extra $2 and gotten the better product. That’s what I get for trying to save a buck.

Wish i could give zero stars. And actually give these Chinese companys that make cheap crappy products a piece of my mind because this scale was absoulute garbage, might as well have just delivered it to my can on the curb because it couldnt weigh a 1 thing accurately. I bought 2 pens, seeing good reviews.  One was faulty, I could not write no matter how I tried.  I binned it.  The second one works but each time I have to test write many time until the ink comes out.  Really bad product and very unhappy.  Amazon shouldn't be selling this.

This scale is grossly inaccurate. I purchased 9.05 oz of fish from the market and this scale registered it at 14.56 oz. I pulled out my old (non-digital) scale and it showed a weight of approximately 9 ounces confirming the market's weight. I then pulled out multiple items in my cupboard to double check and each time the scale showed more weight than what the product was labelled as having. I would understand if it was off by less than an ounce, but to be 5.5 ounces off of a single fish filet is not even close to accurate.UPDATE: customer service emailed to say that I should call them because customer satisfaction is important to them. I called. They said they had to check and would call back. A week later and I've received no call back. Now I'm wishing there was a zero star option.

I have used these cards for Watercolor for years and have loved their quality.  This last box...I can tell the paper changed.  This isn't watercolor paper any more...not like the quality they were.  Crappy to paint on and makes my professional cards look flat.  Very disappointed.  What did you do to this?  Also price went up and quality down.  Like everything else these days....unhappy.  They don't even deserve a 1 rating....

This was a joke, right?We wanted a scale that would allow us to weigh our small animals(rabbits and dogs) plus one that would be useful for our business, we mail things daily. I read the reviews. I am wondering what on earth I received that others were Ok with it. First, the packaging. It was thrown into cardboard box while in China(known by packaging) with pieces of Styrofoam. So what, you say? Styrofoam is good. Pieces of Styrofoam, as in crushed up little bits of Styrofoam with some bigger chunks haphazardly thrown in. It was on everything. It took me 2 hours to remove all of it. No inside packaging--the seller shipped it ion the same plain cardboard box from china. You have to screw feet onto it. There are some other screws, I assume to mount the reader? The manual(piece of paper) is written in really awful Chenglish(Englese?). It makes no sense. They used the word counterpoises--that isn't a thing. The plug is a knock-off white Apple plug, everything else is black. A 5lb weight weighs 4.87. Both did, I thought maybe it was the weight. All our pets weights were off by several ounces. A 3lb weight weighed 2.9, 2.87(it likes.87) and 2.93. Also wrong in kg. I thought maybe it isn't in precision mode(used for smaller weights?) All the manual says on that subject is that different models have different modes--helpful! Changing the mode changed nothing. Also, the display randomly blinks on/off when plugged in. The buttons aren't clearly marked either--worn off? I never bothered with the batteries--couldn't get the Styrofoam off the holder. Just don't buy it.

See photos attached to this review. The children holding the hearts are mismatched, and the item came rolled up in a tiny box causing creasing that I had to flatten before I could even hang. Now that I am ready to hang, I notice the kids are wrong. This cost way too much money to have these mistakes and lack of attention to detail!

Fell apart inside my printer. If I could give this a negative star I would. This ink cartridge ruined my printer and my life for a week. It started leaking black ink all over my papers and then ll over the inside of the printer. I had to buy a new toner on top of new ink cartridges. Not worth saving the money on ink.  Don't waste your time with this one. I know there are other places that will do this service but this was not a quality product.

I purchased this set soon after buying my Officejet Pro 8610, since I didn't want to be caught without ink. I ran out of ink months later, and replaced the black and all three color cartridges, but despite dozens of attempts at reloading, NOT ONE OF THEM WORKED! I would give this product ZERO stars if possible. I've had good luck with other brands on other machines; therefore, I cannot excuse this rip-off.

I decided to take a gamble on these since I needed them for moving and couldn't find any the same size locally. Unfortunately one bin came completely cracked beyond repair. I've seen other reviews saying their bins weren't broken because they were well padded. The bins I received were not padded at all, just stacked into a box with room for them to move around in. I can exchange or get a refund, but it seems like I have to send all 4 back rather than just the broken one. With so many customer complaints about these breaking you'd think they could pack them better or offer an easier exchange.
Cheap and very bad quality!!! I wish we had stars less than 1!!!!

This thing is lightning fast....too fast in fact.  It consistently jams, flings bills everywhere, and when I can get it to count without the aforementioned issues, it's consistently off by one or two bills.  As another review stated, it needs a delay feature as it starts counting before you can properly align everything.  I've tried many approaches to feeding the bills but nothing seems to work.  There may be adjustments to remedy this issue, but the instructions are no help at all.  Also did not get all the parts pictured... Maybe I got a bad unit, but even for the relatively low price of $100 for this counter, I'm extremely disappointed.  I'm a little suspicious that many of these glowing reviews are fake.  If anyone who had this machine knows how to fix the issues over mentioned, please advise.

I am reading reviews that says this paper is great.  I guess they haven't tried others.  I bought this because it was cheaper.  Never again.  this is the worse quality I have used to this time.  If you use it, don't make a mistake and try to lift it off with a brush.  The paper rolls up and is awful. I can feel the cheapness of it right away.  It is totally smooth paper, watercolor paper should have a little texture to it. A little bumpy feel.  I bought 2 packages of 10.  I am going to send one of them back.

Only the black color is good for printing paper, all the other 5 color is a waste of time and money, i try printing a photo in color but omg it came out all the color wash out and all my photo i printed out all look the same with green and blue...how could a photo look like a brown butterfly come out all green and blue...will not order again...i give 5 star for the fast shipping thought..anyone having problem with their printer not working of system ink failures should follow my instructions belowA- Press and hold the “left arrow” key.B. - Press the “Setup” key and release both keys.Display should say “Enter Special Key Combo”C. - Press and release the “OK” button.Display should say “Support” and display the FW rev (something like R0616R)Then perform the below steps:2. Press and release the right arrow button until the display says “System Configuration Menu”. (on C8100 use Touch Screen)3. Press and release the “OK” button.4. Display should say “Hardware failure status”. If not there already, Arrow Key over to “Hardware failure status”,5. Press and release the “OK” button.6. Display should say “Hardware failure status: Clear. Press OK to clear”.7. Press and release the “OK” Button. Message changes to “Hardware failure status Cleared. Press Cancel to continue”.8. Press and release the “CANCEL” button as many times as necessary, so that, either the “Welcome to Photosmart Express” screen appears, or, the “Ink System Failure” screen appears. PLEASE DO NOT TRY TO PRINT AT THIS STAGE.9. Using the Power Button, turn the unit OFF and unplug the power cable from back of the printer and wall outlet.10. Wait 30 seconds for the power to get discharged and then plug the power cable into the wall outlet first and then into the back of the printer11. Turn the unit on. The printer may display message “USE POWER BUTTON TO SHUTDOWN THE PRINTER” followed by “PRESS OK TO CONTINUE”. Press OK.12. If the printer has already initialized, then go to the next step. If not, the printer will start the “ONE TIME INK INITIALIZATION PROCESS”. Allow this process to complete and do not interrupt. Once the initialization process is complete, the printer will print out a Diagnostic Page.13. To verify printer functionality print a SELF TEST PAGE. If SELF TEST prints, then printer is ready for use or Software Installation.

My 4-pack didn’t arrive cracked, which seemed to be a common complaint (via other reviews). My issue is that they don’t seem very durable & the front latch is IMPOSSIBLE to open (on all 4 boxes). I wrestled with one latch, trying to get it opened, until finally, the latch separated from the box & flung across my room. Not sure how to fix this problem. I would keep shopping for an alternative storage boxed set, if I were you.

I read the reviews before purchasing this printer.  I should have not ignored one of the reviews that said the printer would lose itself from the network never to return.  Same here.  After one week it lost the DHCP IP address for wireless use.  Even Samsung support could not find solution and I am returning purchase as fast as I can pack it.

They don't work any better than the cheaper version you can buy at WalMart that are push button.  I was looking for something that dried faster, these do not dry any faster.  They work fine as markers, the 2 stars is due to them not actually being "quick dry" but just regular highlighters.

My butt hurts because this chair is not comfortable at all. It is also difficult to slide/move. Regret the purchase. This is one of the very few negative reviews I've giving, but it's an honest review. Need to buy a new chair.
Should've read the reviews. One pencil.

Don't plan to be able to sit in this chair for any extended length of time. Seat is hard as a rock and tilts too far forward.  Even with the addition of an expensive seat cushion and lumbar cushion, I still haven't been able to make it work. It's pretty (hence an additional star), but not functional or practical. I found I can't sit in it for more than 45 mins to an hour without shoulder and backache. Wish I would have bought a regular ergonomic office chair and sacrificed looks for comfort. Now I know!
One star only because of prompt delivery of correct product.None of the black cartridges work in our printer.  Returned them without even trying the color ones.

at the price point and 1 day shipping it was worth trying for me, unfortunately like many other reviewers I had no success with these inks. it came with 2 black cartridges 1 would read as full but print no ink the other was not recognized at all. the cyan seem to be the only cartridge that worked

I never write reviews on Amazon , i`ve spend thousands of dollars on amazon items and i never write reviews .This product however changed that , this is by far the worse printer you could buy , while it looks sleek and nice , getting it to work or connect is another thing , connecting is a complete mission that 99% of the time results in failure .I bought this for the portability aspect of it (bought the battery and a large amount of "smart" cartridges) , so using it with a phone is ideal , it will only "see" certain phones , and the "smart" cartridges are constantly giving issues (you need to constantly remove and replace the cartridges).I contacted support with the issue , and after a few emails back and forth , the just decided to never mind and not contact me anymoreDo yourself a favor and STAY AWAY , your`e better of using the money on black jack and hookers .

I am so disappointed in this product. When i got it the stapler was opened up inside the amazon box and then the intructions and staples were missing. The box clearly says that it comes with 210 standard staples. I have no idea how to open it either. With all the reviews i had good expectations. I need it for collage.

The shimmer coagulated together and I have yet to see it when I write.  I’ve refilled my pen twice so far and it’s just brown.  So disappointed.  I gave it two stars anyway, 1 for the cool bottle, the other because the ink runs smoothly (even though it’s just brown).

Like many reviewers, I too found this product particularly difficult to work with.  The paper continually stuck to the laminate.  I ended up wasting about half the roll (requiring me to purchase a second roll), because I couldn't get the paper off.  I purchased this product, because I needed the larger size.  In hindsight, I will just pay the extra money to have it done professionally.

HP expiration date was YEAR 2005.  They ship without a box which clearly shows the expiration date, but it is also encoded on the cartridge.  And have a disclaimer about "don't worry if no package is included.!"  It was all green only.  almost 10 years expired.  HP has a shelf life for all cartridges. It does not work.  A RIP OFF!.. A less than second rate "company" (back yard) Billy Bob outfit that buys old ink.  A total waste of money.  I had worked at OfficeMax for over 11 years, and was wanting a cheap deal..... I got it!  The only saving grace was they returned my money in less that 3 days and do not want their JUNK back.  Amazon take them off of you list of sellers BEFORE you have issues please.  Thank you!

I read the reviews and decided to take my chances as I didn't need these for any specific sized product, however..... the pockets I received are sealed on the long side, and even though that didn't prevent me from being able to use them, it was a really unexpected pitb to do so.  I never imagined I'd have so much difficulty with a long side over a short side, but it really was true, stuff was hard to line up and get straight, would wonk going through the laminating machine, and was just overall so much more difficult to use than the short sided ones.  I wouldn't have thought it, but I will make sure that I never again order any that even HINT of being attached on the long side.

I don't print much -- often a week or two between printing something.  I got these cartridges about 6 weeks ago, and haven't printed more than a couple dozen pages on them.  The black is still working, but the color is dead.  Absolutely no red, only weak blue.  Total waste of money.EDIT:  After maybe 50-100 pages, the black totally died.  Printer says it's full of ink, but NOTHING prints.  All I have left is weak blue and some green.  I've run through multiple cleaning cycles, tried cleaning the contacts and the heads, nothing.  It's worthless junk now.I'd give this -1 stars if I could.

I'll admit it - I was cheaping out on buying printer cartridges when I went for this item.  Yes, it was rated as cheapest in ink use.  Well.  What a load of baloney.  The darn thing is CONSTANTLY telling me I am out of one color or another of ink, even when I know darn well that they are almost brand new.  Web reviews reveal that this is a universal problem with this printer.  If you don't use it OFTEN, the ink-sprayer seems to dry up or clog up, giving the message to the printer that it is low or empty of ink.  I can't tell you the number of times I have almost tossed this piece of crap out the window.Every freakin' time I try to use it (after a week or two of lying dormant), it gives me trouble.  Also, it tends for some reason to loose contact with the computer, requiring a re-boot (which takes forever).  Yes, it was cheap.  I guess got I what I paid for.  But all I wanted was an inexpensive printer that would work when I needed it to, and not give me any headaches.  This is NOT IT!UPDATE MARCH 2015: I finally got rid of this annoying piece of ... stuff!  After threatening and complaining for years, the thing finally got a error that I just could not clear.  I AM SO HAPPY!  As a sane and thrifty person, I was reluctant to get rid of a piece of hardware that was still 'working', if you can call what this printer did 'working' at all.  I really wanted to take it out to the driveway and destroy it with a sledgehammer for all the grief it's given me, but because I am a delicate little old lady (AND for the fact that my husband would not let me near the sledgehammer) I instead just had him take it somewhere that recycles computer equipment.  GOODBYE AND GOOD RIDDANCE, LexPro 800-900 piece of crap!  Don't let the door hit you in the butt on the way out!  Woo-Hoo!!!

Not worth your money. And not even worth a star. It is not sturdy and won't last long. I bought two of these.The pocket tore away from the spiral binder the first time I placed a bill in the pocket The second one I bought went right in to the trash can. I can't believe people sell such poor quality crap!!!
Based on the description and product reviews, I purchased these to make car magnets.  Unfortunately as soon I reached about 30mph, the magnet went flying off the car.
Flimsy and not what I expected. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 cause its still functional but I don't think it worth the price....

I put 1 star on as it arrived without all the hardware to even assemble it. So, no, it's not easy to assemble if you don't have the parts. No, it's not sturdy if you can't screw everything together properly. Possibility of lots of storrage space but again can't tell if it will work for what I purchased it for as I can't assemble it.I called the 800 number on the assembly instructions and left a message. We shall see if I get to upgrade my rating.

Holy crap the range on these sucks.I was replacing my old Panasonic KX-TH1211B, which has terrible review on amazon, but works well for me and has amazing range.I was able to get my VoIP setup working, but the range is less that 1/4 what I get from my 8 year old KX-TH1211B DECT devices.The PoE support is great and makes for a nice clean setupI ended up returning the panasonic, and I'm now trying out the Grandstream DP750 which has must better range.

I bought a pack of 3 pens and tried each of them in my new notebook as soon as I unwrapped them this evening. Not one of them works. The ink doesn't reach the tip and I have tried everything to make them write, without success. The ink doesn't flow into the tip. So I am incredibly frustrated and disappointed. So much for Muji Gel pens!  I am bed bound and unable to take these to the post office to return them, unfortunately. So that was a waste of money.  I have to stop believing Amazon reviews.

Per my supervisor, I tried to cancel the order, but since the dealer said shipped it 30 seconds after I ordered it, that was not possible.I ordered the item on March 31st.  There was no tracking number available at that time.  On April 7th, we still haven't received the package so I inquired.  In response, Deluxe Deals gave me a tracking number.  When I went to the shipper's website, they indicated that the item was shipped on  April 5th, not Marchi 31st as indicated.  This is probably why I did not get a trackiing number on March 31st because ONE DID NOT EXIST.I would give Deluxe Deals a lower rating if I could for their unethical behavior.Amazon is doing their reputation a disservice by associating themselves with these people.

The other product reviews speak so highly of this thing.I got the exact same one on the picture. But it was so disappointing. I hung a few 24x36' posters and at first I put 8 tabs, next day it peeled and fell off... so I put even more this time I doubled it and I put 16-20 on there. Now it's stuck there but 2 days later I could see the the top of the poster peel off from the wall. So I added 2 more tabs on the top... We just have a standard dry wall with regular paint, much like you see in a standard house or apartment.Very disappointed. I wish I went with some brand name ones with fewer tabs but larger surface areas...

This printer never syncs with my wireless.  Never.  I’d love to give it zero stars but you can’t.  This is a black and white printer, eats ink cartridges, does not have a copier nor a scanner.  But again, worst of all, never syncs with wireless. ALL other printers I’ve had sync perfectly.

First I want to say that I received this as a gift and at first I was excited. It was pretty accurate. Then I encountered a problem that the pen kept on beeping and blinking purple. I called moleskine which said that they would contact the manufacturer and get back to me. I called for 2 weeks and they had me try everything that you could possibly imagine, they kept telling me that there is no issues with the pen. I contacted the manufacturer which is neosmartpen, and they service is you need to speak with moleskine. I will state the obvious the service is HORRIBLE!If you run into an issue you are pretty screwed. Even the manufacturer neoLAB told me there is an issue with the unit via email but they will not help me and they will try to address the issue in the future. HOW DOES THAT HELP ME KNOW? I am sorry to say that because this is a piece of technology and it needs support. No one want to take responsibility to help. I love technology and I love writing on paper but choose a different manufacturer that has service is my advice. I am sure not every unit will have an issue, but I have read terrible reviews from others with this product.

Amazon description is wrong. Has a lable clearly stating 220 lbs max. Bought three for a star party, and when interfacing with the public, it is prudent to be "over prepared." These light weight chairs are average at best, but will not hold the stated 300lbs. Returned.

I got two, TWO, defective blue cartridges in one order. I read their directions and followed all the steps and their troubleshooting advice and neither work. I've read other very disappointing reviews and since I had no issues last timei thought it was worth the risk to order a larger package. Unfortunately, I'm kicking myself for that now as I am about to go to Walmart and purchase ink and will be spending twice what I would have had I just bought the one color I needed. Perhaps quality assurance is something this company should be spending more time on. Do they test the cartridges before selling them to make sure they work properly? If not they should be. Yes the ink is cheap but if you leave half of your customers less than highly satisfied... Well not good. Won't be wasting my time and money on this ink anymore.

Buyer beware!! I received the UHU magic blue instead of the UHU listed here. This glue will NOT hold paper together.  I will be returning it!! According to other reviews this seems to be happening often. It cost too much to not receive the good stuff. Frustrating to say the least.

I bought this because it was suppose to be magnetic and attach to our dry erase board that is on a stand and we use everyday for homeschool.  This is NOT magnetic even though it describes is a magnetic.  The back is curved and will not even set on the rail at the bottom of the dry erase board.  So, now I have to store it in a drawer away from the board and walk over to get it when I want to use it instead of storing it on the actual board for immediate use.  Kind of disappointed but it does erase, but I really wanted a flat backed, magnetic eraser.  Of course there are more important concerns in the world but I had time so I wrote this review.
This printer constantly had issues from going offline to not printing properly to consuming ink at an alarming rate. Left Lexmark and bought a Canon Pixma, which has been great.

First this thing reeks of a chemical odor. I put it outside to see if it would dissapate and it is still there after several days. It causes my throat to burn. Also there is nothing to adjust to armrest. I am returning and ordering another that has no tray because I don't need a tray, which is not sturdy in any case. The one I ordered is all fabric with pockets on both sides. Most likely at least hand washable.  Remote Control Organizing Holder - Caddy Sidekik R (Striped Wine)  It comes in an assortment of colors. I will review that one after I have used it for a week or so.

The quality control on this pen set is terrible. One of the pens came broken. It had little shards missing from it but they were not in the case or packaging at all and the packaging was not damaged either. In fact the box was shrink wrapped and the set did not look used.The packaging looked nice and expensive and the case looked nice at first glance also. There were no loose strings and the stitching looked nice. However almost every pen was stained black on the side that rested against the case. I can just imagine someone putting the case in an expensive purse or bag and the case's black rubbing off.The pens themselves are skinny and cheap feeling. The grips are hard plastic. My first set of gel pens was a Walmart cheap set that was better built than this set. At least the WM set have a rubber/gel grip and feel more substantial. I did not want to use any of the pens knowing I was returning them so I don't know how they preform.I had little doubt I would like these pens with 4.8 out of 5 stars and over 800 people reviewing them. I now know Amazon's review system is very flawed. Buyer beware. I'm thankful for Prime returns!This was an honest review from an average American that purchased this item at full price expecting a decent product based on the number of reviews and its high rating. :(

I was reading the review of other buyers and they have experienced of receiving broken boxes.  Many were due to the deliver person just throws the boxes.  I was thinking I might not be that lucky person.  I happen to receive the item right from the USPS guy and he hands the box to me the day of deliver.  The Amazon box was clean and neat no dent but when my wife open the box, she found cracked lids and boxes inside.  She tries to see if any were usable and almost got herself cut.  I have a feeling the product were broken before it was even ship.  I guess lesson learned!!

The reviews were all greatly so I decided to try it. I followed the information provided in the box to make sure that My HP printer didn’t reject the ink. Every time I printed something there were streaks on the paper. I had to print several copies before one could be used. Initially I thought it was the kids messing with the printer  because they are doing online learning. We used so much ink and paper so quickly. I mistakenly ordered another set of this ink. Well same thing happened. I didn’t even use it all. I replaced all my cartridges with HP and suddenly everything was printing fine again. I’m sadden to say this did not work for me. HP ink is SO EXPENSIVE. But it’s worth the time and hassle that I save from using smart ink.
Terrible quality and for the first time, I am writing a negative review. I would not purchase this item.

I am 6'5" and 190 lbs--so tall and lanky, tending on the lean muscular side.  I was really hoping that this chair would work for me based on other reviews.  In general, everything is good--it seems a solid chair, surface quality is good, lean is effective...but there is one infuriating quality that is causing me severe back problems:  they seem to have sewn in some added extra padding on the upper shoulder area as a design feature of this chair.  This extra padding juts out and really catches the edges of my shoulder blades, causing my upper back to lurch forward just a bit, while my head then rests backward again to meet the headrest.  It feels comfortable for about 30 minutes, but very quickly starts to reveal very unusual and uncomfortable strain on the muscles in the shoulders and upper back.It's reached the point where I'm really considering removing the stitching to pull out the extra upper back padding to see if everything is perfect without it.  I imagine it's the kind of thing that would be useful if I weighed 350 lbs, but is just really awkward and non-ergonomic when I just need some straight-backed support.  I hoped I would get used to it or break in the chair a bit more so that it wasn't so bothersome, but it has only gotten worse over time, so much so that I've just gone back to my old office chair that was not at all big & tall.Update 12/19/16:  After about six months of use, the headrest broke.  I'm not sure how.  But the metal pole on one of the sides disconnected from its internal support in the headrest and now leans awkwardly backwards on one side.  It isn't of much use now.  I'm seeing if the manufacturer will replace the headrest.

3 words: it is dim. It works but it's probably 1/4 brightness of the original lamp.  1/2 brightness of another after-market replacement (from ebay) I used in my Viewsonic Pro8200 projector after the original blew.  I use it in a pitch-black basement room, and the projected movies still look dim.  Worst of all, when I try to adjust brightness, it changes how bright grays and blacks but only relatively -- it doesn't seem to increase absolute brightness of the projected image.  In short, I am disappointed with this replacement lamp.  I bought it from Exclusive Bulbs in Dec 2016.UPDATE: Turns out the first lamp I received may have been defective.  The replacement is plenty bright.  Exclusive Bulbs reached out to me after I posted my review and assured me that my satisfaction was their priority.  They sent me a shipping label to return the lamp to them, and the replacement they sent, a couple of days after I had sent mine back, is very bright.  I am still unable to adjust the brightness of this lamp to my satisfaction (brightness control just changes the relative grayness - almost like another contrast adjustment), but it is extremely bright, so it's OK.  In truth, it could be my projector at fault, not the lamp. I can't be sure. With my previous 2 lamps brightness could be easily adjusted, and hence I assumed it must be the lamp. In all, I am satisfied with the replacement lamp, and I am upgrading my review to 4 stars.UPDATE2: The replacement lamp didn't last very long.  A few months (probably a 1/3 of the time it was supposed to last).  The same was true for the other replacement lamp I received.  Maybe I just got 3 defective units (too dim x1, and lifetime too short x2).  Changing my review to 2 stars.

Current: I had to come back to revise my review. I realized later than there were only 6 weeks worth of weekly planning/agenda sheets. There is 12 monthly calendars and 6 months worth of week-long planning pages. Not practical for me.Previous: I liked the month calendars and the weekly sheets that you write in with month and year information. I also like the leather cover and strap and the little pouch in the back cover that allows you to carry come post-it notes or other notes. I do not like that the months are separated in one section away from the weekly sheets. I rather have each month separated followed by the weekly sheets.I also would like the planner to already have tabs separating the sections where you can write in the month you want.

This printer has been an agrivating frusteration from opening the box. This printer makes ecsessive noise before and after printing. It sounds like the prinnter heads are going back and forth inside the machine for 2 minutes or more. In the last 45 min i have mamged to print 4 pages. The printer did not complet pages, it halted prining due to an empty paper try which was not empty. The ink runs out so often it owuld probly be cheaper to print at Kinkos. The printer I bought was no reading ink levels correctly and the excessive noise beofre and after rpinting got worse the more I used it. I went through the whole prossess of calling HP to get a repacement. The printer that replaced the first one has the SAME problems. I am going to have to repalce it with something else before my next semster starts beucase this printer makes my life so much more difficult. DO NOT BUT IT. I will never buy a printer becuase the sales person says it is good stuff. I will be sure to look at reviews becuase I can see that other peolple have had similar frustraions with this printer. I am working with a MAC so i do not know if that was the problem but there was nothing on in the literartue in the package that siad this printer does not work with MACs.

Discovered this last year. Bought the 2018 boxed calendar. Loved it. Humor can be a little twisted but nearly always brings a smile or chuckle out of me. Today is Jan 16. I would estimate at least 10 of these are duplicates from the 2018 set. The cartoons are memorable, it's easy to spot a dupe. If new content increases as weeks go on I will rate this higher.If you didn't buy the 2018 calendar and you like this kind of offbeat - sometimes risqué - humor I highly recommend it. The drawing style is memorably funny. My 87 year old Mother in Law sometimes howls with laughter.

The first time I purchased Kingway Ink Cartridges, they worked fine. Second time around - they didn't work. I have thrown away two so far. The enclosed information said to contact them direct. I did. I wanted to wait to see if they would work with me before posting a bad review. They never returned my query about the first cartridge being bad and now there are two that are defective. I will not purchase them again. I purchased Starink with the "Newest Chip" instead and they worked. I have an HP 8710 printer.

Ordered a set of these for my Canon MFC726-CDW. I've only had to replace the Cyan toner but it's leaving streaks and dots on all my printouts. I thought it might go away with some time but even after a few dozen printouts the streaks are still there. Is this just a QC issue for the Cyan cartridge?5/1/2018 Update: Contacted V4INK support about this issue, who promptly sent out a replacement Cyan cartridge at no cost. New cartridge seems to be doing well. Changing to 3 stars from 2, as even though they sent out a replacement, this issue seems to have been an ongoing problem since at least 2015. 3 years is way too long to have an issue like this continue on without some resolution.

One of the worst setup experiences of all the printers I've owned.  First of all, the "quick setup" sheet gives you inaccurate and criminally vague information.  The setup failed no less than two dozen times (I was getting close to 30 times--I kept count) using various methods - with USB, without USB, restarted wireless router multiple times (mind you, all other devices I disconnected from wifi before setup in case it would make a difference.  it did not).  The documentation is horrible.  See my photos--the problem was that the setup couldn't find the wireless printer.  Troubleshooting went only so far as anyone with common sense would guess--Check that the wireless setting is active on the printer.  Try restarting your wireless network.  Check to make sure the USB is connected if you're configuring wireless using the usb cable.  If all 3 of these fail--which they did, over two dozen times.  You're outta luck.  This is literally a piece of garbage  and I should not have ignored the poor recent reviews.Do yourself a favor and take a HARD PASS on this one.  I have no idea how long this will actually function and when it will mysteriously disconnect from the wifi again.  It gets 2 starts because the printing is actually quite fast even for a laser printer.This is going right back into the box for a return.  Not worth the trouble, or the time it took to get this to work.  Utter garbage.  These should be pulled from inventory and destroyed.

I hate to leave bad reviews, but as soon as I opened this, I knew I would be returning it. It says that it is adjustable with scored places. While there were marks, there were no scores. The instructions in the box, state that you will need pliers and some other tools to complete this. I didn't even attempt that, because I knew once I broke it, it would leave a rough edge. I was going to use these in our home classroom, but for sure couldn't do that with rough edges. In the drawer or not, I didn't want to risk rough metal edges. Also, I am not sure how sturdy the plastic pieces would be that were holding it together. They seemed rather flimsy when I took them out of the box. Also, as others have posted, I am not sure that these would work with legal size folders, they middle support piece didn't seem long enough. I didn't take the time to measure but it sure didn't see that way. I am returning these first thing tomorrow.

I have owned my Sport brass pencil for about a year. Wonderfully balanced and fits my hand perfectly, but it now fails to work. I have attempted to fix it but the mechanism will not advance the lead. Prior to this failure I would give the pencil 10 stars. Now it is worthless so my assessment of the device has dropped considerably.

I've had this chair less than 8 months and the pneumatic cylinder is failing. Working at my desk and I'll suddenly start sinking lower and lower. I can't get the pneumatic cylinder out to replace it. Shouldn't need to replace it at all - especially owning it for less than a year. AND I've noticed that the platic casing on the wheels is broken on three of the wheels.I ignored some bad reviews when I bought this chair. Learn from me. I lost money on this - you don't have to. Buy a different chair. From a different company.

Didnt read the reviews on how people were getting 1 individual ink cartridge and my mom bought it, but just make sure to check the contents of orders. This company false advertises and plays off a spoof of words

Started out pretty well. Packaged well, all the components seemed heavy duty and the cushions seemed well "cushy".  Putting it together wasn't difficult, but some of the screws didn't align with the holes.  It took some tweaks and ultimately it worked out.First thing, I liked the look of it.  It is heavy and again seemed heavy duty.  Now I bought this to replace my Staples econo-chair and researched looking for a chair for my size.  I am 6'4" and dangerously close to 300 lbs.  When I first sat down, it was really stiff.  The back hit me in a very weird angle and it wasn't comfortable.  I figured I would let it break in.  That said; the bottom of the chair didn't come out any further than my econo Staples chair.  So what happens is that the cushion ends in a way that is uncomfortable for my legs after long periods.I still would have gave it 4 stars up to this point.  But now, not having it even 3 months and the thing squeaks everytime I move in it.  Loudly!  In addition to that, it has broke in and the results are worse not better.  The bottom cushion feels like a board after about an hour of sitting.  My back hurts more with this than any other chair I have used.So if you are a larger human being and want a comfortable chair to sit in for significant periods of time, I cannot recommend this chair for you.  If you are smaller than me and only use it for an hour at a time, then this should work fine, but there are cheaper alternatives that can do that.

After unpacking, I quickly discovered that the plastic frame -- which is also a hanger bracket -- arrived cracked and broken in the top left corner, which is also the mounting point. It is truly absurd that a mail-order company (the item was shipped in a factory original packaging) is unable to design a box that would adequately protect this fragile item in harsh shipping environment. Here's the problem: there is absolutely no cushioning material (other than the thin cardboard of the box) to protect the board from sliding along the longer edge. Once the item is placed on a hard surface (e.g. my brick porch), even with some moderate impact, it will crack like an egg shell. I do not blame Fedex. They cannot baby every single package they handle. These guys move fast. It is naive of this manufacturer to hope that placing stickers or tape with a label "fragile", will do the trick for any delivery guy/gal.Universal(R), fix the packaging!It would cost you say 50 cent to add some cushioning material around all 4 edges to properly immobilize and cushion the board inside the box to protect it from moving around and impacting hard surface. And then you wouldn't have to deal with cost of restocking, returns, fixing and waste! Not to mention bad feedback, disappointed customers, and Amazon having second thoughts if they should deal with the company. It just makes no business sense whatsoever.I'm giving the product 2 stars and not 1, because the board itself is quite nice -- for the price. The surface (in my case) was smooth with no dents. The mounting instructions seemed clear and simple. So, I think (but couldn't say for sure...) that I probably would have been quite happy with the board... if only I had a chance to mount it and use it.And kudos to Amazon for making returns painless. Print out the authorization barcode. Put it into the box. Seal the box and wait for the UPS driver to pick it up tomorrow. No cost on my part. No hassle. Thank you Amazon -- that is exactly why I remain a loyal Prime member.Would I recommend this board? I've seen other reviews of customers complaining along the same lines as I just did... And based on the box I have just witnessed and evaluated myself (I'm an engineer), I estimate your chances at around 50/50: You might get a board which is intact. Or you might get a board which is damaged in shipping... It's a lottery.Shame on the manufacturer for not designing properly protective box. What a waste and inefficiency.

I bought these as a backup, and now that I actually need the ink for a project that I'm working on I can't use my printer because these do not work correctly. I have the same error that says to insert the cartridge till it clicks in place and it does nothing. I've had this printer for about 5 years and never had any issues with OEM cartridges this had good reviews and I didn't see any issues. Wrong dead wrong piece of crap doesn't work. Do not buy these ink cartridge replacements. What a huge headache and huge waste of time.You can tell these are Epson refills someone's put a little sticker on the back to cover up where it said Epson. Then where it's manufactured it's been smeared and melted off. Cheap refilled junk 👎

Typical fluff reviews here.  :(  These cartridges worked but colors for photo are HORRIBLE!  Waste of time and photo paper to even try these.  I regret my purchase.  I anticipated them to be iffy, and bought them for non-photo use.  My originals died in the middle of a photo print, and I popped these in.  They worked, but photo colors are horrid.  I bought these mainly for large graphic technical drawing prints on my fairly big WF-7720, where I don't mind colors being slightly off or weak.  I was right.  I had hoped it would work for photos for a small photo job.  No!  Ugly prints.  I found a complete OEM set at a club store, and same photos printed perfectly.  These cartridges also report back from printer as non-genuine.  If that matters to you.  I recommend only for craft or general printing.  Don't waste photo paper on this ink.

I purchased several of these packets of stamps from USPS back in 2013 when they cost $9.20.The stamps themselves rate at least 4 stars but this deal is completely bogus. Don't people realize that stamps are legal tender. This is equivalent to me selling you 10 dollar bills for $15 + s/h.

Nice looking magnets that didn’t make it from home to office once. I am an RCA for the post office and needed magnets for my 2002 Dodge Caravan. I purchased the 3 pack of magnets. They arrived rolled up in the box so they needed to be flattened before using. I flattened them and stuck them on the fridge overnight to make sure they were ready to use. I washed the van and had it ready for my new magnets. 6:00 this morning I set them all up and made sure they were flat to the van. Arrived to the office at 7:00 and only had two magnets left. Didn’t even get one days use... what else can I do so that the others don’t fall off? Maybe that one was defective and the rest are fine. Would like to give five stars but can’t, do to this.
I am amazed how this piece of junk could get any positive reviews... In addition it is only printed on one side and the other side is an advertisement for the company.  STAY AWAY

The cards are nice but I’m giving it 2 stars due to the envelopes. They are flimsy and plain white. Photos online show flaps with images coordinated to the cards. This combination is what drew me to the cards.

Wish I could give no stars!!! We are using for legos, and it can’t even handle these light weight items.  Draws fall off track.  Don’t waste your money!!!!  So frustrating and seller won’t return my email.

I tried to erase a number on a regular piece of copy paper and it did nothing bit smudge it worse than my regular eraser does.  i tried several times.  i should not have to give it 1 star to be able to answer a question.
Immediately told by printer it was counterfeit.  Printed one page then stopped working.  Complete garbage,  I will listen to the reviews next time.
Read all of the 1 star reviews. There's no way this thing legitimately got more than 3 stars. I will do a video review to prove just how poor the quality of this thing is.

I bought this for my Canon MF8580CDW. The OEM is 118$ per toner, so when I saw this, it was like great value for money. So I went for it and now I regret it big time. The initial few days were great. But then you start seeing streaks and pages look as if they are sprayed with different colors. I have read from other reviews that this would happen if you use non OEM toners in Canon printers. So I am not sure if its the toner thats bad or if Canon purposefully messes up non-OEM toners. Eitherway, the outcome was really poor and I would caution anyone looking to buy non-OEM toners for their Canon printers.

I would have left negative 5 stars if I could.  very very angry this is not authrethic Jherbin.  Little shimmer but no magenta hint at all.  Way different from the sample I got from my friend.  Will never purchase from this supplier again.

This machine is headed to scrap at less than three years service life. It turns out key parts have a 20,000 page rated life and it prints before 17,000 pages. The fuser needs to be replaced because one roller is wrinkly, I've not seen that happen to any machine before. The laser is at 90% life. Certain paper feed parts have been jamming on us. Replacement parts for all these exist but everything failing so close to each other it's clearly not worth the money or effort to replace them. The parts cost more than we paid for the whole unit.The built-in user interface is clumsy, the included printer management software looks pretty but the looks hide a convoluted logic and makes information hard to find. I can't say I've ever really been terribly happy with this machine.

The lid fits over the box and is therefore significantly bigger. The BOX measures 11.5" x 6" x 9". So my Santa tree topper is pretty mushed and I'm shopping for a new box. And I totally agree with the review about crazy shipping -- the boxes were not nested, and three boxes were shipped in a cardboard box as tall as I am. Doh!

Ordered on line from Palm. Received 3 days later. Unit was charged per instructions...does not work AT ALL. The power and synch cord are a joke..you feel like Mr. Big trying to put threads in a needle. The Palm folks cheaped out and did not include the cradle that SHOULD come with it (like my last Dell Axim). Now the fun part..try getting tech support and returns..ok a wasted 2 hours this Saturday AM. Then they tell that I have to ship it back, wait several weeks for a credit on my card...oh and if I want another one I have to order it all over again.  Read all the reviews carefully...looks like a nice unit, but way too many synch,power, on off, reset issues. If you are a tech nerd that loves to screw with this stuff go a ahead. If you a bit type A and just want something that works with low hassle, Palm and Palm TX are NOT the way to go. Spend your money somewhere else

BE AWARE - SAMSUNG NO LONGER GIVES TECH SUPPORT FOR THIS PRINTER.!!! IF YOU NEED HELP THEY REFER YOU TO HP SUPPORT. BUT ONCE HP HEARS THAT YOU ARE CALLING FOR SAMSUNG SUPPORT, THEY SIMPLY PUT YOU ON ENDLESS HOLD.I love the small size of this printer - fit's nicely on my desk and I don't do much printing so it was perfect.Unfortunately I ignored all the negative reviews and purchased it in March, 2018. I use a direct USB cable from computer to printer.The problem is, the negative reviews are correct. This printer is a piece of junk. My only regret and pain is that it will add to the landfill.The printer worked great for a few weeks. Then, suddenly, it started printing a very faint image of what it's supposed to print. I installed a new toner cartridge and it does the same thing. I shook the cartridge, made sure there is no obstruction, nothing worked. I deleted the printer and driver and then re-installed them. No luck. I spent hours searching all over the internet for suggestions, none worked.Just in case SAMSUNG has farmed all it's tech support out to HP, I will never again by a Samsung printer.

Would give zero stars if I could. I bought this scale back in 2015. At first it worked without problems but this only lasted for 2 years. In 2017 I started having problems with it. When you power on the scale, the digits does not stop on zero, but goes backward in negative digits. Even if you put a weighting cup on it than use the "tare" function, the digits starts falling down again. I endured the buggy scale for a few months than contacted Crestview for a fix or a replacement. The company did not try to solve the problem, but instead answered me with a dismissive e-mail explaining me how to "use" the tare function.Now maybe I had a defective unit and I can understand that, but I cannot understand a company that does not give a crap about customer service and their responsibility towards their product. Would not recommend this scale nor this company!

Meh - I bought the extension so I could use a mouse with my computer while riding. I'm not impressed at all and am thinking of returning it. First off, the extension is not flush with the fit desk. These are good quality protectors but they are NOT top-loaders. I should have read the other recent review that says this. The protectors I was sent have openings on the long end of the side and NOT the top as described. Buyer beware.

MY POOR RATING HERE IS NOT FOR HP INK CARTRIDGES, BUT RATHER FOR MY PURCHASE OF THE HP78XL CARTRIDGE THROUGH ASHBY STORE AND FULFILLED BY AMAZON.I am one of Amazon's biggest fans... I believe they generally have the best prices and service around.  As a result, I buy just about everything I possibly can through Amazon.com.  However, this was definitely the WORST purchase I have ever had through Amazon!This seller, Ashby Store, is quite clearly one of the very worst.  The Hewlett Packard HP78XL tri-color ink cartridge I bought from them, fulfilled by Amazon, was absolute JUNK!  To begin with, the Amazon packaging box was in perfect condition, but the HP box was very beat up and looked old.  On top of that, the HP box was clearly intended to be sold only in a Spanish-speaking country, as it was primarily in Spanish, listed HP as the "Exportador" and listed three different Argentinian, Brazilian, and Mexican companies for which it was "Importado".The area of the HP box that states the Warranty End Date had that end date carefully and suspiciously covered by a professional-looking sticker identifying the cartridge and stating it was new.  The HP box, which looked as though it might have been previously opened and then resealed, contained the usual inner white thin cardboard enclosure that holds the cartridge, and that white enclosure also looked as though it might have been previously opened. Once I took the cartridge completely out of all packaging, the sticker that usually covers the inkjet outlets had ink that had leaked onto it.  Further, the warranty end date printed on the cartridge itself was "20130311", which translates to March 11, 2013 and means the cartridge I received on 01/29/2014 was more than ten months beyond its warranty expiration date while still being sold at a $60 retail price.Just to be sure of my suspicions, I went ahead and installed the cartridge in my printer and then attempted to do the usual printer alignment.  The page that was "printed" barely had a mark on it, and the printer was telling me to try to do another alignment page.  Instead I tried the printer's "clean cartridge" maintenance function, but again got very poor results with only about 5-10% of the usual coverage.  That was enough for me.I was desperate to replace the old, empty HP78XL cartridge that was in my printer, so I got a Staples coupon for 15% off and paid $56.94 for it, even less than what I paid through Amazon.  After installing that new HP78XL cartridge from Staples, my printer worked perfectly.The only positive THING I can relate about this experience was Amazon's excellent customer service.  I called them and was immediately issued a refund along with having them set up a free pickup of the WORTHLESS junk cartridge by UPS.IF I COULD RATE "ASHBY STORE" AND THIS PURCHASE WITH FIVE NEGATIVE STARS, I WOULD DO SO, BUT THAT'S NOT POSSIBLE.  THE WORST THEY CAN RECEIVE IT ONE STAR, SO THAT'S WHAT THEY GOT!

I really wish that I had remembered to ship this back when I filed a claim to return it. I found it in my office, and tried using it again today. For a kid it might be ok, but I can't trust leaving my laptop on it and it doesn't fit over my legs unless I sit perfectly straight. Inconvenience to set up, annoying to use, slippery surface.
