I purchase a box of six and gave them out to others that work in my office. What a disappointment! Correction fluid is very watery & does not cover ink even after several applications. I wish I had returned them to Amazon. The only reason I even gave 1 star is because I wasn't aloud to submit without rsting!

If I could give this a zero for a star rating, I would.  9/10 times when I go to print, it says it isn't set up, or can't communicate with my Wifi, even though the blue light says it is, and is clearly connected.  I have to simply take the time to deal with some sort of permutation of restarting the Wifi, computer, program, or turning off and turning back on the printer in order for this to work.  No rhyme or reason.  Always tells me I'm out of ink, despite it working perfectly fine with the ink that is inside of it, and simply chooses when it wants to, and doesn't want to scan.  Again, no rhyme or reason.  Then when it actually scans, it takes 10+ minutes.  How can a company come out with such an awful product?  It's almost a modern marvel to make such a bad piece of equipment.  I have probably written less reviews than I can count on one hand, and I actually went through the effort of writing all of this out when I should have been working on homework, while this thing is fiddling around trying to complete a scan or a print.  Simply incredible how bad this printer is.  It would probably be faster and easier for me to trace what is on the screen onto a sheet of paper than than to use this.When I can afford to buy a new printer, I am going to go "Office Space" on this absolutely awful piece of detritus.

I read the reviews and wish that I could enjoy the many 4 and 5 stars this printer receives.  Out of the box it has not worked properly.  Try to align the print cartridges and it fails each time.  Customer service is no help - probably needs a new printer head.  Out of the box a lemon and my mistake... didn't buy from Amazon.  I buy 99% of my stuff from Amazon and this is why.  Products are easy to return. I bought this printer on a whim from Staples.  They get a 1/2 star.  Bad service and because I didn't have all items with the box packaging they would not me return until I spent time with the manager.  What a hassle.I recommend to buy a different printer and buy it from Amazon.
Flimsy and tiny, I know these are bargain goody bag stuffers but of really poor quality these are thinner than paper and very small. One star for cute.

I've never posted a review before but this printer is so bad that I have to alert other buyers. I had to frequently do a reset because the pinter would ignore the wireless printing command. Because it worked for a couple of print jobs at my last re-do, I let the return window slide by before, alas, before the same problem returned. My computer keeps telling me that my printer is offline when it is not, no matter what I do. If I want to print I have to physically connect the units. Look, I graduated from physical connections and multi-wirings years ago, and I do not want to return to having to have the physical obstruction of this machine in my immediate workplace. I am going to leave it in the lobby for someone who does not consider this a hindrance. I'm sure that if they print once every couple of months that this will be a lovely printer for them. (In fact, I will pin a note describing this situation.) Oh, and is says it does two-sided printing. Yes, it does---- by hand in a time consuming and complicated manner, defeating the purpose of efficiency. I would not recommend this to anyone, and I extend my sympathies and apologies to the person who grabs this in the lobby

I like to have supplies on hand long before they are needed and in this case purhased these 6 months ago and thoroughly read the reviews, the product use and description. After unpacking and reading the notes they had on the cartridge I loaded into the HP 5200 and when installed and the lid closed an error message came up and said older cartridge and was not compatible. I removed made certain that all packing was removed and re inserted no printing. Went to Wally World an purchased an HP 63XL loaded it and performed beautifully. Hope the distributer reads this and will make an exception to refund my money.
What the hell why did I get a freaking female razor. Very disappointed...put 1 star cause I couldn’t leave it empty

I loved the idea of a telescoping document tube, but I wasn't impressed with the quality of this one. Part of it has already broken and another portion is warping.The telescoping feature is nice and it is fairly easy to figure out how to adjust the tube to different lengths. The lid twists off, so it won't accidentally open or let any water in through there.The tube has a strap that is connected at two spots on the tube, making it easy to carry. Unfortunately, one of the connecters on mine broke within a few uses. The tube is also starting to warp and become more oval shaped along where the two pieces meet. The material just seems low quality. I'm also not entirely convinced it is water resistant enough to be able to withstand talking in a decent rainstorm, but I haven't had a chance to test that.A great idea, but needs to be made with better material.I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I seldom dislike anything I buy from Amazon that has a great rating.  This is an exception.  It simply does not block out the print one wants to obscure.  It may look like it at first glance because it does put on nice black coating over the print, but if you look closely you can still make out what it says underneath the black "coating".  I give it a "do not buy", I'm sorry to say.

After trying this marker on multiple types of plain paper, I gave up.  It did not obscure text as well as a standard Sharpie.  Whether it was my particular marker I do not know; but it was completely ineffective for it's stated purpose.  I am at a total loss as to how other reviewers thought that it worked.  Maybe mine was just defective.

Spend a few extra bucks and get something better. I placed a Bunn machine on the top shelf that weighed about 125lbs (it is rated for a total of 300lbs), and the legs broke through in two places. I switched back to the brand I purchased before and had given to my son. So much for saving a few bucks.

Got this Brand because good reviews and I was looking for a reliable ink supplier at a lower cost. Unfortunate my experience was not so good. Black ink work ok but color cartridge can not be recognize by the HP printer.

I usually don't write product reviews, but in this case my experience has been so awful that I just have to try to keep people from buying this product.First off let me say that I didn't pay a dime for this printer, it came for free with my MacBook Pro.  Seemed like a good deal, the wireless feature sounded great, and our other printer was getting outdated.  Got it home, set it up, printed from my Windows desktop and it worked great.  Tried to set it up on my new MacBook, which the printer came with mind you, and there were no drivers for OSX Lion.  None.  HP even acknowledged that they didn't support Lion at the time.  Why would a printer be bundled with a computer that won't support it?  Also, when HP finally released drivers for Lion, the download was over 500 mb.  500 mb for printer drivers?  Not to mention it STILL doesn't work in Lion, whether wireless or wired.So now we've resorted to printing everything from one of our Windows machines, which is still hit or miss.  The wireless function doesn't work at all, even though the printer is online and I can ping it.  Now, even when plugging in to USB the printer is unresponsive when a print job is sent to it.  I've tried all manners of resetting the printer, uninstalling and reinstalling drivers, turning off energy-saver mode, etc; nothing.  Every now and then it will randomly print a document on the first try, but for the most part it just sits unresponsive.Not to mention some of the other problems like the fact that printed pages get shot across the desk onto the floor, it uses ink very fast, and it spends more time running the motors and cartridge than actually printing.To sum it up, I absolutely despise this printer.  I would rather go back to my old dot-matrix printer than use this.  Even if you can get this for free as a promotion I wouldn't recommend it, pay the extra money for a better printer (probably from Epson or Canon).To HP: If you have a representative reading reviews on here, I really hope your next line of printers is more reliable than this.***UPDATE 1/4/2012***In this review I failed to address the issue of ink usage.  The initial cartridges were used quickly, which is typical with shipped cartridges.  As a replacement we purchased the standard HP 564 Black cartridge, installation was easy, but we printed about 60 pages of text on "fast draft" and the black cartridge was empty (note the cartridge packaging lists it is good for 250 pages).  After this we tried out the 564XL cartridge, and after printing about 80 pages of text on "fast draft" it is also out of ink.  The "XL" states that it is capable of 3x the pages of the regular, so 750 pages.  750 pages of what, 1 word on each page?  I actually had a situation where I had to dig out my old printer and use it to print one page since the B210 wasn't capable.  HP, you have officially lost all business from my household in the future.At least the scan feature is reliable on this printer.  If you need a good, oversized scanner, this is the one for you!

Perhaps, as another reviewer pointed out, these are fine for the young left hand user. I've given these a go over the last week and found that they don't sit comfortably in my hand, there's no pleasure in holding or using them. Ink quality is also poor and too light.

These are by far the WORST mounting tabs I've ever had the displeasure of buying. They are not even remotely sticky to the touch. They will hold NOTHING you buy up. The other reviewers must have cerebral palsy to have reviewed them so high.

I had great hopes for these pens, given the reviews I read. I ordered this 4-pack. ALL FOUR LEAKED. I ended up having to throw all 4 away, one by one, and then had the added joy of attempting to wash ink off my hands, binder, and workspace. Will never buy again and do not recommend.

I should have listened to the other reviewers! Ours arrived with a big dent in it due to bad packaging (easily damaged, it seems) plus some buckling which to me just means a shoddy product. Unfortunately this is the only 48x36 magnetic whiteboard that amazon has for a reasonable price so I'll have to look elsewhere for a better one.

I returned for these 3 reasons:1 - Poor design.  The mounting plate has a screw in it which is secured by a bolt (see picture).  The door stop post with the magnet screws onto that screw after the plate is fastened to the wall.  If that bolt loosens, then it will spin and there is no way to remove the post from the plate so you would have to rip out the screws to get the entire assembly off, and then of course you now have a major wall repair to make.  I would suggest getting some paint on bolt lock if you plan to use it.2 - Poor Quality.  The post does not screw on fully to cover the mounting plate.  The threads don't go deep enough and it bottoms out.  So the post will be a little away from the wall and you can see the mounting plate in the crack (see pictures).  They need to run the threads a little deeper or cut the screw off a little shorter.  I was planning to cut one thread off the screw but the next issue below made me decide to send it back.3 - Poor Quality.  The screw is crooked on the mounting plate (not square).  So if you could screw the post on all the way, it would be touching the wall on one edge, and there would be a gap on the other edge (see pictures).  The plate is pretty thick so I was unable to bend the plate to make it square.So, overall, they need to make another step in the manufacturing to make sure it is fit to be installed.  I bought 6 and only one was fit to install.  I over-tightened the screw into the post on several to try to run the threads deeper and got pretty close but it did flatten the threads on the end of the screw ... definitely not how it was designed.Another note - the pictures of the packaging are not accurate.  They are NOT made by Stanley which is what the pictures say.  They are made by National Hardware.  The packaging is identical other than there is no Stanley on the label, so that leads me to believe this product was bought from from Stanley by National Hardware, and the packaging changed, and perhaps QC was reduced or changed?  This is speculation but perhaps all the good reviews were on the Stanley version?Bottom line is I would keep looking for a better quality version of these.

The cartridges I recieved worked great, except for the fact that 2 of the 4 were broken when I opened them and will not work in my printer. I hate to give a two star review, because the quality of the ink was great if they all would have worked correctly.

I really like this printer, but if you're not technologically inclined, you may want to move on. There is almost no documentation with this printer, and what little there is, is poor. I connected directly to my network via the ethernet port, and installed the software on my computers and my phones. I don't know how it would do wirelessly, but I suspect it will take some effort. Using the app on the phones, it detected and connected easily. It's things like duplexing, scanning, and other features that are very poorly documented. As for the printer itself, it's a great printer, copier and scanner. It's quick, and the quality is good.UPDATE: I can't recommend this printer. There's no easy way to print envelopes. You have to take the paper out of the normal feeder and adjust the guides, and most of the time you will have to try 2-3 envelopes because of misfeeds. I am so sorry I bought this printer, but it's too late to return it. 7/25/21.UPDATE 2: There is no after market toner cartridge for this printer, so you will have to buy the expensive cartridge from Pantum. Dropping my review from 4 stars to 2 stars, and that's being generous.

Do NOT purchase this!  If I could give it negative stars, I would. I am so incredibly disappointed with this file cabinet. The bottom drawer is not deep enough to hold hanging folders, the directions to put it together are horrible, and the quality of this product is so incredibly cheap and flimsy.

When opening the cartridge the ink started running out and got all over my shirt and my hands. Was not able to use it, Have not gotten the ink out of my shirt yet, and product was disposed of. I have it 1 star only because I was required to give it something

I bought this for our local not-for-profit organization; it looked good online and seemingly had reasonable reviews.(1) First I noticed that the plastic tray inside wouldn't stay in position and kept falling to the bottom, but I ignored this problem and figured we could live with it.(2)  Then we noticed that the lid wouldn't stay latched without a key inside; OK, I figured we could live with that too.  The lid did indeed seemingly  stay closed and latched with the key in the lock - except that the key would wiggle loose and the lid open and spill the contents.(3)  Hmmm... but then, the first time we used it with a members' group, the handle came off whilst carrying it across the room, and it spilled the contents over the floor.  That I cannot and will not live with!This is a not-inexpensive piece of junk; don't waste you time and money.  Frustration levels are way too high and life is too short.After returning it for credit, I found myself pondering:  Why would they knowingly make something like this so poorly?  Do they think we won't notice or care?  Another of life's mysteries that will never be solved.

Just received the replacement shipment of these because the first ones were broken inside the box. Zero packing protection and brittle plastic isn’t a good combination. The replacement set of boxes also has one box that’s broken, hence the rating.

These boxes appear to be exactly what I wanted, and I would have given them 5 stars, but one box arrived broken.  The shipping box is not damaged, so I assume the box was broken when it was packaged.  The return/replace isn't working, so I guess I paid for 4 boxes and only have 3 to use.

Purchased these labels (#41567 1 1/2" x 1 1/2" Square Kraft Labels) and regret every minute of it. Although they look nice, I couldn't get the Avery template to work with them. Tried as I may, I couldn't get the template to line up with the labels when printing. I have never had this happen with other Avery label products, but these are a nightmare. As others have stated, they come in a 4 x 6 sized sheet and had they been in a traditional 8 x 11 sheet, maybe that would be better. Paying $12 for 60 labels is steep, but if the company template works with their product, not a problem. If you waste half of them trying to print the product with the company's template, it's a rip off. I gave up trying after 3 sheets were wasted. Sadly, I couldn't use them with my project. Be aware that this could happen to you.Oh, and I find it interesting that all the positive 5 star comments are from people who were given the product for FREE. I paid through the nose for mine, and think there is room for major improvement. I found kraft labels on an 8 x 11 sheet (24 labels/sheet) for mere pennies compared to these at OnlineLabels.com. You can order labels by the sheet if you wish, and I got 240 labels for UNDER the Avery price here. Save your money and DON'T support Avery since they seem to have a disconnect with the consumers.

There's another reviewer here who posted the damage to their item that looks exactly like the damage on mine. So it's not just a user error. I got it because it was cheap but I still paid too much for it!
I, like a few others reviewers, am having issues with the consistency of the print quality. Not sure why, since I've used this product from Staples and other stores with zero issues.
I give two stars bcoz its small my doesn’t fit my papers I thought i can use it to keep and organized my important papers but kind small. Im not happy i got it

I usually don't write reviews but I'd like to provide information for future buyers.I have an art project for which I needed a lot of 0.3 pigment liners so it made sense to me to buy in bulk.I noticed that these pens run out of ink way earlier than the previous, similarly Staedtler liners I used.I recently bought pens from a different seller and the difference was significant. Compared to the others these pens lasted about 70%. It is not only a lot of plastic that I produced and had to throw out but overall was non-economical. I could have made more work with 2 packs of 5pens

So, I purchased this 13 months ago.  I know that is quite a while but stampers always lasted years in the past.  Most have the rubber imprinter disintegrate or the ink pad wear out.  That is not the problem here.  The imprinter has shifted due to poor adhesive holding it in place, rendering it useless.Hoping the seller responds to this review and does the right thing by replacing it as defective.  If so, I will amend the review reflecting great support.

Only actually used this printer, purchased in June/July, very little so far (late November) due to frustrating set-up problems with my tablet. Finally got totally fed up and went the desktop pc connection route - took me maybe 5 minutes to do that! It seems to work really well, a few seconds delay before starting to print but then spits out a page fast. Not as dark as I want and haven't found the setting in the clunky menu to make it darker. Also the page comes out with a noticeable curl from feeding through the printing process. For usage I might be inclined to give it 4 stars (menu has too much room for improvement, page curl) but the frustration with not being successful connecting it to my tablet, which I use far more than my desktop pc now, far outweighs how well it works. When trying to print from my tablet, the app on my tablet says connected, I click to print a doc, the printer screen lights up and says Printing... but nothing happens and the printer goes back to sleep. I did not try any form of customer service for help, after reading other reviews about non-English speaking customer service - thought that might add to my frustration level rather than help it. I'd like to see the company hire a true US-English speaking employee to put the instructions into real usable English - they are clearly written by somebody who knows enough of the language to string a bunch of words together, but not enough to actually explain the steps necessary. Or else the instructions are just plain faulty and need to be updated, which is also a possibility. Summary, when it's working I actually love? it!, but the high frustration and lack of success using it with my tablet far outweighs even the functioning, when forced to turn on my pc if I want to print something.

I'd give Samsung half a star if that were possible. I set up the  printer but could not print the test page. Called Samsung tech support and spent 3 hours working with them.  Told techs the printer kept powering down every minute or so while they worked on it and asked if that was normal. Finally they determined it was defective and said customer service would contact me.  Three days later I spoke to three different reps, and asked to return it, but was told the unit would have to be carried to a repair depot in California and could not be shipped. I live in Virginia. Needless to say, I will not be getting on a plane to CA with a printer that cost less than $100.  It makes a great doorstop, however.

The original purchase was for the extra capacity cartridge which is why I rated it one star.  The first did not produce any ink. PC N Print sent me another one. Little more ink but far from acceptable. They then sent me two regular size cartridges as a replacement. They worked. Sasha turned a horrible situation into a winning one. Great customer service.

I can only review this phone based on the fact that I can't use it. It is mentioned no where in the listing that this is a "backup" phone that only operates as part of a system. While the system itself look great and is goin for a reasonable price it should have been clear what was being sold. So now I'm holding to it until I can afford the whole thing and in the meantyme I'm stuck with the phone I wanted to replace which kinda blows.

Wow, I had the same problem as the other reviewers.  The wireless setup failed repeatedly, and now, when I press power, the printer hangs on the HP screen and never starts up.  I've owned the printer for less than 2 hours.

All my excitement died when i saw it dented at several place :(But decide to keep it cause i don't want to go through the hassle of returning and ordering a new one. So disappointed!Still, 2 stars for the great price.

Will not work in HP printer 8702, so this was a waste of time and money. I’ve read the other reviews and realize it may be due to HP making changes and not this vendor. Regardless, I have to purchase different toners.

This is the biggest waste of money I've ever spent!  We ordered several of these and it was a GIGANTIC WASTE OF MONEY!  I finally had a chance to write a review but should have the moment I received these pieces of junk.  They've been falling apart since day one but since I've never received anything positive (including credit) for returning something through Amazon, I figured I'd live with it.  The wheels have all broken and random pieces fall off from every side.  We tried to return it because of the absolute POOR QUALITY and we were told, "It's just past the 30 days so you can't return it.  Why don't you try selling it?"  REALLY?  You want me to actually sell this to some other chump so they have these problems?  We even tried fixing it but no luck!  I'm having to recycle all of them!  What a WASTE! I will absolutely never order anything from this vendor or from Amazon again.

I love Post-it and these flags! They work great! The only reason I’m giving this rating on this particular sale is because I did not receive the colors that were advertised. They are much darker than pictured. They are not the calm, soft colors that are advertised. So just know that before you buy from here! But they work good!

As you can see in my picture, the Moleskin pen sends pen strokes to the app to display on the screen.  It just doesn't do it consistently, reliably, or accurately.1)  You MUST have the app open to receive the pen strokes2)  DO NOT attempt to write if the pen is transmitting previous pen strokes to the app.  The transmission rate is ridiculously slow.  My 1st grader can write faster than this app.3)  If you were writing away from the open app and have saved pen strokes in the pen, DO NOT attempt to sync and write new content at the same time.  In my picture you can see that the sync failed as I was writing, all pen strokes were lost (that is really stupid...  no fail-over to ensure accurate transmission before deleting the pen strokes form the pen memory?).  There is supposed to be a full page of writing I did last night above the sentence you see.4)  You must write properly for this to work reliably.  The pen does not work well with cursive.  See my second pic of an earlier page where I was less disciplined in my pen strokes.  I tend to write in a cursive, manuscript hybrid and my words have missing letters, groups of missing letters or weird spots where the first letter of a word is connected to the last letter by a diagonal line.  100 years form now someone will be attempting to read my notes and it will be like a game of Wheel of Fortune.I will continue using this thing because I paid the ridiculously expensive price of $150 for a pen and a notebook.  I have two Remarkable 2 tablets on order and when they arrive (they take a couple months) I will be ditching this system.

Why they put that silly storage contraption on the front I will never knowIt hid the scroll bar on my laptop and the only way around that would havebeen to buy a separate keyboard. I sent this product back because of it'spoor design. I gave it one star because it was at least sturdy enough to haveheld my 17.5 inch laptop.
the Software is good for s**t. I rarely write bad review., but i'm to the point that like to smash this printer to the wall. the printer is good but the software is worse than horrible.
I totally agree with the other reviews! I was expecting a pack of 12 and only received one! Please change the name/description it says pk/12!This is very misleading!

If I could give it negative stars I would. Total rubbish. Will not write reliably. Then bleeds...waste of my ink. Pen is on slim side, that is not a problem. Totally sucks to try to write with. Get a Pilot, get a Lamy, get a Sheaffer, ANYTHING but this colossal piece of garbage.

I can not believe all the good reviews I read before buying these. Personally, I feel like throwing them all in the trash, but going to insert all the refills first to see if those work.Alot of the pens are empty or have barely anything in them. Very few of the pens work at all. For some to work, I have to press on the coloring books so hard  the page ends up with a hole in it.I don't know if I just got a bad batch or what, but I find them very aggravating & a huge waste of my money.

I placed an order for replacement ink cartridges for my Epson printers - I have 2, an Epson 2750 and a 2760 (both of which I purchased from Amazon in the past), both use the 200XL printer ink cartridges.  I was having good luck with replacement ink cartridges until I started using the LD brand.  Then I experienced about a 30 -to- 50% failure rate with the replacement LD brand cartridges.  I stopped ordering and even wrote a negative review on Amazon about 3 months ago.  I then started ordering replacement ink cartridges from Speedy Inks - I never paid attention to the brand, but knew it was not LD and also that the Amazon description states a guarantee on printer cartridge.  The first order was great - worked perfectly.  I then placed a second order and much to my surprise, LD brand cartridges were sent me.  I was very disappointed, but I needed the ink cartridges right away.  I installed them first in one printer and had a failure (ink cartridge not recognized) on both the Yellow and Magenta cartridges.  I tried reinstalling them several times, but to no avail.  I then tried to install them in my other printer and received the same error message.  I am a very dissatisfied customer and want these cartridges replaced or my money back.  Please note:  I DO NOT WANT LD BRAND CARTRIDGES.  That is NOT what I ordered - I had the option of ordering this brand when I chose Speedy Inks - and at a higher price.  It appears "Speedy Inks" is nothing more than a clearing house for inferior brand inks.  False, deceptive advertising.

This product broke the black ink part of printer to the point where I no longer can print anything with black color in it regardless of if I use any other brand of black ink. I am highly disappointed in this product and the fact that it did such severe damage to my printer that I have to buy a new one. If I could rate this product 0 stars I would!

UPDATE TO PREVIOUS REVIEW.  PLEASE READ ALL THE COMPLAINTS ONLINE ABOUT THIS PRINTER BEFORE YOU PURCHASE IT - More problems than I can detail.  But WORST is NOW PRINTER will NOT PRINT ANY COLORS!  I'm desperately trying to print out my spreadsheets that have some red, green or blue fonts.  NONE of them print out.  The printer/software showed I had plenty of ink, but I needed this now so I put in brand new cartridges (Lexmark cartridges).  NOTHING!  I changed every option I could in printouts, but just wasted more paper.  I tried to get help on Lexmark site (since manual mentioned nothing about problems with color not printing).  But when I got to the area that asked what product I am writing about, their site would not recognize "Pinnacle", "Pro", "901", etc., etc. - just kept saying "product not found and no drop-down list to choose from).This beats Hewlett-Packard with problems.  Too many to list, but most annoying is TOUCH SCREEN on printer BLANKS OUT after couple months use..have to turn off and on several times to get back.DUPLEXING OPTION does NOT WORK for legal paper.  So if you want to print your Calendars on a program like CCWIN (or any other legal that needs duplexing), IF YOU CHECK "DUPLEX-MANUAL", then print, it prints ALL PAGES WITHOUT duplexing.  However, once you've wasted those pages, if you do nothing else but print SAME document again, it correctly does MANUAL duplexing so you can put pages back in to print on reverse side.More miscellaneous problems so I checked their "HELP" - couldn't believe that one of their two options said "Ask a friend"!  You've got to be kidding me.
Zero stars . E-Z start NOT for me!  I could not figure out how to get tape to work in dispenser. No instruction, diagram, markers. Total waste of my time and $$$. I hope you have better luck!

If this were advertised as just an organizer it would get 5 stars from me. But it has wifi and is supposed to do email and internet. The browser works fine on my home wireless network, mostly. I have been struggling for almost two weeks to send or receive and email message with it. I followed the directions in the PDA manual for set up and I get error messages with an authentication error message. Talked to Palm who said it was the ISP's problem. The ISP says it is Palm's problem. I found another Palm instruction page that gave different instructions for set up from the manual and that did not work. I set up email accounts at hotmail, google and yahoo and the browser on the palm refuses to deliver the front page for google. It just delivers the ads on the hotmail page and no log in. Yahoo refuses to recognize the password. If you want email in a small package for traveling forget this device.

Bought this about a week ago and thought that it would be a welcomed and economical substitute.....but I was wrong. The black ink works fine, but word to the wise, there is no way of knowing the levels of your ink with these cartridges as they are not detected by the HP software.  So yesterday I replaced the tri color ink and it's not printing all of the colors. I've used the eraser method; I've cleaned the cartridges using the HP tools, aligned the cartridges and still the ink is not producing all the colors.  A complete waste of my time and money.  If I could give less than a star I would!
I cannot give this product any stars as this ink did not work with my printer, it keeps showing error message so this was waste of my money

I have ordered "The Secretary" register with alternate shaded lines and smaller size for several years from EGP., as shown in the photos and listing. However, this last order was sent with "The Executive" register which is (a) larger, and (b) no alternate shaded lines. The shaded lines are important to me and the primary reason for ordering these registers. Now I have 5 unwanted registers which are worthless except as shredded paper for packaging. Perhaps EGP vendor thought they could substitute a different product (larger, higher name status on the cover) and get away with it. My rating does not agree. They could have notified me of any problem before sending.

These pens are horrible! I purchased in March. I used them off in on for about 2 weeks. When I tried to use them again in April, they were dried out. I don’t understand why because the lid was closed tightly on them. I am so glad I had a $10 promotion and only had to pay $1.00 for them don’t I would be very upset!!! It is not worth the price, keep your money😍 I only pick 1 star because I couldn’t submit with it being empty.

Using this with Scotch magic tape, it slides and lifts all over the place. Not sure if its a newer model with less weight, but I read all the reviews and its not supposed to be like this. I can hear the sand inside when tilting it, and i think it needs more sand for weight. Sad purchase

I would have given it five stars except for the fact it is tilted a little, which is not good because I use it for my laptop. Tried readjusting it several times and I even had two other people look at it to try and realigned it, but with no success.

I would give it no stars if it let me ! Not even a month and it's wheels are falling apart and the arms never would screw in all the way! Not worth the money in my opinion . Trying to get a return but they want to see pics first. Seriously just give me my money back.
I don't like it at all I done bought 2 packs & it doesn't work i should have read the reviews

After a horrible experience with a brand new HP Officeject Pro 8500, and a less than helpful customer service rep, I boxed the HP and returned it to the store.  I spent a couple of days researching other options for my home office.  I was really looking for a wireless printing option that is customizable through "apps" that can be downloaded to the printer.  I ran across The Lexmark Pinnacle Pro 901 at a brick-and-mortar store.  I read some really good online reviews of it and decided to give it a try and ordered it through Amazon at about $50 off the brick-and-mortar store.Compared to the HP, this printer is a JOY to use.  Set up was easy as pie and it works exactly as advertised.  I was up and running with my printer connected to my wireless network within about 20 minutes.The "apps" (which Lexmark calls SmartSolutions) have a ways to go.  They are mostly just smart buttons which are programmable to perform repetitive tasks (for example, scanning a document and emailing it).  I am hopeful that more companies will create apps for Lexmark which allow printing of boarding passes, maps, directions, restaurant menus, etc. directly from the printer.For now, I am so happy with this all-in-one printer.  It has de-cluttered my home office (I previously had a printer, scanner, and fax machine scattered about).UPDATE: I previously gave this printer 4-stars, but have changed it to 1 star after a few months of use.  The printer freezes up frequently, requiring a restart to bring it back to life.  Also, I have been through three print heads for this printer.  It will just stop printing black ink.  I clean the print heads following the instructions, then have to call technical support which ultimately results in them shipping me a new print head to install.  This printer is very unreliable!!!

We ordered a  Black HP 88XL Black cartridge, the ad said it was "new"  the cartridge we recieved was over 3 years  expired....it's expiration date on the box was covered by a lable, upon opening the  foil pouch  the actual expiration date was shown as 2012/04/11. Now I see other reviews with the same problem....very dissappointed

i just recieved this last week, my printer is already printing like there is no ink and its saying its low on ink. I normally dont write reviews but this is horrible. i print maybe 4 sheets of paper every 3 or 4 days.

This piece of crap won't connect wirelessly no matter what I do. WiFi won't work, NFC won't work. I didn't bother testing it USB because that's not why I bought it. I don't know how it got so many 5 star reviews but I noticed everyone who gave it 1 star did so for the same reason I am. It simply will not connect wirelessly. I'm returning it before ever printing a single page.

I think HP makes some pretty decent products. I've normally had good luck with their printers. But THIS one is horrible. Heed the reviews and stay away. Locks up, gives false error codes, claims (HP) ink is 3rd party and gives warning messages.  Way more trouble than it's worth. I've had mine for just a few months and am junking it.

The board is great in the frame, but it didn't come with all of the parts and there is no way to request the missing parts. The only option provided is to return the item. But the package is huge and the board is in great shape. I just want to attach the bottom brackets and wheels so I can use it as intended.If you're the seller and reading this review, please let me know how to obtain the missing wheels and bracket so I can use this product and update the review.

This got two stars because of the awesome feature set and the design of the scale - nice, compact, sleek, small. And because when I called their company the phone was answered quickly and handled well.Three stars were knocked off because:1) It didn't work. Mine showed screwy weights when weighing the same object - .01 oz; 0, 3 oz. You get the idea.2) Really poor user experience:  a) The manual is in 4 point type and isn't even accurate. For example, it refers to an 'on/off switch'. There is a switch that turns the scale on and off but it isn't labeled on/off.  b) Their website is not much help. No tutorials or even manuals there. Their FAQs contain useless info, such as definitions of 'Weighing Scale' and  'Accuracy'. Really.  c) The manual instructs you to calibrate the scale by using their 1 KG weight, which is not included.My scale may have worked if I calibrated it. But by the time I read that part of the manual I had spent 20 minutes on their website trying unsuccessfully to find a pdf version of the manual, another 10 minutes finding a magnifying glass to read the teeny tiny print, and another 5 minutes calling them. That exhausted all my patience and the thing is being returned.

The bins, which are okay in construction though a little fragile, arrived with a broken lid. I thought it would be simple enough to ask them to send another lid. No. I send an email to their support as listed by Amazon. They don't respond. I send a follow-up 5 days later (because you never know with email!), and I actually thought they just weren't going to respond. However they did respond (5 additional days later), only to pass the buck and say that it's someone else's problem and that I should return these large bins to do the entire process again. So broken item (due to fragility), slow support email, bad support (non-)solution. Awful. Here is the email, with the greeting/signature excluded:> Unfortunately, we do not offer the lids separate from the containers.> We manufacture them as a whole unit when they are produced.>> Per our contracts with them they receive an allowance to cover instances such as this.> We cannot issue replacements for them. We do not have access to their orders to assist with them.> Usually what they require you do is return and reorder.EDIT: Added a star because I am indeed using three bins and lids.

Because this product failed, I have been forced to drastically change a previously positive review.I bought this chair less than four months ago to replace a CPRO 600 that was about ten years old. First, the CPRO 800 does not adjust as low as the CPRO 600. This difference is a drawback for anyone who has to get low and use a polar scope on an EQ mount or for viewing sky objects near the zenith. Second, this product failed to support my 240 pounds after only a few months usage (i.e. used less than 20 or thirty nights). The most disappointing part of this particular purchase is that my chair appears that it might have been previously repaired and I bought it as a new product. If it wasn't a repaired item, it most definitely appears to be some sort of second, and for this I hold the vendor responsible. Frankly, at this point, I honestly don't know whether the seat's support arms were bent when I bought the item new, or if they bent because the product failed. Look at the three pictures of the underside of the seat that I have attached. I swear this product looks like it broke or failed previously and someone re-attached the seat to the frame. I did not misuse or abuse this item and it did not perform as advertised. If I could give this zero stars, I would. I want my money back when I return this product. By the way, I'm going back to the CPRO 600.

I have had it for 3 years. The touch screen worked for less than a year then dead. The cursor lands now about 1 cm from the thumb. File management is nightmare, never know what are installed and what not. The WiFi for web browsing works better than I expected, 2 star there. Prepare a week of study before you can fully understand how the soft and hard ware pieced together if you incline to give a try.

If you read the reviews you will see many complaints about it not connecting. They are correct. After 6 months it started dropping connections daily. After a year multiple times a day and now it refuses to warm up. There is a reason it is so cheap.

Purchased to replace my Sephora sharpener of the same style and design, yet this one will not do.  Not really worth returning for this price.  I trusted other reviews that usually works, but not in this case.  The larger hole was still too small for my larger pencils (e.g., NARS matte lipstick pencil) so this is essentially useless.

While the Paper Mate Red Flexgrip is a classic pen, the box of 12 we received looked rather old. Half of the pens took some scribbling to get going writing - indicating they had been sitting on the shelf somewhere for a long time.Two stars.

I did not receive a discount for this item in exchange for a review.  Sadly, I paid full price.The print quality is abysmally faded.  The first 10 pages were dull relative to the OEM cartridge from Canon, and subsequent pages have become unreadable.  Shaking the cartridge provides no improvement.  The lack of contrast is evenly distributed throughout the entire page.Unfortunately, I purchased a second cartridge before trying the first.  I'll soon review that one, as well.

I'm not sure why I didn't listen to the reviews. See attached pictures. First pic is after one coat and second pic (taken at an angle) is after two coats. And yes, this is after shaking it THOROUGHLY before applying it each time.

Like others I found that the tabs don't stick to themselves when folding them over.  I used a little gorilla glue to make them stick. Printing was pretty easy.  You need to know how your printer prints before you stick one of these in the tray.  I suggest putting a mark on plain paper and doing a test print before.  This will give you orientation before wasting a sheet of tabs.I would have given them at least 4 stars but very frustrating when you have to re-glue every tab.

I returned it.  It was too flimsy and wouldn't stay put on my recliner, even when I weighed it down. The top part didn't stay flat at all.  It has a piece of wrapped cardboard that sits in the tray area, but it just kept on popping out.  It also reeked of a very strong chemical smell.  I was very disappointed.  If I could give it negative stars, I would.  This thing sucked.

I bought one of these a year ago to replace my eight year old HP officejet. I was interested in the low cost of the ink cartridges, the smaller size of the printer and the print quality.  I was debating between the Pinnacle Pro 901 and a similar HP and I decided to try a new brand.I was wrong, and that decision has been a painful one. The Lexmark Pinnacle Pro901 has turned out to be one of the WORST printers I could have bought. It never seems to want to "wake up" when I need to print something.  The print cartridges run out very quickly - even if you get the XL sizes.  And finally, doing anything simple is a chore with this machine - it is always waiting or requesting something. I've done everything from update the firmware to replace the printhead (at Lexmark's request) and it hasn't helped.  Its a poor quality printer.  I will be getting rid of it soon and going back to an HP.As other reviewers have said "I will NEVER buy another Lexmark product again".  I am in 100% agreement.

I don't know what product these other reviewers received, but the one I received was not solidly built at all. Not even close.Here are all the issues I have with the one I received and this is how it arrived at my door:1) Corner of tabletop is broken. Where the corners of the wood meet, they are not attached. Like they forgot to glue it or simply did so poorly and it detached.2) The "magnetic" piece that is supposed to hold the top down when flat is, well, NOT magnetic, has lost all magnetism, or simply isn't a strong enough magnet. So it doesn't connect at all stay down flat. It's the plastic/metal white piece you see in the picture.3) The bar of wood on the tabletop that holds the laptop in place when the top is up has a long crack along it. Who knows when that piece will break off.4) The metal rod/latch that is meant to lock into place to prop the tabletop up doesn't even fit right into the wood slots. You have to jam it in and even when you do, it's barely in there so it will likely fall out if you move around a bit. I don't know about you, but I don't want that top collapsing on my fingers or anything else when I have it propped up.Similarly, the metal rod is fairly flimsy, isn't properly aligned, which contributes to why it doesn't fit well into the wood slots (how you adjust the vertical nature of the tabletop). The rods also aren't secured to the wood, so it can simply pop-out of the top.5) Just in general, the wood has little holes and chipped pieces all over. It's as if they don't inspect these things at all because all of these flaws were SO noticeable. I saw all of this within a minute of unpacking the thing.6) This leads me to the packaging of the product and what might have contributed to 1 or 2 of the issues above (but certainly not all of them). There was no protection in the packaging. It came box that was the same size as the table, with no padding. Unless you call a single strip of 1mm foam paper on 1 side of the table protection. Clearly it didn't do the job.I have pictures of all of the above issues. I wish there was a way to post them in this review.Conclusion:NOT worth $40. This is the equivalent of a $1-$5 purchase at a yard sale of 5 year old items that have seen a lot of wear and tear. I'll be seeking a return slip now.

After I wrote the below review, I already ran out of the 2nd color cartridge today--the one I'd replaced the first one which I felt had run out quickly. Well, this one ran out twice as quickly as the first one, which was bad enough. ! I don't think that 2nd cartridge was in my printer for a week even. I am shocked to be frank. The color XL is rated 450 pages per 5% coverage. I don't think I even got 100 pages! It's not saving money if you only get 1/4 of what you are supposed to get. I have a deadline today, I was sure I had plenty of ink, and now I have to run out to Staples. Total rip off.Original review: I use remanufactured cartridges all the time. Hadn't used this company. Bought 2 sets a month apart, , since I'd forgotten I'd bought the first set and reordered. No problem, I can always use the extra ink. So for the first batch:  I noticed immediately that the ink smells very strong and bad when the pages come off the printer. This is not a deal breaker if everything else worked fine, but it was noticeable and odd, never smelled that before on printer ink. But considering that the cartridges were hi yield, they ran out very quickly relatively speaking. I hardly printed in color to speak of and that color cartridge ran out in a few weeks!  That should have lasted at a few months based on what I was printing.  I will not buy this product again.

The only thing that is really wrong with this machine is that the Ringer Volume does not turn off. I've called support and they tried to help, but they finally said it is the best they can do. The machine still makes a sound when an incoming phone call comes in. This is so annoying as I get calls all day that I don't need to answer as this is set up to be for faxes only. Any other calls coming in on this line should not be coming in on it. I know it may be harsh to give this a one star based solely on the fact that an incoming call is going to be heard no matter what, but this would be a reason I would not buy this machine again if I was to shop for another machine. I can't tell you how annoyed and frustrated I am that this stupid thing will not turn off the volume completely.
I was sorely disappointed in these pens and don't know why they received such good reviews.  The ink flow is pitiful!

If you are looking for something beautiful to set on your desk, then this is the stapler for you!  However, if you plan on stapling anything then I would find a different product.  This stapler jams every other time I try to staple something.  It does a consistently poor job whether or not you are trying to staple 2 pages or 10.  I gave it 2 stars because it says "keep it together" on top, and I do think its cute and clever.

We had high hopes for this notebook after watching the youtube reviews for it. However, it doesn't work at all like they say... We even got the recommended pens and the notebook stained very easily, and the pens (we tried 4 different kinds) left marks on the paper. Very disappointing for the price, but a good idea if it actually worked.

We've had this printer for a few years now. It fit the bill of what we were looking for - not too expensive, no bells and whistles, just a simple wireless printer. It had great reviews.The printer gave us trouble from the beginning. It constantly went offline and every time I went to print it became a 10-20 minute hassle that involved me taking my computer down to the printer and checking and rechecking everything so the whole "wireless" idea was basically eliminated. Early on I spent a few days and over an hour on the phone with a tec support rep and finally had it up and running. It worked for the most part but we still had issues every few months. (We don't do a lot of printing.)Now it's giving me trouble again, randomly going offline, printing barely legible (might be toner? Though the test pages print perfectly.) and I just called support to get some trouble shooting. I had to fill out a form online just to get a phone number to call. The form let me know that my warranty expired, which I assumed meant I couldn't send it back, but it also means I can't receive any tech support on the phone. I only found that out after calling tech support, going through all the back and forth of name, phone, email, serial #, product#, etc before he says, "I can't give you any support over the phone. You can go online and look around there."Thanks. If that had worked the first time, I wouldn't have called.I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because there were times when it worked. But never for long.Don't buy this printer unless you like to make yourself crazy and then get a new printer in a year or two.

Like most of the reviews I will says these are very small and impractical for adult clothes. There is no way you are getting bras to fit in the bra one. And yes these are very flimsy, but you get what you pay for. (I only paid $5 for these.) I bought these to organize my 5 yr olds clothes and it works decently well for this purpose. The ties one is perfect for children's socks and underwear, but I will say her other clothes barely fit in the other ones.Two pros: they shipped quicker than expected and they do fit in the drawers perfectly.If you want something to organize adult drawers, spend more money and get better quality organizers.

You will get some reviews of this saying it's great they love it; and other saying the quality isn't good enough.So it clearly depends on what is an acceptable quality to you.For me presonally, I'm hardly a perfectionist - I don't own an SLR, I'm not a professional, I don't publish.  Yet I do take pride in my photos and don't like poor quality; and this wasn't good enough for me.  I sent it back. I had to returned this as it was tripping off my circuit breaker. I contacted customer support after holding for 30 minutes I was told that maximum amp this printer takes is 11.6. Which is not correct as rating of my circuit breaker is 15 amp.Before turning the printer on I made sure that there were no other devices connected. So max amp rating Brother claims is not correct. After searching online I came to know that this is problem with Brother printers.Before buying this printer make sure that you have circuit breaker at least more that 20 amps ( may be more if you have other device in the room).

Addendum: 8/42/2020I was contacted by Smart Ink customer service after I posted my initial review below. They apologized and offered me a replacement or a full refund. I chose the full refund because I already bought other ink. I was contacted immediately by customer service and they initiated a full refund. No matter what product or service one may choose, good, bad or indifferent, a great customer service experience always trumps a sour taste. Smart Ink has removed that sour taste from my mouth and I am thankful for that.I don't have too much to say except that I was in a rush to buy some cheap ink. I usually buy IKONG ink for my HP 6600 but again I was in a pinch and needed ink the next day. So, I seen this ink set with a cute little branding (the ink dude with glasses) and read like 1 or 2 reviews, so I bought it.I put in place all the new Smart Ink cartridges and began to print and everything I printed had both lines through it and missing black ink (I typically only print out journal articles for school). I did this several more times and same thing. I cleaned the printhead, not exaggerating, like 30-40 times, still the same problem. Feeling utterly defeated I thought something was wrong with my printer and that I would have to get it repaired or worse buy a new one.I decided first to try my longstanding ink brand IKONG, so I purchased it and when it arrived I replaced all the ink cartridges. Lo and behold all my documents came out perfect. I included pictures of the differences of both ink brands I purchased (Smart Ink and the IKONG), you can see for yourself.I didn't need to get repairs or buy a new printer. I cannot with good conscience recommend this Smart Ink product, but I will say "You get what you pay for"!

I develop and printing documents that are used in marketing and distributed to CEOs across the state and government officials. Personally, I find this too big to comfortably hold.  And I'm an adult.  It's also hard for me to squeeze.  And it's certainly too big/heavy to carry around attached to a purse or backback, so I find the keychain attachment to be extremely annoying, and it makes it asymetrical (even when I took all the metal off, by opening and removing the first jump ring), so it bothers me to have one ball in each and because they're not the same.  However, I do recognize that everyone has different tastes, and for some people, this might be preferable to the smaller fidgets.  It's definitely very sturdy, but it's not for me.I'm an adult, with mild Asperger's syndrome, and fairly severe ADHD (although even that was not diagnosed until college, but that was at least in part because it was masked by a combination of severe social anxiety, which lead to extreme efforts not to call attention to myself, and high intellegence, which allowed me to compensate accademically through most of my education).  This might be good for a younger child, who prefers or requires larger toys, a more severely autistic individual who might be less bothered by the size (and certainly the appearance of carrying arround something this size), or someone who just has bigger hands than I do.I gave it two stars because it does seem durable and well-made, and has an interesting texture, but no more because it was not a size or shape I liked, and I think the keychain is silly.

I never even got to use this printer. Every time I turned it on, it tripped the breaker, even when it was the only thing plugged in on that circuit. Granted, I did have it plugged into circuits on AFCIs (the kind of circuit breakers required in bedrooms since 2002), which, from what I understand from the internet, are highly sensitive, especially to big power-drawers like laser printers. But the one and only place I intended to use the printer was in a home office, which is technically a bedroom and therefore uses AFCIs.There really should be a warning or disclaimer in the official product description regarding its ridiculous power needs. It gets a two-star review from me for a complete lack of any such language. I shouldn't have to rely on user reviews as to whether this thing will be compatible with my house.I'll be returning it and I'll try for the smaller and hopefully more power-friendly MFC7860DW. If I think of it I'll even update here as to whether that one works or not.

I've been using these cartridges in an Epson WF-2540 printer for months with no problem other than a warning message about them not being genuine Epson cartridges.  If I had done this review before yesterday, it definitely would have been a five star review.  However, yesterday one of these cartridges actually damaged my printer, rendering it inoperable.  Here's what happened.  After what should have been a routine replacement of the yellow cartridge, the printer reported that the cartridge was not installed correctly.  Removing the cartridge proved more difficult than usual, which seemed very odd.  (At the time, I thought this might just be due to a slightly tight fit along the sides of these cartridges.)  After removing and reinstalling the cartridge, I got the same message again.  It wasn't until I removed the cartridge the second time that I noticed the cartridge chip was missing.  Turns out the chip had somehow fallen off inside the grey plastic bag the cartridge is packaged in.  Unfortunately, even a genuine Epson cartridge won't work for me know, since the rough surface under where the chip should have been on the remanufactured chip damaged the chip contacts inside the printer.  Fortunately, after some research I found that the chip contacts are relatively inexpensive and can be fairly easily replaced.  However, even if this works as I hope, it has been a big time drain and pain in the butt.  Another troubling thing is that this does not appear to be a one-off situation.  The other yellow cartridge I have from the set I purchased has the same exact problem.  See pics of cartridge with disconnected chip and damage to contacts (which have been removed from the printer).  Bottom line, great price on ink cartridges that generally seem to work well, but I would definitely watch for this missing chip issue before installing the cartridges.

Quality of material seems OK, very solid and stiff - perhaps too stiff (see title of this review). Will it flatten now it's on the floor, under heavy weights on the curled up, convex, side of the roll?  Why could it not be sent flat packed, when obviously this would happen?Could not someone have cleaned it off? Anyone who wants a photo of the 6 cloths + soapy water to clean can have a copy: they're truly black.Shame on you Amazon for allowing something that had obviously been languishing in a filthy warehouse for months, to be traded under the Amazon banner. Sloppy and slapdash.'Made in USA': we should be proud of that - and not do the best to undermine that - which the manufacturers and Amazon appear to have done.

The metal base broke on it so the chair is junk. I have been trying to contact the manufacture to see about getting a new part as the rest of the chair is good.. So far NO reply from the manufacture. If they would answer their support emails I would rate it higher!. Plus i have had other chairs that lasted years before issues like this. If I could give 0 stars, I would. The female brass thread insert fell out of the body of the pen when I tried to swap a blue insert into my new pen. You obviously need this part to stay in the pen, the two halves of the pen that house the refill are rather important. Ok. So I glued it back in because there was no keeping it together otherwise. At this point, I could have returned it but for such a minor issue, it wasn't worth the trouble. Or so I thought. Apparently the body that somehow warped enough for the threaded insert to fall out in the first place, after literally owning the pen less than a week now, no longer accepts the CAP. Well, great. So I have a pen that I can screw/unscrew, but not cap. I'd send it back to them for repair or replacement, but they require you box and pay for shipping yourself. Not terribly atypical, but if this is typical of the pen I don't have any interest in paying for postage on the off-chance it *might* be fixed by Fisher. That's just throwing good money after bad. I collect pens, I have pens that cost from two dollars to 750 dollars. This is by far the worst pen experience I've had so far.Oh, and for the record, the metal this pen is made of is so thin and cheap that when I pushed too hard to try and force the cap on, the bottom of the pen dented. The coating seems tough, but the pen is softer than any plastic pen I own. Also, the novelty of the refills wears off and you eventually realize it doesn't write as well as cheap uniballs, either. A huge step down from the fountain pens I'm used to, but I wanted something that works on the carbon copies I use at work.
