You only receive ONE Sharpener. ONE. Definitely Not worth the price.I should have read the reviews. smh . Lesson Learned.

I already have a Samsung CLP-310 & (3years) Love it!  I thought having the WiFi printer would be great as well. But, I had problems from the start..Wrong disc in box, meant wrong drivers.  I got the right drivers (@ least I thought). Customer service was TERRIBLE, from the accents to the over static connection & d/c's. After several calls and from the disconnects I was finally directed to a "Universal Driver".  Now the dang thing prints when it wants to using wifi :( I love how it prints the quality is excellent for the price, as is my other one. But, sadly I have to keep it connected thru the ethernet port.Gave it 2 Stars becuz Cust.Service screws the pooch!  24 hour customer service is useless in situations like this.Price 5Printer 5Customer Service -5

When the most popular reviews are talking about trying to decipher how to put the staples in the stapler to get it to work, it’s a problem. I even tried googling how to do it and that didn’t help. I was literally 1 minute away from returning the item when I had the idea to check the page for the same brand staples I bought with the stapler. There was actually a video for how to install the staples ONLY under the staples themselves. Why wouldn’t they also include that video for the stapler!???? If they couldn’t bother including specific instructions for this complicated way to install the staples, I can’t bother leaving a good review. So far it works as advertised and I’m worried it’ll randomly fail like other people says theirs did. I’m Extremely frustrated and I’ve ordered more complicated things that required installation from Amazon and this irritated me more. I think it’s because I wasn’t expecting to solve a Soduko puzzle to install staples in a stapler 🙄

The cartridge I received did not work at all.  Called the toll free number listed on the packing slip and they are sending me a replacement at no cost.  This was for an HP Officejet Pro 8500 Wireless printer.  I will leave a positive review if the next cartridge I receive works.  Also, there was no associated shipping cost for the defective cartridge.

Very dissapointed with this item.  Color is not as described, it is purple, not blue. Also,I do not think I am that clueless but I could not find the nib. I returned it and have been  bombarded with emails from the vendor. I will review for Amazon only.

Misrepresentation of a product is a pet peeve for me, thus the one-star rating.  The description for these clips (and accompanying pictures and manufacturer information) listed these clips as "Acco Brand", and that is what I wanted to purchase based on my experience with Acco clips.  The seller (Quick Supplies) sent binder clips  in 2 boxes under the "brand" titled "Business Source".  The only reason I did not return these clips is because my husband needed them now, and he verified that the clips were good enough for what he wanted them for.  If you are looking for "Acco" brand clips. look elsewhere.  If you do not care about the brand, the price I paid ($7) is a reasonable one.

I'm not one to give bad reviews... however this stapler is not good! It is extremely hard to open. I opened it once to load it with staples and it then would not shut. Eventually it ended up breaking. I had it for a total of an hour and it fell apart, and I was pretty gentle with it.Don't buy this product. I mean possibly I could have gotten a defective one however I was supper disappointed.

I agree with other reviews that these feel flimsy in my hand, but the main problem with these scissors is they don't seem to cut much of anything.  Too cheap to bother returning so I'm replacing them and will probably just throw them in the trash.Lesson learned (again and again): you get what you pay for.

I was very happy with the price of this book stand.I have been using it with a spiral-bound paperback book.  I end up having to balance a clipboard behind the book to hold the book up so I can read it.  The pages are also very hard to turn.  I have damaged the bottom of my pages by using this book stand.I am going to purchase the plastic $11 one from fellowes which is also highly rated.  I have that one at school and have been very happy with it.I do not recommend this book stand for books.  It would probably work well for a tablet computer or Ipad or something.  I will hold onto it in case I buy another product to use it with.
It did not work. Would not take in paper. I took out the print head and used it to get my own one working.  COMPLETE RIP OFF. if I could post half a star I wouldn't...

After finally getting all the letters put in I go to put in the ink cartridge just to see there's no ink on it. Reading through the reviews others are saying that it can be used immediately with the ink pad that's included. But the ink pad that was included in mine had no ink..... I paid an extra $9.99 for it to show up on time (not that it matters) for a craft show tomorrow but you'd think for a $30 stamper it would have have ink??? Now going to drive around town to see who sells it. 🙃

The boxes seemed strong on arrival but when I tried to snap the boxes closed, only two of the four would do that. That’s a 50% failure rate. I would have kept the two that did close but it was a set of four so I have to return them all. I’m disappointed.

I was so excited to get this to organize my makeup and it came broken . The last 2 bars are broken and it does make the whole drawer uneven . It’s still super cute and I can still use the top drawers. It was easy to put together but I can’t use 2 of these drawers so I  am giving it 2 stars.

Buyer beware! This is just one single ink refill.  Its not a box of ink refills as the picture would lead you to believe. I thought I was getting a great deal on a box of refills and was very surprised to find a single one in the package. I'd give 0 stars if it were possible. Absolutely misleading!

This was highly rated by other reviewers. We found it clutzy to use, very non-intuitive. Navigation was unintuitive and it presented so many results you could spend hours scrolling through them. In its defense, we're not tech-savvy, so maybe someone who is would find it more intuitive. We sent it back.

Never stop door.Ordered three they did not keep the doors  still, Return. Ordered three and ask do you have ones that work. The next three came and they do exactly the same thing. You cannot get the door or doors to stay in any position that you want unless you let it swing all the way open or latch it shut. There is no stopping it anywhere in between opened or closed. Must stay completely open or completely closed.  I don’t know where they’re getting all the good reviews, it’s possible somebody’s working the system. Video to show you is a joke, just put it, Open and shut it five times and it stays perfectly still wherever you put it. Very funny.

Waste of purchase. This product doesn't work. The seller response is not good. Can't give zero stars. No MRP or Batch number on the product. How this company is deciding MRP and discount without labelling on it.

The tape does not consistently move through the Rotex machine I have used for many years. I commonly have two or more letters printed on basically the same space. I did not and do not have this same problem with the older tape (Rotex and Dymo) I had on hand. When that tape is gone, I will have to search for a replacement and it will not be the product being reviewed.

I should have read the reviews before I bought these.I'm a teacher in a Title 1 School. We ran out of pencils very quickly and I couldn't ask parents or the school to help buy more. Since our pencil sharpener in our room hardly works, I chose to buy these presharpened pencils. I found them to be sharp enough to start and kids can do the rest with handheld sharpeners if they prefer. However, the erasers on these pencils are awful. They smudge on the first use and left green marks all over everything. I'm lucky because I had a box of erasers donated to my classroom, so we're able to use those. Otherwise I'd be stuck with pencils my kids couldn't use.Don't buy these unless you have a ton of extra erasers already.

Do not. Under any circumstances. Buy this printer.With two older HP Inkjets slowly fading, I purchased the B210 from a big box store. It had a built-in scanner! It was network capable, so our household would only need the one! It was marked down... to a remarkable degree... And there, even with the rapid changes of inventory that occur at many big-box stores, I probably should have heard warning bells.The one good thing I will say is that the print quality is fine. But over the course of a month, in which we print maybe a few dozen pages with minimal color (we're talking school reports that might have the occasional piece of clip art and a search engine map or two, not high resolution photos) the printer burns through ink cartridges that are supposed to get hundreds of prints. Expensive ink cartridges. And since the printer kindly took it on itself to download an update, it refuses to play nicely with recycled ink cartridges. No, no. Only expensive, factory-fresh brand-name ink cartridges will do it for this little monster.It also scans to a computer... Maybe twice... before losing its connection and having to be shut down and started up again to continue scanning. I will note that it's in the same room as the router and modem, and the computer it's scanning *to* is all of twenty-five feet away.This printer has put me off of HP, possibly for life. I've just purchased a well-reviewed color laser printer from another company to put an end to the nightmare of this printer. Even at several times the price, I'm likely to make it up on ink alone. I wish I was exaggerating.

I normally do not write reviews but felt obligated to inform others who might be looking at Brother Printers.  I have gone through 2 printers in less than 24 months.  I used less than 3 reams of paper with each of them before I had problems.  In the end Brother would not stand behind there product.  I am stuck with extra ink, inconvenience and hours of wasted time online with customer service trying to resolve the issue they are poorly manufactured printers.  Seek other brands!

This review is way overdue. I actually forgot about it, because I ended up tossing this stamp away after a couple weeks. The reason is because after a few uses, it started to stick. I couldn't get it to go back up. I pinched and tapped to get it to release. Only to have it do it again the next use. Then it started to stick going down, and wouldn't even stamp. When it did finally go down only half the image stamped. I wasted so much time trying to get it to work. I didn't waste the energy or time to return it and just tossed it.

Would be one star, but they were cheap.The problem is that several of them are glued together, resulting in rips and tears when trying to retrieve one from a "stack."I will look for another option, I would not recommend this product.
Basically nothing but a wobbling, semi usuable piece of junk. Every bad review listed has been accurate.

It is okay if your going to use it on one side of the bed and unfortunately it does not reverse (of course to the side I needed it for) It is fairly sturdy and the fact it says and it does rotate 360 (the tray) the stand does not therefore leaving you with a unsteady table/desk. It is a very nice tray design for holding not only my laptop but the cooling fan as well, the bumpers on the edge are good and sturdy. If only it would fit both sides I would be giving it a 5 star. I have plenty of room for it to fit under as it is an adjustable bed and they are high. I refuse to give up my side of the bed and since my husband threw  the box out I cannot return it. So disappointed. It is a good idea, good product but needs to be redesigned for both sides.

I purchased this printer last December, and it is right  up there with the worst purchases I have ever made.It has had so many issues that I would not know how to even begin discussing it with Customer Service.  It has been one thing right after another almost since I owned it, and I have no interest in owning a printer for which I have to be calling for help all the time.  The only thing I would discuss with them is a refund.Often when I try to print something, I have to reboot my whole system in order to do it.  Sometimes I will get the error message that it is not communicating, and sometimes it just quits and nothing happens.  I have done updates several times that are supposed to take care of the issue, and it never does - it might work okay for a few days, and then it is right back with the problem again.  I have purchased nothing but Lexmark ink cartridges and have still had several printing issues.  In spite of deep cleaning the printheads, it never prints well and always has streaks; so it is pretty much useless for color printing.  As other reviews said, it was okay for awhile when I first got it; then I assume the printhead got messed up after a few months of usage.  I had to return some cartridges as a couple of them could not be authenticated although they were Lexmark.  I did yet another update this afternoon in order to correct the communication problem, and now I cannot get it to print in color at all.  I will now be shopping for another printer - and it will definitely NOT be Lexmark.  From the number of one-star reviews on this product, something is definitely amiss.
There is no app to connect it to, this is a paint to deal with! I have no idea how there is good reviews for this garbage!

Each cartridge has been poor quality ink distribution to the page.  For instance, two or three lines or more on a page will be faded out, rather than full value ink coverage.  This will be intermittently progressive, starting with a few lines  of occasional lightly applied ink coverage to several lines that happen more frequently throughout the use of the ink cartridge.  If it happened with one ink cartridge, I would probably not take the time to give it a poor review, but it has happened over a few cartridges.

Finally, I found the right cartridge.  My printer takes two kinds of black, the skinny "photo black" and then the main black cartridge that is fatter.  The fatter cartridge is the one I was after and it's the one I got.  It's been a bit confusing because they all have the same number, 410XL.  Anyway, if you are looking for the "fat" cartridge, this is it.EDIT 01/14/18 - Taking down from 5 stars to 2.  It just ran out of ink.  This is way faster than we are used to.  Not happy.

Every single box and lid was cracked. One box had a hole in the bottom. It’s packaged so badly I’m not surprised it cracks. I read the reviews and was like “nahhh won’t happen to me.” It did. The boxes will come to you cracked. You are not the exception to the rule 😂 don’t waste you’re money

I actually initially had a pretty positive view of this little safe until I accidentally dropped it while it was locked and it opened. I've now discovered I can drop the safe, while locked, relatively lightly on to my kitchen table so that it lands flat on the bottom and it will pop open and come unlocked every single time. I read the cautionary tale reviews and figured for the price I'd take a chance, but it turns out I bought a safe that isn't actually safe. I am a parent and I know other parents may read this review-- I'd find some other safe besides this one. I don't use this safe because it isn't safe and I wish I hadn't purchased it.

I've ordered MyCartridge remanufactured ink cartridges for years for my Epson and Brother printers (various models over the years).  Everything was fine until this latest batch for one of my Epson WF printers.Upon installing one of the re-man cartridges, a scary notice appeared on the screen informing me that the world as I knew it would end if I continued with anything but a genuine Epson cartridge.  The back button was an "invalid operation."  I tried other ways to exit out with no success.Since then, the printer is unusable: uneven lines of type, streaks, bizarre colors.  Epson warned me but I saw no way to exit out.My Brother printer works fine with MyCartridge cartridges (several batches),  My Epson printers have to, until this last batch.So either MyCartridge delivered a bad batch of cartridges or they decided to screw up all their customers' Epson printers thus ensuring they would be showered with 1-star reviews, or Epson decided to force us consumers to buy their cartridges by disabling our printers if we wander off the farm.  I'm guessing it's the latter.I'm just sayin.

I've had my Pro901 for 2 years and now, literally nothing works.  Here's why...1. Printing - The ink is uneven.  The top of the page is perfectly fine but the bottom is light or nonexistent.  I've tried swapping out ink cartridges, cleaning the printer head, etc. and it still doesn't work.2.  Fax - Suddenly stopped working entirely.  Still not sure why.3.  Scanner - Jams EVERY time I use it.  I can't even open the top to scan manually because the hinges on the lid broke and it's stuck in the down position.This thing literally can't perform a single function it's supposed to.  I would give it to someone for free, but that's just mean.You want to know the worst part?  Owning this POS is stressful.  When I'm under a deadline and I just need it to scan a document, which takes 45 min.  I've been late to meetings because of it.  My neighbors probably think I have anger issues because I curse like a sailor at it.  Emotionally, this thing is taxing.Never buying anything from Lexmark again.  Look at the overwhelming poor reviews and you should do the same.

I really want to purchase this item but...after reading some of the reviews I get the feeling if I order this PALM TX is will arrive refurbished. Please tell me if I will receive a NEW or REFURBISHED TX is I order this PALM TX from Amazon.  Anybody???? Your 2cent is going to make this decision for me, so any help is appreciated regarding my question.

One of the black ink cartridges never worked, smearing and gaps on page.  The other printed ok for limited number of pages then stopped printing.  Customer service WAS responsive but wanted me to go through extensive troubleshooting and cleaning procedures on print head, and also suggested soaking cartridge in hot water?!  Really - troubleshooting a cartridge???  Swapping another brand and it works fine, so no thanks messing with my perfectly functioning printer.  After a back and forth about 9 messages I surrender!  You keep my money, I keep your worthless cartridges and I write your well-deserved one star review.

Do not buy this twitchy piece of junk.First of all, the printer head failed within two weeks.  Trying to talk to the Lexmark customer service people (in India, of course) was akin to banging my head against the wall.  After about an hour on the phone with them, they finally confirmed what I already knew from online reviews:  the printer head was junk.  They sent a replacement free of charge.Next, I started to notice that the printer would not come out of hibernation on its own when a job is sent from a computer on the network.  When this happens, the only way I have found to get a job to go through is to restart the printer.  Several times, it has taken me 30 minutes or more to get one single sided document to print.  Poured over the settings on all 3 computers on the network, and still experience this random malfunction on each one.  I once again called customer service, and after an hour of troubleshooting they had no advice for me.  I indicated that I wanted a new printer, which they denied.Horrible customer service.  Buggy, twitchy software. Buy it if you have time to coax it into printing every time you want something simple done, otherwise stay FAR FAR AWAY from this piece of junk.

Its is Good Stamp. Mine came with very poor quantity of ink. and by the it could be better though. Quality of the ink or the mechanic system could be better. and giving the two star because of the ink issue.
Blurry! I've never had a blurry calendar before in my life. Pitiful. The stars are for the Hubble's efforts. I would not recommend it.

I bought this chair back in January of this year and it started out okay, but slowly fell victim to what most computer chair do(at least for me). The seat plate, it's seem to always be the first thing to go on any computer chair and so I contacted the company since it's still under warranty. I received everything alright, so customer support was decent enough. Well it's only been a couple of months and the seat plate is already bad. I still could contact the company and have another one sent out, but at this point I don't think it would help. I'm not sure why the weld is so weak on every seat plate.I even had a chair weight rated up to 1000lbs(stationary weight), but even that did the same. So I'm not sure what to purchase for a chair anymore, beside trying to make my own(I don't have tools to do so). The other issue with this chair is its less then a year old and has many issue. The wheels don't roll well(yes I know carpet doesn't help) the seat cushion is flat, it creaks, and is really uncomfortable after a couple of hours. Don't buy this chair, save your money.

I knew I liked LAMY nibs, so I didn't bother reading the reviews for this product. Serves me right, as the reviews saying only one nib is included when it's advertised as five nibs were right. Now I have to deal with the hassle of returning the nib.

This is a good chair with one glaring flaw. The seat height is set via a clamping mechanism consisting of eight, 1" x .6" inch "stopper rubbers" made of a type of soft, rubber tubing. (5/16" ID) The manual states that the stopper rubbers should be changed as an entire set (8) "if you see any cracking or damage". I noticed some cracking (see photo) within 9 months of purchase during light use (2-4 hours/wk) and I only weigh 180lbs. I just found out from the manufacturer that replacements cost $6.95 ea ($55.60 for a set of 8) plus shipping of $40. I paid approx. $100 for the chair which means I would essentially need to re-up the original purchase price every year just for maintenance. Several Amazon reviewers suggested using fuel hose from an auto parts store and I'm currently investigating that avenue... most hoses with the correct measurements appear to be $1-$5/foot range so the price is definitely better. The original stopper rubbers appear to be made of a more "squishy" rubber... possibly a vinyl or PVC blend. If I find something that works well, I'll try to post it for those who find themselves in the same boat as me. If not, I'll ditch this one and try another suggestion, purchase a highly-rated "astronomy" chair.
I didn't even want to add a star. Heading states that it is compatible with clt-y404s, whereas it didn't even print 10 pages, stating that toner is not matched. DON'T RECOMMEND TO ANYONE. DON'T BUY.

I was super super excited to receive this package. When it arrived I ran to go get it. Everything was fine the Amazon carrier had delivered it nicely on my porch. I ran inside to open it and to my surprise the packet the markers comes in was broken and nasty and looked like it had been kicked around on some rocks. I was extremely upset and I typically am not a fan of writing reviews but this is super unacceptable. The markers itself work and they write well. They’re just y’know covered in some dust and dirty. I have no ideas who did this to the package. It arrived well inside the Amazon bag so it wasn’t the fault of a bad Amazon driver leaving it wherever. The markers work well so I’ll probably be keeping them and cleaning them with a wet towel cause I hate the feeling is dirt. This might not happen to all so don’t be discouraged cause honestly the markers are great. (I’d buy the others before this one though, wayyy prettier) oh wait I take it all back. I hadn’t taken all the markers out and now that I have taken them out the black one is broken!! My desk is also now full of dirt and I’m upset.

This pen didn't work for me.I'm a fountain pen beginner. I followed the directions. But no matter which way I stored the pen (nib down, nib up, horizontal) the pen bled all over my fingers and the page. I had to throw it away.It may be user error. But this pen was rated as good for beginners. But for me, as a beginner, it didn't work out.
Wish I had read the reviews! I bought these for school supplies...what a joke
Unfortunately I did not look at reviews before  my purchase,  otherwise I would not have tried this product. Yellow color overtakes the pictures. This is a terrible product. Buy cheap Get cheap.

I never review products. I don't know if the boxes somehow got wet, or if they're just really cheap, but they are ripping as I'm stacking them on top of each other. I only have some sweaters in the medium boxes, but the force of putting them against the other boxes is puncturing the sides and corn of the boxes. I'm delivering stacking them... I'm very scared for them to be hurdled into a moving truck by movers and trekked across the country. I think I will have to buy sturdying, large boxes to put them in since I'm on a time constraint.

12 Sheet Capacity? This thing can't even staple three pages together. I am a teacher and tried using this to staple my comments to graded essays. It just DOES NOT WORK. I actually wrote the company and sent them back my stapler to see if something was wrong. They kindly sen me 3 staplers. Now I have THREE staplers that don't work. Frankly it is dangerous; it sends the staple straight into the sheets but never successfully bends the staple, so it is pointy and sticking out. I've had to manually bend the staples myself (no easy task, and considerably slows my grading process) to avoid pricking my students' fingers! Nano Paper Pro should be ashamed to still be selling this faulty product. Wish I could give it zero stars.
I didn't read the reviews or the lb. weight. This product is a waste of money and why would we want something we can print on regular paper and tear easily anyway?

The concept of the bill pay book is good, but the paper is not strong enough to withstand monthly review and filing. Back cover ripped off after 3 months of infrequent use and inner pockets are also ripping. Due to the size of the pockets, they cannot be repurposed for a 3 ring binder, unless all paper is folded and then filed.

I'm not going to be cliche' and give this a one star rating. Truly it deserves 2 stars. This printer is kind of like a Ferrari. When she runs, it's a beautiful thing, but alas, she's always in the shop. I truly hate this printer now.

These do not seem to be authentic. I have used this brand purchased elsewhere. I am sorry I missed the return window.I will never purchase from this supplier again. These pens leak very bad. REALLY NO STARS!

WHY can't I give  Z E R O  stars?  Bought 2 LD © Remanufactured Ink Cartridge Replacements, BLACK & COLOR, one each for next needed replacement and another SET for the other printer in our home.  Soon enough current/resident cartridge in wife's printer failed.  Replaced with BLACK cartridge.  Printed 6 pages and started showing printer errors.  Could not CANCEL  or  DELETE in printer queue without turning printer OFF.  Took BLK cartridge out,  wiped interfaces and installed.  Same results !!!  Took cartridge to my printer,  FOULED my printer TOO.  Error messages and undelete-able nor CANCELlable print spooler files UNLESS turn off & ON.  Found 2nd bag of BLK & CLR cartridges and saw that product markings are SAME as failed item.  Installed "new" (remanned)  Hope this one last more than 6 pages.  Gave my (other provider) 'working' cartridge in my printer to my wife for her printer, AT LEAST I won't have to mess with her printer,  JUST FIGHT with my printer IF this cartridge goes bad.  ...................  "You GET what you PAY for!"

I ordered an astronomy seat and received this. Are you kidding? This must be a joke or surely, at best, a mistake. I need to review my 10 year old Prime membership. This was one of many holiday screw-ups from Amazon.

Everything arrived that was supposed to but the package was not marked do not bend.  At some point the package was bent half and both folders have a crease in them.  If it were not for the fact my son loves mario and wants to use everything in school I would return the folders, but since he does not want to give them up the review will have to due.  I would just say think twice about ordering folders because they may not arrive how you would want them.

This review focuses on a pitfall into which I fell during purchase, rather than the quality of the product.I needed to replace my stock of HP Premium Plus paper and using that as my starting point, I made mu purchase.On attempting to use the paper in my HP Photosmart C4680, I discovered after much frustration and paper wastage, that the paper now being packaged under this description has been changed in it's weight, it was 75lb. and is now 80lb. This paper is too heavy for my printer and will not feed.The package is marked "Works with ALL INKJET PRINTERS. I have to report that it doesn't!I had assumed that the new-look packaging contained the same product by description. I did not anticipate that I should read the very small print.Bad marketing at my expense.

works but not as explained...needs a constant power supply to view video door bell.  I was going to return this for "Ring" to setup with Alexa but decided to keep it after they wanted to charge me for shipping it back to them and a restocking fee of 15-20%Forget that!  I'll keep it, $100-something loss  is worth writing a review to let others know to beware.

I purchase this paper thinking I was going to be able to use it with my inkjet printer, as it was very unclear in the description. This paper is made for SUBLIMATION INK ONLY, this is NOT going to work with you inkjet printer at all. I thought I would try anyway (to see if at least it could be used as normal paper) and the normal ink just bleeds all over it.I had never heard about sublimation ink before, and after looking it up, it became clear I was not going to buy any equipment to be able to use this paper. It is pretty expensive. I might as well just buy the proper paper for my printer.Anyway, I asked around and finally found somebody that owns a little sublimation printer. I learned that you can actually buy sublimation ink and fill refillable cartridges to convert your normal printer. So we met to try to print some design on shirts (this was my initial project). The paper comes in a clear plastic bag with a sticker on it that tells you which side to print on, so you better not remove it from there. It feels like normal paper, both sides looks the same. You also get instructions with the temperatures and pressing time you need for different materials. The instructions says the material of the shirts has to be 100% polyester or it won't stick to it (so no cotton).We did not have a heat press, so we used an iron as directed. I do not know what went wrong, but it did not work. The design did not print very neatly, and when trying to transfer, some of it just did not stick to the shirt.The last paragraph on the instructions says that you can not return the product. Again, I did not know what I was buying and I am not sure if I did something wrong, but it really did not work. I will use this paper to write on it, I guess. The quality is not very good and I was not impressed at all. If you are looking for something thinking you are going to be able to use this to make shirts or anything else, I would keep looking. If you found this review helpful, please click on the button below. Thank you for reading.**Disclaimer: I received this product for free or at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I have not been monetarily compensated for my review and my thoughts are completely genuine and 100% my own. I have personally used this product and tried my best to reflect my experience with the product so you can make a more informed purchasing decision.**

Please note that you will need the 1KG weight to calibrate the 2KG scales, NOT 100g as mentioned elsewhere. It's an automatic calibration, so I don't know of a way to calibrate it with a different weight.The scales are not accurate as advertised. I mistakenly bought a 100g weight (also from Smart Weigh) as other reviews refer to a 100g weight for calibration (this is perhaps required  for a different scale, as Amazon will often lump reviews for different models of the same product together). On a flat, stable and level surface the 100g calibration weight is reported to weigh between 100.2 and 100.5g, i.e. it will report different weights for the same calibration weight. There is very little point in the scale showing 1/10g increments if it is not capable of accurately reporting them.Not recommended.
I'd give it negative stars if I could. Only half of the product arrived, and its TINY! Dont waste your time or money.
Would not work in my Cannon 2520. Tried all there solutions with no success. Only reason for even two stars was Amazons help and refund.

There was nothing wrong with the product, but I couldn't get it to work with Win 8.1 The company (Clickers4sale) was very good about the return and refund.The one star is only because the product wouldn't work with Win 8.1.

First bought this product last year and was very happy with those envelopes. The original order came as shown in the advertising pictures on the product page... nice quality envelopes in a nice box. Same red product box as shown. Used them up, so I reordered, expecting the same product. Why wouldn't I? Sadly,  what I received this time wasn't even close!This time, what I received was exactly what you see in pictures I've attached to the review. First, no product box at all. Just a pile of loose envelopes in bubble wrap, shipped in a plain Amazon Bag...no product box, nor Amazon shipping box.Even worse, the envelopes are not the same either. They may or may not be the same weight of paper, though they feel lighter weight. The flaps for closing are about half the size of the prior envelopes, and the one I pulled out had almost NO adhesive on it at all. The interior privacy markings were also of a different pattern including the mfgr name now, and less privacy marking overall as well. IOW, They look nothing like the pictures on the product page. I could live with the cheap haphazard packaging, but for the envelopes themselves to be completely different and of lesser quality...this is just sad.Give how the product has changed to a much lower quality envelope, combined with lack of packaging, and haphazard shipping, this product listing is at best, misleading...and bordering on bait and switch. Returning Immediately!
I can’t give one star. It’s the wrong size, I ordered 2mm and recueversca 1mm. The ink is dried up and unusable. Nonreturnable item.

3 of the 4 boxes are in great condition - hood size, sturdy, and stack-able. 1 of the 4 boxes arrived with a broken lid. I can't stack on that piece, and the broken plastic area is sharp/ can cut. That lid also doesn't close securely because it's broken.The quality of the other 3 boxes is great, but because one is broken, I can't give 5 stars.

Like many have said Samsung have p imped  their customer service out to HP and they are useless. The printer prints good though. The wifi and wifi apps for Mac and iOS suck.God help you if you are trying to switch wireless networks and only have a Mac.There are more iOS devices than computers, you would think they would make an app that wasn't useless, but they dont. It looks like it was made for iOS 3 and never updated.Sir Carl Jr gives Zero stars out of five. Using this feels like using some cheap Chinese product from some company that puts out cheap crap for people to figure out on their own, not Samsung, supposedly a respected company.I would not buy again.

There is basically no scent to these pencils.  Especially after the wrapper is taken off for a bit, the scent is gone.  Disappointed. I gave it 2 stars only because it works as a pencil, but that's it.

This is a great little printer, but good luck connecting it to your wireless network in Linux. I'm no Linux expert, so if you know your way around Linux decently you may be OK. I'm giving it one star because I tried a probably five different ways to connect and no dice. I know it's possible, but it requires some skills. Customer support will not support wireless for Linux. Getting the printer up and running with drivers is pretty straightforward.
The back was broken off out of the box. NOT HAPPY! This is the VERY first low review I have ever given.
This is a Christmas gift.  Unable to rate.
I'd give this zero stars if I could. The ink leaked all over and made a mess and printed horribly. I'll NEVER buy these again and I highly suggest no one else ever does either

The product worked well randomly for about two weeks (off and on) and after that, it basically stopped working completely. When I considered returning the product, it was too late.Performance is completely inconsistent. If the software worked with the product the way it should, it would be a great product. I would not recommend this to anyone until the manufacturer fixes the defects/discrepancies.According to other reviewers who were in contact with the manufacturer, it works best with an Ethernet cable, but if two options (Ethernet and USB) are provided they both should work the same (or this manufacturer recommendation should be noted in the instructions/manual).Other reviewers with smaller companies mentioned not running into any issues. There is a possibility that if you have a company with maybe five employees it will work for you, but if that's the case there are also free alternatives (like apps) for smaller companies.

I have worked with cutting plotters before, but never with this brand.Despite the description, the drivers do not work with a Mac.  The plotter requires a RS232 serial interface which none of the computers I own have (including two Macs and four PCs.)  The quick start guide is vague and not up-to-date with the latest operating systems.  There is no hard copy of the manual, and I was only allowed to access the manual included on the install CD after I installed the drivers by using the RS232 adapter I was required to buy.Once I got the drivers installed, I registered the plotter online and got the voucher code to activate the included software (GreatCut.)  However, when I attempted to use the code to activate GreatCut, the software will not accept the code sent to me directly by GCC.I have had this plotter for more than a week, and as of right now I have not been able to use it due to vague instructions, missing equipment, inaccessible user manuals, and shoddy software. If/when I ever get this chunk of junk working, I will update this review.

The product's construction is fine and I like that it folds really flat.However, like other reviews have stated, this product is too small for large books, contrary to the product image.  Normally I wouldn't rely in the product image to determine the product's suitability, but the product description was also woefully lacking with details.  In the worst case, it will hold a book no more than 1" in thickness assuming that you need to hold up a book opened to page 1.  Thus, this product is nearly useless unless you need to hold up a magazine or a copy of the White Pages.Another reviewer stated that you could flip this product around and use the support legs instead to hold a thick book.  That option is a dirty, ineffective hack because it's unstable and the stand will fall forward when a book (that wouldn't fit in normally) is placed on the backwards stand.

It is totally a deception, play trick on the description,Lamy T10 Ink Ink Cartridges Black (20 Cartridges) 4 x 5by Lamy4.8 out of 5 stars  30 customer reviewsOur Price: EUR 1.40All prices include VAT.This means  (20 Cartridges) 4 x 5 for 1.4 euro, but actually there are only 5.

I have a low pile - very thin, maybe 1/4" - carpet in my office. This seemed thick and had some good reviews. 3-4 weeks later, it's already cracked. Now, even standing in certain places cracks it further. I do not recommend.Can't seem to find a good one...maybe 160 lbs. and an office chair are just too much for these things...

Permanent "printer failure" error with these cartridgesI was hopeful after reading positive reviews, but my HP Officejet 6600 now has a permanent "printer failure" error when the cartridges are loaded. I have tried all HP troubleshooting and still have the error. So, I have no functional printer after installing these replacement cartridges.

September 2018.  The containers are well enough with straight sides for files to fit in nicely.  The reason I didn't give it a better rating is because the lids are lightweight, flimsy and non-stackable where I wouldn't want to stack more than two together.  I don't think these lids can take the weight of 3 stacked together.  And even worse, they do not lock into place when stacked which is a major disappointment.  The boxes slide around easily on top each other when stacked which is a ridiculous feature for file boxes.  The lids are not as advertised.  The lids I received are from a different mold, having no inner track for the bottom of boxes to sit.  Heaven forbid someone bumps into them and all your top boxes slide off and fall over and your files spill out.  I'd rather pay more money if they would improve the lids by making them stronger, more durable and stackable.  In using plastic boxes for decades, I find it's the lids that usually break first.  Unfortunately, a customers who purchased these in 2016 and 2017 received well made locking lids so people are buying this based on their 5 star rating.  For my purchase, they obviously went downhill in quality and used a different manufacturer for the lids, cutting corners and making this a less than desirable purchase.  I would prefer to return this item but it's past the window, so I'm stuck with it.  I advise people to choose differently.
Disappointed. In the description it states is a lot of 12, but only received 1!!! Total Rip Off. Giving 1 star because it won't let me submit without selecting one.

UPDATE.  I'm having a lot of difficulty getting a response from Grandstream's tech support.  I have a ticket open.  Every time we have a problem they respond with questions and when I answer them no new responses come forth.We have not been able to get these phones to work consistently.  The longest streak we have had was 28 days without problems.  But more typically the problems surface every week or two.The problems have been particularly acute with the newest firmware.  With the new firmware, the phone doesn't appear to save the login information for each subaccount.You can read my old review below.  I've lowered my rating from 2 stars to 1.-------------------When it works, it works well.  Unfortunately it frequently doesn't work.  I've been having a one-way-audio problem on it, off-and-on, for the past month.  I've also had problems getting it to register the accounts correctly.I reached out to Grandstream support within a week of receiving the devices and I have yet to hear from them!Since the problems were intermittent, I kept thinking that they were resolved.  But every 1 to 2 days the problems would resurface.  I regret that I didn't return these phones when I could.  Buyer beware!Grandstream, I hope this will motivate you to respond to my Grandstream Customer Support Ticket.UPDATE:  After posting this review, Grandstream did respond to me.  They had me update the firmware in the phone.  Hopefully this will resolve the problems I've had with it.  I will update this review again once I've had some time to test the new firmware.

I'm about to order my third Commodore II chair, just about a month shy of three years since I bought my current one.  That's about how many years I get out of them before they die.  Earlier today I came into my office, took a seat in my chair... and immediately sank to the floor as the gas strut failed.  That's what happened to the last one too and it's not that I'm overloading them either.  The chairs are rated to 350 lbs. and I'm barely 280, so well within the limitations.  Still, these are the only chairs affordable enough for me that also include a back and headrest tall enough for my 6'2" body to lean back in and be properly supported.  Heck, the number of naps I've taken in these chairs makes the cost per year of use pretty reasonable, though I do wish they'd last longer.EDIT 03/30/21: About to order my 4th chair.  This last one lasted a whopping 9 months from unboxing to today.  I purchased it in Nov of 2018 but didn't unbox it because we were moving at the end of 2019.  Then Covid hit and that delayed things a year so I unboxed it last June.  As of this week it sinks halfway to the floor every time I sit in it.  These chairs are rated for 350 lbs but I'm just 285.  I think the ratings are just optimistic baloney and not based on actual tests or data.

After reading many great reviews on Amazon and other sites, I was excited about this purchase.  I was happy to find an inexpensive laser printer that is small and wireless. Unfortunately, I received a defective one. I set it up according to the directions. It immediately started emanating smoke. I returned it and am trying to decide if I should order a new one to give it one more try.

I bought 3 of these bulbs each one only lasted about two weeks each.  going to buy a new T V.  the Co. was 5 star the product stinks or no good,  I have bought others in the past and they lasted longer ,

Yes, this product is much less expensive than the outrageous price HP charges for their  "genuine" HP ink.  Here is what to expect.  When you first install these on your HP printer, depending on model, you will receive a cautionary message about using other than HP genuine ink.  we ignored this message of course.  After installation, the colored images printed with Starink were not very true to life.  In fact, they were considerably off and we noted some runs in the initial pages we printed.  The runs mostly cleared up after a few pages were printed, but the colors were still off.  The black works fine for printing text.  We didn't mind the colors being off considering the savings.  Here is where I have a real problem.  Starink claims their product is "high capacity."  However, the colored ink cartridges ran out rather quickly and we printed far fewer pages than with the HP cartridges.  That doesn't mean we're going back to HP ink, but be aware these alternative products won't necessarily give you the quality or service they claim.  I will likely look into some other brands.  It's baffling that this product received so many 5-star ratings.

I wish there were a zero star option for this product. The description states "wood" as material, which led me to believe that this is solid pine - given that pine is a very inexpensive wood, the price seemed about right since this cabinet is made in China. Well, the panels turned out to be made of the very cheap looking particle board with some synthetic material emulating pine texture glued on the exposed sides. I mean, I understand that technically there is "wood" in a particle board, but stating that the product is made of wood and omitting the details looks like trying to intentionally mislead the customers.Regarding the assembly. 14 panels are totally ok, but 196 (!) hardware parts? (yes, 196 - my boyfriend counted just out of curiosity). We both love assembling furniture and are not easily scared by the amount of work involved. But this one definitely crossed the line and is going back to the seller.And last but not least - the seller doesn't make it easy to return the product once you unpacked it. Everything is very tightly packed, and it takes quite a while to fit all those boards, hardware parts, and countless styrofoam bars and plastic liners back into the box.

How this  an be given a 5 star rating by some is beyond me . It does not write properly . I bought it for my marking . There is no way that the kids would be able to read and understand my comments . Just pointless !

Ink came in. I installed on my machine and the black ink cartridge does not print. Colors work great. Tried running cleaning cycles and test copies to no avail. Won't be buying again, was on a deadline with a budget and now have to seek other options to finish my project. Should have been leery of the fact that most reviews have a tag line that "I received this product at a discount or for free." Buyer beware!

Product was shipped in an envelope, not a box, so it was damaged en route. The pieces of broken plastic off of the ribs by the hinges fell out of the package.Difficult to close, it does not align perfectly, the top lid appears to bow inward. When closed, the corners stay open and leave 1/8" gap at the top and bottom.  Would not trust this product in the field if rain is near.The inner sleeves do not hold papers in place, they tend to slide out and get jammed between top and bottom componentsby the hinges, making closing even more difficult.The sticker, yeah I knew it was gonna be a problem from the other reviews, haven't made the attempt to remove it yet..For the money, you would expect better build quality and better shipping care.  Not happy with this item, and I do not recommend.

Too short to use as a standing desk (I am 5'3). No way to lock it in place, so the desk rolls away from you while attempting to use. Meanwhile, if you actually want to roll it from room to room, the wheels drag on the hardwood floor.-Adding to the above review. The height adjuster does not stay secure - abruptly drops and everything on the desk goes flying off. I have attempted to contact the seller now multiple times in order to get instructions to return this VERY poorly make product and they have not responded at all. Incredibly frustrated. Have never been as disappointed in an amazon order as I am right now.

I realize that I probably misread the product description but this scale is TINY and basically useless :(Edit: After reading the above review, the company contacted me and offered me a larger scale free of charge. Excellent customer service!!!

I do not think this is genuine Platinum Carbon ink! It is not waterproof and smears. I didn't bother reading the reviews because I've been using Platinum Carbon for years, always painted over it with water colors and know the product. Wow was I surprised at how poorly it performed. The photo of the bottle that says "Carbon Ink" in large letters is what the genuine Platinum Carbon Ink looks like
They do not work in my printer. I have tried all the suggestions listed on the reviews but it doesn't work at all. Very disappointing.

I purchased this thinking it would be great to have on the arm of my couch so that I wouldn't have to rely on a coffee table, as I don't have one. It didn't fit by itself, so I tried what another reviewer had said she had done-I tried velcro. That didn't work, either! I have attempted to give this thing away three times now and it keeps coming back to me because it hasn't fit my friends couches, either. The reason I gave it two stars, rather than one is because it is well made and the multiple pockets would be great if it could be used.

Leather was such bad quality it looked and felt like spray painted cardboard. Fake stone, it seriously just looks like a rock painted with nail polish. Damaged cover. Smells toxic. Dye on the outside of the cover rubbed off immediately upon ANYTHING touching it.It stained my blankets and sheets when I unboxed it on my bed. I moved it to my dresser to deal with the blanket and it stained my dresser. I moved it to a hand towel to deal with the dresser stain and the hand towel was stained too. I just threw it back into the box and found out the stain won't come out of anything it touched.The rubbed off color severely stained my hands (my picture couldn't quite show how bad it really was), which wouldn't wash off (i washed my hands several times throughout the day for over a week until it was finally gone) and my skin felt like it was burning until I managed to get the dye off.It doesn't say anywhere in the item description what was used to dye the cover, so I have no idea what the hell it is. I don't know if the dye is toxic or poisonous or if I'm allergic to it. I almost had to go to urgent care to get this crap off of me.Whatever the other reviewers got is NOT what I got!

Bought as a gift (on the grounds of positive reviews) but found to be unsuitable. We are is used to using a Bradford puzzle solver, where the screen allows about six lines of text to be visible. The display of this Seiko only gives a very limited amount of info on one line. When you are looking at lists, this is annoying and inefficient.The font is large, but often not particularly clear - the display of some letters tends to break up. Only spent 5 minutes with it, then re-packed it for return. Have not explored its various functions, so cannot comment otherwise

Contrary to all the rave reviews for this pen,I would not buy it again. I purchased two pens at once, and both pens leak ink on the top of the nib, this then collects in the top cap of the pen, when the top cap is on the pen. The pen continues to leak ink even when not in use. I am constantly cleaning out the top cap.  The pen is not a very smooth writer, the nib is scratchy when writing on paper. I am using Pilot cartridges.I understand this is an entry level pen,but, ink should not leak, when the pen is not in use.Considering this is happening with both pens, there is obviously a design flaw or poor quality control.I have a Cross Fountain pen that cost $25.00 and it does not have any of the issues that the Pilot Metropolitan has, and the Cross is a much smoother writer.

I like that the doorbell on the phone is nice and loud. What I don't like is the video display on the phone. It's low resolution make the picture/video look grainy, hard to recognize who is being displayed. I hope they upgrade the display in the future. If they do, this phone would rate 5 stars. All the other features like voice caller ID are great. But remember, the selling point and the reason we purchased this phone was for the "VIDEO" component. That should have been of higher quality.

Ordered two, one arrived broken. Follow all the negative reviews on this, I should not have ordered these anyway. Not durable even for light filing. Not sturdy, wobble when moved, easily breakable.  Absolutely not worth the current price (now $54!-I paid $35 & still too much, even with the file box!). These file carts are worthless junk!  I'm glad the broken one was not replaceable. I returned both and got a refund and ordered the metal frame ones from another seller. The metal ones got better reviews for durability. Hopefully that is true for the metal frame file carts.Update: I returned and replaced these plastic carts with metal ones. Much better, more sturdy. I use standard letter/legal size file tote boxes (approx 18"L x 14 1/4"W x 10 7/8"H), they fit well, don't need the expensive Advantus one. Worth spending approx $40 for a metal cart and buying a file tote box separately.

If this product is intended to store regular 8.5 x 11" paper, it was poorly designed to do so because the documents protrude outside of the folders and organization tabs. you would be thumbing through the pages of your stored documents to uncover the tabs that are designed to create order and easily locate files.  Your documents also become mangled and damaged on the exposed edge from repeated use or searching through this shoddily crafted accordion filer. I don't know how this product doesn't have a worse rating because of this poor design.  Buy this if you want to organize your postcard collection, but avoid if you want to store actual documents printed on normal paper size.

I purchased this as a present for my bridesmaids, and I am so disappointed. I wish I read the reviews, because the stapler does not work! It get jammed every every every time. Beware of a horrid product.
As another reviewer mentioned, these seem used. They’re covered in scratches. Can’t even read the  Guadalupe card, it’s in Spanish. Not impressed.  Sending back for a full refund.

Unfortunately we bought these replacement ink cartridges early and by the time we needed them the return window had expired.  They are not compatible with the Canon MP 560 as described.  They fit the device, no problem but the printer operating system refuses to recognize them as compatible.  Lesson learned always check immediately on receipt.  Dear Amazon why don't you have a zero stars option?

What a rip-off!! Wish there were a ZERO rating. If you read many of the questions, you'll note most of these and negative reviews happened AFTER some HP update that these ink cartridges didn't get, apparently. Unfortunately, I purchased at the end of March, before all of the feedback here; didn't need to install a replacement until today -early October.This is based on a 4-pack product - don't know what the 10-pack product is. Problem with myCartridge replacements 952XL for HP OfficeJet Pro 8720 - yellow doesn't work - haven't tried others. Keep getting error messages re: defective, malfunction, etc.. No way to continue. Unit will not color print at all. Naturally, these replacements ordered in late March along with NEW printer, so I wouldn't be caught short or imprisoned by the hp high price replacement program. And, of course, I'm way past the 30 day free return. I note that these are 'currently unavailable' at Amazon, so maybe they're out of business.I don't know if it's due to a software update after April 2019 as some posts are saying, but for me, the yellow cartridge replacement does not work. I tried wiping the contact clean a number of times, removing and reinstalling a number of times, and restarting my HP 8720 a number of times to no avail. My printer will not continue with one of these ink cartridges in it.

I don't give a bad review if a couple of screws are missing, or the box the item comes in is torn...or even if my order is a couple of days late.  This is a bad review of a really, really, really cheap product.  The construction is cheap, and it is NOT sturdy by any definition.  The last table like this that I bought was, admittedly, a number of years ago, but that's kinda the point; it lasted for about 15 years.  This table might not even last a month!  I would not buy this again, and I do NOT recommend it.  Ya get what ya pay for...

I gave this a poor rating, because if you try to use it without the little plastic cap that goes over the eraser, it is impossible to push the eraser/lead advance clicker far enough to get the lead to advance.  This is especially the case once the eraser has lost a mm or two of height due to use.  I personally think this is completely stupid, as I pretty much lose that plastic cap the first time I use a pencil like this and then it is so frustrating to use for the rest of it's life that it probably just ends up in the trash.  It's really annoying to constantly have to put an eraser cap on and off and keep track of it and hope it doesn't fall off in your bag.  For a company that prides itself on smart design this is unacceptable.
Short and most useful review:Do not but this one even this is the last one in planet.
I received the wrong item. The item states it is stars. I got a package of ladybugs, bees, etc.

If I could leave negative stars I would. This was a nightmare to put together. The directions are not helpful. You basically have to guess you way through them. The wheels stick so it doesn't move as easy as it should. The side and front drawer had to be hit several times to get them to close. The wood panels are nice wood. The screws have a nice holder, but the circle bits that hold the the screws in place at the head are cheaply made. Several of them broke and the top drawer is not held securely because on one side all of them broke. This is one of the worst things I've ever purchased!

Took a number of non-roads shown as roads in this atlas and almost became stranded once. Also missed some interesting roads not shown in this atlas. I later reviewed these errors in the other brand atlas of the same size and found them ALL to be correct in that atlas. I continually find errors in the California, New Mexico, and Nevada versions of the DeLorme atlases. I have since converted my usage to the other brand.

The Artline Secure Marker is a complete waste! In fact ZERO STARS would be a more appropriate rating. I've had mine for two weeks and used it to cross out parts of approximately 15-20 prescription labels and now it's completely run out of ink (regardless how much I shake it). You'd be much better off using a new SHARPIE KING SIZE PERMANENT MARKER. They have very thick ink that covers the type easily and makes it unreadable!

Very expensive printer to fail after 5 months.  The black ink stops printing without any error messages.  The ink cartridge has been replaced.  Googling this printer returns innumerable responses about this problem with the quote "Lexmark is aware of the print head issue".Update:Called their support line:- Very short wait- did speak with a person from India- Ran thru the basics "lets print a test page"- Very quickly determined the printhead was bad and they Fed Exed a new printhead to my house which arrived 4 days later.No not a great printer, however their support on the issue deserves 5 stars.
Extremely poor quality.  I would give it no stars if that option was available.  Waste of money.  Amazon should not provide such a piece of junk.

I will never order these AGAIN! Have ruined my printer!!  I ordered these on the 13th of January and received them within a couple days.  Just installed them last night 2/3/16 and it ran its cycle and when I went to print, it was all globed with ink all over the printer paper so I opened up my printer and there was ink everywhere. I have the HP photosmart 3210 printer. So by trying to save some money by buying this ink now I will be spending about $300-$400 to replace the damaged printer!!  I will make sure to pass this review on to other sites too.

I'm not really happy with this password book. It's the binding, you can't easily flip pages without having to fiddle with the pages bindings alignment. You try to close it and the binding is stuck, you gotta adjust it. That's my major issue with this. The next is that there isnt tabs for each individual letter, there are 2 letters on a tab. Like A-B is one tab. The only reason I'm even giving 2 stars is because the materials and printing is good, the binding method is terrible which makes it unusable for me. The binding is "Wire-O" binding. It would be better if it was just a continuous spiral coil bound. I will just go back to using a "telephone and address book" and deal with its issues of using it as a password book.

If I was able to give zero stars I would... product arrived in a ridiculously big plastic contraption, and both pens were broke. Pens felt very cheap compared to my other “zebra” brand pens. Will never purchase again.

If you are looking for a money counter in order to save time I would absolutely avoid this one. It simply does not work. I have attempted to use two separate counters and they both were very poor. They would jam continuously and the worst part is count inaccurately. The first one I received would only power on when it felt like it which might've been a bad connection but it also jammed and counted incorrectly. I decided to return it and order another as sometimes you get a lemon. Well the next one I received powered on consistently but would jam even more frequently. I ended up having to count all the bills by hand. When I brought the bills into the bank the one time I struggled with getting though all the counting, the count was completely wrong.This thing is a piece of junk. I don't normally write reviews but this thing is that bad.

The listing is for Montblanc 105194, which is a permanent iron gall ink, rated as safe for checks and other documents. It's water resistant when dry, so it's also great for addressing parcels. It has a lovely deep color.  The photo of the box in thelisting also clearly indicates "permanent for documents".  This ink has recently been replaced by a weaker non-permanent ink, which is not safe for documents and washes off if gottenwet. Reviews of the new ink are unfavorable when compared to the old version. I was hoping to secure a bottle of the oldformula before supplies dried up. I trusted the clearly stated product number, and photos of the packaging.  What I got wasMontblanc 109204 (the new version) which came in different packaging than shown.  I'm rating it so low not because the ink is actually bad, but because it's not what was advertised. I'll be returning it. It's almostmore trouble to do so than it's worth, but I can''t see keeping a bottle of ink I know I'll never use.  The seller should updatethe description and images.  Delivery was prompt however.

I am giving these file folders 2 stars strictly because the colors are so pretty but for me, otherwise, these are a total fail. They are extremely thin and flimsy ... much more so than ANY others I have ever had. I planned on re-doing all my many files with these cheerful ones, but just knowing how much many of my files currently hold I can not imagine these holding up with even a moderate amount of use. I just wish I had not gotten excited and opened more than one of the packages before it occurred to me that (imo) the quality is not what I wanted, or I would return them. Ugh.

I was excited to get a whole package of glitter pens. I color  a lot.  Was very disappointed that so many look the same. The pens also aren't free flowing. Have to fight with them.  After seeing so many good reviews I don't understand ,they are junk. Will not rebuy or recommend .

Arrived broken because of poor product materials or packing that won’t hold up to shipping or daily use.  impossible to contact seller to get new lids and instead had to repack and ship back useLess item. Ordered same item about a year ago and that time only one lid arrived broken, so ate the loss.  This time it’s 3 out of four broken lids,,,,, based on my experience and many other reviewer experiences, apparently a product defect or simply poor packaging….but for a customer it’s a no go ….item is made of too brittle plastic

The 5-star reviews must have been submitted in first weeks or months. Look at all the 1 and 2-star reviews with same complaint... The mechanical reset stops flipping back which means the stamp does not get re-inked without pulling and prodding ...plus ink dries out more quickly.

As other reviews who did not receive a discount/given it for free for their review have stated, the back wheels are not able to be attached, the axle is too short to connect the pins which hold the wheels on.
Wish I read the reviews. Very thin and thought I was getting a discounted price after new year.. The price on calendar is 9.99. They have this listed for more money

The cartridges did not work in my Brother printer. They may very well work in other Brother printers and be an excellent value compared to the high cost of Brother cartridges. Unfortunately I had to mark a low rating because I couldn't get them to work at all.

I thought this was a steal for $99 on Black Friday 2 years ago. There's a reason they were practically giving these away. It worked ok out of the box but after about 3 months it lost its driver and I had to delete it from my system (Win7) and re-add it. This seemed to go on every 3 or 4 months. Recently my color toner cartridge lights (all 3) came on which means it's time to change the cartridges. I bought 3 new ones ($150 later) and it kept alarming with a red error light. Once that light comes on there is no way to bypass it to print. Samsung support had me try several things to try to get it to work again but finally gave up and said it needed to be serviced. They also told me it was beyond its 2 yr warranty and I would have to pay for shipping, parts etc. All this after I just paid $150 for toner cartridges. Thankfully I bought the cartridges at Office Depot and they were kind enough to let me exchange them for a new printer instead. I went with a Brother HL-3170 this time. I'll see how it does and write a review on it in a few months. I will never buy another Samsung product again.
The ink disappears within 2 minutes or less, I bought it reading the reviews some said that it stays on for hours , that's a total lie, maybe fake reviews.The ink disappears within minutes.

I'm shocked by the largely positive reviews of this printer.I'm not a big review-writer but was compelled to create an account just to warn people against this printer, which is really, really bad.I'm on my 3rd printer. I've also had the print head replaced twice. I've tried everything I could to get a refund direct from Lexmark, but their strict policy only allows for continued "repairs" until the problem is fixed. In that sense (and in fairness to the Lexmark brand) they're very responsive and try hard to make it right (hence the repeated replacements.) But the problem, it turns out, is that the printers aren't broken. They're just poorly created.The problems:* Routine paper jams* Frequent ink leaks - several times, when printing photos, the paper has come out completely saturated with one color of ink or another.* CONSTANT color issues: when printing photos, colored text, etc., it invariably comes out with discolorations (blue = green, black = gray, etc.)* The touchscreen freezes about 3/4 of the time i use it, requiring a reboot to continue use* The scanning quality seems lower than advertised - always comes through a fuzzy* The print quality - when it DOES print correctly (rare) - is still very low. Not sharp, not vibrant.I'm somewhat computer savvy and have tried EVERYTHING recommended on the site to remedy my problems - updated drivers, firmware, etc. No luck.FYI: I'm using it wirelessly with my new MacBook Pro, so my only thought is some sort of operating system incompatibility, which might explain others' satisfaction with this printer.For me, though, it was a big mistake. And even though I'm on my 3rd, shiny new one, I'm going to buy a different brand of printer, because it's essentially useless.Stay away! If your experience is anything like mine, you will surely regret it.

Bought this off of Woot, but can't seem to leave a review. Assembled the main body of the cabinet and knew at that point this was a loser. Nothing was square and when I went to nail on the rear piece I saw that it wasn't lining up despite my best efforts. I walked away for a day or two, then this morning decided to finish. One out of four screws... ok... keep going. 3rd and 4th drawer same thing... splitting wood. I was so disgusted I took every remaining piece and threw it in the trash bin. Quickly disassembled the rest and put that also in the trash and recycling bin.  There goes $100+ dollars.  I will never purchase another piece of Adeptus anything again.

It started off pretty well, but very soon after purchase it started getting really dry making writing a pain. Every time I use it I have to wet the cartridge to increase the ink flow. Upon the suggestion of a previous review I have now ordered a faber castell loom. I hope that one writes better and I can use all that ink I have amassed.Its a shame because I really like the ergonomics of this pen, its just not a working productEDIT:I had tried the above and also soaked the nib and front bit in soapy water to no avail. So in a last ditch effort to reclaim the pen I tried running a piece of paper through the slit in the nib. There must have been very persistently dried ink there as it now writes smoothly again. I have always stored the pen in horizontal position and used Lamy's own ink, so in my opinion thats not something that should have happened.Regardless, my Faber Castell replacement writes incredibly smoothly and I have my lightweight Lamy back.

I'll see what my left handed son or some of my left handed co-workers think.  However, right now, I'm with that other old dog who can't learn new tricks.  If you learned to write upside down in a right hander's world, don't bother.  If you learned to write as a lefty should have learned, maybe.This is an update after I shared these pens with one of my left handed co-workers.  His opinion was almost identical to mine, and he's a good 20 years younger than me. I guess it's not just us old dogs that don't like thse pens.  This is a 2nd update. I shared these pens with each let hander in my office. That's 4 of us.  Not one of us liked them.  Our ages varied from 30-56. We didn't find them comfortable to hold and all of us felt the ink quality was extremely poor.

THESE ARE NOT MUJI PENS!!! These are KNOCK-OFFS!! I have Muji pens, and I bought these because I saw the photos and thought they were muji. After looking more into the reviews I realized they are not real muji pens. They have a muji tag on them but they are fakes! I bought a real Muji pen in store and the head of the pen is short with the body being a bit slimmer than the fake pen. The fake has a longer head with a thicker body. I received the Veho VFS-002m scanner for Christmas a few days ago, eager to get to work scanning decades of old Instamatic 110 negatives. The Veho VFS-002m is one of only a handful of scanners to include a tray for 110 negatives. It's a pity, because the film holders are this scanner's best attribute. With the bundled Arcsoft scanning software, and using a fairly new Core i5 laptop, scans of 110 and 35mm negatives were both very speedy. People who complained in their reviews that the scans were slow should try putting some money into a faster computer. The scanner itself isn't doing a bit of the processing. In fact, as near as I can tell, it just backlights the image for a photo sensor. The film holder must be manually slid from image to image. Not a deal breaker, especially since it does scan quickly with a fast processor, but it does make lining up the image a little tricky.The main issue is that the image quality that you get in your scans is not good. I have an older, but very high quality Minolta Dimage III scanner which I typically use for 35mm slide and negative scanning. I was hopeful that I'd be getting a scanner which, while maybe not quite as good, would be in the same ballpark - using newer, cheaper technology. Not a chance. Even with relatively large 35mm source material, the Veho VFS-002m only managed mediocre image quality. The lighting is uneven and small details, like faces, are a pixelated mess. Larger details and backgrounds are recognizable, but this isn't scanner which will let you archive your old photos. It's fine for scanning old photos to email or post on Facebook, but the image quality just isn't there to produce acceptable prints. With 110 negatives, the problem is much worse since the source image is about 1/4 the size of 35mm. Faces are barely recognizable blobs of pixels with all detail lost. All other small details get lost as well. As with 35mm sources, the quality is probably good enough to email a picture to family or post online, but it's not nearly good enough to ever allow new prints to be made (not without sacrificing too much in image quality, in my opinion).Basically, this scanner does what it says it will. It's easy to use, mostly because it's so simplistic. The film trays work well enough, but it's a shame they only work in THIS scanner. I guess I was expecting too much considering the price range it falls in, but with no higher grade option available for 110 negatives, it's unfortunate the image quality produced is so bad. For 35mm slides and negatives, there are many more (and better) options from better known companies. They may cost a little more, but the improved quality is probably worth the extra money. If all you want is 35mm scanning, look elsewhere. If you have to scan 110 film, whether this is an option for you will depend on what you want to do with the images. For me, I'm looking to find a way to permanently digitize a lifetime of old photos so they can be shared, cropped and reprinted at will. This scanner just can't do that for me.

I really like the look of these pens. I got one from a dollar store and gave it to my granddaughter. She loved it and uses it all the time. Then my grandson wanted one so I looked to amazon. I saw this set of 8. They look exactly like the one I had. Despite the multitude of negative reviews, which mostly reported gems falling out and things I felt I could fix, I made the purchase. The pens came with all gems attached and I thought all was good. I gave one to my grandson and another to my granddaughter. After a few minutes my granddaughter was asking what that was on the floor. It looked like a giant beetle, but upon closer examination, it was a blob of ink that had been stepped on. It was all over the place. On the couch, all over the floor, on my pants, and the kids feet and clothes. I found it had poured out of the bottom of the pen I gave my granddaughter - the new one from this pack. I confiscated the one I gave to my grandson and quarantined them in the bag they came in. I don't trust them and will probably discard the entire package. The good news is that the ink did come out of almost everything. The suede couch still has stains on it, but we do not have a cleaner to use on it yet. My feelings are that if you really like these pens - invest in a good brand.

Not a well behaved ink. While it performs fairly well on high end paper (Clairefontaine, Rhodia, and Quo Vadis) it is extremely wet and will spread, feather, and bleed on typical copy paper and even mid range notebooks. If you plan to use this ink solely on 80-90gsm paper designed for fountain pens you will be pleased with the very attractive sheen that it produces. You will need to make sure that you gently shake the bottle and mix the very fine gold particles before filling your pen/converter. It would also be wise to gently agitate the ink in the pen prior to writing to achieve a consistent golden sheen while writing. This will only require very gentle agitation by tipping the pen back and fourth a few times before putting the pen to paper. If this ink was $10 a bottle I would have given it 3 stars. At over double that price at many retailers I expect great performance even on lower end paper.
