While the picture on the site shows the Canon Ink box, they came in a plain white box. I went to use them today because three of my cartridges were out of ink. My printer will not recognize them. I went online to see if there was a fix, but had no luck with the suggestions. Upon further inspection of the cartridges, where my previous Canon cartridge has the color name on the cartridge label, these cartridges have Setup. I ordered two sets because the price was good. It appears I'm out my $55. There is a reason they were so cheap! I am past the return and product support dates. I had no idea they wouldn't work, because I didn't need to use them until now. The only reason there is a one star rating is because I couldn't post without giving it at least one star.

Piece of crap. I've been putting furniture together for 20 years and this one is awful.  Instructions are poorly written.  Wood is too hard for flimsy nails provided.  Pieces were cracked in 3 places and of course there's only  customer support Mon-Fri 10-4 and nothing on the weekends.  Nothing is labeled and there are no pilot holes.  In total, 8 pieces were damaged before I even started.  Of course I put it together anyway because now I have a time on full of pieces and have to wait until Monday to call tech support.Will never buy anything from this company again. IKEA has much better quality and instructions, as well as available support if needed.I don't even want to give it one star.

I inherited the HP Photosmart Plus because it was bought for an international visitor days before departure from the US, and the brand-new unit would not work out of the box. We spent hours on it, but could not get it to recognize its own HP ink cartridges! Finally, we called technical support, who ran through a battery of standard issues before concluding that I needed a new print head.We received the replacement print head and promptly installed it. It was of no use. We changed the ink cartridges to the new ones that came with the new print head, and the cartridge tray got stuck in its housing. We could not pull it out.By now, it was too late for the printer to make the international trip, so it was dumped in my hands. After many more hours on the phone, HP sent me a refurbished printer. Now I had a used device after paying for a new one! But it at least worked.A few weeks ago, the ink ran out after we printed a bunch of photos. I swapped all the cartridges with genuine HP cartridges that came along with the replacement printer, and they are not recognized! This dud of a machine is now taking up space on my desk.The only reason I give this unit two stars is because it still performs as a scanner.

Okay, so this device clearly states, "Coin Manager Pro," NOT "Coin Counter." I simply assumed that when one of the coin slots was full, that was an indication that it was correctly counted and ready to be placed in a coin sleeve. WRONG! The slots actually hold more coins than can be held in a coin sleeve, BUT upon further investigation, with a bright light and magnifying glass, there are graduations on the sides of each coin slot that show the monetary amount. However, when I placed $10 worth of quarters in the quarter slot, the stack of quarters was exactly one quarter past the hash mark on the slot, and yes I recounted to be sure. So while this item was not dishonest about what it is, it's still very hard to read and seemed a little inaccurate to boot. I would have given this item a one star if it had called itself a "Coin Counter." Bottom line is that I am returning this item due to the fact it's nearly impossible to easily see count marks on the sides of the slots, and the count marks seemed to be inaccurate as well.

This is the first time I have written a negative review on Amazon.com!  These are inferior when compared to the Avery 5126 labels.  Its very hard to peel off the backing since there is no gripping edge.  Also, when you separate (tear) them down the middle even after multiple creasings (bendings) they do not separate cleanly.  I use a Brother Color Laser MFC-L8900CDW printer for printing purposes.  After printing they readily smear even if they have set out for a day.  MACO needs to re-engineer their labels and bring them up to Avery standards to remain competitive.

Okay so, people complained in the reviews about the smell... but some didn't smell anything, so I bought anyway. As soon as I opened it, I got the strongest whiff of farm animals and poop. So I threw them into the wash, hoping to salvage them, because they smelled so bad I didn't want to touch them to hand wash them. The washing machine bent them all over the place (which didn't surprise me) but worse than that, they still smelled, and so did my washing machine. So I washed them again, and the washer finally got better but they didn't. So I threw them out. People are saying they were too small, too, but I have no idea because I never got to pay attention to them because of the overwhelming smell.

Used 3 colors right out of box.(Light, medium & dark)Size of picture colored. 9" X 6.5"Results:*GLITTER LIMELIGHT C241Non left. Colors scratchy & not good cover or flow.*GLITTER COPPER C2831/2 left. Intermittent scratchy & medium flow.*GLITTER SAPPHIRE C2561/4 Left. Good flow & coverage. Maybe a little fast flow & could be why used so much.I treated myself to 4 different gel pen brands & read reviews before choosing what I bought. I decided to do this test & send the pictures & my review so you could make a better choice. Reason for 2 stars is the cost is way too much for what I believe I'm going to get compared to a lesser priced pen giving me more colors & refills with similar results.

It's not a completely bad chair, but it does have its drawbacks.  I needed a sturdy, cheap chair for a basement office space, and from the pics and reviews this looked like it would work.  Everything arrived perfectly -- no problems with packaging, all of the parts were there, etc., although it had a strange smell to it, but I guess that's to be expected since some of the chair is actually vinyl.  Assembly was not that great of an experience -- some of the instructions were a little misleading, but worse than that, it took an incredible amount of time to get the bolts from the arms to connect through the leather (i think this part is actually leather) and padding to nut.  It was very frustrating -- I really had to play around with it to get it to connect.  Once everything is assembled, the chair is actually quite comfortable.  However, it is cheaply made.  For example, the back rest cushion is actually fairly crooked -- its sewn on and has a noticeable incline looking at it head-on.  The structure of the chair itself seems sturdy, but i have my doubts about the leather lasting for any long period of time -- it's definitely not the highest quality, even for bonded leather.My biggest problem with this chair, and why I gave it 2 stars instead of 3, is actually something that I think is a little dangerous. If you use this chair, be warned that you really should wear shoes that protect the back of your ankles.  I'm sure that sounds strange in a review for a chair, but the metal base is incredibly sharp where it extends over the wheels.  I've knocked the back of my ankles into it a number of times, and it hurt.  A lot.  On one occasion I hit hard enough that it actually drew a little blood.  I'm sure I could put duct take on it to fix the sharpness, but after spending $200 on it, I would think I should expect a chair that isn't trying to hobble me.

See former review to poor performance rate for these cartridges.  Seems to be related to electical contacts not relaying correct info.  Printer would not recognize new cartridge,  error showing cartridge missing or improperly inserted or a new cartridge as empty.

I'm guessing here that everyone who has rated this chair has rated it after very short period of time usage (possibly even within a week). I have absolutely no idea how the ratings are so high. I absolutely NEVER review anything on amazon unless it is a really great product and I'm happy about it, but my experience with this chair has been absolutely egregious and I'm seething while I'm writing this.The chair looks nice, it has a very nice appearance, however it is evident that the company who manufactured this chair has zero quality control, and no desire to have good customer support. I laughed reading someone else's joke on here about the company name (Cavalier) because it is very fitting to how they treat you as a customer.Now, that being said. I have NEVER, and I mean NEVER purchased or even used a product with as poor quality control as this one. Every single screw falls out despite being relentlessly tightened down meticulously (I am an engineer so I do not cut corners). There are holes through which the screws fit and these circular pieces that are inserted over the holes for aesthetic are consistently found on the ground, no matter how many times I put them back where they go. I sit back, (and mind you, I am 120 lbs at most), and the chair falls apart and breaks because the screws don't stay put. The seat portion of the chair is built for inhumanely long thighs (my body type is long and lanky) and because of this alone, it is very poor for any back support. I keep a back support cushion at the back of the chair which is at the thinnest portions at least 2 inches thick and my very long legs still are off the ground when I'm sitting with my back against the chair.DO NOT buy this item. The customer support is absolutely horrible and they want to charge you $15 for any replacement screws (no, you have to buy the whole kit). They provide no replacement screws initially (only the exact amount, I'm sure to save money because they seem very cheap). The entirety of the chair is $90 and paying $15 just for some screws is ridiculous.Okay, put this way, if you don't mind having tripping and choking hazards all over your floor (circular pieces and screws) and you aren't actually going to sit in the chair, then this $90 decoration would be a very nice addition. Don't plan on sitting in it. In addition, if you really enjoy a quick pick-me-up every morning of reassembling your office chair, then this chair may be perfect for you as well. Just make sure to buy the appropriate hex screw because they won't provide that for you. Oh, and definitely keep your hex key on your desk for convenience.
After 4 months of use my 7 year pen stopped writing. I give it one star for the sustainability idea but it deserves 0 stars for execution. How do I get my money back?

I should’ve listened to the other bad reviews, boxes arrived with holes in corners where they’d just been tossed around. A couple are just fine, but I can’t return or replace the others without returning all of them.

I bought this remanufactured ink because of the positive reviews. I've been burned before on remanufactured ink, but I just need something to get taxes done this year. The ink is dispensed inconsistently, but most pages are very light. - not impressed!In the future, I'll go back to making the awful choice of paying for ink or buying a new printer. Either way the cost is about the same.

So Annoying!  I tried to install two of the black cartridges and, no matter what I do, the printer returns "cannot detect" errors and refuses to print.  I took a chance on an item with few reviews and got burned!

I'd give this zero (or negative) stars if possible. Literally died within less than the first five minutes of use. Although I wasn't expecting luxurious quality at its price, I expected it to perform better than the 25¢ 'manual' sharpener it was replacing. Sadly, this product is garbage.
Arrived damaged - containers and lids. In looking at other reviews, this appears to be a common problem.

bought them as backup cartridges. when I got around to using them they failed within a couple months. magenta and yellow toner is printing smeared down one side of the page (much like other pictures posted on reviews). i called them to see if they would replace the cartridges (had bought them over a year ago, but hadn't used them. they were my backups) they said no since it was over a year. so they did not stand behind their product when given the chance. don't buy these as backups and have them sit around. use them right away so if they fail you might have a chance of getting them replaced.

I tested it with the reader through which I gain access to my office. I covered the my access card with the SHIELD GUARD CARD and sure enough the door to the office opened as usual. I also put my access card in my wallet covered by both SHIELD GUARD CARDS in the pack and I gained access to my office using my wallet! The SHIELD GUARD CARD is useless. I am returning it. Do not buy this product. It is not worth even one star.
Be sure to check for reviews! Pictures of actual product can be deceiving 🤨...there are not to scale (pencil coloring in page, hand putting sticker-necklace on). Very disappointed in size.

If you want to use the notebook and the "smart" pen that is supposed to digitalize your notes and drawings, you need to download the Moleskine App to a mobile device. This app has terrible reviews in the Google Play Store, some of the worst reviews I have seen. After about a month's attempts patiently to try out the notebook and app, I have come to conclusions that are quite similar to the other reviewers'. Bluetooth recognition and paring of the "smart" pen with your mobile device works haphazardly at best. After a few weeks, my mobile phone has stopped recognizing the "smart" pen alltogether. Synchronization does not work as promised in all the glossy and stylish promotional videos. In the end, I paid a lot of money for an ugly ballpoint pen and a notebook. Moleskine offer a lot of FAQs on their website but these did not really help me to solve the problems I encountered with the pen. Given my experience, I would never buy this item again.

I bought this printer based on reviews here and at other sites.  The cost per page was a definite plus. The installation went well and I thought this was the best printer ever....Until today.  My wife was printing some paperwork when the print head error message came up.  I carefully followed the cleaning instructions and when that did not work I called customer service and waited patiently for 10 minutes, finally I connected to a tech who downloaded the latest firmware, to no avail.  Then he told me that I,yes,I damaged the print head and they would send out another print head in 3 or 4 days.  3 or 4 days is unacceptable when there is work to be done.  I have to have a printer so I will be going out and buying a reliable but expensive(ink-wise) HP.  I had so much hope for this printer, I really thought it was the best printer I had ever owned.Update 9-9-2011;I see a theme running through the bad reviews.  I have always trusted the  2,3,star reviews over the 1 and 5,  This printer and other lexmark printers seem to have print head problems.  This seems to be a problem that has been occurring over the last year and a half. Lexmark folks,if you read these reviews.....and I know you do, you might want to pick up on this issue and find a permanent fix.  As for the ink issue, I have yet to find your $5.00 cartridge except during your return program.  I spent at least 14.00 for 5 cartridges to get that 5.00 cartridge.  I am not saying do not buy this printer....it does have a place in the market, just know what you are getting.  This is definitely not a business class printer.  You will wait for several days for a new "Print head".
if I could give -100 stars this would be the productI was replacing the same producttake a look

I'm aware that usually buying off brand printer ink is not a good idea, but I saw this one had excellent reviews and gave it a try. IT DOES NOT WORK in the printer. The black cartridge was horrible. When I replaced the black with this remanufactured ink, the ink level says its full, however when I print, nothing but small streaks of black come out. The magenta was alright since there were still some streaks visible. I did the head cleaning 7 times, but the black still had the same outcome. I'm highly disappointed as I expected more from the multiple high ratings.

The black cartridge is slightly different from the one I was using -same brand. I have an HP DeskJet 3520 and as you can see from the photos, I cannot push cartridge down into the printer ink section and The original sits flat.Which makes the entire product useless. I emailed the seller and unfortunately it was two days after the return window. The seller never responded to me.This is not as advertised and a  waste of moneyIf the seller does contact me for a refund or an exchange,  I will be happy to update this review to reflect  that.

I'm knocking off stars because this thing is already pissing me off. The wireless printing just doesn't work anymore for no apparent reason. I needed a wireless printer for all pc in my house and it just simply wont print on any now, it worked fine day 1. It refuses to connect to any device wirelessly. The only way I can print is connecting directly with the cable included.

2018 compact pages are misaligned im using a filofax personal binder, never had this issue before and have always used the same binder. The holes seem misaligned and smaller. Will have to ounch bigger holes. :/ I should of listened to the review I saw about this below but figured it may of been a one off situation. Guess not. For $35 I shouldnt have to fix holes on pages. I got a few from our promo vendor at work who said they were the latest and greatest. I'm an Executive Assistant so I do a lot of highlighting. I would NEVER use these on any papers that anyone else was going to see. The other reviewers are correct, they are like translucent crayons that constantly make "crayon boogers" that are litle dried off pieces that go all over your paper and end up smearing other places... and stick to your hands when you try to swipe all away. These highlgihts absolutely smear too as the flakes can be squashed and dragged like a bug and his guts (sorry for the gross analogy, lol). Furthermore, since it's waxy, once you highlight, you can't write over it so be sure what you highlight is good to go. All in all, I use these on scratch papers to check things off my to do list just waiting for them to run out so I don't feel so bad throwing them away which is what I WANT to do... :)

Edited review:  I loved this printer for the first few days.  I printed from various devices within my home through the network.  Then it stopped working through wireless unless I had it less than a few feet from the router.  I connected it directly to one computer, and that was fine for a couple of months.  Now it rarely prints, even directly from the computer.  It won't print wirelessly at all.
Installed and in less than a month it is already flashing.  I guess you do get what you paid for.  Ordered a more expensive one from a 5 star company instead.

I purchased a LIFEDRIVE from Palm and I was immediately thrilled with it and I rated it 5 stars.  I purchased a metal protective case for it and I purchased a special remote alpha/numeric keypad.  I thought it was the greatest of all the Palm devices I had ever purchased! I had been buying Palm products every since they had a memory of only half a megabyte.  Now I have lost all personal and business information that I acquired over all these last ten years.  And when I call them for customer support they refuse to be responsible and demand that I pay then to just look into the robleem.

I’m not one to usually write a bad review but I couldn’t keep this one to myself. First I opened the packet and I immediately had red ink all over my hands. I use turned the knobs to put the correct date and the rubbers for the dates would not move. When I finally forced the correct date, and did a ‘test’ stamp, it stamped the wrong date, completely. Every single part of this item was super low quality. I am returning it immediately.

So over 2 months later, the pens finally arrived from Singapore I think. I ONLY received 4 (FOUR) instead of the dozen(12) stated. in this product. As if only getting one third wasn't bad enough. One of them was already printed on stating "DEA TOUGH WORK. VITAL MISSION." So I can't use this for my 4 year old daughter's Birthday goody bags, unless someone has a time machine, and a Star Trek replicator to make up for the missing 8 (Holy heck, as an Asian, I am sincerely am disappointed in my bretheren's lack of basic counting skills)

I bought 2 of these (Pro901s) printers for my business with all the good media reviews on amazon and elsewhere.My experience with these printers have been awful. First 2 out of 2 the printers were not printing correctly when I received them and after I set it up. Network setup went fine. But the primary purpose of the printers were lacking. The printouts were unacceptable and after spending extensive time with overseas call centers in troubleshooting them they said that the firmware had to be upgraded. When this did not do the job they had to ship over new print-heads for both of them. Immediately after which the printers appeared to print an acceptable output. However, after a few months had passed, the same problem reared its ugly head. The same process were followed in updating firmware and then the shipment of new print heads. Even today, everytime I send something to the printer it feels like a gamble and 3/5 times the prints are unacceptable. These printers are the most unreliable piece of office equipment I have encountered.Second big issue, the ink on the printers seem to just dry up by themselves without much use. If the printer stays idle for a week or two the printers seem to need having to go through cycles of "clean" and "deep clean" the heads to get them to function acceptably or need an entire new cartridges. So much of low cost of black ink or any ink. These printers are ink guzzlers.Third big issue, every time a print is sent from the computers my wireless Dell wakes up immediately and I do not have to think twice and automatically expect it to be waiting for me at the printer. However, with these Pro901s it is a constant gamble. My employees are constantly craning their necks like jack-in-box's looking to see if the print they sent to it is coming out or not. Some take the touble of walking all the way to the printer to turn it on, just to make sure they are doing everything possible so that they could get their print-out.Now, my favored printers in the past were previous Lexmarks and I stuck with them and bought this promising product but I am so uttlerly disappointed that I will probably never buy any Lexmark unless something improves dramatically.For those looking at this product, please look elsewhere. Don't gamble with your hard-earned money. I don't even want to talk to Lexmark about these units unless they have new models that work as reliable as the ones they used to make. I just feel like I threw away a good $500-600s on them.I also suspect that most of the good reviews on this board are set ups and sales pitches. The ink savings are absolutely not there with the number of clogs encountered and the number of cartridge replacements you have to buy. These printers cannot prossibly have such glowing reviews. The mission of what they set out to accomplish is great but they are extremely unreliable. Also, the glowing reviews are probably customers who bought them just recently. I bought one first and thought I liked it and bought the other one weeks apart. I would love to hear their comments 4-6 months and later.Very frustrated customer!Good Luck!

Will not read ink levels. I read other reviews that this happens, but thought I would try it and it did not work. The packaging was good and no ink was leaking anywhere. What this means in the end is that they are useless and a waste of money. I am very disappointed in this product.

Review is for "ColorIt 48 Glitter Gel Pens for adult coloring books....I bought a 4 pack at the dollar store for a buck.  I THINK,  48 divided by 4 = 12  so as far as I'm concerned these should be 12 bucks.  If there is a divide sign on my junky laptop, I can't find it.

These are very, very tiny.  I was looking for something that I could label and these definitely weren't it.  Also sometimes while dispensing one, a whole bunch will come out.  Not that great.  I will give them 2 stars because they do seem durable and are colored on both sides (unlike a lot on Amazon).

There are quarter inch margins on top and side and an inch margin on bottom.  Huge forum post online 4 years old with everyone else having the same problem.  No solution.  Not sure why this has good reviews.  Returned.  Huge wast of time.

I'm somewhat pleased with the sticky pads. They don't leave any sticky residue behind. They are perfect for reminders, page holders or marking places on the walls that need touch-up paint. Unfortunately, they are not as sticky as the PostIt brand so we will not be using these as a replacement.Disclosure: I was given a pack of these sticky notes to use for review purposes. I'm always honest and give my true opinions whether they're positive or negative.

While I did not have the smell issue like some other reviewers, I can't get mine to "flatten out".  It was rolled in a box and it has a bunch of "humps" in it that will not flatten.  I put things on it to flatten it, seemed to work but then when I took the stuff off of it (after 2 days) the humps came back.  It is not completely clear as stated, it has a blue/purple like tint to it.  If I could get it to flatten out I would be very pleased with the purchase.
Product came damaged just like the other reviews stated.

I bought 2 of these, based on the description and pictures. That was a mistake. This item has no way to secure it. It simply hangs over the arm. No velcro. No grips. No attachments. No long piece of cloth to put under a cushion. Nothing. It just slides around very loosely. The slightest bump knocks it off. I think that it would probably only stay on somewhat securely if the arm of the sofa or chair is flat and about 6 inches wide. I'm giving it 2 stars because if you do have furniture with that kind of arm, then it would seem to be a decent item. I'm returning them.
doesnt look like what you can see in the picture.do not trust this picturethe only reason why i gave 1 star to this one is for right a review

At the time of this writing, the printer has generally negative reviews, of which I understand and agree with. When I bought this printer, it actually had good reviews and even good video reviews on YouTube. It was very exciting to get a printer with a display, wireless capabilities and cheap ink!The printer is great in theory, but falls a short of reasonable expectations.The black ink is cheap, but it won't let you print unless all the ink cartridges are full to prevent damage to the printhead. Unfortunately, this means that the cheap ($5) black ink cartridge won't be the only ink you need to purchase, and the color ink is expensive as expected. Even if you take care to avoid printing in color, it happens when you forget to adjust the print settings, when you forget to select B&W copy instead of just copy, when it is aligns or cleans the cartridges, etc.Technology flies forward, and sometimes some of our older electronics feel slow. This printer is relatively slow, especially to start up, even from just sleep mode. It doesn't operate quickly even when it is on, but with a little patience, no big deal but worth noting.It doesn't always play nice with the different computers in the house. I have an XP, Vista, 7 and 8 machines, but with a little bit of time, you can get it to work. Also, it appears that there have been firmware updates so look to make sure your printer is up-to-date.The scanner jams sometimes when pulling from the auto feeder tray. That top part eventually broke, with minimal use, thereby making all scans from that point on blurry somehow. The hinges are made of thin and small plastic so it can break very easily. I removed the hinge and the feeder works again, but now be extra careful since it doesn't have 1 of the 2 hinges.For the price I paid I expected a better product. There are other printers which that are much more durable, and ultimately, even with more expensive ink, have a lower cost of ownership. Actually, for the use this printer gave, IT HAS THE HIGHEST COST OF OWNERSHIP out of all the printers I have used.This model has been replaced with a newer one, which I have had the benefit of using at work. It is much faster, and more solid, I have reservations about recommending it because this older model was a poor performer. If you're in the market for a new printer, stay away from this one given that even within Lexmark there are better options.Thanks for taking the time to read my review, I hope it helps.

I would go less stars if I could. M & N do not have any sheets to write on. Contacted very unhelpful seller & they want pictures. Okay, you got it! Since there is no way to get your pictures to you, I will show you here. Don't buy this cheap book

DID NOT WORK RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX! I have ordered some amazing items from Amazon and I have left very positive reviews on virtually all of them. But to receive such an attractive item, and for it to become irreparably jammed on the very first try out of the box, is extremely disappointing. I am now wondering if this stapler was intended to only be an eye-catcher item-a simple decoration on a desk-and not actually a functioning office product. I have a jammed stapler in front of me as I write this review, that I unwrapped 15 minutes ago, tested, and now I can't even pry it apart. I am remorseful that I ordered it.

This desk is not sturdy enough to hold a coffee cup, much less a laptop. First item in 19 years, I have given a bad review. Put it together and it wants to hang sideways, like the picture I am posting. Just very unhappy with this desk. For no reason, It will hang sideways. I give up. Customer service says it isn't their product in the photo?? What?? yes it is, it is just hanging sideways.  Time to order a new, sturdier desk.

Printer (hp psc 1350) initially recognized both black and color cartridges, and both worked well.  I originally gave the product five stars.  But after a month or so - using the printer only sparingly - it suddenly would not work and I came back to edit this review.  I printed one document just fine, but when I tried to print another five minutes later I got a "check print cartridge" message.  It turns out that the culprit was the black cartridge.  You might give this a shot based on price - it worked well for me until it suddenly didn't - but I guess I am going back to HP.

Hit or miss performance, but extremely frustrating recurring problems that are well documented by other reviewers.We've suffered through this thing for about 2 years.  Tonight was the last straw, will be promptly replacing and never buying from Lexmark again.Software is overly complicated, bulky, and slow, but it works... usually.One problem is that the printer loses connection with the network computers: sometimes we'd have to restart the computer, sometimes we'd have to reboot the printer.Print head is a nightmare.  $200 machine brought low by a $5 plastic part.  Will print the first half of a multipage document fine, and then half-way through starts spitting out white paper.  Clean print heads (use a lot of ink) and then the printing works again.  Basically, before every use we had to clean print heads, which gets expensive when color ink is $50 a set.  If you're out of color ink, the print heads won't clean, you must refill them before it will do it.  When that happened, we were left with a printer that spit out white paper, and couldn't clean the print heads because we were out of color, and all we were trying to do was print black and white documents.

When I read the other reviews regarding the smell, I figured some folks are sensitive, and I would be fine with this mat.Wow was I ever wrong!This mat doesn't just have an "odor". It verily oozes toxic fumes that burn the throat and eyes, and leave a bad taste my mouth. When it first arrived, I aired it out on a sunny porch for three days, and then put in my office. The window was open, and everything was great. Then night came, the window was closed, and the room began to fill with a noxious miasma.I tried more airing out. Per some suggestions here, I tried soaking it in baking soda in my tub. This resulted in the mat filling my entire house with the poisonous reek, which literally woke me up in the middle night with its strength, in my bedroom with the door closed. I had to air the entire house, despite the cold night. I feared for my dog's life.This mat was a complete waste of time and money.

I was so excited to try these.  I'd heard a few people rave about them and saw the positive reviews. BUT I hate these.  Plain & simple.  I am an actor and use highlighters all the time for scripts.  These are about the worst I've ever had.  Because the nib is so large, it is very hard to be accurate with them and I ended up highlighting half of the lines above or below those intended.  The coverage is horrible on one pass.  In order to fully highlight something, you have to color, like with a crayon, over it multiple times. Aside from the inefficiency of this, it also burn through the highlighter at a rapid pace. Pieces of the gel flake off very easily and either build up on the nib or stick to the page, making a terrible mess and highlighting something you might not have wanted highlighted.  The waxy finish is slightly sticky, so the pages stick together and, when you highlight something on the next page, the color from the previous page transfers to the other side.  There does seem to be some difference in performance between the colors, with yellow being the most successful, but even the yellow is extremely sub-par.
If I could give it a 0 star I would. They blow up all over the place. Don't buy, you will need me shirts!!!!!!

Initially this seemed like a great deal. Unfortunately this cartridge didn't last half as long as other 3rd party cartridges I've used. It also started making an alarming clacking noise that had me looking through the copier with a flashlight. I thought my machine was broken! I'm going to go back to the other brand, if it works as well as I remember, I'll leave a positive review there.

When I first bought this printer I was very pleased with it.  It's set up was incredibly easy, including the Wifi, and the quality was awesome.  It would have received 5 stars from me.It has since (less than a year an half) become almost useless.  The first issue was the wifi suddenly, randomly not connecting with the printer, even though the set up and location has not changed one bit.  Next my wife's computer was suddenly not able to print at all using the wifi, and it has never worked since.  We contacted customer support and did everything they recommended, including new driver downloads etc, and even though the system says its working...it will not print.  "Cannot find printer" etc.Next it started to jam, and did it many times.  Each time we carefully removed the paper exactly as they recommend, but it clearly had an effect on both the roller that feeds the paper and the printing itself. Now it jams around 50% of the time. Lastly the hinge that supports the upper lift up portion broke.  I can't actually see what has broken, but it no longer has any tension to it.  This is a problem because when you scan, light is being allowed in from the sides at the back, and the quality is drastically reduced.I don't doubt that some people have had good luck with this printer, as I said, I did initially and I loved it.  However, there seems to be far more people who have had trouble with it than not, so you may want to keep looking.  I wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy.  Then again, maybe I would... ;o)

I bought this printer in May 2015 and pretty much tolerated it for the first couple years. Yes, it would disconnect from wifi every once in awhile, and it was annoying to have to reinstall drivers to get it working again. But I got it cheap at a time when there were few affordably priced laser printers, so I considered it a trade-off. However, HP has now taken over and things have gone from mediocre to absolutely awful. It will no longer connect to wireless at all, even after I scoured the internet for the drivers (HP's customer service is non-existent, so don't bother asking for help). All of the documentation online is ancient. In fact, I was surprised to see that it is still for sale because I was sure it had been discontinued. I have no idea how they can sell a printer that no longer has online support or current drivers. Based on my experience, as well as the reviews here and elsewhere online, this model should be considered a wired laser printer that occasionally gives you the gift of wireless connectivity once a year. I've already ordered a different brand and look forward to going Office Space on this one.

Before purchasing this product, be sure to check how many of the positive reviews are from individuals who have received the product in exchange for their "unbiased" review.This product has a hard time coming off of most surfaces. We have a chalkboard sign and have used several pens with it. This was the only one that left significant residue. It was even difficult to get off of the window. I understand that it should only be used on non-porous surfaces, and I further understand that I neglected to have a technician come out to tell me that my chalkboard was porous, but "chalk" is probably a term of art here, and the idea that my wife needs to read the fine print to discover that these chalk pens can't be used on chalk boards is ridiculous.

I liked this badge despite the negative reviews. It broke the first day I wore it so I had it replaced, which was speedy and hassle-free. Received the replacement and you guessed it- that one broke too! Don't waste your time.

I bought these with the intent of writing on photos and other things that needed a fine point. Well, as other reviewers have noted (and I wish I'd seen before I bought these), they smear badly. It takes forever for them to dry, so the smearing continues for quite some time, depending on the surface it's applied to. To me, Sharpie means waterproof, non-smearing ink. NOT in this case. I guess pen is the important word here. Oh, and the ink dries up pretty quickly. I haven't had these that long and just pulled one out of my desk drawer to find that it's dry.

I wish I could write a proper review for this, but sadly I am unable to do so. I ordered this whiteboard and after a few days, it was finally delivered! However, only the casters and frame arrived-- there was no writing surface to be found. I checked to be sure it wasn't sent in two packages, found out that it wasn't, and then asked Amazon for a replacement to receive the missing part. A couple days later, the delivery was completed again, but still no writing surface. There was no number to contact the producer of the item, so I just returned the casters and received a refund.Customer service was very helpful, but ultimately I was still left without a room divider for my office. Sad times

I’m giving it two stars because the page designs are cute. The listing indicated it was magnetic, it isn’t. The listing also indicated there was perforation between the grocery list and meal plan, so you can tear the list off and leave the menu, it doesn’t have that either. So while I like the way it looks, the function is missing for me.
Cracked upon arrival!  Although I read the reviews and told myself “it won’t happen to me”, it happened to me. I’ve tried calling and it just goes to voicemail!!!  Extremely frustrated!

When I only received one in the mail, I thought I made a mistake by only selecting something like a one-pack.After checking the product description and Q&A, it specifies multiple times that it is meant to be a six-pack.Other reviews are also stating that they only received one, two, or three out of the six promised.

Beware! Can’t use folders till you send the tabs & inserts which were supposed to be included. Not worth the expense to ship folders back. What a ripoff! Send the tabs & inserts & I’ll edit my review.

Bought these as an aid to help me study. What a waste of money! They did not erase from the dry erase board unless I used alcohol or a wet rag and even then it still left markings on my board. The package should really say that it will not erase on boards other than their own. Save your money! If I could rate it a zero, I would.
Items arrived cracked and broken. Recent review noted that shipping seemed to have improved. These arrived with no packing material, just inside a box.

Have purchased many gallons of their print varnishes for over 4 yrs. I am uncertain as to whether a supply chain issue is the problem or not, however the product dries cloudy and the timeless pint I just received is clumpy and will not mix. Problems occur, it is how those problems are addressed that is important. This aspect equaled the failure of the product. Several phone calls were placed and emails sent detailing the issue and enumerating my dilemma. I received the standard email of potential problems I may have caused during the application process.  Interesting that we had no problem with the thousands of other prints we used their product on, which they were made aware of. I am now scheduled for a 15min phone call... I have learned so much from this experience I am grateful, but know also many may not feel the same, hence this review.

---Very frustrating.You think it'd be easy, if you have SAMSUNG phone and tablet, but you'd be wrong. Neither would connect to the NEW printer.(Neither my Samsung Galaxy Note s4 phone or my Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.1, and that was with Samsung's own "SAMSUNG Mobile Print" app).The printer would show up in the wifi search screen, but the pop-up window would just say "Connecting the printer" forever. It would never actually connect.It's surprising for Samsung. I have a lot of Samsung things, even my washing machine. I thought they were big on quality. It would be one thing if I was the exception, but apparently I'm not. At least have some freaking troubleshooting somewhere, Samsung.Did I mention, "very frustrating"?06/28/15 UPDATE: I talked to text support today to resolve the issue, kind of. The call was 1:40 long. The guy I spoke to was the only positive really (very nice and accommodating). We had to set up the printer through my PC using the USB, and then from there we could disconnect the printer, and go completely wireless (there are lots of speed bumps). BUT, like I've read in a lot of other reviews, the printer doesn't stay connected to either my phone or tablet. And, using the app actually switches of my Wi-Fi. So I have to keep reconnecting my Wi-Fi, and opening and closing the app. I'll probably stick with this printer, but we'll see how cumbersome the process gets.7/3/2015 UPDATE: RETURNING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Doesn't print eBay shipping labels right, no matter what settings I mess with. Not grabbing paper  anymore. STILL have to keep reconnecting wifi. I can't wait to get rid of this time-wasting headache!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great size and wonderful organizer however the back split in 6 months.  Wish i had read more reviews

If there was less thank one star I would have rated it a minus.  These letters do not adhere to much of anything except maybe paper.  I was trying to make a sign for our church with these vinyl letters on a sign banner made of reinforced vinyl and they continuously loosen up even lying flat on a table, even trying heavy books overnight to keep them flat, to no avail. They do not stick, they do not stay, they are useless for this purpose.  Don't waste your money and especially don't waste your time.

I would give no stars if I could.  Just installed cartridges in my empty printer and neither of them work.  I am so upset, I have lost out on my money and now I have to go out and purchase ink today because I need to use my printer.  Would not recommend or buy again.

Would not pick up my vinyl to even be able to transfer. I would give out my stickers and everyone that I gave out with this transfer paper gave them back to me to redo. The only reason I even gave it a star is because I love my silhouette machine. I may have got a bad batch but did not work for me.
The price seemed really a good deal and the reviews were decent.  It worked the first little while, now every time I try to print I have to clean the printheads, and some times won't print at all

At first, I liked it; however, when I saw how using it regularly caused the outer blue coating to wear off the paperback-like covering, I did NOT like it anymore. Whatever the company uses as a coating on the outer cover wears off easily and you are left with an ugly, splotchy, blue and grayish-white mess. I don't usually write reviews, but when I read about parents and grandparents wanting to use it to leave messages to their loved ones as a keepsake for years to come, I knew I had to take the time to warn people that this adorable looking book will NOT STAND THE TEST OF TIME. Fortunately, I use mine as a check book register which stays in my desk unless I am making entries, and the fact that it has deteriorated is disappointing but not devastating as it would have been had I unsuspectingly made it into an heirloom.
Same problem as the last reviewer: expected four, one of each color, received one. Very misleading. I felt cheated! Thumbs down!!!!

I brought these souble sided squares to stick the little stars n planets on the ceiling of my baby's room. As u can see in the picture, i used varied amount of these stickies for different sizes of the stars. But none of them lasted more than a minute on the ceiling before they dropped off. When i tried to restick them they wouldnt stick, so their 'repositionable' claim is incorrect too. I brought these because they were cheaper than 'scotch', but i guess u get what u paid for

I never leave reviews but this is so bad, I have to warn others! It is nearly impossible to change the date without getting ink all over your fingers, the outside of the stamp and anything else within a mile radius! It stamps clear, sure but the way you change the date is a very poor design and half the time when you spin the wheel, it slips and doesn't even move causing you to get even more ink on your hands! DO NOT BUY!

I read about this issue in some other reviews, but the price made it worth taking the chance . . . until it happened to me!  I've ordered the same product a couple times with no issues, but in this shipment, the magenta color will not work.  The biggest problem with this is that with an "incorrect" cartridge in place, my printer/copier won't work at all.  So if you rely on your printer daily - as I do! - you may want to skip this product.  Also, since I've had the item over 30 days, I can't refund or return.  Frustrating!

Yes, I ordered the item without reading the reviews and fell for the picture and description which are for the entire organizer, even though this item is a mere 3 metal dividers with no organizer, no stand, not an 8 Section Organizer. After the seller was kind enough to refund the item after letting me know they have no control over Amazon's description, image, etc, I promised to notify Amazon of the error.  I have done so in at least 4 different ways (contact Amazon, call Amazon, product feedback, contact Amazon again, and finally this review). There are other similar items on the site that clearly show a picture of just the wire dividers, and a description that is clear that the product is JUST the wire dividers.  That needs to happen here so both buyers and sellers don't get ripped off by an Amazon error.

I read the reviews and it seems this is a very common issue. Even after waiting a day or two it is still very stiff and practically impossible to unroll out the box. It was almost like it wasn't meant to be unrolled, I mean...it wouldn't open at all.

Wasnt going to write a review on this, but4 months later and this thing is junk. Where the drawers go in and out is scraping the plastic off and they wont even hold anymore, just fall down. Dont waste your money.

As stated in previous reviews, these stickers do not match the Avery templates.  If you look carefully, Avery has a feed paper end and the stickers start closer to the edge of the paper on that end.  These Americopy are equidistant from the edge on both ends and therefore the print is shifted on the stickers, worse at the bottom of the page than at the top.  I won't order these again.

The cards themselves are great, however they are a different color than the accompanying envelopes. The cards are ivory and the envelopes are white. These arrived right before we left for our second wedding in Europe so I had to use them or I would have returned them.Aside from the color issue, the paper and foil quality are high. The envelopes, not so much. Customer service was great as the sellers reached out personally after my purchase. It saddens me to leave a sub-par review.

This paper curls extremely bad. I wish I had read the other review about this issue, as it would have saved me shipping time and money. With the paper edges curling, the print head snags the edges and bleeds/smears the ink. It also will not feed into the printer smoothly do to the curled edges. I have reverse rolled it seconds before printing, by the time the print it finished the bottom is already curling again the last couple inches are unusable. I'm using it for testing, so I'll eventually be able to use the rest that I ordered. But I NEED to find a better paper for actual production runs.I saw the seller respond to review stating that moisture will make the paper curl... Well I live in Colorado, which is an extremely dry climate and do not have the paper near any water/moisture sources.I'm using this with an Epson NX415

This is the worst product that I have ever ordered from Avery/Amazon. Instead of the sheet protectors that I have always used, that are sturdy and supportive of the sheet; I got a foggy, floppy plastic bag with 3 holes punched, through the bag, along one side. As others have noted, the holes do not line up with standard 3 hole papers.  It is a ridiculous product. I would have given it a zero star if I could.

I'll make this short, since most of my experience has been well expressed by others.The Pro901 was easy to set up with my wireless network. My XP and Win 7 machines worked well with the software and the printer.Print quality was very good for about 50 pages, although I did notice the print levels going down at an alarming rate. I used the copy and fax functions, which were fine. (Although be aware that ANY incoming call will awaken the printer, which is a poor design.)After about 50 pages, I noticed banding when printing cyan. I tried the various cleaning and aligning options with no improvement. (That really hit the print levels badly. Black was down to about 50%. I can't understand this as I was using the Quick Print setting most of the time.)I chatted with a Lexmark rep who was very responsive. They arranged to send a replacement printhead and new cartridges, which I received overnight. (Great service.)After reading all the bad experiences here, though, I decided to return the printer (while I could) and look for a better choice. I just don't have faith that a new printhead is likely to provide smooth sailing in the future. And even if it would, the ink consumption is unacceptable. (As an aside, you should be aware that the printer will not accept anything other than a Lexmark cartridge. This was introduced in a firmware level recently.)A printer should be reliable out of the box. While Lexmark has great customer service, it should also understand that good service does not take the sting out of bad quality. The best service is no service.

I thought these would be normal greeting cards. They were rated 4.5 stars with hundreds of reviews and I am familiar with the brand.  They are terribly thin paper. I’m embarrassed to send them.  Thank you notes from a dollar store are made from heavier paper stock.  I’m surprised these are Dayspring brand honestly.

I have never received a product from Amazon that I was this unhappy with. I got everything assembled until it came time to assemble the armrests. There is no way quality control is happening on this product, as the armrest was cut in such a way that it is impossible to attach.Do yourself a favor and read these other reviews carefully and do not buy this item until this issue is fixed./

I bought this rather than the Chambers equivalent because it has a bigger screen and has good reviews.  The big disadvantage is the Thesaurus as a crossword aid.  Basically it is rubbish.  The Roget type construction of the Seiko thesaurus using keywords is very difficult to use and unnecessary, as crosswords are always ambiguous in the use of words.  If you want a general purpose portable dictionary and Roget, then buy it.  But if you want a bedside crossword aid, you will be much better off with the Chambers toy.

So yes while it is my fault for not reading carefully, they definitely give you the impression from the picture that you get a PACK of pencils. Needless to say if I could give a lower star I would. Absolutely awful, furious right now.
Do not purchase this product.  Every single bottle had just a little liquid in the bottom.  They were almost empty bottles!  It should not have a single star.

Doesn't hold up very well. Purchased two sets - one in March and other in May. Doesn't come close to rated number of pages and a few of the cartridges start to leave streaks. Went back to buying original Canon cartridges since it would end up costing just as much without the hassle.

I recently purchased a Palm TX to replace my aging Palm Tungsten T3. I would give almost anything to have my T3 back. I have had repeated failures with Hot Syncing, adding files and software and I am unhappy that the 4 buttons don't activate the 4 primary functions of the Palm, Date Book, Contacts, Memos, and Tasks. One of the 4 must be allocated to turning on the "menu page." I do not recommend this device. I would give it only one star, but it does do some things right so I feel it would be unfair to give it a complete failure rating.
The eraser does not erase my blackboard!  It really should have a -0 rating!  I have to use a wet paper towel.

Ive had this for a year now and it does the job I guess. I work from home and it’s not the MOST comfortable but I sit on a pillow anyways. i didn’t expect much out of it just because the chair was so cheap. I’m giving this 2 stars because it started to squeak and makes noises every time I lean back in the chair or move in general. I have to place my clients on mute when I need to change position so that they don’t hear the chair squeaking. It’s very annoying. The chair also slightly wobbles.

Says '12 Pack'.... I only received ONE and it was bend with scratches on it. I really would like my money back to be honest... I needed these for my daughter's class. I would get 0 stars if that was an option 😡

I am so disappointed by this printer! I read the reviews and purchased this because reviews said it worked well for shipping. A total waste of my money. So frustrated after paying for postage only to learn I can't use this for printing shipping labels/postage and should have purchased the 450 Turbo. It also does not allow me to return this item.

This product would have received a much better rating if it weren't for the fact that it does not print straight. The font is beautiful and legible. However, I have to guess as to where to place the stamp on my paper in order to have it straight. Very disappointed with it.

I bought this product to have a spare black cartridge in stock if needed.  Well, I finally needed to replace the original cartridge.  I read reviews on this site about the product leaking, so was careful to take it out over the sink.  The reviews were correct.  When I took the orange cover off the ink literally exploded out of the cartridge.  It dripped into the stainless steel sink instead of on the floor, but got all over my hands, and it does not come off.  I turned it over to the position it would take in the printer and the ink just runs out for a bit.  Installed it in my printer and the printer will not accept or use it.  From reading the reviews on this site, it sounds like some folks have success with this, but not me.  Looks like a hit-or-miss proposition.  I suggest you avoid the drama and buy a reliable product.

I should have believed the reviews. This product arrived with three of the boxes cracked and all of the lids cracked. Sending them back and will find a more durable product. I would have given it a zero stars, but that wasn't an option.

Terrible, terrible, terrible. I should have listen to the reviews. Was supposed to get tape, labels and a marker. Only received very small boxes. Not worth the money. Unboxes, you should be ashamed for shorting so many people from the product they paid for. How much do you make from doing that? Reading the reviews, seems like it happens a lot. Maybe on purpose.
I disagree.  The tip is NOT strong.  It bent then broke off.The ink is very light.One star is too manySincerely,Harpie Against Sharpie

This is what happens when you don't read customer reviews first (shame on me).  I needed a label printer for my Ebay and Etsy  mailing labels so I got this little monster from the local office store.  What crap, it is not integrated with Ebay, Etsy, Paypal or Google Print.  Statements on the label regarding postage mailing are completely misleading.  I have to go through a ton of hoops & use photoshop to even use it (then it wastes about 2 in of label per print).  Worse, you have to download 98 mb software to even use it.  Is it easily found? Heck no.  Seriously, these people need to get it together.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.

The product does not work.  Wish I had read the reviews before wasting my money & time trying to troubleshoot it.  My son knows a little about gadgets and basically said the wiring is bad.  No current flowing from the batteries.  This was only I had unscrewed the back twice to double & triple check that I had put batteries in the correct way and then replacing said batteries again with yet another set.  My son spliced some wires and was able to make it work but one of the lights stays on no matter what so it'll drain the batteries. It's not worth the hassle.
I ordered 3 packs of these, in all 3 packs the green pen was dry (still had ink in the well?) and would not work.  1/4 of the pens we're inoperable, hard to give a good review with that stay...

I NEVER have rated an item bought and I love Amazon Prime but this phone intended for those with vision and hearing problems has not worked from the beginning. I kept thinking it was the phone line since it was added in a nursing home for my mother. It was not...and on top of that the Square Trade warranty (which I bought) has not responded as well in sending a new phone or where to send this one for repair!  I will be selective in what I choose to buy from now on!

I used to  go 6 months on a cartridge, but with these, they go empty in very  few weeks.  These cartridges are quite skimpy on the ink. There are 48 negative one-star reviews. Also the ink status  monitor does not work with these cartridges.I'll avoid buying anything from this company.

I was so happy to see left handed pens! I should have looked at the reviews first. My biggest issue is the ink writes so light on all of them. The blue ink is terrible it’s like the pen is running out of ink and the red ink pen is the same way. Now the black is a tiny bit better ink wise then the other 2, but still not that great.The design is a bit awkward but I could deal with that. Overall though these pens are a waste of money. Sorry but it’s the truth.

These have a very bad chemical smell.  I hosed them down with water in the back yard.  Left them outside for a long time on multiple days.  They still smell very unpleasant.  I've never had a plastic with a smell like this.  I see other reviewers have complained too, when I search the reviews.  So it is not just me.Otherwise, these are sturdy and seem great.I planned to keep them in my office, but now wish I had a garage.I consider returning them and getting a more expensive set that doesn't smell.

I should have considered the reviews more carefully.Two boxes arrived with cracks. I am very unhappy with the quality of this product. I have purchased several Iris products. They have all been sturdy and great quality.These are thin and flimsy.

0 STARS! I have used these types of cartridges in the past. I was really hoping these would work. But, sure enough, the screen read "one or more cartridges is damaged." So, I am attempting to return. I hope it is at least a smooth return process. I will try looking for the best cartridge for this specific printer... btw, this was my first time replacing cartridges for this printer. As always, I will never see the point in paying $90+ for new ink when I could buy a new printer for the same price or less. I know there are cartridges out there that will work! But it is not this brand. :-(

I have never once left a review - I needed this tape for a big project at work on multiple boards and was expecting to receive 6 rolls, as the description and title describes! Only received ONE roll. Will need to order more now - delaying my work project. Very disappointed.

With all the 5 star reviews, I thought these envelopes would be the best I've ever seen but they're just OK. The paper is pretty thin and I had to add tape on the edges of the flap so they wouldn't get caught in the mechanized equipment at the Postal Service.

The item I received was much smaller than the listed dimensions.  I should have done more research and noticed that was pretty consistent with other reviews, but then again I shouldn't have to if the seller is legit.  Why does Amazon allow this company to continue with false information?

Very disappointed in this product.  Wish i could go lower than 1 star!  They must be refilled. I inserted them into printer, and printer no longer worked. Don't buy this product unless you feel like replacing your printer.
Product description says that this is a 6 pack and i optimistically ordered in spite of the other reviews of people getting shorted. I should have listened! Sure enough...only 2 rolls arrived.
1 star for sending me a phone with no AC adapter.  Product description didn't state it wouldn't come without one.
This stapler is crap!!!!!  I want to give it zero stars.  The sparkly pink one in my photo works better and I only paid 3 dollars for it.  Will never buy one of your staplers again!!!

I bought this to try and bring my keyboard/ mouse closer to me in order to play games more comfortably. The material used is cheap and was cheaply made. All the screws loosen up easily and it almost falls apart if used often. The reason I gave this a 2 star is because ultimately its not balanced enough even when the screws are tightened enough. The table part slouches so badly before you know it your typing at an angle even when you use a laptop because underneath it has no level control except for a screw that holds it up by the weight.

***********UPDATE*********** - 3 months later, I would give this NEGATIVE 5 stars.- There is no more resistance to keep the tray elevated.- Likewise no resistance to keep tray from swiveling - which results in table becoming off balance and even falling.- The wheels don't swivel well, so pushing it on hardwood just scrapes the floor. (which contributes to the risk of table falling over)- 2 of the wheel 'locks' have broken off.Really - BUY SOMETHING ELSE. I just can't believe anyone would rate this positively.***********Original review***********I don't get why anyone would give this 5 stars. Maybe they've never seen another rolling laptop table like this ever before. If I could give this a 0, I would. Heck, I'd give it a negative 5 if I could. I've never been more disappointed after opening a box... Where do I start.1) All of the "hardware" that holds this together and allows you to "adjust" it are made of relatively flimsy plastic. I doubt they can bare much weight. If you use this often and leave you computer on it so the time, I'm quite sure it will break.2) Even the metal fasteners are extremely cheap steel. You can't buy this low quality in a hardware store in the US. The screws and nuts are easily capable of de-threading each other. If you hold out a screw and wrap the thread with a screwdriver, you will dent it and it will no longer be fully useable (well, for this table you might because half of it is plastic). To dent threads on a discount store, discount screw, you typically need to hammer a screwdriver or chisel into it. Like I said, you can't buy this low strength alloy in North America.3) The casters, like everything else, are small, flimsy and all plastic. The "locks" as they call them have no real mechanism to hold them in "locked" position. When I locked and unlocked one about 20 times in a row, it ceased to be about to prevent the wheel from turning.4) Nothing can be securely fastened. Every piece has some wiggly and give to it. I'm good with my hands and have expertly assembled countless pieces of furniture and mechanical pieces. I assembled this table as perfectly as can be done. Wiggle wobble every piece every direction.5) It's MUCH smaller than it seems in the pictures. Especially the misleading image that shows 23.6" measurement for the main tray. That's the length across both trays at the middle where it's rounded. The actual width you have for your laptop is just under 15"I will update this review when it breaks and becomes unusable. I expect that to be in less than 3 months. If it's still alive in 3-4 months and proves any bit of my original assessment wrong, I'll share that as well.Until then, there's no reason on Earth to buy this. There are similarly priced tables all over Amazon. Even if they are horrible, they can't be any worse than this.

UPDATE: Since purchasing another set, I have been storing these in a ziplock bag, caps down. It seems to be working out. I'm still irritated that these dry out so quickly and I wish there was a better alternative.As mentioned in other reviews, the cap design is TERRIBLE. There are holes in the cap so the markers dry out. I've had them barely a month and they are all dried out. Buying another set (I need them for an upcoming GRE at-home examination) and will try sealing them in a plastic ziplock bag when not using them. So frustrating. Also, the ultra fine point goes away fairly quickly. I have been using one pen a lot (in an attempt to preserve the others!) and don't push hard but it's last the 'ultra fine' characteristic. It's still fine for what I need (doing lots of math). The most frustrating part is how quickly these pens dry out. Unfortunately, I haven't been able to find a suitable replacement that has a similar ultra fine tip. :(

I bought this as a gift and didn't have high expectations. I simply wanted an expensive "Pretty" stapler. Unfortunately the stapler does not work, the person I got it for was hesitant but eventually let me know it does not work. Occasionally one staple will work, then it jams up and is nonoperative. It looks nice and I really wish it functioned, hence the 1 star.
These are wide ruled, not college ruled. I should have double checked the reviews first.  Returning.
They even didn't publish my earlier review.. I didn't expect this from Amazon, doesn't look like a genuine product and now I don't have the strength to write as they will not publish it.

Terrible. They would have gotten zero stars but I had to pick 1. I had bought these ahead of time and just tried using them,  my printer says they are not “discoverable”  so they do not work and now I can’t send them back.

The printer I received is drastically different from what other reviewers are describing. First, there are many issues with copying and printing. Every page has a black line on it, including scans. Second, the scanning damages originals by jamming the top of each page slightly. Third, the printer often grabs 2 pages at once during copying and spits out copies that are half blank. All in all, I am returning and exchanging this printer in the hopes that my model simply turned out to be defective or damaged. I will update my review if the replacement I receive performs better.
I have only had this cartridge for about 10 printings, its aready telling me that the cartridge is running low. I'm not so sure this was a good Buy. 2 stars because only 10 printings is bad

Great shipping and amazon service but product is too expensive for only 1600 pages. Returned item unopened and purchased a printer from a different manufacturer instead.Pantum printer quality is not up to par... but that's a different review.

Be careful about this cheap product.  I bought it on July 23, 2015 at the same time I replaced the cartridge on my Samsung printer ML-2165W with a original Samsung cartridge.  This cartridge was supposed to be a replacement at a great price in case I ran out of ink in a pinch such as on a weekend.  Well, it happened last weekend.  But when I tried to put it in, I found out it a tad too long, even though previous reviwers on this product attested to the fact it's an exact fit for ML-2165W.  This was when I found out that AMZN has a policy of not refunding after 30 days.  So, my caveat for you is (1) check any cartridge for fit right away before the 30 day deadline.  (2) Don't trust any reviews you read.  I lost money on this one.  My first one star purchase.

Do not buy these on Amazon.  Item expiration date printed on box is Sept. 2016 and received this in June, 2017.  Printer test page shows no blue ink at all in the cartridge.  Piece of junk and vendors should not be selling these!  NEW cartridges of this type are great and have used them for years.  But they cost $20 more than this thing.  Believe the bad reviews of Amazon sellers on these.

I am really disappointed to be writing a bad review for this pen. I had bought it for myself as a Christmas treat. The pen does feel good quality and the pale pink colour is nice. However, on first writing the pen does feel scratchy and I don't think it has made my handwriting look nice, if anything it looks worse. The pen is actually quite heavy and I don't think that I would choose to write a long letter with it. I feel that I have just wasted a lot of money on a pen that I will probably not use very much. Would Amazon except a return on a used pen?

This item is fake. Packaging is flimsy and doesn’t have the canon genuine hologram. I’ve worked for Canon and know the quality of packaging and what the genuine one looks like. I’m shocked Amazon are selling these as original! Also explains the other reviews complaining about the amount of prints from these cartridges. Amazon stop selling fakes

I would give less than 1 star if that was an option. 4 months after purchasing the bulb (and extended warranty) it went out and smelled like an electric fire. I contacted the extended warranty company who advised  it was still under “manufacturer warranty”. Contacted Amazon who directed me to Samsung as they are the manufacturer of the item. Samsung stated  “they are not responsible for the defected part” WITH THEIR NAME ON THE SIDE”. At the end of the day Amazon was great and refunded my account. I have replaced the bulb 3 times in the past two years ( not with this one). Time to go shopping for a new TV... GO LG

First of all -- this did not include the tape and packing paper as advertised. I only received the boxes, and now have to go out to buy the tape separately.Secondly -- these boxes are SO small. Definitely read the dimensions (and reviews) before purchasing. If you're looking for MEDIUM boxes, look elsewhere. What they call "medium" is what you'd see on the shelves as a standard "small" box at Home Depot, Lowes, etc. And the "small" boxes they've included are about the size of a shoe box. Not sure why they think this is enough to move one average bedroom. We'll see how it goes as I start packing today.Unfortunately I have no time to return this and wait for a new kit to arrive as we're in the middle of moving right now. Terrible purchase at the WORST time possible.

Installed in my HP CP1215 and the printer control panel showed all was well... however the printer kept telling windows there was an unspecified error and nothing would print.  Tried re-installing cartridges, printer, reboots, everything with no luck.  Putting original HP cartridges back in and everything was fine.  I only took a chance on these because of amazon's excellent return policy... and I returned them as non-functional.  Do not recommend at all.UPDATE: The vendor reached out to me months later and offered to send me new free trial cartridges to see if they worked better for me.  Between my original review and now, we replaced the printer since new HP ink costs about 2x what a new printer does.  I just wanted give credit to the seller for reaching out.  I added 1 star.  FYI I had tried all the work-arounds mentioned here with no luck. If there is some magic config changes needed, the seller should think about including them.

The wireless option to setup the printer is not actually wireless.  It didn't work for me so I had to use the USB only option which was fine.  Then the wireless network connection setup wouldn't work and then logging into my router and entering the WPS key also didn't work.Eventually, the push WPS and logging into my router to push WPS worked.  There was no confirmation on the screen that it worked so if you get this far beware that your wireless might start working without notice.When I tried to select the manual duplex scanning I received a popup that said odd numbers have been scanned now I can put the evens back and hit Start.  The text was cut off in the pop up so I couldn't see if there was a button to Start the scan.  I ended up having to copy the evens then I just inserted them between the pages and scanned my entire batch.This printer/scanner needs a lot of work on the software side but it did what I needed and for someone like me this is good enough.  I'm tired of printers breaking after a few years when I only use it maybe 5 times a year.----Update Feb 8 2023Bringing it down to 1 star. The printer won't stay connected to the wifi for more than a day. I have to plug the USB cable back in to go through the setup wizard again.

This is a crappy printer.  It leaves ink streaks all over the final paper.  First time I had Lexmark send me new print head.  After few months it started doing it again which shows that it wasn't a lemon printer/print head.  Also it adds a lot of bloatware to your pc.  I would not buy this printer again.Update.  Their support sent me a new print head and updated my firmware.  Now this this printer requires color ink to be not empty, all of them to print in black and white. They just want to suck money from your wallet.  If I could give them 0 stars, I would!
I gave it two stars because the I did not receive what is depicted in the photo of the product. Since I paid a paltry sum and it does serve it's function, I let it slide.

PLEASE...everyone must know this is NOT a solid substrate material like that of a dry-erase board or chalkboard!  This is a very crummy approximation of a blackboard (or chalkboard) surface that is "flexible," as it comes rolled up and must be rolled out flat and weighted down (preferably in a warm sunny location) to get it to remain even remotely flat.  Be aware, it DOESN'T flatten out cleanly & neatly by simply slapping it onto a magnetic surface!  That was especially annoying.Furthermore, to establish clarity over what this is and/or is not, please accept this basic physical description to better inform your decision making process:This is a thin, relatively crude magnetic material that is essentially the same sort of flexible, easy to cut, semi-magnetic backing material found on the back of cheap refrigerator magnets or the removable or temporary magnetic signs / insignia that can be applied to car doors or the side of a panel van in business applications such as realtors who advertise on the side of their personal vehicles or some other delivery drivers who use their own personal vehicle, which preclude affixing more permanent vinyl lettering, etc.  This material is NOT very magnetic most of the time and this chalkboard backing is no exception.  It barely holds to stainless steel refrigerators--so don't be fooled.Now, that thin magnetic backing is adhered to a black paper surface that is what the customer "sees" as the chalkboard surface.  This paper is extremely thin and it is laminated with an even thinner clear plastic, "erasable" or wipeable surface that is what the customer actually physically writes upon.  To make it abundantly clear, this is a clumsily & crudely crafted black dry-erase surface that is made of laminated black paper....not metal, wood, slate or a hard acrylic or thermoplastic of any kind.Why do I make this all so unmistakably apparent to you?  Because, it took me mere minutes to destroy the blackboard surface by doing nothing more than wiping my refrigerator door with a damp kitchen cloth--a chamois to my precise.  It was not soaking wet and had no cleaning chemicals or soap on it....just warm tap water.  Within a few seconds I noticed the edges of the blackboard were swollen, bubbled up and upon closer inspection, the paper had taken in moisture that then began separating the ultra thin clear laminate covering from the black paper.It was not repairable!  Just to test further, I wiped over the surface of the blackboard once more with a barely dampened paper towel and waited a minute or two before assessing how it affected the materials.  Sadly, the extremely small amount of additional moisture was immediately absorbed into the paper along the exposed edge and it was more pronounced in the already puffy, swollen & separated spots that all formed only around the edges of the "chalkboard" lookalike material.The black paper then swelled and itself began coming apart to show the white cellulose paper that was PRINTED BLACK WITH INK.  It isn't even solid black paper using black dyed paper pulp to manufacture the product.  It's white paper, inked in black that is laminated with the thinnest plastic laminate I've personally ever seen on any paper product.So, in short, you won't get much use out of this if, like me, you keep a clean kitchen and your kitchen has humidity, moisture, running water and/or humans with wet hands or any other source of moisture because IT'S NOT WASHABLE IN THE LEAST!LAST....the chalk makers suck worse than the "board" in that two of mine are dried out upon first use.  The other two were interesting but nothing to be excited about.
