The markers are ridiculously small and will provide a few months of use at best, but with consistent daily or weekly use, I fear you'll find yours dried up or exhausted entirely, so take this into account.If you buy this, you might as well purchase a decent set of neon chalk markers & toss the crummy ones that come in this silly kitI'm sorry I can't offer any more positive review, but I strive to be as honest and forthright in all of my reviews as possible to inform prospecting buyers so they know what to expect themselves and can decide accordingly!Good luck.P.S.  I have actually purchased instead a real chalkboard in a great wood frame that looks sharp and can hang from any surface depending upon the method of attachment.  I simply used 3M brand heavy duty double-sided tape to adhere several thin, black enameled neodymium (rare earth) magnets that are bar-shaped and provide more than enough real magnetic holding power and they are completely moisture proof, don't scratch my stainless steel fridge because of the nicely enameled coating....and the best part is that I bought a set of 10 (leaving me four extras for another project) and it cost less than $11 (magnets & 3M tape) + $31 (solid, real, non-porous chalkboard that looks sharp & works the way it should) + $10 (full set of 16 AWESOME chalk-markers in thin & broad tips & great neon colors that really pop on that black background)!  Something I'll use for a very long time and I know now, I should have simply invested wisely in the better materials rather than trust this other product that in hindsight is just too good to be true.

I am very disappointed in the photo quality of this printer.  It is beyond me how anyone can write a review and say that the quality of the prints are great.  Each of the photos are faded, and there is nothing you can do about it.  I compared a print from this printer to a canon print, and it was night and day difference.  I am not just talking photographs, but just printing color of any kind.  I also noticed that the black print is faded as well.  What a total waste of money.
Read the other reviews about how easy it is to hack this safe.  You can also check on line for the same info.

Like some of the other reviewers, I received a product with warped plastic bushings for the casters.  On two of the three casters that I attempted to install, the bushings broke or warped to the point of not seating.  I stopped my efforts at that point and initiated a return.  In my opinion, ordering this product is a gamble.  If the quality of the finish of your particular cart is adequate, you may have a good cart.  If the quality is like the one I received, you'll get to experience the always excellent Amazon customer service and shop for another product.

Nice compact printer that prints wonderfully via USB cord.  I worked for hours, however, to get the wireless function and was unable to get it working. Searched the web and HP (who now owns Samsung) tech help to no avail. Many, many other reviews complain about this same problem.

Box and packing was good,,Directions better than most, hardware of top quality,,Assembly,,may need a helper.I smiled when I received this chair ,,, Everything was going great untill I got to the arms in the Assembly. The left arm bolted up fine. The right arm however was a different story. Two bolts hold on each arm. One goes in the side of the back and the other goes into the side of the seat. The bolts screw into a nut welded to a frame of sort under the outer cover, two on each side. Three  of the four were attached so they were just under the cover and you could see them. Those three bolted right up without a hitch. The fourth however, the second of the two on the right arm,,well this is where I quit the smile. At first I could not even find the nut. The hole in the cover was there, but no nut. As a matter of fact, where that bolt went there was no frame either. I stuck a screwdriver in the hole and hit the frame ,,, three inch's futher in under the seat. Pushed the bolt in as hard as possible and got the bolt started in the nut and tight. Problem is that pulled the end of the arm in three inches. This in turned pulled in the side of the seat causing it to bunch up which was not going to work for me,,,this is a new $200 chair. See attached pictures.This can not be the only one!! These seats were not made one at a time by hand. They were mass produced making every single seat ran was bad untill it was caught. The factory, the dealer and maybe even amazon knows this chair has a defective seat. The bad part is they let it go. Well there options were throw all away,,, fix by hand each one or take a chance,,and not even offer a discount to us. This chair is what you call a"second" not of quality chair. Something else to think about is I read the reviews,,,no where has anyone even said a word,,,shame,shame,shame, Look at the picture's, they do not lie, Sure,,you can still keep and use the chair but I dont want a new car with a run in the paint, I dont want a pair of new shoe"s with a heal attached backwards and I dont want this chair....Once more this can not be the only chair like this,,,,the parts on this chair are mass produced.......

I'm happy that so many people like this but I don't think they have touched grass in some time.  When I opened the package it looked like a rolled up artificial Christmas tree. However when I opened the package to feel it, and it felt...like  artificial Christmas tree.  Sorry for the negative review.

This card stock is completely unusable. Apparently, I got a batch that breaks when it is folded. I tried printing the card both ways, with the crease inverted. Doesn't matter, both ways, it breaks and is terrible looking at the fold. f I could give it 0 stars, I would!

scale looks nice comes with a nice plastic cover but it was not accurate,  when I placed a known weight on the scale it would not read it correct,  was off and I noticed when I took the item off the scale and was getting ready to weigh something else it would start reading weight that was not on it,  I was planning on using it for reloading but I cannot trust it so I sent it back.  The product has great reviews but mine did not work.

This is great quality fill in calendar, HOWEVER do not get this if you need your planner planned out for 365 days! It’s only taking me from 1/1-6/18 which will cause me to buy another one to fill out for the rest of the year. This might be some what of a consumer error for me assuming there would be enough for 365 days, but at the same time I would not have bought this if I didn’t think it would hold the entire calendar year. I believe there needs to be a better description of the product, and if this was for a six month calendar I would have given it a 5 Star review. I am giving this only 2.5 stars because it’s only half a year.

I am not happy with this. I purchased it and cannot get it to work. No software came with it and I cannot find any on the internet. If i did, I probably would not be able to afford it. If I could get it to work, I may be able to provide a different review. I was so excited to get this but now am disappointed that I can't use it.

I got this US scratch off map as, like everyone else I would imagine, a way to visually track all of the states that I've been to.Previously, through this site, I bought a scratch off world map and it was amazing but I really wanted another one just for the states.Based on the pictures, reviews, etc. before purchasing, this looked like the perfect fit for what I wanted.It was a different story one I started scratching off the states.First, the included scratching tools are too harsh for this map and now I have a permanent indent somewhere around Flagstaff, Arizona before I finally realized what was happening and switched for the rest of the time to a much more effective dime.Secondly and the thing that bothers me the most about this map by far is that there are so many overlapping words/places.For example, if you scratch off Washington state, you have also scratched off the large word "Portland" from it's southerly neighbor Oregon, even if you don't scratch off Oregon.There are many examples of this but I doubt it would have been too difficult for whoever made this to just keep everything in a state IN that state.While I decided that I wasn't going to complain and return the item, I honestly wouldn't ever purchase one again for any reason or advise anyone else to.

Picture shown is of a base that the foot rest rocks on. The one I received does not have a base but rather a round bottom that rocks on the ground. The part number on the box matches that of the listing, so I don't know who screwed up here. The picture on the box matches what was in the box but not what was pictured on Amazon.So either the manufacturer changed the design and used the same part number and didn't tell Amazon or Amazon is just using the wrong picture. I don't know....As a review for the foot rest, it does the job but it's shorter than it looks. I have it on carpet so it doesn't slide around but I imagine on a smoother surface it would.

I was fooled by the low price and print output expectations listed by Samsung when I bought the CLP-325W.  I have printed less than 1,000 copies on this machine, and have replaced ALL FOUR toners, and the Yellow is already empty AGAIN!  I have called Samsung at least a dozen times; have been 'escalated' to tier-three level support, and still am not satisfied.  They basically refuse to deal with the issue of toner usage, saying it's all based on customer usage.  That's bunk!  Also, I'm getting smudging on the paper, and they say it's the image drum!  Another $100!  NOT HAPPENING!  I paid $199 for this printer, have spent over $300 in toner, and now they want me to replace the image drum?  I don't think so!  It's going into the garbage where it belongs!  I have been a Samsung customer for some time, and told Samsung about my other purchases (refrigerator, LCD TV, DVD, etc.).  They don't seem to care, so  I promised I would post my review on as many sites as I can find to warn other customers about this completely sub-standard printer, and the company's flat refusal to deal with my complaints.Samsung:  You've lost at least one customer, and hopefully others will avoid your products!End note:  2012:  I threw the printer out!  Good riddance to bad rubbish!

The calendar seems nice, good quality, no complaints. But as others have reviewed, it ships folded in half so when it arrives to you it never lays flat. This is completely crazy to me given that the entire point of the product is for it to lay FLAT on your desk. Not sure if this is an Amazon problem or the seller but somebody needs to invest in a bigger box and DON'T FOLD THIS IN HALF.

I do my best NOT to write reviews when I am upset.  But if I stayed with that otherwise simple rule, I'd never write a review of the HP Photosmart Wireless piece of crap.  I usually want to buy a printer that is easy to setup, easy to use, and easy to maintain.  The HPs generally promise each of those things.  The delivery leaves a lot to be desired.  If you are looking for trouble-free, look elsewhere.  First, I get printouts only sporadically. I have ZERO confidence that when I hit "PRINT" in whatever program I am in that I will actually get a print out from this HP.  It is wireless and three computers (and an iPad) and directed to it.  It prints MAYBE one out of five or six attempts.  It reports that it has a problem and 0% is printing, and it will try again in 30 seconds, which usually means it will print never.  Sometimes it works, most of the time it doesn't.I threw away the last HP desktop printer I had because it had "printer head" issues, and the one before it is forever turned off because my new HP desktop that it's connected to doesn't even recognize it, and HP Customer Complaint line -- it would be foolish to call it customer SERVICE or CARE because it is neither -- told me that the drivers for it are "out of date" and that they don't support them anymore.  Goodness!  You'd think there was some software that they could merely send me online that would "care" or "service" their past customers.But back to the Photosmart.  The look is fine, and the touch screen is cute.  But if you want it to print, this is not the product for you.  If you want to spend $50 every two months for 564 ink with moderate near-daily printing of a page or two, this is your printer! If you want mediocre printed photos that looks like someone smeared film over them or left them in the bright sun for days on end, you may have found your printer!This is an utter disappointment, and poor purchase.  As you see from the ratings, it is not a unique point of view.  Luckily, I didn't purchase a new $50 set of printer ink, because this one is leaving very soon.  It is impossible to recommend this to anyone who values NOT being annoyed, frustrated and disappointed with their online purchases.  Fool me once... fool me twice...

This is a horribly made product.  I only got as far as putting the wheels on and I knew this was a bad product.  The wheels do not screw in straight.  That's as far as i got because the holes in the frame do not line up so i couldn't go any farther, even though it was clear that there was no need to continue.  The pencil case came misshapen and the frame does not fit together well at all.  I contacted customer service with all the issues to see if they would stand behind their product and fix the problem.  Their only solution was that they could send me a replacement frame bar, while not addressing the pencil case and wheels that don't screw in straight.  I declined that option requesting that they send me an entire new box and a return label to ship this junk back.  They have yet to respond at that point and it's been over a week.  Clearly it's a bad product and customer service doesn't seem to be any better.Update:  Customer service never got back to me after I requested an entirely new box and a return shipping label for the horribly made one.  If I could give them a lower rating, I would.

Reading the reviews beforehand, I thought it would be more adjustable.  It would probably work fine on a square armrest, but did not work well on my curved armrest. It was always sliding off, threatening to spill everything out of the pockets.  There are lots of pockets, which is good, but they could've been sized better for remotes (the pockets were too big and the remotes would lean this way and that, making the whole thing more unstable).  It's not very attractive either, which I didn't think I'd care about when I bought it, but seeing it on my chair it always drew the eye and looked bulky and out of place.  It's an okay product, but I have buyer's remorse after this purchase.  It's stored away in a closet already, and I've only had it a few weeks.
Very good cart and would rate it higher if the wheels were better. Within the first week the wheel housing bent. Just not worth the money if u can't move it around.

These pens are comfortable and I like that they write well on very hard surfaces without the roller skipping and leaving blanks. Overall, I find the ink flow to be weak and for that reason I give them only two stars.  For a given pressure, my Pentel ENERGel pen writes about twice as dark as the BIC Atlantis.  See my attached photo. Even if I press much harder with the BIC, the ink is less dense than with the Pentel.  For that reason, I don't recommend these pens. Get the Pentel.

the hopper on the top of this bill counter is at such an awkward angle. You have to put the stack of bills in at JUST the right angle otherwise they draw in crooked and jam right away. You can’t put more than 100 bills in either or it jams numerous times. Spits the bills out at the bottom quite bad as well. I’d give it 2 stars counting 20s/50s/100s and 1 star counting 1s/5s/10s. It literally can’t count a stack of singles without jamming or throwing an error. I have a royal sovereign bill counter which works 1000 times better for only twice the price but what do ya expect for $69. Would not recommend for any large quantity counting or bundling. It just sits in the closet now as I went over the 1 month return window. Not even using it. Waste of money

Product was horrible I ordered multiple toners and when printing the pages they all came out with horrendous streaks and unable to read reports I work in a professional field and reports are crucialI wouldn’t even give a star that is only because it was prompted to continue

One star for the color. zero for the rest. listen to the other reviews. I could have made a nicer planner myself. The quality of the binder is very poor as well as the thin paper used.  I don't usually leave feedback but this was a must.

Product works great but buyer beware as other people have said. One of our lids arrived cracked. Left a message with their customer service - if they send a replacement, I'll increase my rating because they do work for what I need them for.

I've used these labels to organize drawers in two different rolling carts (for scrapbook stuff). Easy to use and prints great, but like other reviewers, can't get them to stick! They curl up at both ends, and they are just on the front of plastic drawers. Not like they are being washed, or even touched for that matter. They are simply sitting there and still come off! I guess I will put clear tape across them, but don't think I should have to do this with the amount I paid to begin with.
Gift - no review

I had hoped these would be perfect for my office and soften the glare from the ceiling lights.  I opened and ironed them, as reviews had suggested, but when I put one up it looked awful!  It gave a yellow hue to the room, and looked like I had hung an old, dirty, yellowed parachute from the ceiling.  I packaged and returned them the next day.  I will say that a colleague has the ones with the clouds and they look much better, though give a bluish tint to the space.

I just received this a week ago.  Three out of the four tops were damaged.  One bottom was damaged.  I tried calling, TWICE, and left my name and number.  No return phone call.  I was just looking to replace the tops, as the bottom just had a small crack.  I am moving and don't have time to be hassled with returning.  So, here's my review.  Annoyed.  Don't buy IRIS!

This printer is complete trash.It worked for the first year, but then maybe because we rarely used it.  We probably printed less than 200 real pages, and 300 or more aligning the print head, printing again because of a bad first attempt, printing a "print head cleaning page".  Quality went downhill after that with smeared ink, missing colors (despite FULL ink cartridges), on every attempt. Now after 2 years, I have the dreaded "Print Head Error".  For the $50 they want, I'm probably going to be better off going with a new Cannon or Epson, even though I have a full set of unused color cartridges that I paid $45 for (anyone want to buy them?). With Lexmark "quality" I know the print head will just fail again in a year. And yes, I updated to the latest firmware.  Although I don't see why I should have to do that.  Why can't Lexmark make a printer that will PRINT, without the need to update?When I bought this 2 years ago the star rating was over 4.  Now look at it, 2.8!  These do not last.  The only "good" thing about it is the low cost black ink, otherwise I'd give it zero star, instead of one.

Not being one to write reviews, I felt compelled to write on this pencil.  Cutting to the chase.....Pros:  Cool design, great look, nice feel (maybe a bit light).  Gave 2 stars because of the design and look only.Cons:  Breaks lead.  I mean into tiny bits.  No chance of getting through one inch of lead, let alone the whole stick.  Then those tiny bits clog up the internals, requiring a complete take-down of the pencil to clear the bits out, only to resume breaking the lead all over again.  It is exceptionally efficient at snapping lead into fine bits.  Not sure I stressed this point enough.  I would not recommend, nor will I ever purchase another one.Rotring pencils are much, much better.
I bought this ink and printed 3 pages and it reads empty, I returned and got my money azback.  WILL NEVER ORDER AGAIN ...  I wouldn't let me post till I rated it ...  NO STARS GIVEN ...

I had to drill out the alignment holes to make it fit.  It over heated and would shut off the first week I had it.  It is winter time now so it is working well.  It seems much brighter then my original bulb so now it is working great.If your handy and have a drill to drill out the alignment holes then the $35 price tag VS $300 might be worth the risk.  But it is a risk.  Looking at the other reviews looks like a 50/50.  Its now working out for me but the first week I was disappointed.  Don't expect it to work and then if it does you will be happy you saved some serious cash.  If it fails, oh well.

With HP constantly updating their software it is making items like this totally useless I read the reviews and it says it works with my 6500A with HP constantly updating their software it is making items like this totally useless I read the reviews and it says it works with my 6500A But after about a month of trying it never works never came on I was not compatible with my printer even though the reviews and question responses from the company said it would.  they have to modernize the chipping and keep with the updates HP doing. if not I’m stuck just buying HP ink. Had to return. P.S. I removed all the packaging and tabs as instructed I took out the cartridges and put them back, I turn off the printer took off the printer I even rebooted my HP on my laptop to see if you would accept  it and no dice.

The printer died out the second day, it start emitting grinding noises and then i realized there are alot of bad reviews on this item. DONT PURCHASE SAMSUNG PRINTER!!!! Very bad experience, never buying a samsung printer ever again.

The workmanship is shoddy.  First of all, the picture showed a cup of coffee sitting on what appeared to be a hard surface, which was the part of the pouch that went over the arm.  Well, that "hard surface" is a piece of cardboard, like shirt cardboard, and it is not attached to the pouch in any way.  So to use it, it just sits in a little area with folds of material to hold it in.  Of course, the folds of cloth do not hold it in, or even come close. So the top of the pouch is worthless for any purpose.  Also, after less than a month, the stitching in the pockets is coming undone.  Also, as I have seen in other reviews, it doesn't stay on the arm of a chair very well.  Its like a balancing act puzzle how much stuff has to be in each side to keep the pouch from slipping.  All in all, not a very good product.  I would not recommend it to anyone.

Advertised as good for carpet... I weight 160lbs and my chair sinks into this. It leaves bent craters in the mat, and I'm unable to roll around. Might work on a hard surface, but 1 star if you ended to use on carpet.No major problems with smells, no major problems with unrolling.

I was very excited to use these during our next move. However, they ended up coming with no lids. The shipping rate to get a replacement is going to be here after we are already gone. Was excited about this purchase however, it did let me down.

I had read the reviews of this board before ordering, and didn’t mind that the letter “d” was off centered since i have a separate set of letters i was planning on using anyways, but the board arrived damaged. Two of the sides were disconnected at a corner. The box was also damaged upon arrival, so I’m not sure if it was broken in transport of it the quality of the board is just super poor.

This is the second review I wrote for these markers, but the first one disappeared. Perhaps this one will stay so I can let others know how this stained my chalkboard permanently.I was really excited to get these chalk markers for our family chalkboard that we are constantly decorating and updating, and I was tired of using old school chalk. The markers are vibrant colors, but not at all like the color shown on the package. But, I figured for the price it would be fine. The really do cover well. You can't see the chalkboard under the color.However, when I went to wipe off the chalk to decorate again, the color would not come off. I tried everything to get this off.  I did as directed "Simply use a clean, damp cloth". Nothing. Soap, goop off, Fingernail polish remover. Nothing worked. I had to waste time and money to get chalkboard paint and paint my perfectly good chalkboard that we've used for years without any issues. So disappointed in this product.If you are looking for a chalk marker that won't come off, then these could work. But if you're looking for something to wipe off then keep looking. They list this as "EASY TO ERASE" and I have to wonder what they tested that on. It surely wasn't a chalkboard. The only thing that seemed to erase was my review
I am very disappointed with this product. The description said 3 inches but the stars are barely 2 inches tall. In the picture I took, I have against it against a canvas that is 3x3.

I have to give this only 1 star because my 2nd toner definitely did not work.  I put it in new out of the box and it prints so faintly and it acts like it's not done.  One good toner, one bad, not sure I can trust either.  I work for a church and we don't always go through this stuff quickly so it's past the return window.  Disappointing.

I usually don't take the time to write a review, but this item is such a waste of time, money and energy...got this a month ago and it is useless.  I have tried everything i could think of to get this thing to stay put with no luck. It is not adapter for large recliner arms. It keep falling no matter what i do. I even tried to put little weights to ounterbalance the weight of the remote. To no avail. Would put minus 5 stars if i could. Don't waist your money

this product deserves no star ! scale is way off from actual, i placed my 26' measuring tape on it and showed 0 g, Proceed to calibrate scale with known 1000g object and it keeps showing err on screen, going back to my trusty old mechanical scale..

I got a 10-cartridge combo (the item is now removed from Amazon) which is now removed, but it's still same cartridges just in different counts and I really feel the need to share my reviewAnyway, after I installed the set the first page came out really nice.  Shortly after the printer complained that magenta cartridge was not installed.. Cartridge re-seated, but magenta still doesn't print.. I  was printing something that didn't really all the colors so I let it sit.  Then today I need to print some photos for a school project.  half through one 4x6" photo all colors fade.  I printed probably 15 pages all together since the cartridges were installed, including a couple of color tests and clean print head pages.  I removed the cartridges thinking that they must be re-seated again.  They were empty."That was quick," - I thought.  I installed a new set.Half of a 4x6 photo came out almost right, but the other half became unnaturally blue.  I reprinted it again.  Very blue through the photo.  Adjusted the photo digitally for more yellow tint (not original cartridges, probably the yellow is not bright enough?).  Reprinted - super blue.  got yellow cartridge out.  the cartridge itself is contaminated with blue.  Strange, I didn't see it before.  Did cleaning, printed color test.  All colors were way off.  Magenta square had a wide blue line in it.  Orange had a wide green.I pulled the whole print head and found it flooded with ink.  I guess that's where all the ink went from the first set!  Looked inside of the printer - the pad that remove excessive ink was full of goo.  Big ink spot where the cartridge rests.  Even if I replace the print head the pad still needs to be replaced too or it will contaminate it all over again.  Basically the printer is dead.  Going to see how far the warranty will go and update my review.

I have had this printer since last March. I used it literally a handful of times to print some color labels for my biz and for a handful of blk and white prints. It started having a stripe pattern on the left hand side of the page ruining several labels- this happened two days ago. Then a piece of paper got stuck in the orange roller ball thing at the top- guess what, it is impossible to get paper out of that thing, no dials to move it and if you touch it is is damaged and ruined. Also no way to take that piece out if you try to.I live chatted with Samsung support. They were useless- gave me links telling me to replace the toner and then clean the printer. The paper jam link video did not address something getting jammed in this area, the orange roller ball or whatever it is called.I have hardly used this, it doesn't need toner, the inside was practically spotless.The agent informed me that my warranty was up, based on when it was manufactured- who warranties their products based on that?If I produce a receipt I get to ship it to Samsung, pay for that and possibly get it back in some sort of working condition, but who knows for how long. If not I have to pay for everything and who knows how long it will take or how much it will cost.If I remember correctly I paid $150 for this- it's not worth it. This is imo a very bad purchase, it seemed great, truly, I was very happy with it, but now I truly regret buying this printer. I liked the price and the size since I don't have a lot of space. I may sell it for junk and then buy something of better quality, hopefully, and which is unfortunately a lot more expensive as well as humongous.UPDATE: after 4 communications with Samsung CS 3 online and 2 phone calls I have still not got this resolved... I was asked to send a receipt for my purchase which I did twice. My first 4 hour chat where I gave all the information was LOST by the inept cs agent. At the first phone call I received an apology and I was told I would be sent back a label to ship this printer back for repair as soon as my receipt was received. Now I'm on the phone with an agent named Byron, who is telling me instead of sending me a label to ship back the printer I have to do a firmware update.  He is rude/smug and is now insisting I have to now do an update, yet this will not resolve a printer jamming paper as far as I know and this will not resolve printing a stripe a long the left side of the page as well as randomly printing all over the place. He is a very smug person who likes to bait people and not HELP them.  He informed me that a supervisor was not available to speak to me, but I will get a call back. I will believe it when it happens. Like so many other "US" companies Samsung now ships out their CS calls to the philippines or somewhere where people can barely speak english and who try to keep you on the phone for several hours. After 2 minutes with those people you will feel like you want to strangle them. Then eventually if you demand better help you will get transferred to someone in the US who speaks english- the first CS I spoke with in the US was fine, But Byron was not, he is your typical nasty human being who loves to cause problems for people. I have now wasted too many hours of my life trying to get this resolved. My advice to you is DONT BUY ANYTHING FROM SAMSUNG. I never will again. They make good tv/monitors and I was thinking of buying one at some point but I now will NOT do that.  JUST DON'T DEAL WITH SAMSUNG, DON'T BUY THEIR PRODUCTS- IT'S NOT WORTH IT.  I hate companies who don't stand behind their products and who maltreat customers.In addition I feel very upset that I was lied to and given several different stories about what to do with this and the last agent was just plain nasty- unfortunately he has the same name as my noble cat Byron- he should change his name to rat fink...lol. This company just gives you the run around, so don't fall into this booby trap- listen to the 1 star reviews, they're dead on. Please feel free to message me with any questions you may have about my review.UPDATE 2:Just to let you know- I somehow managed after much trial and tribulation and MORE phone calls to Samsung to get a return shipping label sent to me and I shipped back my printer for repair- this past SAT at 3 am, jan 11, 2013 I received an email from Samsung saying that they had not received the printer and that the repair ticket had been cancelled. I fortunately save shipping receipts and looked up the tracking number at UPS. It was delivered and signed for on Jan 11, 2013 by someone named Kim. I called Samsung today and an executive cs rep eventually made a new ticket for my repair. No apology or anything, although she was polite. This company is completely INEPT. I will let you know if it is actually found and repaired now. BTW, I did put all of my information inside with the printer, although the UPS label should be enough to give them that. The CS supervisor who did return my call was very rude to me right off the bat. I gave it back to him and he then purposely did not send me the return shipping label. I complained about him to the next CS rep who sent me the label online as we spoke. I also emailed the president of samsung with an email I found online- I received two phone calls from people higher up at Samsung so I think this was his email. My advice to you if you get into this situation is to persevere. If I get a new printer or advance to something else I guess it will be worth it maybe. I would have preferred to get my money back but it was too late for a return to amazon.UPDATE 3:I have finally received my printer back.  I don't know what happened with Samsung cancelling the repair ticket and if they had really messed up yet another part of this it REALLY wouldn't surprise me at all, lol.  I  have tested my refurbished printer and it seem to be working ok so far. We will see if this holds up or not. For the first time I printed larger images and I have to say that it doesn't handle them very well, the tones  are VERY dark overall. I will try printing on photo paper next time and see if it makes a difference. It has been fine for the labels I did, but I don't think I would use it for photographs very much.

I have all my life owned HP printers and I am sad to say that this is by far the worse model they have put out. HP got too "smart" on us this time, just look at all the negative reviews and you will find out why. The great advantage that I thought this printer had over the previous models I owned was that it uses 4 individual ink cartridges instead of 1 black and 1 color, which I thought was going to allow me to save on ink. This sounds like a great idea if it weren't for the fact that these cartridges are not like the ones we have been used to all our lives; these cost $10 dollars each and (at least from the black one) you won't get more than 30 normal-quality, text-only pages printed per cartridge. Gone are the good-old days when one could print homeworks, emails, coupons, etc. at home without worrying too much about the ink levels. I also noticed that while the cartridges might still have ink left, the quality starts decreasing quickly until it becomes unacceptable and you will need to change the cartridge anyways; be ready to stock at least 2 of each all the time. Think of this model as a bulky scanner that you can also use to print on emergencies cases, not as a home printer. I find it ridiculous that owning a printer I still find myself having to print at school to save money.

I am 190lbs and sat on this thing for 3 hours, it didn't soften at all. Its like sitting on a hard piece of plastic.I have 3 others cushions by different manufacturers that are fine.  I really can't understand all the positive ratings for this block of granite.

This is the WORST printer I have ever purchased.  I am extremely disappointed with almost everything on this printer.  It is extremely slow when printing, scanning etc., the print quality is horrible even with settings adjusted, the color printing is pointless, it also breaks constantly.  Even though hardly used, I have to clean the print head constantly (wasting ink) then the print head broke w/in a year.  When the print head does not work, you cannot scan...does not make sense.  I only used the black ink because the color was so poor, however, all the ink must be full to print, even in all black.  Ridiculous.  I NEVER write reviews, but this printer made me SOOOOOOOOOOOO mad I felt like I must warn everyone.

This is hands-down the worst glue I’ve ever used. The “restick” option means that the glue stays moist and gummy and doesn’t actually cause the two objects to adhere to each other. I have tried it several times with simple kids’ art projects, and it has failed every single time.  Even worse, it leaves a gummy coating on whatever you’re trying to glue so that you can’t just use a different glue (i.e. regular glue stick) over the top of it. I would give it zero stars if I could. I can’t say enough bad things about this product. It is completely useless.

The description says colorful, the picture is colorful, what I received was black and white. After reviewing some other posts, this seems as if it only comes in black and white.I bought these specifically to color coordinate my week. Maybe I can hunt down different color markers and try coloring them myself.I'm giving 1 star because I passed up several other similar magnets that weren't in color to buy these. The entire purpose of my purchase was negated. Minus that they aren't bad magnets.

I never write reviews, but hate this thing so much, and think that it is such piece of crap, i just had to write this. Really it deserves 0 stars, not one. Wireless will seldom work, be prepared to re-setup this thing every time you want to print. Just bought all new ink cartridges and it tells me they are half gone already. Next day it tells me they are all corrupt and i need ot buy new ones. Haver to take all ink cartridges out and clean them, reinstall, re-setup, wait 2 minutes for it to print the stupid system page, then start all over every time i print. Takes FOEREVER to print even the simplest B&W document, stalls in the middle of printing pages for no reason. I have not even tried to print photos, I doubt it can. Possible the LOUDEST printer ever, the entire desk moves when it prints. Warm up will take about 5 minutes. What it's doing, i have no idea, but makes so much racket I'm surprised it doesn't just fall apart. Here's the funny thing, we got this printer for free at the apple store because they screwed up on our order (long story) and still I am so disgusted with the quality and reliability of this printer that I am taking 5 minutes out of my life to write this review.  And because of this experience I will probably NEVER buy another HP products again. If they make junk like this, and this is one of their flagship printers, i can only imagine what kind of other crap the are selling. Don't waste your money, don't believe sympathetic reviews that HP is probably paying for, stay away. Really, stay away. You will want to throw this piece of junk on the garbage the day you take it out of the box. If you really want one come by my house, this thing will be sitting out on the curb, for free. Maybe some homeless person can use it as a stool.

Giving it a poor review because both cartridges didn't work. Now waiting until next week for a kit that is supposed to clean the nozzles. This printer had been sitting for a while, it may be possible that nozzles are plugged with dry ink, will look at changing review later.

Within a week of buying this the frame broke off which is why I rated it a two. On the bright side the actual board doest require the frame at all to be safe to use. Overall a okay board, but could be much better. There are better boards out there for around the same price. So buyer beware.

wow..this is my first Amazon review and I am only writing this to warn future buyers of a TERRIBLE product.After EVERY page I get an error..the first time this happened I immediately called tech support and the guy went through every step in the book to resolve my issue..When he couldn't, he suggested that I return it to the store I purchased it from. So I did the next day.Well guess what..the second printer I received had the SAME stupid issue.DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER............To clarify my problem after printing I receive this notice: "There is interference with the _______ Ink Cartridge Communication"(it varies from print to print between which cartridge is not "communicating", usually between either the black or magenta cartridge)What is really odd is that when I open the top to "fix" the issue, it will print one or two pages, then give me the same error, sometimes with a different cartridge (it doesn't matter if I remove and reinstall, or do nothing).What a waste of $200................I thought I was getting a great deal because I rarely use color ink, and at $5 for 500 or so pages of black ink I figured I could not go wrong..unfortunately I picked the wrong printer/company.
Product received was of very low quality. catridge cover is of the least quality and was open. Ink was spread all over as seen. Not sure how this product getting a 5 star rating.

I received my printer ink cartridges today.  The first cartridge (C) I installed worked properly with NO warnings.  3 of the cartridges (2Y,M) didn't work at all and I get warning messages about them which I never got from other alternate ink sources.  Even after telling the printer to continue the install and it did so, still 3-failures.  Product quality control appears to be negligible.  The ratings on Amazon were good.

I usually go by the reviews if I'm not sure about something and the Dachshund had alot of wonderful reviews so I did order it. I was very disappointed when I saw it. I tried to like it telling myself it was like a cartoon character but it had too many pits all around it which made one leg deformed looking. I'm really surprised at all the great reviews, I must have gotten a lemon!

BEWARE..  I was foolish enough to ignore the reviews about the bad video quality thinking I would have better luck.  No dice!  As per the instructions I did not mount the camera on the sunny side of the house and still the image of the person at the door is just a black blob.  You cannot make out any details about the person what so ever.  I have already removed the camera as it is junk.  It's amazing that companies can put HD cameras in phones that are 1/8 inch thick, but this huge box has a camera that is from the 80's in it.  STAY AWAY unless you want a nice phone.

I've been working from home and replaced a very old mat with this mat.  Within a year, the mat started to develop small cracks.  Now the cracks are getting larger and I fear they may snag my carpeting. I, like many people have added a few Covid pounds but I don't think this should happen when I now weigh 155 pounds.  It doesn't look like this product is even offered, but I thought I would write a review incase it becomes back in stock.

I was looking for a bright red-orange. After reading the reviews I thought this would work well for me. Sadly, I found this ink very light and pastel. I can't imagine why they named it "Brilliant".  I won't be using it at all.

I use to keep papers in files.  I have files from 10 years ago that the rubber band has held up better than these.Hate to write a bad review but have been finding one after the other to be too quickly dried out.Whenever I go back to a file with these bands, it has disintegrated.

I’m not sure how this got such high reviews. The top and bottom drawers do not slide in and out at all. The middle drawers slide fine. The quality overall is poor., cheaply made. I do not feel this is sturdy at all.  Buyer beware. I would NOT recommend!
Was ready to give all the stars, then this morning I pulled it out of my bag and it has split on the binding.  Would like a refund or replacement.  :(

The brown color is a little too light for my liking but that only killed one star.  The other two came from my bottle only having 21ml in it instead of 30ml.  I guess you can't expect perfect bottle forming but this was a little ridiculous. On the left side of the bottle the cavity only come 1/2 the depth of the bottle.  I have a lot of other 30ml bottles and none of the others are this bad.  Should have gotten a 40% discount for this funny bottle.  Oh well. Just have to switch back to royal blue sooner than I thought I guess.

these cards are the worst strathmore has to offer. i love their watercolor paper, which is why i went for this brand. but these cards are so heavy and feel like they are coated with wax. water actually repels off of them. you can't layer any colors and none of colors were true to form. reds come out as weird pinks because of the coating, greens are dull... so disappointed... see the full review at my blog with photos. [...]

Like others, wish I had read the reviews prior to purchasing. The file totes are not durable…3 of the 4 arrived broken (shattered pieces in the bottom of box). They were shipped without any bubble wrap or padding. Very disappointed. Poor quality.

The eraser part works well. The grip is a little slippery. The case is super cheap plastic but that shouldn't be an issue. I would have rated this 4 stars because it provides all advertised functionality well, but mine came with a scratch down almost the entire length of it.

This is one of the more worthless printers I've ever used.  Do not, under any circumstances, ask it to print more than one page at a time.  It will print 1/2 a page, if that, which will take approximately 5 minutes to accomplish.  The one star I give for decent print and scan quality, when it decides to work.

Save your money. You're better off using a steak knife to sharpen your pencils. This flimsy piece of garbage cannot sharpen your pencil. It will make a lot of noise and shake like crazy. The amazing thing is that not only will it partially sharpen 1 side of your pencil, it somehow manages to crack the pencil. I wish I could give it zero stars. I'm returning this rubbish today.

I was hopeful when purchasing this, but like some of the other reviewers, I had issues with the printer. I ordered 3 of the black and 2 of the color cartridges and only 1 black and 1 color worked. Of course, it ran out and the others didn't work right when I really needed it too!From now on I'll just pay the couple of extra bucks for the legit Canon cartridges.
I bought it for a spare. By the time I got around to testing it the return time has passed. My printer rejects it as not OEM so I reasonably cannot review the product

Returning.  I needed some index cards to create 'flash cards' for foreign language study.  These are not nearly sturdy enough to stand up to any sort of regular use.  I don't think they can even fairly be called 'cards', as an actual playing card has more heft to it than these things.  They are pretty colors, and they are spiral bound, and they are ruled with regularly spaced lines . . . but other than that, the description of "index card" falls flat.Speaking of flat, Amazon tells me photos work better than text in reviews. Fine.  Here's a photo - edge on - of the booklet of cards.  See the warp in the stack?  That's what thin 'cards' with no heft will do - they can't keep their flat plane, even when bound together in a pack.  Useless.

Its a good badge holder. I give it 2 stars because the clip that holds the badges to the lanyard is plastic and the badges fall off. I almost lost my badges a couple of times due to them falling off because the plastic clip bends and allows the badge holder to come off without notice. If it came with a better clip or a more secure way to hold them  I would give this 5 stars easy. I had to buy a new lanyard with a metal clip to help make sure I don't loose my CAC card. Hope this review helps.

Well, my "Like New"  binder from the marketplace arrived yesterday. It is rather hilarious. I look for all my purchases in the marketplace, have been disappointed only once, and returned the item for a prompt, no-hassle refund.I'm tempted to keep this Daytimer binder in hopes that someday it will be an extremely rare and priceless collector's find.It is beautiful... It is "Like New" indeed,  its stitching perfect and everything in precise alignment. But here's the hilarious: when I opened it the pockets were all upside down! The "snap strap" had been sewn to the front, so that the binder's snap closure fastened to the back. If I held the binder correctly with the snap on the front, opening it gave me an upside-down interior, insuring that everything would come flying down out of the pockets. If I wanted the interior correct, with pockets all right-side up, I had to turn the binder 180 degrees and snap the strap onto the BACK side.Also, not one single element of the very helpful  "starter component" was included."Like  New"??? Ridiculous quality control on four fronts; the sewer, the Chinese factory's inspection, the Daytimer USA supervision over QC in China, and Amazon's marketplace evaluators for listing something so screamingly defective, missing as well the very helpful "start-up" component, as "Like New."First time, for me anyway, that the marketplace has gotten it all so wrong. But it was definitely all worth a laugh. We can all use that, I suppose!Returning it today, a perfect-condition "Like New" DT binder, if one would happen to enjoy using it upside-down and without the starter filler. One star, sadly.

For some reason, it wouldn't let my laptop cool. If I had my laptop on a table, my laptop would be fine, wouldn't overheat. On this, my laptop would get SUPER hot - so hot, that some of the plastic on this melted! And it didn't happen just once. I would be internetting and all of a sudden smell hot plastic. It got to a point where I had to stack a textbook on top of the lapdesk to use the lapdesk but keep my laptop cool. Also, I wasn't a fan of the beanbag cushion ... it just wouldn't sit as comfortably and straight on my lap as I would have liked ... not as much stability as I would like either. My macbook would just slide all over this thing.On another note, my puppy got a hold of the cushion on this thing for less than two minutes and next thing, bean bag fillings all over the bed ... didn't factor this into my rating, though.Had to toss it out. Won't be getting this again despite the appealing price. I think an extra $10 will be worth the investment.

I should have read the reviews. I don’t understand how this planner is so successful with its inconsistent calendar. When I read that it was a 6 month planner, I was fine with that because I was excited about the idea of the planner and figured I would just buy another one once I finished. What I can’t understand is why there are only 13 weekly pages in my calendar. It is frustrating that I can only use this for 3 months. Not worth the price.

I've had this printer just about two months. I've been able to print successfully (either wired or wireless) exactly TWICE.I've been able to print via wireless without problems exactly ZERO times. The two times I was able to print involved me having to go up and check printer- it had turned itself off. Turned it on and it appeared as a "new" version of the same printer (M2020) which I had to delete in order to print my original document.I knew I was in trouble when I started searching for support and I was directed to HP. I bought a Samsung SPECIFICALLY TO GET AWAY FROM HP'S CRAP MACHINES.This printer was highly rated by CNet (a rating it did not deserve) and, it was only $70. But, it's $70 of crap. Given my "return window" has expired, it looks as if this device is headed to the electronics recycling center. Maybe it'll get stamped into a doorstop or coat hanger where it will, you know, actually be useful.Yes -- I'M PISSED. I've been attempting to resolve this issue for the last SIX EFFING HOURS and it's just a nonsensical loop. Everything can see the printer but, nothing can be printed.

I print maybe 2-3 pages a month (I really only use it for emergencies), and now I've "run out of ink" after about a year. This is the 3rd time this has happened. Not sure how these things are rated at 4.5 stars, because they are a rip-off. It's like, 3 or 4 pages per dollar.

Wanted to like this to make my tiny apartment a bit more WFH friendly but after assembling I lied to myself that this would be able suit my needs instead of just disassembling and returning. It is wobbly, unstable and slants significantly downward from the supporting arm to the side that is freestanding. No matter how tight I make it, the table top does not stay flat— not just from side to side, but also the split to tilt feature I can’t tighten enough to stay level. You can not swing it to not be over the wheels (as advertised) unless you want your laptop on the ground. I’m using it as a printer stand for a very basic, light printer and it’s about to slide off, each day it slides further away from the support arm. I’m pretty handy and I can’t get this thing to be anything more than a headache. It’s added zero to my life other than just being in the way. Can’t even call it a table since I’m too afraid to put anything on it. Sadly after 6 months of trying this will be going on the curb for trash. Don’t waste your money, put the money towards a higher quality version. Wish I did. 1 star is generous. Great table if you want to keep 1 sheet of paper and a pen on it only… can’t write on it without losing your mind from its instability, but it can hold a single piece of paper if that’s all you need it to do. Would have preferred lighting my money on fire… would have enjoyed that more than this product.

This self inking rubber stamp locks up EVERY time I use it.  When I complained to the company, they told me to stick a pin in it to release.  So, if I pay 3 bills, it sticks all 3 times and I'm supposed to unlock it with a pin each time.  I'm giving up with them.  I will buy another "paid" stamp from a different company and toss this one.  I rated "easy to use" and "value for money" as 1 star because there is nothing lower.  Easy to Read...Sure, letters are big and easy to see as long as I have my pin to unlock it each time.  I've ordered and used rubber stamps forever and I've never had this problem.  The company is not standing behind their product and that is very disappointing as I've purchased dozens and dozens of items from Amazon, once or twice a return or problem immediately corrected.  Not this time.

Definitely not as good as I expected. The black part is made of thick plastic and not metal like I had hoped - also (as others have reviewed) the magnetic board is extremely flimsy: a sheet of thin magnet stuff glued to a piece of super thin cardboard. Skip this one and buy the metal boards from craft stores!
It is basically a bumper sticker. Shipping alone was worth more than the sign. 2-stars because it arrived in good shape and was more or less what was advertised.

This printer seemed great. As a gadget hound, I loved the fact that I could just send pictures from my phone, wirelessly, and have them print to the photo tray. Over time, and not very much at that, the printer started coming up with new and inventive ways to not print.About 99% of the time, it won't accept the paper...from any tray. It's so slow to attempt to print as well, so you'll be ready to throw it out the window by the time you've got a picture. Maybe if I fill the photo paper tray all the way...Nope. How about half full? Nope. How about if I only put one sheet of photo paper in there...Nope. How about a printing dance, and a let there still be ink chant? I think that worked...Aside from the fact that it doesn't want to accept any paper into its trays, it drinks ink at an alarming rate. I'm seriously considering an intervention. I've spent about $500 in ink, and have printed, maybe, 50 pictures. If you leave it sitting for a few weeks, the ink will just evaporate, and you'll be another $50 in, just to print that one picture you want.This printer does everything but print, so I'm only giving it one star.Hey, HP! Make your printers print well first, then add all the gadgetry.

Lamps replaced in three working BenQ projectors  all 3  were fine. Just needed  new lamps.  After replacing with lamps purchased from this store all began shutting down after one day in overheat condition.  Would not have given 1 star

I did not receive an amico business card holder for 144 cards. I received a chengna card holder for 240 cards. while it does what it's supposed to do, as other reviewers have noted, it is of cheap quality and not worth the $9 price.

Always have issues connecting via wifi with this printer. Finally called Brother and after 30 minutes of being on hold their tech support was no help and basically told me there was nothing to do. If I could give this printer and brother a negative star I would. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRINTER!!!

I like the chair and it was straight forward to assemble.  I would have given it 5 stars.  However, one of the plastic castors broke within the first 24 hours of use.  I am trying to decide if I should just return the product or go out and get better castors.
See other review.  Have to press down very hard to remove surface. Designs aren't that interesting.

This is the first time I have logged on to leave a review. The first 20 or so mailers that I used were fine. Today I went to use one and realized that there was no adhesive on it. I tried the next one with no luck. I went through about 20 more mailers before I found one with adhesive on it to use. I purchased too long ago to return. I will not be buying these again.

I've bought "aftermarket" cartridges for my Canon printer before. Never has a set given me so much trouble!I spent HOURs troubleshooting, thinking it was a printer problem -- I almost bought a new printer! Then I installed official canon cartridges and all the problems went away!A prior review says it best!"I ordered a pack of two black ink cartridges. I tried one but no matter what I do the printer does not accept it and throws an error that the cartridge is installed incorrectly. I followed the troubleshooting directions but it did not correct the problem. I can't waste time returning it and getting a new one because I have stuff to print........so I inserted the second cartridge and crossed my fingers. Luckily it works as it should and prints well. In the end I paid for two but only got one (working) cartridge."
I never write reviews but I felt I needed to let other people know that the ink is awful!! Don't waste your money!!!! While the colored ink is fine, the black ink does not work!!!

I don't know if the tape that came with this just sat on a shelf or in a box in a hot room, but the tape was all stuck into a single brick on tape strips.  I even tried to manually separate each strip, but all of the strips were so stuck to the next strip that this was immediately useless to me right out of the brand new packing.  It's too bad that I'm unable to give zero stars, for all of the time and frustration I wasted on this product.

I’m not normally one to write bad ratings but this deserves it , Giving this the lowest rating possible. It’s smaller than the dimensions given. The wheels do not want to work on it. And clearly Amazon doesn’t know how to handle their packages because I’ve purchased two of these both of them coming broken. I would rather just go to Walmart and buy one.

I ordered 2 of these for my classroom, and they won't clip together. The back right corner on all the pieces is bent in, prohibiting the rest from fitting appropriately into one another. They would have been perfect, other than that-- I rated it one star because I can't even use them.
I wish I had read all of the earlier reviews.  These files definitely do not fit into a regular file cabinet with hanging files.  They are not able to be used.

(I also posted this review on one of the refill pack reviews)I first bought these some years ago and they seemed to be ok. Then I bought refills. AAAAARGH!!! IF the initial protective strip pulls up the actual first strip of tape, it's a miracle! I have wasted more time, energy and patience attempting to peel a corner of the tape off the block to make these blasted strips work in the little holder than they are worth. DOLLAR TREE cheapo tape is sooooo much more preferable to these little devices of torture.Another problem (May be personal preference, however, I think not after seeing several similar comments), the strips are anywhere from 1/2" to 3/4" too long!! A lot of wasted tape.For the Scotch Adhesive Tape section, A) your control testing groups need to have a LOT more women on them! B) I suggest you "stick" with post-it notes and normal tape unless a more viable, cost-effective product can be developed.The attached photo shows strips of tape removed from multiple different refill blocks in an attempt to make even ONE work.

Very hard to sync with our Acer Chromebooks.  Took over two hours with Tech support.  Worked for a couple of days and then became a problem printing.  Have to unplug the unit every 4th or 5th time printing.  Tech support said we have to have a Windows computer to correct the problem.  We go rid of our Windows computer and our now using Acer Chromebooks.  Very odd.  Not sure if we should send the printer back.  The reviews said that this printer is one of the best and easiest printers to E print if we have a Chromebook.  So much for the reviews.  Big problem.  Samsung Tech support was little and no help.....  Good luck if you purchase this printer.......

UPDATE: Lexmark no longer makes commercial printers, so this review is only here for people buying used or new old stock. My recommendation: avoid ALL Lexmark printers. This company now has little incentive to do anything but sell you overpriced ink. The fact that black ink is cheap becomes meaningless now that they've caused this once beautiful printer to become crippled and useless without a full compliment of color ink. I have never used my color ink, yet it was empty within a couple months of purchase.Pros-----$4.99 for a 500 page black ink cartOnce setup, wireless printing and scanning is fast and easyEnergy StarGreat dynamic touchscreen controls5 year warrantyCons----Color ink still expensive but can be disabled on MOST systems.Though it used to be Easy to disable color printing, that's no longer true. Convoluted and complicated. Lame. Lexmark is nothing but an ink sales company now. Shame.After two years the wife's Windows XP machine now insists that I buy color ink even though I've never used any color ink and it's worked fine without color ink for ages. LAME. Both win7 machines still print in black and white just fine and the printer still copies fine and prints test pages. I guess she'll just have to suffer or join the 21st century of Windows sometime because I highly doubt Lexmark is going to fix this problem. I wasted two hours of calls, chats and screen sharing with their support with no satisfaction.Update:I have never once printed using color on my 901. I've had it since 8/25/10 (2+ years) and it started claiming to be out of all four color cartridges well within the first year. In that time and since I've been through several black cartridges. Then, a couple of months ago, my wife could no longer print from her XP machine. Lexmark claimed that I needed to buy color ink. I assured them I could still print just fine from my Win7 machine, make b/w copies, etc.. After a couple hours of chatting and letting them remotely control her laptop, they got it printing again by switching from "black ink only" to "all available" - which makes little sense, but whatever. If it made sense, they would have just fixed it instantly, more so, I wouldn't have had a problem to begin with. Here we are two months later, I just put a new black ink cartridge in the Pro901 and now it's trying to tell me it can no longer print in black and white from my Windows 7 machine because the color ink is empty. It's been empty for almost two years and I've printed just fine until now. What a crock of corporate profiteering @@!#%#. Lexmark stopped making commercial hardware (printers) recently, so they're exclusively selling ink. Clearly they're not interested in just selling us $5 cartridges. Great. I will not be buying any more from them. I'm through with this throwaway company. Let me know if a class action starts. I'll take time off to rub Lexmark executives' faces in ink of ANY color ;)Support is spotty at best. Lexmark no longer makes printers so to some extent they lack incentive to support products they've already sold.Wireless setup lacks good instructions for some setupsOn my Cradlepoint router I had to disable the User Login page. Not a huge deal, but added an extra 15 minutes of trial and error to the setup and removes one additional layer of security from my home wifi.Other:To disable color printing on a per-computer basis in some Windows systems:1. Open printers folder under Control Panel.2. Right click on the Lexmark printer then choose printing preferences.3. Check the box for "print only in black".I do not use the fax function on this device, but everything else works great. Got it for $175, but it's worth the $199 price I'm seeing now.Summary-------Great value (best around) for black ink. Wireless adds crazy feng shui possibilities. (I have mine hanging from the ceiling.) Poor support.

Received an already opened product. Which is why I am taking off 3 stars, since I believed I was purchasing a new item. The product itself looks and feels solid. The magnet and spring are pretty strong.

This is NOT compatible with the Canon MP470. Unfortunately, the canon ink we had lasted longer than expected and now I can no longer return the item. Very disappointed that it was advertised as being compatible, and there are even troubleshoot steps in the package in case the printer thinks it is not compatible, but they did NOT work - so not happy about that. Wish I could try to return it and then I could maybe give it a better review, but at least I can try to warn others.

I expected a PAIR of bookends, like the picture shows and the product details describe, as well as what others left in review. I only got one. I don't think I'll be holding very many books up with just one bookend. Planning on returning it.

This is a good product when it works. As you can see from my rating, it never works (would have given "zero" if it were an option). This was without a doubt the biggest waste of money I have ever spent. First off, it NEVER prints when I try to (an I mean never as in 0 out of 100 times). My only recourse is to delete the printer from my computer, reinstall it and turn the printer off then back on. Only then will I MAYBE get it to print (about 50-50). Wireless printers are a complete waste of time and money. I have yet to speak with someone who says theirs works correctly.DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. You have been warned.

These markers, though easy to apply (thus the 4 stars for “easy to use”) do not erase fully. We had to paint over the remaining “chalk marks” that would could not remove, despite our best efforts. A complete waste of money and time spent restoring the chalkboard. Very disappointed.

It's ok... the price is great! BUT, even considering the price, these cartridges come filled barely half it's capacity it seems, and does NOT last many pages of printing at all.. You get what you pay for is my review.

I was looking for a pen with the different ink colors.  I ordered two.  This one and the red, blue and black one.  I was so disappointed! For some reason the cartridge was unable to lock into place and made changing colors useless!  Only the blue worked in one pen and green in the other.  The green is light and hard to see as well, so both pens were a waste of money.  I don't have the time and energy to send little stuff back, so I learned my lesson and thought you'd like to know before you spend yours.  I gave it one star because it is the lowest possible.
Two crates were new, one had chunks out of the top and smears of black grease. Would have been 5 stars if they provided all new, undamaged merchandise.

These boxes are excellent from past use and were previously purchased from Staples.  The 4 plastic file boxes had to be returned instead of the missing parts being sent.  These is time consuming to customer and costs Amazon resources.  The box being sent back is 40x14x20 which would cost $40-50 if you were not a commercial business.  The customer person was excellent - I am getting new boxes 2-3 days.rating is based on missing parts on plastic file boxes - low friction disks that are on bottom of box

I don't usually take the time to write a negative review, but I want to let people know what my experience was. I bought an item like this from another company and really liked it and I wanted another one, but they were sold out. When I saw this one I thought it would be the same, but boy was I wrong. The frame part went together pretty well, but the drawers were a mess. About half the holes were drilled so close to the edge that they were slots, not even holes. I probably should have just returned it but I was half way in so I glued the places where the screws wouldn't hold and I just hope it will last till the other company gets more in stock. I was very disappointed.

I bought the desk, file cabinet and bookcase of this set and I am quite dissapointed in what I got.The file cabinet was the first piece we assembled. While everything fit together, as a previous review said, the parts do not line up well. One of the drawer slides is messed up and the plastic rails for the hanging folders are not supporting the weight of the files I put in there. When assembling the piece I noticed that it barely supported it's own weight until you nailed the back on. Which brings up my favorite part of the instructions. It tells you to take a screw and hammer it through the back into the frame.The Desk is about the same. Things don't line up very well and very cheap components (drawer slides).This set is not going to stand up to daily use. I just need to figure out how to return it.
I would have rated it higher but what I received clearly isn't what they have pictured.

They sent the wrong color but did rectify that once I sent proof of the packaging by sending them a photo of the box. That took a few emails back and forth to make happen.The new chair I received has a small hole in the back but because it took so long to get the correct color I let it go. Normally I would have returned it again but did not feel like going through all of that again. After giving it a fair amount of time to be tested (I have had it for a few months) I though I would review it.Plus: The chair looks nice, is comfortable and was reasonably easy to put together once you lined up all the holes. Based on looks it's quite nice.Cons: This chair leans way too far back to be useful as a working desk chair for me. It reclines and has a lever to stop the reclining mechanism from tilting back further. There are 2 reclining positions; too far back and way too far back. The amount of the recline on the upright setting is just too far back. If I lean back in the chair (my back against the back of the chair) I can not reach my keyboard even with my arms outstretched fully. The lever that holds the chair in this (not so upright) position tends to unhook itself and the chair tilts fully back. This can make you feel like you are falling as it tilts back quite far. Today It unlatched twice. The first time I grabbed my keyboard tray on my desk to steady myself and pulled the tray clean off while falling backwards. I was on a business call so not so professional to let out a whoop on the phone as you think you are falling. No points for functionality so not a good recommendation from me.

I followed all of the instructions, installed the software and connected the device. When I tried to capture an image it said "Scanner is not connected." I went on the Veho website and saw this problem in the FAQ section. Their solution is to make sure you are using a 2.0 USB port, and preferably one that is on your computer, not a hub. I was already doing that. Then it says sometimes it can't detect your scanner if you have other image capture devices plugged in (other scanners, printers) so I unplugged all of my other USB devices and restarted my computer. Still nothing. I uninstalled the software and re-installed it using the download on their website (instead of the disc that came with my scanner) and it still didn't work. I tried installing on two other computers and it didn't work on those either!If you could use this scanner with the native image capture program on your computer I wouldn't care about this issue at all, but it ONLY works with this software. Either my scanner is defective or (and I think this is more likely since somebody else already left a review saying it doesn't work with Macbook Air) it just doesn't work with macs. All three of my computer are macs (2 imac desktops and one macbook air, 2 running Lion and one running Snow Leopard.) so I can't test it on a PC for comparison but I'd definitely be wary of ordering this model if you only have a mac.

Update after 2 months:  The black is awful too. Changing rating to 1 star. Printing gray boxes/shading if splotchy and inconsistent.  Text is over-saturated like it soaks into the paper too much. This is unbearable and unusable professionally. DO NOT BUY THIS INK!  It is not worth the savings.  I've given up and ordered HP brand ink. It always worked very well, just is very expensive.------The black text seems to be ok, but the colors are horrible. Even "gray" highlighting is switched to blurbs of colors.  The colors are inaccurate unless I print on the highest/slowest print quality (using the most ink).  Anything less in quality an I get variations in darkness and totally inaccurate colors (i.e. red instead of gray, blue instead of red).  I will definitely NOT buy this again and cannot recommend it.  I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 simply because it was cheap so if you just want black only text with no gray, it is probably sufficient.

I've never owned anything... anything that has disappointed me more this piece of junk.  I also never write reviews but this thing forced me to warn others as it warrants a ZERO, I had to give it a one to register my rating. I am literally throwing this out tomorrow and getting ANYTHING other than a Lexmark.. Slow, unreliable, poor quality, etc. etc. etc.Just terrible!

Disappointed. While assembling the product, specifically when I got to putting together the stand, the bolt that was built in would not take the screw no matter how i turned it, the bolt was too large to secure the screw. And I made sure I was using the correct screw. Therefore, assembly stopped there and this item will be returned. I was excited for this product and it isn’t exactly cheap in terms of pricing so that was extra disappointing. I didn’t even get to see how well the finished product functions since my review is on the parts and quality of the parts itself. It looks like a sturdy desk and would’ve been nice if we were able to actually put it together! Im considering if I should exchange it and hope the replacement will actually work since I really do want a computer stand like this. But what a hassle!

Extremely cheap construction. My product came with scratches on the side of it. Plus the magnets don't work: they are tiny. If I try to put the eraser on the fridge, it slides off. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it actually erases.

I have never been so upset about buying a product.  So upset that I'm taking the time to write a review.  This printer is loud, the wireless works when it wants to (which is not often), the ink is very expensive since the cartriges are only good for a few pages or a couple of pictures.  Even worse, the HP help desk was worthless; I think they get a lot of calls about this printer.I stopped using the wireless on this and hooked up to my computer with USB.  Even then, did not always print.  I removed and then reinstalled this thing, had the HP help desk try and help again, it was no use.HP, you should be ashamed that you put out a product like this.  I use other HP products and love them; this one is a nightmare.I bought a different printer by another company and am very happy.  I do not want to name it here because then people will think that I work for that company and I'm just trying to knock HP down.To summarize, don't buy this printer.....actually, don't even accept it as a gift!

I installed it and printed about 15 pages. After that it told me the cartage was out of ink. By reading some reviews, I have realized this is a repeat problem. I paid 18 dollars to print 15 pages. DO NOT BUY!.

Seeing all the wonderful reviews I was looking forward to receiving my scale... but it didn't work! I kept getting an error despite trying both the battery and AC adapter. Nowhere in the manual did it mention what "ErrE" meant. I'm sure it would have been a great product if it worked as it is quite lightweight and simple to use.

It took a few weeks for me to install these as I wasn’t doing a lot of printing but when I did the black ink was completely smudged. Not even legible. I tried cleaning and re-aligning the cartridge but that didn’t help. Of course by then the return period was over. What a waste. The color cartridge was ok.Update: after contacting the seller directly they have agreed to send me a replacement cartridge. I guess if they do then 5 stars for their customer service. Just hope the replacement works.

I dont know if it is supposed to leak all over the place but i kinda of doubt it. writing with it is smooth but not only does ink come out at the point of the pen (the nib) but it comes out on the top of the silver part and then where the nib and black thing connects it leaks there to so when i try to write with it, it gets ink all over my fingers....and hopefully you write semi fast because the longer you hold the nib on the paper ink just pours out. it took me a while to write the review because i thought maybe that i was putting the ink in wrong or squeezing it to hard or something but i've even just put the ink in without squeezing it and the outcome is the same no matter what.

I am shocked by all the super positive reviews about this printer.  Yes it is easy to set up, but the host of other problems with it make this a printer that is going straight to the thrift store after only using it 5 times.  I simultaneously purchased a Canon imageCLASS LBP6030w Wireless Laser Printer also from Amazon for my office so I can genuinely compare two printers that are both inexpensive.  The Canon is not easy to set up if you have an Apple computer, but in the end far outweighs the Samsung in terms of performance.  Here are the issues with the Samsung:  It gives off crazy amounts of smoke after printing about 10 pages and starts to overheat.  The printer tray, more like an extended post doesn't hold the papers well, so they all collect in a haphazard way.  Lastly, the most important quality is missing, the print quality is not good, it prints quite light, so thinking it was the paper I purchased Samsung compatible paper and this didn't solve this problem.
