I have none of these issues with the Canon  http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00K5UZO0Q/ref=sr_ph_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1457824233&sr=sr-1&keywords=Canon+imageCLASS+LBP6030w+Wireless+Laser+Printer

I'm a little disappointed as I use the pens the ink will randomly not work. I have several of the pens that won't even write. The ones that do write I have to keep shaking as I colored my picture. Plus if you are not careful and you mix the pens up like I did you won't know what refil goes with what pen. The rolls are numbered so if you mix them up you have no clue what refills for on what pens so now I have no way of telling what roll the pens came out of to even use the refills. I have never had this bad of an experience when buying new pens. If I could give zeros stars I would. I feel this was such a waste of my money 🥺

The middle section of the stand was broken upon arrival, it collapsed after putting the slightest bit of pressure on it.  Someone clearly broke it and shoved it back in place. We were giving it as a gift and didn't have time to return it for a new one, so my husband was able to fix it by screwing on metal strapping. Very disappointing because otherwise I would have given it five stars easily because it's a beatufil item.

I work from home and spend probably 60 hours a week in my office M-F.  After hours and on weekends, my hubby and kids use the office for gaming or surfing the internet so I needed a heavy duty chair that would be in constant use.  I decided to try a big and tall chair thinking it would last longer than a standard chair.I was wrong.I've had this chair for one month and the gas lift has already started to fail (from getting up and down constantly maybe?), and the casters are really cheap plastic and break easily.  For a chair that's rated for big and tall, I was surprised the casters are so cheaply made.  The seat of the chair doesn't fit into the bottom snugly so it wiggles around a little -- not so much that it feels unstable, but enough that it's annoying.For my taller hubby, the seat depth is fine, but I'm shorter and it's uncomfortable for me.  I can't sit far back enough to support my back so by the end of the day, my back aches.  If you're going to use it for just a couple of hours a day, I think it's fine.  For long-term use, it's just not a comfortable, well-built chair.  I'm sending this back for a replacement.

This item was given to me for my review.The Quartet Stainless Steel Finish Magnetic Dry-Erase Board is a nice sized dry erase board with two pretty powerful post-it magnets. However, the item, in no way, looks like stainless steel, but just like what it is....silver/grey plastic. The magnets for the back of the board are not strong enough to firmly hold the board, and it slides down my fridge if you bump the board at all. I actually DO like the look, but I feel that the product is hampered by its description, which is a bit inflated for the actual product, and by the poor quality magnets that are included for the back. The company would have been better off using the same quality of magnets for the back of the board as they did the post-it magnets. If one does not choose to use the magnets, there is double sided tape that can be applied directly to the wall....with the knowledge that it might take off paint or paper if used that way, but that is just common sense. I think it would be great in a locker, but only if you used better magnets or used the tape because every time you shut the door, it might fall off. The board is useful, and I will use it, but it is not without defects. For the price, you are getting a functional,  but only if the buyer is willing to tinker with the product to make it work properly with magnets.

I was very excited about purchasing the new printer since I had recently gotten an iPad and wanted to be able to directly print from it.  The HP Photosmart Plus Wireless e-All-in-One Printer had received good reviews and the price was right, so I decided to order it.As with all of my previous Amazon purchases, this one came on time.  However, there was something wrong with the power button.  It would only power on maybe once out of every 10 tries.  I contacted HP customer service via e-mail and they gave me a few ideas to see if this could be resolved, such as plugging the printer directly into the wall instead of into a surge protector.  Nothing helped and I needed to return the printer.  This process took nearly 30 e-mail exchanges and an agonizing two weeks to complete.  I eventually spoke with someone in HP customer service who was in either India or Pakistan, but their knowledge of the English language was poor at best.  The problems ranged from not understanding why the old printer needed to be returned, to how I would receive a new one (or a reconditioned one, which I balked at immediately), to whether I would receive an HP gift coupon to purchase a replacement, to how I would return the old printer.As I mentioned, the process took a very frustrating 2 weeks to complete.  But the replacement printer works as advertised, although it is fairly slow to get started (it replaced an HP Deskjet, which was lightning fast in comparison), but doesn't have e-print.So, HP's customer service is truly a dis-service to the company, but if you are lucky enough not to receive a defective printer, you should be quite happy with the printer.  The wireless connection from my computers and the iPad works great.
I'm only giving this product 1 star in order to write the review. This stapler is tiny. A lot smaller than advertised.

The product itself is very good and rigid making it good for chairs used on thick carpet.  I have given this a rating of only two stars mainly due to poor packaging.  I read a review prior to purchasing this mat, with the same poor packaging complaint and had fully expected that it would be packaged better this time.  It arrived in box that was too short and too wide causing the mat to curl.  After multiple attempts of weighting the mat down flat and even trying to reverse bend it at the curl, it is finally usable, with barely a curling up at one edge.  This type of very thin material should be packaged in thicker, flat (cardboard the same size as the mat) and not in a box with room for it to curl.
I have a soured opinion of this product at the moment due to every lid and every box having defects.  I will review this in the future when the new product arrives.

Purchased the chair in February and it is now May. The chair has popped, like welds going bad in the seat base since day one. It has gotten extremely bad in the last 2 weeks and I am expecting it to collapse at any time. The pneumatic height cylinder is also failing, maintaining set height about 15 minutes. I am quite aware I am no lightweight since I am pushing 300 but for all of the manufacturer claims and ratings it should last longer than 3-4 months. Guess it is time to see just how good the manufacturers warranty or the extended warranty works. If they shine I might come back and raise their rating... I don't think I can go lower.

I gave this set to my mom, who is an avid colorer, as a Christmas gift. I read many reviews before making the purchase. There were loads of positive reviews. I asked my mom if she liked the pens and was surprised, tbh, by her answer. She says that the pens do not color smoothly and cut in and out. I was very disappointed to hear that. I guess I won’t think about purchasing this brand again.

I ordered 2 sets these cause they were a great deal and about the size I needed to consolidate school/office paper work. The attached lids meant there were no pieces to lose or misplace. The handles meant easy retrieval. However when I got them today, one box had half the handles missing, and therefore they can't do the job I need them for. If I had had all of the pieces it would have been a five star review...
Can't rate junk. And this is not a good scale, you have to buy special weights to calibrate this scale because it doesn't calibrate itself as most scales do.

As other reviewers have noted, some roads were poorly marked "other state route or major connector"; when we got to some of these roads they were dirt, and labelled "unmaintained" and "use at own risk". In addition, I am fairly sure that some of the roads marked on the maps do not exist. We looked for a couple of turnoffs off SR 160, twice going back and forth where they were supposed to be, without seeing them.This inadequate accuracy made the atlas worse than useless, since it cost money and time.

First, I use my printer for business, personal documents and graphics. I did a ton of research before picking this printer, which I've had about a year now, and settled on it because of the large format, pages per cartridge, and good reviews. What the hay do people print on this that they are left liking this printer?Print quality - sucks in color. Black & white is fine, but the color is faded regardless of what medium you print on, even when set for "best" printing and "vivid" coloring. Rich red looks like faded brick. Browns look gray. Everything has a grayish cast, actually. Nothing pops.Prints per cartridge - one of the other major factors I chose this printer for was the touted prints per cartridge. Maybe I could get that many out of cartridge IF IT ACTUALLY USED MORE THAN 2/3 OF THE INK IN THE DARN CARTRIDGE! I bet I get the same or less as comparable machines.Mediums - it SAYS it will print on card stock. Sure, if by "card stock" you use nothing over 60 lb. paper. If you use card stock, you know this is basically resume paper. Actual card stock will jam.every.single.time. you hit print for every.single.sheet. And, yes, this means most labels won't feed smoothly either. Excellent. And I for sure can't run fabric through like I could on my HP all-in-one.Paper size - this, unlike most, will print 11x17 large format paper. It will, however, require you to completely withdraw the paper cartridge and pull a dozen parts in various directions to make it big enough. And yes, you'll have to do this same operation, only slightly less complicated, for every different size of paper. THERE IS NO MANUAL FEED with which to print a few envelopes quickly. If you are doing letters, you will have to print the letter, pull out the tray and paper, manipulate the interior, put in the envelopes, replace the tray and THEN finally print the envelope, even if you are only doing one. What.a.pain. Sure you could use labels instead, except that it struggles to print things as thick as labels, remember? Large format also often leaves ink residue in the margins.What IS right with this machine - was relatively easy to set up. Wireless convenience is terrific (note: not compatible with my daughter's alphasmart, so make sure whatever you think you'll be printing from IS compatible). But wireless is in other brands, too, so that's not an advantage specific to this printer. Scanner, fax are both satisfactory.So, if you are debating between this and another brand of printer, pick the other printer. I wish I did.

If I could give this product zero stars, I would - it is an absolute piece of junk. My daughter is using it at college with a fairly lightweight laptop. It broke on the day it arrived, the first time she tried to use it. She put her computer on it and the weight of the laptop caused the top to split (the part that split was the non-tilting piece). She was not abusing it, she was simply using it as it is supposed to be used.This product is not suited for the purpose for which it is advertised.

ZERO STAR. Poor quality, started having printer head issues after using this ink. Before that I have been using Epson ink for 4+ years and never had a single issue with the printer. I hope I have not spoiled my printer.

the ink roll is way too light - everything is readable. so just a 10% ineffectiveness creates a binary choice. it just doesn't offer any security - so there's no mid-star review. I still have to send my documents to the shredder. I did buy another one a while back and it had darker ink - that was great - but this one is a disappointment.

This is a garbage pin and most definitely does NOT have a peso back.One star because at the minimum, it is a pin.It does not have a peso back like a far nicer one I had in the past.The metal of this pin is a cheap thin piece of junk, and the stamping of the letters and design is poor.Not as advertised, Misleading, junk, sad, sorry purchase.
The Thesaurus section gave only a list of 'words beginning with the same letter', not words of similar meaning! Now it does not work at all. Otherwise I might have rated this solver quite highly.

What I liked very much was the variety of colours in the 20-pack for a super price of $11.00 (not purchased at Amazon this time).  And they were highly rated so when I saw the price I jumped at it.Here is what I didn't like about them:1.  All light colours are darker than the pen indicates.  But to be somewhat fair, the paper quality has a GREAT deal to do with how the colour comes out. For example, I tested the colour on regular paper (your college ruled subject book) and each colour was darker.  Then I coloured in my colouring book and it was 4 shades darker.2.  Significant bleed through on the colouring book page (but none on the college rule book paper).  I believe the book I was using, has overly porous paper and I had to use 2 sheets of paper to keep the bleed from going onto the next colouring subject.  So I tried them on another colouring book with less porous paper and there was still bleed through, but not much - only dots, as opposed to full seepage.3.  They are not smooth feeling - very scratchy.  I would hate to use them to write with for any length of time.  Yet many of the reviews here loved them so much for both writing and colouring.I don't like them and I cannot recommend them for either writing or colouring.  Hope I can find someone who can use them cause 20 pens of colour I can't use...is too much (bummer).
I’m so sad that my experience wasn’t 5 stars, like others. My set (all 3) skip a lot. It’s really frustrating.
*warning*. False advertising of product.  This is not a 12 pack.  Wished I’d read reviews first.  Just an overpriced single marker.  Don’t buy!

I bought this printer and loved it for the first 4 months, about the 5th month, it stopped connecting to my computer. It would give error signals that the door was open when it wasn't, I would try to print something and it would say it was printing but it clearly wasn't. After messing with it for about 30 minutes it would suddenly start working again and then 2 days later it would do the same thing. So now every time I want to print anything I know its going to take me 30-45 minutes troubleshooting before it will start working again. And I hate giving this review because I have so many samsung products in my house (TVs, Washer, dryer ect.) that I love and never had problems with.

I finally replaced my ancient Handspring Visor with a shiny new Palm TX.  I was excited by the ability to play MP3s, download photos, and view videos as well as be able to take some work documents home with me.  Unfortunatly, what I didn't realize is that to use any of these programs you need to purchase an additional memory card - otherwise you won't have enough memory to do more than one thing. Other things I am not that happy with are: the graffiti is hard to figure out.  After years of writing on my handspring the same graffiti does not work on the TX; The on/off button is too small and needs to be pushed at least twice to turn on; I've had to reset the device because sometimes it doesn't turn on at all. Overall, i'm getting used to it.  I'm liking it more every day until something, like having to reset it, takes me three steps back. Bottom line, if you REALLY need all the things on the TX then go for it, but if not you may want to seriously consider a less expensive device. 9 MONTHS LATER:  I hate this thing.  It often does not turn on and all the fancy programs (even with a memory card) suck the life out of the battery.  Before considering this device go to the Palm website to read the complaints - mostly about the turning on problem.  I do not recommend this device - find something else.  I tried to change this rating to ONE STAR but couldn't.  The only reason I give it that is because the screen is a good size and has great resolution.

I purchased 3 of these. The first two came fine. They are beautiful and sturdy, perfect to display signs at out store. The third one arrived minus one of the legs that this needs to stand up. Amazon had great customer service and immediately sent another one, which arrived minus 2 legs and it was cracked. Amazon took it back but said they could not send out another one until they had done a review of their entire system to make sure there wasn't a problem (about a week). They also said they would get back to me when a new one could be sent out. 3 weeks later and I am still waiting.

The zipper sticks and the pens write in pastel colors only (orange, green, pink) and you can't read/see the ink.  Good concept, but not a good execution.  It's pretty to look at, but not very practical.  Stickers are a bonus and I like the pen loop:-)  This is why the product isn't a total fail or 1 star.

Update: seller offered to replace the product, will post update once resolved. Upgraded rating for being fast on response.Previous:Got three different patterns from this vendor. Like all of the patterns but this one seems to be the cheapest and I think I know why. The seams are unraveling at the finish point. If I try to tuck in the loose thread, they come undone and there are no give to safely try to rethread even with the forcep. And the thread is a heavy duty multiple strand kind that unravel at the end so it's hard to grab all at once to even try to fix it. Maybe going back.

This "calendar" is unusable. Every month's page starts with a different day of the week at the left! This is scrap paper at best. The review MADE me choose at least 1 star - but really, negative stars.
Would  Put zero stars if it let me. I opened the package and the box was all ready open there was no ink and on my computer doesn't even recognize this damn cartridge waste of money do not buy

I have now had the Lexmark Pro901 for almost a year, so I feel very qualified to finally review it at this point. I really want to like this product and give it high marks, but all-in-all this is not a good product and I would strongly steer you away from this printer and maybe even Lexmark products in general. I replaced an old and very well used HP Officejet with this product as an upgrade and hopefully to save on some ink costs.Maddening and frustrating having to deal with this product's printing and communication issues. I had my old HP Officejet for for 7 or 8 eight years and never once had these kind of problems. I will switch back to an HP product after this experience with Lexmark, I just hope that I can save you some of the pain I have had to deal with. Please buy a better product than this one and save yourself the trouble.PROS:-- The black ink cost is cheap and I do like that. I keep my printer set on draft quality and print in black only, so this has helped keep my ink costs down in addition to the cheap black ink price (the color ink, not so cheap).-- The touch screen interface is nice and easy to use, definitely a step up from my old printer.-- Print quality is good for text, photo quality is just average.-- I like the scan quality on this machine better than my old HP.-- It is more compact than my old HP, although most of the machines out there now are about the same size.CONS:-- If you have a phone line connected into the printer for FAX, the printer will come out of sleep mode and make alot of noise (even if it is not a FAX coming in). Then a few minutes later when there is no FAX, the printer goes back into sleep mode with a load starling noise. I finally just disconnected the phone line and plug it in whenever I need to FAX, which is infrequent.-- Setting up the printer to work on your network is not particularly user friendly. But the biggest problem is that I constantly lose communication with the printer over the network. Not just occasionally, but repeatedly. This drives me insane! I have had to reinstall the printer driver software 4 times over the past year to solve this problem.-- The printhead became dirty after about 3 months, so I had to pull it out and clean it off. Otherwise you get black or colored block marks all over your page when you print. I have had to do this several times over the past year to keep the printed page clean. If you are not technically savvy, you may feel uncomfortable doing this yourself although it is a fairly easy procedure. Nonetheless, this never happened on my HP and should not happen on this product either.-- To feed in an envelope to the printer, you must entirely remove the paper tray, pull out all of the paper that currently sits in it, adjust the paper guides in the tray for your envelope, print the envelope, entirely remove the paper tray again, return the paper guides to where they were, put the regular paper back into the tray, and replace the paper tray into the machine. It is a ridiculous setup, the designer should be fired.-- When lifting up the cover of the machine to copy or scan a document, the whole upper section tends to lift off of the machine. I am not sure why this happens, but it feels like you are about to break the top cover off of the machine when lifting it up. I am used to it now and know how to baby it, but it is a very poor design.BIGGEST PROBLEM:My biggest problem occurred after about 5 months of use. Paper started to jam in the printer, it got worse and worse, and then finally would not print at all. After about a week of interfacing with the Lexmark technical team, they decided the machine was broken and replaced my printer.......of course with a refurbished model and not a new printer. That was another instance where I had to uninstall and reinstall the printer driver on every computer. I did not have a printer for about a 2 week period, not even a free ink cartridge or discount coupon on ink for all the troubles with this new printer that had to be returned.

I have BAFFLED as to how this calendar has so many 5 star reviews! Did these people receive a different calendar than I did? The images are dull, blurry and totally uninteresting. If you follow Hubble images or NASA images on Instagram you’ll see what beautiful images are out there... but these are totally bland and look like they were taking with a 1980s LeClic camera... bitty, gritty and awful. Too embarrassed to give as gift. Too ugly to hang up.

The only reason I gave 1 star is because I thought a zero might be mistaken as I forgot to rate it. It was broke when it arrived. But we did not have time to reorder one. So we tried to make due. Three cuts in and the blades became too dull to cut. Pos
Two of the ink cartridges exploded in the printer.  Printer is now ruined.  If I could give it NO stars I would!

Cartridges gave error messages of incorrect cartridges.  Hate even giving one star
The product is fine, but I've been contacted almost everyday about leaving a review, which almost doesn't make the purchase worth it.

This isn't the worst printer I've ever used.  It's the worst product I've ever used.  I partially blame myself for ignoring all of the terrible reviews.  Never again.  There are so many things wrong with this printer I don't remember them all.  Let's just say that it has only printed once or twice without any issues.  It will say there's a paper jam.  You check everything there is to check, and:  No paper jam.  After closing it back up it starts printing again from page #1!  The average print time is about 3-4minutes per page.  Yes, you read that right;  3-4 MINUTES per page.  That is the best it's ever performed.  About half of the sheets it spits out are blank.  There are several kinds of "print errors".  Hour-long phone calls to the Lexmark overseas operators will help fix the problem for a few minutes.  The next time you print there will be another problem.  Most frustrating product I've ever purchased.  BTW this is the first time I've ever been motivated enough to review anything; ever.  I'm ready to go "Office Space" on this thing.

It was great while it worked, but that wasn't for long.The first printer blurred the print and wrinkled the paper while still within warranty.  After spending forever on the phone with Brother, they had me take the ridiculously heavy printer over to a UPS store to ship back to them postpaid.  The replacement arrived, but it had the same wrinkling problem.  This time, after an hour on the phone with Brother, the last rep I talked to told me that my warranty had expired, which contradicted what the rep had told me when I called in about the problems with the original printer.  Bottom line:  I have to drive it to the nearest service center, 1-1/2 hours away, and pay for the repair myself.Lesson learned:  don't believe all the online reviews you read.  Lesson #2:  don't believe what they tell you over the phone unless you get documentation.

OK.  I confess.  I had way too many gel pens before I placed this order, but I was drawn in by all of the glowing reviews!  I've come to consider ColorIt products as being a cut above, so just one more set of pens can't hurt.  Right?Wrong! I wanted to love these pens!  The fact is I don't.  The ink in the glitter pens flows smoothly, and the amount of glitter dispensed is alright.  I've used pens with more glitter and some with less, but all in all the glitter pens are good.  However, it was pretty much downhill from there.  The metallic part of the mostly scratchy metallic pens was definitely understated.  There's no risk of depleting our planet's precious nonrenewable metallic resources with these pens. The neons were bold and bright...and also mostly scratchy.Maybe the gel pen gods are sending me a message, "You don't NEED any more gel pens!"

After using five of these carts once a week for a year, all of the wheels have problems.  The threads on the wheels and the inserts on the legs are stripped. If the wheels had held up, I would have given the cart 5 stars.

Does not stand proper. When i bought it I was so excited because I need it for work. After putting just some stuff the whole thing bended to the side. Read reviews ! I have to place it next to a wall so it doesnt fall!

This is such a deceiving listing. Most of the reviews here seem to be for a package of colored pencils. Also, there are multiple pencil sharpeners under the same listing? I got the small blue sharpener and while it's not *completely* worthless, MAN is it weak. I will be shocked if it lasts more than a few months. It's usable when it's plugged in via the USB connection, but don't even think about using it with batteries. Save your money and find something else.

This paper cutter has no finger guard on the pressure (paper holder) bar.  It is very easy to cut your finger because the pressure guard is also loose and comes off, paper slips, uneven cuts.  I also think it is not really strong enough to cut a folded card (two layers of card stock at once), so the card slips and the cut is wrong.  I have used guillotine cutters for years and never once have I had a problem with cutting my fingers.  I am a very productive crafter so I use the cutters almost every day.  I have a large tonic guillotine and a full size office guillotine.  I wanted a smaller one for my desktop, thinking it would be handier.  In that respect it is.  But after I cut the side of my finger a second time (two separate occasions) when trying to hold a card in place for an even cut, I am trashing it.  It is just past the 30 day return, and I won't pass it on because it just isn't worth knowing the injury it can cause to any user.  I don't often strongly advise people not to buy a product just because I don't like it.  But I do offer that advice for this trimmer.  I like Fiskars products and find their scissors one of the best in quality, longevity and comfort of use, which is why I didn't hesitate to buy this trimmer, I trusted the brand.  Truth told, I never noticed the lack of a finger guard when I got it, my other guillotines have that, but it wasn't something I looked for when I bought them.  I have ordered the tonic small cutter, after I looked to be sure it has the guard.  Also, I have never had paper slip and wasted so much paper, time and effort with the other cutters, so on both cutting and safety this is a ZERO star product.

I was a loyal HP printer owner and I still have an old tank, ten years old (820Cse) that refuses to die but it uses a parallel cord and well, it needs to be retired.  These newer HPs that should be so much improved have become throw away units and you should throw them away before you install them and save yourself a lot of trouble.  After I put in new ink cartridges my last one wouldn't calibrate.  So I looked for recommendations for a printer and this Lexmark had high marks.  For me it installed without a hitch.  I now have four computers networked to the Lexmark  printer.  One by USB, two laptops wireless, and a second desktop via DSL network. Now we have the test of time in progress.  Will it last? but so far it works great.Update and downgrade (3/2012): I reinstalled my router and after that I couldn't get the printer to work on my network.  I did not call tech support, ya know, hate the wait and ya gotta be sharp that day to click this and click that, just dread to do it.  But on my primary computer, it still worked fine albeit slow.  The machine will take the time to suck the page back inside to print the back of the page even when there is no back of the page.  One of the big selling points that drew me in was the $4.99 black cartridge.  Well, the printer is designed to trickle in a little color into the black.  I suppose that makes the black blacker.  This is to herd the cattle over with their money to buy the expensive color set.  I always click draft quality and most of the time even click black only, yet somehow the color got all used up, but when the color is out it will not print with the $4.99 black.  The set of three colors go for $52 at Office Depot and the same at Amazon .  I used the HP820 for years with the color cartridge bone dry.  I am gonna try a Brother HL-5340D Laser. The reviews of Brother also complain of those printers refusing to print even when there is still ink in the cartridge but some clever reviewers also give tricks and fixes that keep it printing until actually empty.

I purchased this product a couple months ago. Im writing the review now because i just replaced my old ink cartridge. When i opened the seal the cartridge started to leak and spill. I would not recommend the xl of this product

This paper cutter is very cheaply made.  If you buy this, make sure you get the cut right the first time, because out of the box, the blade is not sharp enough to trim.  I gave it two stars instead of one, because it does its job as far the most basic straight cuts, most of the time.edit: About two days after I wrote the review I BENT THE BLADE cutting four pieces of 8 mil matte cardstock.  I wish I was joking...

I think it's pretty sad that a company that says in its description that all major holidays are included : (copied from the description) HOLIDAYS: All Major Holidays are mentioned such as Labor Day, Christmas Day, Valentines Day, Independence Day and New Years Day.There is not a single Jewish holiday in the calendar!Being Jewish I take this as very offensive especiallywhen the description says that it includes all major holidays.I am returning this calendar ASAP!Hopefully this review helps others who find this important to them.

The Handspring I bought back in '99 had a better Grafitti program than any other Palm I bought later. My Zire croaked, my Tungsten screen died - couldn't entered any info, and that after I gave up on using Grafitti on it (it was unreliable, slow) and used only the keyboard. I now purchased a TX because I desperately wanted to believe it'd be better - despite mixed reviews. I liked it at first, but the grafitti portion of the screen is beginning to act up already (after a few weeks, it started developing blank spots and gets confused). And I had to resort to help from my company's IT guy to install the software on my PowerBook.How about this: the software I purchased from Palmone for my Tungsten was not comaptible with the TX!!!It's been 9 years since I bought a Handspring. By now, Palm should be the most reliable and intuitive device. Seriously: this is the only consumer product that seems to be devolving. And its tech support is lousy plus the staff at the store I visted was unfriendly and ill-informed. My bet would be Palm will be a dead trademark in the near future.

I cannot understand why Amazon claims these are "heavy duty" staples. They are "high capacity" staples...that's it. No where on the box does it say heavy duty, because they are not. I bought these...and for months we tried using them (knowing that each time we stapled, TWO staples came out...which we hoped would work). We are just tired of all the jams. Heavy duty staples are thicker. These are thin like "normal" staples. When you hold them up next to each other, the difference is very clear. I'm rating this a one-star so that buyers might catch this. The product is probably fine...but Amazon's listing is wrong. If you have a true heavy duty stapler, these probably won't work (unless you also are OK with 2 staples shooting out each time you staple).Take note of the difference between "high capacity" and "heavy duty".I don't know why so many people are giving 5 star reviews...perhaps their staplers are high capacity and they mistake this for heavy duty.
I am updating my review since recently my printer identified theses ink cat ridges as counterfeit. The printer now asks me to replace these cartridges.

I bought two boxes for these envelopes for our business, wanted to only review after our business finish using them. We might as well just sello tape our invoices and labels onto the boxes directly without using these envelopes.  Not impressed at all.

I have a Brother HL-L2380DW, and it is wonderful. I was hoping this printer, the Brother MFC-9340CDW, would also be the same.Setup was very easy, instructions were very clear, and the interface is wonderful. Wifi/AirPrint printing worked great. The Brother software you can install on your computer (Windows or Mac) is not bloated, resource intensive, or intrusive, and it provides you with excellent information. The fax setup was pretty easy as well.  The colors are great too. Obviously this is not for glossy photos, but for anything else, it was terrific.The reason I had to give this one star is because I returned it.The reason I returned it is because when scanning single sided documents, scanning duplex documents (which this model does support via the ADF (auto-document-feeder)), printing duplex, and printing on envelopes, there are simply WAY WAY WAY too many paper jams.I tried a few different paper weights and a few different textures (smooth white paper/"textured" paper/recycled paper), and a few different envelope types.I also triple checked I removed all the "blue scotch tape" that usually comes with printers during shipping.It just jammed far too often.  If you end up purchasing this, and don't have those issues, consider yourself very lucky.I would have given this 5 stars if there were no jams, but alas, I had to return it.Amazon made returning this hassle free, and I did NOT have to pay to shipping to return it.

Very disappointed. Purchased this the last day of July, knowing I was about to run out of the yellow plastic tape. Opened the cartridge package today and the tape is jammed in the cartridge and will not feed. I tried to manually pull out some of the tape, but it jammed even more. You can see the backside of the tape turned up in the slot that allows you to view remaining contents. Cartridges cannons be opened to fix by rewinding correctly. The return window closed 10 days ago. You can see where I attempted to print, but all letters are stacked atop each other.I stayed with the more expensive OEM Dymo brand hoping to avoid issues like this.  Zero stars if I could.If you order in advance, check each one fo a problem when you receive them.

Box came in from shipping a complete mess like other posters.  The paper inside is wrinkled and creased.  A complete moron came up with this packaging concept.  I need to call Amazon and see what they can do about this purchase.  I am TOTALLY dissatisfied with this purchase and hope that others stay away from this product as well.  Amazon should not allow such garbage to be sold through them.  I only gave it one star as it didn't seem to allow me to rate it ZERO stars!

I'd really rather not be giving this phone system a 2-star rating because it actually has quite a few snazzy features which work well. Unfortunately, the main feature that differentiates it from similar - and less expensive - phones is a washout (at least for my personal home - yours may vary). Specifically, the exterior doorbell which sends either a snapshot or video feed of the person at your door is all but useless during the daytime, sending only a black silhouette image (hence "The Shadow" reference) with a blown-out bright background. There's no possible way of identifying who is at your door unless they have a really distinctively shaped head.The night vision works better - lighting up a face in almost complete darkness and, as a bonus, giving your visitor that "Blair Witch" quality that everyone enjoys on a dark and stormy night. But seriously, if your main concern is seeing faces at night then you may be well served by this phone/doorbell combination.Again, I've got no problem with the phone's other functions, all of which seem to work well: answering machine, intercom function between handsets, speakerphone, etc. For that matter, the audio doorbell function works well - your visitor pushes the doorbell, and it will sound wherever your handsets are (useful for me because my existing doorbell can't be heard in my home office). But that feature alone doesn't make it worth the bother of installing the external unit...and being haunted by the glowing (albeit pretty) screens on the telephone handsets reminding you of a feature which doesn't work.If V-tech finds a way to solve the backlighting problem (maybe a quick LED flash?) then they'll have a pretty nice product here.
Ink bleed all over the papers . if i could give 0 star i would

One additional piece of information that would be nice is to state the size of paper the unit is made for.  I ordered two units because I hoped they would fit 12 x 12 paper - but it fits 8-1/2 x 11 paper.  I will keep one of the units and return the other.I read the other reviews that indicate how good it was, but I can't say I'm as happy with the unit as others indicated they were.  I feel it's vastly overpriced for the price paid.

How about asking, 'DOES THE PEN DISPENSE INK WELL'?!  Because they DON'T.  Very, very disappointed.  Everyone rates these low for a reason.  If someone would make a quality pen with this design... they'd make a ton of cash!

Started out great! But that didn't last too long.  I couldn't understand the reviews on the curling but as I got to use all those bad reviews made lots of sense.  Unfortunately a slight curl on the paper, could and will cause printer to break it and jam it. One more thing would it kill you to place a small dot on side to print?... Just a suggestion

I should have listened to other's reviews. I didn't because I have always found value in Snead products before. Not the case here. These hanging folder frames are cheap, flimsy, and a waste of money. They are difficult to put together. the plastic end tabs that are supposed to hold the frames together bend and break. The "adjustable" metal hanging bars bend. I am very disappointed.

I am cautious about leaving a poor review for an item sold by many different sellers because some sellers have a good product while others sell something under the same listing that it grossly inferior.In this case, the document envelopes are extremely poor. The opening is just slightly smaller but means our invoices don't quite fit when folded. The colours for the heading are faded and look "cheap".  Obviously we paid only about £7 so I guess it is natural that they won't be the same quality as the higher priced ones we have bought in the past.  We have kept them rather than have hassle of the returns process but will keep them just as a reserve in case we run out of decent ones.Amazon really needs to find a way that buyers can differentiate between items from different sellers for reviews. The current system is unfair to good sellers who provide a good product.

I recently purchased this item not knowing what to expect like many other readers. Luckily it is available from Amazon with free postage return because you are likely to want to return it. I initially persevered starting off with scanning 110mm negative. The results were very poor. Even on the highest resolution scan the results looked like something from a John Bull printing press from the 1960's. The results with the 35mm negatives were better and occasionally reasonably acceptable. I consider that I wasted a lot of time scanning in negatives that I feel I will have to do all over again. One other really annoying thin about this device is the fact that the light has an inconsistent spread. In the centre of the slide you can see a dark circle and around the corners the scanned copy is brighter. You can notice this particularly when reviewing the slide window without a slide in place. Save yourself the time and go for something that has consistently good reviews. Bear in mind that you do not know how good the scans could be with a better unit. I will put a comment on Amazon if I find one which performs well.
Case is defective. Does not stay closed. They won’t let me return it. Terrible customer service. Guess they know it’s defective that’s why I can’t return it. Only gave 1 star because I had to

I bought this item hoping it would work as well as the PB brand that costs $84, but sadly it did not.  I put it in my machine (that was working perfectly up to that point) and within four days it was making streaky prints on my envelopes.  I had bought two of them so I replaced it with another new one and it did the same thing.  The only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is only because Amazon returned it with out any hesitation.

This printer has been nothing but problems so I advise to STAY AWAY. A colleague of mine has another printer similar to this one and it worked great but not only have I not been able to connect to the printer wirelessly at work, it only worked at home on a smaller wireless network, the USB cord I bought does not work either after I reset it several times, on my computer and the printer itself. The CD supplied DOES NOT have support or a driver for MAC OSX 7 (Lion) and I had to dig through the Brother website myself to go through three different installations before one worked. The print quality is not that great, prints much lighter color than on the screen, other than that its ok, but I would not recommend this printer to anyone, I would take my HP back any day if it had not have flooded in my home. I purchased this mainly for its 11x17 size because I work in design but I am very unimpressed, and read the other reviews, THIS PRINTER IS BIG, 3 ft takes up a lot of space...

I bought this printer today from a local box store due to the features, reviews, and great price.  I got it home, unpacked it, set it up, plugged it in and my APC battery backup started chirping. This was indicative of an overload.  This Brother printer (like a black and white laser I also tried months ago) uses a ton of AMPS when it heats up causing an undue load on my house wiring.  (The monochrome Brother actually caused an APC BackUPS to fail and blew my fuses).  So I took it back and bought an Epson inkjet instead.  Brother is the ONLY manufacturer that I have tried so far that had any problems with my home wiring.  No problems from Canon Lasers, HP Lasers, HP Inkjets, Lexmark Inkjets, or Epson Inkjets.

I purchased this after reading the review that the product works well, however, ever since installing these ink cartridges, I've been seeing nothing but blank streaks on my printouts. I have an HP C4240 Photosmart printer and am very dissappointed. I have done all the ink cleaning and printer cleaning steps, but it still does not print properly.

This is a good machine, but it is not for the home office user.  It will trip my circuit breaker all the time and I have a home that is newer than 10 years.  I later read in reviews that this is a common problem. It's now on my cabinet doing nothing for me, since I got tired of resetting the breaker before each use.  I wish I had known about this issue before buying it.

This chair is okay, but not great, I wouldn't even say it's good.  The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the customer service behind it is good, which I had to use three times in the first year I had it because of broken parts, but more on that to come.Pros:The chair is comfortable to sit in for long periods.  The nice high back and adjustable headrest are perfect for us tall guys.  The adjustable height of the chair is fantastic as well.  At it's full height I can just touch my toes to the ground.  Usually most chairs my feet are still very firmly flat on the floor at full height.  The wide base and arms make sitting in this chair easy and doesn't press against the outsides of my thighs.  The customer service and warranty replacement folks save this chair.The cons:The base and wheels are terrible.  Terrible is putting it mild..they are deplorable.  I am a big guy, which is why I purchased this chair, but I am well within the advertised limits of the chairs capabilities.  I am a little over 6 foot tall and a little over 300 pounds, so I should fit easily in a chair rated for a 350 pound weight limit.  The nice wide seat and arms are great, but the base, the foundation of the chair itself, makes this not worth buying.  In the first year that I had it I had to have the wheels replaced twice and the base replaced once.  The main body of the base is very strong and sturdy, made of metal construction, however the wheels are plastic casters.  For a chair rated for larger people, you might thing they would be a little more durable, but no, just plastic.  The brackets that the wheels pop into on the base are also less than ideal.  At one point I had one the brackets bust off while I was sitting in the chair, leaving me with only 4 working wheels left...hence the replacement base.  Lastly, the edges of the base are very sharp.  When sitting in the chair if you move your foot or roll the chair and hit your heel it hurts like a banshee and on more than one occasion has drawn blood.The short story is, if you are looking for a reliable chair, this is not the one to buy, however if you are looking for a chair that may very well break on you a time or two but has great customer service behind it, then you might consider it.  Personally I think it's great that they have such good service, however I would have preferred my chair to hold up so that I would not have had to contact them in the first place.

I love a good pen, and I have a lot of them.  Never satisfied with using the same one for too long, I am always looking for something better.  The many good reviews on this pen, and this brand itself got me interested in it, so I bought one.  In all honesty, I think the higher cost for this pen is because of the fancy box it came in, and not the pen itself.  No offense to Parker, or Parker users, but if you put this pen in a pile of cheap pens, most would have a hard time telling the difference.  I also found that it is too small for my hand, making it hard to get a good grip on it to write...it wants to slide through my grip as I write.  Apparently there is a niche for this kind of pen, so, as the saying goes -  "different strokes for different folks" (no-pun intended).

This is a good idea, but for less money I could have purchased a plastic binder and envelopes that would be much sturdier.  The pockets are made of rough paper that is not strong and easily frays.  The outside edges of each pocket are partially frayed from the folding of the paper to construct the pocket.  I doubt this will last the year.  The cover is pretty but thin.  I gave this 2 stars because the concept is a good one, but the construction could have been much better for the price.  Not a good value.  You'd have to be very careful with how you use this so the pockets don't rip.  I reinforced the outside edges with washi tape, but there's no way to reinforce the punched holes.  This is supposed to last at least a year.  I doubt that it will make it intact for that length of time unless I really baby it.

I bought this unit as reviews indicated it was the most reliable.  However, after just over six months, the auto feeder is eating my originals and the copies are good one page and horrible for others, seemingly random.  I am the only user and have followed all instructions carefully.

I got these because several reviews said they were strong. They must have gotten a different set of magnets then I did.  These are so weak as to be useless..  They barely grip themselves on never mind when adding something under them.  Totally useless..

Wow!  I can't believe how many 5-star reviews I see for this completely awful product (It's like I don't even have the same machine as the people who wrote those reviews...).  I bought two of these machines for the organization I work for, and they have both been awful since Day 1.  Right out of the box, both machines produced poor quality copies and prints; with lines on the page, random black flecks all over, and with text that is ragged rather than crisp.  We returned one of the machines straight away (and had it been up to me, I would have returned both...).  Now, less than two years after purchase, the performance of the second machine has deteriorated to the point that all text is extremely blurry and printed pages emerge from the machine covered with various ink shadows and smears in different places on the page.  I can't believe what a lousy product this has turned out to be --I wish I had returned the second machine along with the other one.  We have called brother for support with these issues, and they have offered no help at all.  Brother should be ashamed of this terrible product.

I REPEAT. Do not buy this vinyl!  I absolutely love my Silhouette Cameo and have had it for about a year now.  I've always purchased Silhouette's premium vinyl and was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to use.  Since my first venture with vinyl, I've used it on everything, walls, plates, mailboxes, family member's walls, everything, really!I needed some new white vinyl and decided to head to Amazon only to realize they now only offer "matte" or "permanent" vinyl.  After some research I found that Silhouette no longer offers Premium vinyl which could be used for pretty much anything (I have it on our walls and my mailbox).  For indoor use with this newer vinyl, I should purchase the "matte" type. Well I did and now I am NOT happy.  I did a larger typography mural in our laundry room.  The vinyl cut well and I was able to take off the negative part easily. As I was doing this I even said to my husband how I was nervous to purchase this vinyl due to all the negative reviews but so far I really liked it.Well, folks, I SPOKE TOO SOON. Putting this awful vinyl on our wall was a HUGE pain in the butt!  It literally took me almost a half an hour to get it to even come off the transfer and even longer to make sure all the parts of the letters stayed on the wall! Every time I walk by the piece, I find myself pushing the letters back on the wall.It's so frustrating that I spent all the this time designing the piece, put my money on a silhouette product that I would have assumed was great, due to the brand name, only to be frustrated and having to buy new vinyl and restart the whole process!The photos attached are of the letters not staying adhered to the wall. Even after pushing them down and smoothing them out not even an hour earlier.

I have tried and tried to get this paper to work without luck! The paper rolls very badly making paper jams in the printer. Once I got it to print onto the paper I could not get it to transfer on anything. I would not waste money on this product again. I have not been so disappointed in a product in a long time. For that reason I would not recommend it to you.I check back often for questions, so please feel free to ask anything that I missed and you’re wondering about this product.I received CISinks A4 Sublimation Ink Transfer Paper (50 sheets) 8.27" x 11.7" at a discount or for free for my honest and unbiased review. That has not swayed my review in any, way my review is 100% my own experience with this product.

Overall impression: Would not buy again, but would try a different brand on Amazon. These are not comparable in quality to well known brands, but somewhat less expensive. Nice carrying case.Cons:About 1/3 of the pens are scratchy on paper from first use until I take out the replaceable cartridge and replace it with a new one, which is often not scratchy (luck of the draw?)Ink flow skips approximately 25% of the time in all of the pens, which means more than 1/4 of the time I am coloring, the pens are skipping or I am slapping them against my palm to get the ink to flow down to the tip so I can start coloring again. This happens with new refills and old ones, but more frequently with used cartridges, of course.Cost is high in comparison to similar type pens on AmazonColor names often are highly misleading--always test the colors, as mine did not come with a color coded sheet to show you what the color actually looks like on paper, so I have scribbles everywhere and finally just went through and made my own color coded sheet for referencePros:Huge variety of colors (but an awful lot of greens and purples in comparison to some other colors, with several of the greens looking pretty much the same, in my opinion)Carrying case is very handy (my favorite feature)Refills are great/necessary, especially since I've had to replace 1/3 of the cartridges almost immediately on use (but I'm paying for the refills, so I don't know if this is actually a pro??? I guess this is a con, because I had to throw out full cartridges because of the scratchy tips, so 1/3 of the "refills included" ended up being used immediately, which makes the set cost more, not less)Variety of metallics, neons, and glitters (do they make a solid set? That would be nice too)*Picture caption: that leaf is colored with the green peridot pen. As you can see, there are two leaf segments that are very scratchy looking. When that happened, I wiped off the tip of the pen, tried it on discard paper, and when I saw that it wasn't getting better, I replaced it with a refill. The rest of the leaf is with the new pen refill. But now I don't have a refill with the peridot color and had to throw away a basically unused cartridge because of the scratchy tip. As another reviewer said, this process of scratchy and skipping is extremely annoying when I am trying to engage in a relaxation coping skill. It is so annoying that I stopped coloring just now to come and write this review.
Cannot use these unless you add extra cardboard! Not a good product. I am tired of adding more words so that I can submit this review!

It is not customary for me to write bad reviews.  However, I needed to replace my print cartridges for my HP Printer.  The MyToner Remanufactured Print Cartridges were sold out. I decided to try the CSStar brand (61BXL/61CXL). The colored cartridge worked OK after me having to press the chip, wet with a paper napkin and hold for 2-3 seconds.  I never had to go through this much trouble for a replacement cartridge.  The black cartridge i did the same, however I discovered it was defective.  So, bottom line I had to purchase an HP 61BXL (black cartridge).  I can't return one without the other, so I wasted time and money.  I would not recommend purchasing this product.

I bought and used this marker six months ago, and capped it securely.Opened it to use just now, and....BONE DRY, unusable.Otherwise, six months ago it worked pretty well, given the limitations noted in other reviews here.Just don't plan on it lasting very long.

Below was my original review, which I will change back if this seller takes care of my problem. I have ordered many cartridges from this seller, and I haven't had a problem until now. My printer won't recognize the ink cartridge, but I was able to print some pages by holding down the power button and cancel button. However, that is no longer working. It won't print anything now. No ink is coming out. So, I got a handful of pages out of the first cartridge that I bought. I bought a total of 3. The 2nd cartridge is doing the same with holding the power button down and cancel button. But it is printing in a really weird manner. The pages are illegible. So, 2nd cartridge is a failure. I'm about to try the 3rd one, but I am really upset. I choose this seller because I have never had a problem. So........ What is going on?!?Original: (5 Stars)I have a HP Deskjet 2542 printer, which requires HP 61 ink. I bought 3 of these cartridges on Feb. 2, and I'm now on the 2nd cartridge. I print out a ton of stuff for college, and I am thrilled that these cartridges last for an incredibly long time. I bet I could print out 500 pages of something on 1 ink cartridge alone. I LOVE these. Thank you, seller!!!!!!!
Horrible! Do not buy this product! I did not read the review before buying. Tried sheet after sheet. Again do not buy!

In short words, do not waste your money for this junk product. I bought this for my business. Originally, I thought it should be easy to use and should work much better than the paper record. It looked nice and the price is reasonable. The reviews are relative higher than the competitors. However, the set up procedure is much harder. It took me and my manager a long time to set it up. Another thing is to read the time sheet is even harder than setting it up. It's not convenient at all. It used for a month or so in my business and got BROKEN. After set it up, I hang it tightly on the corner of my store. I did not even start to use it. The records inside is all but trash. I could not get the time sheet of my employees. It totally a waste of money. It is very difficult to use and very easy to break within very short time. I will give even lower review if I can.
read reviews of a lot of these arriving broken, thought I’d be lucky but nope 2 lids were broken.
Wish I could give 0 stars.  This thing will print beautifully for about a day, then it goes to crap.  Waste of money for myself, and waste of resources for humanity building the atrocious thing.

I have experienced all of the failure modes listed in these reviews - the printer james often, and in unpredictable ways, the cartridges run out faster than you can believe, and the wireless drops off at the most inopportune times.  I have had to run to a local copy shop to make really critical prints when the cartridge ran out when I needed copies for an important early meeting.Customer service could not be more indifferent.  I actually came to Amazon today to read the reviews on other printers because I am just trashing my Samsung.  I was furious with HP over their ink prices; however, they are not looking so bad now.  Is there a reliablbe, cost efficient printer anywhere?  All those positive reviews for this model makes me question all positive reviews anywhere.I feel like such a sucker for buying this thing.

Don't really know where to start...tapped on a note today to retrieve tech specs while at a customer site and it shut off.  Started it back up (with the reset button) and it did exactly the same thing.  Routinely needs to be started with the reset hole in the back instead of the power button.  Litters your Outlook notepad and calendar with duplicate entries and you have to figure out which one is current.  Changes all-day Outlook appointments that are "free" to "busy" (all day).  Hard reset results in a never-ending loop of "tap here" to align the stylus/screen that won't let you out.This device has been a major disappointment, especially after the incredibly reliable Zire 71 I "upgraded" from for all the cool features of the TX.  I've been trying to convince myself I haven't been had for the two months I've owned it and have finally given up.  Will try to get a few bucks refund out of Amazon, otherwise it's going in the landfill...I can't ethically try to sell this piece of garbage.  Buyer beware.  Maybe you'll get one of the ones all these reviewers are happy with, or maybe you'll get one like mine.  And I thought the Pocket PC platform was flaky!

I purchased this along with suggested better wheels. The wheels received a positive review, this chair will not. It is very attractive. The wood 5-star base had a minor defect. The manufacturer offered to send a new base free. That was positive, but the lift mechanism gets pressure fit into the base and after a two-hour effort, gave up trying to separate them. Without the ability to separate the pieces, the new base would be useless. It could not be returned, since it could not be packaged without separating the pieces. The very thin seat pad provides no real cushioning.  After only a few days of ownership, I gave it away to a friend who will use it as only a display piece. It is NOT a real task chair.

This printer does NOT work well with MacOS. There's almost no support, and the software that can be downloaded is glitchy and long out of date. The iOS app works a little better (it has 2 stars out of 5 on the iOS store), but it's far from reliable. It's very difficult to get it working, and it doesn't stay working. Really frustrating.I strongly suggest the Canon one instead. It's a few dollars more, but not only does it actually work, it has duplex printing.

The pen is  made of cheap plastics and  some reviews overvalue it  It arrived in unofficial packing with no EU standards warranty. It is an UGLY thing I must say  and one won't necessary recognize this as a pen.  It lacks the traditional look and feel as a pen.  My mother , who has a collection of nice traditional fountain pens quite rightly refused to call it a pen!  The ink amount is set not allowing the desired  amount of ink to be transferred on  the paper resulting in sort of vaguely writing.

Okay, it easy to assemble but, I am so glad that it waited to review.Terrible. Not big enough to hold my laptop properly. It slides down after I set the height. It actually fell today. My laptop hit the floor (so angry). Started out okay in the end crap.

Not impressed, but I should have read the reviews before buying. Cheap, parts missing, warped sides. I thought since it was solid wood it would be higher quality, but no. I ordered replacement parts, so we will see if it improves, but I’m not holding out much hope.
I like the stools but one was sent without a nail in floor coaster so it sits lopsided. I will happily change this review if they send me the piece missing.

My Canon MG5420 would not work at all with this replacement ink. I'd say that both the printer and the ink are at fault, because the system requires a chip in the ink cartridge to match what the printer expects - and in this case, all three ink cartridges failed. I think Canon brand cartridges would work OK, but, man, the cost! My recommendation is to avoid this touchy Canon printer despite the glowing reviews it has gotten on the internet. This Canon printer is a kludge and this Shermin Ink would not work with mine.

Not able to provide a 0 star rating.Does not work. I inserted the cartridge and powered off and powered on my Samsung printer 3 times. Now it won't even tell me the ink is low on the original OEM cartridge. Who is going to pay for my broken printer?I know 3rd party ink manufacturers usually work with the original manufacturer to comply with their standards. This does not appear to be one of those companies.This is why the Federal Government regulates big, giant corporations that pay their employees just barely over the minimum wage and giver their local communities the finger when they make a mistake.

Should be a Zero star rating.  What more needs to be said, one of the support pieces on the bottom of the stand was termite-infested.  As I had placed it on a wood credenza, this became a bigger concern.  DO NOT BUY unless you want to take the chance on buying a termite-infested piece of wood.  Did I mention that this was TERMITE-INFESTED!!!!! Sigh.

It didn't work on my chair. It falls off frequently.  I would not recommend it to anyone.  I would not have ordered this item if I had known how bad it is.  My review was confirmed when I saw my husband picking scattered items that fell out this evening.  This has become a common sight in our house.  The title of the item is certainly deceptive.

the good reviews are apparently paid because this table is junk even following the instructions the table refuses to stay elevated and DO not even try to use the swivel this is very un balanced and will not stay elevated spend money for the more expensive one

I bought to use while sitting in my recliner and putting my lap top on and for writing surface. My laptop barely fits on it, slides around. As a writing surface it is terrible because of the lip all around the edge. It is much smaller than I thought it was. Ordered a bigger laptop desk from Amazon but I read the reviews first. Would not buy this item again.

I've been a Palm user for the last 12 years. I decided to go for the TX after my Palm Pilot needed a retirement (case was coming apart...still worked swell). Switching over was easy. Nice screen graphics, and it functionally had more than I would use. And...it worked great...for the first 3 days. At the end of the 3rd day, it would not turn on. I did everything tech support suggested (spent HOURS with them). After more research, it appears the Palm quality has disappeared. Tech support insisted I send it back for a (refurbished) replacement. I guess it pays to read and believe in the user reviews. They made this unit sound risky and it sure was for me. I'm not willing to go thru several rounds of replacements with these folks. I travel and luckily the failure happened at home and not in a meeting on the other side of the country. I am disappointed and getting my money back. Tech support is in India and I had a LOT of trouble getting them to understand they needed to think beyond their script. I guess I'll give HP a go and hope for the best.

JUNK! Don't buy, can barely see the letters. VERY, VERY POOR QUALITY. I should have listened to the other reviewers. I rarely leave negative reviews. This Embossing Tape and the DYMO Organizer Xpress both deserve ZERO stars if I there was such.

I must give it "zero" star, but it is just not possible on Amazon website! The pen looks good, but you don't want to buy a pen that does not write well. Start writing with it, and it will make you crazy as you need to go back and re-write some parts of many letters again. I have tried different papers, inks and levels of hand pressure and angle, but it did not change the results.Your script will always look like as if the ink is about to finish! I had a Parker fountain pen (old Parker 45, made in UK) for about 15 years, which was such a great pen. This pen is just a total disappointment. It does not even mention in which country the pen has been made! I made a mistake and bought two of this pen at the time of purchase, one as a gift for my friend. Both pens have the same issue.

Please read the negative reviews and take them mind. I did not with regrets. I like to buy American when possible but this product will leave you in a lurch. I tried all the remedies to make this product work on my 5895 mfc brother printer. After no success I had to buy the brothers 61 and 65 cartridges. Worked perfect right off! No I did not contact manufacturing. No I did try to contact Amazon. I wasted enough time with this product and decided to take time to warn people off this product. Please believe the negative reviews it will save TIME and perhaps money if not aggravation. I had to give it a one star rating just to submit this posting!

I have to believe that the majority of the positive reviews were written by people who didn't bother to use this printer for more than a single test print after they took it out of the box.  After having one for several months now, I wish that I had the cash to turn this one into a pinata, or perhaps a boat anchor.The good:  This printer looks quite stylish for an all-in-one machine, and it has a lovely full color control panel.The bad: Literally everything else.Print quality - The prints are often streaky, with streaks appearing in any color, midpage, and irregularly.  It's not an issue of having a problem with just one color.  The printheads clog regularly, requiring repeated cleanings before the machine will print again.Ink consumption - Amazingly terrible.  This goes through a $10 black cartridge in 50-70 draft quality pages of text, and a $20 "double sized" cartridge in fewer than 100.  Color consumption is lower for me, as I rarely print images, but when I've printed larger color pictures the ink levels drop incredibly fast.Wifi - This printer goes offline regularly (every 10 minutes or so) and won't wake up for a new print job.  It must be manually reactivated each time.I'm kicking myself for ever having purchased this piece of junk, and I can't believe that HP ever offered it for sale in the first place.  I've never bought a printer that was not made by HP.  This clunker is going to change that.

Zero stars.  Bottle of ink leaked in the delivery package.  The box was broken and now I have to take time out of my busy schedule to return the partially full ink bottle in order to receive a replacement.  Seriously?

Utter garbage. Take the $5 to $7 you plan to spend on this "tool" and burn it if you feel the desire to make this purchase. You will never be able to make a reproachable line because a) the two arms move out of plane from each other, b) the screw assembly slips constantly, c) the screw assemble actually runs through a slot rather than a hole, meaning that even when the nut is now moving, you have a 1/4" wiggle in the scribe line. The positive reviews HAVE TO BE fakes. This thing should not even be in a middle school math class.
I bought two Black cartridges 127  for my Workforce 645 printer and they were both bad.  They replaced the two and one of the two was bad.  75% failure rate; not good

I was expecting a brass metal plate. NOT! I went back to the product listing to see if I had missed an obvious description that the plate would be made of plastic. I found nothing in the vendor's description disclosing that the "plate" is made of colored plastic. It's not until you start reading all of the reviews that you finally learn from some of the purchasers that the plate is made of thin plastic that is colored either silver or brass. It's barely thick enough to be considered a "plate". One reviewer referred to it as a "sticker", which is not far from the truth. Still, it does look nice, but is way overpriced for a plastic plate/sticker.

See the photos. I tried all three cartridges in my HP C4450 printer. None worked. Printer cannot recognize the cartridge as the right one. Photos I attached to this review tells the story why. The pin ID matrix must be identical to the HP one on the right in both photos. Note how all three of the pin identifiers are damaged or torn, thereby resulting in a misalignment of the coded key that tells the printer it is a legit ink cartridge. Guess this company has no QA.

I bought this around November 13,2018 for my store , worked fine in the beginning now doesn't work that all , now it reads real 100s,20s as fake its happing more often now. This thing is now worthless wasting my time and my customers time . I rarely write reviews on amazon but this is the worst thing I bought on amazon. DO NOT BUY

I purchased these cartridges right after buying some HP cartridges with the intention that I would use them when my new HPs ran out.  When the time came, I installed the black first.  It initially worked fine, but after a few uses the ink began to gum up the print heads (HP ink didn't do this).  I had to run multiple cleaning cycles to try to get them clean - so many so that I need to change out the color cartridges just from cleaning.  Unfortunately, the Kingway color cartridges did not work at all.  The printer did not even recognize them as being installed.  So, not only is the ink cheap so that it gums up your printer, the chip set is cheap and only works some of the time or is incompatible with the printers for which it was designed.If that were not enough to steer you away, after my purchase, the company immediately begin contacting me about writing a review.  I am not a regular poster of reviews - I'm just a normal shopper.  But holy cow did they want that review!  The frequency and tone of the communications was really unlike anything I have otherwise ever experienced with a vendor - and I have bought a lot of stuff online and offline. They were all over me with emails about posting a review and they did not seem to care that I had not yet used the product, even after I advised them as much.  Now, I know why they were in a such a hurry for the review . . .

The size is not correct. Mine measures 7 1/2 X 10 X 2 which makes it slide back & forth and looks terrible. I bought it because of the reviews and was recommended as the right size for my bible. My bible measures 5.8 X 9 X 1.4

Previously I give this printer a 5 STAR rating, since then Lexmark automatically updated their firmware purposely draining all the ink cartridges in a 10th the time. This printer used to print in “Black ink only” Now it counts how many pages you print regardless if you use ANY of the color ink OR NOT and it stops printing until you buy more color ink @ $60 a pop!This should be a class action law suit!

Got this as a 'gift' from my boss to use labeling stuff. He wasted his money on this. Looks like I'm the first person who isn't a Vine reviewer though.I've been working (fighting?) with this for about 2 weeks now. It worked OK when I had it hooked up via USB, but I wanted to use it as a wifi printer so it's out by the copy machine (about 12 feet from the primary AP antenna). It goes to sleep and won't reconnect to the wifi on demand, you have to turn it off and on to get the wifi to connect and the printer to show up on the program.The program. Oh, what a piece of junk the program is. Even if the printer is hooked up to the wifi (and I can see it on the DHCP client page), most of the time it won't show as connected in the program. Trying to create a label is a chore, too - it only inputs text horizontally even if you need it to be vertical. Label choices are hard coded into the system so you really can't do a custom label without jumping through all sorts of hoops. When it works, it works, but that's few and far between. Oh, and the printer has to have the name "Leitz Icon" or the program crashes when you try to print.Labels look OK when you can get it all figured out, but you're still limited on sizes. Even on a continuous roll like it comes with, you can't make a 1/2" tall label - it claims the margins are too small. It won't operate as a true WYSIWYG label printer since it resizes text on the fly.Bottom Line: Don't buy this if you're expecting something that actually works. This will do its best to make you tear out your hair and gnash your teeth, all while laughing at how stupid you are since you can't print out the label even though your printer is definitely connected. Don't buy this if you want to use it on wifi only. Don't buy this unless you have money literally burning a hole in your pocket (like if it were covered in fluoric acid or something that you can't be exposed to).

I'm honestly king of disappointed in this product. I was super excited to get this, first off.But the title of the product is a little bit misleading.There is not 98 pens.There is 48, plus refills.So the color variety was not what I was expecting at all, and is the main reason I purchased this kit.Second, the quality is not up to par with the price. But these pens aren't smooth and seem slightly dried up.Some of them roll smoothly, but most do not.With that being said, the only reason I am giving two stars is because the package came quickly, and I like that it includes a folder and refills.

This is my second review of this ink cartridge and after use for about four mounts I have found that I'm having a problem with the cartridge. The problem is the ink stop printing and colors are not true. The black ink is a big problem have also had problem with the yellow and red ink not printing properly. At first I tried cleaning the print heads no change. Then I replaced the ink cartridges with Canon ink cartridges and the problem stopped. My printer works fine the problem is with the Inkjetcorner cartridges so be ware and try a different brand this company has problems..

Bought this printer on April 2014. It has served very well for about a year - main reason for giving two stars instead of one. After 1 year, printer started to have transfer issues, giving blank pages or partially blank pages 90% of the time for all colors. Printer has been using authentic Brother toner throughout - this was the first set of toners. After the standard troubleshooting from Brother support such as printing test pages, copying test pages, toner replacement, and driver re-installs, we were directed to a third party service center due to the printer being out of warranty for mechanical service. For the price of this printer, it should have lasted more than a year...
