*UPDATE* After the cartridge settled in my printer, the black ink shows that the cartridge needs replacing...I've printed (at most) 10 documents on "draft" setting and use my printer sparingly. I would give 0 stars if possible. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!ORIGINAL REVIEW:When I replaced my cartridges, my printer indicates the black ink is not even at 50% capacity! Highly disappointed. Prints fine for quick documents, but don't waste your money to only get a fraction of what you paid for!
My WF-2630 will not recognize this cartridge and will not print. Wouldn't let me do ZERO STARS false ad

I would rate this as no stars if I could. The product description says this Canon 240XL will fit in the Canon MX492. IT DOES NOT! I am going to try to exchange it for the Canon 243 cartridge, just wish I could find the correct cartridge in the XL size.

These Brother toner cartridges are good, and the printer usually works well (often simply wont print from networked computers for no reason), but it is an evil thief.  It will shut down printing after a certain number of pages, EVEN IF THE CARTRIDGE IS COMPLETELY FULL.  It uses page counting, NOT any toner sensor in the cartridge.  Most people (including me) are sending back (or throwing out) nearly full cartridges and paying $80 for new ones.  BUT, one reviewer gave instructions on how to reset each cartridge to make the printer think it is new.  This has saved me bundles.

Bought this magnetic white board based on the price and positive reviews. The board arrived damaged in several different areas. It is not a well made product. I found a smaller, but better quality board elsewhere for a quarter of the price. Buyer beware!

Worthless tape.  Will not stay on package. When you are wrapping meat, you expect freezer tape to stay on package.  I now have 3 rolls of tape that are worthless.  Will never buy again. I wish I could give a negative review.
Medium is more large than for a Bible that is 6 x 8 1/2 x 1 3/4. Read the reviews prior, but bought it anyway. My mistake, next time stick with reviews.

I bought the Palm TX because my Tungston wouldn't hold a charge any longer. I have been a long time user of Palm ad thought that the TX might have some good features.  My first Palm TX wouldn't turn on even after recharging it several times and soft and hard re-setting it.  A two hour wait for Palm tech support (when the voice said only a five minute wait) didn't help my mood much.  Tech support told me what I already knew--the product was defective. I returned it to Amazon and asked for a replacement hoping to have a different experience. This time the Palm charged but after it charged the screen went blank.  Again tech support gave the same advice--which I already knew and finally told me to just charge it for 24 more hours (of course I knew that wouldn't make much difference) so now after another 24 hour charge I am returning the TX to Amazon and asking for a refund.  I think I am finally finished with Palm after reading all of the negative reviews for their products.

So far, everything is working except one of the yellow cartridges. That totally stinks. Once I replaced it with the OTHER yellow cartridge, it started working right away. Any chance you could send another yellow? I would give 5 stars if I got another yellow cartridge.

NOT suited for Legal size folders. Poor design. I would send it back if I hadn't cut and assembled the frames as needed. Just trash now. At least they were cheap. That's what I get for ignoring some of the reviews and going cheap. Sadly I couldn't find ANY hanging file frames on Amazon that I would call sturdy for Legal size. My 10 yr old busted IKEA frame was MUCH better than this but I don't think they make them any more.VERY loose connections and unstable frame at that size. Might be OK for Letter but I needed Legal. I DO NOT RECOMMEND for Legal sized hanging folders!

I bought 2 sets of this storage compartment a couple of years ago and would give both sets a 5 star rating at that time.  I decided to get a 3rd set recently and quality control is apparently no longer part of the manufacturing process.  Tabs no longer line up with the slots and do no stack together at all.  The cover on top will only attach on the front tabs.  Would no longer recommend this product.

Printed less than 25 sheets, entirely used up the black ink cartridge that came with the machine completely. Tends to jam frequently (every other page in most cases). Very 'cheap' printer, you DO get what you pay for. Just needed something for a temporary setup, thankfully it is not needed long-term. Had to give at least one star - otherwise no stars would have been more accurate.
So, I finally decided to write my review. These cartridges are horrible. I get half printed text, or blank pages. Please do not waste money on these, If you have an HP printer, buy HP ink!!

They yellow replacement cartridge was defective. The printer will recognize the old ink cartridge but not the new yellow one. I bet if I go to staples and buy a new yellow it would work... In 2017 with modern testing and reliability on most other products, I can not believe that Epson has such a high failure rate. I have been trying to be a supporter for a long time but this is not my first Epson printer that has this problem. At lease with HP the ink cost more but it never had this kind of failure rate.I would not trust this ink. I wrote Epson and no luck, I doubt this post/review will even stir a response.This ink this product the ink and the printer is a zero in my book.  EPSON is a zero in my book. Band then before they pollute the earth with more of the failed products.@Epson Consumables I went with you as the vendor of choice... So much for that...
I wouldn’t even give it 1 star. Put it in my printer, printer kept telling me it was low on ink and this was brand new. It won’t print anything at all, kept spitting out blank pages.

Update below.This is a great little scale for weighing all types of things in the kitchen.  I mostly use it for making soap but use it for general kitchen use and making lotions and other uses.  My one major complaint is the auto-off feature.  It is not customizable and you can't shut it off.  I often have to start over measuring things as it shuts off after a very short amount of time (supposedly 2 minutes but I think it is a lot shorter than that).  It would be really nice to just have a button or toggle to just turn the auto shut-off off.  I don't care if it eats up batteries.  They are cheap and my time is not.And I have to second what some other reviewers have said, the buttons are way to shiny and they are hard to make out in regular light.  I can't really tell what one button says from the other one and it is a little frustrating.  They could make them way more readable and it would make the scale much more usable.But I have tried several other scales and this beats the other ones hands-down.  Don't let the small size fool you.  It is more accurate than much larger and more expensive one.  Maybe much more expensive lab scales might do a better job, but for this price, you can't get a better value.UPDATE:  ONLY LASTED A FEW MONTHS AND I DIDN'T EVEN USE IT THAT OFTEN.  THE SCALE WAS ALWAYS STORED IN THE ORIGINAL BOX.

The bins fit the specs as advertised but 2 arrived with broken corners. They were packed decently (padded) and stacked (the one that was 2nd from the bottom actually had the broken corner in my photo) so maybe the deliver wasn't the issue? These bins would be 4 or 5 stars if they didn't come broken.
This doesn’t deserve even 1 star and there are NO RETURNS. I’m tossing the entire package in the garbage. They click one color up and then get stuck. Cheap, horrible product.
Terrible printer. Horrible support avoid this product at all cost! Stopped working right after ability to return. Biggest mistake buying into this second rate product. Never again

Usually I had good luck even other people gave bad review, this time is different. This product shipping took 1.5 weeks and then I installed right after I received it. The black color doesn't work at all, the color ink shows very light green color for the entire page. Spent $20 for nothing. Don't buy it!
I was excited to receive this set of pens based on the reviews. The case and box are terrific, but the pens are not. Many of them are very scratchy, several don't work. Not worth the money.

1 star is picked because you can’t give 0 stars. The product I received did not match the product pictured on the website.  I received 5 unpackaged refills in a plastic ziploc bag.  Also, the product can not be returned.

Good product, but questionable software practice, and horrible customer service.Bought the printer a few days ago to replace an old black and white Brother printer, installed the driver and software suite immediately, and found it printing and copying properly.But once I started to try the scanning function, issue arose: the Nuance PDF Professional software originally installed on my computer (for the Brother ADS1500W scanner  I bought in February 2014) was gone!  It is replaced with Nuance PDF Viewer Plus, which lacks the scanning function and many editing functions of the PDF Professional. I do a fair amount of scanning and PDF editing for kids' school work and record keeping, so the downgrading is a severe penalty to me.Unable to find the scanner software installation disk, I turned to Brother customer service for help.  I asked whether a replacement scanner software installation disk could be mailed to me.  The answer was no.  Rather, I was advised that I need to purchase the software disk by calling a telephone number.  Disappointed, I made the request again and made sure that the customer service representative understands that the uninstallation of PDF Professional was not my fault, and Brother should not have done that without my informed consent, and doing so amounts to taking away my license to the PDF Professional.  I informed the esteemed representative that I would have to share my negative experience here if the issue is not addressed properly.I was then flabbergasted to receive the following:"We understand your frustration; however, when new Brother Machines are installed and it has updated software, the updated software is installed as well. Unfortunately, we are unable to replace the installation CD free of charge as it was not damaged or found to be defective upon purchase. Please note that you are certainly entitled to do whatever you feel is necessary. If you decide to publicize any comments regarding Brother, we must caution you to make sure that any and all statements you make are accurate and verifiable. We contract an outside agency to monitor the Internet for all information posted regarding Brother. This information is periodically reviewed by our legal department. Brother pursues legal action and seeks punitive damages against any individuals that post information which is either untrue or slanderous to Brother's reputation. We say this not as a threat, but only to advise you to you consider your actions carefully. …… Thank you for choosing Brother! At your side, … Brother Customer Service."Brother!  Big Brother! Do I deserve this?  I thought I have been a loyal and good customer, albeit small and helpless!

Came quickly and I was so happy because I was anxious to try it. I am not a professional artist but I was able to see a huge difference in quality compared to the ones you get from the pad.  I should have believed in the other review I read here. Very disappointed!!!

I have had several previous VTech phone systems and this seemed like it would be a nice upgrade. The most important thing I require is clear sound and the VTech delivers with great sound in HD. Five stars on the sound quality. But I had a major problem with the set I received. One of the phone receivers starting getting stuck so that no matter what button I pressed it would indicate that I was pressing "6". ANY button I pressed: talk, hang up, menu, any number on the keypad etc. making this a worthless receiver. 0 stars for the defective receiver. I also didn't like that there is a color picture on the display at all times even when not in use. The picture is a picture of a city building and it's not obvious how to either change the picture or not display any picture since I'd rather not have something illuminated 24 hours a day. While the phone sounds good I wouldn't get this particular set again.

It only works 1 out of 20 times when i try to print something. I keep cleaning the ink system again and again and still extremely poor printing. Better spend some extra money and get better ink. I got this one as it had high ratings but not sure how it got all those high ratings!

These rings are seemingly strong, durable, and the thickness is right. They give enough flex so that I can separate the ring to attach things.My biggest complain, and reason for 2 stars, is quality control. About 1/3 of the key rings I received were melded together into a solid ring with no openings.  Meaning I could not pry apart the ring to loop anything, rendering the key ring useless. I tried using an exacting blade to separate, but nope- they’re melded solid.I like the product. Just need to get past the QC issues that will send 1/3 of them straight into the garbage.

This is so disappointing! It's so nice looking. As other reviewers mentioned, the back and drawer bottoms are not real wood, although they seem reasonably sturdy. However, the nails won't go through them. This is partly because the nails bend instantly; of the many included in the package, about half of them were unusable. I had to duct tape the backs of the drawers and the bottom back of the cabinet - in addition to adding pieces to the bottom because it wasn't long enough to meet the back. The pre-drilled holes are in the wrong places. It's hard to tell in this photo, but the bar in the middle that's supposed to be extra support is uneven, it tilts both vertically and diagonally, as in there's about an inch difference where each side sits from the side, and an inch difference measured from the floor as well. The drawers won't even go above and below it when it's in there. I'm not going to try to send it back, because it's more trouble than it's worth with such a large piece. But what a complete waste of money.

I was really pleased when I first installed the cartridges. The print quality was good enough for at-home casual printing. When you needed or simply wanted a hard copy of something that didn’t need to be high quality, it seemed these inks were the perfect solution. However, when you don’t use your printer for a period of time and then decide to print, the cartridges perform horribly! The ink seems to bleed and you can hardly discern what you intended to print. The print heads have to be cleaned before each each use (assuming you don’t use your printer regularly) to print normally. Unfortunately, I’ve never paid attention to how long it has been before each printing. Nevertheless, this is not a problem with official inks or even Costco refills! Rating this product - when it’s good, it’s good. But those moments when it fails, is horrible!

My god this was such a horrible stapler.  I was in the market for a heavy duty stapler because the higher-ups at my job don't provide the best staplers for their employees and I decided to just get one myself.  The kind of job I have at work involves stapling papers all the time....I could use a stapler up to 60 times or more per day and that takes a toll on a regular office stapler.  Sometimes I would staple thick stacks but mostly thin stacks.  After two years at the place where I work, I've already broken two staplers and I knew it was only a matter of time before they made me buy my own stapler.  So I decided to do it right after I broke my second one.  While the reviews for this product were mostly positive with the exception of one other reviewer, unfortunately I have to side with that lone review that gave this product a one star rating.  It jammed almost every time I tried to use it.  Then after I got it to work, it refused to push the next staple forward.  Then I took out the 1/4" inch staples and put in a 3/8" inch and I still got the same problems.  The stapler did work with 15/16" staples without jams but then the staples would protrude back up..which means you could accidentally stab yourself!  Plus I didn't have anything thick enough that would require a 15/16" staple.  This stapler was marketed being able to staple anything from 2-220 sheets but I can tell you right off the bat that's not true.  It's possible that this stapler requires special staples like the Stanley Bostitch EZ Squeeze 130 (Which I wound up replacing this garbage with) but it never specified that it did unlike the Bostitch 130.  For the record I did find Rapid Staples but at that point I was so disgusted with this stapler I just chucked it instead of returning it.  If you are looking for an all purpose stapler that can handle small and thick stacks of paper, go with the Bostitch 130, not this.

I used to buy pencils reading the reviews but this one , I missed . I used to buy a lot of writing supplies and it’s only now that I got frustrated . I thought at first . “wow , many erasable pencils with just $5 “ but to my dismay when I received one. Get back to my account and read the description .: Lesson learned: Don’t be fooled by the pictures  .

The only thing I like is the assortment of sizes. But I am very disappointed by this product, the quality is very inferior, the pouches don't lay flat. Also many of them are very wrinkled, they look like they were heated and started to slightly melt. That best describes what they look like. I am afraid I won't be using them for any of my crafting projects.  As far as giving this a score, it gets the lowest 1 out of 5 stars, I would not recommend, nor would I buy the product again!

I am not sure if I will keep or sent back. It appears to get the job done. However all I did was get up quickly and bumped my table a little with my hip and it fell off the tray. I am telling u, I am a small person, and I barely touched the table. It was the teeniest shake ever. I would spring for a better one, one that locks the laptop in instead. Also...not the pics. The screws on the bottom are in an awful place! I was just trying out my laptop on it, moving it around to get the best spot for my Webcam (onine teacher) and all the while it was scratching my brand new table! Cheap, $30 table from Walmart but I love it! It has been perfect for my set up..and now it's scratched to death! Not happy!! I had to putty over the screws. Thank god it wasn't an expensive table I would be throwing a royal fit. Those scratches happened in like 3 minutes of time moving it around to adjust lighting and comfort etc.  If keep this, I will need to find a permanent fix for both problems. Covering the screws and getting to lock in my laptop. The only reason it got a 2 and not a 1 star, is bc it is doing what it should, but with defects. And maybe if someone can lower it, i have it as vertical as i can get it do to needing to use a stylus and trying not to bump any keys. Maybe it won't fall for someone who would have it lower.

I got burned on this one. Sold as a pair and I only received one. There are a lot of other people who have had the same experience if you read the other reviews. I'm bitter because the it would be too much hassle to return it so I'll just wind up writing it off as a loss.  If Amazon cared they would pay attention to all of the people this has happened to and drop the pain down on the seller till they shaped up.

I will only give them a 2 star because out of the two inks in the box only one worked, I followed all the troubleshooting in the box and still got an error, so I give up, the one I used first worked very good,  The other one I couldn’t use at all seems to me that the chip is missing a dot when I compare the full to the empty one that might be the problem.

This is not the complete phone for anyone else who gets confused. This is an accessory handset. You cannot buy this by itself and use it as a phone. There is no phone jack on the phone or the base. You have to buy CS2619 or CS6229. I would think there should be a better description for this phone since it is one of the top results for "cordless phone" but whatever. The only indication is the two word description "accessory handset." Again, do not buy this unit if you need a complete phone. Rated 1 star for inaccurate description.

It has 12 pages of monthly calendars, but it does not have enough daily pages to be a 12 month calendar, only enough to get you from January to August. Also, the monthly stickers that are shown, they gave me 2 pages of the January through August stickers (which is fitting) but not the page of stickers that cover from September to December. I kept getting hassled to leave a review so here is my review.

It looks like you're getting 4 books. Who orders 1 comp book for $6? Assorted colors is very misleading!!!!!!!  One crappy, over packaged book.  Normally I read reviews but this looked so straight forward.  It is misleading and deceitful

Envelopes are wrinkled right out of the box. Obviously a quality control issue at production. I should have listened to the reviews and not saved the couple of bucks. Adhesion is questionable, I'm going to tape these as I can't trust a second rate mailer to not open up.

Carefully consider the other reviews.  There is a serious critical flaw that renders this item near useless.  First, look at the positive reviews and see how long the reviewers have had the item - not very long.  I've only had it for several months, and just did a "check" tonight to make sure I could access the case rapidly.  It didn't work.  Why?  Were the batteries dead?  No.  The plastic battery compartment that holds the batteries is shockingly flimsy.  The lag of rigidity means the batteries cannot make contact, and therefore you cannot open the safe.  Unable to open the safe I had to hunt for the manual keys (defeating the purpose of having electronic access) and open it up only to find that the stunningly cheaply made flimsy battery holder was warped (despite being kept in a climate controlled environment and have had it only for a few months) preventing the batteries from maintaining contact, which prevented me from opening the case with the electronic code. I push the batteries into place, they pop right back out.  If you are OK with only being able to access the case with a manual key, maybe this will work for you, though there are cheaper options for that kind of manual access.  If you want an electronic key-code access, you simply cannot trust or depend on this case.
The extension for the mouse as advertised was missing. It was not included in the package. This is the main reason for the low overall rating.

This is my third Palm.  I started out with the orginial one; then a Palm Vx.I am not too computer savvy.  I have to have my son help me with hardware/software.  I bought this in Dec. 05.  Several times at the most inconvenient times, it doesn't turn on even without a soft reset.  But it will turn on when I plug it into the USB port on my computer...except that I am usually not anywhere near my computer when this happens. I travel a lot and when it refuses to turn on even when my battery is almost fully charged, it is very frustrating.The customer support is awful...can't get them on the phone and the website addresses the problem with a soft reset which doesn't solve my problem.  But I would like this fixed!I recently had a problem with my HP laptop and the HP support was awesome.  Palm customer support has a lot to learn and certainly won't win any JD Powers awards.  Consider alternatives if you want stability.  Reading thru the reviews, I am not the only one having this problem....and I have only one additional program downloaded and it's not a third party program; it's one that was offered on Palm Addit.

I bought this chair and I'm a little pessimistic about it. I've owned other big & tall chairs as well as regular chairs. I can tell you that in a regular chair, the first thing to go are almost always the casters. The second to go is almost always the height and recline angle bar, internal to the adjustment mechanism. I have owned other big & tall chairs that have enforced, heavy-duty casters, thicker bars and a thicker, stronger "elevation mechanism" - not exactly sure what its called. I don't really see any of that on this chair and I'm pessimistic that this chair will work out for the long term. Also, as another reviewer mentioned, the seat itself isn't very wide. Every big & tall chair I've owned also has a wider seat, this one does not. So all of those items make me believe that this isn't a REAL big & tall chair. I feel like TUL has just added some more padding and called it big & tall but I don't see any of the construction that indicates to it lasting me a long time. I'm disappointed in this purchase.

This is horribly awkward to maneuver. Even if you get it to a good position, it tends to tilt & then once you put your laptop on it then the slight tilt becomes the whole thing tipping over. I finally got the thing into a somewhat acceptable position, however the mouse attachment wasn't able to be in a position that was remotely comfortable and convenient to use. I usually don't write reviews but this product is so horribly constructed.
These cartridges are too big for the standard Lamy AL-star fountain pen - don't buy them.

Read some reviews about the drawers not fitting, I thought "well, I'm pretty good at fixing things I'll make it work." hahaha no. I loosened the screws evenly, little by little to try to make space for the drawers, they don't fit at all until the stand is wobbly enough to fall over.  Not sure what to do with it now.

I read the reviews and wrongly thought I would be the exception!  I carefully opened each cartridge after laying out a layer of paper towels just in case they leaked.  Wow, these carts redefined leak.  Ink poured out of the black and cyan like rainfall from Noah's flood.  I cleaned the mess up (my hands will need several weeks to wear off the mess) and wiped down the cartridges. It was then that I discovered that my HP Photosmart B8550 printer used two different blacks.  One is a narrow one and the other is considerably wider.  I only received the large so I do not have a cartridge for the narrow slot.  The printer will not run without all carts in place.All 10 cartridges are now in the trash.

I don't usually write reviews, but this company really pissed me off.The stamp is fine, that isn't my issue.My issue is that there's no way to get small text. I read some other customer reviews and people recommended filling all 5 lines in order to get small text. So I did this, but I didn't want 5 lines of stuff, I just wanted small text. So I put it in this format:..(Text)(Text)(Text)Basically I added periods in the top 2 lines as placeholders so they would scale down the size of the text. They did not do this, so I asked for a refund. After receiving a refund, the company wrote an email and asked me how to fix the issue, which I detailed pretty clearly. Jump ahead a few days and it's Deja vu. They've sent me another stamp IDENTICAL to the first one they sent, neither of which being what I ordered or wanted.So I said forget it, took my free stamp, and ordered from Vista print. I'll probably throw this one away.Don't order from this company if you actually want a custom stamp. Spend the extra $10 and get one EXACTLY how you want it from literally any other website. You wouldn't think when they say "custom" it's "5 SMaLl or 1 rEAlLy biG!"

Doesn't last as long as a new purchase - my printer still indicated that color was low after switching the cartridge into this. I had read reviews saying the same thing before and didn't believe it but it is definitely true.

Its good for the price, All three ink cartridge are NOT broken that good,  but if I open one of the package I think M~(Pink ink cartridge) it was broken :( please send an replacement M Pink ink cartridge so i can give it an 5-star

This is a great chair with a very strong hydraulic and pretty great lumbar support. Aesthetically, its quite pleasant and attractive. I suppose for some users, the cushioning might be a bit on the firm side, but it has never been uncomfortable for me. All-in-all, a great purchase worth the money.Just remember one thing: leather does not breathe as easily as mesh. After the first 4 hours or so, you're going to need to stand to let it cool for a while.UPDATE 10/16:Sadly I have to revise my original rating down as I'm having a rather serious issue with my chair. The plate connecting the chair to the hydraulic has, for lack of a better term, torn in half. I've attached photos to show what I'm talking about. The chair now has a STEEP slant down and to the right, and is nearly unusable.I did get some "mileage" from this chair, but for a $250 price tag and a rather inconvenient, even difficult assembly process I was hoping for substantially more time before I had to look for a replacement.

These clips seemed great at first glance, but they did NOT fit my Harbor Freight 6 x 8 greenhouse.  They are shaped differently than the original clips and do not seat firmly between the panels and the frame. They just slide out and are useless for their intended purpose.  I tried every imaginable orientation, all with the same poor result.  I am baffled by this as many other previous reviewers have said that the clips fit their same greenhouse perfectly.  Perhaps the design has changed.  In any case, they didn't work out for me.

I was very excited for this pen, but was very disappointed. I watched videos and reviews and everything looked perfect. The ink that they supply for this pen is very light. I mean it's so light you can still see the paper behind the ink when you write. Honestly I was expecting something that was WAY better quality.

I should have paid attention to the reviews. It arrived with a 1" hole completely through the board (see photos). That despite an intact layer of air-cell plastic wrap completely around it. Almost like it was already damaged when it was packed. I need to use it immediately, so no time to re-pack and return. Unfortunate, because it's a nice design and I like the weight of the frame.

Only one of the pens had ink in it...the other ones were all dried out. Terrible!The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because I have been using this type of pen for a long time and like the way it writes.

This is what I paid 34 dollars for ??? What a waist of money don’t buy zero stars 06-28-2022update: I didn’t know prior to buying these boxes and that you can go to your local grocery stores and ask them for boxes like your Home Depot like Walmart and Costco ect. they give them to you for free do this save yourself some money and the boxes are decent

This ink has ruined my printer, I have purchased other compatible ink in past that worked great.  I just wasted my money on this ink, nothing but printer errors and black ink everywhere in printer.  I have tried everything to clear ink cartridge error, nothing works. I guess it is back to over priced hp ink, if my printer is even savable at this point.  Wish there was a zero star choice.

They stuck a giant sticker on the top of the box with so much adhesive you need chemicals to get it off.This makes the box very ugly and a waste of money. Choose a different product. I can't believe anyone gave this piece of crap a positive review.

I hate reviews that rate the manufacturer or the delivery rather than the product. But in this case, I believe the rating of the manufacturer is appropriate. The chair came unassembled with a flimsy Allen wrench. The assembly took approximately 45-60 minutes. The very last assembly was the arm to the back. This is where I found out that the part did not fit and the arm could not be attached to the chair making it a "one arm" desk chair.Now comes the good part. I contacted the manufacturer as per the instructions. I faxed a copy of the parts request form and Amazon receipt and waited for a response. After 3 calls to inquire when the new arm would be shipped, I was finally told that it would be shipped the next day and would have it by Christmas (the chair was supposed to be a Christmas present. Today I get a response to another (my 3rd) e-mail inquiry that the part is back ordered and hopefully I will receive it in 10-12 weeks.This is a company the knowingly sells defective products and does not provide for replacement for 3-4 months. It does not deserve to be in business, and everyone who is concerned about the lack of customer service in this country should boycott this product.

I purchased this printer in July of 2010, which means I have owned it for over two years now, and in those two years I have gone through 5 print heads.  Each time the print head failed the ink cartridges were between half to full.  I called Lexmark tech support five times and they verified what I had already knew, the print head failed.  Lexmark Tech support was very kind and helpful, and every time I called with a problem they sent a new print head and new print cartridges, but it always seems that the print head failed when I required the printer the most.  As of the writing of this product review another print head failed, so I am looking for another printer.  The said fact is that I worked at Lexmark and I know they can make a better product than this over sized "plastic paper weight."So, to sum this review up, I give the printer one star and Lexmark tech support 5 stars, but I am not going to reflect the tech support rating in the overall rating of this product because the review is on the printer.My advice to all of you out there, avoid this printer, it is a waste of money.  Unfortunately, after reading many of the customer reviews on the various printers (from the most notable printer manufacturers) there isn't too much out there to choose from in the reliable low cost printers arena.  It seems the manufacturers of these printers are more concerned about the bottom line than producing good printer.  Personally, I am fed up with all of the Chinese made junk, I think it's time to start bringing the engineering and production of goods back to the U.S. where quality control can be monitored much better.

I was very impressed with this printer for the first 6 months, however, a multitude of problems have since rendered this thing nearly useless.  What a waste. As many other reviewers have complained, the printhead developed problems and had to be replaced early on, the WiFi constantly lost connection with the computer, requiring frequent printer reboots (my other WiFi devices have no such problem), the software freezes, particularly when printing from Windows Explorer (even with the Lexmark Toolbar), and the cartridges simply stop printing evenly, even after multiple cleanings. There are other problems as well, but I will spare you.  All drivers/firmware etc. have been updated.  I eventually pulled the plug on the WiFi and use ethernet. At the moment, I have 4 half-full relatively new cartridges that print erratically, which finally prompted me to write this review to warn others. My wife is ready to bring in the slegehammer.

PIC - left side is from a different brand (Ampad) - Right side are ones Im reviewing here (junk).  They are both suppose to be the same 24lb paper.  They sure dont feel like it. After reading all the reviews on all different envelopes on amazon - it seems that all  have same reviews. Everybody says they are too thin. Same complaint.  So I figure I buy the highest rates ones.  Well, guess what - same story. I have a picture to prove it.  I fluffed both and took a picture. This is the best way to visualize how thin and cheap the paper is. Even taking the peel paper from the glue it tough. Its hard to take a picture of thin paper.  I return them and bought AMPAD envelopes.  I used them before with great success.  I do a lot of mailing. I figure I try some brands from AMAZON. Well, that was a bad choice.

This product does work, but don't buy it planning to easily adjust the height.  Each individual joint has a knob that you press in to adjust the level of that segment.  Thankfully, the button/knob does have degrees on it because you'll have to make sure the other side is exactly the same or the table will not work.  It took a lot of finagling to get it to a usable height where it was balanced and would not fall and I found it no use for bed (was hoping to use after back surgery while laying) but I did end up using this on my desk to raise my laptop so I can use it while standing.  But once you get it in the right position you are not going to easily raise or lower it because if you adjust one segment you have to adjust the other segments or else the balance is off.  The pros are that it is lightweight.  There were no instructions for attaching the mouse pad to the table and I wish there had been recommended settings (degrees on the knob/buttons) to make it easier to put it in the position you're looking for without so much trial and error.  My 17 inch laptop does fit on it and overhangs the back slightly - about 1-2 inches - not enough to cause any balance issues.  It is a nice idea for a concept but it doesn't really work in practice and I definitely wouldn't buy again or recommend to anyone else unless you plan on putting it in one position and leaving it there indefinitely/permanently (and not needing to fold up for storage).  This product was just under thirty dollars when I purchased it.  For ten to fifteen dollars I would probably rate it a star higher b/c it'd be a decent value, but it wasn't worth what I paid.

Do NOT buy this product. I wish I could say Kudo's to one other review I looked at but could not find their review. I should have listened to their review about the leakage of these ink cartridges.I purchased this because my HP D7260 printer kept saying my ink was "old" and needed replaced along with expired ink cartridges. Before using "these" I tried to clean and align the printer. Kept complaining about the ink. Purchased these. Each cartridge is really flimsy on the cover on the ink ports (like Saran Wrap) and was not sure whether these would work. Well.... They are JUNK. I now have to pitch the printer and (thank goodness for previous review) not my desk, I put 4 layers of paper under the printer should it and It DID leak. Magenta, blue all over the place. Paper under the printer stopped this from ruining my desk. To sum things up... These ruined my printer and almost ruined my desk.Buyer Beware... Don't buy this product. It is JUNK and will cost you a lot in the long run. You may have to repair your desk or get rid of your printer.

I should have paid more attention to the many informative reviews before I made my purchase. Like dozens of others here, when my boxes arrived, one was cracked to the point of being unusable. And like many others here, I was offered a refund, which tells you the price of these boxes is marked up way beyond cost. Indeed, they’re constructed of cheap, flimsy plastic and shipped with zero padding because why invest in quality control when you can pass any extra costs and headaches on to the consumer? Look, I’m not oblivious: I ordered mass produced plastic containers to be delivered straight to my door to store the excess stuff piling up in my home. And now I’m griping about the imperfections I myself have incentivized. Shame on me. But you can do better, and you can start by looking elsewhere. These boxes might hold your stuff; they’re unlikely to contain your regret.

These folders are really nice - the review is not because the actual product is faulty. I love that the folder zips shut and I can fit a ton of letter-sized manilla folders inside. As a teacher, it is nice to put papers inside and know that if my bag dumps or it falls off the desk the papers won't go flying. The 1-star review is because the description says "assorted colors, 6 files per pack" which implied that there would be six files in my order. I received only one. Amazon customer service refunded my money and had them resend my order. Again, I received only one. The seller needs to adjust the product description so that it is accurate. Don't expect six files!

If you are a graphic designer, STAY AWAY from this printer! It cannot handle "complex" documents (e.g., InDesign files -- nor PDFs created from InDesign files, for that matter)... You will get a stream of gobbledygook PostScript errors printed across the top of many sheets of paper, and it's not easy to cancel a job once it starts printing! And when it does print correctly, the colors are awful -- this printer adds a layer of wax to the CMYK inks, which makes the colors look dirty. If, however, you just need to print simple text documents (from a word processor, say), or image files (JPEGs, TIFFs, etc.), and you are on a tight budget, then this printer will do. (I did not use the wireless printing feature, so I can't review that aspect.)

Your description states this is for models including the TS9120, but comes without the Pixma Blue color.  I see now it says only 5 cartridges, but who reads all the verbiage?  Had the right model listed, had good reviews, so I bought it. It should not list a model that requires 6 colors.

Was amazing, until the armrest that I never used decided to break, and now it keeps leaning back. On a side note, the locking mechanism to stop the backrest from leaning back is finicky and will disengage itself randomly, sending you flying back when you least expect it. I had this for exactly eight months before it broke. Only reason it gets two stars is because it is really comfortable, aside from the the terrible backrest angle.

I would have rated ZERO stars if it were possible.I bought this printer about 2 years ago and it has been nothing but a headache. I had to have Lexmark send me a new printhead the first week of use, as it kept drawing huge swaths of cyan across printer jobs. It's true the printer cartridges are the cheapest around, but they also run out the quickest, and I have had several fail. The print quality is only fair. The printer cover never quite aligned correctly with the base, and a few months ago, as I was trying to get it to align during a scan, the left hinge broke. I would be willing to say I was responsible if not for all the other users complaining of very same issue. Finally, I replace a black cartridge tonight, and now the printhead is not communicating with the printer. It will cost me $60 for an new printhead. Not going to happen.I will never purchase another Lexmark device again. The only way I could recommend this product to someone else is for use as a boat anchor, and only if they didn't have to pay for it.

I'm not sure how these can even be sold.  I have purchased two from a chain store and both were irreparably broken. I inspected two more in the store only to find them broken in the same way. So in my experience 100% failure rate.
Like said in other reviews, this arrived in a super bulky box and was dented, scratched, and torn.  So not worth it, I want my money back!!!!

I don't like to give bad reviews, but I must on this item. Got this October 26, 2018 and use at work. It is so hard now that I can't use it. Actually makes my siatica and leg pain worse. I recommend the Everlasting brand it keeps it's cushiness and is worth the extra money. Bought it at same time to use at home and it is as good as the first day I got it.

First things first:  This unit is more like a thermal wax transfer printer (for those of you old enough to remember those) than a laser. I didn't know this until after I bought it and read that it puts down a thin layer of wax to create colors. When crinkled, you can see the wax "crack" or wear down. True laser printers don't use wax. Okay, not that huge of a deal breaker because of the low price.But then there's the question of how economical it is to keep.  The replacement toner cartridges cost more than the unit itself. Other reviews talked about how it drains power out of the sockets - it's totally true! Our computer room has 4 breakers, with the overhead fan/light & desk lamps on the lowest powered one (the original - we added the rest). The first time I turned it on, ALL of the lights flickered for more than a few seconds. When you power it up or print to it, it sucks the electricity right out of the wall! That can't be good news for when our electric bill comes.It is very slow to print, which is acceptable considering the price.  The wireless networking feature doesn't work like it's supposed to, and we tried every which way to set it up.One major annoyance is that I lose the device status/connectivity every time I shut down or reboot my pc.  We've got it hardwired to the network, and everything's perfectly fine until I have to reboot/power down my computer. When I power back up, the device shows as being "Offline", even though the printer is on. The printer is still listed under "Devices & Printers", but until I reinstall it, it will continue to show it as offline.But, if you don't mind the power drain, wax transfer, high replacement toner cost, and using the printer directly connected to your pc via usb, it's definitely the printer to buy.  Me?  I wouldn't buy it again & wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.

I should have listened to the other reviews, this is not gold nor is it shimmery.  It's so ugly!  Resembles a 1970s vinyl kitchen floor.  The color is more of a mix of tan and mustard.  Not cute at all.  So disappointed :(

This  product does not do what it promised.  There is very limited verbal function.  To use it takes so much time and distrction that ordinary communication is not possible.  The Spanish speakers are derisive of it.  I put it aside and never used it again agter one day, I am in the middle of a 24 day trip for which I bought it, and this product is a waste of money.  I will be very very cautious about buying any electronic product from Amazon, it was rated ver highly.....impossible for me to imagine how.

Ordered two units from Epharos - both lasted only a few minutes, then quit. - returned for refund.  Advise get name brand replacements - even if they cost several times more.  (The original bulb was rated for 5000 hours).

I hate paying so much for ink and True Red ink is never in stock from Staples, so I was super excited to find this with relatively positive reviews. It arrived within 2 days. I installed the black cartridge with no problems. I printed one page in black & white but it came out sort of blue-gray. I tried to print another page and although the printer was going through the motions, the page came out with nothing on it at all. I tried pulling it out and putting it back in - same result.Sadly, I had to return it. Perhaps I just got a bum cartridge, but I needed to print and had to move on.

I read the other reviews and purchased this numbering machine based on those reviews, which except for 1, were very positive.  NO ONE, HOWEVER, MENTIONED THE INSTRUCTIONS that came with the machine.  They are not specific enough.  I searched the web for better instructions, but only found the same sheet that comes with the product.  The line drawings of the machine are not detailed enough for me, and it took me a long time to figure out how to work the machine.  Granted, I had never used a numbering machine before, but I am a reasonably intelligent person who would not have experienced such difficulty if better instructions had been included.  The machine does work well once you figure it out!!

dimensions are not what is listed in the description. This thing is tiny. It's not the older "ergobeads" product. The dimensions are more like 5" across, 3.5" at the highest tall, and about 1" deep. It's very small. Too small compared to the older "ergobeads" that many are used to. I'm going to toss this one out. I gave it 1 star since I couldn't give it ZERO stars. Too small to be effective - needs to be larger - not in the same class as the larger ergobeads product.

What a giant piece of worthless!Sure the B + W cartridges are only $5, but the color cartridges are almost $20 each at some outlets.  And guess what happens when your color inks run low, all functions stop working.  Not just printing, but scanning as well.  This thing won't let you scan to a digital file when ink is low.Each time you turn it on it spits a fair bit of ink out for head cleaning, so even if you don't print in color, expect to have to shell out $50 a year for color cartridges just to keep the thing in operation.I bought this printer because at the time it had great reviews, now not so much.  Lexmark really dropped the ball on this one and I am done playing ball with them.This was my first.... and now LAST Lexmark product.  Going back to Epson or Canon.

I wish cartridge makers were required to indicate the amount of ink in the cartridges. I had cartridges last year that would last months ( I put the date on all my cartridges for comparison). When my supply ran out 2 months ago I order two of these thinking they would last about 4 months based on past usage. When the first ran out after 2 1/2 week I thought it was just a bad cartridge and replaced it with second cartridge. Well the second lasted about 3 weeks. I don't do heavy copying as I just do about 100-150 sheets per month. Second one went just a fast so again I though I had received a bad production batch. Reordered because I like to use original manufacture ink. Third cartridge is now in and I'm not expecting much better. Just read reviews on another site (sorry, I forgot to copy link) that states most manufacturers are really cutting the amount of ink in the cartridges significantly!! some by 2/3rds. This is how they sell the printers cheap and kill you with replacing ink cartridges. I really don' want to go to the trouble of refilling these little jokers.

I never write reviews, but I felt compelled to write this one because of how terrible these markers are.  I had to double-check that the seller was actually Expo.I received them in a large box with another item I ordered.  The markers were not even in a package; they were rolling around freely at the bottom of the box with the packing materials.  They look identical to the old Expo markers I am replacing, but the ink color is incredibly faint - in fact, it is MARKEDLY lighter than the drying up markers I am replacing.  I can barely see the letters unless I am standing right next to the white board.  I'm confused by how bad they are.  Definitely would not order again.

I received the pen and I had questions about it from the moment I took it out of the package.  The LAMY box was taped at the top.  As another reviewer noted, the clip was very loose.  I was overlooking that, assuming it was simply an issue with the design. (It would appear that if you put pressure at the top of the clip it pushes the bottom of the clip away from the pen to make it easier to slip in a shirt pocket.) But, the final straw was that the pen had difficulty engaging the ink cartridge.  It would take multiple attempts to engage at times, and sometimes the cartridge would retract when you tried to write with it. I changed the cartridge and still had the same issue.  I am a fan of LAMY, and do like the design, but I was not going to spend this much on a ballpoint that was not reliable.  Maybe I received a return that had problems. Regardless, I may try another LAMY 2000 in the future, but this one is going back.
I am returning this box because the top box came with a broken lid. When this is resolved I will update my review.
If I could give 0 stars,  especially for sturdiness,  I would.  Bought for my disabled father who lives on a third floor,  and the cart feels like it's going to fall apart. I would NOT recommend

Is not fit for purpose. Would give 1 star it had been more expensive. It states that is a Dry Erase for white board however it sticks like it is a permanent marker. Every time my kids find them and use them on the whiteboard I have to use detergent to wipe it off.
Adhesive doesn't stay. Only lasted about 24 hours and every piece I used fell off without even any weight on it. I should have read the reviews.

Update to my previous 5 star review.  When I ordered the HP 92/93 cartridges I ordered two sets.  The first set worked fine and lasted a long time.  The second set which I just put in worked fine at first and then ink faded out after only about 10 pages of printing.  I put my printer thru the cartridge cleaning cycle and the amount of ink got even worse.  Useless cartridges.  Sadly it is obviously hit or miss with these and I will never be buying again.______________________________________________________________________________________________________________Previous review  - Both HP 92 and 93 cartridges work greatIt's been over 10 years since I have given remanufactured ink cartridges a shot.  They were always leaking and worked streaky at best.  So I've been buying the HP 92 and 93 dual pack to be sure they would work.  But the cartridges are very pricey and when I saw the price and reviews of the Valuetoner cartridges I decided to give them a shot.  If they didn't work out - nothing really lost due to the price.  I was totally impressed with the purchase right upon receiving them.  The cartridges are packaged individually and with great care.  They also come with detailed and clear details on the cartridges themselves, how they work and how to troubleshoot if your printer won't see them as valid cartridges.  It all went very simply for me.  My printer noted that they weren't authentic HP cartridges but accepted them right away and printed the test page the same as after every cartridge installation.  These cartridges did not leak at all upon opening and printed flawlessly upon installation.  The test page was perfect and after about 100 pages both cartridges have not streaked or faltered in quality at all.  I see some people feel some cartridges are not performing as they wish.  Honestly that has happened with authentic HP cartridges to me many times as well.  I print many photos and often with the HP cartridges they would start fading or streaking after only 10 prints and I would have to put my printer through the clean cartridges mode.  With these Valuetoner cartridges that has yet to happen.  I am more than thrilled and impressed with their quality and the professional packaging of the company.  I highly recommend giving this company and these cartridges a shot.  If my cartridges do indeed start to falter I will adjust this review accordingly to be as accurate and helpful as possible.

I am also a middle school teacher (saw a review that someone else left who is a teacher like me).
