I will be moving to a company such as Epson which realizes that gouging customers for the price of printer ink with their smart chips isn't worth it. I'm going for the new Epson Expression EcoTank cuz these babies can be easily refilled with ink which is much more affordable than actually counting the amount of pages your cartridges will do before they run out. I do a lot of printing and the amount of cartridges I've purchased already is enough to buy 10 new printers, plus the amount of empty cartridges that I've thrown away in the garbage could start another plastic landfill..! Take a little time to review the Epson Expression EcoTank, I think this would be the best way out for someone like me who does a lot of product and presentation printing on a daily basis.
this is a weird review in that I love the product, I just didn’t get what I paid for. Seems there were only ten in my dozen.
Would have been 5 star, but they stopped perforating halfway through the roll.

I wish I can give 0 stars. This was a TERRIBLE product! When transferring, I had to go back several times w/my Rowenta iron & press it down. The picture I've included was after ONE wash.  Aggravating. Anyways, this is just not worth it!

These tape dispensers have good reviews - I'm surprised they do. At first impression, the tape seems good - no apparent problems. I taped several *new* boxes and filled them up. I didn't immediately tape them closed. After a week, on about 1/2 of the 10 boxes I taped the tape lifted away. This wasn't due to hot or cold temperatures, or wet conditions. They just peeled away. This is unacceptable.

Do not purchase.  False advertising! This safe is advertised as keeping documents safe from water. However, all of my documents are moldy from condensation. I had no idea that this was a problem. I have the safe for four years now and have not gone into it for two years. Just went into it and my valuable documents are moldy. The safe is stored in a dry, room temperature area.  I find this absolutely ridiculous that a company can advertise a waterproof safe when nothing could be further from the truth. Incredibly disappointed with Honeywell for putting out such a product. There’s no getting my documents back. Protecting these documents was the reason for purchasing this safe - to keep them free from water and fire damage. I was willing to put up with such a heavy safe in order to preserve my documents. I am beyond disappointed in this product.  I wish I could read it zero stars!

I have two Jinhao 450s - the Blue Swirl and the Red one.  They are both beautiful pens and decent writers for fountain pens under $10.  I had expected the same from this pen, but the color does not at all resemble the picture in the description.  The pen is more metallic or pearl yellow than gold.  It seems well made like the other pens, but I am disappointed by the color.  At under $10 it would be a 4 star pen (unlike my Pilot Metropolitans, which have all be 5 star pens) - another 2 stars off for incorrect color.  Still debating if it is worth trying to return it since I waited over a month for it to arrive.

I am so disappointed in this planner.  I'm a teacher and use my planner for everything, after reading rave reviews I decided to purchase this planner and I hate it will a passion.  The cons:-It's not hardback, rather a laminated paper cover which is not going to last-You can only use it if you lie it flat, you can't fold any pages behind.  Which is very cumbersome and hard to use if I am on the go and trying to write something quickly.  Plus, it takes up way too much room on my desk open flat.-The stickers are cute but a complete pain to put on.  They are cheap and flimsy.-There are no times or lines on the daily planner section, just 3 boxes.  I suppose you could section them into morning, midday and afternoon but it doesn't work for my purposes-If you are flipping through the months quickly, the pages stop and snag.  I have 2 that are already almost torn and I've been using this for less than a week.Pros:-It's pretty.If you seriously use a planner that gets taken to and from work with you I would avoid this one.  I'm upset that I spent the money on this one.
These are the circular shape only. Not mixed - no star or heart shapes photo holders we’re included with mine.

They worked well at first, but after about 3 months they started leaking toner onto the sheets. First a little magenta toner was streaking one edge of the paper, then within a couple of weeks the cyan cartridge started doing it as well, a cleaning cycle stopped it for about a day and now spots of toner are going on every page I print and it's pretty much unusable. The price was great, but the quality just isn't there. I've ordered OEM cartridges, and I hope I didn't do actual damage to the laser. Lesson learned, I guess. I give two stars instead of one because they performed so well at first.EDIT: I will credit their customer service. Within a day they contacted me and shipped me a new set of toner cartridges overnight. I had already installed OEM carts in the printer by then, but I will try the new ones as soon as I use up the HP ones, and will update my review again at that point. Stay tuned. The product I started with may have been poor, but the customer service was not.

After reading other reviews mentioning problems with the keying and lock system for this chest, I decide to purchase one anyway and find out for myself whether the key could be replaced locally with a steel or otherwise stronger material which would not be prone to breakage.  I contacted three local hardware stores and one reputable locksmith.  None could reproduce the key by any method they had available.  Since we cannot risk breaking the provided key, getting it stuck in the lock, and being unable to retrieve valuable contents I plan to return this item or sell it locally.

This item is an absolute waste of your money.  We have an inoperative paper weight now after sharpening less than 2 dozen pencils.  People please read other reviews on the electric and battery operated sharpener and then you will not purchase it.  Seems it lasts just long enough til you throw away the receipt and then it is dies.

I'm an Architecture major who is constantly sketching on all kinds of surfaces. I needed a pen that would not dry out and would provide consistent thin lines. A friend recommended these to me.Now, maybe for a secretary, banker, or business man, only needing to write a name on paper or maybe a checklist, this pen would work Ok. But for my specific requirements the pen is obsolete. After a pretty extensive test (a lecture, and design review) This pen began to gel-up ink on the tip and daub the paper with huge blobs. The ink is painfully slow to dry, does a poor job writing in any position but 90 degrees from the writing surface, and overall is horrible for any artistic application. If you're a lefty like myself RUN AWAY, this pen will make a finger painting from your writing and leave your hand extremely stained will gelled up blobs of ink that won't dry anytime soon...

The product is not as described. It is intended for a professional  operation that has no problem cutting the sheets cleanly into 4 precisely congruent quarters that would look good to an elegant lady. The writing on the product box matches what your website says, but the contents do not match.I am a disabled senior citazen whose printer is not working, so returning this product is a big problemI paid for one day shipping because I considered the need to be urgent.After reading other reviews claiming that there are perforations for separating the sheets into quarters, I re-examined the sheets and found faint perforations. However, I found that the separations were not crisp.
Like other reviews, the suction cup doesn't work well enough to hold on dash or windshield.  Great idea, but poor design. Waste of money.

This product does not deserve 1 star but it would not accept review unless it had a star.I have been using Avery 8315 for about 10 years and the colors were just perfect, and this is using different printers.  Now Avery has changed from manufacturing in Germany to Mexico.  The colors produced on this new stock are just awful -- brown, dull and just no life to colors.  I have been in touch with Avery personally and they do not seem to get and are not very responsive.  This product goes from 5 stars to 0.

I wish I read the reviews before buying these pens. I have the same problem as a few other people. After writing with any of the colored pens for a couple of lines, the ink fades out, as if it is running out of ink. I haven't even dropped any of the pens. I have had gel pens before if I drop it the gel gets messed up and wrote write like it is supposed to, but that is not the case here. Waste of money.

I purchased this printer for my home office based on tech magazine/site and personal reviews 2 years ago. Initially the print quality was good, not great, but okay for my purposes.  About 1.5 years after purchase it started getting squirrely - pages wouln't print and nk quality deteriorated (even with new Epson ink cartridges). Two months ago big green bands of color appeared on everything I printed. Cleaned the nozzle heads and ran numerous troubleshooting scenarios based on the manual and none of these actions worked. A week out of my life that I will never get back. This printer is a dissapointment.

These were absolutely terrible.  I ruined four shirts trying to get them to work.  Not a single transfer ever came out even when: following the directions, using a higher heat setting, trying different fabrics.Eventually I tried the normal transfers (that have all the good reviews) even though I was using 100% polyester and they worked great!  do yourself a favor and just start off with using those.

I have no idea how there are good reviews here. I make huge boxes to ship paintings, and I need a tape that actually sticks. This one doesn't. When I'm in the process of sealing the box, I always hear "pops" because the tape starts coming off. I can actually remove the tape from the box without leaving a trace, it just comes right off very easily. I needed a heavy duty tape that sticks and doesn't come off, and this one is definitely not the one.

I bought this thinking I could have a 2nd tray dedicated to envelopes only. Maybe it'll do the trick, but I have not been able to install it or get it to work as promised. I'll update this review if I ever get it to work properly.

It isnt even worth 1 star. I had to click it to continue.I have never seen such junk in my life. It is unsteady, shoddily made & all but unusable.I have since purchased a STEEL one in a chain store which serves my purposes just fine.

If I can make this product to work as advertised I will up grade this review to 5 stars.I'm talking about the Type B (multi-purpose) paper for film-less decals.  I'm trying to be apply decals on finished (dry) acrylic paintings.  I followed all the directions and tutorials and experimented with heat drying vs natural and with variable drying times, but no matter what I do the ink sticks to the film and peels off when the film is removed.  I love the idea of this product and would be very happy if it worked as well and as easily as shown in the demonstrations.  Hoping for a response from the manufacturer.

This product says that it includes 6 packs of 12 pencils, for a total of 72 pencils.  Instead I received one pack (12 pencils) for nearly $8.  I did see that this happened to at least one other reviewer, but I took the chance because my kids really wanted these for school and it didn't seem to be a problem for everyone.  We love the Ticonderoga brand and the pencils look very cool.How can I make sure that I receive the other 5 packs as advertised?  Otherwise I will be returning these for a refund.

I usually never write reviews and I never write a negative one but.....I am so surprised that there are so many people saying this item actually works!! It doesn't! It's so flimsy. First of all putting it together is not that hard but it falls apart when you roll it! I can't even believe people can say it's great. It's not. Save yourself money and buy something that is sturdy and you can actually roll without it falling apart.

I’d love to review the ACCO clips, but the vendor (Amazon seller Quick Supplies) identified another brand of clip as ACCO.They’re just clips, so in this case, it doesn’t matter. But one would have to wonder about what Quick Supplies would sell packaged as something else.

Defective product.  No January 31!  Pages out of order.  Looking more closely at the reviews (too late) it looks as if someone got stuck with a run of defective calendars from the drunk shift at the printer, and is flogging them off here.  I'm hesitant to return it because I'm fairly certain they'll just turn around and pass it on to the next sap.  Don't be that sap.

Just awful, received this a few weeks ago but just got it out of its packaging (as it was supposed to be a present) and it's all scratched! Read a few reviews after seeing this and other customers have said the same. Poor quality especially for what I paid. Tried to contact the seller, however, it doesn't seem as though you can after searching for a few days? Please message if you see this.
Boxes were light weight (similar to other reviews), however they were packaged so poorly that they all arrived damaged.  I would not order again!

I wish I had read the other reviews of this product before I ordered it. Although it is advertised to fit a Brother HL2270, it doesn't. It seems to slide into the drum assembly, but makes a flapping noise when you try to print, and the paper doesn't load from the tray. Bottom line: it doesn't work at all. I even took my printer to an authorized Brother repair shop, who verified that this toner simply doesn't work with the HL2270. But because I ordered it in April, but didn't really need it until December, this company refused to provide a refund. Do yourself a favor and order something that actually works. I'm disappointed that Amazon allows vendors to claim their products work when they do not.
The pens are defective. The red one never worked. The black one dried out after two uses. The blue one does not have a tip. The purple one is still going strong. Hence the 2 stars.

This is absolutely not worth 2 cents. It is super difficult to get the needle in and out of the gun, it jams with every pull of the trigger and it leaves BIG holes in anything you tag! If I could give this product zero stars, I would! I would love to return it, because I feel like I just threw $10 in the trash, but it is "not eligible for return". I assume I can't return it because the seller probably knows what a POS this product is and wouldn't want to deal with everyone returning them all the time! Don't waste your money!!

I gave this item one star, because I had to rank somewhere. Item is garbage, I cleaned the wall, laid the item out to flatten after receiving it in shipping, but as the picture shows, item will not stick to the surface at all. No matter how many time I kept flattening it with a credit card to eliminate bubbles behind the surface. Don’t buy this item, spring for a true FatHead or something of better quality. Tried to return or replace the item, but that option is not available on this item. So, I’m stuck with trash!!!!
I have ordered 2 different ones both came broken, so I can not review how it works as neither purchases worked properly.

My friend bought the blue Lamy pen and when I used that I fell in love with it. I got the purple one as a present for a professor who writes all her test corrections in purple "Because it seems less harsh then writing corrections in red". When then pen arrived it did not write in purple but the same shade of blue as my friend's blue pen. A huge disappointment considering all the positive reviews and the high price I paid for this pen. I'm probably returning the pen and ordering another, hoping that this was just some kind of mistake and not all the purple pens have blue cartridges, the description says the ink SHOULD be purple so we'll see. I also attached a picture of the "purple" ink so everyone can see what I mean.
I wish I could give 0 stars this broke the minute we took it out of the package.
Disappointed. I bought it based on good reviews, but unfortunately none of them worked. I tried all four of them, and the printer could not recognize any of them.  Total waste of time.

I don’t usually write reviews but I feel this is not been advertised right !!!.I have received this today beautiful Filofax and It is advertised as a 12 month Filofax . This had 2020 diary inserts in so there is 3 months left to write in.A waste of everyone’s time ! .
The media could not be loaded.                      as u see in the photos  those aren't the original ink it doesn't work for my printer bad quality if I could I would give then zero stars

I don't normally write reviews, but my experience was so bad, I wanted to tell others not to waste their time or money.  I tried to get this to work in my printer multiple times and tried the tips other reviewers listed to make it work in my printer (which is one of those listed that it should work in) and it still didn't work!!  All this after waiting for 2 weeks for it to arrive.  Save your money and time and just buy the real thing at a local office supply store!!
Very disappointed!  For $7, I received one tiny stack of elephant sticker notes.  Last time I order a product without reading reviews first.
Black cartridges didn't work at all, the only reason for the 2 stars is because the color one worked

I didn't notice until these cards arrived that nearly all of the 5-star reviews were from anonymous reviewers until I received them. These cards will suffice in a pinch but they are definitely not as nice as other alternatives available at the same price point.

As other reviewers stated, the cartridges started off fine but quality has degraded.  With 80% toner life left (per printer) the Cyan cartridge has failed, leaving cyan roller marks on side of page along with toner "splotches" all over each page.  While I did not have any cartridge compatibility issues, the print quality is completely unacceptable.  Have tried numerous calibrations and cleaning print cycles to no avail.Look elsewhere for inexpensive toner cartridges, these aren't worth the hassle.

If you buy these cartridges, you'd better go ahead and budget for a new printhead: Hp 950 Printhead with Set up Cartridge for Officejet Pro 8100 8600 8600 8610 8620 8630 8625 8635 8640 I bought these for my HP OfficeJet Pro 8615 All-in-One.  The colors were faded right out of the box, and if that were the only problem then I'd leave a four star review and keep buying FUZOO ink.  I used these cartridges for about a month without any other problems, but I went on a 10-day vacation and when I came home everything I print had white horizontal lines across it.  I cleaned/aligned the print head repeatedly, but to no avail.  I reached out to FUZOO and they said I caused the problem by allowing my printer to sit idle for a week and a half.  I guess I should have hired someone to pop in once a day and print something while I was on vacation?  I never had any problems with my old HP cartridges (except the sky-high price), and I've gone MONTHS without using them at all.After FUZOO made it clear that they didn't have any intention of fixing my problem, I bit the bullet and bought new HP cartridges.  Unfortunately this did nothing to fix the problem because the printhead is messed up from using FUZOO cartridges.  I thought I was saving money, but the cost of the new printhead more than made up for it.  Never again...

Cutting to the chase: There are two large bolts affixing the chair back to the seat whose heads protrude quite a bit and dig unmercifully into my lower back no matter what seated position I assume. I have attempted to pad that area using various methods but nothing alleviates the problem. I absolutely hate this chair and strongly recommend potential buyers consider the situation I have experience during the three weeks I've owned this dreadful product before making a purchase. I'm not certain what all the five star reviewers are doing to avoid having bolt heads dig into their spines, but I salute their ingenuity and fortitude. Perhaps, their model chairs do not exhibit this particular design flaw?

The biggest mistake I made was buying this safe. It worked fine for the first 6-8 months, but then I opened it after not having gotten into it for a few months and everything inside was damp (actually wet to the touch) and smelled musty. Passports were all wrinkled from the moisture, birth and marriage certificates, cash, SS cards - everything now stinks. It is kept inside my closet in my home with multiple absorption packets in the safe so there is absolutely NO reason for this to have happened. I now have items wreak of must that, without a safe, I had managed to keep in pristine condition for 20+ years.Do not waste your money on this item. How can a fire and water rated safe get moisture inside when it has NOT come into contact with any water in a climate controlled home? Now I have to use a smelly passport for the next 9 years - thanks Honeywell.

Since I just opened this today to put into my Dayrunner I only now realized it was defective -- it is missing everything from February 18th through April 13th!  No wonder it was so inexpensive!  Maybe I can manage not to have ANY appointments for two months?!  Unable to return since I waited too long to open it, but I can promise you I'll never buy from here again!!  I'd rate this with zero stars if I could...

The one time I didn't read the reviews and this turns up. As others have said this is a shadow of its former self, weight has been slashed and the balance feels odd. The finish fell well short of expectations. For the price it's okay but I wouldn't buy another.

Like other reviewers, I went through the process with Cross only to find that they no longer have the replacement cartridge so I had to get this crossover. The eraser is this little itsy bitsy thing that doesn't last and cannot be replaced so everytime I need an eraser, I need to buy a fifteen dollar cartridge. Cross used to have a quality product. No more.
Terrible print quality - Wish Amazon had 0 star rating for this piece of junk.
These labels do not stick to any kind of fabric and are totally useless.  They don't even deserve a one star rating.

We are not impressed at all with the poor performance of this machine or the support from Samsung regarding the issues we are experiencing.  The main ones are as follows,1) Wastes a lot of paper printing error pages that cannot be turned off when a page fails to print correctly.  The print driver is supposed to support all the way back to OS X 10.6 and it does work, some of the time.  The same driver from OS X 10.9.5 works more often but still has issues printing random PDF files and many Pages files.  When it fails, it typically starts spitting out pages with a few odd characters printed and will not cancel.  The only way to stop it is to pull the drawer out so it stops pulling paper and wait for the last sheet pulled to cycle through then shut off the machine to clear the print job.  It does not clear from the panel button that is supposed to cancel jobs and does not and it can't be stopped from the print queue in OS X after the job has been sent to the printer.  Many of the files that won't print right from Lion print just fine from Mavericks.  All of the pages that don't print correctly print perfectly on a Xerox Phaser 6180DN.  Support's solution was to uninstall the printer and reinstall it with the same driver.  The solution sometimes works but mostly not, and one shouldn't have to keep uninstalling and reinstalling their printer just to print.2) The cartridge that comes with it should print 3000 pages at 5% coverage according to the specs for it (D203S).  We have had it use 83% of the toner with 1572 pages printed according to the web utility the machine comes with.  We are not printing graphics, just pages of text at 12 to 14 point and that would have been three reams of paper but we have barely gone through two so the counter isn't even accurate.  The specs for the toner capacity is simply not accurate for the D203S cartridge and the driver can't accurately count the number of pages it actually prints , including the error pages with a dozen odd characters on one line.3) Every time the printer comes on the lights dim.  This machine draws more power than the more than five year old four color Xerox Phaser 6180DN.  To get the power saving features it claims to have you have to sacrifice toner.  We are not using the power saving features because Samsung toner costs more than the wasted electricity.  It has not flipped a breaker yet but it is really annoying to have the lights dim all the time when using the printer.I selected this printer largely on reviews here on Amazon knowing that many people also had noticed its power hungry nature but I did not read issues with its unreliability in printing from older Apple OSes.  Personally I can't recommend this printer at all or the Samsung support solution. At least their support person spoke fluent English without a difficult to understand accent - too bad their support solution doesn't consistently work.

Would give no stars if I could.2nd time printing from this cartridge- and it doesn’t work. Left side of pages is unreadable. Tried shaking cartridge- still no.Spend your money buying name brand- not this.

As other reviewers have mentioned, these bracelets run EXTREMELY small (I have small wrists, and still barely got them over my hands and onto my arm), and aren't the same quality/feel as the true "gummy bracelets" from the glorious decade that was the 1980s.  They also require an inordinate amount of time to off-gas - I opened them and put them out on our front porch for 3 days before wearing them, as they REEKED (there's still a lingering smell to them after several months).  That being said, I mixed these with the white gummy bracelets and wore them to an 80s dance party and got a ton of compliments.  Still going to keep looking for the real thing...not a fan of these.
I don't like writing negative reviews... but not worth it!!! Looks cheap, slightly lopsided...

These ink cartridges are not working. My printer made a weird noise. Ink smeared. Dry flaky ink came out on page. I used the self clean feature on printer and it helped but pages are still printing poorly. The right hand corner is smudged and faded. I do appreciate they sent a follow up survey to see how the product is performing. I completed the survey. If they send a replacement that works, I will update my review accordingly.

I am very disappointed in this journal. I read all the reviews on this and many products and trusted what others said. It does not seem to be real leather, though may be a thin layer on top of some other material. And it does NOT smell like leather at all. It smells very chemically. For the price I was expecting much better quality. I will be returning it.
I love this product and want to give it more stars but when it arrived the numbers and other pieces were damaged. It almost looked like a mold of some kind from moisture getting to it.

I purchase these because of the positive reviews people left about how smooth it wrote but they were ordinary to me. Nothing special at all,would not purchase again! They're called ink joy but brings me no joy!

I purchased this item last year & the lock broke last month.  I have called Honeywell twice and no reply.  I would not purchase this again because of the poor customer service for warranty item at Honeywell.Please note:  I do not write reviews normally.  This is the only unsatisfactory item i have ordered through my Prime service due to the manufacturer.Not due to this site.

THis just arrived in my office and I am not happy with the packaging. It did not come in the box as pictured. There was a tear in the packaging. I hope this is a genuine cartridge. I only give two stars because of this.

I read reviews and wonder.  I was the only one who received a heavy box that spoils everything that lies in it?  In joy, I packed all my important documents in this safe  and a year later I opened the safe and a terrible smell of mold hit my nose.  Having dried everything and ironed, I managed to put everything back....  After a while I open the safe and smell again, everything is wet, the paper clips are rusted, the stamps on the documents are smeared.  This is not a safe....  Does anyone know how to return it back? And get my money back. I am so frustrated...

This item was shipped in a big box, the size of a TV box. When the item arrived there was a small hole in the box. Everything inside was packed and when I got to assemble it I realized that the Axel B as per the instruction manual was missing.Amazon sent me a replacement, I had to send it back in that big box again.And again I got the same big shipping box.Pros :Easy to AssembleUseful when you have to carry so many grocery bags from your car.Cons: Its design lacks Maneuverability. Since the wheels move only front and back, it becomes difficult to come out of my elevator and turn left to my apartment I have to like take a few back and forths like parallel parking my car. My wife criticized me for buying this item. But it's me who has to carry the bags up and not her, so I give it a few stars.

These notepads are very flimsy. I have 2 of the 6 unopened. They are not even worth doing the return thing. Once I remove the plastic wrapper they are getting tossed into the recycle bin. If I could leave zero stars I would.

Bottom Line:  Half the reviews are great, the other half are not so great.  I suppose it's the luck of the draw.  If you get good cartridges, then you are in luck.  But if you get a set of bad ones, well then, you are screwed. Like me.  Ran out of the factory OEM ink that came with the printer.  I had bought this 2-pack set earlier to have on-hand when I ran out.  But the problem is the printer randomly says "The cartridge is damaged."  This happens with one, two or three of the cartridges.  I reboot the printer and it seems to work (no error) but when you try to print - there comes the error again.  I swapped out all the ink twice (I bought a 2-pack set) and the randomness of the error did not stop.  I ended up running to the store and buying a full set of OEM because I had to get this project printed before the morning.

Like other reviewers noted, it was a pain to assemble. And the box does smell terrible. But who cares about that when this is supposed to be a great utility cart. However.....I bought this expecting it would hold up for the weekly 3-block walk to the laundromat. Having used it for less than 2 months, both of the back tires have, on separate occasions, popped right off. The pins included in the packaging don't hold. This product is unreliable, low quality, and I wish I would have spent $20 more on a better cart that would have lasted longer than 2 months.

20120425 UPDATE ...-------------------I think that I should mention that the NeatReceipts uninstaller leaves a lot behind when finished.  Granted, it did say there were a few files it could not remove; however, 610 megabytes in 274 files in 53 folders is a bit much for me to have to remove manually.  If it were possible, I would now rate the developers and the writers of their software as ZERO Stars because they were extremely sloppy and totally non-professional by leaving a lot of "rubbish" on my computer.  They really need to be "Neat" and clean up their mess!Also, I did notice, reading the logs, after uninstall, that they do have TWAIN drivers though not seemingly accessible to other software.AND, the change the Neat software install performed that causes the System32 folder to be displayed at each reboot was not fixed during uninstall.  Sloppy, totally sloppy!20120423 Original ...---------------------I really had great plans for this NeatReceipts Mobile Scanner and Digital Filing System. There were many receipts from two and a half months of travel and QuickBooks was ready. There were plenty of business cards to glean contact information. My plans were dashed! I am not sure where to begin in describing what this device and its associated software did NOT do for me. It was supposed to collect information from receipts. It seldom if ever processed the receipt especially if it was long. In all but a very few instances, little or no information was extracted from the receipt - and, what was extracted was mostly incorrect or put into the wrong field.  I am certain this was because of the terrible job of scanning. I tried business cards. Not much luck with them either. The scanner did not do an adequate job of scanning to allow the software to make a reasonable attempt to collect the contact information from the business cards. Neither black-and-white nor color scans of documents faired any better. The results were the same even after the calibration process was done.Over all, the device was a disaster and proved to be an exercise in futility.I manually corrected the flawed scanned-receipts to determine if the interface to QuickBooks offered maybe a reason to retain the unit (QB has a horrid UI)and it is very expensive to put QB on additional computers.  Well, the Neat unit's software did transfer some, but not all, of the data that might be collected from a receipt.Something annoying was, after install, at boot, the system32 folder started being displayed.  At one point, it became necessary to delete the database.  I could find no information in Help or on their website.  The only solutions available was to uninstall or just delete the folder containing the DB. It sorta worked; however, there were some artifacts left behind that could not be eliminated (showed 19 receipts but there were none).If you track cookies, this unit communicates with cloud.neat.com (...) each time the software is launched (session and secure).  Their cookie "must" be allowed for the software to operate.  If you are into reading the license, the license seems to restrict use of the software to one and only one computer while someone at neat wrote a FAQ that says the software can, also, be put on a mobile device.I guess I would have thought that the scanner would have had a TWAIN driver but it did not and could only be used with their software (in Device Manager it appears as an imaging device).Other reviews indicate the unit worked. It was very disappointing when the one I received did not even come close to actually working. I gave some thought to getting a replacement. I decided that I had put enough time into the device. I have returned the unit to Amazon.com.
A customer of mine wrote to me to let me know that the glue on the envelope didn't hold and it arrived open. They received their product but this cost me a five star review. Don't trust the glue.

I bought this back in November, when the "Toner Low" message first appeared on my HL2270-DW, so that I wouldn't have to buy toner within a moment's notice and have my grad school work put on hold for "printer issues."Today I go to install it, once the "Replace Toner" error message arrives, and the "Replace Toner" light now won't go off. I can't print. I'm in the middle of printing a paper, and now I have to go to the library to finish printing. I bought the aftermarket toner thinking I was doing the right thing, buying it advance to nip any problems in the bud, but now I can't return this toner cartridge (which is leaking in the box, FYI) since it is past the window, and Brother support can't help me a bit.Now I'm reading all the reviews about streaky pages and I have to say just this: I paid $15 to learn that Brother toner is just the way to go because it comes with an actual guarantee that it WILL work, unlike this cheap piece o' junk.
Broken within a week. Poor quality. I bought it after seeing good reviews but totally frustrated. I sent it back.

As stated by another reviewer, the exterior latches seem a bit flimsy. My primary complaint is that, although the specifications indicate that the interior will accommodate standard 8-1/2 x 11 letter paper, the front-to-back interior dimension is actually a bit smaller than 8-1/2 inches. Papers curl at the edges unless folded.Update - I have taken this chest out of service. I recently needed to get out some important papers for business at a local military installation. When I opened the chest, all of the papers inside felt damp and had a bad smell. This is despite having a large pouch of desiccated silica gel inside to try to lower the humidity. I don't know if this is the result of moisture getting in from outside (the chest is kept in an air-conditioned closed in the master bedroom) or if it is chemical out gassing from the plastic lining or insulation. Couple this new issue with the small size that causes standard, letter-size paper to curl, I do not consider this product useable. I will be consulting a professional as I move forward to try to find a better solution.
Don't waste your money buying this item, never worked!!  I gave one star for the delivery but would give nothing for the pen
I should have read the reviews, especially the latest ones. Fell off immediately.  Total waste of money, don’t even bother, move along and pass over this one.
I bought these for a hristmas gift, and when I went to wrap them, I noticed that one of the pens exploded. So I will be returning them. Would've like to see how they worked to give a better review.

Received on time, undamaged however we did use chalk pens and they wont erase. We have tried multiple cleaning procedures and we are now stuck with this board for one time use. Previously mentioned in another review.
Jammed with first use. Difficult to load. Have yet to get to to work. Very disappointed as I read many positive reviews.

I've been using EZink cartridges for several years.  When I first started using this brand it was excellent.  Print quality and amount of printing exceeded Samsung's own.  Last several purchases have been light in print, you can't use toner saver feature and get readable copy .  This past purchase failed after only a few prints - printing the left side unreadable.  I see that a number of reviews specifically mentioned this problem, and others mentioned light printing.  I'm going to be ordering a different brand to replace the one I just bought that only printed a few sheets.

I am getting discouraged in finding a quality laptop tray. This will be the second one that I am sending back. I read the reviews, and they were so mixed that I decided to give it a chance. I don't like that I would need to add my own adjustments to make it more functional e.g. adding something to the little side drawer so that it will stay closed until I want it open. If you were to tip the tray sideways even just a little for any reason, it will slide right out. Also, the little laptop bar that keeps the laptop from sliding off of the tray, is detachable, and a very weak piece of wood, so if you remove it a couple of times, I don't think it will hold up very well. In my opinion, it should have been glued in and made to be stationary for stability, whereas it wiggles when something is not propped against it and could probably be popped out with handling/storing. The tray came with a ding and scratch or two in the paint, but I think they occurred during the painting/staining process. It looks nice enough if you don't look too closely at it, and the propping portion was great and very functional. Overall though, for the price, I was worried that with the lack of quality (strong wood material) that if one of my 3 children were to knock into it accidentally, or if it fell for some reason, it just wouldn't hold up. $30 isn't expensive, but it's not inexpensive either, and I really need something with durability, but that looks nice and works in a functional way. It wasn't for me, but if you don't have high expectations then this is for you.

We had high hopes for removing cat hair from clothing, furniture, etc., with this little device.  It does work - once.  Then you have to spend minutes cleaning it, letting it dry, and then use it again.  So, cleaning off, say a pair of slacks is a half-hour-long process.  In comparison, using strips of 2" wide masking tape took about two minutes, including the time it took to tear off strips, use them, and discard them.  It may be more wasteful in terms of material, but it works a lot better and lot more quickly than the Sticky Buddy.  The only reason I don't give it only one star is that it works - once.

Bought on August 5, 2018. Broke on September 22, 2018. No longer locks. The door will not lock and remains unsecured for any combination. Work exactly three times and now is beyond the return window for Amazon. I assume the warranty is still in effect but not really going to waste a lot of time to get a replacement that will just break again. Don’t be fooled by the few other positive reviews.

I received 3 tubes with 12 leads each instead of 3 tubes with 35 each.  False advertising.  I see other reviewers have commented on the same issue and yet the company has done nothing to correct the description.  I'm returning these on principle...
Only one star because it was pretty but it was too heavy and pulled on my uniform.  That after using it for a few days it completely fell to pieces.

The pen was packaged nicely however there are no instructions with it.  It turned out that the LED light did not work.  It didn't work because the batteries were bad.  No instructions on how to replace them.  Managed to disassemble the pen to get at the batteries and replace.  All is good now.  The pen is nice and I would have rated it higher if not for the problems listed.

Wish I could give this ZERO stars! Ordered grey and white. Got wood and black. I am using this for my birth announcement for my son. Thanks for ruining my idea. Now I have to figure out something else since he will be here this week.

The width of the case is not accurate for a A4 page, the pages get folded when inserted in it.....would not recommend this product. I wasted money buying a 100 pack thinking they would be standard size. I would still give two stars as the quality ( thickness of the case) is good !

This review is for Houselabels.  Yes it is removable, but be careful on what you stick it on.  It does not stick well on non smooth surface and many of my items the label peel off itself on both end after a few week.  It seem to work on smooth glossy plastic surface but I decide not to bar code my items, unsure how long it last and un peel again.  If you use on something and know you will want to remove them in a short time, then this is perfectly fine.

DO NOT PURCHASE THE HP CARTRIDGE from tekdeal! The price is great, but it is a waste of money. Was wondering why new cartridge from HP was $180.99 and I could purchase this cartridge on Amazon for $83.99. Now I know why, because the cartridge sucks!  Did not read the reviews before purchasing, but the print quality is terrible.
I gave it two stars because of the inside. The paper is thick that it almost bends which disturb my writing. It's also hard to write in because of the lack of space.

I would have given this pen 5 stars if it did not run out of ink after a month. I bought a black and blue Frixion Ball pen to use for writing notes. After a month, the blue pen ran out of ink and shortly later the black pen. I decided I would give it one more try using the refillable ink. Less than 3 weeks later, the black pen ran out of ink. This is a horrible product. I don't understand how it gets 5 stars. Another friend experienced the same think with the black, blue, and RED pens. I contacted Pilot to let them know about the problem I had with their pens.Pilot's response to my compliant:The FriXion erasable gel ink pens and highlighters have a new kind of thermo-sensitive ink that is designed to write smoothly and erase cleanly.  The FriXion ink refill has been designed to deliver optimal ink performance.  As a result, the write out of our FriXion pens is approximately 1045 ft.I guess I'll return back to my faithful Pilot G-2 07 pen. Has anyone else had these problems or is it an isolated incident with the Pilot Frixion ball pens?

I'm really upset and disappointed with this shoddy product - it has so many missing/blank sections and printing errors. It's extremely unprofessional and frankly unacceptable. I see in the reviews that other people have had similar problems with it, which makes it even more frustrating because the company has clearly not taken this issue seriously and has not fixed it. Don't waste your money on it.

If I could leave less stars I would. Heavy duty my ass. We attached my sons single house key to this so he could keep it on his backpack and use the retractable cord to unlock the door after school. The metal part that attaches the key ring to the retractable cord fell off while we were putting a single key onto it. And now it says the item isn't eligible for returns. Piece of garbage is what it is. Do NOT waste your $10 bucks on this they have higher quality trash in a dumpster.

Don't buy this electric sharpener. I had it for three moths, and does not longer works properly. It's eating up my pencils instead of sharpening them. I bought this product in January, and only use it once a week to sharpen less than 12 pencils. It was great when I first got it, but after two months started malfunctioning. I got so frustrated with it that I put it away, and started using my classic metal sharpener instead. I never write reviews about the products I get, but I'm so disappointed with this one that I decided to share my experience.

Prepare for one very honest review ... 3M should think twice about charging (what is tantamount to) a king's ransom for this potential doorstop.Pros:Honestly, none that I can find. (And, I usually can find SOMETHING positive to note about a product).Cons:Installation was a nightmare. I originally ordered this for the desk in my office. However, once I received the astonishingly weighty tray (over sixteen pounds), I realized that I would have to drill sizable holes in one fairly expensive desk. Rather than nervously bore holes through a valuable piece of cherry, I decided to first experiment with it on a less pricey piece. And, thank goodness for that! Not only was installation a struggle (I needed an extra person to help me), but the end results was far from ergonomic. At first, I just assumed that I would have to "get used to" it (maybe years of ingrained, bad habits would have to be broken). Turns out, this was just painful and bizarre. No matter how I altered the product, it was just awkward. And, "awkward" soon translated to aches. Perhaps 3M needs to reexamine their design ... perhaps it's just a problem with me.If you were considering this on a whim, I vote that you skip it. If you came here because you are dead-set on buying this, maybe you will have better luck. (And, with these new reviews posted here, you will have a clearer idea of the potential drawbacks).

Installed the cartridges, all recognized and worked. The blue toner leaves a 1/2 inch line down the middle of the page. I reached out to customer service by email and left a message. No response to get it corrected so I had to buy more toner elsewhere and spend time leaving this review.

The one I received had some obvious differences from the one pictured.  First, the front looked more crumpled, rather than looking like a sculpted tree.  If I hadn't known it was supposed to be a tree, I wouldn't have been able to tell.  One of the folds was in a completely different direction from the others.  I wish I could post a picture for others to decide what they think.  The falling leaf on the main picture looks lovely, but the one I received had a bright orange, cartoonish leather sticker, or something, instead of the elegant leaf stamp.  The front had fine yellow/gold glitter on it in some places, and some came off on my hands.  The 2 stars I gave it were because of the feel of the leather on the back cover (so nice and soft), and the fancy leather edging (very well done).  I wish the company could post the exact journal they were selling, as they must all be very different.  I did send it back and receive a refund, so I was only out about $10 in shipping.  Still wishing I could find one similar to the one pictured.
I wish I could give 0 stars. The cord fell out if the real today. It gets zero wear and tear. I work a desk job for an insurance company and it is used twice a day.

1 star because they are cute.  They don't stick to any of my cups...and when they peel off they leave a nasty sticky residue and then hair and dust stick to that and it basically ruins the cup (or I have to invest time to get that off).  They don't stay on my Klean Kanteen stainless cups for even a 3 hour day at school...either the stainless part or the plastic top.  They do stay on my Camelback for a week or so, with hand washes.  I don't put my cups in the dishwasher, so I don't know about dishwasher safe, but I seriously doubt that.
Zero stars if I could. The cartridge was empty. Didn't even print one page. Don't waste your time. Go to office depot.

Very flimsy metal. Weak drawer rollers. Expected better based on reviews. Not suitable at all for commercial use. I would have returned it if I had bought at Staples but not worth the hassle to return having bought from Amazon. Better to spend a little more and get a useable product.

I used this a few times then it quit working properly. It stopped swirling laundry. It still drains ok but I need it to work longer than just a few wash loads. I could'nt reach the company but it may be due to internet connection not cooperating. Maybe it needs a new motor my guess ?? Until I hear back from them I can't give a review .

Words written with black sharpie rubbed off after wearing item 2 times (had label on inside of cloth strap watch). Whole label fell off the inside of shoes (placed on tongue of athletic shoe) after 3 days.  Seems to work ok on lower friction areas (inside shirt, inside school bag). I know it was meant for cloth, but some reviews mentioned using it for plastic and metals items- didn't work for me; I labeled a thermos and it fell after handwashing 4 times.
Wish I could give no stars. Was very excited to receive this product, but 2 of the pieces were missing, and the remaining pieces were folded, which left permanent creases. Returned for a refund.
Clearly from the reviews posted already, this is a repackaged product with the protective clips removed.  Ink is only partially filled.

This is (obviously) not an OEM lamp. It had two good reviews, so I thought I would give it a shot. Unfortunately, I could see immediately out of the box that it was of inferior quality from the original lamp.The bulb was crooked in the housing.The glass on the bulb was not nearly as thick as the original bulb.The protective glass in front of the bulb was swirly, as if it were different thicknesses in different places.The wire going into the end of the actual light was caked white and pointed upwards.Despite this, I tried it anyway, being as I had no lamp. This lamp was DIMMER than the old 2100+ hour lamp I took out. It had a rainbow pattern horizontally centered on my screen. The little light it did put out was uneven. I wondered if there were something wrong with my projector, but when I put the old lamp back in, it was brighter, no rainbow and evenly dim, so definitely the bulb was defective.It's nice if you can get a good lamp for a reasonable price, but this one wasn't it for me.

I bought this Gel Grip by mistake for a Uniball RETRACTABLE pen since I have used Signo Uniball black retractable pens for years and love them.  I just needed a different color.  This pen is less comfortable to hold (rubber grip is shorter) and the cap ieasily lost.  The ink blotches while writing and the flow is difficult to control.  The ink smudges easily and takes longer to dry than the black retractable kind.  When I had these problems with the first pen, I tried another but the same happened. I wish I could return them because they are unusable but the return conditions require new condition.  I've given it a 2 star only because the color is nice and the rubber grip is adequate.

I bought this scanner because of the high ratings.  I got random specks throughout the photos that I scanned.  They were clean color photos.  The white specks stood out especially on dark colors, as you would expect.  I scanned the same photos on an HP and got no specks.  Cannon was no help.  Other than the specks, the scans were great.  Too bad.  I returned the scanner.

I love the look of these pens but for whatever reason mine keep not working. I've tried all three and one works, but the other two don't seem to have consistent ink. Disappointed because of all the great reviews and liking the look of them a lot!

The open is suppose to light up but mine does not! Can not change bulb as it is riveted together. Not bright at all can not even tell it's on in the daylight! Very poor quality! I want to give no stars but that's not an option!

Exactly what I was looking for, HOWEVER, the details stated that you received 6 bonus months; July 2016 through December 2016 in which I needed. But when I received the product it didn't have those months in there that I needed! Therefore it gets a 1 star!

This stuff is great for hanging posters but it leaves a blue residue if you have textured walls. i haven't tried it on non textured walls but this stuff sicks pretty well. If you leave it on a poster for a while u can start to see and oily spot where the BLUE STICK is.Only a 2 Star product for me...
It is pretty much what I expected. A low security lock box for collecting ballots or money. I am giving it a 1 star because the key does not unlock the box.

As other reviewers have indicated, the wrist strap portion of the 7” lanyard is not large enough for a man to slip his hand through. The seller’s photo indicates the wrist strap portion of the 7” lanyard is 5” long, but the 10 that I received have varying lengths of 4 3/8” to 5”. Only one was 5”, most were 4 ½”. So, instead of having a circumference of 10” (2 X the 5” length), the circumference of most is approx. 9”.The quality of the 7” lanyards is questionable. On 3 of them, the plastic piece that covers the joint between the wrist strap and the 1 1/2” end piece easily slips off (not properly glued in place?). This plastic piece not only covers the joint, but helps prevent the joint from coming apart. Also, on one, the wrist strap material was frayed.Of the ten 17” lanyards I received, one of them is missing the detachable connector, making it useless.In this case, the overall quality probably reflects the price paid.I would not purchase again.

Similar to many other reviewers, the printer was working great before installing these cartridges.  Immediately, it started smudging inks, jamming paper, printing binary text data garbage on top of printouts, and leaving huge ink stains.  I don't know if it's HP doing something deliberate or what, but my printer went from being fine to nearly useless immediately after installing these.  Cleaning the head made no difference.Followup: A couple months of super smudged printing later, the printer stopped working entirely and just spat out an error message when I turned it on.

I am amending my original review of these pens from what I originally wrote. These are by far the worst gel pens I've ever bought. They pen casing is cheap flimsy plastic which are easily broken while trying to remove the lids for the first time which are impossible it seems at times to pull off. The ink flows out so quickly that one pen barely lasts for one entire picture. The photo posted is to reference a pen I used once on the only picture I colored with it. I'm sorry but when I buy gel pens I should be able to color more than one picture with them. There was several pens so far that we're a one time use pen. Am requesting a refund.

It’s overall a great product, but I just discovered a major flaw: there is no May or June. Instead, there are two September and Octobers. I’m just now discovering this and I’m outside of my return window and the only other option under my orders is to leave a review. I’m not sure if all of the calendars are like this, but I do plan on contacting customer service. Check your entire calendar when you get it so you can catch it during your return window.
Low toner message from day 1. Read the other reviews.  It could trash your printer.

I really hoped these would work, given their great reviews. But I've used 5 of the 8 cartridges so far and haven't been happy at any point (I'm just printing simple documents / recipes, etc - no photos).They often don't print one color at all (ie red and yellow print, but no blue; another cartridge blue but not red, etc). Sometimes the black cartridge is working fine and the color isn't, and sometimes it's the opposite. There seems to be no rhyme or reason, and I feel like I wasted my money on this pack. It's also super frustrating when you need something printed quickly, and it ends up being a 10 minute ordeal to troubleshoot, test/replace cartridges, and reprint multiple times just to get ONE simple page.Sadly, I'll probably go back to the overpriced Canon brand just so I don't have the frustration.

This is a beautiful planner, great for people that do not need that much writing space. I needed more space to  write notes on my daily task. Unfortunately I got too excited with the reviews and this planner does not fit my need.

The good - the ink print colors brilliantly and unlike other generic brands they don't come up short with colors (another brand only prints magenta and purples - no greens or blacks - was a complete waste of money) - these work.The bad - number of prints per cartridge are very inconsistent - my first cartridge generated 45 4x6 prints - after that one another crapped out at 16 prints - and the next at 22 prints - and after that 12 prints (at least with an original Canon cartridge I'm guaranteed at least 65 prints) - in short I blew through 6 cartridges that one Canon cartridge would produce.Update - I'm downgrading this to one star - the print count for 4x6 prints is very low - the four pack of CLI-36 prints an equivalent of one Canon cartridge - so is it worth buying these? Very disappointed with these. The only redeeming factor is the color is faithful compared those awful Lime Ink cartridges that only print in magenta, purple and yellow (funny - their brand is called Lime Ink but doesn't print any greens)

I bought these to make floating ornaments for my family, we lost our grandma/mom a couple years ago. All the reviews were raving about how great these were, I've used koala brand paper for sublimation before and it was great.I read the directions, tried printing on both sides of the paper, tried changing my paper quality, tried using my sublimation printer as the last recommendation is using a dye ink printer.They all turned out awful. Returning these with stuff printed on it because I'm not about to be out the money I spent on them to have wasted as many pages as I did for it not to work.Maybe I just got a dud, but won't be trying another pack.

Before you try and save money buying third party ink do some research on reviews through YouTube.  Sadly I did not do this before buying third party ink.  The common theme from people who print professionally are that these inks will kill your printer.  Which is what happened to me.  I've emailed the company a twice to just try and get a new ink cartridge or a refund.  Today I found out that my printer is dead and the third party cartridge is most likely the culprit.Use at your own risk.  If you have a newer printer I would absolutely not try using it; it will void your warranty as well.

Works only when it feels like it. I've had this for less than a year and use it a couple times a month for my budget. I have to constantly unplug the USB cable for the scanner to work and all too frequently the software says Neat Software is not responding and will have to close. This had the potential to be an excellent product but because it only works some of the time with frequent restarts is why I'm giving it a negative review. I paid over $100 for this and in my opinion, it's only worth about $40. I can get the same result using a custom built database that's easy to design and my personal all-in-one printer scanner. I'm sorry I took the short cut this time.

Bought these in November of 2015, for use to report 2015 income.  Was sent 2014 forms and didn't notice until after I send forms to employees and government.  Now to deal with corrections.  Should have read the reviews, looks like a common thread hear.  Last year's forms are good for scratch paper.

I wish I could have given this zero stars because it doesn’t deserve even one.  It is not freezer tape!!  It is stretchy and all of the rolls were stuck together in the package. What a waste of money!! Do NOT buy this!!

I saw this planner in the store and loved it.  Plus it's USA made.  I looked it up on Amazon on my phone and saw it was cheaper so I decided to order it.  I didn't read close in the store that they decide your planner cover.  Luckily I caught it before I placed my order at home.  UGH, back to the store....so aggravating!!  Five stars for the planner, 1 star for not letting you select your own cover.

Unfortunately my HP OfficeJet 8600 Plus rejected these cartridges. I always buy when expecting them to be replaced in a month or so. The box looks like real HP ones and they fit in the proper installation place. I am giving 2 stars because the service by Amazon is always excellent. I'm wondering is it too late to return them.

I was very disappointed to find that, although the product description is for various shapes (heart, star, loop), and one of the product photos depicted these three shapes, what I received was 50 of only the loop shape.  I specifically ordered this item, instead of other options, because of the variety of shapes I thought I was ordering.  I'm keeping the item because I need it now, but I'm not satisfied with this order.

Not impressed! This whiteboard seemed like it would be perfect for the job, so I had high hopes when I ordered it.  Unfortunately, it came with small dings and dents in several areas.  I was able to get beyond that because I was eager to get it hung and use in my office and they were relatively small spots.  Once hung, I was super unimpressed with the marker tray - it attaches with double sided tape!! So far, its sagged and fell twice!The part that really bothers me the most, is that the SINGLE marker it came with was completely dried out.  When I went to use a typical Expo marker, the ink bubbled up as if it were not compatible with the board surface.  I tried a different brand and it won't erase! I should have sent it back - it's a process through my department to requisition items and then to return, so I was just trying to let it go but, man this board sucks.So to sum up:- came dented- only one marker included- marker was bone dry, therefore not functional- other markers won't work or won't erase (see pics)- marker tray comes unattached due to cheap designI would have gave 0 stars if possible!!

If you don’t mind that each inch is divided into 10ths, these triangles will likely do a fine job for you.They’re otherwise as described... ALTHOUGH, mine arrived in what appears to be used condition.  i.e. - While these supposedly new triangles arrived in a protective sleeve, they both have the micro scratches that tend accumulate on plastic over some period of normal use, as well as one of them having smear marks from something being spilled and not comepletly wiped off / cleaned.Giving two stars because this needs to be called out and addressed... I could see giving 1 star, but they do function as 360/60/90 and 45/90 triangles.(To the seller...  They’re coming back.)

the push pin is glued to the wood pin.  The push pin separates from the wood pin in your hand while attempting to use.  Disintegrates in your hand.  Complete trash.  I would give this zero stars across the board if possible.  Do not even consider ordering.  Any positive reviews are clearly entered by the seller.

Wish I would have read reviews, but I was looking for white-out tape quickly and chose this product. Literally the second time I used it, it broke. I don't have big hopes for the second one in the package.
Waste of money to purchase. I would have given it no stars if that was possible!  The markers wipe off easily from the material and do not want to stick… cheap product

Well as other reviews have mentioned, this thing is TINY! It was bought as fun novelty item for my desk and it really isn't functional at all. It's just too small and honestly, it takes two seconds to brush something off your desk. DEFINITELY overpriced! Shouldn't be more than a buck or two.

I was so excited to get this desk and there's a lot to love about it!- It fits my oversized laptop very well.- The wrist rest is the perfect height and made of memory foam, so it conforms to your wrists.- The desk is curved, to allow for you to bring it closer to you.- The light is easy to tuck away and it doesn't create any strange bulges or uncomfortable points.- The "wood" looks real and is beautifully done.So, why did I only rate it two stars?- I added the batteries (it requires 4 AA). First, the battery case is very tight, making it difficult to place batteries in and nearly impossible to get them out again.- Once I put in (brand new) batteries, and plugged in the light, nothing happened! The light didn't turn on and that was a major selling point of this desk for me. I'm greatly disappointed.I'll update this review if anything changes, but as of now, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who's choosing it based on there being a light.

Mat cracked after one month of use.  Not even asking for a refund just throwing it away.  I've spent 10s of thousands on amazon and have yet to write a review.  This product is so bad I figured i'd take the time to warn others of this garbage product.  This mat also slides around on my carpet, and thus was hitting my desk.  It damaged the bottom half inch of my 2,000 dollar desk by slowly chipping away at it.  I weigh 145 pounds and cracked this mat in a month, what a pos.  Buyer and amzon beware.

I rarely write reviews, but I'll make an exception in this case.Your shredder was horrible. Could barely do four sheets when I first got it, kept overheating and making popping/clicking sounds, and now not working at all. Complete junk. In this case brand name is probably the way to go.

This is a ridiculous, stupid and DANGEROUS idea. People, you do NOT NEED your electronic devices or food in front of you when you are in your car in the DRIVER'S seat!!! If you must work on your device, do it at at HOME or at the OFFICE, and NOT in the car. I am POSITIVE people are thinking they can multitask and work on their device or eat while they are driving. This is what this stupid thing is promoting and I do NOT LIKE IT. If a person is THAT addicted to their device and needs it in their face while driving, that person needs serious, professional help. I do not give a flying rat's behind if a person is stopped at a light or whatever. STAY OFF THE DEVICE until you get home or to the office or to a place where one is NOT on the road. The same goes for eating while driving. This thing should be illegal, because someone is going to cause an accident while having a device or food in their face while driving.I sincerely HOPE all the people giving this screen addiction device 5 stars are NOT using it while on the road at ANY time. Anyone who is using it deserves a ticket for distracted driving. Sorry. I like safe drivers and not the ones who can't keep their hands off their devices or food while driving.

I was extremely disappointed in this planner. If I could give this 0 stars I would. From July 2018-November 2018 this planner is a MESS. I’ve included some pictures to show. It starts with a monthly spread of July where the numbers are miss printed and duplicated. There are also dates missing. Then it goes to August where it starts with one page of an August weekly spread but once again dates are missing. It has Aug. 1, 5,6,7,8. On the next page it goes back to July’s weekly spreads beginning with July 9. After the July weekly spreads it goes to August monthly spread. Then, to September weekly spread beginning with September 3 but numbers are once again duplicated on the next page. It has 2 pages of September’s weekly spread and then jumps back to August’s weekly spread. This is a recurring thing all the way to the 2nd November 2018 tab which it oddly has.The planner is good starting from the 2nd November 2018 tab, but I need the planner now and can’t wait until November to begin using it. Starting in November it begins with a monthly spread and leads into the weekly spreads. I am very disappointed as I am a teacher and was excited to use this as my new planner for the year.

Upon arrival, I installed the cartridge per installation instructions. After closing the access door, the toner goes through a setup process. At this stage my printer started making this god awful grinding noise. After further investigating, the toner cartridge was actually cracked and the green bar was actually black from ink coating it. It printed a completely black page every time. I also noticed that the "qc ok" sticker was previously cut, which lead me to believe these are remanufactured. I'm not biased on remanufactured items, but I did not recall seeing this in the item description prior to placing this order. I originally picked 1 star but as I wrote this review, I upped it to 2 stars on ease of return
Purchased and my printer says incompatible cartridge has been installed and will not print. Disappointed based upon the reviews.

Horrible phone system.Can't check call logs(incoming and outgoing). Can only check missed calls. If there is a missed call, all phones will get a miss call notification. You then have to manually clear the missed call on every individual phone. There is no clear all miss call. You have to scroll through every miss call on every phone to clear it.Buttons are hard to push. As you dial the buttons, it makes a sound tone acknowledging you dialed the button. But if you dial the numbers faster than 1 sec interval, it skips the sound tone making you think it didn't register.Can't block numbers. You have to call your phone provider to block numbersReception was ok. I was at about 100ft away from the base with no static problem.  There was only a single wall of obstruction between where I was standing and the base.Would not recommend this phone. Phone was so bad I had to write my first review about it.

I bought this product because of the great reviews, first off it was broken when I got it. So it just makes for an awkward experience overall.  It is functional I guess, I could have made the same thing with four legs and a plank of wood though... Save your money -- this safe failed in within a few months of purchase. Like others on Amazon have mentioned, the locks failed for no apparent reason. I'm glad the lock mechanism failed when the safe was in an open position so I could retrieve the items I had stored, but there's really no excuse for putting such a shoddy product on the market.I rarely write reviews, but this safe has earned its single star rating. Seriously, don't even think about placing your valuables in one of these safes. If it can't stand up to being opened once a month, I can't imagine it would actually hold up during a fire or flood. Also, when the safe fails, making contact with customer service will be a pain since Honeywell doesn't provide customer service for these items and has a third party in charge of replacements.

My rating was lowered from four stars to two stars after I had to add update number 2.  Definitely pass on this one.This is a large unit.  I use it in an elementary classroom.  The sharpener dials to fit six different pencil sizes which is very convenient for the classroom.  It has an adequate shaving recepticle and is easily emptied.  (I also use the  Stanley Bostitch QuietSharp Executive in the classroom. That unit is more quiet than this one is and it is smaller. It does not handle varied sizes and that recepticle is quite small.)  The Swingline unit is very easy for the children to use and we do not have problems with jamming--I stopped using electric sharpeners in the classroom for several years because of jamming.  The swingline sharpens pencils smoothly as well.UPDATE #1:After using this a bit longer in the classroom I feel the need to update the review. The sharpener jams up and stops working. Sometimes leaving it idle for a short time is enough and we can then sharpen a few pencils but other times we go for days with it not working. Although this is in a classroom it does not get heavy use as we have more than shaprener in the room. It seems that the sensor for activating the sharpener is really faulty.UPDATE #2: this sharpener tends to implement the safety that prevents it from "overheating" a bit too readily.  After two pencils being sharpened, it often shuts down.  Although it has various openings, it also is a bit "touchy" about how the pencil is inserted.  My original rating is 4 stars but I think I would have to reduce that to 3 stars.  I find my cheaper units to be more reliable.A custodian knocked the unit onto the floor and the black plastic around the opening cracked. If the plastic is held just right it will partially sharpen still.  I think it is disappointing that the motor is OK but a crack in the housing prevents us from still using this unit.

I bought this product to help with groceries as I live on the top floor of an apartment building . Seemed sturdy and durable . Was a little smaller then I thought it would have been however there was missing parts . I was unable to assemble because the axel was missing for the back wheels . After receiving the item I seen many reviews stating the same . I contacted the original company and they were willing to send me the missing pieces but I just sent it back

Two minutes ago the plastic channels that were supposed to hold the plastic + poster + backing sandwich together let go. Three channels, the plastic, and the poster fell to the hardwood floor -- the corner of the plastic shattered and the poster was folded under and creased. This is a poor design badly implemented because the channels were loose from the beginning and the plastic was too thin. With nothing but friction to hold the channels in place I should have known that failure was inevitable. Thicker plastic or tighter channels or thicker backing or some sort of ridge on the backing for the channels to grip might have salvaged the design but now it is too late. How does one return something like this? Will they replace my poster? I would have given zero stars in the rating had that been possible.

I would have given this product a higher rating had all of the pieces been included. Three of the days of the week were missing. I didn't realize it until I got to work and started setting up the calendar. I had to white out three duplicate days and write in with marker the days that were missing.This was not what I paid for. The quality of the materials seem to be durable, but I wouldn't purchase this again.

I wanted to like these, but...I bought a 2-pack of the Linkyo HP-compatible toner cartridges for my HP2035 laser printer. Good price, good reviews, I thought. The first one worked rather well and seemed to yield the promised 2,300 pages. The second one, however, immediately put a series of dark gray blotches along the right margin of the page, 7 in all, each about 3/4" wide. The more pages I printed, the worse they got, clearly a defect in the remanufacturing process. (I'm a retired quality assurance manager. A 50% defect rate in a random sample of 2 items is not a good sign. It could be that I just happened to get the random defect, but... In normal sampling inspection, 1 defect in a random sample of 2 would usually cause the entire lot to be rejected, depending on the specified Acceptable Quality Level, or AQL.)The bottom line is that I can't use toner cartridges that leave blotches. Period. Linkyo's price advantage pretty much vanished when cartridge #2 failed the minute it was installed. I have never had a problem with genuine HP cartridges and I don't consume them so quickly that the cost per year is an obstacle.As I said, the first one of the two was just fine. Hopefully, you'll get the "good one". I just can't recommend them based on my experience.
If I could give this zero stars, I would. Assembly was like something out of a comedy skit. This is potentially the most impractical piece of equipment I’ve ever come across.
Product description stated "Legal Rule" but actual notepads were wide rule.  Two stars because they were actually notepads with accurate sheet counts.

I bought this despite seeing the bad ratings. The ink card fit my printer, the first print was flawless, but then the second print was dry as a bone, The ink has suddenly vanished.
