BTW - Assuming you own Neat 5.0 software, you cannot purchase a scanner without a second purchase of the software!  Greta sales idea!UPDATE IS AT THE END OF THIS REVIEW as of 6-JAN-12I've spent over 8 hours running uninstalls/re-installs and registry cleans and under direction of two technical support representatives gone into file folder permissions and changed permissions and ownership - all installation issues that the reps acknowledge are failures in their installation script for Windows/7.  To put it bluntly, on a vanilla Windows/7 notebook, they are unable to have the product install without it crashing either instantly or after a few minutes of use.Great Idea - Terrible implementationIf you have Windows/7 - DON'T EVEN CONSIDER THIS PRODUCTNEAT is in violation of IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY -Why? IT DON'T WORK!Received NeatReceipts yesterday NeatReceipts Mobile Scanner and Digital Filing System Went to do install today, found that the installation CD was out of date (!) so downloaded the most currect version 5 software from Neat.com and installed without error.This is a Win/7 configuration Dell M1530Installed Neat handheld scannerStarted using the product - entered a few receipts to learn the filing and categorizing parameters.Walked away for a moment and on return found a popup error message:"Neat has stopped working" and "Windows is closing Neat because it has stopped working"Tried to reload and re-execute it - it loads momentarily into the task list and then abends/crashes almost immediately - same error messages.Did a complete re-install.Used for about 2 hours - loaded a number of receipts in to Neat - trashed the receipts - WRONG MOVE!Why?  went for dinner - came back to find Neat had abended/crashed again - back in same situation - no access to data entered - and the images cannot be accessed without Neat - non-standard storage method.Sent support inquiry to Neat.Got back a truly nonsensical response"Based on what you've asked, the following answers might be relevant.The following answers might help you immediately.Title: Connecting Your QuickBooks Company File to Neat 5Link: [...]Hmmm - I have never had Quickbooks.  Don't have Quickbooks,  Never said I hasd Quickbooks.It was never mentioned in the installation process.Never said anything about Quickbooks in the support inquiry.RESPONSE TO RON in the Neat Forum:Ron, and any one else reading,Yes, after several days including much time on the telephone, at least for my configuration, which is Windows/7 3gb memory, the problem was the install script being deficient in how it set file/folder permission.Before I go on, you may ask as you read the next sentence, why in heck does Neat 5.0SP2 required total administrative control of your machine, but I'll let you try to get the answer. The "solution" is go in to the folder properties for Neat located as follows:\Program Files\Common Files\NeatReceipts\Program Files\Neat\Program Data\The Neat Companyand the desktop shortcut for Neatand modify the properties of all folders and subfolders within, or the properties of the shortcut for security so that YOUR OWN SPECIFIC LOGON on this machine [as opposed to already Administrators, etc] has FULL CONTROL.The result then is the program works SO LONG AS YOUR MACHINE DOES NOT GO IN TO POWER STANDBY or SLEEP or worse! So you now have a working program as long as you remember to either keep the machine from going in to an idle state or you shut the program if you know you are going to walk away for a bitNow today I spent time on the phone with a nice young man in Philadelphia who explained to me that they had never heard of this problem before so there was no way for them to debug it. As for the obvious questions of why does the program so violate windows security and why is the install script not correct, your guess is as good as mine. So if you want to tell the nice young man that you too have experienced this supposed one-off error, use TICKET [Incident: 120101-000139].Best to all and to you Ron, good luck

I usually do not leave a review, but I did not get the product I ordered. I ordered a six pack of notebooks but I only got three notebooks. They are very nice looking notebooks but it was not what I ordered.

Final Update: A lifetime of just 2 years.  Wow.I was somewhat impressed with Neat at first.  This little scanner filled a basic need, with several glitches and the occasional total software crash.  No big deal.  I suggested some improvements, but the software was never fixed.  Now, after owning one for just 2 years, Neat has shown why they had no interest in fixing or improving their product...The scanner software started crashing at startup.  It had done this on occasion, so I thought "no big deal."  When I went online to get support, I received a message that Neat no longer "supports" its devices and software; they just sell a monthly service.Neat got tired of working with ordinary 500% profit margins on $150 portable scanners, and decided they would also require a monthly fee.  This is where the real money is.  Sony and other companies have been coming around to the same truth.  I think they all learned it from the cell phone companies.  If you just bill a relatively small amount to a few million credit cards ($5-$50 per account, per month), you can make a fortune in return for absolutely nothing, and no one will protest because it seems like such a small amount each month.I guess some people like having all their finances and other personal information out there in the "cloud," but I don't.  Besides, if you just want an online backup of your data, there are several free, secure alternatives.  I was already running Neatware with as little online interaction as possible, but I would never pay these crooks to mine my financial records!So, what I thought would be a lifetime (or at least long-term) $100 receipt scanner lasted about 2 years.  I will never buy another Neat product for as long as I live!1-Year Update: Had to drop it to 4 stars, because it is great, but it could be improved in many ways.Now, the hardware is very simple.  It's an open scanning cylinder in which the paper feeds straight through.  Because many (most?) receipts come from a "roll" of paper, and are sometimes folded or crinkled, they very often tend to exit the scanner and then loop back around to the feeder--causing a looping scan or a jam.  Barring that, receipts are often difficult to load.  This front-loading scanner is supposed to have a grab/preload function, but it only works about half the time.Most problems, however, are with the software.  First off, the OCR software is not great.  Receipts are often askew or printed poorly, and this accounts for some (but not all) of the problem.  There may only be one field that is incorrect on any given receipt (e.g. vendor, date, tax, total), but I am quite surprised on the unusual occasion that every field on a receipt is correct and the receipt is immediately ready to file.  Then, when you type in the correct info and go to another field, the corrections are not saved until you open another receipt or folder.  Problem is, I often correct the data and immediately drag the receipt into a folder--losing the corrections.  To keep from losing corrections, I have to click on another receipt, wait for it to load, then click back on the corrected receipt, then drag it to a folder.  This is a tedious waste of time.On the other hand, Neat is the only company that has these simple fields--which are just what I need.  This is still much easier than creating *and* filling appropriate fields in any other program.Second, and this may or may not be a problem for most folks, but we have several credit cards in our large family. Every time I scan a receipt, Neat seems to want to categorize the payment method as simply MC, Visa, Credit, or Debit.  I have created separate labels for, e.g., Visa ####, but Neat seems unable to learn this system--even though the numbers are printed on every receipt.Third, I started hitting a lot of bugs in the software after almost a year of use.  I looked up some tips on the web, and they worked for awhile, but Neat then started crashing every time I loaded it.  I eventually contacted customer support, who requested a log, and who gave me a 100% permanent fix.Since most shortfalls are in the software, it seems Neat could improve them if it really wanted to.  Problem is, with a hardware-based payment system, there is little to no motivation to improve the software.  I think all Neat really needs is some good old-fashioned competition.  There are plenty of great scanners out there, and there is some software that *can* manage receipts (e.g. Evernote), but no one else is really shooting specifically for the receipt-scanner market.  There are some companies now focusing on the smartphone-receipt-photo market, but I prefer the clean system of an actual scanner for my tax returns.Original Review: So I ordered the Fujitsu ScanSnap because of its great reviews.  It was a great little scanner, with a great range of functionality.  Only problem is, I needed a scanner for one very specific task--receipts.I have an awe-inspiring Brother scanner/copier/laser printer.  The resolution suits my needs, but what I really needed (badly) was a simple, reliable, and accurate hardware-software package for receipts.  It's so simple that it may seem corny, but Neat really does the job.I have a large family, and I've been wanting to scan all my receipts so I could claim our actual sales taxes.  Every time I want to scan a receipt, I just open the software, load the receipt, and hit scan.  The OCR is very good, and it has a certain amount of learning so it can recognize the vendor and format (tax, etc.).The scanner could be improved.  For one thing, the software shows up in Windows 8 and anti-virus programs as like 30 different programs and registry entries.  No big deal, it's just sloppy.  More importantly, if the computer has hibernated since you last used Neat, you will have to unplug and replug the scanner to get it to work.  I do it at the scanner, and I now know to do it while the software is loading.  So again, no big deal.  I also have not yet had to deal with a major software update and the reported losses of data, backward compatibility, or other problems.  But 6 months into the year and several hundred receipts into it, everything is peachy!

Unbelievably frustrating-buy something else.

This is the first product review I have ever written but I feel the Neat system is such a bad product and people need to be warned about it.  I purchased the Neat scanner in June 2013 as a simple solution to keep receipts.  I am not new to scanning -- I have owned an Epson commercial scanning system for several years.  While Epson is good for large documents, small receipts are cumbersome.  So the Neat system seemed to be a good solution.The Neat software began to have trouble sometime around 4 or 5 months of use.  Technical support is nearly non-existent and the technical support staff is not very knowledgeable.  At the end of 2013, or after 6 months worth of scanned receipts, I decided that the prudent thing to do would be to archive the data  and start 2014 fresh.  I followed the Neat instructions to archive the data and the software produced a nice archive file.  Problem solved, so I thought.  Last week, I tried to go into the archive to retrieve a receipt and guess what only about 20 receipts had been archived -- there should have been probably 200 or 300 or so.  OK, I thought I'll get the receipts from the Neat cloud back-up.  And guess what the receipts weren't there either.  After several online chats with Neat technical support (live agents are apparently not available for phone conversations), the online agent concluded that the system had malfunctioned and my data had been lost.  There had been no warnings or anything -- just lost data.  Let's hope I never get audited.I should add I am quite adept and capable in terms of computer and networking literacy and experience and I own new, high quality computers with up-to-date software which are the core of my small accounting business.  Fortunately my client data has been collected using the Epson system and that system has never malfunctioned in roughly 5 years.  I should have never trusted the Neat system.  Bottom line -- poor software, poor technical support -- do not purchase unless you want to lose your data.  Mine is going into the garbage dumpster.

Buyer beware...these are fakes.  The pen I received came without any packaging...no Lamy box, no product warrantee (all Lamy fountain pens come with a warrantee, at least the real ones do).  Additionally, the grip section does not align flush with the pen body when assembled.  I'll give it to whoever manufactures these fakes...if the lack of packaging/warrantee didn't tip you off, then at first glance they appear legit, especially so if you're unfamiliar with them and don't know what to look for.  But I own two other Lamy fountain pens, and if this is an authentic Lamy Al-Star, then I'm the Queen of England.  If you don't care about getting an authentic, warrantee-covered product that will function properly with other Lamy nibs, and all you care about is saving a few bucks off the going retail price, then by all means, buy this fake Lamy.  I hope it works out for you.  As for me, I've learned my lesson: only buy from an authorized Lamy retailer.  I've initiated the refund process and will be returning this fake in the mail tomorrow.

It's a wonderful concept but falls short in actual use. I have used this little desk with a 15" laptop and a small mouse, always while sitting upright in bed with the stand over my legs. First, the pad area for use with a mouse is nice, plenty of room for even a full size mouse. I don't tilt my laptop more than about one notch but that too is handy -- there are several positions for you to tilt your laptop, iPad or book. I never had a problem with the laptop sliding over the edge but mine was never terribly upright. The teeny light is virtually useless -- not enough illumination to be able to see your keyboard. The little storage area is odd -- why did they design it to open from the front side of the table instead of the back? Not convenient at all if you are storing Post-its, flash drives, pens, etc. and want to retrieve something. The desk is very uncomfortable to use if you fold the legs under and use it as just a tray -- there's no padding or anything of the sort so you would need a blanket or pillow. We're talking hard plastic here, which makes the device fairly light in weight but you don't want it digging into your legs.Now, let's get to those lap-desk legs. This is what caused me to give it only two stars. They're okay in the shorter position while you're using it in bed, on a couch, chair, that kind of function. When the legs are extended out all the way they're very unstable and lack any kind of locking mechanism. So what, you might say. I always store my laptop on this desk with the legs fully extended and it stays on the floor between uses. I can't tell you how often I've moved or picked it up to vacuum, shove it aside or just pick it up to use it -- and one or both of the legs folded inward and my laptop slid off the side. Gaaa! For the past year I've been thinking I was doing something wrong, it must be that I'm not smart enough to figure out how to lock the legs in place. No, now that I've decided to give this thing away I can see it's a design flaw and I should have smacked myself in the head after the first collapse of the legs, watching my expensive new laptop slide off. Ah well, live and learn.There are many more choices of lap desks out there, I wouldn't bother with this one. Save your money and find one that's rated higher and constructed better.

I've been using Neat Receipts for a while now and have found it to be a decent product. A nice side benefit of their portable scanner was that I could use it without the software for other scanning tasks.I recently bought another laptop running Win 7 and did a search to find the driver for it. Imagine my chagrin when I couldn't find one. However, chagrin turned to outright anger once I discovered that the reason I couldn't find a new driver is that Neat Co. is charging another $30 for the "privilege" of getting a Win 7 compliant driver that will allow me to continue using their scanner with Neat software....or anything else.So if you're planning on buying this or any other Neat product, make sure you budget for the cost of buying new drivers whenever Neat Co. needs a boost to their bottom line. Sure there's nothing that requires a company to provide a new driver....well, other than a sense of decency, a lack of outright corporate greed, and perhaps a class action lawsuit.By the time one of their reps shows up with a slick response to this review, I'll already have a new scanner and will have started the process of archiving and/or re-scanning all my data as I refuse to give my money to a company that operates this way.Buh Bye Neat Co.

Bought these for my Cannon PIXMA MX922. I had put the first cartridge in a few weeks ago without inspecting it closely, which was my fault, as this is a new vendor for me. The printer stopped working today with the infamous B200 error code (and ink cradle error that stops your printer dead in it's tracks) I pulled out the cartridge first off and sure enough the cradle was full of ink. I had to clean copious amounts of ink out, and then started opening a new one to insert. Each new cartridge was leaking ink all over. None were useable. I ended up going to Walmart and paying $24 for ONE Cannon ink cartridge to get my printer going again until I can get new ones from a different vendor on Amazon.** All this being said, this vendor did give me a full refund, no questions asked upon request in the return form and I did not have to return the ink cartridges, so the vendor is an honest, reputable vendor.  They get stars for that.  I see now my old vendor I have always bought my generic ink cartridges from is back in stock on Amazon and have ordered new ink from them.
I’m giving two stars because that’s how many sheets of paper it’s capable of stapling without getting jammed.
Does not work on an inkjet printer.  Thought I read reviews correctly so could be my fault.  The ink just sat on top of transparency.

I debated whether to give 1 or 2 stars.  Aesthetically, these were Exactly what i wanted..  the boards and twine are great.  The problem is that the black chalkboards are actually stickers on wood.  The adhesive is not appropriate for the wood and fall off.  I ordered two sets and have at least half of them fall off.  I am using superglue to place them back on-- so there is an at home fix.  But i shouodnt have to.  The business needs to work with the manufacturer for a tougher adhesive so tgey stick.

I give this calculator two stars because it has a lot of functionality.  It is mostly a time sink and a source of frustration.Pros:1. This is a capable machine.  It can do a lot.  Much more than I ever want a calculator to do, actually.2. Hi-res screen.  The high resolution is nice.Cons:1.  The keyboard is terrible.  The keyboard on TI's earlier calculators were bad, and this one is actually worse.  TI needs to take a lesson from HP on how to make keys that don't wobble around and that provide some decent tactile feedback.  The keys, all of them, are squishy and wobbly.  The extra crowding by the letter keys makes it incredibly difficult to type anything, numbers or letters, without hitting the wrong key.  It is a constant source of frustration as well as a waste of time.2.  The learning curve it too high.  If I use this in class, I will need to take considerable time (a few days) just teaching the students how to use it.  This is time that then cannot be spent teaching math and physics.  Which should I teach my students, Newton's Laws of Motion, or how to click "Menu...Action...Pointer..."3.  Doing simple tasks is now difficult.  Turn it on, wait for the operating system to load, then click Home, then 1:calculator, then Enter, and then you can finally type 2+2 and get an answer.4.  The screen, while it is hi-res, is not all that easy to read.  It gets a good bit of glare.5.  My students don't like it.  With the TI-83, I would at least get a lot of "Oh, that's cool" comments when a nice graph would appear.  When one of my poor students finally accomplishes a task on the nSpire, there is instead a sense of relief that they finally got it do what they were trying to do.  This calculator is not enjoyable to use.6.  The calculator is bulky.  Even the TI-83 was pretty large for carrying around, and this one is even larger.I'm sticking with the TI-83 for now, and considering switching to HP.If you want to do any real work in physics or engineering, go with HP.  They are still the gold standard of calculators.

Color is quite dark, it’s really a dark blue close to black. Almost impossible to open the bottle the first time. There should be a real problem as I read other customers also faced the same problem. A customer in France even broke the bottle when trying to open...Aside this two remarks, the ink is of good quality. Small remark it cannot be erased, so maybe less appropriate for kids at school.Update comment on Feb 17/02/2021Impossible to open the bottle... Incredible. I thought that there will no more problem once it has been open for the first time but unfortunately, it's definitively not the case.I didn't dare to try to force it with tools given comments os some users stating that the bottle has been broken...So 4 stars for the ink but -10 for the bottle!!!!!!!

These replacement cartridges were ordered for a HP Deskjet 3050 which is being used to print a low volume newsletter. Initially, the print quality was good, however the tricolor cartridge produced multiple errors, which caused the printing to malfunction. About 9 pages into the print job, errors in the printing began to appear, and each time, a tricolor cartridge error was displayed on the printer. I replaced the tricolor with the old, nearly empty tricolor cartridge and the problem resolved, until the color ink was depleted. I have returned the set to the seller in exchange for another set. I will revise this review once the replacements are received and tested. Follow up: I received replacement cartridges the next day and the print quality was good. No errors. However halfway through printing 13 copies of a 14-page newsletter, the color cartridge ran out of cyan ink. These reman cartridges don't produce as many printed pages as a standard cartridge. My last set printed the whole newsletter, which is 14 pages--half containing color images. Back to the drawing board while the few non-tech members wait for their copies. This company is a no-go.
I hate giving this item a poor review, but the open spaces are way too big for a pen/pencil holder. They slip right through. Very disappointed because I love the design.

I almost never leave reviews but I feel like I was cheated with these. They fit in the printer fine and it says they are compatible, but there was no ink. I did three test pages and cleaned the printer head since it was so faint, and then it told me they were out of ink!
I would give 0 stars if possible. Only 3 pens that arrived were functional. Rest of them did not write. Will not purchase again.

While the frame is nice, the actual board (on both sides) appears to be separating from the backing. As a result there are large "bubbles" and it makes a sticky noise when writing on the board.  If this was resolved, it would be 5 stars!

I ordered 2 pencils and paid for two and they only sent one. I'm not sure how to go abt getting the other pencil but that's all I really want. The pencil writes excellent.. but I've read more reviews abt the same thing happening to them. 😕

This company discontinued all software downloads for previous legacy customers to switch everyone to their annual cloud service. Despite my scanner working perfectly fine and having paid to use the product they quietly did so to increase their bottom line with no regard to previously loyal customers. I don't write reviews often but am soo dissapointed at this corporation that I feel new customers should be wary of supporting a company like this. I even wrote to their customer support and they said there was nothing they could do. PLEASE PLEASE do not BUY!I hope someone from the company is reading all the bad press they are receiving! DO NOT ACCEPT THIS!

Why put size:12 count if you know it is just 1 pen? I thought it was a mistake until I read other reviews stating they received just 1 pen seriously, I wouldn't pay that much for just one pen. just put one pen next time. I wanted to contact the seller instead of putting a review but I couldn't find where to send a message to the seller.

I have used these pens for many years and buy new ones as the old ones run out of ink since refills are about the same price. The pen has always been dependable. However, when I decided to buy the pens this time, the pens that came were not the same pen as always. Although it looks very similar, the grip part is about 1/3 of what it used to be, the pen is smaller and feels lighter, the ink fainter and not as smooth, and the buttons are smaller and harder to press down. The only real difference now between this pen and the blue barrel model is the color of the outside.The picture in this review shows the difference between the old pen (the one shown in the amazon picture) and the new model. I am incredibly disappointed in the drop in quality, and plan to return the pens I bought if possible.

I got subpar performance out of the first cartridge - 1200 pages or so, after resetting the spring - far less than I'd gotten out of others.  The second cartridge seemed to be mis-aligned; it made an awful racket as it picked paper from the tray, and that was virtually right out of the box.  Put the old toner back in, and no alignment problems.I rarely review, but this deserves a "stay away" warning.

I've owned the Charles Leonard pencil sharpener (model #89508)for six months. After reading many reviews and searching the web for an economical and functional rotary pencil sharpener I took the plunge and bought this sharpener. And then wanted to return it.First flaw, the mounting screws are useless. I knew this going into the purchase and thought a trip to the hardware store would make for an easy fix. Now I ask, why should I do the work that is the MANUFACTURER's responsibility?? It's still not mounted. I've many other things I need to do and doing somebody else's job isn't among them.Second flaw, because it is unmounted (still) one person has to hold the sharpener firmly down so another person can sharpen the pencil. Typically somebody knocks off the cover...frequently...because it just does NOT stay on...and it ain't goin' back on in a hurry! The cover just does NOT go back on in the up/down position (as shown in the picture). Mine has dents from forcing it back into position.If it were sideways mounted(HA!)then presto, no problemo, the cover easily goes on sideways. EVERY time a pencil is sharpened the cover comes off and pencil grindings are everywhere...again!!Third flaw, yes the sharpener has eight holes for differing sizes of pencils. One hole is helpfully marked STANDARD to show where standard-sized pencils ought to fit. I'm not sure which country the Standard is set but it isn't the U.S. since my average #2 U.S. school pencils don't fit in the standard slot.For that matter, my child's oversized pencil fits in the largest oversized hole but the burr doesn't touch the pencil. What's the point of offering eight sizes if the largest holes are just for appearance not function?Lastly, sometime recently it began only sharpening effectively in one direction. And not in the comfortable direction but the awkward one (remember it takes two people to run it). When the sharpener was new the burr mostly cut the pencils on all sides so maybe it was worth a little effort. Now it only shaves one side. The tip is long and sharp...and breaks often so that now I'm back where I began: looking on Amazon for a functioning rotary pencil sharpener.In the immortal words of my child: "The thing's a ripoff".

Not sure how these got four and a half stars. The paper is pour quality and thin. Don't try to use an eraser because all it does is smudge. Yes, I use quality erasers. Gave the pads to the Grandkids to scribble on. Did not feel like driving to drop them off for return.

Disappointed in product. From day one of opening package...gun does not work properly. The needle comessage flying out every time I try to tag. I used up half of fastness barbs just trying to make gun function properly. I'm only giving it a star because I'm required to rate..I wish there was a minus. Don't waste your money on this item.

Worst pair of scissors I've ever bought!  And you can't return these per Amazon policy.  Probably because they are 2 pieces of "made in China" junk & every one would send them back if given the option.  I do not believe that any of the 5 star reviews were really given for these scissors...IMPOSSIBLE

You get what you pay for.  Bought this three months ago and it has already decided that the stapling of 3-5 pages at a time was too much for it to survive. It gave up. Opened it up and a piece of the stapler jumped off "I can't take it any more! The pressure is too great!!!"My wife teared up as the piece was an emotional wreck. I tried to get the piece to rejoin the others, but he refused.  "Why do you hate me so?"  I just wanted my wife's stapler to work.  "I'm not lazy, I am not up to the job, I can staple one page, maybe two."I replied "I don't really need to staple 1 page documents, those would be placed in a folder by themselves. Two pages, those do happen, but the job is for 3-5 pages and you are obviously too soft and weak for that kind of work.""You can return me? Get a refund? "Sadly too late, the window to return for a refund ended May 31st.Easy to use- if it worked, it would be a 5 star. It worked sometimes, so a 3 star.Lightweight - that's not really a great characteristic for something that you are pressing down on to staple. I'd rather have something a bit more sturdy.Sturdiness - you see, that's an important aspect of a stapler.. this, unfortunately is soft and weak.Lastly - where is this mysterious stapler remover?
Won't work - keep getting "not compatible" error. As someone else posted in their review, these must not be original, new cartridges. Buyer Beware!

If I could, I wouldn’t give this product any stars. One needle broke. The instructions aren’t correct in saying to align the needle groove to the gun groove. The needle lock won’t turn back to the 9 o’clock position. The tags continuously jammed. I am surprised I got the tags back on the item I’m returning. HORRIBLE PRODUCT. HORRIBLE.
IMPOSSIBLE TO RATE SOMETHING THAT DOESN'T WORK

Finally a pen that erases without wearing down the paper! The only problem is.... I couldn't even finish my grocery list without it running out of ink.Today is day number two with this pen. I bought it last night and already, at 2:55pm, the pen runs out of ink. Why?? How??This would have been five stars if :-it didn't run out of ink the second day of use-the cap was designed to also erase (when you put it on the end it covers the eraser!)-better price for the qualityIt was a great idea, and great results with the eraser! Unfortunately, I need a pen that writes as well.

The worst scanning software I've ever experience. Software hangs after scanning one slide at 600 dpi, 4x6" output. C'mon. I've got 2 gigs of memory.OCR only outputs to Windows notebookand can't be reset for any other word processor. Useless for my needs and, I'd venture to say, for most people.No usable output for either slides or text after hours of experimentation. Scanner appears to be working properly; it's the software that won't allow me to save the scanned images.Finally, one reviewer called this the PERFECT scanner for 120 negatives. On this recommendation, and others, I pulled the trigger and ordered this scanner. Big mistake. It DOES NOT scan 120 negatives, nor can it be adapted in any way to scan these medium format negatives.  Canon makes great lenses, but boy was this a failure.P.S. I have above average technical skills, but this one had me beating my brains out. Save yours and look for another scanner.
If I could give less than once star I would. This thing refuses to work. You get what you pay for I guess.

Wasn't to impressed when this safe arrived.  When I unboxed it I found the latch was bent and I could not even lock it.  It was like someone had it before and had dropped the lid on the latch when it was up,  30 minutes of bending on it with a plyers and it was usable.  Certainly not a first rate buying experience.

Buyer beware!  This toner cartridge gives extremely poor yield and, therefore, is a poor value.I purchased this toner cartridge for a Brother DCP-7065DN printer.  The original Brother “starter” cartridge lasted for slightly more than 1000 pages, although the last 200 or so pages were after the “low toner” message had started.  The replacement cartridge worked fine for approximately 800 pages.  Then, the print quality suddenly deteriorated very badly.  There was no “low toner” warning message;  there was just the deterioration in print quality.  The print quality problem was exactly like that shown on page 63 of the printer’s “Basic User’s Guide.”  It was typical of the fading-out that occurs when a cartridge is running out of toner.  (This was clearly NOT a print-quality problem related to cleaning, e.g., it was NOT the type of problem in which specks or lines appear.)Unfortunately, I had bought another of these cartridges because the first one was initially giving good copies.  Because of the poor print quality, I ended up switching out to the second cartridge before I had reached 1000 copies on the first cartridge.  In other words, a cartridge that was supposed to give me 2600 copies lasted for fewer printed pages than the original Brother starter cartridge.  The second cartridge is currently giving good copies (just like the first one).  It remains to be seen how long this cartridge will last.UPDATE  on 08/19/15:  The second cartridge is now running out of toner and giving poor copies.  I got less than 1200 pages!  Both times there was no "toner low" warning, so now I have to act quickly to buy a new toner cartridge, but certainly never again from Shop at 247.  I wish that I could give a negative number of stars to this ripoff product and ripoff company.  Please do NOT buy anything from Shop at 247!

This should be a zero rating. It appears that poor quality control renders item useless as an adjustable stool.The best two things that can be said are: (1) that it works as a single height stool; (2) customer service answers emails promptly.The stool arrived in good condition. There are slightly different versions of the assembly instructions - one online and one with the kit.  This causes confusion.  A critical piece of information is missing from both: the orange cap  is not removed.  The illustration of which cap to remove is not to scale and appears to indicate the orange cap on the piston.In this case, the cylinder piston was inoperative. The company sent another without argument.  It arrived 7 or more days later  which defeats the purpose of having Amazon Prime for speedy delivery.Taking apart a forcefit assembly requires muscle, padding, and a non-marrying mallet.  You can add $25 to $45 dollars to the cost for a good mallet unless you think the company will accept a dented return.The second cylinder worked but only after another round of assembly and disassembly.  Sitting and bouncing on the chair did not activate the piston as per the optimistic instructions. A sound wack on the orange cap  with the mallet did.Still, the stool did not work. A final disassembly found that the weld for the seat adjusting lever was crooked.  It did not make contact with the piston.  No easy fix.Customer service has not been contacted about the second quality control failure.  If they read this and want to send another seat assembly I'll edit the rating.  It's not worth the time, effort, or expense to go through another round of emails or to box up the unit and send it back.Seriously considering giving the stool a Viking funeral then have an artist friend render the remains with company logo and address into an art piece for the local gallery.

Bought this at Michael's for mandala making, but want to share my review since I can't on the website . . . Just opened the product (brand new) and it is missing the graphite refills and sharpener. The case itself does not shut -- the lid is too wide for the base and the "locking" parts do not even touch. The ruler, protractor, and triangles are very cheap plastic. The compasses looked like a sturdy metal, but they seem cheap as well. NOT worth the money I paid and I WILL be returning this for a refund.Might be okay for young students, but not for true art supplies!

I purchased two cartridges for my HL-2270-DL. The first printed less than 250 spotty, streaky, shadowy pages and finally started not printing anything on the rightmost inch of the page. I put the second one in and roughly 300 pages later, quit printing on the rightmost half of each page. TRASHED them both and ordered V4Ink cartridges. Happy as a clam with the V4Ink cartridges - 1500 pages & still going strong (see my V4Ink review for more info.
Product arrived defective. Returned it but amazon would only cover $3.99 for return shipping. Cheapest rate with Canada Post was $16.50. So basically I was out over $12 for a faulty product. RIP off!

I bought this because I aspire to be more "green" in life. Well, it was a mistake. I hate this calendar, you have to have very small handwriting and a thin pen which can be hard because dry erase markers are never really thin. Also, once I received it, there were many wrinkles on the calendar. Things I thought I could deal with, but it wrinkled 5x as much after just two weeks. I hate writing bad reviews... but I wish there would have been one like this before I purchased.

I would like to give 0 stars if that was possible. Nasty , rude, condescending seller. These labels are the cheaply made they are indeed ultra thin and do not work as advertise. Its crap. After contacting the seller, the seller proceeded to write back a very nasty and condescending message  that does not even allow you to reply to their message. So with that being said , I will reply in my review. This is why people go to places like Etsy and other popular businesses for their needs. Treat your customers better
No stars..they came all dried out and do not work

Bought two of these based on the extensive stellar reviews, for two 14 year olds in Geometry Honors.  Math teacher commented that this "type" of compass was not recommended as they are not reliable. Within a week, both sets have small parts falling off the compass, and I have no idea where the part came from.  On both compasses the led is now now unsecure and falls out.  With the return window now closed, we're now buying another 2 sets.  Cheaper is not always a better value!

I have had this item for at least 5+ years now, and I am finally resolved to the idea that I am going to save my time, money, and temper and look for a different product.  At least twice a year I am fighting with the refills to get them installed correctly.  Too many yards of the refill are wasted on wrinkles and crinkles, as the two sides refuse to line up properly for the machine to evenly roll them together to laminate things.Why the manufacturer can't put out a product that is install and user friendly, I have no idea.  I have given this product more time than anyone should allow, and it has failed, miserably.  It has one star, mainly because Amazon requires at least one to be given.  Perhaps that one star will go for the fact that once the product is properly lined up (which you can plan on using the whole half of a day to get it right...), it protects papers and crafts very well.

Looks like they have a bad batch. I tried twice, got a leaker each time. I give up on these, I hope the vendor catches this. Two special trips to return defective is.......a bit ridiculous.Update: So, I called them. Spoke to a very understanding rep, who initiated an immediate refund...Definitely 5 stars for customer service, and I might give them a shot next time...

The Honeywell 1102 is a nice, sturdy lockbox. However, the seller has the Honeywell 1104 lockbox listed in the "From the Manufacturer" information. The 1104 is bigger and can withstand more. It was very misleading to have that lockbox's information for a different product.The product I would rate 5 stars; the seller gets 1 star as long as the misleading info is there.

I should have listened to the reviews and steered clear of these but of course I had to learn everything else in life the hard way so it’s only fitting that be the case with these as well.To begin with, I opened the case to find pens with all sorts of different amounts of ink levels which is always a red flag but was especially concerning and disappointing because some were nearly empty and I do mean empty. I have emptied enough gel pens to know that this isn’t something that happens easily or by accident. Maybe if the pen was nearly empty AND there was a bunch of ink leaked all in the cap and case but that’s not at all what went on with my set. The cap and the case were both clean. The different various ink levels along with the fact that when I emailed the seller and requested a replacement set and was instead given a refund and told that there were no more sets tells me that I almost certainly received a used set that had been returned after quite a bit of use.I assume the reason it was returned was not due to the levels of ink though. I imagine that the original owner received a pretty even batch and that the ink amount changed as they used the pens. The reason I imagine they probably returned these was because, quite frankly, they aren’t very good pens. I could be wrong because I got a used set and maybe the previous owner left the caps off or something but all of the pens were mostly dry and barely flowed. The ones that did flow would skip a lot and were frustratingly unreliable. To top it off the colors were not very vibrant or anything special. The ink did dry quickly, I will give it that. Also there is a good variety of textures as this set has neon, metallic, and glitter. Out of the entire set I really liked the color of four of them and of those four, two were dried up, one was empty and the other worked.These pens are so thin that I can’t imagine getting much use out of them for coloring anyway even if they did work. They barely contain much ink at all. I definitely really liked the feel of the skinnier pens in my hand though as I have pretty tiny hands though so that may be why. The difference in feel though does not outweigh the negatives however and I’d take a fatter pen between my fingers for longer lasting, reliable ink flow, cheaper price, and better color selection any day. The case was nice and hard and latched solidly and I thought that was a great change from the usual folding, cheap, annoying, plastic things that most gel pens come in but unfortunately the pens were super hard to get out of it and I felt like I was going to snap a pen in half trying to get it out or put it in.Bottom line: Do not buy these! Look elsewhere on Amazon because they have some amazing sets with 100 beautiful colors, comfort grips, perfect flow, and refills for almost half of what these cost. Check out Aen, ColorTechnik, Amazapens, and GelWriters right here on Amazon for some high quality and reliable gel pens!

I wouldn’t have even given it one star, but that is the minimum allowed.  This is the worst pencil sharpener I have ever used, could have done better with a knife!  It doesn’t sharpen evenly; one side is perfect, but the other side of the pencil has wood all the way around the lead.  I thought the pencils were bad, but tried different brands.  Same thing happened every time.  Do not buy, waste of time and money!!
The picture & description indicates Medium Binder Clips, 12 boxes of 1 Dozen Each (144 Total) but only received 1 box of 12.  We are owed 11 boxes, 132 Clips.  Will revise rating once corrected.

Similar to other reviews I have read, this bulb had both a misaligned screw, though I was able to torque it in with some effort.  However, no more than 50 hours of use and the bulb popped and I need to find a new one.  After sold on the statement that these bulbs would last 4000 hours, I have been through 5 bulbs with the average now at about 1000 hours (maximum 2200).  This bulb was absolutely the worst of the disappointing bunch.

I purchased the calendar for a Christmas present for my wife.  She was pretty disappointed after viewing the photos.  In fact, she didn't even hang it in her home office, which was a first.  The only consolation was that a portion of the proceeds go to a charity.  For those reasons I have to give it a lower rating and review.

We brought these for our little boy after he got an easel for Christmas. Unfortunately these don’t work on his whiteboard and after reading reviews elsewhere it turns out these will only work with Crayola’s own whiteboards.

So, I bought these to feed my pen addiction and, being a lefty, had heard these were perfect. At first they were magnificent. They wrote smoothly, didn't leave the side of my hand  like a 5 years old passing with magic markers, and had beautiful colors to choose from. But, sadly, within a month, the ink stopped coming out smoothly. I would scribble in circles, furiously hoping for just a few more lines of notes. But, it was to no avail. I miss those pens but honestly, I miss the money I spent on them instead of tacos. The 2 stars are because when I first got them, I loved the colors and they did write well and dry quickly. But, I can't give anymore because they didn't even last a full month.
Mine has two pages of March and no April!! Same as other reviewers, already filled out until March, probably not worth shipping back!

I like the overall concept of this planner, and after doing a lot of research and seeing positive reviews I went ahead and bought it. BUT when it came in, I noticed the front cover and about a quarter of the pages were bent pretty severally and made the planner look pretty ugly, I didn't return it because I am in Graduate School and desperately needed a planner ASAP. Now that I have had it for maybe a few weeks, the ribbon that "bookmarks" where you are in the planner came off (I have no idea how). So overall, I am disappointed with the product and wish I would have returned it before marking in it.

I don't know what labels the other reviewers are using but apparently not the same as the ones I received.  I can't peel them off the sheet.  What good is an adhesive label if you can't peel and stick?  I will not buy these again.  In fact, I tried 3 sheets (none of the produced a label!) and trashed the entire package as useless.

This thing sucks! It broke on me inless than a couple months just from resting my feet in it in a sitting position!!! Don't waste your money ! Find a better quality version of the same thing is what I'd recommend 😠 -5 stars

Arrived timely, and  a month into using them, the cartridges appear to be fine.  Review update.  I've had several problems with the mint cell cartridges.  One of the black cells leaked in its packaging.  More recently, the magenta cell I just installed is full, but I am not able to print using the magenta color.  I have run the cleaning program and done the nozzle test, and the magenta color is simply missing.  Also, the cartridges are running out of ink much faster than I was led to believe from other users' reviews.  Very disappointed in this purchase.

I purchased this seemingly sturdy safe after reading all the great reviews;  but the lock broke 6 months after purchase.  The safe is useless as such.  Makes an attractive door stop. I probably opened it less than 10 times.  Total disappointment and waste of money.

I've used other labels from House Labels in the past, such as 8.5 x 5.5 shipping labels. Those shipping labels were the best "off brand" labels I ever used, and were nice and thick so that I could run them through the printer twice when needed. They also stuck perfectly to boxes.These Dymo labels were a disappointment though. Although they have a premium feel, they keep peeling off items that I stick them on. Maybe I received a bad batch. I don't have this peeling problems with the Dymo or Brother brand labels I've used in various label printers.Edit: In reponse to the comment noting that these are meant to be removeable labels- I did overlook that when I originally purchased them. That does make a difference. However, I'm leaving my review at 2 stars because I think they also fail as removeable labels. These are "too removable" and simply would not stay on the items. They kept peeling off after a few days, and lasted an even shorter time for items that were not perfectly flat. Amazon uses labels that are removeable yet actually stay on the item when you want them to, so I imagine that House Labels could improve these with a slight change in their adhesive formula.

I love the ink and the way the tip glides effortlessly over the paper. Best writing experience in a pen as far as that goes.I had been given a sample pen with a cap and knew I like the pens. I prefer retractable pens so I ordered these in blue. I put three pens in my purse to transport to work. When I took them out one had completely come apart. I checked the others and the bottom part that screws onto the pen was not tightened on any of them. I could not get the spring to fit back into the pen that fell apart so I had to throw that pen out as it did not function. Very bad construction. Please work on this PaperMate! I deducted three stars for this.

OK- I just ordered this paper, but only once I got it did I realize that the title clearly says it is Heavyweight Matte inkjet paper, NOT the 4 star premium presentation paper shown in the picture. While the paper that was delivered says "perfect for high quality photo reprints and enlargements", its not! Its perfectly fine as cardstock but horrible to print photos.

Got these for replacement on m-302 and m-402. The stock erasers worked great and we're very rubbery/pliable. I expected the same quality from these replacements but they were much firmer and seemed dried out. They did not erase well, will be returning for refund. I may have gotten a bad batch if they send replacements that are similar to the stock ones I'll up the rating to 5 stars. They fit great.

Im giving this one star because it is the lowest I can give. I bought this ink as a replacement for my HP laser printer that I use to print shipping labels. I have printed about 40 labels and discovered that the ink just rubs off. barcodes are coming off - a waste of money. beware - even my Christmas card labels rub off - get on your hands - messy - JUNK.

Overall, I am really disappointed with these. The quality of the housing unit (plastic holding the white tape) is great which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. However, The white out it’s self is constantly slipping off of the track and it tears up the other white out around her The white out itself is constantly slipping off of the track and it tears up the other white out around  when I try to make it even. With all of that being said, BIC Has always been a reliable brand for me, and I might have gotten a bad batch. So is the manufacture sees this and would like to send me a new batch I will gladly change my review once the new batch comes if it performs better. I hope you all find this review useful. Happy shopping!

Well it was not the best as sharping pencils or anything for that matter because the sharpener didn't line up with the hole in the nose so nothing could be inserted. But for the price and because it was cool looking and super cheap it still gets 3 stars.

I've had this notebook since September 2018 and it's held up great until a few days ago... I had noticed the stretchy band on the back that is supposed to hold the notebook closed was coming undone and it finally snapped. I really wish it had a better quality band because the paper itself is beautiful and sturdy (I use Pilot G2 pens and there is NO ink bleed through!! yay!) maybe if the band was better I could give it a better review.

****3days later Edit****Oh man I hate to admit it but this thing really let us down. The cup holder netting and ring broke off literally an hour after I left the first review. I was able to fix it but now the little drawer it sits on won’t shut. The legs not being individually adjustable really turned out to be a bigger deal than I thought it would be. Here’s why: the pop up top is actually pretty heavy. And when you have it raised, it makes the whole thing want to fall toward you. Being able to adjust those legs to make them longer under that side, would balance that. But instead it just falls in your lap. Spilled the drink all over the place. Another thing is: when the top is raised for propping your device, the crease between the raised part and flat part pinches and scratches the crap out of you. Finally, the little pedestal won’t stay in either designated place, the little pegs are just too short.It’s a real bummer too because my kid really loves the tray. I noticed the problems on the second day but she begged me to keep it because she loves the anchor stamp and how beautiful the whole thing is. And I do too. But I’m afraid I’m going to have to return it. I even thought I would keep it and get her something different but it does the exact same thing to me. I’ll be contacting the seller ASAP because I’ve already thrown away the box.First, I want to say that this tray is BEAUTIFUL craftsmanship. I’m so impressed with it! It’s solid! Sturdy, smooth and absolutely perfect. I ordered it for my special needs daughter who needs it for her iPad. The only issue I have is her iPad case makes it a little too bulky to prop on the pedestal, which was my reason for getting the tray. That’s the cases fault, not the tray. But it would be an improvement to make that pedestal a little bigger to hold a bulky device. Also, as you can see in the photo, I had to put a pillow under the tray to stop it from falling forward on her. Adjusting the legs didn’t help prevent this. I think if you would make each leg individually adjustable, so that I could level it against her weight and pull on it, it would fit her needs better. And, if you do indeed decide to make that improvement, I will keep this one and buy her another one. Because we really love it!! But for now I’m going to use Velcro to help hold her iPad and I’ll continue using the pillow for her lap. Thank you for such a beautiful piece. My daughter especially loves the cup holder.

This is horrible and I wish I would have listened to other reviewers.  Complete waste of money and does not work!!  I used an flat-head screwdriver as my staple remover and it worked much better.  Save your money.  It would get a one star if it was an option.

I picked this specific portable washer because the reviews were good but I wouldn't recommend it. They would not budge and kept saying to take a video of the drain not working. Now why after 3 attempts of having to manually empty the water out of the machine would I want to refill it again. I just wanted to return the machine but they gave me a run around and I'm finally told I can return it BUT You cant even get a full refund because returning the machine cost around $120 cause they dont pay for the shipping OF COURSE . fed up and stuck with a broken machine.

The planner itself is beautiful. I thought I read it had stickers, not this one. The only ONLY reason I gave 2 stars (tempted to give one) Is because the condition it arrived in. Smh! There is no reason for it to arrive this badly bent! None.

I corrected my review.In the beginning, I wrote:Excellent product. 200 pencils for 10 minutes. It doesn't break them.Now this sharpener doesn't work. The sharpener is made up of plastic gears. Yes, the milling cutter is solid, metal. But the sharpener broke after three times using it. Apparently, one of the plastic gears was piled up and the engine immediately stops.I had to throw the sharpener in the trash. It's a pity, I loved it.

UPDATE **See revised review below** I have been hesitant for years to try third party printer cartridges, but after shelling out hundreds of dollars and realizing that I've spent 5 times as much on ink as I did my actual printer, I decided to give these a shot. I'm glad I did. They are identical in terms of output quality to their HP counterparts. Seriously, why throw away money? I use my printer daily for various things and I cannot tell the difference. It's a no-brainer for me, I'm done wasting money on HP's ridiculously overpriced cartridges.Update July 2017:It took a while for me to get what I paid for, but the day finally came. I guess it's true, If something seems to good to be true, it probably is. After months of use, these cartridges have failed spectacularly. While ink levels remain good, the quality of printing is disastrous. Streaking, bleeding, gobs of black ink on my documents, and now an error message on my printer, which might be permanently damaged from these cheap cartridges. I'm not even attempting to print photos, just standard documents with basic colors. They come out dark and hideous looking, and the black ink is also bleeding onto the paper on the sides.I hope these didn't destroy my printer, but it's back to genuine HP for me. It's just not worth it. Don't buy these under any circumstances!

I would give it less than one star if I could. Completely useless after one use, one task which it did not even complete. Washing it does not restore it to new, and even if it did, right out of the box it was crappy. A regular tape roller is much quicker and more efficient and most importantly, does the job. Save your money and pass on this one.

Things were off to a rocky start when I didn't know exactly how I was supposed to even start putting it together. It tells you to "Attach both legs to the tray by inserting them into the holes from the outer side until it clicks". ...What? I gave them the benefit of the doubt and went right to it, only to realize I started it wrong. I had a 50/50 shot lol. What they SHOULD say is for you to make sure that their logo is right side up, facing the direction of the top of the tray. Was that so hard to explain?Because I put it on incorrectly, I had to pull the legs back out, and this was REALLY HARD. It felt like I was going to break it. I couldn't proceed with how I had it, because inserted incorrectly, the screw holes weren't aligned properly. I read a previous review that mentioned they weren't predrilled...it sounds like this person didn't insert the legs correctly. They also mentioned that the degrees didn't match up...this is also likely why.My biggest gripe is how much of an absolute pain the legs are to adjust, which is its main feature. You really have to shove your thumb into the hard plastic button to get it to rotate. This is really awkward for me, especially because I'm currently going through physical therapy for my wrist. Whenever I think things are going kind of well with it, I get stuck trying to rotate it because the legs are misaligned, and want to just throw the whole thing in the trash.I purchased this because I figured it was more convenient to have something that is easy to fold up and put away, than to replace my entire desktop with a large standing desk. This is absolutely not that thing lol. I pretty much never want to adjust the legs because of how painful wrestling with them is. It's fine if you never have to adjust it.Not recommended.
I give it a one star just for the simple reason it seemed it would have worked well, but received the item and the the 2 tabs that hold that you rest the light stand in were broken off. Worthless!

I needed printer ink for my HP 1315 to return something to Amazon. I saw this incredible deal. Less than seven bucks for printer ink? Wow. The reviews were helpful, but they are all either very positive or very negative. For that price, I decided to go for it. I received the ink cartridge quickly, but it didn't work on my printer. It wouldn't read that the cartridge was in there and kept throwing me an error. One reviewer who had my same printer said it worked great, so I'm thinking it's a gamble, 50/50.

Tragic.Roaring Spring does zero justice for Whitelines. Please make the original Swedish-made products available for purchase in the US again!!!! I would gladly pay so much more just to be able to buy those again or guess I’ll have to go to Sweden.Purchased these about a month ago despite reviews of lower quality - I said eff it I don’t know what else to use so I’ll just get these and see how it goes. I’m writing this review now because I am SO OVER these stupid spiral holes that are literally just open at the top.I think the only thing I actually like about these Roaring Spring versions are the stiff, cardboard backs. Otherwise everything is worse, ALSO cheap looking. The pressure from my Muji pen shows up on the other side and the spiral holes are atrocious, with the top hole being cut so unevenly it’s actually just open.  Now the only differences between this and every other sh*tty notebook out there are the actual Whitelines/paper color (I really don’t mind the greyish shade) and the paper is like...A TOUCH heavier than standard paper.I miss the slimmer spiral, the A4 size, the beautiful matte white soft touch covers, and the heavy paper of the original Swedish books. The amazing quality made me more thoughtful of what I wrote on the page as I didn’t want to waste any of the beautiful space. Glad I stocked up on perspective paper and grid notebooks before we got stuck with Roaring Spring’s sad sad excuse.You should probably not buy these if you’re used to the much superior original Whitelines products, I know I wanna cry about it every time I write in them.

I bought this product because of having fan and being almost of the same price as other. But this product is very badly manufactured. The fan is working but all the screws are loose and cannot be tightened. The whole fan box is shaking and obviously it will detach sooner or later.All the joints are loose and the whole structure is shaking. Specially, if you set it in the highest situation, it is not at all reliable and you cannot leave your laptop on.I don't know how good or bad are other products either but my point is that if you wanna give it a try, start from other products because I did and I am definitely returning this and I will buy one of others that has at least many customer reviews.

Like other reviewers said, this box is already so flimsy, it won’t close properly. It wouldn’t last a week in a classroom. Also, they showed a picture of a blue box and I received a pink one. I wanted the blue.

I purchased these to do labels for a charity fundraiser at our school. I used an HP color laser printer. The yellow and black smudged. I contacted the seller and they blamed my printer. Told me clean it. I have NO problem with Avery. They said thet only get 5 star reviews so OBVIOUSLY they dont bother to look at the lower ones that are given. Yes, they are cheap but I guess you get what you pay for. Our school wanted to save money so we could spend it on the kids not expensive labels. I even sent them photos of the smudged labels and my yellow fingers from applying the labels!

I had major issues with the black, yellow, and magenta cartridges. After printing 7 pages, a horrible sound came from the printer. Investigation revealed the black toner was so tight the printer was having problems turning it's drum. It was actually sounding like the printer was stripping its gears trying to print black.  I put the old black back in and no problems!Then.....The yellow and magenta began to smear on prints after 10 printouts. Since I had bought these a month ahead of time preparing for my need to change cartridges.Update August 8:  Global toner customer service has contacted me and has offered a refund or replacement.  Very prompt response and I am impressed with that.  More to follow, so I have updated from 1 star to 3 based on their care for the customer. Will update more as soon as we discuss next steps.
One box is being sold, not 12.  Many reviews show this but it still is not being corrected!  SCAM
This is a rip off.  This was a bunch of little piece toys, that 2 broke when I was playing with them.  If I could minus stars I would!!!!  Very disappointed!!!

If I could give this one star, I would! Just returned it - it is poorly made, difficult to assemble, and just overall CHEAP. Impossible for one person to adjust on his or her own -- you need like four pair of hands. Don't waste your money. I'd rather use a stack of phone books than put my computer on this flimsy stand.

I've now installed two sets of these in an HP Photosmart 7510.As mentioned in other reviews, you have to mess with the printer quite a bit to even get it to recognize that there are cartridges installed.  After a few hard resets (unplug the printer, plug it back in), and forcing a cartridge cleaning, it found the cartridges.  However, the printer would give an error when you asked it to do a print head alignment, so it's not possible to do a print head alignment.  The cartridges are also super-leaky.  Wear latex gloves and watch out for your clothes.I think because of that, the print quality was poor, and had lines in it.  I still kept using the cartridges, though, until the Magenta cartridge died after about 50 pages.  I had a spare from the same company, but that one the printer wouldn't recognize at all, even after trying to reset the printer three times.  I gave up and put my old, depleted HP cartridges back in the printer, and although the printer complained that it was low on ink, it still was able to print for me, so I know my printer and the setup is working.I went ahead and check the rest of the second set, and about half of them are dead, at least on the first try.At this point, I give up on these cartridges.  They're super cheap, and I might get them to work eventually, but there are other inexpensive HP-compatible cartridges out there that work the first time, every time, and have great print quality.Also, since the manufacturer expects you to pay return shipping, if you do have to return these cartridges, you're out the shipping charges both ways, which is about the same as the whole pack of cartridges costs.  So you can't really even get your money back.
They said that it is for brother mfc6490, but it is not compatible. i believe that positive reviews here are fake. what a waste of money!

This is most definitely NOT A5. It does not fit my A5 diary. I have read reviews from others who have complained that it does not fit but I could not believe myself but...nope it is true. Do not understand why...

I really dislike leaving poor reviews, but in this case I have no choice. My daughter asked for this journal to write her stories in. The paper appears to be handmade, and is a courser version of watercolor paper, so it will be difficult to write on smoothly. But that isn't the reason for the poor review. The reason that I'm giving it one star is because there are only 42 pieces of paper (84 pages) which is LESS THAN HALF of what was advertised. If my daughter weren't so anxious to have it, I would return it immediately.

Not exactly sure why these are so highly rated (and I'm only giving it two stars, out of generosity), I mean they are decent pens, but I feel like these have some issues. Not sure if this was just my batch but I don't think I'll be buying these again. The issues started with the ink flow -- these things skip constantly during writing, now don't get me wrong these pens are very precise, but the ink flow is incredibly poor, if you are not holding them at the right angle or forcing the ink down yourself, it constantly skips, which in my opinion makes these just not worth buying. I have not used the Japanese version of this pen, but I have heard they are much better, if you need this pen, buy the Japanese version instead, you will be better off.

This seller or manufacturer contacted me after I gave them a negative review. They offered free replacement cartridges. They were trying to get me to remove the negative review. The toner ended up leaking all over my printer. I eventually replaced these extremely bad cartridges with HP and now my printer prints just fine.Be smart. Don't buy from this seller!

4 out of 5 cartridges worked (the magenta did not work at all) the ink level chip did not work at all in my HP Photosmart 7525. I called Amazon about the defective cartridge and they gave me a partial refund. (Best customer service in the world).  They best I could rate these cartridges were 2 stars because the ink chip not working was a big no no.

This is an update to my initial review. I received these toner cartridges in June 2022. The cartridges worked well for five months. Now the color toner leaks on every page printed. The printer is now out of service until I receive replacement cartridges. I do not recommend these cartridges now. I ordered new cartridges from a different seller.There is a reason the seller only guarantees their cartridges for 30 days.Original review:  This is my first order from this seller. I have been using these toner cartridges for almost a month. So far I am impressed with the print quality. My canon MF731cdw immediately recognized the cartridges. The printer is able to read the toner percentages. The price of these cartridges is much better than OEM.I plan to buy again from this seller.Based on my experience so far, I would recommend these cartridges.
Should’ve read the reviews. I feel like this is false advertising rather than accidental.

I purchased the Large, 30 Liter (Model 1108) Safe and was incredibly disappointed. First and foremost you will notice that it is incredibly heavy. 82 Lbs. My fault for not thoroughly reviewing specs before purchasing. After my initial shock at the weight I thought it would be ok since this is going to be on the floor in a closet anyway. Inspecting it further and playing around with the locking mechanisms is the another reason behind my disappointment. The gold/beige clips that hold the lid down are shockingly flimsy and felt like the would break immediately. As a result they are pretty much useless for securing/keeping the lid closed. The next issue was the locking mechanism: it felt cheap and flimsy, they keys barely worked (you had to carefully wiggle the key into the lock to get it to work, I was also afraid I would accidentally break it).Finally the last issue (and the main reason for buying such a safe): Hanging folders. The safe is ever so slightly narrower in the middle, there is a very fine and slight bulge (presumably due to the insulation) but it is just enough for the hanging folders to catch the side and get stuck/fall off the side 'rails'. The ultimate deal breaker was that once you have some hanging folders in the safe you cannot close the lid because there is not enough 'head room' in the lid of the safe. What a complete waste of time and money.Returning this awful product.

I really wanted to love this pen, but my complaints are similar to those of other reviewers. The ink leaks are ridiculous, especially when changing the cartridge (and yes I followed the instructions). I also cannot get it to write consistently; it will write beautifully for about five minutes, then skips for the rest of the page.

These cartridges are XL.  I guess I overlooked that point.  They do not fit our printer so I can't rate them other than they should be clearly marked XL, and what is remanufactured?  I missed that too.

Manual says chest must be opened for 30 min once a week or contents may be damaged by moisture. Not suitable for long-term storage unless you have no better things to do than to ventilate your chest weekly... Would work fine for frequently accessed things.Size is also incorrectly stated as other reviews mention - it does not fit letter size paper flat.You know it's not a good product when "do not return to store" is written all over.

I eagerly awaited this automatic sharpener after reading several positive buyer's reviews.  So far, I am not impressed.  I read the directions carefully so I wouldn't make mistakes.  I have been waiting to sharpen my new set of Prismacolor VeriThins.  They come totally unsharpened and I don't know if it's the VeriThins or the sharpener, but it did a horrible job.  I need them to have a very sharp, pointed tip so I set it to the third setting for just such results but not only did it sound like it was eating the pencil, the very sharp tip I wanted is on one side only. My manual sharpeners can't adequately sharpen the unsharpened VeriThins, so now I cannot use them though I need them for the work I'm doing.  Way too much aggravation. Also, not told in the advertisement for this sharpener, but mentioned in small print on the package once you get it, is the fact that it may ruin soft lead pencils which most artists and colorists have a lot of!  Buyer  Beware!

I wouldn't recommend. Cartridge worked fine for the first few print jobs, but then I started getting error messages on my computer saying there was a problem with the black ink and the cartridge was not supported (the one I had just replaced) and it refused to print. After taking it out and shoving it back it a few times it finally worked again. I guess you get what you pay for.  This is cheap so it's worth trying, from other reviews it seems like others had better luck. Personally I won't be buying this product again.
These do not work. They wouldn't write on the chalkboard at all. In fact, they scratched the chalkboard. Sorta wish I would have seen all of these reviews before I made the purchase.

I didn't read reviews of this item (HP 10A Black Original LaserJet Toner Cartridge / Condition New) before ordering (my mistake), but it's a toner cartridge (!). What could be simpler. right? After installing this NEW cartridge in my printer I was getting these big black streaks and ghosting repeats on my prints. I've never had that problem with my printer before. After digging around online to try to figure out the problem, I read the other reviews above. Apparently these cartridges have a shelf life of a few years, and then they start having the problem I described. My "new" cartridge seems to have been an OLD new cartridge, and should never have been sold to anyone. Returned!

Buyer Beware!  Have no idea what world the other reviewers live in but as a computer scientist working night and day, these do not measure up at all.  So much for great reviews.  Returning them ASAP.1. If your table is too low or legs big/long the screw clamp will bump you underneath.2. The top clamp literally sits on the top of the screw and will fall off if tipped.3. Once arm/wrist weight is on these supports they are VERY stiff/hard to move/swing.4. There is NO padding on the top of these arm rest cups.  NONE!5. The arm cup with NO padding are made of plastic and could break, crack or even chip at the corners.They look cheap, feel cheap act cheap and are cheap in cost. You end up fighting with them to get the mobility needed.I'm familiar with this arm rest and plan to buy them though they are way overpriced. I’m posting this review to let other customer’s know that they should not buy any ink cartridges from shoplet. I purchased a combo pack of Lexmark # 24 color ink on 11/17/15. BEWARE! FALSE CLAIM!This review is for the "Honeywell Safes & Door Locks - 30 Minute Fire Safe Waterproof Safe Chest with Carry Handle, Medium, 1103"The text on Amazon says that this box can hold letter-sized documents flat.It turns out that the "From the manufacturer" information is for a completely different product - the 1104, which is considerably larger, and could store letter-sized documents flat.The text on the box says that this box can hold letter-sized documents flat.There is ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for this lie being printed on the product's box though.A4 documents fit just fine, they are narrower than letter-sized documents.See the photo of me not being able to put a ream of letter-sized paper into the box.IT CANNOT HOLD LETTER-SIZED DOCUMENTS FLAT.DO NOT BUY THIS BOX TO HOLD LETTER-SIZED DOCUMENTS FLAT.For my purposes, this box is completely, totally, utterly useless.I returned it, reported this nonsense using the "Report incorrect product information" link, and posted this review.

I was fearing replacing my personal printer’s toner..... Editing my review.  After just over a month the cyan toner started giving pages a nice coverage of blue.  The problem is I was printing in black and white.  Other reviews after I submitted my glowing review also mentioned cyan toner issues.  I could not leave my review stating the product was so good after the cyan toner gave out so quickly.  ....I was right to be concerned in the beginning.

This was garbage. It didn’t come with the visor clips shown in the picture and the adhesive tape it came with won’t hold it to anything good enough to insert even a regular pencil in and out of it. Had to give it a star to submit a review
