I would give this 0 stars if possible.  I asked for and received this as a Christmas gift thinking it would be very useful for managing business-related expense receipts for my company.I spent over 6 hours trying to install the scanner and software to no avail and finally corrupting my Windows7 system in the process of multiple installs / deinstalls.  When I finally heard back from Neat tech support it turns out that the scanner will not work in a virtual pc environment NOR can you save the data to a network drive or network share.  While Neat tech support suggested I connect the scanner to the main system running the virtualization software and install the Neat software on that system, that approach completely negates the advertised integration with Quickbooks, Excel, etc. which in my case are running on a virtual pc. This deficiency is not mentioned on their web site or in any of their documentation.Finally, the software installation forces you to create a "NeatCloud" account to warehouse your scanned documents.  That is - by the way - a pay per use service after the 30-day trial.So unless you are looking for a solution only for a standalone pc stay away from this product.ALSO BE ADVISED THAT APPARENTLY THE SCANNERS FOR MAC AND PC ARE DIFFERENT SO YOU CANNOT MOVE IT IF YOU SWITCH PLATFORMS. At least that is what I was told by tech support.

14 out 20 pieces arrived broken = 70% and white is NOT "dustless", but colored is much less dusty. See my box opening photos! Details: After reading reviews, I decided to check the boxes when they arrived. Carefully poured them onto a black foam mat. The box opening results are: 4 white whole, 6 broken into 14 pieces: 11 about 1/2 + 3 very small pieces. Fairly dusty. 2 color whole, 8 broken into 16 pieces about 1/2. Some dust, much less than white. Whether broken from factory, shipping, Amazon warehouse, or UPS, I don't know. But should be better protected or better quality chalk.
Should have paid attention to other reviews. Arrived broken, gold plate off. Could not get glued back on with any kind of super glue. And could not get off the crap adhesive they used.

I had seen a lot of good reviews about LAMY products and was looking forward to writing with the Lamy Safari rollerball. I thought the grip would be good for my arthritic fingers. But it skips as I write: some letters heavy, some faint: a big mess. I ordered the medium point, maybe fine would be better, but I'm not going to order another one to find out. I'm better off with a grocery/drug store product.

The bottom line of any review is would you do it again? This is a 4 pack for a HP 277 laser jet. Three of the 4 cartridges have been used. I can't tell the difference in these and the OEMs. I do not buy for lowest price, I buy for value. I would buy them again.**********************************************************************************************************************************************************Was I wrong. Changing from 4 stars to 1 star. My HP 277 Laser jet puts out a supply status report. First a report summary then a quality review.  Black  Cyan  Magenta  YellowApprox pages of ink remaining  750  1950  3100  2000Number of pages printed  1862  1611  1424  1607Several hundred pages ago the printouts started to have small blue dots and splotches down the sides. Then they started down the middle. Then went away. Then the blue ink started to streak. The graphics and pictures are now terrible. Now all three colors are streaking. I would guesstimate that over half of a graphic or picture is not getting printed. Switching over to grayscale.
The ink is half evaporated, very old cartridges. Tried one and it was extremely thick, not good for my Waterman Opera. I am ordering a replacement, will update this review after I receive it.

I had high hopes for this pen set based on the positive reviews. Unfortunately, mine was not a good experience.  After the first 2 pens that I tried using were dried out, I did a quick test of the rest. Eight of the pens were dried out.  One had no ballpoint at all. Twenty others were close to dried up and will likely not work if I tried to use them for any length of time.  At the rate this is going, I can't use the set. It's just too frustrating to start drawing/writing and have the gel flow stop after a few seconds.  After removing all of the pens that didn't work, it was really depressing looking at the half empty pen case.  On the up side, the case is convenient and the pens are nicely organized.  I wouldn't buy this again nor recommend it.

I'm writing this review with ink stained hands from this awful created product.  They do not know how to seal the ink pad nor the refill hole appropriately.  When either the sticker or tab are removed, a stream of ink will pour out of the product.Buyer beware of this product.  Order elsewhere!  Cheaply made without any kind of QI!

DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT USE THIS INK!!!!!!! learn from my mistake. This is the first time I have purchased this ink and I have never had this problem with any other remanufactured ink! I put it in my printer and hit the ok for the no HP ink as usual. Then I started hearing these sputtering and splattering sounds I thought it sounded weird but was like ok.... then the printer touch screen says ink system failure... I open the printer to find ink splattered on the walls and back of the printer and a pool of ink where the cartridges usually slide to..... I’ve tried turning off and on several times and all I get is system failure!!! So now this $9 ink is probably going to cost me $100s in a new printer!!! Not good! I should have just stuck with inkjetsuperstore.com who I’ve used for YEARS without problems!!!!!!!!! While obviously from other reviewers this ink works for some it didn’t for me and I got burned big. Maybe mine was just faulty but it won’t happen again so beware!!!! Amazon was kind enough to refund my money but it won’t buy me a new printer.

I normally don't bother with reviews but if writing this review helps someone else then great.I've watched the Neat commercials for a very long time now and have always been skeptical of their claims.  I'm in need of a portable solution for receipts and business cards being that I travel nearly everyday.  I figured I'd take a chance and get lucky so I ordered the Neat Receipt for Mac.  I was a little surprised to see that both Mac and Windows software wasn't provided since the hardware should be the same.  Long story short...this product just doesn't work.  It scans ok but it will transpose numbers or totally miss it all together.  I had one receipt that was $1.87 and it read it as $1007.00.  It is of little use if every single entry has to be edited with the document type, amount and vendor name.  It was no more useful than taking a picture with my phone and submitting my expenses report that a way.To be fair...I did scanner without destroying the paper documents and the scan capture was fine but all the organizational claims are none existent.  You don't have to believe my review, just buy it, try it and you can return it like me.
DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. This is a waste of money. The body of the pen comes apart. Listen to the other reviews. This pen is useless. Stick with a cheap plastic pen instead.
Pretty clear stone delivered in a raggedy box. I'm ordering more because I give them away with my books. I would have gave 5 stars if they came in a nice gift box.

The whole bag was opened within a plastic bag.  I don't care about that so much as we have 24 pencils, 2 erasers BUT NO PENCIL SHARPENERS.  How can I get the pencil sharpeners?  If I get the pencil sharpeners, I'll update my rating but right no, order requirements were not met so not happy.

I just received this item today. I bought it for my son who games on a pc from his bed and would place the keyboard on his lap. As far as the intended use goes this does precisely what it was purchased for. That's enough to get 2 stars. The manufacturing quality of this item is absolutely terrible. The holes in the tubes have heavy burrs that will cut your fingers. The wood panels were riddled with chips along the edges. And the screws are not efficiently guided by the holes they pass through which significantly compromises strength and durability. I don't have high hopes for the longevity of this item. Buyer discretion is highly advised.

I bought these because of all of the positive reviews, but in my case that was a mistake. I can only comment on the replacement cartridges for the Epson XP-600 -- they're mostly useless. The large black cartridge works all right and, once installed and after clicking through all of the warnings about how they're not genuine Epson cartridges, the software recognizes all of them and shows the ink levels. However, the color cartridges do not print dependably. Different colors print at different times but never all at the same time. I followed the troubleshooting instructions, which say to clean the print heads 3 times (this, by the way, uses about half of the ink in a new cartridge) and waiting 24 hours, and the results were actually worse. I think the genuine Epson cartridges are vastly overpriced, but they do work, so I suppose I'll keep buying them. If it weren't that I need a printer that prints on CDs I'd probably buy a different brand, but I do so I'm stuck.

I bought this based on good reviews and my extreme poverty. The cartridge arrived quickly and seemed to fit the printer fine. Sadly, it printed only a few times before beginning to give error messages and blocking the queue. No toner is being released.  Even sadder, by the time I had fiddled with it long enough to give up, I had missed the return limit by days. Unpleasant experience.

I have never used nor purchased this unit, but really?!  The two previous reviews seem totally fake like they were paid for by the company.  I am highly suspicious as they were very vague in nature.  I'd simply like to know - as others would who are thinking of buying this I'm sure - how reliable is the video capability and from what distance??

I first rated this as a 5 star toner. I am updating this to a 1 star.I thought I would save money by going with a generic model instead of the Brothers model. I regret that choice. This thing produces lines through my pages, and make the whole page a weird chalking black color to it. I would NOT buy this again.Go with a Brothers model.

This geometry set is totally worthless to me.  As soon as I opened it up I knew that it was a mistake and this set isn't even good enough for kids.  I am now going to start from scratch and buy a good compass and protractor.  Sorry Mr. Pen but  this set is not good and I don't understand the positive reviews. :(Update: My expectations for this product were probably too high, and I am possibly at fault for not looking elsewhere.  Obviously, for the low price, one can't expect high quality equipment.

When it worked it was a 3 star product. Would not sharpen the pencils evenly. It stopped working after a few months. No wonder you can buy this product for under $20. I would rather put that money towards a better quality brand.

This may work on carpet, but it will not work on hard surfaces.  Extremely dangerous!  I tried on stained concrete floor (with anti-skid) and it will literally slide out from under you.  I'm convinced it moves even while not in use.....  I should have paid more attention to the reviews, that said said that slippage, was an issue!  The other problem with it, it will not lay flat.  The edges curl up.  If you flip every other day, it will lay flat.  I ordered another brand at the same time (for another desk).  The other one does move some, but not at all like this one.  The other brand also lays flat.

I never write reviews here, but I just had to for this one.  I really wanted this to be good.  I print a lot and while I read the reviews that it wasn't good, I had hoped maybe it'd work for me.  Literally the from the first time printing with it, the ink was faded, had lines in it, and smudged/made a mess on the page.  I used it for some of my "throw away" printing and it never improved, so I promptly ordered the real deal created by Canon for the documents I had to present to my client.  I am so disappointed.

I am very disappointed with this product. I ordered this after reading quite a few good reviews. I was happy at the time that I had picked a good replacement cartridge for my printer. I was wrong.The first thing I ran into was while opening the magenta cartridge to put it in the printer is that it leaked all over my hand. ( I now have pink fingers.) Then as I was about to put in the cartridge I noticed that the tab on the front was broken off. The cartridges can't be installed without the tabs. The second magenta went without incident. Then I moved on to the Cyan cartridges. I found that both of them had the tabs broken off. To make a long story short. I found broken tabs on one yellow and one small black cartridge also. I also ran into leaking ink with the large black cartridge.So in conclusion almost 50% of the ink I purchased is useless. My fingers are now stained black and pink. I am attaching pictures so you can see what I am talking about. I am returning the cartridges and I do not recommend them.

I've tried using three different types of dry erase markers on the folder and the writing smudges off without any pressure. So if I put a note on the outside of the folder, it just disappears after the folder is moved a couple times (without me trying to erase).  I gave it one star because it won't work for office work unless they can tell me what markerwill not "automatically" erase just by mere movement of the file folder. Otherwise, good product.

I am a big fan of Jatstream pens, and I am writing this review to say that this BLX line of Jetstream RT's do not live up to the good name that Jetstream has earned for its superior performance over the years. My main reason for this is at the core of what pens do - make lines. I was consistently disappointed with these pen's ability to pull consistent solid lines at any speed, slow or fast. Now, I use these for writing more than drawing straight lines, and I can say that I have stopped using them for the same reason - inconsistent ink to paper.(I actually took a Jetstream BLK RT and an original blue Jetstream RT side-by-side, and the blue was consistently MUCH more reliable than the BLK, and any speed and for any line.)I may have purchased a bad batch, but at this time I cannot recommend these Jetstreams to anyone, and I will stick to my classic Black and Blue Jetstream RTs (Which are great!)

Worked great for about 5 hours and looked beautiful.  Then it exploded.  Luckily I was able to blow all of the glass and plastic out of my projector and put the old bulb back in and it still worked.Several weeks after I sent the bulb back and still waiting for a refund.  Disappointing Service to go with the Disappointing Product.  Stay clear of ExclusivebulbsP.S. - Why do I have to give a star?

Check out the other 1 star reviews and decide if price is worth the inconvenience of no reliability.  My first set of cartriges worked fine.  This second set, the black ran out after 1 page.  WTF?  So yeah, the price is great but I've never had a official HP cartridge fail after one page.  I recommend you buy two so you aren't forced to go buy something last minute to finish your important print job.Edit 6/28/16 - I just got a print cartride error on the color cartride.  That has never happened before either.  I have tried replacing it, turning printer on / off and cleaning the electrical contacts.  Next step is to go buy a genuine HP cartridge.

Ahem, I read lots of review about fake Mont Blanc and I start wondering myself. So I bought this pen brand new from Amazon LLC, not from a third party, and yet it's still fake.It still say Made in Germany, and still missing the PIX inside the clip. Thought Amazon LLC does not sell fake pen, but I guess I was wrong. Time to return.

There were all these bad reviews about this thing not being able to hold a book. Fine, I thought. I don't need it to hold a book. I only need it to hold a piece of paper. It won't. It won't even stay put. Both the front and the back pieces slide down no matter what position you put them in, whether you have anything in it or not. I can't believe amazon even sells this junk.

I am sick of getting abused by printer companies who price as if they bled ink.  They sell it as if it were gold, in tiny amounts, and force you to keep coming back for more should one of the many itty bitty cartridges run low.  The short-lived print quality is nice, but once you look at the cost, you realize the retail price of the printer is less of a gimmick, and more of a bait and switch.  The Artisan 725 is engineered to prevent the use of external ink supplies, available at much reduced rates from third parties right here on Amazon.  I'm looking at my Epson 725, which I have not used for a couple of months now because I refuse to pay their extortionate ink prices and I don't have the time to shop resellers.  I will get around to it, but I am done with Epson ink, and done with Epson printers after this one.

I loved this item when I first got it but now it won't pick up pet hair or anything. IT'S LOST IT'S STICKINESS after about 6 mons. I tried to contact seller but got no reply, so I withdraw my good review and change it to "This product is CRAP".Previous review...No more using sticky sheets of paper. No more waste. This sticky roller works GREAT and rinses off GREAT too. Priced higher than I think it should be but what isn't now a days? Glad I got something to get the dog hair off my bench at the foot of my bed.

I was disappointed at the size of this journal. Its super small and for the price I dont think its worth it. I gave it away. I gave it a 2 star instead of a 1 because for the size it should of been around 2 bucks but the person I gave it to was happy so thats why the 2 star.

Product doesn’t work. As you use it, the tape reel comes out more and more. Item can’t be re turned either so you’re basically out of pocket for a def ective item that you can’t use. Highly disappointed and feel sca mmed into buying a product with a ofdly high rateing.

So i received the gun yesterday,  first reviewed the video (couple times) what a surprise was when i saw the needle attached to the gun. I removed it as it shows in video, and it was jammed or squished.  Also T shape strips all are slightly damaged broke or separeted. I regret buying  it abd return immediately

The only reason that I gave them 2 stars is because it was very hard to match the size eraser to the actual mechanical pencil based on the description.  The Zebra erasers wear down very fast and need to either be replaced or thrown out.  You can order them directly from Zebra, but for the $2.50 the vendor charged, Zebra charges 5 times that (of course you probably will get the correct ones), it's cheaper to buy a new pack of pencils.  The vendor was very good about refunding my money without returning the eraser, though there was a lot of back and forth on emails with questions about what was wrong with them.

We have three of these, and I use them on nearly a daily basis to file almost everything, from receipts to copies of important papers. The database software is easy to use and provides a backup functionality that every user should take advantage of on a regular basis. (I have needed to run restores a few times when my PC died in the middle of a session and the database ended up in an unusable state.)My biggest gripe is with the absolutely abysmal customer support provided by this product. One of my scanners has a fault. Each and every time I have reached out to them, I get back the same link to the same web page telling me how to clean the scanner. Even if I mention in the ticket that I ALREADY cleaned the scanner. The warranty for the scanner is not worth the paper it is written on (or the electrons you scanned it into). And many of the so-called "service plans" you get from vendors like Staples insist that you exercise the manufacturer warranty first.I like the product. If Neat EVER resolves my tickets with the broken scanner, I will happily upgrade my review to four stars. But since they don't honor their warranties, they get two.

Doubt these are genuine the Xerox imprint is not sharp like a genuine packaged xerox product. Nor is the configuration.The by pass key is used to block the sensor to allow the ink to load.Stay away from these I agree with the other reviewers I doubt that they are legit!

It is the wrong printhead and ink selection for the HP officejet Pro 8710This 8710 uses 952 carts not 951 as suppliedThe ink order from left to right is - Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, BlackThe printhead we got is - Magenta, Cyan, Yellow, BlackThe quality of the product is great, it is just misadvertized.Print quality is rated as low as we could not print.

I'm very disappointed with this product.... it's nothing more than stickers I could have easily made this at home on my own computer and printer. Trying to put them on it ripped some of the pages of my Bible...they won't last long cause their cheaply made and paying almost $25.00 not counting shipping... this wasn't worth it at all. The design and font are nice but I could have done this at home not what I expected at all. Like to give no stars but it won't let me. Their not waterproof they do tare and it is nothing more than a sticker they're not durable either cause some of the design came off just from me handling them and putting them on....only reason I didn't return them cause I didn't want to go through the hassle and I waited for long time for these only to be disappointed.

Ordered Name/Address directory for my day runner. Due to a current medical condition I found it difficult to keep track of all the doctors names, appointments and tests on my phone so I decided to give my planner a try. The directory consists of 12 tabs A-Z for $15 dollars with no additional pages, those have to be purchased separately.  A little expensive especially if 1 of the 12 tabs is defective.  It keeps hanging out sideways and I'm sure it just a matter of time before it gets stick when zipping planner closed. I tried to request a replacement but when I do it says it not eligible for a refund? How about a replacement, which it what I was hoping for? I would be happy to update this review if item is replaced. Thanks

The pen writes and feels super smooth until it reaches half of the refill quantity upon which it literally stops writing! I read few reviews where people mentioned this and thought it was fake but when this happened to me, I realised that it’s true and for some reason it stops working half way!

My first review gave a very positive rating. However, these have not worked in my printer. I do not use my printer very often and about the third time I tried to print something the cartridges would not work. Now my printer gives me an error message saying the cartridges are defective. Waste of money!
These just plain don't work. Even if you can get them to print the quality is horrible and they run out quickly. There is a reason they are so cheap and poorly rated.

I have used this brand of pens for years, as they work especially well for me, as a left handed writer. I had never gotten the blue-black, but it is a nice color. Since I purchased them, at least two of the pens have dried out or skipped (write one minute and not the next). For the price, I would think that these should work each and every time until the ink is gone!Update: I have revised my original rating to one star. As I try to use more of the pens from this order, they are dry straight out of the box. I guess I should have tried them all when they were delivered. I will never buy from this seller again.

My friend bought this for her small business and I've been helping her out.The concept of Neat is great: insta setup, scan your stuff and access it anywhere.The reality is: needs some work.1)SLOW!-it scans and the processes. I triedMulti-tasking by editing previous entries. Sorry! Can't do a thing while "processing"2) Custom fields? Nope There isn't even a website field. Huh? Multiple address fields? Nope.3) Tagging? Nope! What?! It would be so much faster finding stuff if I could search by "San Francisco" or "Office Suplies" or "Health" Or whatever you can think of.4) SLOW. Yeah maybe I said that.It does a decent job of sorting data intoAppropriate fields but you have to review each scan and check for errors.
The ink cartridge does not fit the Epson picturemate snap so had to send it back.  The other epson print packs work very well - 5 stars.
I got this ink for my cannon printer after reading the reviews...but I’m highly disappointed...all the pictures are coming out with a blueish hue...ughhh!

So far the picture has been pretty dim.  Installation was easy, product arrived in good condition and packaged well and included instructions.  There was no burning smell as stated on some reviews for similar low cost replacement option for the Epson 8350 projector. 2 star rating is only because the picture is just not as good by a wide margin compared to the original bulb.  I can barely watch during the day which was never a problem before.  I have to keep the lights off and watch at night and then the picture is just ok......3 stars in those conditions.  I'm going to double check if there is any alignment procedure I'm not aware of when installing the bulb.  The bulb unit went in so easy and there are only 2 screws....didn't seem like there was any option to make an adjustment forward or backward in positioning.  I will research this and update the rating if anything changes.  Total use is about 1.5 weeks and around 40 hours.  If no better results, I will either return or hold on to this one as a backup to use in between bulb replacements using an original from Epson.  The original bulb must really make the difference in the great picture we had.  I have owned the Epson 8350 for almost 2 years and the original bulb lasted 2,300 hours.  I use it as our day to day TV 100" diagonal picture:-)

Wish it could have been 5 stars, but it was missing the d-pad magnet. Incomplete. I should have read other reviews first. Clearly this is a common problem. Will return and not be ordering from them again.

Note:  This review is being written by the husband of "MomOfTwoBoys", who is currently sitting in a Yoga position, sipping a glass of white wine, and chanting oooom in an attempt to bring down her blood pressure.I would rate this pencil sharpener as two stars.  My wife says one star and only because "zero stars" is not an option.  My wife is not an overly critical person by nature but her contempt for this model sharpener has no bounds.  She can't get it to work.  She tries gently sticking in the pencil, she tries it forcefully, she tries twisting the pencil as she inserts it...nada, zilch, nothing.  For a while she found that unpluging the power adapter from the unit would cause the sharpner to spring into action, but sadly, no more.  My interactions with the device have been a little better.  I found that if I had a positive attitude when using it, I got better results.  I would say a few encouraging words and I could get one or two pencils sharpened before the thing would refuse to service me anymore.  But if I waited 10 or 20 minutes and came back with some more sweet words of kindness, I could tweak out another sharperning, but really, who has that kind of time.  Trying to get through a pack of 20 pencils for your kids' school supplies on a Sunday night can take the better part of the evening if my patience persists and meanwhile my wife is in the other word calling the machine names that I cannot repeat here.  So, no, I would not recommend this Swingline automatic pencil sharpner for its intended use.  Now, if have an itch to annoy your spouse who is typically an easy going person, then that's a different matter all together!
Top of marker kept falling off. Coloring of marker was faint, could barley see. I hate to leave bad reviews, but I want others to save their time and money.
These are not sticky notes! I read the reviews and someone said they were!

The media could not be loaded.                      Bought for a secret santa, hence 2 stars for value for money. However the print isn't finished properly, it's chipped and the actual sign isn't glued on straight. Shambles.

I read other reviews and this tape sounded good but I won't be buying more. This tape is easy to tear off, etc. but as far as holding power on cardboard boxes and bubble mailers, it's pitiful. I'm going back to either Scotch or the HD Duck brands. I get complaints from eBay buyers that the tape is peeling off after a couple of days in the mail. Not sure what the intended use is for this stuff, but it isn't for my use. So they call it mailing tape? What do they mean by that and what materials is this designed to hold?

While these labels (and numerous similar ones in other sizes) are very useful around the house, a design change in the last year or two has added a fatal flaw. Previously, the labels had an overprinted border so you could see where the label stopped and the background paper started. Now, probably;as a cost-cutting measure, the individual labels no longer have a printed border. As a result, it's very difficult to tell whether you're writing on the label or the background paper. I've wasted I don't know how many labels by going off the label and writing on the background. It helps to fold the label along the border edges  so you can see where the label stops, but even this doesn't always solve the problem. It's really too bad, because the older labels really deserved five stars, but without the printed border, the labels are much more difficult to use, imho. Also, Avery has by far the largest piece of the removable label business; the only alternatives I've found are from Staples.

I put the cartridge in and the Dell printer software told me it was not genuine, and would not print.  I'm adding a star because the computer and printer were both very old and it could have been a software issue.
First times leaking bottom....I try to find out the problem but nothing happened...1 star...btw...too difficult to choice correctly adapter size for me...0 star

I bought the HP "3 ink cartridge" in July 2020.  I did not need the magenta cartridge until October 2020 (I had previously used the cyan and yellow cartridges and they worked normally).  The product expiration date is 01/2022.  At first I could not get the cartridge to work at all, even after re-seating it numerous times.  I called Amazon customer support and was informed that their warranty is for 30 days, but that HP would cover the warranty.  I called HP customer support and was told that they do not warranty ink cartridges that are not sold by HP, and that Amazon is responsible.  I called back Amazon.  Of course when I re-seated the cartridge again while on the phone call, my printer 'recognized' it and I was able to print.  The color is not normal, but it is 'red'.  So at that point I dropped the issue with Amazon, who was nothing but helpful.  This review is to let you know that if you buy HP ink on Amazon and do not try ALL the cartridges within 30 days, and try to get satisfaction from HP, they will NOT cover the warranty even though it is a genuine HP product sold by Amazon.  I did end up buying, 1-day delivery, an 'off-brand' set of ink cartridges from Amazon (manufacturer: iKong) so that my printer would at least print (it will not print at all unless ALL the cartridges are full enough) while I was awaiting an outcome on the HP ink cartridge, which I could NOT get in 1-day.  Well, the iKong cartridges print in non-smeary, nice color and the 3 cartrige colors were about 1/3 of the price the HP cartridges were.  So guess what?  I will NEVER buy HP ink refil cartridges again, as they do NOT stand behind their product.
Two of three were unusable. Other reviewers shared similar problem, don't take the risk buy a better product.

Yellow cartridge worked fine for about a week, now the printer says it's damaged and it no longer works.  I followed the instructions that came with it, on what to do in such an event, but it did not help.  The price seemed too good to be true and apparently it is. UPDATE - they sent me replacement cartridges for free after just a few days, so great customer service, I'm giving them another star for that. Apparently the chips on the cartridges needed updating.  I'll update again once I see if they work properly. UPDATE 2 - These $18 cartridges have now cost me $350. To their credit, the company sent me a new set within a couple of days, but I needed to get some printing done immediately so I bought a proper OEM set of cartridges.  Within a few pages the Cyan started printing very streaky.  I have done all of the resets, cleanings and alignments several times but I think the ink from the Fuzoo cartridges clogged the print head.  The new print head is about $120.  A new printer is $129.  Of course the updated version of the exact same printer takes different ink cartridges, so I had to buy a set of those at $110.  So I spent $250 for the new printer and ink, plus $100 for the new OEM cartridges that are still brand new and full in the now useless printer. You could say I am not pleased with my experience. Since you can not give 0 stars, I will give the minimum 1 star, that's for their customer service.  Even though their ink clogs up and destroys your printer, they are very friendly and replace the ink quickly.  I now have 10 Fuzoo ink cartridges still completely full of clogging, streaky causing goodness.

I use this for calligraphy with Higgins Eternal ink.  Previous pads bought from art suppliers have always been fine.  This pad caused the ink to bleed rendering it useless.  I think it must have been stored in a damp place before being sent out.  I have returned it.  I would give it no stars bu seem unable to do that.  Also the paper was a yellow colour not ivory as described.

The agenda is wonderful, and is very well crafted. The pages are somewhat thick and the calendars have a friendly format. This smaller one is good because the larger ones are noticeably heavier and can be a pain to bring around in a bag. I bought it for my girlfriend keeping these in mind, because this is a complaint she had in the past with the larger ones.I leave two stars because you should get it directly from Lily Pulitzer. It's $17, and the Amazon price is not worth it honestly. I regret buying it through Amazon, but returning it would cost too much.

I have been using the neat receipts software and scanner combo for approximately two years now, and I just can't recommend it. The software is clumsy, and makes you wonder how this can be considered a productivity tool.The while you can scan at a reasonable pace (I have no issue with the scanner), the scanned receipts pile up in the cue (my computer is reasonably well resourced and reasonably new).The character recognition software is weak enough that vendors are rarely identified, total amounts are frequently incorrect, and dates are frequently wrong.While reviewing and correcting your receipts, it does not appear that you can always navigate where you need to go using the keyboard. Plus, when using the mouse, repeated clicks are required in most fields to gain focus for editing. The software appears to try to maintain your sort order (ok, a good thing), but when you are editing the field on which you are sorted, the row will move to its properly sorted order, and you all of the sudden find yourself viewing and editing a different receipt (not so good). Then, off you go searching for your original row so you can finish editing.Additionally, the database is PAINFULLY SLOW, the dollar Amount field is left justified (making it hard to visually scan), and the use of real estate on the screen is inefficient and there is simply not enough control over it. Plus, the smart comment feature? It simply is not.This product has been out for quite a while, and it seems to be going nowhere.I hate doing expenses enough as it is, and this product isn't helping.

Took a chance and purchased this toner based on reviews. My mistake was waiting until my real Samsung toner ran out to try these toner cartridges. Now it is past the return window date, and doesn't always  print. I have tried several workarounds (switching the chips, rebooting, shaking the toner cartridge) nothing has worked long term. It was the same with both cartridges. sometimes it prints fine, other times it doesn't. Either having the low toner light come on or the orange power light comes on.

Package arrived on time and in good condition.The problems started during the install of the software. I got an error message stating that two of my fonts were corrupt or missing. After about an hour of searching the web I was able to reinstall the fonts and proceed.Once I got through that, I plugged the usb cord into the computer to find that the scanner would not power on.After talking to tech support they determined that the scanner needed to be replaced. I was told that they would send me an email and I could fill out a form to get the replacement.The email was not / has not been sent so I am returning this item.Two stars because this has become a huge inconvenience. This review should not be reflected badly on the seller but instead on the manufacturer.
I actually really like the planner.  The reason I gave two stars is that it did not come with any of the stickers at all.  While a quality product, all listed should be included

Ordered this product based on reviews but reviewers obviously did not use with a large pencil.  Rotator ring will accept a .440"/ 11.2 mm pencil but pencil goes no further.  Cutting head is not large enough to sharpen these large pencils.  I ordered product for that specific pencil and it will not sharpen it.  Unit does a nice job sharpening regular pencils although I am not impressed with the build quality.  I would return unit but it is not worth the trouble involved.

This is the wrong product, it does not fit.  Am buying a new Brother printer and I will check the fit before returning it.  This is of course a very big nuisance, the box has a small label attached that indicates it is TN-450, there is nothing on the box.  This type of mistake deserves a negative star.

Had to throw item in the garbage can! When I tried to return the item I got something that said something like not eligible for returns. The dry erase part was scuffed and damaged at the bottom, the non dry erase side had a jagged rip across the top. Where the eraser and stuff goes was coming apart from the board itself and the middle part was coming apart too. Extremely dissatisfied with this item and even worse something that I couldn't return. Waste of money! I hate to even give it one star.
Would give zero stars if I could!! Not 12 pens as advertised, only 1 arrived!!

I should have read the reviews.  It wouldn't go through my inkjet printer either, which is a good HP printer.  This paper is way too thick for an inkjet.  I gave it 2 stars only because it's good paper otherwise and a good size.

Although this calendar appears to offer one page per day, Sunday is only 6 small lines and thus the Saturday page is truncated.  This does not work for infant feed/sleep scheduling or for a family or individual with a full schedule of activities.I give it only one star b/c the lay-out is such that the pages are smaller than they should be and as a result, there is not at all enough room to write down a day's worth of activities.Strongly suggest to avoid unless you can write what you need in  about 3 inches of space per item.

Bought this chair to go with an art table by the same company. The art table works fine enough, but the chair! GOOD LORD, I'VE SAT ON EXERCISE BALLS MORE STABLE THAN THIS THING! It has a mind of it's own! Most of the time when you sit on it, it will lower to the lowest setting, scaring the hell out of you. Other times, when you sit up from it, it will rise up to the highest setting. NEVER has this chair stayed on the adjustment setting I set it to. A CHAIR SHOULDN'T DO THIS!I didn't bother calling for support or "replacement parts" (since I read the other reviews stating it did nothing), Hell I won't even bother selling it. NO ONE deserves a chair this horrid. Not even my worst enemies. Do yourself a favor and go look at another chair.

To start out, I'm as planner addict, and have used planners for years once I was introduced to them in the Navy. I've always used Erin Condren and (my BIG ideas) Happy Planners and have LOVED them. I was tired of spending the money on the bug name brands, so I gave this Law of Attraction a try and am pretty disappointed, in all honest. This "planner" is half made up of self-help mantras and the other half is a poorly executed planner. After you wade through 20ish pages of this "self help and self growth" charts/quizes/whatever, you finally get to start your planner...the month layout starts on a Monday, which I wasnt used to with standard planners, so it's been a bit of a battle trying to remember that when filling out. Also, the days are broken down into lines of "hours" instead of a larger box so that you arent cemented with documenting everything you do at every hour.If you are looking for some kind of self help and self growth oddly thrown together planner, then this is for you.If you are ACTUALLY looking for a planner to keep track of things/remjnders/events etc, this is totally not for you.Star for being cute and stylish but the cover with the odd mantras feels childish.

I have been very happy with this case, but be warned...it is heavy! The case provides plenty of room to store important documents, hard drives, passports or anything else you want to protect. To me the weight is actually a good thing as it would be a pain for a crook to lug this thing out of our house. I took the advice of a few other reviewers and bought a desiccant pouch for moisture and I have not had any issues.Update: March 12, 2015I was very happy with this safe until today. I was having a problem getting the lock to disengage and when it finally did I felt something give and now the lock will not lock. I am very disappointed as I have not opened and closed the safe more than a dozen times. It sits in my closet. Unfortunately, I have had it too long to return so I am now stuck with a non-locking safe that hopefully will still work as a fire proof box.
Did not work … wouldn’t grip the heavy duty stapler which was kind of the point…..ended up using pliers  to twist and pull them out. Curious how Amazon is working reviews now !!

Bought this to use at work so I can stand at my desk. It took 3 people to adjust the height!  Each joint works independently so in order to get it level it takes umpteen steps. Desk looks more like an Imperial Walker from Star Wars. Not user friendly at all.

CEASED PRINTING AFTER JUST A FEW MONTHS - Print head was clogged just a few short months into the life of this printer.  I didn't know what the problem was though so I bought new XL cartridges thinking it needed new ink and of course it still would not print.  The 5690 printed very poor quality pages for a few months before never working again.  Unfortunately I bought this when it was 369 USD, whereas now I see them for 210 USD.  I used the cleaning feature to no avail and even hired a computer technician who told me it might be a loss!  Because of the hundreds of dollars already spent on this printer itself and on two sets of XL cartridges, am going to try the home cleaning kit as a last resort.  I can't believe it came highly rated in Consumer Reports, which is what prompted me to spend 369 on an inkjet printer in the first place.  Also, even in its short life when it was printing shoddy pages of text, it was VERY difficult to connect to any device via wi-fi and required turing the wi-fi off and on.  Even tech savvy visitors became so frustrated in trying to get the connection to work.  Terrible experience and such a great loss financially.

Decided to give this a try based off all the reviews. It arrived fairly quickly with the 1,000 staples. The stapler feel is nice. That is where the good stuff ends. The stapler couldnt get through 3-4 pieces of paper before each staple fell apart. I went through at least a hundred staples through the 3-4 pieces of paper. The original paper that I initially started with. The reviews I find hard to believe are anywhere near accurate or believable, based off the performance of this stapler. I did initiate a return and was ready to drop it off, however i was refunded and told to keep it. I really dont want it, because it doesnt work.

I have used the two black cartridges. I write books for my grandkids and print and bind a copy for each of 10 kids.The first cartridge is put in, ran for about half a book and then printed everything in light blue, possibly using my blue color cartridge to do so.  Since the books are printed in bookfold I had to hand feed almost an entire book on both sides of the paper to make up for the bad cartridge.  I replaced it with the other black cartridge and so far it seems to be doing fine.The odd thing is that i can hear the ink sloshing in the cartridge when i shake it, but it doesn't deliver.  i removed the tape and the cartridge worked for a little while and then just quit.So my review is going to be mixed.  I really need to find a good source of cheaper ink, and I trusted the reviews, but now I'm leery of buying this again and no, I would not recommend it to a friend.

Read the reviews and they said these were good, however they were not what I expected and poor quality. Even though I use them with students the brush collected more paint on it versus the object they are painting

not a single color is an accurate color to skin, i was very displeased by this all the comments and reviews listed them as amazing however i wouldn’t recommend if you are looking for a skin tone base

I made a mistake in ordering - and that was thinking all Pilot pens were the same nib width, and I picked the green one for the color. I ended up with a 3.8mm pen that is not for letter-writing at all, which is 100% my mistake and not a fault of the pen, but renders it useless to me.The ink flows well, but it tends to get blotchy, and the ink quality is low - it runs slightly, sinks through paper, and it only about 90% opaque. The pen has an excellent feel to it and the design is brilliant, but the low quality of the ink cartridges and the cheap feel of it doesn't impress me as much as it has apparently impressed other reviewers. The value for the money is lacking.

Are you kidding me? The lid weighs a ton (not the problem), but there is no handle, pull or finger holes for getting a grip on the lid in order to open it (the problem). God forbid the hydraulics fail upon closing, because the user's fingers would likely be pinched.The lock is cheap garbage, but I knew that from the reviews. Nobody seems to be emphasizing the lack of grip. I guess people are happy to find some kind of purchase on the thin ridge. Sure, it works--in the same way that my kitchen cupboards and cabinets and drawers would work without knobs. They would work in a pinch (perhaps quite literally). I expect more from my designers.

The dispenser is horrible,  There are absolutely no instructions on the package, so I thought that I had to pull out the tape a little to get to the white part.  BIG MISTAKE.  I then had a big loop of clear tape that would not retract into the dispenser.  After watching multiple Youtube videos (for a stupid $2.77 product) I learned how to fix it.  I had to take it completely apart and reassemble it and I did get it to work properly eventually, after multiple tries.  IT SHOULD NOT BE THIS DIFFICULT.  Terrible design, non-existant instructions, waste of time. The only reason that I gave it two stars was that eventually I got it to work, but I dio not recommend it and I will never buy it again.

Update: After this cheap ink clogged up my Canon iP100 printer, I tried everything but there was only one fix that actually worked.  I removed the cartridges and print head, and soaked the print head in cups alternating with Windex (or ammonia) and Reverse Osmosis (or distilled) water.  I soaked it for a few hours until all the ink was out of the print head.  I removed the thin cleaning pads on the right side of the printer using a long-nose plier similar to a tweezer, and also soaked and cleaned those of the all the goo.  I cleaned that area of the printer using Windex and Q-tips.  I don't know if I harmed the printer by doing this, but at least now it works.  I thought maybe I'd have to throw away the printer, before this fix.  I will never buy these junk refills again, I'll stick with the genuine Canon cartridges.Original review:Update: after the LD cartridge printed with the wrong ink level, I can't get the nozzle unclogged on my IP100 printer no matter what I try with the utilities.  I think this LD cartridge messed up my print head.I bought a pack of these cartridges because of the good price, but now I'm going back to Canon genuine ink.  The Canon ink level indicator shows that I have about 25% of ink remaining in the color LD tank, but it's printing awful gaps.  The color ink has run out prematurely.  LD needs to take this product back to the labs before they can claim it's compatible.

The media could not be loaded.                      Small size works well easy to use and light weight but it did not last me but six months next thing I know my floor is getting wet one of the hoses actually the drain hose started to leak inside the machine I contacted the seller they were very quick responding however the ultimate fix was definitely not what I was expecting so they had me take the  cover off on the back and take a picture of where it was leaking they’re sending me a hose and they want me to cut the old one off and glue the new one on what kind of garbage is that? Am on my third one from Epson and still having problems.  Using genuine ink we have had a variety of problems in our small business.  The concept is good but the printer itself just hasn't delivered.  I'm not that picky but this thing can't function as good as a $50 throw away printer.Update 3.21.16 my review to Epson:Everything works great except the printing. (This is a printer after all) . Wifi, Lan, ADF, Scan to email, all wonderful. This printer was first purchased when it was new technology. (Oct 2014)  We use this printer in a small business environment but we are on our 4th replacement from Epson and now Epson refuses to work with us.  Out of warranty.  My main complaint is misaligned text and lines through text. This has been a common theme with this printer.  I've run countless nozzle cleanings and alignments but to no avail.  I use genuine Epson ink and staples general printer paper.  So there is no mystery there.  The printer is in a closed office with two office managers and a controlled climate.  Ie constant temperatures and minimal air particulates.  I like to think I'm not that picky but I firmly believe that hard to read text is an issue, so is smearing and random splotches of color.  I have used Epson products for years and still have an epson printer at home that works just great but this 5690 series for us has really left a bad tasted in my mouth.  Service recently told me that I can buy a new printer at a reduced rate (loyalty program)  Why would I want another epson when the one I have doesn't work? Probably going to try out a canon or xerox multifunction. Hopefully the epson projector I just bought works better.

This may be more a review of Amazon's business practice issues than the scanner, but I wanted to bring it up.I received the item in a box with ZERO packing material around it, as usual from Amazon, in a box several times larger than the box the item was in.  This made me cringe, since this was an electronic device and probably should not be crashed around in a box during transit.  I had paid $12 for two-day shipping and got the poor packaging for my money. (Absolutely no items I have ordered from Amazon have ever get packed properly for their nature, as in breakable items are always just thrown in the box.)My fears came true.  The scanner was completely non-functional.  There is seemingly a power light, this never came on when plugged in, if that is the function of that part (I cannot find any information about that on their web site).  My computer eventually did recognize the existence of the scanner, but the scanner itself was totally unresponsive.  No power light, no "grabbing" of the inserted paper (I was even using the "calibration paper" they included with the scanner), and the scan button was not clickable on the scanner or in the software program.  After uninstalling and reinstalling the software and trying multiple other USB ports, I was once able to click on the 'scan' button on the program, but got a message that the scanner was unable to scan and then the option to do so again was greyed out again.At first, I downloaded the update, then uninstalled that and put the original software back on but there was no change.  I suspect that this particular scanner was returned to Amazon.com by someone else because it was broken, and then it was sent to me; the software disc was opened and the CD sleeve was torn and wrinkled.Do note that the software that comes with the scanner is from 2008, and you have to go download the newer version (only if you know if your computer is 32 bit or 64 bit), and then *that* software uninstalls everything you just spent 15 minutes installing.I have requested a replacement, as I really need this item's features to manage an immense mountain of receipts, but am not terrible hopeful that the outcome will be different with the second one unless Amazon bothers to pack their items properly for once.  As for the scanner itself, I will have to come back and add to this review if the next one they send me actually works.EDIT:  The second one arrived within one day of my asking for an exchange, though Amazon charged me for shipping on the second scanner even though it was their error.  It did come with one sheet of bubble wrap laid over top of the scanner, woo.The second one seems to work properly.  It does not obtain all of the information off of many receipts; it hardly ever gets the name of the business or the sales tax.  You will have to type these in yourself.  The software is not very organized in that the ability to create categories is limited to the pre-defined ones in the program and duplicate categories are easy to make if you try to define your own sub-categories.  As an example "Personal Expenses" is one of the three choices, and you have to put all personal expenses under that heading and still try to separate them somehow.  Not terribly intuitive or helpful.  I have not yet tried to export to Quicken, but will as soon as possible.

I normally dont write reviews but feel this is warranted. I bought this as a cheaper replacement for the OEM replacement toner after reading all the reviews. My initial reaction was that even new, it was not as crisp as the original toner. After 6 months of use and maybe 300 copies it is out of toner while the quality of the print went down as well. This toner is being replaced with factory Samsung toner.

I consider myself a very informed consumer especially on fountain pens. I enjoy them very much but something about spending 50$+ on a pen always requires a lot of mental brainwashing with positive reviews/feedback to get me to buy a $$$ pen. I often make this comparison, I can buy a Table saw... or a fountain pen! Yes they are indeed instruments of luxury and I am as frugal as it gets so it makes a bitter standstill sometimes. However if you are like me and read even a little into fountain pens you will find Pilot pens to be dripping in positivity. Their metropolitan,74, Falcon, ect. The list goes on. I have used every one and let me tell you none (including this one) have done anything for me.The pen itself is well build and it gives thick durable feel to it, something you know would withstand a drop. It weighs 22.36g with a CON-70 converter in it half full. Which to reference is less than a metropolitan (27.28g). If you are someone who likes huge, thick, heavy pens this one is right on the acceptable line. It's a standard thickness in the hand for a pen. Overall this pen is an okay looking pen, I personally believe the saying "beauty is in the eye of the beholder" to be untrue as almost everyone can tell you what is nice looking and what is not. By that standard I can say I think you will find this pen to not be very eventful looking. The cap is a screw on/off which I enjoy very much as it adds a level of security to potential splashes from drops and or just general lugging around. The nib is silver not the gold tint that you see here. Don't Panic! it's gold. If you look at the nib it will say 14k. The build quality is the only reason for the 2 stars.Writing is what you would expect from a Pilot Pen. Awful, inconsistent, Skippy at best. The pen will write very good so long as you only write down. So if your name is ilililil you're in good shape, my name however is nick and when wrote with this pen it comes out as "l l i c l". A majority of the days this pen choose to write dry (that's what I wanted) however during this time your pen will often bottom out and not lay down any ink and skip. Other days it will chose to write like a wet medium which makes your handwriting look like a gorilla wrote it, thick and bumpy. The nib is as springy as you would expect from a gold nibbed pen but that really is about it. The reason I was so persistent on pilots was because positive reviews and the statement that eastern pens supposedly have finer nibs. This is partially true, outside of some German pens most fines are about all the same. My Parker and Lamy write just as fine as this. So the allure to stick to eastern pens just because of a finer fine is so negligible.What I don't understand is the ?fan base? of pilot pens. Doing deeper reading on this pen you will find it's inconsistency to be a not so much a problem but a guarantee. The fountain pen community is a very tight-knit community and most well seasoned fountain pen owners DO NOT recommend this pen or the 92 for the same reasons above. However there is always a group of people that love their pilot pens. There is a story of a guy who got a pilot 92 that didn't work day 1. He sent it in to pilot for repair and after 3 send backs to pilot later to get it fixed and 4 months of down time it still came back still inconsistent, the guy was bummed but still LOVED his junk pen. All in all after getting burned by multiple pilot pens at varying price points I can say for certain I will never buy a Pilot again, the proof is in the writing.Buy a Lamy 2000, now that is a thing to behold.

The toners worked initially, but after using them for a bit (you can see how much toner is left in each in the photos above) they started to streak and produce weaker colors than other toners I've used before.  I'm hopeful this is just a bad lot of them as the cyan toner seems to be working okay at present (but was the most recently replaced).  However, at present, I can't recommend this product.UPDATE:The company worked with me and sent me replacement toners for this issue.  I've installed them and they are working well.  I'm updating my score to a 2 due to the customer service.In addition, I'll update this review after a few months of usage if the new toners end up working out.

The older ones lasted so much longer than these new much cheaper ones. Time to move away from another has been company.

I've bought several of these bins. However this last one looks used. Fingerprints everywhere and looks like it was wiped with something that left a hazy glaze. There's even scratches on the second pic. Idk what the hell is going on. Still works but damn at least sell it at a cheaper rate.

UPDATE FROM RECENT PURCHASE (1 June 2013):So, I initially bought one of these bulbs in 2012 for my Epson Home Cinema 8500UB, and it was amazing -- great color for a fraction of the price, and I gave it a 5 star rating. The bulb lasted about 1400 hours before it became dimmer and dimmer, and fearing that it was going to go out, I decided to buy two more of them.And something has clearly changed within the last year, because both of these bulbs were made differently. They were difficult to fit in the projector, to the point where -- for each of them -- I had to remove a screw to keep both of them in.And, more disturbingly, the brightness was HORRIBLE out of the box. Worse yet, when an image went from dark to light, you could watch the bulb change -- almost as if it couldn't handle the changes in dynamic brightness. I was really concerned that my projector was broken, but before looking at a repair that was a few hundred dollars, on a lark I decided to order a genuine Epson bulb for $299 from their site.Not only did it fit right in, but the bulb is AMAZINGLY bright than either of the new ones were. No more generic bulbs for me.
Broke after 1 yearThe seller is welcome to contact me and make it right.  Until then, the review stays up.

I bought these after reading several reviews like the one I'm about to write. Basically they initially worked and then after two or three printing jobs (no more than 20 pages) my printer indicated one of my cartridges was faulty. After troubleshooting the problem I gave up and ordered HP print cartridges. They are more money but they work flawlessly and last. Do yourself a favor and buy a brand name cartridge. Pen was ordered as a replacement for one I lost. I ordered what I believed was a  NEW item. When I pulled the nib out to put in a refill, ink was found all over the inside of the pen.update.... I found the issue to be that the moron who put the cartridge inside the pen, put it in backwards. This caused the cartridge to be damaged/opened and leaked all over the inside of the pen. I really wish I had read the reviews prior to ordering this item....It's lovely once you get it together but getting it together is really difficult without instructions, not even sure what we did was correct but it seems to be holding together, so far.Also, I'm sure people of all ages would use this item, however, we were wondering what an elderly person would do if they ordered this item since what we ended up doing to get it together took 3 people in the office pulling, tugging, & sqeezing. We wondered what someone living alone would have done to put this together.I'm going to write to the company to suggest - simple easy to explain instructions should be included. I would give this 0 stars for if it was allowed. I tried to peel the protective sheet off the sign and it peels off half the adhesive and then half the plastic sheet was stuck. I then tried to peel the numbers off m, and they were not cut thru so I needed sissors to cut them off. Terrible product.

Where have the NEON ORANGE Avery dots gone?  I should have scrolled through more of the reviews (dating back to 2015) to notice that others have mentioned these are NOT neon. I need the neon orange dots. Not neon red, not neon green --- NEON ORANGE. Color is not acceptable, product functions as it should though.

We bought this printer last summer when we wanted to upgrade to a wireless printer. We selected this model because it had good reviews and had multiple color cartridges and would more efficiently use ink. This printer does many things well. It prints well over wireless.  It prints pictures wonderfully.  BUT even set on the thick paper setting, it is an effort in frustration to print on cardstock. (And sadly, I need to do this often!)This morning, I  spent over an hour trying to print 12 copies on cardstock.  Even putting in one piece of paper at a time, I had to reload it 8 times due to error messages indicating the paper was loaded improperly and it jammed 3 times.  I still only have 7 of the copies I need.So, if you are a teacher trying to print items for your classroom on more durable paper OR if you want to print your own greeting cards on cardstock, this is NOT the printer for you.

O stars if possible.  Installed black cartridge in a HP C6150 and got a "Black Cartridge is Damaged" error and will not print.  You get what you pay for.  I gambled and lost.  A new OEM HP cartridge works fine.

I advised the seller of this on October 16, asking if they would replace the defective cartridge.  Having heard nothing from the seller, this is a follow-up review. This product states on the packaging as well as on the Amazon listing that it will wash off of paint.  The Amazon description cautions against A) leaving the pen markings on the hood of a car in direct sunlight for a long period of time, and B) using the pen on damaged paint.  I didn't do either of these things, and it STAINED MY WHITE CAR PAINT.  I ran a "test strip" with the red colored pen along the hood of my car, about 6" long, and left it for several minutes to dry. I came back to "wipe clean," and it stained my car!  I've only had this car for six months and I AM LIVID that this paint pen STAINED MY NEW CAR.  I wish I had seen the reviews where people complain of this issue, and I wouldn't have bought this product.  I'm glad I only applied a 6" test strip, but after wiping repeatedly with bleach, there is no change at all and you can see a stain from the pen on my car.  LIVID!!!  Do not purchase!!!

I have to say I am quite disappointed in these pens. I read the reviews about how smooth they are and the colors looked beautiful. I really do like the metallic pens and the colors from the Glitter pens. The neon and pastel pens were not as smooth to write with and the colors skipped. I have had this safe for a few months, rarely ever open it and the lock broke so now I can't get the key out.  I read the reviews and heard what people were saying about the lock but chose to purchase it anyway.  The lock really is pitiful. According to Amazon I can't return it so I guess I will donate it and rent a safe deposit box for important documents.  If I still had my boat I could use this as an extra anchor.
I wouldn't pay more than $2 for this item. It's like balsam wood which I paid $13 for. At $2 it would get a 5-star for quality-price paid.

My 11 year old son has had this binder for less than 3 months. The zipper on the front pocket is broken and now the entire pocket is ripping off the front. I replaced the base plate on my office chair with this and for all intents it looks and feels really similar, but after sitting on it for two days the front of the chair now slopes forward slightly and it keeps triggering the air canister to send the chair to its maximum height (and to RELEASE it!). So when I stand up, the chair goes all the way up like I'm triggering the lever on the side, and when I sit down the chair goes all the way down as if it's being released.This is ridiculous. I replaced the old one because it was extremely creaky after 5 years of use and day one, this seemed perfect. Now it's ALSO slightly creaky and it's doing this silly nonsense with the air canister, at this point I'd rather just buy a new chair.Two stars because it technically does/did fit and screw in properly, it's just functionally useless aside from that!---------------------------------------------------------------------------Update, dropped it to one star because it actually fits SO POORLY that it bent a heavy duty gas canister out of shape. That mechanism it kept triggering because it was ill-fit? Yeah, it actually was pressing down on the top at a bad angle and every time it "dropped me" because the mechanism was perpetually triggered, it dropped me onto the thin stem of the gas canister and over the last couple weeks it slowly bent forward until the whole front of the chair drooped downward.Of course it's well past the return window, so, I'm just out that money. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!

I have already written a review of this product. Could have been made of foil - came bent - nothing like the description. Both will be returned. Remove this product.

I bought two toner cartridges based on the good reviews. One review suggested to buy 2 in case one does not work and this was the only one mentioned toner not working. Very sadly both did not work for me. I was too trusting about the reviews so I didn't try the toner right away when received. Therefore, I can't return or replace them because the seller only provided 30 day return policy. Luckily I found on Youtube how to refill the TN450. I followed the refill instruction and dumped the black powder from the non-working OEM one and filled the Brother one. It worked!! So I don't need to throw away the un-compatible ones. It is also cheaper to buy the "powder" and re-fill by myself.

Just to clarify, I want to say that I did not mean to buy these pens. I meant to buy GELocity, not VELocity. Which was a mistake on my part, not anyone elses. But since I did buy these pens, I needed to post this review. The pens that I got did NOT have good ink flow. The end of the tip gobs up and ink gets everywhere, and your writing looks awful because of it. If you're looking for an AMAZING pen, however, use the gel ones. The gel ones are incredible.

I rarely find myself dissatisfied after purchasing items that have generally high ratings and positive reviews. This particular tape - of all things - had to be the exception to that norm.My ask of sticky tapes is simple - hold brown corrugated paper boxes together, be easy to apply, easy to tear. The last of these is generally an issue with other packing tapes - you need a pair of scissors or a knife to cleanly cut the tape off. This tape, without any doubt, makes it very easy to hand-tear when you are done.However, I also expect a sticky tape to actually stick. The material used here is much thicker than regular tapes, and if you don't stick it back onto itself (i.e. going all around the box), the edges start curling up and coming loose after a few days. I used this tape, for example, to stick some labels on to cleaning fluid spray bottles, and all of them have come off after a few months.I went back to the basic Scotch disposable dispenser with packing tape -  http://amzn.com/B003W0P2SA - and love it. The cutter right on the dispenser makes it easy to cut, I'd say even easier than hand-tearing the tape, and these simple tapes stick better.

These are very poor and do not write with crisp thick colours but are rather see-through. As you would expect if you were using a normal felt tip on the board. I needed to replace a leather office chair that I've had for 8 years and is so worn down that the leather has cracked and the piston for the height adjustment is finally breaking down. I thought this chair would be a great replacement. I was mistaken. I'm built and weigh 200 lbs and after using this chair for two weeks the seat frame delaminated from where the receptacles for the screw was mounted and 3 days later the rights arm thoroughly split from where it was mounted to the seat. The chair is rated at 250 lbs so I was very disappointed. To top it off, the seat wasn't very comfortable. The only thing I liked about the chair was the mesh back, like lying on a hammock. It's a pity, really. Last time I buy a cheap office chair.

We purchased the neat Scanner 15 months ago and have really liked how it helped to organize all of our business receipts. heck, we even talked a friend of ours into buying one.  Then after about a year, all the problems started. It became very difficult to import/export old files, would only scan 1 receipt at a time, many issues with the files and folders and finally unreadable scans. When I called customer service, (and I say that GENEROUSLY) the first time I was told to delete a QSP file to get it to scan more than one receipt at a time which worked but then the images were so bad that you cant read them. So I called them again and got a woman who had me calibrate, calibrate, plug, unplug, etc. (she was so pressed to get me off the phone that I actually mentioned it to her) and I still got no results, just a promise that someone would get back with me after I emailed her an image of a poor quality receipt so they could determine what the problem was. Cricket....cricket....cricket.....cricket.....In the meantime I ordered more cleaning sheets and calibration papers,  and calibrated and cleaned with still no change. It was 4 days and no phone call or email, so I called again. This time I spoke with another woman who had me take another scan and when I told her it was still hard to read, she said that she was "determining at this time that your scanner is defective" and more or less let me know that I would not be receiving any more help. Of course after reading all the reviews, which I wish I would have read before I bought it, and having my own experience with 'customer service' I was not surprised at the rudeness of this girl. However, I was given the offer to buy a new one for $100.00 less, ($299.99). When I asked her if she was aware of the reviews that say that this product does not last much more than 12-18 months she says 'well some customers get two years'. WOW!!!! So I guess if you want to buy a new scanner every 1-2 years at 400.00 a pop, then this is the scanner for you. As for me, I'm looking elsewhere. For all those who give this 5 stars, please let us know how you like it after 12-18 months. Anyone looking to buy this for the first time, save yourself some money and trouble, don't buy it. #regretful  #wishIwouldn'thaveboughtit  #wasteofmoney

I would return this if the delivery box wasn't so big. I regret not listening to the reviews before buying.Cons:-Assembly instructions are unclear (not every detailed).-Unstable design. (the wheels are held in place by pins, cheap thin metal cage that wobbles)-Can get a better one at Costco for a cheaper price.I hope this cart will last me at least one year.Don't buy this unless it's dirt cheap. Around $10ish, which is what it's worth.
Arrive in damaged package and with damage to the corner just like the other reviews. Don't order!

when I received it. Opened up the box today (6 months later) to find only 1 cartridge along with a returned merchandise label! This is the first time this has happened, hope it's the last! I will give 4 stars for past orders that had no problems. They have been good inexpensive compatible cartridges.

I had this box for 8 months. Put all my documents in it and didn’t think about it for a while. 8 months later I opened it and my passport was moldy and birth certificate showed discoloration consistent with water damage.After reading reviews, apparently in the manual it says you have to open it once a week for 30 minutes or more to keep humidity consistent. How impractical. Wish I’d known this before my documents got ruined. Definitely would not recommend.It’s also VERY heavy so grabbing this in a pinch as you’re running out of the house is very impractical as well.

The ink ISN'T XL, IS NO'T XL. It's a regular size. The cartridge says it is XL, but IT'S A LIE. This cartridge is much smaller than my real black ink XL. Also, my package "WAS DELIVERED OPENED" without the protective tape. I'm very angry because they stolen my money. I want my money back.I give it one star because I can't give less.

Hate to give products a 1 Star but feel shoppers should know. The tape itself is good. However the dispenser it comes with is very difficult to use and struggles to rip the tape. Kind of disappointed since I tried purchasing a quality product

To start I gave this item two stars only because the over all style, the size and the color of the stain are exactly what I was looking for. However the execution of it was terrible. As soon as I saw it I immediately bought it because it was exactly what I was looking for and I thought it was adorable. I couldn’t wait for it to arrive and it came early, even better! So I thought, until I opened the box. As soon as I lifted it out of the box the bubble wrap bag drooped as if something was weighing down (very thin bubble wrap bag at that). The item weighing it down was the broken drawer front of one of the center drawers. Split clean just under the handle, the drawer front didn’t just come off the sides it snapped 9/10s of the way down, shown in my pictures. Immediately after that I noticed the texture of the wood is very rough, it doesn’t seem sanded down nearly enough, to the point where in some places I was worried about getting a splinter. Looking at it further I found visible nail holes on every side from where it was nailed together, something that could’ve easily be hidden with a little wood filler and a little sanding. There are dents and dings in multiple places but that kind of adds to the charm so whatever. Then I looked inside one of the intact drawers and there is an exposed nail that could easily cut your finger open you weren’t paying attention. If this item had been an absolute bargain I would’ve over looked some of these issues and simply asked for a replacement for the broken drawer, but considering I spent $70 I’m very disappointed. And to add a cherry on top, based on other reviews, I don’t feel confident I would get an adequate piece in replacement! Overall I do not recommend this piece from this company AT ALL!! Spend your money more wisely somewhere else.

I purchased this product and from the very start, the scans were virtually unreadable. If it were possible to give it less than one star, I would have. I repeatedly calibrated the device with no improvement. I called their customer service number for assistance and got a voice message to visit their website for assistance, either open a customer service ticket or speak with a representative in "live chat." No where on their website was an option for live chat. After submitting two tickets, each with attached images of the scan quality, I then went on to look for information on how I could modify brightness and contrast, hoping this would help. The manuals (not included, but on-line) indicated a tool option that should appear at the bottom right corner of the scan image. I could find no such option there or in the menu options. It's been two days and no word from Neat. I have run, crisp, clear, wrinkle-free receipts through this repeatedly after calibration and tried every possible setting before hand in hopes of a better scan with no luck. This is a piece of junk and I've never been sorrier to buy a product. The IRS would never accept these receipt "scans" (and I use the term loosely) as documented proof of expenses. Meanwhile, I spent the same amount of time the following day (that I did the day I set it up and tried to resolve the scan quality issue) entering 6 months of receipts by hand in a simple profit and loss spread sheet I customized in Excel and hand enter my purchases, keeping the hard receipts for my backup. This ultimately ended up being faster, easier and cheaper. Don't waste your time, desk space or money.

We had to return both in original packaging by FedX Freight which ran us roughly $20 each box ($40).
