I have purchased re-manufactured ink toner cartridges many times in the past with no problems.  I print a few pages regularly - anywhere from maybe 10 to 30 pages a week.  I used this item regularly - and it seems to have stopped working even though my printer showed that my black ink cartridge was over 1/2 full.  It was printing so poorly that I couldn't even read the pages (it was very light and spotty).  I took it out and replaced it, did all the trouble shooting the printer offered, and tried it again - and it still didn't work.  (It also still read as being over 1/2 full - my printer always gives warnings when the ink is running low - and it was not low with this cartridge).  Besides not getting what I paid for, I also wasted a lot of time and  paper in the process of trying to get it to work.  The color ink seems to be okay so far.  I don't believe it dried up from not being used, as I do print on a regular basis - and the color ink still works (I print with both color and black regularly).This has soured me from buying re-manufactured in toner.  I really want to do what is best for the environment and, of course, save $$ - but I can't justify only getting 1/2 the printing when I am paying for the XL.  The problem was definitely not my printer - as i went out and bought the HP brand and now it's printing perfectly.  The only reason I am not giving one star is because it did print fine for a little while.

This stapler rates a zero star review. If you attempt to staple papers together while holding it, the staple will not close. If, you staple by putting it on a desk top and hit it hard, it will close the staple, but not tight. Basically, you might as well put the staple in by hand and not use this HUNK O' JUNK.

This is not a review, this is a complain. I did not find a place to write a complain about this so I am writing it here.I've received a pack with 2018 forms instead of 2019, did not notice it and filed on the wrong form. Now I am having a headache because I have to file it all over again in the right form and give it to my employees again. I think I should have my money back at least.Thank you for your attention.

The scanner is OK but the software is garbage on so many levels.  You can find free, generic scanning software that is more reliable and much less hassle.First of all, you must create an account with them to even get the software that you need, for the product you just paid $100+ for.During the install process (version 5.5), you have to sign up for their awful cloud service, which btw can take sometime 4-5 hours for your uploads to appear, and must fill out a questionnaire and provide your phone number.  This is just to INSTALL the software.  If you don't want to try their cloud service then you cannot complete installation.  You have NO choice.If you used a previous version, your receipts will NOT carry over.You used to be able to scan to PDF with just a button click on the scanner but now you have to use their software.If you have an "older" scanner then you cannot rely on 5.X version working properly even with their driver fix.ORJust search for "free scanner software" and you'll get a product that isn't slow, requires a login, forces use of a cloud service, and is free of charge.  Your best bet is to avoid Neat and just find a scanner with good reviews and avoid this company's headaches.

I really wanted to like this. It was well packaged. I put it on my desk after I assembled it and one of the legs was slightly up in the air so it was off balance and kept shaking. I am returning this item but will order another one to see if this was just one defective item and update the review.
I would have given 5 stars, but I ordered a pretty floral planner and I got a plan blue planner 👎

Never thought I'd write a detailed review for a flipping stapler, but it's really pretty awful.  For an office stapler that should simply stable, it barely suffices.  Inconsistent binding of papers even just 5 or 6 sheets thick.  Operates with difficulty/requires more force than a halfway decent stapler.  Jams more frequently too.  Brand new, using the staples that came with it.Amazon needs to throw this design in the trash, or reconsider their manufacturer because something isn't right.

This tape is so thin as to almost be unmanageable and I am using the tool that has cutter and holds roll in place.  Can't imagine trying to handle manually.  When tape comes off role I invariably have to throw half away because it folds onto itself.  Haven't even made it through first role, but am giving up on this product, buying different tape and writing this review.

I bought these inks in spite of the reviews because the main complaint seemed to be drying out with infrequent use.  I use a lot of ink so assumed that it would not be an issue for me.  Wrong!  I used the first lot within 2-3 weeks of purchase.  The black cartridge did not seat properly in the holder on the printer but with a bit of manipulation I managed to get it seated well enough to work although it pops out occasionally and has to be manipulated again.  However, this was not the main issue.  The 1st black ink cartridge stopped working after about 4 days and had to be replaced.  At this rate the ink will work out more expensive than the Canon branded stuff!

Purchased these for my EPSON WF-3520 after reading the reviews. But error message "In cartridge (s) are installed incorrectly. Press down until they clicked in place" keep showing up even though I did multiply attempts. I also wiped all the chips with the alcohol swap provided. None of them works. Returning them today.

Simply awful product, it is difficult to cut with anything other than scissors. It will not tear worth a damn as it is aluded to on the packaging and don't even try a razor blade as it masticates the edges of the material. The "perforations" for easy "tearing" are just holes in the film you bought to block out the light that in fact allows light to permeate it. The "static cling" is more luck than magic.The 24" wide roll is actually 23 1/2 inches and patching the pieces together looks awful. Don't even bother with this unless you have large flat non segmented windows. Any odd shapes, lengths or detail is a nightmare. If you don't want light to permeate the edges of the windows you have to overlap the edges of the window frames with the film rather than cutting it to the exact dimansions of the window. However doing this is both unattractive and prevents the product from properly clinging to the window. Also it may interfere with the movement and functioning of your windows. So rather than having an easy to take up and down static cling you have to tape the edges down and over lay them on the frames making your windows look like a kindergarden art project went horribly wrong and be semipermanent fixture.The material itself is very light weight and brittle so holes and cuts and rips happen quite easily. It took my wife and I three hours to cover three windows in this garbage and our windows only had two segments each. The only reason this gets two stars is it does block out a significant proportion of the light coming through the windows but at what cost?We wanted a temporary solution to cover the windows when we had shift work and to be taken down when we would like to use our windows. The only quality solution to this dilemma is blackout track blinds, but they are exceptionally expensive and have to be custom cut to each window. This seemed like the way to go, however now our windows are a mess and I don't ever want to go through trying to get them placed again even though they are cut. I will leave them up for now until I find a better solution but this is going in the trash at the earliest opportunity. Do not waste your money, before the next person makes this $50 mistake this horrible product should end up on the scrap heap of history.

On the plus side, when my scanner died a little AFTER the warranty ran out, the company sent me a new one very quickly, and paid all shipping to and from (for the return of the old one). They were very helpful. That's why this gets an extra star.But the quality of the scans with this is very bad, and the character recognition is almost non-existent. I just ran 10 receipts thru, of varying quality, and only ONE picked up the correct merchant name and transaction amount. Some just showed blank, and others had random stuff it picked up. None of the receipts were faded or illegible - I scanned a few into Evernote with my android phone and it picked them up, the OCR worked fine.I knew this wasn't a top of the line model when I bought it, but I was trying to save a bit. Bad move in this case. Maybe their larger models are better quality, but I think I'll save up and try one of the Fujitsu ScanSnap models next time. I'd also like the option to feed more than one item at a time, and this mobile scanner just can't handle that either.

Contrary to some reviewers, my boxes _did_ arrive with a roll of packaging tape sandwiched between the boxes. However, these boxes are of such poor quality that having the roll of tape between them damaged some of the boxes as they were smashed around the roll. I honestly don't think I've ever seen such poor quality cardboard boxes, would absolutely never buy these again. Since these boxes are so flimsy, I probably won't be able to stack more than 2 on a handtruck. Moving (and maybe finding a new job) are the most annoying things in the universe, and these boxes will make your move harder and take longer. There is absolutely no reason to purchase these boxes unless you are A) planning to transport air. B) need something to start a fire with (and you will probably be starting said fire to dispose of your other order of these boxes)

I really hate leaving bad reviews but I wish I should’ve listened to the bad reviews on this item. I love giving items a try even if the reviews aren’t good because I always end up getting great quality.  I guess I just got a dry pen or maybe this is how light they’re supposed to mark. Oh well. The tip is great though!! I would’ve loved if this item colored darker.

I ordered dozens of rolls of bubble wrap, and from various venders at Amazon.  And everything arrived pretty quickly.  But this took almost a month to get here—weeks later than everyone else!  Two, i have the rolls everywhere and these rolls are much smaller in size, so it looks like a lot of the product is missing.  I have read other reviews about such practices, but this is quite noticeable due to the visual comparisons....so this has not been a good experience.  And they sure have lost me as a client!
I gave 2 stars because it arrived as promised (the next day), however, the package was unsealed, and the claim papers were wrinkled, have to throw some away.

I ordered these toner cartridges thinking they’d work great based on reviews. Sadly they didn’t:( the toner doesn’t seem to adhere well to the paper. I’m using high quality laser jet paper and it just won’t work. Please help!!

Blotchy print issues. Printed 10 pages, did not get better. Put the original almost empty cartridge back in, printed with no problems.Ripped off. Should have read the reviews before I wasted my money. I will NOT buy from this vendor again.

There is still a great deal of manual entry required.  The software, essentially, cannot read handwritten amounts.  Even if it's a machine-printed amount, it may not find the correct amount on the receipt.  It may, or may not, find the name of the issuer of the receipt.  In short, the user has to review EVERYTHING for accuracy, and do a lot of manual entry besides.  Furthermore, the "upgrade", I'd call it a "sidegrade", to version 5.1 is a hassle.  The new version of the software cannot directly read the previous backup file format (.nwbak), requiring a special migration process.  I have run the migration utility  more than once, and it still has not migrated my data saved in the older version. I am waiting for one of their technicians to tell me how I can get the data into the new version.  In the end, I may have to re-scan all the receipts into the new version, or go back to the previous version.Once the data is entered accurately, it can run handy reports easily.  It's the entry of the data that's the problem.  I had great hopes for its potential, but it is nothing as automated a process as I'd wish it were.

I was very disappointed with these pens. I really like sarasa and have been using this brand for many years. the 14 pack of multi-colours took a while to arrive, but that wasn't a problem. The ink inside the clear shaft of the pen looked like it was about 1cm low. They had not been previously used, because the package was sealed. Perhaps these have been sitting around for a very long time. 3 of the 14 pens were dried up and unusable within a week. I found this rather infuriating. This is not good value for money. I would definitely not waste my money again on this product or anything similar by the same seller. I only gave the one star because it actually did arrive, looked like the picture and there is a nice colour selection. DO NOT PURCHASE!

It was easy to connect to the network, but has been a problem with sending different size jobs. There may be a setting for this, but if it senses that a job is not the standard size it will demand the right paper untill it is reset. This makes remote printing impossible from phones so far.I am changing my review to only one star. The manual and adjustments on the key pad are impossible to understand. Everything is written in language incomprehensible to the beginning user. Just trying to set the correct paper size for internet network printing as proven to be a long confusing process. The manual needs to be easier.

The worst set of pens you could ever buy - literally every single pen stopped working just with a day or two of using. Go through the other negative reviews on this page - it's the same experience with most of the people who used the entire set before reviewing.All the positive reviews are from users who got the pens and haven't used it yet. Go for some other company instead. Else, you'll definitely regret.

Since the package was already open at the top, I was able to check the quality of the folders without disturbing the rest of the plastic covering and my excitement to see them vanished immediately.  They are thinner than any folder I have purchased in the past as well as the others I just purchased from Amazon as well as another source.  Very flimsy.  With regular use I doubt if they would have lasted more than a couple of months.  Based on the reviews, I was quite surprised.  I don’t know if reviewers were so taken by their appearance that they glossed over the quality or if there has been a change in manufacturer or something else.  I just know that I returned them and cannot recommend them.

I have this marked as the lowest rating possible because I was clearly sent a used/returned item.  There were scratches & finger prints (not mine) all over it.  The box it was in was also torn open prior to my receiving this product. Looks like it might be a decent product if I can get one that is new.  I set up an exchange of the item.  If 2nd one arrives better I'll update this review.

I gave it two stars ONLY because the shipping was very timely. The set was incomplete with sharpies missing. Also, it did not look exactly like the product that was shown. This was purchased to be part of a Christmas gift set, but now I have to figure something else out.

I actually had to order two of these because the first one arrived with a broken clamp - Amazon customer service was great about sending out a replacement free of charge.After a few weeks of storing documents in the replacement safe, I went to retrieve them only to find that some felt damp.  To confirm my suspicions, I removed the items and replaced them with some blank paper and an unsealed envelope; I let it sit for 2 months and returned to find the paper saturated and the envelope sealed!  Plenty of moisture indeed.I wish I could return this but unfortunately the return / replacement window has passed.  Despite the price and the brand name, I would recommend customers looking for a fireproof safe to avoid this purchase.  See other low-star reviews for similar testimonials about how moisture gets in and ruins the important items this safe is intended to safeguard.Also, despite the product description, it is not wide enough to allow a standard Letter size piece of paper (8.5" x 11") to lie flat.This is a complete waste of time and money.
If i could give 0 stars I would this pen is useless.
If I could give this item less than 1 star I would. You can not change out the inserts. No store carries them. Do not buy this this product.

I bought two of these for my two lefty kids. One broke after just a few days. Same place as pictures from other reviewers. The plastic that holds the screw broke. There should really be a metal nut to accept the screw, this is a compromising design flaw.
Like the other reviewer, I too discovered that the box is very unstable and requires a pound of tape to secure. Not worth the money at all.

Never worked.  Tried sharpening new pencils and it just never worked.  I kept having to push harder and harder to get anywhere but it never actually sharpened the pencils.  Terrible.  Wish I could give it 0 stars.

Updated April 22, 2016I saw a review of a related item with the samt idiotic wheel assembly.  There was mention of 2 cotter pins shipped with the equipment.  With my cart, I received ONE cotter pin and 4 bending bolts for the front and back wheels.  And, on my older Trimmer cart, I DID receive 2 cotter pins.  I tried those, and they DID NOT WORK.  The ends of the cotter pins are too small to be reliable held in place.  I would STRONGLY suggest the manufacturer come up with a RELIABLE way to keep the back wheels in place, because I love these carts, and I don't want to have to provide engineering instructions in my refiews (I have bought a replacement for this cart from Overstock, because I want replacements for the PARTS THAT WENT FLYING AROUND THE NEIGHBORHOOD.  Then, I am going to fashion RELIABLE back-wheel retainers out of jumbo paper clips.  Probably a D-shaped arrangement.  I am confident that THOSE won't come off and leave me with a bunch of springs all over the block.  Why can't these people use a Jesus clip or something?Update April 16, 2016.  I have to do this.I have had to reduce my review to ONE START in the hope that the MANUFACTURER WILL READ IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!WHEEL FASTENERSWHEEL FASTENERSWHEEL FASTENERSWHEEL FASTENERSWHEEL FASTENERS\Do I have to say it again? FIX THE WHEEL FASTENER DESIGN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!A back wheel of my just-purchased EXTRA-LARGE shopping cart fell off, and of course, parts went flying all over the neighborhood.  Get it?  Got it?At least they had the sense to cap the bending bolts on the FRONT WHEELS, and on my own normal-sized one, I duplicated that by shoving balls of electrical tape into the tubes by the front wheels.I'm debating whether to pick up a new extra-large for the spare parts or go to the hardware store to buy some sprigs, washers, and heavy steel wire and keep the old one.  By rights, they should send me a replacement WITHOUT requiring me to ship this heavy thing back.  Unless somebody WRITES ME FROM THE COMPANY and offers me some kind of solace, I will NOT restore the 5-star review.tHE least they could do IS HAVE A PLACE WHERE i CAN order replacement parts!Putting a "bending bolt" at the most vulnerable place on a wheel/axle assembly always struck me as the dumbest idea I've ever seen.  I've done my best to compensate for this stupid mistake; I would appreciate it if the manufacturer would meet me half-way.  They need MORE STABLE AND CERTAIN fasteners on the BACK WHEELS.Update March 8, 2016My wife has passed away, and I am now involved with a lady who lives about 3/4 mile from my house.  The "large" shopping cart is rated at I believe 50 pounds, so i bought the extra-large, which is rated at 96 pounds.  I assembled it today, and it still has those weird "bending bolts" for the back wheels.  I bent the ends on the back wheels as described below, but i really wish the manufacturer of this product would come up with a better way to hold those back wheels in place!  It's going to be interesting to see how this thing holds together when I take 50 lb. of cat litter over there.  I'll keep you posted.I cannot drive, and so I have had many a shopping cart.  In the old days, I used a really common two-wheeler that squealed like a banshee - these were all over the place!  I got a 4-wheeler from my mother-in-law, who got it from a garage sale, and last week, the last bottom rod fell off; the other rods were Jerry-rigged with wire, and I didn't feel like taking the trouble to fix it again.  I will keep that one for a spare.Assembly: It took a long time to assemble this, because I managed to rip the instructions in half while unpacking it.  But once I figured things out, the assembly went perfectly.  I did decide to do a couple things other people may not have done: When I put the large wheels on, I put the bending bolt through both the wheel and the cap.  Then, I squeezed the open end of the bending bolt together with pliers.  Finally, I bent the straight end of the bending bolt up against the groove in the cap.  Now, I know it's never going to come apart.Usage: In the store, the handle is about the same height as a grocery cart, so it's easy to walk it around.  I got the cart liner, and so I never use bags unless I know there will be leakage from something (such as raw meat.)I drag my shopping carts around a lot, sometimes for miles.  When dragging this one behind on the large wheels, I find it balances much more nicely than the others I have had.  It's also almost silent, and has a very smooth feel when dragging!  If the sidewalk is smooth, it's very comfortable to walk this cart on 4 wheels, although I never recommend this for any cart over long distances.I might have taken a star off for assembly issues, but they really didn't bother me.  All in all, I'm very happy with this product.

DO NOT BUY!!!  I always regret when I buy a knock-off brand and this was NO exception.  However, Dell ink was out of stock.  Using this worthless cartridge, the text was smeared and lines of text were missing altogether.  When you have to literally dump your printed output into the trash....you might as well march straight to the nearest loo and flush your money straight down the toilet.  NOT ONE PRINTED PAGE WAS ACCEPTABLE.SUPER DISAPPOINTING!!!WORTHLESSCROOKS!!How can you give NEGATIVE star ratings?!?!

This is the first time i found a product at Amazon i give a poor rating. When I received it, small chips of the leather fell off (very poor quality) and the paper is recycled or so. - Very hard to write on.You can find way better quality for that price!!

I bought these based on all of the good reviews.  After being stubborn and trying over several months to give all of the pens in the box a chance - same result, they constantly stop working mid sentence/word.  I missed my return window because I was being too optimistic.

It only got one star because I could not give zero stars. I stuck one magnet to my wall and a post it to the other side and the magnet was so weak it would not hold the paper. I then tried using more for my medicine cabinet door to stay closed and that failed to.

Package is as described in terms of contents and as usual great Prime delivery quickly.That's the 2 stars.The ink cartridges although claiming compatible are NOT! I have a Canon Pixma MX922. The cartridges are not a good fit. The quality of the cartridge itself was a problem as 2 of them broke after inserting them ( and I did insert them properly!) another huge problem was although I unwrapped them carefully and held them upside down so the area the ink actually comes out from was on top,while I took off the large plastic tab the ink still went everywhere. It was like it was overflow or something. It was a terrible mess and my fingers will likely be stained for a while. I am very disappointed and will not buy again.

DON'T BUY THIS CHEAP PIECE OF .... Just read the reviews. The "stainless steel" cable makes it sound heavy, duty but it's not. Like at least one other reviewer, I found that the cheap stitching on the belt came apart within a couple weeks with minimal use.

I purchased this product based on the reviews.  I have an HP 8600 Plus printer and ordered the multipack cartridge replacement.  Although the cartridges looked in good order when installed they printed horrible pictures.  When you run the HP print test page you can clearly see that the sample solid color bars do not print a solid rectangle and on top of that, ink smudges would appear on the page.  To sell  a product like this you should first ensure that it actually works in the printers they are sold for.  Luckily the return process was not a problem.

I’ve had this tag gun for several months and was very excited to get it in. I make and sell tshirts and I was going to use it to attach my logo to my shirts. I couldn’t figure the gun out immediately and watched a video of another review to make sure I was doing everything correctly, but they gun just would not work. It’s been sitting in a drawer for several months and I got it back out to finally try to really figure out what I could be doing wrong, and I think it’s just a defective product. As you can see in my picture, I’ve wasted several tags trying to get it to work. It pushes the whole row of tags out and gets jammed very easily. I’ve changed out the needles and nothing seems to work. It really is a good deal with the extra needles and tags, but it’s useless if the gun itself doesn’t work. 🙁

I should have read the reviews. Just like everyone else here, I was so excited when it arrived. Nicely packaged, beautiful planner. Only 4 weeks per month... this won’t work at all. Except for February in a year that it starts on a Monday. I’m going to try to return. Now I know why it was on sale I guess.
I should have believed the reviews.  This worked the first time, and could never update or enter anything after.  By the time I bought it as a Christmas gift and installed, it was past time to return

This cart is extremely weak.I saw some reviews about it but wanted to take a chance because negative review doesn't always mean the product is bad.But thia cart! Please, don't waste your money.It's weak and flimsy and broke the first day I used it.Sooo embarrassing!

This is the second time I purchased this product.  The first time I did, I experienced streaking with the Cyan cartridge.  Nevertheless, I decided to give the vendor the benefit of the doubt because it still seemed like a good deal and I could tolerate the occasional streaks.  So, I purchased another 4-pack and I am now experiencing severe smudging with the Magenta toner on all prints.  At this point, purchasing this product is like playing a game of roulette with a sure bet of losing; it's just a matter of which color you want to place your bets on.UPDATE: I'm increasing my original rating from 2 stars to 4 to reflect good service. The vendor contacted me shortly after this review and offered a full 4-toner replacement st no charge.  They were very responsive throughout the process and checked back frequently to make sure I received and tested the product.  So far, the Magenta replacement is functioning as it should be.  I will update my review again once I make it through all four cartridges.UPDATE 10/16/2017--reduced rating to two stars:  So, I finally went through the remaining toner cartridges from the initial shipment, as well as the replacement, and the final verdict is that I will never purchase these again.  I have experienced issues with every cartridge I loaded.  The black toner seems to be the safest bet, but even those don't operate to the full 2500 page capacity based on printer stats.  I experienced streaking, smudges, and premature toner outages with all color cartridges.  The Yellow toner created light smudges along the left edge of all pages during its entire lifetime--including on BW prints; Blue toners always streaked, spotted, smudged, and seemed to run out the quickest; and the last new Magenta toner I loaded today registered only as half full.  My original review stands; it really is hit or miss, with most missing the mark.  2 stars, for at least, having decent customer service.
Printed Pink for Blue objects. Read my review for their Wothless Black ink cartridges,equivalents for  H-P 15. One package was full of ink and the other printed more dark brown than black.

This is a terrible product. The basket is full with only 1-2 grocery bags and is too small for my reusable bags. Turning is a pain since you have to tilt it to turn, and sometimes this unlatches the bar on the base and it starts to collapse when back on the ground. Forget about going up stairs, I’ve found the only option is to lift the entire cart and carry it up stairs. I wish I’d spent a few more bucks and bought a bigger one with better ratings.

These aren’t gel highlighters (In comparison to actual ones) they are basically crayons. They arrived obviously used as packaging was stapled back together with crayons in upside down .  Upon taking lid off one they were used and smeared on the casing .  No returns allowed on this item.  Zero stars if it was possible.

Bought this because of the sterling reviews about the OCR and document utility software.  Got it, plugged everything in, and it simply does not do anything except the most basic of scanning with my Mac.  The description says it works with Mac OS X, the box says it works with Mac OS X, but first thing tech support said was, "That software only works with Windows."  In addition, there is no way to calibrate the scanning function (and it needed it) since even the driver interface is different than the one described in the manual, although tech support said they might have a patch.Box is completely misleading  - reading it, you would think that if you have OS X you are good to go.  But everything you look for in your scanning function will not work on an Apple.

Like other customer reviews for this product have said, I also have had the aluminum carabiner break (two of the them) after several weeks of usage.  The spring mechanism that keeps the latch closed has fallen out both times.  I have not had any problems with the cable part of the key chain.Addendum to my original review.  I continued to use the device for about 2 years after the carabiner broke.  Now the steel cable has broke in half.  I could had easily have lost my keys if I had not been paying attention.

Although this tape is strong the issue is when you have to tape a label with a bar code, the strips prevented proper reading of the bar code, had to put a label with different clear tape therefore my 2 stars rating overall

Great customer service, if you leave a bad review they call and call and call and negotiate a fix but unfortunately it is my opinion that these are not real sony bulbs and not only was the housing broken upon arrival and the bulb was dim, flickered, and had a very faded picture. And yes I replaced it with a real bulb, my t.v. looks fantastic now so I know it was the bulb.
I bought this to use on various handmade products that i wanted a country feel to. Literally falls apart upon unrolling any amount. Awful. Zero stars.

I’m not ready to buy an expensive fountain pen but Parker is a brand I recognize and the price for a basic pen is great. Unfortunately, the description says that this is a fine tip, but it’s actually medium. Also no ink is included, but it does come with an empty refillable cartridge. Stars lost for inaccurate description.
The only reason I gave it one star, is because there is not a no star
There wasn't an option for zero stars. It arrived jammed and does not work.

I bought these to clean dog and cat hair from my kitchen chairs so I could clean off the fur quickly if I was expecting guest.Well I cleaned 1 chair and had to rinse and wait for the sticky buddy to dry before I could start on the second chair.  Really the first chair didn't even get completely fur free.Don't waste your money!!  Not even worth 1 star!!

Granted, I ordered this cartridge over a year ago (May 2011 from the vendor JAMinnovations) for my HP Deskjet 845C and just now needed to install it.  The cartridge that was in my deskjet (purchased by the way from inkjetcartridges dot com) lasted over a year - printing about 12-20 pages per week.  It finally went dry, so I installed this one - figuring since it was a genuine HP cartridge in retail packaging (which it wasn't - it was a white box, busted open, with instructions stuck on the outside) that it would work great.  But maybe if it really was an original HP product, since they probably don't make these for this older printer, it was dried up long ago.  Anyway, I immediately ordered another cartridge from Amazon (OfficeMax Black Ink Cartridge Compatible with HP 15 (C6615DN) OM98673 Sold by Speedy Inks, $8.99).  It arrived today, I installed it & it works great!  It was packaged very well, is fresh, isn't an "original" HP cartridge, but I don't think that matters for these older printers.  It also has a "use by" date on it of 2014.  I'll review that cartridge also.

I agree with the other reviews that the ink is quite light, which is disappointing because the colours are interesting. But the most disappointing is that is difficult to wipe off the white board, I haveto apply quite a good pressure in the rubbing, and it still leaves a faint stain.

I have never written a negative review but this item warranted it...Started out working but then shortly after became chalky on the paper and documents came out nearly blank.  Switching back to HP ink.  The bargain price unfortunately wasn't worth the wasted time and paper.

Other reviewers say the same thing, so I don’t know how I missed it. The manufacturer is purposely misstating the dimensions.I would’ve given a 5 star review, but this was a total fail for the purpose.

I bought based on reviews.  My Epson R280 has done nothing but fail to recognize each cartridge randomly every day rendering the printer un useable.  When on occasion it does print its missing lines and needs to be cleaned so much that cartridges empty before you know it.I bought 2 boxes and have gone thru 1 box and still can't print!What a waste.

the reviewers talk about tape, markers and bubble sheets. So I had assumed mine would come with those. However, this company was only selling the boxes. Amazon needs to take down the reviews as they do not seem to go with the product advertised and it caused me to purchase a product for an unfair price.

The reviews I read before ordering this product we very missleading! This cannot support the weight of a laptop. Maybe an ipad would work but that is about it. I am hoping to be refunded because this is unsusable , it tips over. Very disapointed

Now that the device is out of warranty, I'm having nothing but problems. At first, it would go offline for hours at a time, even though my internet was working on all my other devices. About 2 weeks ago it stopped working all together, except for a few hours yesterday. I was on the phone (my cell) with custormer service last week for almost an hour before being transferred to someone who supposedly has more technical expertise. I was with the tech person for over an hour. They both had me trying the same things over and over again. I did tell them that I had already tried those things with no success. The tech person finally told me that the problem was in the device itself and that I needed to purchase another one. These days most electronics last for years. If this product has to be replaced every 1 or 2 years it must mean quality was not a concern when it was designed. I now have to decide if I want to fork out the money for another one and spend time searching for a price I can afford. My advice to anyone considering buying - it's good while it lasts, but that might be for a short time.UPDATE. I sent my Ooma phone number as instructed when the company replied to my review. I was supposed to be connected to Support. They have my email address. No one has contacted me. I believe this is a big scam to fool future customers who read the negative reviews into believing the company cares about their customers.
Would love to rate this product as great but used once and it immediatley cracked down one side of its leg.Maybe a bad batch but cannot complain to much as it was refunded without quabble.
Bad- see my review of the Color Ink Cartridge I purchased

I would give these 0 stars if possible. Bought a pack of three. One for each office and one for computer bag for on the go. The first one I used was just a few days after receiving them. Other than the blue and yellow, the markers were practically no good. I wasn't that concerned, it happens, no big deal, the yellow and blue for that day were fine and I knew I had 2 backups...right?When I went to go use the second one not long after that, only the yellow and blue and orange worked. The last one I used soon after that, on the go, basically the same deal.Good luck getting anything done with these. They are old and dried up.

Toner was DOA.The toner I received was an old toner cartridge that they had broken the seal on and refilled. However, they did not reset the cartridge (the printer decides when you are out of toner based on the position of a gear; a high yield toner has a gear that can spin further, a low yield has a gear that does not spin as far). Therefore after about 10 pages the printer thought it was out of toner. Pushing buttons (which I had to do at first anyways) didn't work for fixing it this time. Luckily I found how to reset the gears myself and it's working again.Leaving a one star because this was a dishonest sale. No one should have to do this.

The wheels were great. But after only 2 months the bearings started to fall out of the wheels. I tried to get in touch with the company sunniedog since they offer a lifetime warranty, but they never returned my email or phone calls. That is why I give them a bad rating.

Showed up quick, but the rivets that hold the clasp on the lid weren't installed, so I have a cheaply made, extremely non sturdy box that I can't even lock. Would give zero stars if I could, and will def be going after a refund.

What an awful product. The cheapest/ flimsiest product you can purchase for nearly $70. Upon the first time using it to carry groceries from 8 blocks away, a wire snapped off mid-walk. The wires are flimsy and would break easily. Pushing this cart was embarrassing, as the ergonomic construction and design was not properly thought out. It often tipped forward, and the cheap wheels often caught quite easily on a tiny pebble or leaf; better off pulling the cart behind you. I would not recommend this product at all. 0 Stars.
I would give it zero stars. Its ONE banner with the posters on the reverse side. Very Disappointed!
2 stars due tonthw sturdiness. Cant puncture a semi tough wall map board, pins bend and aren't sharp.Better use for puncturing softer material
Like every other review, the point will not stay put. Literally just arrived yesterday and first project in and I'm about to through it in the street.

First of all, I installed these with absolutely no problems.  The first couple of days, I printed like 5 things... It worked like a charm!  About 2 days later, I went to print some coupons online (knowing you only get so many prints per device) and my coupons were destroyed.  The black ink is absolutely smeared all over the paper!  Almost as if i dipped wet ink in a bucket of water.  I paused the printer, tried again.. NO LUCK.  Same thing happened.  I thought it was something to do with printing coupons, so I tried printing other things...an absolute mess!  I took out the black cartridge, and the colored ink printed "black enough" for the coupons.  The next day, I was trying to print something colorful for my child.  The orange letters were a dark yellow, pink printed in brown, and the colors are horrid.  Never again.  I should have listened to the negative reviews.  Take my word, buy better!

If I could give it zero stars I would. None of the pens worked when I got them. You can see a clear gel when you write but no color - I suspect they over heated in transit.This is the warning from the manufacturer: “Erasable pens are not recommended for use on legal or official documents. Do not expose to extreme temperatures (<14°F,>140°F). If pen is exposed to temperature that reaches 140°F, the ink will be colorless when writing.”Really disappointed and the no return policy sucks!

Got maybe 1600 pages before the toner started fading on all my documents.  I know the price can't be beat but the fact that it did not even come close to living up to it's high yield claim is why I'm giving this product 2 stars.

Not the Parker pen I remember.  This one is a cheap $2.00 pen.  I guess the company that now owns Parker cares not of the quality it used to be.  The good reviews given here are by people that don't know or don't remember the good pens the old company made.  Pass this one up and go for a Cross pen.
I see now others have said this in the reviews -- wish I'd thought to check for those.

This is my first negative Amazon review. I should have known... You get what you pay for!!! Most pens were dry. The white pen (which I was most interested in) didn't work at all. I'm donating the few that work to a community center. They will not work for any kind of project, adult coloring or bullet journal. I will spend the extra $10 and buy from a reputable source!

The on/off button stopped working after about 8 or 9 hours use over a 4 or 5 day period. I had to plug and unplug it to remove the full tubes, wrap the coins and then continue sorting. Very limited capacity on the coin input slot; coins tend to fall out of the sorting barrel behind the sorting wheel. To clear it, you have to remove the top (there is a screw in the back) and turn the machin upside down. Finally, the quarter coin slot plastic tab diverter bent under the drop tube, so quarters did not sort until I managed to find the problem then reset the plastic tab. This is a shabbily made, poorly functioning piece of garbage machine. I do NOT recommend this to anyone! I would have given this ZERO stars if that was an option.I would have returned it but I had it for three weeks before I got around to using it and by the time it failed my 30 day return window had expired.
These pens don't dry rapidly, so the ink bleeds outside the lines. Two stars is for color selection.

Half of the pens in my set were dried up. I saw reviews to have them sit upside down to get the ink flowing and still they didn’t work. Maybe I got a bad set but in my opinion I would find another set.

I purchased these for my HP Envy 4500 Series about a year ago when I was out of Black ink in my HP Envy 4500 Series printer. I only needed black at the time, but bought the pack with color also due to what I perceived as a great value and chose this due to the great reviews. The XL black ink cartridge didn't last half as long as just a standard HP cartridge, but that I can live with due to the price being much lower than authentic cartridges. When it came time for me to use the color cartridge it was around a year later, and I had kept it sealed in the box that it came in. After printing a few things, I realized that the blue ink in the cartridge didn't seem to be working. I tried everything to troubleshoot the problem, including all of the utilities to clean the printer heads and such. The color cartridge I received either has blue in that just doesn't work, or it doesn't have any at all. It's too late for me to return, but I figured that I'd warn others of this issue. I won't be purchasing another Valuetoner ink cartridge.

Sad that Amazon insists on combining reviews for unrelated products.  This review is for the one with the built-in gel wrist wrest MW85B.I have the matching wrist rest WR85B, so I thought I'd get this one.  The wrist wrest is OK.  This mouse pad is, however, garbage!For starters, it is not even close to being flat.  It is warped/dished, and the corners raise off my desk 1/8" to 1/4".  So, as you move the mouse around, it is flopping around as well.  This is a deal breaker for me.  I tried to flatten it out with no improvement whatsoever.Next, it is really too small.  Like the wrist wrest, the gel is quite hard, and, therefore, it's best to use it as a PALM rest.  Either way, it is too short.  From where your wrist wrests, the mouse goes off the top of the pad often.  Width-wise, it is OK.  Not generous, but OK.Additionally, it is a very scratchy/rough material for the mouse surface.  It feels like you are almost dragging your mouse on sandpaper.  It does not move easily, and, considering I am using a very expensive/precious Logitech MX Revolution mouse, I don't want it wearing the pads off.Finally, sort of a con, but these are not the "satin pillow" that 3M describes, but rather a firm (almost no give) gel/rubber with a matte soft-touch vinyl cover much like you might see on some automotive surfaces.In sum, the wrist wrest is OK, but the mouse pad version is terrible.
No star!!! Did not work. Printer detected a cartridge that needed to be replaced. Will try to return.

I thought I would purchase these since the price was reasonable and the reviews were ok. I have an Epson WF-3520.  I tried all 3 black ink cartridges and very little color would come out. I contacted the seller and they offered a few options to try and fix the cartridges (shaking cartridge, cleaning printer heads), but no luck. I received a partial refund and purchased genuine Epson product and it works fine.
Lesson learned...read the reviews before hitting submit! Disappointed.

These are a complete waste of money.  Seriously, save yourself the hassle and do NOT buy these. I've never reviewed a product before as I have a three year old, two year old and six month old and very little time - but I couldn't help but want to inform everyone at how bad these truly are.

I bought it before the review from november 3rd which describes the same problems I had today.There is no warning on the cartridges to be careful when removing the caps. After reading nothing but great reviews I jumped on this cart over the OEM one as it was 1/4 the price.  The housing is slightly different but it fit fine and after the printing OS having objections over installing a non-HP cart installed, I went about my business.  However, since installing this cart the printer jams constantly.  It makes no sense but I put the old OEM low yield 255A cart back and and the jams stop.  Put this new 255X high yield in it and constant jams and paper size mismatch errors return.  Put the OEM back in and no jams.  Very disappointing and obviously something is up with the toner cart since the problem is easily repeatable.I looked at the functional ends of both carts and they are different but the mounts and location of the developer looks the same, so I have no idea why my printer hates this new cart.
I wish I could give checkbook cover ZERO STARS. It is the cheapest cover ever. I can’t believe I paid $3.95 got it. It might be worth 25 cents.

I was hoping for better, second manufacturer of ink I ordered, after first one didn’t even get recognized by printer. I read the reviews, mostly positive, so I was hopeful when I ordered. Good sign, the little light came on like the others, and the level indicator showed me they were full. Okay, great... now, for the real test. I did a printer head cleaning, ran a test page. Not great, didn’t look like it was giving me any ink from the gray and black tanks I had replaced. Next, tried printing return labels (regular paper, bar code label printing like we used to have to do for Amazon returns) for stuff I needed to send out. Major fail—the bar codes were missing data, the print quality was crap. I tried repeating with color vs b/w, no improvement. Wasted a lot of OEM color ink trying to troubleshoot this mess. Finally realized that the one-star reviews had it right; I’m not a high end user, wasn’t trying to print photo quality or anything. Just wanted to print a darned shipping return label or three. If it’s not good enough for the text to be readable, it’s useless. Needless to say, it’s getting returned.

No stars - installed the cartridge correctly in printer and it doesn't work. Yes, I put it in the old cartridge first. The new ink cartridge just rattles like it is broken and won't spin.  Of course I ordered it more than 30 days ago, so I can't return it.  I plan ahead so I wasn't out of ink yet.Terrible product - terrible return policy on something you might keep in stock to use later.

What I got was a set with 3 different colors.  I'm not ok with it. I noticed several other reviews that alsoi got mixed sets.

Review menu iconThe WORST service for businessesjust nowIf you need or expect service that works reliably and dependably, this is not the company for you.  I own several franchises and this was the biggest mistake I’ve made since going in business.  They complete about 1 in 4 calls successfully and have no way to open a ticket with a technical team to resolve the issue.  It has cost me so much in lost revenue and they are a complete nightmare to deal with.  No desire to even have a person support and resolve the issue.  Try to open a trouble ticket before ordering the service, you’ll see what I mean.  Every day there’s a message that says they have an outage and are experiencing technical issues, after sitting on hold and reaching one of the front line people, you’ll get no where, because they just take your name and number, then they will tell you they are escalating, but they don’t.  What will you do when an employee needs to call 911 and the service doesn’t work?  If you are reading this because you are experiencing a similar issue, file a complaint with the fcc.  Use a company who understands telecom architecture and infrastructure and the responsibilities that come with offering a mission critical lifeline service.

I've tried all different brands and sizes of scissors, and carefully followed the extremely easy and simple instructions, and it won't sharpen any of them. And worse (I guess?), if you're not careful when you're pulling your scissors out, you'll cut and damage the cheap plastic on either side of the sharpening area essentially slowly cutting the device in half. I wasn't expecting military-grade for the price but I at least expected it to do the simple task it is advertised as doing. I dislike giving negative reviews and less than 4 or 5 stars, but I've been having a terrible run with products purchased through Amazon lately. Perhaps Amazon should practice a little more quality control with the vendors they allow to sell through their good name and the products those vendors sell. Maybe it's just a Winter curse and things will go back to the old, reliable Amazon that I've relied on and loved for 15+ years. I really wish this device would work for me in some capacity and would sharpen, well, anything, so I could give it 2 or 3 stars; it is what it is though, unfortunately. About the only positive things I have to say, besides the instructions being simple (although to a futile end), is that it was shipped to me quickly and packaged as expected. I don't have any reason to think that the seller was trying to be dishonest or fraudulent, just that an item they sell doesn't work for me. If anyone has any tips or ideas that would help me, although the instructions are foolproof enough, I would love to be proven totally wrong. I guess granny will continue to cut her quilting cloth with dull scissors until I can find a sharpener that will get the job done.

I purchased this mouse board to replace my Rocket Fish Aluminum dual sided mouse board. I do NOT use this for gaming, it's used for precision mouse function of Design/3D building programs. The Rocket Fish surface coating was becoming worn smooth from several years of use with a Logitech M705 Laser Mouse (my mouse of choice). I'm not one for change, so if I find something I like that works well, I stick with it and re-purchase another one when it's time. I was impressed by the ad presentation and claims of the RUDE-220 so I tried one.Upon receiving the RUDE-220, I couldn't help but notice that the rugged packaging was very well designed with considerable thought, very professional. After opening the package, I discovered that the 'FREE! Teflon Mouse Skates' were missing. Missing Teflon mouse strips aside, I still couldn't wait to try this thing out. The first thing I did was to wipe down the new board with some LCD screen/lens cleaner to remove any residue from the surface.The board is very nicely constructed with a fully bonded, non-skid rubber back over the entire area, not just 4 rubber feet as with similar boards. The mouse surface is completely bonded to the metal core which provides for extreme durability. Noticing that the metal core has been fabricated with radiused edges, gives a nice finished appearance with no sharp edges. I also discovered that this particular board is 'crowned' (curved/bowed) top to bottom, which means that the board does not sit perfectly flat on my desk, with a slight gap on the bottom. Because this 'crown' is so slight, performance of the board should not be affected.After taking the Logitech M705 mouse for a test drive on the new mouse board, I was very disappointed. There was no smooth mouse movement on the 'super slick' surface' as I expected. In fact, I experienced a heavy drag with the mouse on this board. The board's surface feels quite coarse and grainy to the touch, not at all like the 'super slick' surface' that is claimed by the product hype. Based on 35 years plus in the computer field, I feel the performance of this product has left me asking this puzzling question: Exactly what is it that makes this mouse board so special?In conclusion: It's very possible that performance could be enhanced by the 'Teflon Mouse Skates' that were omitted from my package. However, until I can verify this with the proper Teflon strips provided by Rude Gameware (seller), it is only a possible solution at best. Until then, I may be breaking out my old Rocket Fish mouse board, which has a much smoother and slicker surface.UPDATE 12/21/14: I have continued to use the board since posting my review and have found that the mouse surface seems to be getting smoother with use. Although I'm somewhat skeptical about thesurface improvement in such a short period of time, it is now far better than when I first posted results, which was yesterday 12/20/14.I will post further updates on surface performance as necessary.UPDATE 1/2/15: The tracking surface of this board has improved greatly and is now the accurate and smooth surface that I expected it to be. I'm still puzzled as to why the 'break in time' was required to 'smooth out the wrinkles'.Mel

I want to give 5 stars, but I can’t. There are a lot of sharp edges and corners around the box that could cause a lot of pain and injury. I like the style of the box and the fact you can add a lock to it, but I’m worried about my students  getting hurt from it.

The product is okay, half the holes needed to put this thing together were not drilled out. The back doesn't match the rest of the item, the back of the item and the bottoms of the drawers have to be nailed in, but the nails are flimsy and the board is so thick it is borderline impossible to hammer through without injury. In fact,  I ended up using a nail gun. Assembly is unnecessarily difficult, and also doesn't make any sense. For example, why do I have to nail in the bottom composite board to the drawer when you went through the trouble of boring out a track to slide it in on 3 sides of the drawer, but not the back???Then, after all was said and done, AFTER it was assembled, I realized there is a huge scratch on the top. Overall, crappy experience. Sure it's mostly made of real wood, but it was incomplete and nonsensical to assemble. At this point, it's done so I can't even send it back, but if I could, I would.I should have just ordered something from office depot. I only gave 2 stars because it "looks" like the picture and will generally function as it is supposed to, otherwise I would give it zero. And this is coming from a person who just literally built an entire office from scratch, wood work and all.

.. The Cyan cartridge in this pack is defective, rendering the whole product useless. Don't trust the reviews, this is a bad product.

We ordered the Explorer English World Globe by Brookstone on August 14 after seeing the globe photo and reading the description and great reviews. Imagine the disappointment to receive a red felt banner instead! We called Brookstone Customer Service expecting a quick resolution to the mix-up, only to be told by Kara that Brookstone does not sell this item on Amazon!! Brookstone offered to refund our purchase price, but refused to honor our original order. We then discovered that the globe photo previously attached to this item has been replaced by a photo of the banner we were shipped. All other parts of the display including description and reviews remain the same, but, trust me, you'll get a banner instead of a globe if you order this Brookstone item.

The problem with this cart is definitely the two front wheels ... the are as useless as they come .... I live in NY where you have cracks and slits in the pavement and if you try to run the cart you'd just end up hurting yourself ... This was way to small for the price ... I saw a cart twice the size of this one with better wheels while I was walking past stores on display and it was the same price as this one ... that got me a bit upset. I felt like I wasted money ... This is also definitely not for a tall person ... cart is small and handles are low.  How this got five star reviews is beyond me. Just to show you how frustrated I was. I'm just trying to make use of it by running it on the back wheels only until it can't no more ... I recommend looking around at local stores ... don't make the same mistake I did.

This was a very handy case for my Create 365 Planner at first. But the handles broke right after the return date ended. So now I am stuck with an expensive storage case that I can't carry. There are lots of storage pockets and pouches which is a nice touch, but if it can't even hold the planner with out breaking, it's a waste of money. I didn't give it 1 star because function wise it is a great idea. But since you can't use it due to the handles easily breaking, it definitely doesn't get above a 2 star.

Hello! As beautiful as the feather and packaging was, my feather broke off in less than 20 minutes of using it. I just got this pen today, and I have to say that i'm not particularly impressed by it. The pen and ink flow is good, but my problem is with the stylus end. They really should have gone with a twist open instead of needing to push down on the stylus to use the pen, because it feels really awkward pushing on the hollow rubber stylus. I imagine the stylus won't last long under the stress of pushing my thumb down on it whenever I need to use the pen. On the other hand, the stylus functions perfectly on my iphone screen.UPDATE: Within 2 weeks of owning this pen and hardly using it, it no longer works. When I click on the pen to open it, it stays stuck and won't go back unless I force it to. Really bad quality and really disappointed. As I said in my original review, the design for this pen is horrible. If you are looking for a stylus pen combo that blows this one away search on Amazon for "iDream365 stylus pen", not only does it come with 2 pens and refills, it is cheaper, the design and quality is much better and it takes Parker pen refills. It is really sad that a Chinese company can make products that are better designed, higher quality, and cheaper than an American company like FIsher.

This is not a real chalk board. I would like to return it. I bought it a while ago and finally used it today. Very unhappy with this product. Will change review if I can get a better one. Thank you for your help.

Well, Looks like I should of forked out the extra money for the new one, since I have had to get a replacement already! Received it in time but when I hooked it up, no go! The premise is nice, receive a discounted rate for a "Certified Refurbished" unit, but only if it WORKS! I would have rather spent the last 2 hours that I have spent on the phone with Ooma customer service, tech support and escalation reps, at the DENTIST or even outside. The money saved is not worth the hassle of what I went through to get one that actually works. Not only was the ethernet cable provided broken, but the port itself is blown. I would like to think that quality assurance would check these units BEFORE they ship and that mine just HAPPENED to miss EVERY quality check, but this sure steers me away from buying another refurb product period.Granted, Ooma is replacing a new unit for this one, so while troubleshooting this with them they did provide a replacement so I did not have to contact the seller, even though I did, but the amount of time spent getting a replacement is not worth it for this customer.  I still have to make a call back to Ooma to get credit for the time I have been unable to use this product when I ACTUALLY get a working one, since you have to sign up BEFORE you activate, so essentially I am in the hole with this purchase. Refurb purchase minus time on phone getting replacement/troubleshooting plus getting new replacement minus call back to get account corrected...HMMMMM you decide

I’m getting suspicious of all these Amazon products with “paid reviews”.Here’s a non-paid review. I decided to bite and try the product. Only cause I needed just ONE of these things (versus buying in bulk) and bought based on price.The product is made of extremely thin and cheap plastic. This thing can hold one sheet of paper, max.Because of the thinness of the plastic, it’s not surprising that a high probability of these came broken (for proof, read other reviews). Mine came broken.This thing feels like it was made for 5 cents (if that) and is being sold for $6.62 (at the time I bought it). That’s a HUGE return on such a cheap product.Conclusion? If you just need one like I did, better to go to your in-person box store and just buy one. Sure, you’ll pay about $3 more, but the plastic quality will be better, and you can guarantee yourself you won’t get a broken one.I guess this is part of a new business strategy where you mass produce a cheap product, give some away free to get a bunch of positive reviews to get the internet version of “shelf space” — i.e. higher placement in search rankings, and based off that placement, hook enough people to buy your product to make it worth your while. It’s like infomercials.Based on this experience, I would trust products that DIDN’T have paid reviews. Buyer beware.Addendums:- About the positive paid reviews: I’m sure if you got something for FREE (no risk to you at all), of course you would be nice about it. And I’m sure they made SURE the reviewers didn’t get broken products. I’m sure it cost them barely anything to give away free 5 cent products to buy people’s time to improve search page rankings.- I would be more forgiving if this product was half the price (being generous). I would be even more patient if it was a dollar. Then I could say, “Well, you get what you paid for”. But this product is EXTREMELY OVERPRICED FOR THE QUALITY.Last addendum: As I'm writing this review, the price has jumped up to $13 for ONE?? TOTAL RIPOFF. DO NOT BUY.

** update-My original review still stands. I will not be purchasing these again. I was sent a replacement and it was exactly the same and had the same issues. I wavered between one and two stars, ultimately choosing two because it does work.The main issue I am having is that the right side of all my papers has horrid black toner spots/ streaks/ melted toner. i don't usually leave feedback but feel it necessary in a case where i might help others avoid a bad situation w/ a poor product. i was excited to see sharpies oil based fine point markers things they would be perfect to highlight some bracelets i was working on knowing the embossed area should be easy to highlight. sharpie has proven to be a good maker of markers so why wouldn't i trust this new product??i saw the reviews before ordering and there was mention of problems ...but i thought i would take a chance as i can usually overcome product quirks. not this time. the silver pen arrived first. it worked "fair" and by fair i mean it didn't gush out too much extra paint. the gold however... well please look @ my picture and judge for yourself. i was VERY careful... and followed directions verbatim. it not only RUINED my hard work and design (i am an artist and this has been a big loss of material, time & investment in sharpie.) the white arrived today and i toyed with the idea of refusing the package. (all three colors came from different sellers). anyway i did keep the white and it is doing the same as the gold.i am SO SO very disappointed in sharpie and the fact i spent nearly $5 a piece for three pens that will likely end up in the garbage. the gold leaked on my wood counters and i had to scrape clean with scissors and it still shows.****BIG loss of confidence, sharpie.**** i hope you not only see this but consider myself and others who wasted valuable resources on your products. thank you... beth

As I sit here comparing my 2015 and (new) 2016 Moleskine Weekly Notebooks, there are two quite disappointing and unnecessary changes introduced for 2016:First, the eminently useful, vertical annual planning calendars in the front of the notebook - which allowed one to plan for four months at a time over two years - have been replaced by very conventional single-page mini monthly calendars, which are actually a disadvantage for planning purposes, and seem to miss the entire point about annual planning. What's more, there were TWO years of the previous vertical planning calendars, which (apparently to save page counts and production costs?) have been replaced by only ONE year of these stupid blocky monthly calendars. So there's no longer any place to jot in your plans for the next year, which is this case would be 2017. It seems like a whimsical decision by Moleskine, and at least for me (I do plan events and deadlines months and even years in advance), this really detracts from the previous usefulness of this product. Very disappointing.Second, the very nice typography of previous years has been replaced with a rather heavyset type which draws attention to itself on every page. Again, it seems a rather whimsical and counterproductive design decision. Very much an anti-Moleskine decision. (It's kind of like putting sharp edges on an iPhone, and I don't even own an iPhone but can understand the aesthetic appeal).I can't put my finger on all of the things that are wrong about this "new and improved" 2016 Moleskine Weekly Notebook, but there are several beyond those already mentioned.I've been using various Moleskine since before they were popular (10+ years?) and they obviously have a new designer who has made some very poor decisions. At this rate they are on track to join the unpleasant muck of the dozen other "popular" planners, most of which are detestable.

Edit: Changing my review from 4 to 2 stars. After several days of using the pen, it has become less and less reliable to the point that now, to write at all, I have to hold it at a 90-degree angle from the paper, or even upside down on the top of the nib. Also, comparing it to the V-301 Black fountain pen I bought only a few days before, the nib tip seems larger, which explains while it doesn't really achieve the "fine point" it's labeled as. I think I'm going to have to give up on this one. The black one is doing fine. They should be identical, so I'm not sure if this one is a lemon or it's a consistent design or manufacturing flaw.For the price, I like this pen a lot so far. It seems sturdy and writes well. It was a little difficult to get the ink started, but after rinsing the nib under the tap, I got the ink started and the pen writes smoothly. My only issue is that it's supposed to be a fine point but I find that it's writing thicker than any other pen I've used, fine or not It's almost like a marker! I can deal with this and once I finish my first cartridge, I'm going to try it with some different ink and see what that does.

When I first tried the stapler, I used about 50 magazine pages as a test. The stapler jammed. It continued to jam each time I tried it with anything, even when I was down to two pages. I called ACCO customer support, and after describing the issue they told me to return it or exchange it. I opted to return it. Although it's possible that mine was an exception, the part that the staples come out of was not properly aligned with the recess on the bottom plate, leaving nothing to get the staple to bend on the bottom.A positive point is that it comes with a lifetime guarantee against jamming when used with the correct (included) staples. I can't say how likely it is to jam, but if yours stops working after a while, you always have the option of calling customer service. They answered on the first ring, which is a plus.You might also consider the  PaperPro 60-Sheet High-Capacity Stapler (1200) , which has a capacity of fewer sheets (60) but works reliably and with very little force. Hopefully, the distribution of reviews will give you an idea of how well it works, under what circumstances it fails, and what remedy people had when it failed after owning it for a long period of time.

Purchased for a Canon Pixma MX922.  Locked up my printer with the ink carriage inaccessible, stuck at the far left, making a grinding sound when printer initiated.  Carriage would not come back to center and I kept getting error codes 5100 and 6000.  After two hours searching the internet I found a way to get the carriage back to the center so I could remove the defective ink cartridges.  This is what worked:  Open top of printer as if you were going to scan.  Plug in printer, turn printer on by pressing power, have cover of ink area access open as printer prepares to print.  Watch carriage travel and when it reaches center, unplug the power cord.  You can now access and remove the bad cartridges.  Replace with good cartridges and start printer as normal.  Printer working, error codes gone.I thought I had broken my printer which is less than one year old.  It appeared that the bad cartridges could not be removed and the error codes could not be resolved.  These ink cartridges are unusable for a MX922.  I hope the seller reads their reviews and refunds my purchase price.  These cartridges wasted my time and money and I am grateful I found a way to get them out.

I REALLY wanted to like this scale. But when it arrived I put in the battery and tried and when it produced the 0.00 weight I put several varying weight items on it and it still read 0.00. I tried plugged in with the AC only. Same issue. Tried both battery and AC adapter... still no weighing. Then randomly I start getting "Err" reading on it. Of course this isn't listed in their very small "troubleshoot your equipment" insert, and even my Google-fu couldn't find the solution. Fiddled with it for hours and sometime the "Err" would go away, but still no registering of weight.Bottom line: Just invest in the $25 or $50 version of a scale through the post office. I now am out of money while I wait for it to return and now need to wait for the new scale to arrive. Small business with no easy at home shipping options? Very upset. The only upside was the product was packaged very well, otherwise it was a total bust. It wasn't even worth contacting the manufacturer, if I'm having these issues right out of the box, I can't even imagine what it would be like down the road. I should have listened to the other negative reviews, but I'm an optimist. This time it didn't pan out. Please shop around and make sure you buy the proper scale for your needs. This is very basic, and of course, inoperable.

One star is too generous, but there is no "zero star" category.  The product is well packaged in bubble wrap and a sealed black plastic bag.  When I opened the black plastic bag in which the toner cartridge was shipped, it was full of fine black powder.  Apparently the seal on the toner unit had broken and shaking during transport had caused a large quantity of the black ink power to spill out into the sealed bag.  What a mess.  Sadly, I will have to buy a genuine (read, expensive) HP toner cartridge in order to get on with my work.  This is my last gamble on these outlaw refills.  Thanks to Amazon, most items are returnable.  Still love Amazon !

If I could rate this a ZERO, I would.  I have a graduate degree in computer science and more than 40 years experience in computer imaging systems.  While this device is fast and the image quality is "ok" the programming and documentation are terrible.  There is a USB connection to power the device and allow you to copy files to your PC. However, it appears that the first images you scan get stored in internal memory.  After scanning about 200 slides, I copied them to my PC over the USB connection.  Next day I scanned another 200 slides and copied them over the USB connection as well -- or, rather, I thought I copied them.  Turns out it copied the first ~90 slides I scanned the day before (but had subsequently deleted from the memory card), probably copying them from internal memory, instead of copying the first ~90 slides I scanned that 2nd day, but also copied the remaining 110  files.  Stupid me didn't check every single slide but just the last few to be sure I got all of them.  I deleted those files from the SD card and repeated this process for 4 days, today being the 4th, when I discovered that nearly 400 of the 800 files I scanned were not present on my PC, but rather 4 copies of the first 90 slides I scanned, plus any additional slides I happened to scan on those days.  Fortunately, I copied each day's work to a separate directory, so I still have about 1/2 the files I scanned.  The bad news is the numbering overlaps so I can't just combine them into a directory without renaming every file.  I contacted DigitNow customer service to see how I could resent the starting number for the next batch of slides, but it cannot be changed!  This is the WORST programming I've ever encountered.  Don't waste your time and money.

I have bought these replacements from MymorExpress in the past for both the MFC 7460DN and an HL 2270DW and until now would have rated it 5 Stars. However my most recent replacement for the MFC 7460DN had two problems.1. The cartridge wasn't recognized so the unit continued to call for new toner. I corrected this with a machine reset. What worked for me was posted by BerkeleyBerney on the website FixYourOwnPrinter.com:"This trick for other Brothers worked for me on our MFC 7460DN:You can reset this internal value by:1. Open the front toner compartment door.2. Message reads "Front cover open."3. Press the "Clear" button.4. Message reads "Replace Drum?"5. DO NOT respond to this. Instead, type in "*00" on the keypad."2. The other more disconcerting problem is the ratcheting or grinding sound as the drum turns. Printing is fine but I'm concerning that I may be damaging the drum unit.

I shop a lot, and don't typically take the time to write reviews for products. HOWEVER, if I can save someone the expense and frustration of owning this useless paperweight, then the time is well-spent.  I was not able to use this stapler even one time.  On the initial attempt, the first staple was mangled, became stuck, and nearly impossible to remove.  I remain in such disbelief at the inferior quality of this Swingline Optima 70 Desk Stapler, that I went online to search for more reviews (something I know should have done prior to purchase, but I erroneously trusted the brand).  It seems that I am far from alone in my disappointment and dissatisfaction.  Please do not confuse this unit with the other lower-capacity sheet Optima reviews.  This 70 model is WORTHLESS!  It will serve you best to try another stapler for high-capacity jobs. I waited too long to use it, and fell out of the return window, hopefully you'll think before buying in the first place.
