I normally don't write negative review, but I am outrageous at this toner. I recently purchased this toner from Amazon. The toner is now out of ink after only 20-30 pages of printing. It costed me more than $0.5 for a page! Totally unacceptable!!

HP=6 lines of single spaced text when they talk about a page at 5% coverage, check out the math that totally favors HP.Here is the answer I found at an HP forum, by someone with a lot of posts and HP hasn't removed or said it isn't accurate. It will be different for each printer (I am trying to give them the benefit of the doubt here, but seriously they are ripping people off). In my case for all 3 color cartridges and a black cartridge in my HP6970 I get about 50-60 pages, and I rarely use color at all, I try to totally avoid it. The cost per page for me is roughly $1 a page (I should say was I am not going to use HP anymore you may not when you read the following, to see his actual chart you will need to go to the following link (assuming Amazon leaves it intact).https://h30434.www3.hp.com/t5/Printing-Errors-or-Lights-Stuck-Print-Jobs/NEW-HP-2135-PRINTER-DOES-NOT-PRINT-MORE-THAN-30-PAGES-PER/td-p/6295623Here is the text of the reply from UNIXPLUS:"Here is a chart to help with Ink Cartridge Page Estimation.  All cartridges are based on a 5% coverage when new.Note:  A 5% coverage is about 6 single spaced lines of text on a page. No bold, graphics or pictures.  A full color photo would be 100% coverage.A ‘regular’ page of text would be about 72 lines and give us 30% coverage (more realistic).  Don’t forget the font type and size you use will use more ink too.Example: 564 Standard Black = 250 pages at 5% coverage.Let’s say your average page coverage you estimate is 30%.  So…250/6 = 41.Therefore the number of pages expected (30% coverage) out of your cartridge would be about 40 pages.A 564 Standard Color (300 pages) at 100% coverage yields – 300/20 = 15 pages."Each printer manufacturer will be different, but look to see if you can find something like the above or actual reviews that talk about how many real world pages they actually get/print. To me this feels like false advertising as they often talk about cost per page in the 20 cents or less area, not my experience over 3 printers and replacement HP cartridges. I thought my kids were doing stuff and not telling me but looking at the page counts and finding that page at an HP forum totally hits the nail on the head. That being said as I have covered this has happened with 3 different printers I have had over the last 5 years, I thought the issues were on my end. I guess if you consider they don't openly seem to share the math of how their cartridges work on any of their advertising, it is my fault for not digging much deeper. Do yourself a favor and find a different printer manufacturer that actually prints more than 50-60 pages of typical black full page text pages, unless you love HP and don't mind spending close to a buck a page.
The pictures are misleading. Should have checked the reviews before buying it.

I have had this happen with other chairs and figured it was due to the weight limit.  This chair has a 330lb weight limit which I am 280lbs so no reason it shouldn't be able to support my weight. I was super excited for these pens to come because who doesn't love No Face?! Unfortunately, they were not worth the money. They are incredibly poorly made. The pens are cheap and while they write just okay, the No Face characters at the top look terrible. Three of mine came with pieces broken off of the character and all of them were really really poorly molded. You could see scratches, tears, and plastic that looked like it had been pulled wrong all over each of them. The No Faces are also all sized really weirdly so they look odd together as a set. I wanted to give them out to friends who love Spirited Away too as little gifts, but only two were kind of okay and could pass. I ripped the rest of the characters off the other pens and have been using the plain pens since. I was paid absolutely nothing to do this review and have no reason to other than that I'm pissed that this is what I received.

I probably should have paid more attention to reviews, but I had a table like this before as a rolling nightstand. My biggest concerns were the caster wheels, which are actually quite good themselves. Since I'm on carpet, leveling issues aren't noticeable but as others said, a few washers or a thin leveling nut will fix that.The stand itself is good steel tubing and pretty stable, so my biggest concern windows down to the actual "countertop" and the fact that it is cut into 3 parts to make the flat-pack more efficient for shipping. There can be no other possible reason they would do this. This creates an inconsistency in manufacturing where after assembling the pieces, they are not flush across the gaps of the joins. When you buy this as a laptop stand, this becomes a major irritant when trying to use a mouse because the crack jutting up catches the edge of the mouse and starts scratching the teflon mouse skates that make the mouse easy to slide. My only solution was to use a good fabric mousepad to minimize the effect, though I can still feel the crack through the mousing surface.

Purchased as a hopeful alternative to a landline. It didn't work for my purposes, the latency (lag) was too much...almost a 1 second delay of when you spoke to when they heard you.  So we decided it wasn't for us.  No problem, and with that I would have given it 3 stars as it did most of what it said it was going to do.My issue is with the customer service afterwards.  I actually purchased this Ooma over a year ago.  I'm still getting calls from them (even today) telling me they need to update my info, or my service, etc.  I've told them to cancel my service and quit calling me probably a half dozen times.  Each time they nicely say ok, then go through a script of countless reasons I should keep my service or at the very least try to gift my Ooma to a friend (it's been in the trash for months).And each time it turns out that...no...they still have me as an active customer. They keep emailing me (even though I opt out), they keep calling me, they never stop.  I now just hang up on them because the simple act of helping me is not their primary motive at all.

I am extremely disappointed in this product. My boys were so excited to earn their stars when this package arrived. We sat down, talked about what chores we would all agree on, what our star rewards would be, and who was represented by each star. Then I realized the magnets were not attached to the board. I attached them specifically following the instructions, only to place the board on the refrigerator and have it come crashing down to the floor. The magnets extend past the frame and definitely are all four touching the refrigerator. They are placed exactly as directed in the diagram and the weight is balanced. These magnets simply are not strong enough for this product. They don't work whatsoever. Now I will have to damage the board to remove them and make a special trip to Office Max to find replacement magnets that work. What was the point of purchasing this board and having it shipped to my home if I now have a board that I can't use, disappointed children, and need to go hunt around town for replacement magnets. Very unhappy with this product. I expected better from this manufacturer. Dont ruin your board and attach these magnets if you purchase this item.

I should have read the reviews. I paid 4 buck for four erasers. There are supposed to be 5 in each tube. Knew I should have just bought them at the store. Save yourselves the hassle. Find them in a store and pay less for more product.

I staple quite a bit at work, going through a couple lines of staples each week.  I burned through a lot of cheap staplers before finally ordering some better ones.The last couple years, I've used a  PaperPro Desktop Stapler, Black/Gray (1100) .  It was able to get through 25+ sheets easily and consistently with almost no effort.  Downside was a loud click/bang noise which was distracting in the office.  After quite a bit of use, the stapler broke and would no longer attempt to staple anything.I ordered this Swingline Optima 40 because it was meant for heavy duty use, could staple more sheets, and would staple them flat.  I've used it for a couple months with the recommended Optima staples and it's just not very good.First, the stapler can't get through much more than 25 sheets.  Definitely can't staple as much as the PaperPro, even though that was a cheaper light duty model.Second, the staple punches through quite a bit when using fewer than 5 sheets.  Often the back of the staple will come through the top page, sometimes all the way.  Other times, the staple won't lay flat or fails to staple at all.Third, the stapler can't accept a full line of staples.  Neither could the PaperPro, but these staples are specifically designed for the Optima.  You either have to try and break off the last 10 staples or break the staples in half.  It's annoying either way.On the plus side, it's built like a tank and when it works, flat staples are great.It might be silly to nitpick a stapler, but then again, you're reading a stapler review.I'll be ordering a  PaperPro Prodigy Stapler, Black/Silver (1110)  as I like the performance and can live with the bang noise.

This stapler has a Flat Clinch stapling feature, which is supposed to make the staples flat at the tips, so multiple stapled papers can lay flat. Sounds like a good idea, but as another reviewer mentioned, the staples WILL poke your fingers. It happened to me. The regular staplers, which make the tips of the staple curve away from the surface, are much safer.

It slides around everywhere, is very uncomfortable and stiff, and is a very tall. After using it for a few hours my hand had almost completely fallen asleep. It obviously works for some people based on the the reviews but it did not work for me. Sent it back.

This jams alllll the time and when you’re doing a lot of clothes at once it gets old real fast. I mean I’m writing a review a year after I bought it and I never write reviews. What does that tell you?

I have 2 printers and so I bought this as a spare since I use a lot of ink. Putting it in today and I get an error message on both units. Checked to see if I could return it and guess what? The return date just passed.  Great, these guys have it figured out. People buy cartridges not when they need them but in case they need them and by the time they figure out that it is crap it is too late to return the product. It gets one star since I can't give it zero stars.

The black cartridges worked for a few days and then dried up. The other remanufactured cartridges do not work in my Epson XP-430 Printer. I get an error message and cannot proceed to install/use the cartridges. Back to the official cartridges for me. An expensive experiment. I'd select ) stars if I could

I had to ship things quickly so i order this scale since there were alot of reviews i was like what hell. took forever to receive so i just took it to the postal office. when i finally got it i had to buy freak batteries, no ac adapter. put it the batteries but when i turned it on there were numbers on it. so i look in the manual. it said wait a couple of second for it to warm up, i wait several. looked online, youtube, nothing. then i read that you have to recalibrate it with 10kg weights. where the hell do you get 10kg of weights. sigh.... i hope they give me a new one that works. if not a full refund.This is a update. 05/13/11So i got a e-mail today saying that they are going to give me a full refund cause they don't have any in stock. i think thats bull because they still have the item up for sale. LOL. anyways they also told me to keep the scale trash it keep whatever i want with it. lol i can't stop laugh.

These are made in China. They are flimsy and don't grip like the old made in America Boston Bull Dog clips that lasted for 50 years.  These start rusting in weeks, and half of them loose springs.This is why you should ALWAYS read the ONE STAR reviews FIRST!

This printed 12 sheets of text before running dry. I have requested a refund or replacement. If I get either, I'll update this review, but it seems from other people that a little pressure is needed to get this vendor to respond.
The product quality seems ok, but I only gave 2 stars because I was 4 short ,either their scales are off or somebody can't count. It may seem pretty but I paid for 100 not 96
This is my first negative review ever.  Junk.  Lasted just long enough to be past the return period.  Looking at all the negatives I'm not sure why Amazon allows them to continue to be sold.

The crown is too heavy or big and the clip isn't sufficient to hold it up, it flips over on my scrubs so it can't be seen. The button on the clip for my badge broke as soon as I opened it. I'm currently wearing it taped together and flipped over and not visiable, total waste of money. The one star I am forced to give would be only for the bling. It looks great, but other than looks it sucks.

I'm sure these are fine in environments where they are viewed from a distance and no one comes near enough to disturb the surrounding air space. Seriously though, it will stick to metal, weakly, but will fall off with any movement, such as opening a refrigerator door. Very disappointing, particularly given the misleading reviews and vendor claims of "strong magnetic backing" and the like.

Changing my review as the supplier raised the price by $8 so it isn't such a great deal any more.  After ordering several different kinds of poster board, most very disappointing, this one is the thickest.  I have gone many places including all office supplies store and ordered on the web but couldn't find anything much thicker than card stock. This is still not as thick as I would like but am not bad.Both sides have a matt finish but that is fine for my purpose of mounting pictures.
I am just over half the load rate of this stool. the first time I used it the top cracked in two places. Do Not Buy this one.

The quality seemed comparable to others, but my issue was that the listing was for a 700’ roll.  I ordered two. I received a refund so I’m not too upset and it could possibly have just been an error.  I’ll give the company the benefit of the doubt since so many other reviews are positive.
It’s good, but getting one star because I ordered black and got blue now I have to go out and buy black from somewhere else!

Got it with good expectation despite the reviews of jamming up with coins .. But i had to return the item because of jamming ..not a good thing...40 plus dollars.jammed almost right out the box.😞..but luckily amazon is great with returns .😍👍👍

An absolute waste of money for a flimsy cardboard box. I bought and assumbled the product and found it was less than sturdy, as advertised. I asked for a return to be charged a $6 restocking fee and $8 return label, which let me with around a $10 refund. I called them to fix the issue to get a better return rate, since the product was not as advertised, and they were less than easy to work with! Don’t buy from them!

The media could not be loaded.                      Terrible. I have never had to make a review for amazon, but this time I was extremely disappointed. The table is terrible, quality is terrible, the seems are so wide. It’s so shaky and unbalanced, the middle wood piece moves on it’s own.

Color toner on these cartridges ran out within 2 weeks of light use. The black toner cartridge is still nearly full, but the color cartridges are so low that the printer began defaulting to black and white earlier this week. Thanks for reminding me why I shouldn't be buying cheap toner cartridges.UPDATE: Vendor has reached out multiple times asking me to "simply delete my review or change it to a 5 star rating" even going as far as letting me know where to find the delete button. This magnet is NOT super strong for the purpose I bought it, which was to cover metal ceiling vents in rooms we weren't using.  These vents don't close, and I should have bought the more expensive magnetic covers that are for this purpose...  Not sure what else I can use this roll for, but if I find something that works, then I will revise my rating.

Absolutely awful! It says right on the packaging easy wipe off. This couldn't be further from the truth. Even with using a liquid cleaner it still leaves the writing on the chalk board. Its just not as bright. I have tried multiple types of liquid cleaners too, many suggestions that were in the other reviews. Nothing gets it off. This has completely ruined the board. And its not because it sat there for long, this was only after a days use. DO NOT BUY unless you want your message left permanently. Very disappointed with this purchase.

I cannot comprehend the high number of positive reviews.  This "stool" is teeny tiny, does not lock into place, and poses a very high risk to anyone standing on it.  If you read the negative reviews, they are all consistent.  Caveat emptor!!!

With two kids, having to sharpen pencils and colours every second day took a lot of time so was on a look out for a good electric helical pencil sharpener that grinds your pencil instead of shaving it. The latter I found kept cutting up the soft wood in a lot of the colours and fancy pencils the kids wanted.It was great for about 8 months but one day it just wouldn't sharpen the pencils,  the blade was sharp, put new batteries in still no luck. Amazon have offered to replace it so 5 stars for the service thereI have gone with the same sharpener as until this point it worked well.Things to be aware - It can be noisyRechargeable batteries go flat quickly, I now use them with normal batteries. I didn't try it with the hybrid low discharge batteries.Batteries can be a pain to put in as the cover is very tight and it was difficult to see the polarityI would love a sharper that has both battery and mains one together and can deal with different sizes pencils, but either they are very expensive or the reviews have not been great.One I did consider was Jakar Electric Pencil Sharpener - Model 5151 which has good reviews, but is twice the price and heavier.UpdateAfter having two more items replaced as they didnt work. I ended up with a Manual helix sharpner which is working great.I got the Swordfish 'Ikon' Desktop Manual Pencil Sharpener 8mm ref 40100

Nice design but two of the drawers were broken when the item arrived (although the box appeared to be undamaged). I tried to contact the vendor via the email address they provide but didn't get any response. I would like unbroken drawers. I'm hoping that they pay attention to reviews.

I knew after reading reviews that this was made of cardboard but I thought it was strong nice cardboard like some office supplies are made of now.  It's not!!!  It literally looks like a blue cardboard box.  This looks like a piece of junk.  I don't even know what I am going to do with it now!!!
As many reviews have pointed out even prior to use the design on pen is faded.

Similar situation to other reviews - it had a terrible clicking noise and faint stripes on the pages.We ordered four of these, the first one made the clicking noise right away, the second one seemed to work fine for the first 15 pages or so, then the clicking noise started.  Issued a refund/return for these the same day we received them.Unfortunately, this kind of quality is common with these cheaper cartridges, but the defect rate is absurd.  It's almost worth it to buy the name brand cartridge.  :-(

This pen may do what it advertises.  But, at my first attempt to use it, the tip slid into the barrel and was impossible to retrieve.  It has been awhile since this all happened, so maybe they have solved the problem.  When I saw that this pen was still being marketed I decided to write this review.  The pen is less expensive now.  Maybe I'll give it another try. I gave the product 2 stars instead of one in consideration that even good products have a failure now and then.

If I could give zero stars, I would. We received the binder today and it was definitly used. The front cover is completely bent and there's what looks like chewing gum stuck to it. Not impressed and quite pi**ed about the junk we received.
wish you had no stars because that is what it rates
This gets only one star because it is so long I cannot lower my chair to a comfortable level. Very unhappy.

Don't understand the good reviews on this product b/c it doesn't work for me at all.  I cannot figure out exactly WHERE to sit on this donut.  And, instead of improving my posture and making me sit up straight, it pitches my body forward.  The front of the pad slopes down and is supposed to help support my legs properly, but it doesn't - it makes them swell.  All in all, I don't like this thing at all!P.S.  I am a senior female of average weight and height, so that is not the issue with the fit of this pad.

After sporadic light use, the stapler stopped working.  I took it apart and discovered that the feeder (the brass thing inside with the staples) had jammed and the tension spring had snapped.  There was still enough of the spring remaining that I was able to fix it but the stapler is still touchy - sometimes not closing the staple, sometimes not stapling at all.  I find that I actually have to exert more pressure to get this stapler to function correctly than I had to with my last one - not what I call "Reduced Effort".Anyway, maybe I just got a bad one as the other reviews here seem to be really happy with the product.  At least the staples that it uses (Optima 35550) seem to be strong and durable, even if the stapler is not.

Update: Failed after a month. Just past the return window.The cylinder on my chair was going out and I searched on here for heavy duty hydraulic cylinders and this one came up well reviewed. This thing is very long and if your tall like me it will improve your seated position. It's lowest setting sits higher than the old one fully extended.I had a more difficult experience removing the old one. I had to use a 10 pound Sledge to get the bottom part out. At that point the old cylinder fell apart and to remove the chrome piece from the top portion of the chair. After working to remove it for a few hours I took it to a machine shop where they were able to remove it.

First of all I have never had to write a review this bad about any product ordered off Amazon. This product is a joke and a fast way for the company to make money off of people. The wood kept breaking every time a screw went into it, the wood is not all painted and not all matte black, the screws, nails and less were just thrown into a bag and you had to figure out which one was what, I finally got one up and the drawers are not closing easily they stick or had to fight with it to close. I put my makeup brush container on the top and it left white makes all over the top, my cat gently walked across the top and left mark. This company product is not even worth a $1

Based on just one purchase -- I won't risk another -- this no-name drum is a real no-go: lines on paper, and spatter, and gray overall...  Sometimes its printing is acceptable, just, if you keep your standards low, and other times it is just filthy, with no obvious reason, or any clue that the user can do anything about it.Avoid.I gave it 2 stars because it does print. My first one worked fine, but the next two kept printing ghost images until I stopped using them.  Bottom line, I bought 3 to get one good cartridge, same total cost as buying a regular cartridge, but more time wasted.  And I'm not sure if these cheapos will cause some permanent damage to my printer.It seems to be getting worse, as they recycle used cartridges over and over.  Look at the reviews in "Newest First" order.  DON'T BUY!

What's the point of having pictures that are completely different than the product received? This seller should be given a warning as there are many reviews saying that the item is not what is pictured. So frustrating.

I ordered this looking at the reviews and turns out that it doesn’t stick at all. I sticked it and was a little sceptical and put thumb pins around the edges (which was a good decision). The next morning I saw that its not sticking to the wall anymore.I’d recommend not buying this product.

I was very excited to receive this as it reminded me of a coin sorter that I had growing up (that one worked FOREVER).  I wanted a non battery operated sorter as a gift for my son who is learning to "save up" his money. My son opened it and immediately started putting his coins in.  Operation wasn't totally smooth and we had some issues - but I was willing to work with it.  Then the whole bottom lever broke. Within five minutes the thing was inoperable.  Unfortunately - I waited one day past the return window...now I am stuck with this piece of plastic junk.  Don't buy it.

I bought this cartridge and it printed 4 color items( not even a full page color page). It was then 100% Empty. Item was received in unacceptable condition. The binding was all crumpled and did not even reach the edges of the pad and the pad itself was completely warped in a curvy pattern. Horrible!
