I love Neenah paper, best out there. But whoever is packing and shipping this product needs a lesson in how to ship.See pictures. Pages crinkled, bent, outer wrapping was torn away from paper. Sloppy. I know Amazon probably won't allow this review, because product is good, but it is the packing and shipping that is awful.

I was looking for something a bit thinner than a traditional sticky note yet wider than a page flag for small notes. These are exactly what I was looking for! I tried a Sharpie pen with it first which didn't work, it smeared. However, I tried a fine tipped traditional Sharpie (the permanent kind) and it worked perfectly. You just have to use a permanent Sharpie to write on these and you will be all set. You get a bunch of colors and even the dark ones you can see through to text underneath it. Love them!Update: They do leave sticky residue on paper if you remove them. If you have something you're never taking off a page, go for it. If you intend to remove them, no-go. Changing my review from 4 stars to 2.
This is hands down the worst product ever. It is so thin that it breaks every time. Then you spend the next half hour trying to find the ends. They need a minus star set to even rate it.

I don't often write reviews but felt this was an important one to relay, I see there have been a couple other recent reviews complaining of the same issue.  The 2X2's themselves aren't too bad, a little thin but no big deal, in fact I don't mind the carboard being thin.HOWEVER - the windows are very foggy and almost appear to have a residue on them giving it a matte appearance.  Not only does this make for poor viewing of your coins but what exactly IS that residue?  I'm not willing to take a chance, I should have gone with a better known brand out of the gate.

It's an August through July planner. The left page of the August month is missing. The August tab is stuck on the September calendar. The October tab is there but the calendar is missing. The December tab is missing as well as the left page of the December calendar. The November tab is stuck on the wrong calendar page.  The top of the spirals were bent.  I should have read more reviews. I see other people had the same issues.
Printed about 7 sheets and ran out of ink. I'm surprised Amazon allows the sale of this product. Gave it 1 star only because I had to !

Be carful, it’s NOT Safe on the sidewalks.The front wheel are way to small and they get stuck in every little bump on the street (while you crossing) and on the sidewalks. It’s literally flipping over  and extremely dangerous for elderly!!!I am sorry for this reviews but I did seriously hurt myself....I am not old and in pretty good shape to handle it and don’t break my legs.

I bought this product 1 month ago. This is the first time I am reviewing any product, because I felt so frustrated. After printing about 500 pages, the ink has faded. This is hopeless. It is much better to spend more and not get frustrated, and buy again.

I’m unable to put all wheels in because one side seems to be defective. I’m not looking to write this bad review but I can’t find a way to speak to someone directly. If there is a way to fix this via a longer screw in caster or a new bottom side frame I’ll appreciate the quick accommodation and forget about the initial defect.

Terrible quality, as other reviewers mentioned, the edges curl up and the magnetic strength is really weak. Tried to make a bunch of magnets to sell at a craft fair and none of them were acceptable. Cost me a lot of wasted money in the cost of this item, and the cost of the stickers I printed to affix.It's a shame, because the ProMag brand is one that I've used before and loved! I think it's just this specific product that doesn't work, though. The sheet is too thin I think.  I have some of the thicker magnet paper (comes in a 3 pack, I think), and the magnets I made out of that 5 years ago are still working perfectly.  Don't cheap out on the thin paper, it doesn't work - definitely go for the thicker kind.

As others have mentioned, the font will be much smaller than you would like it to be. Most people will have trouble reading it.Unless you press extremely lightly, there are also black marks that appear next to the text which made it look very cheap and unprofessional. See picture.The seller did refund my purchase, so I'm leaving two stars.

I don't really understand all the good reviews.  I got this a while ago for when I need to staple larger stacks of paper and mailing labels for my business.  For one, it hardly staples more than my trusty red Swingline standard stapler.  And when I do try to use it, it's CONSTANTLY jamming up.  Countless staples have just gotten stuck in whatever I'm trying to staple, and I just end up using a paper or binder clip to hold the documents together.  It's long overdue to just buy an actual heavy duty stapler that can handler more than a couple sheets without jamming.
The planner I received was 3.5 x 5.5"  - not 8.25 x 5".  Would be 5 stars otherwise.

I used 8513 refill earlier, which was buttery smooth, nice flow, clear ink and all the characteristics which felt like "Cross". But this one is bitterly disappointing. Not smooth, not so dark ink, not even remotely "cross" like. I wish I could return it and get my money back. For 300 bucks all you are getting is refill called "crap" not "cross". I should have gone with other bad reviews here and not bought it at all.

I have been looking for a Rolodex for quite some time, and settled with this. I wish I had read the reviews prior to doing so, as it is big, clunky, and not at all what I expected. Pretty angry that I am unable to return it.

Service was good --arrived on time, but the product does not stand up. It is  certainly not  a "high yield" cardridge (as TN450 is rated) and we ran through these cartridges very quickly -- less than half the capacity of other replacement brands we have used.

One star is too much, this item should have the tiniest star sliver. Enough to inform the potential purchaser that, yes you will receive something, but it will not work...at all and will most likely fail within minutes of attaching your work badge and extending it to scan said badge.

This is the first time I've felt compelled to write a review on Amazon. I've generally had good experiences with items I've bought, thinking that the overall ratings would be correlated to a reasonable extent with the actual quality of the product. This was not the case with this toner cartridge.I wish I had paid more attention to the 500+ 1-star reviews. It's easy to disregard them when you see a relatively high overall rating, but in this case, I am sorry that I didn't heed the multitude of warnings for this product.I have a Brother HL-2270DW printer, and this was the first time I was replacing the toner cartridge for it. I followed the very poorly written instructions that came with this cartridge and had no success in convincing my printer to turn off its error light. I tried all possible resets that I could find online, and I even called Brother (which included a 30-minute hold time) to ask for support over the phone. Brother had no idea what was wrong and referred me to a local business machines store, where they were able to confirm that this toner cartridge was the problem. The toner simply doesn't work.My advice -- DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I am very disappointed that Amazon still offers this item given how many awful reviews exist. Then again, I'm very disappointed in my own naive hope that a significantly-cheaper-than-brand-name product from this manufacturer would be a sufficient replacement. No free lunch, I guess. :)

Desperately needs a mouse pad of some sort.  If you are sitting on the sofa using this - where do you put your mouse?  I see there is an attachable mouse pad to buy for this as an attachment, but reviews of that mouse pad are very bad.

What a nightmare.  I had a desk chair mat at home for years but it was beginning to crack.  So I ordered this.  It's not that wasn't heavy duty as represented but it came so tightly wound it was almost impossible for me to open it up.  I needed the help of another person and heavy weighted objects and it took me way over an hour.  In the end it wasn't worth the aggravation.  The last mat I bought came in a big box, I opened it and put it down.  Unless you are a weightlifter and have a lot of time to spend trying to unwind it and flatten it out, I don't recommend it.I had to lower my review to one stars since I can't stop the mat from curling up at the edges and I've had weights sitting on the corners for a while now.  I almost tripped a couple of times.
I don't know why this rickety piece of plastic got good reviews. It is not good quality and is going to break. I would never have bought it had I known that.

This is a very cheaply made stapler! Jams/diffult to open for loading.  I bought 3, 2 broke completely soon after purchase and I threw them away! The third one just died today-it only made 1 year. I figured a review was I order!

The media could not be loaded.                      I don’t know how this has any good reviews. There are literally no casters for the drawers, it’s wood on plastic and they are not properly fitted, so you legit have to yank the drawer out. The bottom of the drawer can easily slid out of the back because the back piece does not have a notch to secure it. The pieces are not labeled and the instructions are not very clear are to what part is front or back when beginning. And yes, I have made sure everything was tight and correct before putting the drawers in, so it’s not user error. Avoid this item and save for something better! I hate that this cost so much and is not worth $15 tops. Will be returning.

This Toner is horrible. Do not waste your time trying to save money like i did. The good reviews on here are not real people.. I tried every trick in the book to get the toner to work. Shaking it, running lots of paper through it and nothing worked...... Bottom line spend the extra money and get the Brother recommended one.

The old bait and switch.I ordered what I thought was going to be the Ultra Pro "Special Combo Deal" of the sleeves and the top loads and instead they shipped me an inferior brand. Maybe the vendor or customers think its the same, but nevertheless it's not what I ordered. I can only assume it's a cheaper product and Wowzzer makes more money when they sub out the actual product for a cheaper one. I guess it's always a gamble when you order online. Makes you think - how can there be so many positive reviews for a product? Answer skews to the shining 5 star reviews must be written by the vendors cousin, brother or nephew.Here's a little about me as a hobbyist: I'm a sports card and memorabilia collector and have been collecting since 1984. I have a special collection of valuable rookie cards and only trust placing them in the right plastic sleeves and hard holders. I've used Ultra Pro in the past and that's why I ordered them. But as mentioned, the vendor shipped another brand (BCW) instead.The sides of the BCW top loaders have awkward oil and glue markings. Overall, they are thinner than Ultra Pro. BCW holders also have more give (an undesirable characteristic). They are softer and more flexible then the Ultra Pro ones pictured. This means they are not the best product to protect your cards.  Don't get me wrong, they are not horrible. I just don't like them as much as the ones I thought I was buying, which were a better product.I guess the one thing I can't complain about is the price. They are very cheap and offer decent value, hence the 2 stars. Just be fair warned, you may not get the brand you want and if you read the small print they point out that the ol' "switcheroo" is likely a comin.I would not use these for my more valuable cards but perhaps those I might sell to someone else in a short amount of time. I think that sums it up!
Bout them before,work excellent. From last order,don't work at all. That is the reason for the change of rating.

Thought I would try because of low price and good reviews. The cartridge printed a few pages and then the printer would not recognize the cartridge, and no more printing. I have used several remanufactured ink cartridges in the past and have never had this problem.

I had these board for approximately a week, and pulled the marker out of the attached holder may three or four time before the entire holder simple fell apart, broken into little tiny pieces. On one, it was simply broken before we even received it.  Highly disappointing based on the reviews I read before ordering.
I order one of these based on the reviews.  Not my experience I'm afraid.  It jammed more than it sorted. Returned.  I'd rather pay the 10% sort fee than go through this aggravation.
JunkThese reviews are ridiculous!This thing is PURE CRAPJust vibrates one spot on your body

I really wish I had read the reviews before purchasing, but figured I'd be safe. I mean, they're just cards, right? As many others have noted, there is no adhesive on the envelopes. Really disappointed.
Doesn't even deserve one star--has never turned on since it arrived.  I put it next to a window for a day in case the solar battery needed to charge, still nothing.  Don't waste your money.

Chair broke away from base (same as pictures already posted by other reviewers).  Contacted the company for replacement parts.  They said they would send them but it has been over a month now and no parts.  They also will not answer calls any longer.  Huge waste of money.
I bought 3 stamps and today was the first time I used them.The star stamp broke immediately. Sucks because my students really liked these stamps but it doesn't even work anymore.

If I can give this product 1 star I would .I am someone that doesn’t like to complain and I don’t really take time to write reviews about the products that I bought . But I will spare time to write about this markers . A completely waste of money!On the video that I watched before I purchased the markers every thing looks nice and fun , but as soon as I open the package and tried to use the markers they seem all dry out!I will post a video as soon as I have the time .Really disappointed with this product.Next time I will use water colors instead .

Accurate information listed, would have gotten 5 stars had the badge been better quality, I feel it is very cheaply made, flimsy I expected it to be similar to a credit card and instead it's pretty much a piece of laminated paper... I did receive two in my order so I'll keep the second one as a spare for when the first one wears out... I'm an emt so it's a nice quick reference if needed in the field.. Like i said the information printed is accurate and there is a lot more printed than what I had expected.. Also on the back of then card maybe try printing it "upside down" so when we flip it over its right side up its kind of a pain to flip it over and then having to mess with my other badges to try and read the information

I used this scale for years without any problem. Up until 2011. The hallmark feature of this scale is supposed to be its ability to download UPS, FedEX and USPS rates from the internet. Royal has failed to upgrade the software for this machine in years, and as a result, you will NEVER be able to use the built-in rates. The available software will not install on Windows 7 if it THINKS you have a 64bit machine. You must run a 32bit version, and the software may still not install. If you can get it to install, you will not be able to upgrade your machine, i.e. the firmware. It will work on 32bit XP, but it still cannot update the firmware, just the latest rates Royal has compiled. The latest update from Royal was years ago, and the latest UPS and FedEx rates it will download is 2007, and 2011 for the Postal Service. DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT A PC ENABLED SCALE.

I wish I could reply to other reviews! So, I bought these to use with my Rocketbook Fusion & Rocketbook flashcards. I wanted to use them in university. I can't seem to understand how other users got the highlighters to show up without smearing their writing or to even show up in scan. As you can see from my pictures, I applied light pressure and it did an okay job (although subtle smearing) but then when I scanned it with the Rocketbook app, it doesn't even show! I wish they worked for me like they did with another reviewer where it clearly shows them working like normal. Anyway, if anyone can reply to this or somehow let me know, that would be cool. For now, I think I will return because they did not work for me unfortunately and I guess I won't be highlighting. I plan to use colored pens when needed and normal black/blue for the rest.

I gave it a low rating because of the following:1. One of three units I bought caused paper jam warning. Repeated re-installation could not clear it. I returned it and ordered a new one. The new one worked.2. The capacity is low and variable. Three units I bought printed 1200, 1278 and 720 pages (Ave. 1066). I did the shaking/re-insertion routine when the low toner warning first showed up. That milked about 80-100 more low-quality pages. All my prints are single-space text documents. No pictures or photographs.You get what you paid for. It's true that "your yield may vary" and that at 1/4 of the price of a genuine Brother cartridge (2600 pages claimed), one should not expect to get the same number of pages. However, the claims of  "High Yield" and "2600 pages capacity" by the Amazon listing are misleading and down-right false advertisement.It is one's own judgment whether to buy this item.

Unfortunately, both units we received had the same issue, a clip on the side is broken.  The clip holds the toner securily in the device and this is definitely a surprise since the reviews were great!I am returning both broken toners and am getting our go to LD brand...

This planner is cute and small enough to easily carry around in your bag or purse. However the back cover arrived damaged. Because other reviewers have had the same complaint, I have opted out of a replacement and will instead look into another brand. I unfortunately already began to write in this planner before I realized the defect and I hope this doesn’t affect my return process. Buyer beware.

This thing is not worthy of putting anything of value near it. It is not sturdy or stable. I would give it less stars if that were possible. A TV dinner table would be a better option with no assembly and cheaper.

Pen is attractive in appearance, but as others have noted the cap does not stay securely on the pen when writing or when positioned for writing.  Had to return it and am somewhat surprised that it is being sold with such an obvious design flaw.  Am always hesitant to give poor reviews to a product, but strongly advise against purchasing this item.

I was looking for a nice pen for work as my company has switched to buying the cheapest pens they can get. I took a chance on this one as it is prime and had good reviews. I really dislike the  pen, it has a very sharp point which makes me feel like it is digging into the paper, the pen must be rotated every so often as you write so the ink will come out, and the body of the pen is super light while the clip is heavy which creates a strange balance. I went to return the pen but it will cost half the cost of the pen in shipping even though it is prime.

Got the toner cartridge and swapped out the old, original one, but still get the Low Toner message.I read the other reviews on how to disable this message, but this just disable the toner monitoring on the printer.So while it's cheaper I'm not confident that it will work correctly and that I may be surprised when it does run out.11/15: Stopped working completely. At least the company refunded me the money.

The mouse pad is ergonomically comfortable, looks and feels great. However.....My mouse does not work with the pad, it simply doesn't track the movement on the screen. Sensitive mouse? Material of the pad? Not sure why it does't work with my mouse. When going back to my old pad or others in the office it works fine. This is the only reason for the two star review.

The first time I bought one of these carts was about 2 years.  I used it to go grocery shopping, about a 4-mile round-trip for me, up and down a lot of hills. I buy a lot of food at one time because the trip is exhausting and this cart generally carried it all very well.  It folded nicely and was easy to store.  It was great!About 1 year after owning it, one of the wheels fell off on a shopping trip.  I managed to save it and get the cart home again.  I repaired the wheel with a simple screw and it worked fine for another year.About 2 months ago on a grocery trip, another wheel fell off.  This time I could *not* find the lost wheel, so I could not repair the cart again.  I ordered a new one, thinking it would be as great as the old one had been.I WAS WRONG.What I got was a piece of JUNK (I'd used stronger words, but I want this review to be posted.)  The types of wheels had been changed.  Instead of the former rubber ones, these were now plastic.  The problem was these new wheels were TOO BIG for the cart itself!  The cart would no longer fold properly, because it had NOT been redesigned for these larger wheels.  The new wheels also interfered with the ability for the card to move properly!I went on my first grocery shopping trip with the new cart.  Getting the cart there and back was an ongoing problem during the trip because the wheels kept hitting the metal of the cart.I returned home with my food and when I got there, one of the metal supports for a wheel *BROKEN*, nearly collapsing the cart and spilling all my groceries.The cart was RUINED.  It was UNREPAIRABLE.  After using it ONCE!  I threw it out in the trash the next day.  I couldn't stand to see it and think of the money I had wasted.I am on a very-fixed income; the lost of the $20 for this piece of junk cart is money I could not afford to waste.  But this cart is now long gone, taken away in the trash where it belonged in the first place.  It should NEVER have been sold because of the replaceable of the old type of wheels with cheaper ones which did NOT FIT.  Either wheels of the same size as had been previously used for it should have been added - or the metal cart itself should have been redone to properly fit these larger wheels.Now I have to find and buy and pay for another large cart to carry my groceries; I have to find a way to afford it.  You can be certain I will *NOT BUY* a 3rd one of these carts!** UPDATE! **I also posted negative feedback to this seller's account.  A short time after that I got a email from him offering me a full-refund if I would change my negative feedback to positive.I said "No".The fact is, this seller is likely going to *keep* selling these shopping cards that are defective as can be seen in the *recent*, very negative reviews here.  He is also likely going to keep selling a lot more of these carts in different colors in other Amazon listings.I'm out my money, which as I said, I truly cannot afford to waste.  However, I am not going to change ANYTHING that might warn people here these carts are seriously defected because changes that were made to the wheels -- and DO NOT BUY ONE!  I can't afford to have waste money of this piece of junk, but I would rather loose that money in the hope that someone else might NOT buy one of these carts because of my review.* * * * * * * * * * *AGAIN, DO NOT BUY THIS CART!  IT IS JUNK!  IT *WILL* BREAK A *VERY* SHORT TIME AFTER YOU START USING IT!* * * * * * * * * * *

Pen is great but doesn't come in a package just a pen with a label on it 1 star is for the shipping method NOT the pen. Does not match the picture above. Label left sticky residue on pen had to wash the pens to get it off. Its like they opened a multi pack and sold them individually. 3 pens no package just pens

Used it once and it fell apart, not broken, just apart.  I contacted them for help to put it back together.  They said they would follow up on it??  It should be a very simple request, but a month has gone by with no reply.  So they get one star until I hear back.
The pig tops are cute, and they're removable, so you can put them on other pens or pencils. However, the pens literally don't work, so I have to give the product one star.

WORST. SHARPENER. EVER.  I usually save hate speech for people, but this sharpener is asking for it.  It sharpens half of the pencil.  So one side will look perfect, and the other one has the lead still covered by the pencil's wood.  (ha ha).  I can't believe that I spent $25 on this piece of crap.I just bought a Westcott electric pencil sharpener at Costco this morning.  For $11.  IT IS AWESOME!!!Hopefully this review saves someone money.  I might as well have just lit $25 cash on fire.

Read many reviews and decided on this one since the positive ones said it was the most stable which was important... couldn't be more displeased. Package arrived with one small piece of flat styrofoam, the center boards top left corner was crushed due to lack of padding then part D which is where the wheels go on...the welding was broken so it was at a permanent wobble. I don't know what is going on but my husband had to spend more money on parts to fix this desk that we paid for it since a replacement desk was not available.

This is an update for a previous review on this product.  I bought two of these cartridges (my first mistake) and the first began to fade within a few hundred printed pages.  My previous review mentioned this.  Shortly thereafter, I tossed the first cartridge in hopes that the second would be better....but I was wrong.  Printed less than 100 pages before the printing began to fade.I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  IT IS THE WORST RE-MANUFACTURED TONER CARTRIDGE I HAVE EVER SEEN OR PURCHASED.

This toner doesn't print. It constantly flashes Error light. The first print with paper jam (Error light flashed). After reset cartridge  multiple times (turn off, open front door, clicking Go button twice, wait for 3 lights on (whether wait 30s or not) ,  then click on Go button 7 times ... etc per online tip), then it finally allowed me to print again. But instantly, the paper jammed. It doesn't matter I use duplex or not, paper jams. The "Error" light does not go off even I tried to reset cartridge multiple times. Then I switch to old toner, the problem went away.) Strangely, I bought the same kind of toner (from different seller) 1 year ago which worked. The quality is unstable. The problem is I didn't test this one when it was delivered couple months ago ( since it was working before); now when I really needed it, I could not return it even it doesn't work. So if you do plan to buy this toner, make sure to test it right away to see if it work not. After reviewed my previous orders from different sellers I am not sure if they are the same OEM product. However, Amazon seems always link to this Cool Toner Compatible link now, even though my previous purchase link name doesn't have "Cool Toner".

Did not work.  There is no way to tell what is wrong with the print head, which is why I give this 2 stars.  Very messy.  If you buy this, wear gloves.I wouldn't waste my money on this again.  Just ordered a new printer.
This was such a let down. I will be returning it. I’ve nver been so disappointed with a creative teaching press product. I should have read the reviews first.

I do a lot of art work, and got this paper cutter so I could cut different shapes. But it is IMPOSSIBLE to cut it the way you like it with this cutter. You can hardly see where you are cutting.Like the positive reviews state, it may be great for opening packages and covers, when you dont care about if you are cutting them neat or not.If you want this for art work or for cutting paper neatly in a line, please dont buy this.

When I print BLACK only, the print sometimes is very faded and with a little salmon color!  But the worst part, I now have a reminder of how bad these cartridges are... blue ink spots on my carpet and clothes!  I was very careful opening the last one, yellow, which was only about 3/4 full and it leaked too but I was prepared!  Will NEVER buy  these again, one star is too high a rating!  Waste of money and very unhappy about the damage the leaking caused.
I read the reviews and took a chance anyway. I should have listened. Yes the product is real wood, however it’s very cheaply made. Not sturdy at all. Try a different product

This shelf organizer came with good instructions and was easy to assemble, but the description should have indicated that this is constructed of flimsy cardboard. And the packaging scheme resulted in a crease in the middle of he left wall, which compromises the stability of this item when loaded. i should have returned this item, but I had destroyed the shipping box before I realized the problems. Buyer beware. READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE YOU BUY ANYTHING ON LINE!

I set up the stamp with our name and address and tried to use it.  It was disappointing the stamp did not leave a clear impression.  It was very spotty. So, I decided to leave it for a week to let the stamp to absorb more ink.  When I tried it next it was not any better.  Later on, it still does not stamp clearly.  If my puppy had not chewed up the tweezers I would have definitely returned it for a refund.It has now been several months since my review and I thought I would let everyone know, it still does not work.

I bought two of these pens at Office Depot recently and have used all four colors on a fairly constant level. After only a few days of use the red ink will only write for around 3 seconds before going dry which requires you to wait a minute before attempting to write again. This is a problem in both pens and no conventional fixes for ball points have helped. Without this repeating problem it would be at least a 4 star pen.

The reviews seem to be either 1 star or 5 stars, which is indicative of an employee or hired hand falsifying the high ratings.  I would disregard all the 4 and 5 star ratings, which should give you valid information.  Check the web to see how these husksters operate.  By the way, the toner cartridge I purchased turned out to be worthless.

One of three purchased for group to decide to give to promoted boss.  We ALL LOVED the looks of this one - very thick, classy, nice color.  But as all of the other reviews, it arrived mostly unglued.  Had the color matched the bosses new desk, we would have glued it together and given it to her.  This matched her current desk and we were all hopeful, but it would not have looked good on her light brown desk.  Because other reviewers stated the return charges and postage were cost prohibitive for return, I still have this.  If anyone wants it for the postage to send it (and you'll have to glue it yourself, we didn't bother), just let me know!

Wish I checked to see if these cartridges worked as soon as i got them because now the 30 day return policy is gone and i wasted $32.50. DOES NOT WORK WITH PRINTER MODEL MFC-J480DW. Cartridges are not recognized at all.  Someone should seriously remove a few models from the product heading as other reviews state there model printer doesn't work as well.

I bought this cart after reading several reviews and decided to spend more money on this cart vs others available because it claimed to be “heavy duty and able to withstand sidewalk bumps” etc. This cart broke the first time I used it, leaving the grocery store. Its stated to be rated up to 300 pounds. The entire structure just collapsed!  See Photos attached.  The failure sprained my ankle and elbow when i fell on my side.  Please replace. So, I ordered this based off of the reviews... and for the first time I am extremely disappointed. It seemed like such a durable piece of metal, guess I was wrongI live and work in NYC, and used this belt clip daily... I typically clipped this to the inside of my blazer and within 2 weeks my ID had disappeared. Had no idea it snapped off the string and have no idea how it happened. But waiting over a week to get this in a mail and for it to not even last a month is EXTREMELY disappointing. I will not recommend nor order this again.

I bought 3 of these for skiing based on the excellent reviews. I had to put them in the drier every night as they were all wet from a day of skiing or playing in the snow. Just terrible! I am returning all of them!

This pack of pens showed 14 pens in the product photo but arrived as a pack of 12 of 8 colors and did not include the orange, yellow or brown pens which I was most excited about. Because I have been looking for a brown ballpoint pen... I should have red the reviews...I will keep them because I like these pens but disappointed about what was actually received.

Some pens worked great, some didn’t work at all. For a lot of the pens I had to go over the same stroke multiple times to get the full color. The ink does not go onto the paper very well and some of the brush tips were separated and went on the paper in split lines. For the high rating, I was disappointed with the quality.

I was so surprised to see such high reviews. This item doesn’t stick to the wall for anything! I even laid it flat for an extra day beyond the directions and it still doesn’t stay on the wall. Disappointed. Don’t waste your money.
Much the same as other reviews the cartridges are not full (pic enclosed)Very poor

Very poor ink quantity, the ink only lasted for less than 50 prints of text only, I even had the printer sent on draft, that uses less ink.I Returned for refund.This is made in china and it shows!This is a update to my review...the company had sent me a 100% refund for the returned product, for this action I will give them 5 stars!

I don't believe this box is the brand they advertise. Photos show a nameplate but this box doesn't have one. It is very badly made. Screws sticking out. The corners of the lid don't even join like the photos show, they are angled out and separate and therefore a danger which can result in bad cuts to you. The edges are rough. It also bulges out in the middle. Honestly I would have to classify it as a piece of garbage. Every time you go to pick it up or open it you will have to be slow and careful in your movements because there are so many rough dangerous edges and screws sticking out that you will end up cutting yourself on it. It comes in a plain brown box with the words made in china on it. No brand at all. It looks like a cheap knock off. Very disappointing.  I would give zero stars if there was the option.

When I needed this it was not compatible with the machine I had! It was to big...The time to send it back was to late! Since I always buy extra, so I don't run out! There was not way to contact any "Human" I would love to get a good one and send a positive review.....

This cartridge said it was for my printer, but it didn't come with any instructions at all. The cartridge didn't seem to fit properly in the cartridge opening and it stuck twice. I tried the instructions printed by others to get the toner message off the printer but that was unsuccessful. A total waste of money and possibly did damage to my printer. I'd give this 0 stars if I could.
I will attach photos to justify the poor review I am given. Please note, this are the first pages I ever printed with this ink.

This is NOT a pencil sharpener for anyone but very careful adults.  The shavings container is only a semi-circle of thin plastic, not a cup, so to empty shavings "constantly" as the instructions suggest, means you'll have to open it over a plastic bag, or for sure shavings will get all over.  That review was in my mind before I plugged it in.  Then I discovered it doesn't work.  Sending back now.

I wish I could give this product less than 1 star.  I guess you get what you pay for.  I was looking for a cheap scale and I found one.  Cheap in every respect.  Scale will not set to zero and the numbers on the display are constantly jumping around.  Run far and fast from this product.  Spend a little more on something else and get a LOT more.

Like many other reviews have said, this thing is a flimsy piece of crap. I bought it with the intention of using it for a specific project and didn't want to break the bank on a more expensive compass, so I settled for this. The moment I tried to use it, the issues started piling up. Every time you try to draw with this, several different things are going to happen. One, the needle at the center of the circle will move out of place. Two, the line it produces, if it produces one at all, will be broken and deformed as you struggle to twist it while keeping the center in place. Three, the arm will bend all over the place once you finally get the pressure and directionality perfect. Four, the arms will move further apart as you go, forcing you to readjust after every single circle you manage to make. Anything you manage to draw out of this will be an extremely thick broken line in the general shape of a circle, likely one without a consistent radius. Do yourself a favor and pay the extra $10-20 bucks for a higher quality model. This is a waste of money in every possible sense.
It's not as sturdy as the photo indicates with the muscle man. It's clearly photo-shopped. I would give it 0 stars, other than easy to fold.

I do not recommend this. I got it at work and it is the most uncomfortable pad i have ever gotten. the padding is stiff compared to gel based ones. The pads on the bottom do not stick but are a hardened rubber that slides around on the desk. If you are not at the perfect height which is based on your desk to wrist ratio  you will end up with a kink in your wrist. This aggravates my Carpel Tunnel worse than any pad I have used. The one I have at home for gaming and long computer use is much better. It is the deadpool mouse pad with a gel chest where my wrist rests gently in the crease of his pecks. If there was a 0 star rating I would be using that for the above purchase.

It was broken when I received it but the packaging did not reveal any damage that could explain the state of the box inside when it arrived. The metal hinges were torn like paper. Generally, when I see a critical review of a product priced this low  I think the buyer's expectations are unrealistic for the price they paid. So, I can't fault anyone who is reading this and thinking to themselves "you get what you pay for" but I would have been fine getting something worth what I paid or even a little less, because I'm pretty sure that's how commerce works on a good day. Here the lesson is a low price alone isn't enough to stop you from paying to much.

I was looking for a planner that was more than just a to-do list and after owning many different kinds I saw this one. I can’t believe how huge it is! I have your average 5 1/2x8 1/2 planner book and this is huge, needlessly so. The description doesnt mention the size, it takes up half my desk when it’s open, so it sits closed on the floor and I keep my to-do page on the desk. The weekly assessment pages ask questions about the day. So it’s confusing and I haven’t used it. I have gone back to using the planner pages I have designed myself in my own planner. And I would expect a planner such as this would be 90 days, though I knew it was 60 when I bought it. I gave it two stars because the quality of the cover and paper stock is nice and the day layout is too.
Wish I could write a review about this ink. But instead I received the wrong ink twice. Going with a different seller to hopefully get the ink after 3 weeks. Frustrating to say the least.

This company talks about how great this drawer unit is because its made of real wood, not particle board. Okay, yes, its real wood. I give them that. But get ready - its a real hassle to build it (unless you have a DRILL which we don't). It took us two hours, using a Philips head screwdriver and by the time I was finished, my hands and arms were really sore! The worst of it is, the bottoms of the drawers have no lock pins, nor does the manufacturer provide "brads" or even small nails to secure the drawer bottoms at the back, so they simply are free to slide out of the little "grooves" provided for them. See the pic attached. As a temporary fix, I put a piece of gaffers tape across the bottom to keep the drawer bottom from sliding out. Next step - going to Home Depot to get some small industrial staples or small nails so I can "jerry-rig" this thing, and take the gaffers tape off. All in all, this one issue is INFURIATING: it simply means this a STUPID/INEPT DESIGN, and extremely CARELESS ENGINEERING by the manufacturer. If they included little staples or extra nails to hammer in to hold the drawer bottoms in place, I would have given this a 4 star review. I hope the manufacturer actually reads this, as its a situation that could be easily remedied.

When buying a replacement cartridge there is only really one thing that matters: whether it works or not.  This one does not.  I see many people have reported success with this cartridge, but the one I got was a mess, and I'm lucky it didn't ruin my printer.  It leaked toner all over the inside of the printer, printed large 1" thick black lines down each page, and was just a total failure.  It was installed into a once-used official Brother toner carrier.  If you judge by the star ratings, this has 4 stars.  That means a lot of people are lucky enough to get a good one.  So if you buy this product, what is the chance yours will be a failure?  Making some simplifying assumptions, that 1-star reviews are failures, and 5-star reviews are good, there is a 25% chance yours will be a dud.  Maybe look somewhere else.

This is my first review of anything.  I have been buying more on Amazon because I have a Prime membership and it is so easy to order.  I may have gotten a little carried away buying a package of 12 pens I would not spend the money on trying to return.These pens are useless to me since my first pen is blotting after hardly any use.  I prefer a fine point, am not fussy about blue or black, but a pen that blots is useless to me.  I do not want to sign a letter or card only to have my pen blot.  I do a fair amount of note taking and underlining in books and I do not want my pen to leave blots of ink.There did not seem to be an option to give no stars, but since I do not plan to use any of the box of 12 pens I just bought, I cannot imagine why I would give them any stars at all.Do not buy these pens.  I read the good reviews about them before I ordered, but my pen is leaving huge blots of ink.

I'm pretty much in the same boat as all the other 1-2 star reviewers out there. Didn't see the fine print that said "May come in BCW depending on availability blah blah".tl;dr Expected Ultra Pro toploaders/sleeves, got BCW. Too much of a hassle to return for such a small amount. I plan on getting these again, making 100% sure they are Ultra Pro this time.

I read other product reviews that said it might not be compatible with my brother printer, but I thought I would luck out.  Sadly I was not amongst those luck people.  I tried the trouble shooting suggestions but they were not successful.  Please be careful when purchasing this product.

I have been an advocate of the solid ink printers since Tektronix first introduced them because nothing comes close to producing print shop quality output at this price, but after having owned an 8500DN and an 8570DN I am moving on to something that has a much higher durability and a lower initial buy-in. Rated at 85,000 images a month, I managed only 13,466 images before the print head started leaking and because a refurbished replacement costs 70% of a new unit and the ink is another 80% it truly is disposable once the ink runs out. If you want to impress on that single project then print and go but don't expect it to support your needs for the next couple of years, you're just throwing away money.

This cartridge was not recognized in my printer and would not print. I have an HP Officejet Pro 8630Update: I have changed my stars to 5 because the seller's integrity warrants it. I have not used the replacement cartridges yet as I had to purchase others when the originals did not work. If they do not work I will update again.UPDATE 09/14/2018 I HAVE INSTALLED THE REPLACEMENT CARTRIDGES. THOUGH THIS SELLER IS AWESOME THIS PRODUCT DOES NOT WORK IN THE HP OFFICEJET PRO 8630 NOT ONLY DO I GET AN ERROR BEFORE IT PRINTS. I THEN HAVE TO RESTART THE PRINTING AND THEN THE COLORS ARE NOT EVEN CLOSE. I AM SURE IT IS AN HP ISSUE AS THEY WANT YOU TO BUY THEIR PRODUCT. BUT I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT FOR THIS PARTICULAR PRINTER.

The print quality with this ink set is terrible. (The printer worked perfect before running out of ink last week)  After changing to these inks the prints all of ink blobs and is missing details like simple lines.  (please see attached photo for this review)  The colors are not crisp, for example a purple container looks blueish grey.  The inks almost seem watered down.

I *should* have read the reviews before  I bought this - my bad.  I bought this to stamp the backs of my art/photography prints that I sell, and since it is near impossible to read, and my email address line is impossible to read correctly, it is therefore useless to me.  To make matters worse, this is the second of these stamps I've bought - on the first one, they had my name spelled wrong!  I didn't even bother trying to return that one, although I definitely should have!  At least with this one, I'll be receiving a credit to my account.  MY ADVICE to anyone thinking about buying one of these...  don't even *think* about it, just do not do it!  If I could, I would give this item ZERO STARS!

the front wheels are very bad for going over bumps - such that I fell today - would not recommend this for a fragile senior like myself - and the handle is very narrow and forces you to keep your arms in the center to push the cart - this is very uncomfortable- and there is not enough foam on the handle only in the center - for the price i paid  - and the description and reviews that i read i expected more - yes it is lightweight - but is that because it is smaller than most carts like this?the only good things i can say is that the wheels are much quieter than other carts like this and they pivot very well, and they do give good screen metal in the front and back so your stuff does not fall out - but - the sides are left with big gaping spaces so stuff can fall out on the sidesI have had many carts over the years and this is the first time that a cart has caused me to fall that is why i give this a bad rating

These things are super flimsy the film is so thin worst than saran wrap! The cardboard is super fragile and easily scratch or bendt. I'm confused as to the good reviews. Maybe I got a bad batch. But for 14 bucks what i got was utterly a disappointment 😞

SAVE YOURSELF the aggravation and the wasted money... DO NOT BUY IT  --- I inserted the replacement cartridge into my printer on Dec 14th immediately upon receipt.  Was hoping it would function like other customers had stated, but it streaked immedieatly from the outset.  This is such a POOR product that is not worth spending your time or money to buy.  Spend your $15 on somewhere else.  Evidently, you are buying a "re-furbished" cartridge that only has new toner in it and cannot be expected to function well enough to print normally.  Considering it functioned so poorly, I would recommend buying a refurbished cartridge for about $37 from LDProducts -- like I have from the past.  At least LDP guarantees that your replacement cartridge will function properly or you get a replacement.  I made the mistake of thinking I could buy one for half the price, but got STUNG.  Apparently, the customers who gave this product a 5-star rating, are either grossly misrepresenting the product or they "lucked out" somehow.  DO'NT WASTE YOUR MONEY.  Buy a replacement cartridge that has a guarantee.  I'll NEVER buy this product again....
Can't imagine why it got good reviews.  Won't sharpen to a good point at all and breaks off pieces in the process.

I was really upset when I received my item in a beat-up box where the paper cutter handle was exposed and was just hanging by a thread with the tape around it. It was not very pleasing to the eyes. I bought this cutter because of the reviews and the price. Sometimes, it's better to pay more to have fewer headaches.Some of my thoughts...1. The box that it came in was beat-up. It was the original box but come on, it was ripped everywhere.2. There was a clinging sound inside. A tiny piece broke off (probably from the shipping) when I was trying to take off the tape to open the box.3. The locking mechanism was broken. When I finally got all of the tapes around the box, that handle with a freaking sharp edge just popped open on my face. That was a little something. There's no way for me to lock it in place either.  So it just stayed lifted. Not safe at all.4. The handle is already chipped and the adjustable backstop was fractured (plastic material).5. The paper cutter was sharp and lightweight but I guess you will have to put some weight when you try to cut papers and make sure it's on a flat open space area for safety.6. It was a perfect size for home-use. It wasn't too big or small to just do normal document or paper cuttings.I contacted Amazon to return my item and finally, on the 3rd day the company reached out to me. I appreciated their response and they seemed genuine about their feedback. Just sad I can't use the cutter and will have to find something else.

Out of every single purchase I have ever made on Amazon, I have never had a single bad experience except with this product. It doesn't even come close to working as it should. I started by testing it out with 50 clean pennies I COUNTED ahead of time. The coins were not properly sorted, the pennies went into the nickel slot AND penny slot, the machine jammed (from only 50 pennies...come on). The wrapper also filled up before the pennies were even full so that you can't even trust the count. Already I was working with a piece of garbage product, but I decided to throw in a bunch of coins and see what it did with them. It immediately jammed (again these are clean, newish coins) and wouldn't fix itself as advertised. So I then had to figure out how to remove the jam. But there is NO WAY TO TAKE APART ANY OF THE PIECES. You can't separate the overflow tray, you can't lift the lid entirely off, you cant take out the whole sorter to remove the jam. I had coins going down into the power supply area, coins jammed in places you couldn't reach, I ended up having to take the whole thing upside down and shaking it until most of the coins fell out, then I had to detach the back panel which, again, DOESN"T detach all the way and fish around for all the coins that fell back there. If I could give this product less than 1 star I would. Please do not buy this product and post negative reviews if you have had similar experience. I have never had such a shoddy product in my life, let alone one that costs nearly $50...

I was very pleased with the board but I am giving this product a one-star review because it came with a completely dried out dry-erase marker. I had to go out and buy some since I didn't have any at home.
Both tapes are broken. And it's almost impossible to peel the plastic cover off. I'd give 0 star if I could. Worst thing ever.

I saw some of the negative reviews for this sharpener, but decided to try it out anyway and hope for the best. That was a waste of time. I tried it out as soon as I got it. Everything seemed to work ok (not great, but ok), except for the fact that it would sharpen and then immediately break the entire tip EVERY SINGLE pencil/colored pencil I tried to sharpen. At first I thought the initial pencil I tried to sharpen just had really broken up lead inside, but after trying it on multiple pencils I realized it was the doing of the sharpener. Other than that, I really disliked that it was just one of your typical hand held pencil sharpeners attached to a motor. I didn't think about it before purchasing, but after trying to use it, all of those broken pencil tips had to be removed by hand. In other words, after each attempt I had to open it up and use a toothpick to push the broken tip back out. SO annoying!!! Do yourself a favor and buy something different.

I bought lights for under my cabinets in my kitchen. The original ones didn’t stick. These did. Happy so far.I have to change this review. They no linger stick. I have to replace them almost every day. No good

This toner was not compatible with my printer.  Because of this toner cartridge the pages would jam inside the printer....every time.  To print anything we had to print one page at a time, and then we had to pull the jammed page out to have a printed page.  I purchased a new toner cartridge, the brother T450 and that solved the problem.  Do not buy this cheep cartridge, you will be wasting the money. If no stars was an option here, that would be my rating.

First of all, I weigh 210 lbs.  I bought this stool to help me reach things on my garage shelf.  I used it maybe 5 times.  The last time I used it I was standing on it and leaned just a little bit to the side and the stool shattered.  I rolled my ankle and the plastic from the stool cut my leg when I fell to the ground.This stool is rated for 300lbs.  I can tell you it cannot even hold 210lbs.Please do not trust this stool, it will break and can hurt you....
Wish I had read the reviews first. I don't shop on Amazon to get stuck with a product that's non - returnable. Plenty of other options out there.

Without question Brother makes a 5 star product, however, Amazon's service on this item is very unkind.  I purchased the printer that these labels go to from Amazon and went through approximately 5 or 6 rolls of this refill product, also ordered from Amazon, when suddenly, without any explanation, Amazon informed me there was a "slight problem" with my order--namely that I had exceeded my limit.  The computer then automatically changed my order to "0."  Examine this item's page closely, do you see a limit?  I assumed there must be a computer glitch, so I left my order in my shopping cart to try another day.  Not long afterwards, I received a message from Amazon that the price had dropped, as an encouragement to order, I assume.  But no, just like the last time, there was a "slight problem" with my order.  I would have to abide by my limit (again, what limit?) and again only order "0" copies of this item.  When I inquired with Amazon, both in phone calls and emails, I have learned "so that more people can enjoy this product" Amazon is limiting purchases.  Translation, you are welcome to buy the printer, but don't expect Amazon to sell you refills, so that "more people can enjoy this product."  Needless to say, I am not enjoying this product anymore.  However since Amazon appears to consider this a reasonable policy, I will try it myself.  Therefore, so that more businesses can enjoy my purchases I am going to limit my purchases from Amazon on all of its product lines. Brother QL-570 Professional Label Printer

The item arrived on the date promised. However the box it was in was never ment for shipping. It wasn't even taped shut. The box was open and badly torn. The item was loose inside with no type of packing material at all and looked as  though it may have fallen out of the box several times during shipment. It was scratched in several places and had a small dent  on one side. If it hadn't been for the good quality of the item I am sure it would have been in piecesI would like to say that this was NOT shipped by amazon bit by the manufacturerThe item itself is very good and works very well. However for the price I paid for the item and shipping it wasn't worth it. I feel that an item of this price should have at least been packaged and sent to look like New when it arrives. It arrived looking as though I have been carrying it in the back of a pickup truck for awhile.So I have this item a low rating because of the lousy shipping. The item itself is a very good product if you don't Mind scratches and dings when it arrives
This is not a review of this product. I just feel three of these reviews are false. Not posted by genuine buyers.
Rated at 300 lbs. Couldn’t withstand 225.Broke first week of light to moderate use.

I got this to use my laptop (MacBook Air 11") on my bed. It seems like a very cool concept and its construction is actually very interesting and well made. However, I found that it just wasn't convenient. So, it's a well built product whose function is not very good for my use, or at least whose function I didn't like. Perhaps it deserves more than 2 stars for that reason.

This item will not work with PIXMA MP810 printers.  None of the photo pigments are compatpable with this unit.  I am now the proud owner of a CLI-8PC ink tank that is completely useless to me. I suppose it's my fault since, when I looked at these reviews several other people had the same problem.  Let all other buyers be aware and not make the same mistake!

I love the  Prismacolor Premier Illustration Markers, Brush Tip, Set of 8 Assorted Colors  (1736674)  ones by Prismacolor, but they didn't have the expanded color palette I needed. So I branched out and got these double-ended ones. I did NOT like them at all.For clarification, I am NOT an artist - this review is solely based on my use of them for Adult Coloring Books. Specifically, the  Secret Garden: An Inky Treasure Hunt and Coloring Book .BUT, I do NOT like the Double Tipped Markers. I DID like that these markers come in TONS of colors. I even went and bought some that were the single markers just to get some extra colors - like the light blue in the photo. Unfortunately, they don't write/draw/color at all like the 'brush tips;' which are awesome. These are firm and clumsy for fine detail coloring. Additionally, I didn't like the thickness of these in my hand - they're really wide.Most importantly, I was SO DISAPPOINTED to realize these big fat markers by Prismacolor BLEED. On one page, I used all brush tip markers EXCEPT for some spots of light blue. It was a lighter color than all the others, and made by the same company, so surely (I thought) it wouldn't bleed. It did - see photos. The first photos are a page colored with the standard brush tips by Prismacolor. They didn't bleed. I used ONE of the Double-Ended Brush Tips (THIS type of marker), the light blue, and it DID bleed. The owl image is the backside of that same page. So sad. I hope this review is helpful to others considering these markers for the same purpose. Now, if you're an artist or designer, you may have a completely different experience. I found these inferior to the single-ended brush tip markers by Prismacolor... (Those are shown in the last two photos)

Absolutely terrible!  This product deserves 0 stars. Printed two, yes two, pages and was out of ink. Thought maybe one was just a bad cartridge so tried the other cartridge, same thing. Buy another product!!
Only lasted for a couple of months.  Would give no stars if I could.  Also return it is a hassle.  Better off getting one from office depot with a good warranty.

I bought this for the purpose of using it on adventure races, where I would have to write, measure distances, and plot points on a map on the fly.  It appeared easy enough to clip onto a carabiner that was attached to the chest location of my backpack strap.  The pen is constructed very solidly and writes just like any ballpoint pen.  You simply tug it to detach it for use.  But the one MAJOR flaw is that the pen can accidentally detach very easily at the clip.  If it does that on its own, you'll lose your $15 pen (the most I have ever paid for one pen).  I gave this a 2nd chance, in fact, and it fell down the same fate.  Two pens lost on two races = one star.

I liked these envelopes and they were highly rated, but the flaps didnt stay down after sealing. In an hour or so the flaps were lifting up requiring tape to seal the envelope. May have been a bad lot. I returned them.

I didn't read the reviews before I purchased and that was a huge mistake. There are only 3 notebooks when the picture shows 4. It states in the small print that you get 3 so why not just picture what you plan to offer. The notebooks are also much less sturdy than the other brand I purchased. I wont but these again. The only reason I selected these to begin with is my son needs 7 different colors and these were different from the others I purchased.

ONE star because there is no ZERO. I have purchased these elsewhere so I knew what to expect. But these are not only pale - they are completely dried out! The package hasn't even been open for 24 hours... AND now I learn this item isn't eligible for return!! TOTALLY DISSATISFIED!
Sorry can't rate product too high. Only one out of two cartridge's worked. However they did give my money back.So kudo's for that.

Already tossed the packaging or I would return this.  Magnet won’t stick to anything on its own ...let alone try to stick the magnet to something and then expect the magnet to stick.  It’s pure junk!!  Do not recommend.  Wish I could leave 0 stars.
I wish I had read the reviews before ordering. I was ripped off as well.  Seriously????!!!  It didn't even come in a package- just the click eraser by itself.

I have been meaning to write this review for awhile. I bought this during Christmas 2018 because it was on sale, and was able to use it twice before never being able to use it again.  I use whiteboards nearly everyday, so this was not my first rodeo. LOL The dry erase markers (my good quality markers) did not erase well off of this board, and after the second time we used it, nothing would erase. We tried board cleaner, windex, and finally, magic erasers, and it won't come off! The marker tray also does not stay on. So in the trash it went. I would not recommend this white board.

Don’t buy it! Broke on the first use with legs detached from the top. The compass was very loosely constructed, as soon as I tried to draw a 4” circle the top detached from the legs. I would give a zero star if there is that option. Super disappointing.
When I opened the black cartridge, it started to leak. Stained a t-shirt. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT! I don't know where the five-star reviews are coming from. If I could give it zero stars, I would.
What's there to say? Read the other one-star reviews.  Buyer beware.

I would rate these lower if I could.  Some pens leaked inside & don't work, while some colors separated.  This was posted as a great deal, in a group of over 44,000 people, so it's my fault for not researching before purchasing.
Item was DOA out of the box.  Did not light.  But, the pen worked so it got 2 stars.  Returned it.
None of these cartage's works. Receive non-HP product message on every single one tried. Should have paid attention to the negative reviews...they are on point.

I was so so excited about this compass. When I used it for the first time it was perfect. Right around the second use, the upper piece that keeps both ends of the compass together simply came off and my compass was in 2 pieces. Don’t buy this.. it breaks so quickly. All the other reviews were so good too, I was so sad when it broke.

My wife ordered this without reading the reviews. DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE.You get a single folder. Not "one order of 4" like she thought.The price on this item is not competitive, and there is no way anyone should purchase this.

After 3 days of use, it started printing a yellow streak across the top of the first page of whatever I wanted to print (SEE OTHER REVIEWS FOR SIMILAR ISSUES). Now after 1 week, it started printing weird blue and red streaks on the left margin of my pages. I regret not keeping the box to return this item. NEVER AGAIN.

After struggling with this tape for a bit I went their website and found these most helpful instructions: "To initially start the roll of our Scotch® Double Sided Tape, there is a protective wrap that is about 8 inches long. Just pull the tape out about 8 inches and use the cut blade on the dispenser to cut the tape. Throw that 8 inches of tape in the garbage. Now you can begin using the double sided tape. As the protective wrap is clear, you will probably not be able to see where the double sided tape begins and where the wrap ends, so you will just have to touch the top of the tape to make sure you have both sides of the adhesive exposed. This protective wrap is not included in the listed dimensions of the tape, the tape length starts from the point where the protective wrap ends."I can't review any other aspects as I haven't used it yet, but the omission of this valuable info might keep you from giving up on it. . . as I nearly did.

This pen was bought to replace a favorite pen that was "nicked" from me during a trade show.  I looked at the reviews and I noticed that a minority of reviews strongly stated how the quality has gone down hill.  They were right.  In direct comparison - The plastic in the old pens was robust and had a good feel to it.  Now the walls are so thin that I can feel them flex a bit if I squeeze.  Shine used to be deep and lustrous much like those hand rubbed finishes on cars.  Now it is flat with minimal gloss.  The metal tip used to have a shiny finish - now not so much. It has the feel of cheap promotional pens with a thin metal top. The overall finish reminds me of old Soviet Block products.  Believe me, I could go on.  Since I sprung for an unusual color - the pen cost me $10 through Amazon Prime.  I feel the pen is worth $3-5

We use a step stool to assist our disabled son in getting into our car.  This step stool failed on its first use  He weighs only175 lbs against the rating  of the step stool at 300 lbs.  Returned before I could even activate the warranty.

Perhaps the Optima we got is defective, though I can find nothing physically wrong with it (or the packaging). Even with the Swingline 40 staples which are supposed to staple as many as 40 pages, the best we could do was 26 pages, and the points do not bend over to make a smooth underside. In other words, you can get stuck on the points of the staples.When stapling two or three sheets, it's hit or miss. Sometimes, it performs adequately. At other times, one end of the staple is crumpled.Last, even for 25 pages, it takes some effort to get the staples to go through.I've been using Swingline products for decades, and I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say that this one is a dud. It's going back, but I will not replace it with the same model.(Why two stars? Simply, reviews with one star are usually dismissed and not read because the reviewer is seen as disgruntled and without objectivity. So, two stars just to get you to read this. We returned this, and bought the PaperPro Prodigy Stapler. Will review that one as well.)ew

Nice design aesthetically, and the built-in handle is nice.  But it only has two heat settings, one for 3mil and one for 5mil pouches.  I set it for 5mil and waited for it to signal it was ready, then ran through several Fellowes brand 5mil pouches (1 sheet of 20lb bond in pouch).  They all came out wavy and distorted, a symptom that points to the heat being too high.I reset it to the 3mil setting and waited for it to cool down and beep its ready signal.  I again tried a 5mil pouch (at the 3mil setting).  Much better, almost acceptable but still some waves.  Tried a 3mil pouch and it came out very wavy -- I would call it rippled.  No way to reduce heat any further since the machine only has two settings.  Apparently this machine just runs hot!Other issues...  There were minor scratches on the front panel (this panel is completely protected during shipping, so it had to come out of the factory that way).  Also, every few minutes the normal "humming" sound would change to a loud "buzzing" noise for several seconds (another reviewer complained of this too, so it isn't just this one).I returned the SL95 to Amazon and purchased a GBC H212 instead.  The H212 has variable heat control and auto-shutoff as well.  Worked perfectly with the Fellowes pouches -- none of the problems I had with the SL95.

They work just fine. Like most bad reviews, the locking mechanism isn't the greatest but if they're snug enough in a drawer, it's fine. The problem I have is with the price. The exact same 8 piece set is significantly cheaper at Target for only $9.89 vs $15.99 on amazon.

Similiar to other reviews, the ink cartridge I used was defective. It leaked all over the printer and printed out all black pages. Seems to be a theme with this product and I do not recommend purchasing this item.
5 star! Plenty of room to write and nice decorations.

Very scratchy and rough and no better than crayola, I actually still prefer my crayola over these. I'm glad they were only $5, I'll be trying prismacolor next time. However there is a purple, some reviews have said there is no purple but there was one purple in my set.
expected the desk height to at least to comfortably rest my wrist upon as I type. Otherwise putting together 5 stars super easy.

If I could rate it zero stars I would.  Hp recalled all these inks due to print quality issues.  After not seeing them for mo ths I believed these were corrected.Nope.Dont throw your money away.  Black prints great, color wont.  This is my third color ink and been burned each time.  All printer maint, head cleaned, alignment fine, its just the toner is trash.Want my money back but they screw you after the packs open.  Sorry its been opened you cant return it.  “oh silly me, I should have tested it before IOpened the box...”

In my opinion the paper in these envelopes is to thin and not stiff enough..I question the 24lb spec listed.  I have better self-sealing envelopes from my warehouse club for 30% less price.  Not sure where all these 5 star reviews are from....I have ordered business supplies for over 40 years....I don't get it.

My order of pens came with the package pf the three pens open and the black pen missing. The shipping package was still sealed so it leads me to believe the package was shipped this way. I have not used the pens so I cannot review them but, regardless of their quality, I cannot rate this product highly as missing one of the pens is pretty crucial issue for the entire product.
I would have given a 5 Star rating but the box was damaged, opened and 30 sheets were missing... Shipping box was fine just the box to the lamination sheets...

I usually don't write reviews, and I was just about to buy another one as a replacement, but I came across a negative review similar to the problem I had as well. The pen was well kept, and even drained of it's ink during storage in proper casing.  I do own several fountain pens range from a little as $25 to $450.I have to say that I was a disappointed  when all I did was twist the top of the cap the the nib disconnected from the body. I'm not an expert but paying $65 for a pen just to break like that is absurd.
Horrible toner cartridge - leaves smudges and marks on most pages.  Other reviewers commented on this, but I was too lured by the cheap price.
Was NOT compatible with our printer.  I noticed quite a few "bad" reviews but decided to give it a chance.The printer wouldn't even recognize it.  It went back today.

I ordered the combo deal of Ultra Pro penny sleeves and top loaders. However, that is not the item that was sent to me. This is just horrible. I've had problems with amazon shipping speeds before, but this is just ludicrous. The title, description and picture clearly say and display Ultra Pro but they sent me an inferior product that I did not order. I will be contacting Amazon to have this matter resolved. 1 Star (deserves 0 stars)

* These off-brand cartridges Do Not Install properly in the printer.* You will probably have ink leaking inside printer, because the cartridges have to be removed and then reinstalled with quite a bit of pressure in order for the printer to clear the empty signal. The excessive pressure is also damaging to the print head alignment.* It's not worth saving a couple bucks in order to have such a large supply of extra cartridges.* The manufacturer only warrantees them for 90 days, long before the second set is needed.* I've owned and used 4 different Epson Inkjet printers, and never had any problems until attempting to use these second-rate knock-offs.
Very expensive, tried to use it and it tangled itself 1st use and the cartridge is junk now- could have been due to very cold weather conditions- see my review of the Fimax tapes ( W on B) 6 for $25

When I researched the alternatives to paying HP for replacement TONER, b/c HP has really jacked up their pricing beyond fair and reasonable, I found these.  Many of the alternative reviews mentioned toner leakage, but overall this brand had good reviews.  Well these have toner leakage as well after running several sleeves of paper through it.  Not good if your using this for a small business and you just want your printed papers to look nice and clean.

I purchased a box of 500 in December, 2015.  Well I just opened it today and realized the envelope windows do not fit my Quickbooks checks properly.  One of your reviewers said it fit QB checks but they were wrong.  And now it's too late to return these.  I'm disappointed.  Do NOT buy if you are using for Quickbooks' printed checks!

.Prior to purchasing this product, I had read the favorable reviews of three other users. The only thing I can say is that their experiences were different from mine.I bought two of these. The first one was pretty much packaged like the original HP product, but when I removed it from its plastic protective sleeve, it started leaking toner all over me, the floor and the printer. The cost of cleaning up the mess was much more than any savings on sales price.Based upon that experience, I never opened the second one.

This in theory is a really cool idea however, my little light that came in the box didn't/ doesn't work and I didn't know until the person I got it for opened it (a gift) over the weekend and I looked like a fool. :(I am not sure where to go from here as he already has the gift and I feel like a jerk asking for it back. It's definately not the same, pretty useless without the light. I should've checked it but giving a gift... you don't usually open thing's first. At least I don't. I didn't know how to rate this one. The idea is cool and perfect for the guy I bought it for... just wish the light worked. (Yes, the batteries are okay. He tested them)Just a bit sad because the guy I got it for is a Detective and has many things he needs to keep track of but not share with other's. This was the perfect solution... dang it!

Jan 2017Downgraded to 2 stars from 5.Scratches horribly despite being carefully stored in a cushioned pen slot in my backpack. All other pens great and no scratches. Very disappointed since it happened about 4 months after and then got worse.June 2017Male with large hands and medium length fingers: Writes superbly but don't get this if you think it's light. It isn't. In fact on the heavier side but works fine with my hands since it writes so smoothly.

Light weight and easy to fold.  I weigh 230 lbs.Took it out of the box, opened it up, stepped on it and it snapped. Would not recommend this item. Says it is rated for 300 lbs.  luckily I didn’t get hurt.

Just loaded the second cartridge.  It is streaky right from the start!  The first cartridge had yellow ink loaded in the magenta compartment.  DON"T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME!  These are not worth one star.

This ink doesn't remotely resemble the color that is represented on the picture.  The picture shows a yellow ink that could be legible on white paper.  This ink is very bright yellow and very difficult to read on white paper.  If I wanted a highlighter, i would have bought a highlighter pen!If the seller would only show a color that better matches the product all would be well.  Those that want a fountain highlighter pen would be very happy, as can be seen in the other reviews.

Cylinder lasted about 2 years with very light use. I’m 160lbs not the 450lbs it is ‘rated’ for.There is a poor excuse for a bearing with cheap plastic to retain ball bearings at the bottom of the unit which is the bearing surface for load and how the chair turns.  There seems to be either a plastic or sintered graphite bush that completely deteriorated making horrible squeaking noises all the time. Upon closer inspection the failed balls bearings also cause significant wear and scoring to the cylinder wall.Product works as advertised but do not expect a long service life - this is a very cheaply made gas cylinder.

I'm reviewing the light blue color: it's lightweight and seems more plastic-y than older versions and feels cheap.  To be fair, it was priced at $5.99 which was cheaper than other links.  The ink is already starting to clump/pool and I've only used it for a few days.  On the other hand, the grip is good and very comfortable.  I used to have several of these from years ago and this is not living up to what I expected: a good-weighted, comfortable, smooth-flowing ink pen.

I wish this company would let me return the item.They don't work.  I trusted the reviews but they must get friends to review the item.I have tried every pen in the group.  They won't write even after tapping them, pushing down the point to get it started, etc.  I've tried it all.  The ink will not come out.  This is the worst product ever.  I wish I could have given it no stars.

I like to give happy reviews...this is not one.This fidget Literally Stinks. People who want fidgets may also be people who are particularly sensitive to smell. One needn't be sensitive to be repulsed by the off gassing of this bad boy. I don't even know about its fidget value, maybe a 2/5 also. Even with it in the bag, I could not stand to play with it {smell it} long enough to evaluate it. It is also quite large. Nobody is going to be hiding this in their hand. It is about the size of a racquetball.Sorry, I wanted to like it. I was hoping to pass it along as a gift...

Not even close to measurements stated! I was so disappointed and what is point of sending back? It cost me $6.22 and shipping $7.00. Not paying more shipping. Really bad ! Had to hit star rating to begin but it is not even half star.

The shimmer and color is exactly what I was looking for, but the paper isn’t like heavy cardstock. It’s really thin. I should have read the reviews saying that. Oh well, I’ll find some other use for them. Maybe use them as my envelope inserts.
If I could give this zero stars, I would! Ink ran out after four color pages! I’m so upset!!!!

Love this, low rating isn't because it's junk it's because of the price I bought this same one here a few years ago for less than  $25, mine just quit working so I went on to buy another but not for this price ridiculous!

I don't normally write reviews, but I was so shocked at how bad this product is, I had to leave something to warn other people looking for a magnetic adhesive; absolutely DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. After cutting some of the strip with a pair of scissors and holding the adhesive side against the wall for a minute, the strip curled up and came off without anything attached to it in less than 5 minutes.
