I decided to cut a little further into the roll to test it, and while it stuck a little better, the magnetic side is so weak it wasn't able to hold up what I wanted to hang in the first place (which weighed less than two pounds for those that are curious).

I purchased these pens about a year ago for a special project requiring red ink. When they first arrived I was impressed with their quality. However that impression quickly faded. I have gone through a dozen of these pens and they ALL have BLOBBED and smeared red ink, without exception. The color is great, the 1.00 rollerball is great but unfortunately this pen has a real performance issue. If you enjoy getting red ink on everything you write on then this is the pen for you. If however you are looking for a smooth performing pen that produces quality writing ...... RUN FROM THIS PEN AS FAST AS YOU CAN.  Sadly The rating scale does not allow for an Overall Rating of less than 1.

After reading the previous reviews, especially one that said this cushion was too soft, I ordered it.  It was delivered very promptly and in good condition.  However, after sitting on it for about 10 minutes, I decided that it was much too firm for my sensitive area.  I have fibromyalgia and find sitting for too long very painful.  The parts of me that touch the office chair seat burn and hurt after a while and I was looking for something to help me prolong my ability to sit and work in an office atmosphere.  Unfortunately, when I attempted to return this item, I was told it was non-returnable.  According to their returns policies it is considered a hygienic item and since I had removed it from its plastic bag, it could not be returned.  Personally, I think this is stretching the "hygienic" definition. (I have returned swimsuits, for goodness sakes!)  Additionally, description of any product that is non-returnable should be labeled as such, in a way that is easy to see, not buried in the returns policy at the bottom of the seller information page.
Greenbox ink cartridge are worthless I only printed 3 shipping labels and they were dry I contacted the seller and they refuse to do anything about it. Greenbox is not worth 1 star.

Brendon usually does an outstanding job but I find myself hard pressed to give this a high review. Content is great, typical Brendon style with great thought provoking questions each day.  The 60 days does not bother me, these type of productivity/thinking planners typically are not a full year so that was not a surprise.  So a good idea, but....The layout and the size is what I cannot get past.  For size, it is a large (8.5x11) hard back book.  The layout and space is awkward to write in.  It also has your thoughtful insite for the day right there with your schedule so if you pull out your book to make a note on your schedule or see what is next it is there for everyone to see.Personally, I would rework it.  Size should be about 1/2 what it is (maybe 8.5x5) and perhaps the layout should be broken up to two sections for each day.  I would like to see the top portion and schedule on two pages with the morning and evening mindset and daily habits scorecard on the next two pages so they are more private if you were to use in an office setting.  Yes, that would make the book a bit thicker but it is already bulking...at least the smaller size would make it easier to take it with you.

I bought this with high hopes a it had some great reviews. Once I put it in my printer, it was fine for the first test print or so minus a couple of things, then the color all together stopped working. I guess that's what I get for trying to cut corners and get the off-brand ink. I will be returning it.

Step stool cracked the second time I used it. I weight 188lbs and this is supposedly rated for 300lbs. Unfortunately it completely failed today which is outside of the return time-frame. Not recommended!

UPDATE: As another reviewer stated, on 3rd use of this compass, the mechanism holding in the center “point” fell off and we cannot reattach. Updating review to 1 star, and would give 0 stars if possible. Look elsewhere for a sturdier compass that comes with all pieces as advertised.Upon receipt it appears we (possibly) received a used item as there were markings on the interior packaging, and there was no extra lead as indicated on the item description. The compass is very lightweight, and tends to “slip” frequently during use. I intentionally chose this compass as it was packaged separately (rather than a set), and quality appeared to be better than the type with mini-pencils inserted in product images. Overall, I would give this product a solid mid-range review. It’s unfortunate that it is not heavier, and that we did not receive the extra lead. Amazon customer service did make this right for us, thank you.

DO NOT BUY!!I bought these to replace my HP originals. When I removed from the packaging, the magenta powder puffed out all over when I pulled out the protective film. I cleaned up the mess and continued on.There were blue lines all over every page. When I print shipping labels for my business, I selected B&W and blue still managed to smear across the barcodes on the label.When I printed technical documentation, there was a blue and magenta ghosting effect next to every sentence.I have very little patience to handle this poor quality situation. My expectation for a product is for it to work right out of the packaging. I do not have time or patience to call the manufacturer to get replacements. I see that others have had to do that.I called Amazon and got my money back.I'm very displeased with this poor quality of a supposed 4.5 star product.
I wish I would have read the reviews, Only one folder showed up....misleading, I needed the pack. Off to the store I go. Please change this

I was attracted to these cards not only because of the verse and picture but because the cards were a lovely red.  The ones I received are burgundy purple and not as festive because of this.  I was disappointed at the lacklustre look compared to what appears on the website.  I should have read the other reviews on here first.
Stamps unevenly. Completely useless. Judging from the reviews this only happens about 15% of the time. Glad they're not running an airline.
I gave these only one star because one pencil was empty. Middle was totally hollow.  Paid for twelve, only 11 could be used.

This is a really lousy cutter. The restraint which is supposed to hold paper in place so it cuts cleanly, does not extend beyond 22cm. Anything that extends beyond 22cm does not get cut cleanly and has ragged edges. The clamp down paper holder is not long enough. Also, there is a gap between the bar to which the restraint is attached and the surface of the paper cutter so that paper slips underneath makingit cumbersome to use. Really poorly designed and I am sorry I bought it!!!!!  My mistake... Sincerely EvaDeserves 0 stars, but will give it a 1 just so it gets recorded.

I hate writing negative reviews, but I just have to let others know not to purchase.  Unfortunately I had purchased this over 6 months ago, but used it intermittently.  Tried using it to sharpen some colored pencils, and it wasn't sharpening, but making this slow whirring sound....then it just stopped.  It completely died, and I am so disappointed.  I assumed using the Bostitch would at least guarantee some good use, but I just wasted $20 on a sharpener. Perhaps I just got a dud, but it worked the first couple of months, and I haven't really used it in a while. Now when I need it, it doesn't work.

I'm surprised to see so many positive reviews, to be honest. I purchased this item and tried it on multiple pairs of scissors and it didn't work at all. In fact I threw the "sharpener" away. Ironically, the scissors I was trying to sharpen were also Fiskars.

Will not allow a zero star rating.  My printer model is included in the list provided but the cartridge did not work.  It physically fit, but printer would not accept it.  Unfortunately, I did not test it when I first received the cartridges and waited until I was actually out of ink, which meant I missed my window of opportunity to return.  In my case this great price turned out to be quite expensive.  Not getting it returned in time is my own fault. Being naive enough to trust that if a product claims it will work that it will work, maybe also my fault.  I suppose there is a chance that I just happened to receive two uncharacteristically faulty  cartridges and all cartridges will work fine for others who order, but just be wary.

I read the reviews about it being difficult to put on, and as such, took the time to unroll the sticker, lay it flat under some books to keep it from curling in, and cut into smaller segments so it would be easier to place down onto a piece of poster board. Despite all this, the sticker immediately coiled up as soon as I took the peel off, and was impossible to pull apart. Even with two people it was incredibly difficult to lay the remaining piece down without any air bubbles.

After extensive reading of reviews and trying to get the best laminator for my money, I purchased this for teacher  use at a Nursery School.  The papers came out of the machine wavy.  After trying many things - using the 3 mil setting even though we were using 5 mil sheets, placing a file folder on top and bottom of the laminating sheet, making sure it was coming out with nothing impeding the straightness of the paper, placing the completed lamanation sheet under a stack of heavy books, .... I called the Fellowes Help Line.I was told that the machine was probably too warm and they sent another laminator.  It was a factory reconditioned machine (I could see that from the manual that was sent).  The replacement laminator does the exact same thing and the papers come out wavy. I called Fellowes to tell them that I was very dissatisfied - to let them know of the poor quality of their merchandise.  I just got an "I'm sorry" and at the end of the conversation the employee actually read off his script and said, "Thank you for choosing Fellowes".I am very dissapointed with this product and would warn others not to buy a Fellowes Office Laminator - Saturn 95.
A total inferior product.  Jams consistently - would not sort.  Not deserving of single star.

This product came with a sticker on one side saying it was rated for up to 350 pounds, and a sticker on the other side saying it was only for 75 lbs and under!! Which is it?! Either I can use it or its only for a child, and I don't know which. I guess I'll know if I use it and it collapses under me and I break my ankle!

i chose this rating..for one reason.. the ink in the cartridge was either old or a factory dud. I can print with some color, it lacks the pigment red.  I couldnt afford to drive 20+ miles for a round trip to Wal-Mart.  I thought getting the cartridge through here would be more of a convience.  Instead, I believe from now on..Im gonna have make that trip to Wal-mart if I want to make sure I get a better ink cartridge.

Was initially excited about this stool as I purchased it for my 5 year old to use for brushing her teeth and washing her hands. However, I started using it and after about 3 weeks it broke. I noticed it had excellent rating which is why I bought. The stool I purchased at an ALDI store lasted 4 years while costing less than 1/2 the price as this one.

My order was for a 4 pk. I got the pkg and it contained 2. Had already opened it and pitched out the pkg in the big trash can on trash day before realizing...heck, I was supposed to get 4! For that reason alone I gave this purchase 2 stars. They do work okay as long as its fairly thin paper envelopes.

I purchased these with the intent of using them for pencil pouches after reading other reviews. I pack extra school kits every year for Operation Christmas Child. I believe that if I giving a child a gift, it would be something that I would appreciate my children receiving. Some of the pouches are okay but several had broken zippers which makes them useless. The cost was reasonable if they all worked but it's not worth my time to  return them. I will use the ones that I can but in the future I will purchase different bags.

I would have rated a one but have it a 2 because I should have paid closer attention to the picture and reviews. This is not a functional calendar. It’s a book of cute pictures with numbers shoved in at the bottom. It doesn’t even follow the traditional weekly format.

Great color, comfortable to hold, but I've already tossed out 3 of the pack because of blotches.Update Aug 20:  Dropped a star because I tossed the box out as pen after pen left blotches on my index cards.

We waited too long to return the tri-color ink cartridge or maybe this would have a higher review but it had absolutely no ink it. It was empty so ended up having to buy another one, which made us pay even more money for it. Not worth it.

I would put 0 stars if I could. The pens smear really bad. I tried to blot it with tissue, I used a mini fan and it smeared no matter what I did. I even tried different papers. Now I have to go through the inconvenience of returning them. I would just throw them in the trash if I could. I don't know about the 2 reviews that say they don't smear. Maybe they were company employees who wrote the reviews. I'm extremely disappointed, because I did read and do my homework before buying. I was just mislead.
Should have read the reviews before I purchased. The lights didn't work properly. A strip of the blue lights were much dimmer than the rest.

Pros: Great design, lightweight, conceptually cool, functional (to a degree)Cons: The "arms" are sturdy and hold well, but the "desk" portion is a little flimsy, especially when it comes to torsion and weight bearing, because it is weaker than the arms it makes the whole thing unsteady, especially if you move it much. This is amplified if you have a 17" laptop, because on my 17" at least 3-4" of it is hanging over the back of the "desK". Now add to this the fact that this is exactly where your weight is, due to the screen connecting and sitting upright exactly over the area with no support. My laptop had fallen off the back of this thing with the littlest amount of movement, especially if I have the screen angled back at all, then it's just waiting to do a back flip off this thing. A little tweaking with the design, especially the "desk" portion to make it a bit bigger with some kind of catch to make sliding off the back so easy would go a long way to making this a 4 star item.

Terrible rulers and they shatter easily. Terrible company. I am an art teacher and needed these to be shatterproof as stated and most of the rulers snapped in half like a twig. I reached out to the company and they did not even bother to reply. I was I could give this zero stars.

Great produce and great price for protecting document worthy of five stars. If needed to protect and display documents with color images or photos, the film is grainy and I would rate only 2 stars for this purpose.

I really like these because they are sheer enough not to bleed thru the page and can easily read thru it. However, they die out pretty quickly and are therefore not a good recommendation if you have more than 2 chapters to read:/ If they doubled the ink and made them able to withstand being uncapped for normal usage, they would be 5 stars! The pic shows the pink died mid-chapter, and I had to switch colors!

This item does help with keeping small and large paperback books open and stable, and it is particularly useful for paperback cookbooks.  Because the product does what it says, I gave it two stars.  I ordered this product 'new'. Unfortunately, when the item arrived to my house, the packaging had already been opened, and the clip was clearly used multiple times.  The protective coating was absent from the two bottom prongs as well as from the top arch which touches the edges of the pages.  The entire reason I went with this more expensive clip was because reviews suggest that the protective coating is necessary to prevent page tearing.  I recommend the product, but not buying it from this particular seller.

I’ve used the 1.0mm and 0.7mm and 0.5mm of the 207 signo pens. This review is for the 0.38mmThe tip is fine but the ink doesn’t flow smoothly so it feels like you’re ‘scratching’ across the paper so it’s not smooth at all.

This pencil sharpener had the best reviews. I do not know why! Maybe my sharpener just has a malfunction, but it's stays turned on. Unless I unplug it, which is very odd to me. I have never seen a sharpener do that. I also don't care for the part that looks like it holds the shavings. It does not! At least the sharpener is already unplugged! Much easier to take over to the trash that way. Don't waste your money. Put it towards a real pencil sharpener.
Dollar Tree quality for 10x the price. Wish I had read the reviews before purchasing, but went by the description on the top "number 1 best seller"... what a joke!

I never leave reviews, but seriously this was not good! Very poor quality printing. It leaves black marks down the sides of the pages that I print. Luckily, I don't need to print anything of major importance right now because I would not be able to use this toner. It looks terrible. I had no problems installing it or getting it to work, just really poor quality printing.

How can this be rated 4+ stars? Every time I use one of these the tip is "wobbly" It isn't solid, anchored... it is like writing while walking on a ship in a storm. If the plastic housing was more rigid, then yes. We had these pens 35+ years ago when i was in grade school and I swear they wrote fine. The pen shafts or housing with much firmer. These are JUNK. Nostalgic and cool but USELESS for writing.

I got the item in the picture but the strip I received doesn't have the magnetic holding power to hold a paper clip. I cut a 4" piece off the roll and stuck to to a wood shelf and the adhesive stuck fine but when I tried a small screwdriver I felt NOTHING ! I then tried many smaller items including washers from my magnetic parts bowl and it has almost NO MAGNETIC HOLDING POWER. I wonder about all these good reviews? Advice..Don't cut any off the roll before you try so you can return.

I never write reviews, but as a pen-picky English teacher, buyer beware: these are not the elegant and versatile Papermate stick pens pictured. Instead, these are the cheap pens your work gives you when they don't want anyone to take pens home. For shame.
I purchased one of these in April. Six months later, it will no longer stay extended. I am 6'6" 320lbs. The weight rating is a joke.

Basically gave this product 2 stars because it's cheap and does print. However, there are smudges at regular intervals on both sides of EACH printed page from the toner-roller. I tried running the printer through multiple clean cycles and printed about 50 pages.  The smudges do not appear to be getting any lighter.  I tried swapping back to the Brother cartridge that came with the printer and the smudges are not present on the paper.Really makes me wish I just went ahead and bought an official Brother replacement cartridge. I do not want to risk the chance of damaging the drum which would cost more than the printer cost to replace.

These roll worse than my stock wheels... i expected them to be smoother and roll a lot better. i would give it 1 star but part of the use for these is they protect your floors which they do. as a side note these will increase your chair height by about an inch.

OK I am a stupid foreigner but I expected firm cover. It isn't it is floppy. I was going to not put a review but then I noticed that others selling this product displayed it with a bent cover to show it is soft.Added to that it arrived scuffed with white showing through the spine but that is probably caused by rough handling and it is probably A-m+a.z**'s fault not this company's. (Apparently we cannot criticize you know who).
Didn’t work well at all…wish I could give no stars.

After installing the new toner, the printer would almost print one sheet, but then report a "jam inside." The jam was not inside though - the paper had gone through the fuser but wasn't delivered to the output tray. I see this problem was reported by several other users. Additionally the printer would tell me there was a jam inside even after removing the paper, but re-seating the drum unit a few times cleared the fault - until the next sheet :-(After pulling out much of my remaining hair, I came up with a temporary workaround. By running the printer with the cover open (a matchstick can be used to defeat the front cover interlock) I determined that lifting the rear of the drum unit solved the intermittent "Jam Inside" problem.Poking a matchstick under each side of the drum unit to raise it up allowed printing to continue. I'll look for a more permanent solution and will edit my review when I find one.In the meantime I'm back in business, though this cost me an hour, so I'm not very happy!I hope the workaround may be useful to others who haven't yet returned their cartridges.Update 24 hours later - the matchstick trick worked well. To make it a little more permanent, I flipped over the drum unit/toner carrier, and taped half a matchstick to the rear outside corners on the underside. It is enough to lift the drum unit slightly when inserted, and solves the problem. (The toner still only gets 2 stars!)
I did not get a projector pen!! It's just a standard ballpoint pen!! If I could give zero stars I would
I was initially really happy with this stool and would have rated it 5 stars, however the stool cracked on top after less than a year's infrequent use. Disappointing.

I've never written a review before but I felt I should for this. Got it for my kids. It got used less than 10 times. Completely stopped working. Didn't sharpen well to begin with. When I was a kid we had the same sharpener for 20 years. This didn't last 1 month. Will never purchase something by this company again

Over counts coins in tubes. 1 over .25, 1 over .10, 1-2 over .05, 1-3 over .01.  You would lose about .41 cent if all 4 were filled each round.  Does jam consistently if you do not trickle coins in.  Great for sorting coins ( which is why it got two stars and not one) but not god for accuracy of coin count.
I bought this on another site but can’t write review there.  This doesn’t work at all, they are lying and it is a scam.  Don’t bother.
Very light wight make ink bleeding in paper got them for work use but they are very inconvenient to work very disappointed especially because it have high ratings, Don't get it not worth your money

I would give this product no stars if it was possible. It was a complete waste of money! One of the cartridges did not have any yellow ink to begin with. The second one lasted for probably only a month with minimal usage. For comparison, genuine HP cartridges last me for, at least, 3 - 4 months, and my printing volume does not fluctuate. I feel completely taken advantage of. When I brought it to Costco for a refill - I've heard good things about it and decided to try this route - they told me the cartridge was too dry and not suitable for a refill.

Does not look like the picture at all. You can barely tell they are giraffes. Over priced for not getting what they are advertising. No rating for how disappointed I am that I paid so much for this item. Does not deserve any stars.

Believe the negative reviews!  Bought this over a month ago and just now getting around to using it.  Jammed on very first try and 90+ percent of the time since.  Guess it's my fault for not trying immediately, as 30 days is past.  Just thought it would work like other smaller Swingline staplers - not so!  The video posted below is exactly what I encountered.
This left black streaks on all my pages.  I would be happy to have given this thing a better review if someone can tell me how to fix this issue.

These ink cartridges do not work in my HP officejet. Yes I ordered the correct number. The printer just displays check ink cartridge errors and does not allow you to calibrate or print. Resetting the printer does not work.  I did not try the cartridges until about 40 days after purchase, now they can not be returned even though they are NOT compatible with HP Printers.  I will update my review if the seller makes good and exchanges these for ones that actually work in HP printers. If not I will go back to using Linkyo from Supermedia Store.

I'm all for trying cheaper options and I've always hated the high price tags on OEM toners but I guess you get what you pay for. I read reviews and many said their purchase was worth it. Unfortunately directly after I put the new toner in, I had a paper jam for the first time since I've own the printer. (2+ years) I cleared the jam but the printer kept saying "jam inside" regardless of what I did. Finally, I had to put the old OEM toner back into the printer to get rid of the jam message. Since I couldn't even get one successfull print job, I'd recommend that you save your money and buy the OEM product for peace of mind.

These do not highlight written work in the Rocketbook- anything you write in rocket book will smudge if you try to use these to highlight. Big bummer! Giving 2 stars because they work well on printed text on paper and they do erase as claimed.

Worked fine the first day. The next day my printer kept giving me an error message, smelled terrible like machine parts working to hard, and, ultimately, simply would not print. Oh I almost forgot. It also sounded like my printer was dying a slow painful death. I put my old Brother cartridge back in, and the printer was as happy as can be.Bottom Line: I'll be returning this product.Background: I'm a law student and on law review which means I print like the dickens.

I very rarely provide a review for a product; however, I think I owe this review to anyone considering purchasing this one. DO NOT purchase until or unless you review all the specs. I usually do myself; however, I did not on this one. I was looking for a file cabinet that had wheels so that I could maneuver it around for plugs, electrical outlets, cleaning, etc. Know that this cabinet is PLASTIC! It is very light weight so that when you fill it, and then pull out the top drawer (presumably filled with your documents), the whole cabinet falls over because it’s so light-weight. If you have a dozen or 2 dozen docs, I suppose it would work well, but I have the cabinet drawers filled and it does not work for my needs. $70 for a plastic file cabinet that falls over when I open the top drawer is not what I thought I was buying. Buyer-beware. You can buy a sturdier metal cabinet (and 2 for this price) at Walmart or Target.

Dislike greatly. Lead and point does not stay in position .you should pull this piece of junk off the market. This is not as good as the one I bought before this one, it only cost .99 and it didn't work either. Mr. Pen you should be ashamed. I shouldn’t have to rate this compass with stars before I can submit my review.

This item does not link to a Disney account. I was told I could try to link it once we were at the resort, but nothing we did online or over the phone would link this device. Had to order another band fromDisney. I should have listened to some of the other reviews. Waste of money!

Ordered one of these cartridges about six months ago, and expected to get 3,000 pages, as advertised.  I didn't keep track, but probably got maybe 200 pages tops before running out.  Since several of the reviewers on this site say they got 2 or 3 thousand pages, I'll try it again, since I don't want to take a chance on an unknown brand.  I'll post another review when the new one runs out -- hopefully it will be favorable.

The binder is good, five stars, but the seller (Prime Office Supplies) was misleading.Ordering this on the Amazon App, I was under the impression that "Assorted", the highest priced item on the list of options, showing six assorted colored binders, was six binders. It is not. After receiving only one binder, I investigated further. There is a bullet point that does not show up on the app screen (only the first three do) that clarifies that it is just one binder. Glad they have it there, but the way it is set up and the photos that are used is very shady. I'm disappointed.
PIECE OF JUNK! Do not buy it!Impossible to use due the tips, there's no way to adjust them.It's incredible this item has more than 4 stars reviews and is Amazon choice. Is a total scam!

Talk about a pain in the A to use, wish I read the reviews instead oflooking at the price and how fast I could get them.Hard to get  the holes popped out, there plastic not paper.Hard to loop  threw , 1/2 the time the key falls off it anyway.and hard to write on, because its plastic it just smugges.ready to throw them in the trash !
Look at other pics of reviews - the ones fall out of the holes on the bottom.  It’s useless

Will not recolonize the Ink. Witch at this point the printer went into the trash. the cost of the ink vs nothing works Im out 54.34 $ for the printer and 35 .36 $ for the ink that does not work and I have no copies nothing prints. The Printer and the ink are worthless. I rate these products a NEG number

So disappointing.  It gets one star for cuteness.  BUT... The layers stuck together, so the adhesive from one layer would pull the decoration off of the next layer.  Wasted about 1/4 of the roll and a lot of time.

I didn’t notice the negative reviews saying that the corners of this mouse pad curl up but I noticed it immediately after setting it down on my kitchen counter on DAY ONE. The photo was taken immediately after being unboxed. I’m returning it immediately because I’m sure it will only get worse from here and this is an expensive mousepad.

Not going by the usual way I choose a product by reviews, producing a total failure and disappointment from the moment I plugged it in the socket.....didn't turn on. I never got an item that didn't work. It tells me about their quality control. Could this be a Friday /Monday production? For the price, I expect a working product. I can talk the coin jamming a bit. You may be the 50% 5-star buyer, but I would not recommend this product to anyone.

This would get 5 stars if the small front wheels were adequate to rolling the cart.  The cart itself is just what I wanted - smaller size, sturdy, with a fold down shelf near the top.  Very pleased with the design. But the tiny wheels get hung up on cracks in the sidewalk or small almost invisible pebbles. It isn't large sidewalk cracks that stop it (it will actually tip forward) but the usual size between the slabs of concrete.  Cannot understand why a manufacturer would produce an excellent cart and then put such inferior wheels on it.

I bought a box of GA Pacific regular copy paper.  I have had to fight curling continuously.  It made printing large docs very time consuming and the paper wouldn't sit flat or stack cleanly at all.  So I did a test.  I printed a 400 page document with the GP paper. I use a brother mfc 8460.  Every six or seven sheets I either had to pull the sheet or push it down.  I had to continuously monitor the production to avoid a jam.  Then I put in Hammermill Copy paper to print a second copy of the same document.  The Hammermill worked perfectly.  So perfectly, that I could write this review while it was priting.  No problem.  The Hammermill paper came out flat and stacked neatly.  This GP paper is garbage compared to Hammermill and I will never, ever purchase GP copy paper again.  I watch for sales and usually get a box of Hammermill for around $30 on sale.  Even if it wasn't, and the GP paper was a little cheaper I would not buy it.  Frankly, I was amazed at the difference.  Don't buy GP copy paper if Hammermill is available.

I waited a while before writing this review, I was honestly hoping the product would change my mind. I have had it for a while now and use it every day, all day at work. I don't believe I could possibly dislike it more. It stinks for starters, it has that weird strong plastic smell, one reason I was waiting a while to review. I thought meh, that will go away once it has been out of the package for a while. NOPE!  It states that it grips to the carpet so it doesn't move.... that's a joke. This thing, I have even tried tucking the corners under my desk at multiple points and it still manages to get out and crinkle up. IT. DOES. NOT. STAY. PUT. so if you are totally cool with moving this thing EVERY.SINGLE.TIME. you roll in your chair and enjoy the smell of stinky plastic this will be a great buy! go for it. But if you are looking for something practical that isn't annoying beyond belief, look elsewhere!  I hate writing bad reviews because I know that when I read them I usually don't buy the product (if there is enough of them) that's why I waiting so long, but seriously this thing is horrible!

Bought them for my Mom's Presto mailbox printer. She just put in the first one from this order and, so far, works just as well as other cartridges and the HP OEM cartridges. REVISED REVIEW: each cartridge only lasted 4-6 pages.

I purchased these cartridges because they are advertised as being compatible with the HP Officejet Pro 8600 and are considerably less expensive than the original HP cartridges. In this case YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. Not only were the cartridges not compatible, they froze up my printer and I had to unplug the unit to remove them. I was able to restart my printer and install the more expensive HP cartridges. BUYER BEWARE! If I could have given zero stars I would have.

I have been wanting these watercolor pens forever and because of a great deal on Amazon I was able to purchase them. I watched a lot of videos on using these water color pens and they were fabulous in those videos unfortunately my experience was not what I expected and it left me a bit sad and disappointed. In the YouTube videos I watched the watercolor pens were fluid with very juicy colors making it easy to paint and or blend colors BUT when I started using the watercolor pens I found many were a dry to very dry and did not give me color unless I pushed hard or scrubbed the brush on the paper having to do several layers to get good coloring.  I wanted to love these as the Arteza advertising of them was inspiring I think the people making the YouTube videos must have recieved better quality pens to make their videos. I may give them another try and hopefully come back with a better rating. I really wanted to love these!
Wish I had read the other reviews. Waste of time and money. It only has one job to do and that’s write! It won’t!

Here's what I like about it---it was very, very, very, very quick and easy to put together---no tools required---great design---took 60 seconds. 5 stars for that.But I'm finding it to be a really frustrating cart to use for my purposes---it's probably fine if you live in a civilized city with very smooth sidewalks, but it's nearly useless to me here in Taos, New Mexico---it doesn't move well over any type of bump, crack, curb---God forbid gravel.  I gave some thought to whether I was being too critical of it---I checked the price again to see what I paid and decided no, I'm not being too critical, for that price, it should be a little bit more tough and capable.  I've owned a lot of wheely carts and this one is the most frustrating one I've had.  I think the problem might have to do with the little flexible front wheels, but I'm not sure.

These are adorable and remind me of tsum tsums and/or Piglet. I gave them 2 stars because they are definetly aesthetically pleasing and would look nice displayed in a stationary holder. The pig motif itself it a nice hard rubber with good details. I was able to find these cheaper elsewhere as well.As a pen, they were barely functional and I returned them since I bought them as favors and don't think guests would want or use them after leaving. They wrote okay, but had a cheaper needlepoint type tip I didn't really like and I'd expect the ink runs out quickly. They feel light and cheap as well. I had a difficult time taking the caps off, but once removed they either still went on super tight or basically fell off. Some reciepents were going to be schoolchildren who I feel would get very frustrated using them despite looking cool.
VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS PRODUCT. I SAVED IT FOR 6 MONTHS IN IT'S ORIGINAL PACKAGE AND THE YELLOW INK WAS TOTALLY DRIED UP.I WOULD RATE THIS ITEM BELOW 1 STAR.

Had good reviews. Seemed like a good deal compared to the Canon cartridges I have been buying. But then a couple of weeks later it said printer was out of ink. I checked cartridge and i literally see half of it still with ink, shook it a  little and put back into printer. Same thing. I went and used a canon cartridge i still had and no issues and never had an issue in the 6 years I have had this printer with canon cartridges. Feel like you pay half, but also get half the print worth.

I wish I had read other reviews before buying these. They are only useful for permanent projects! They absolutely do not come off with water! I tried everything and ended up ruining my chalkboard! I used Dawn dish soap and scrubbed only to find black chalkboard residue on my paper towels and the chalk still there! This is not the product that is described by Amazon as water based and easy wipe off.

During the past two weeks I have used three pen refills. The first refill lasted a week, the second refill lasted 5 minutes. I am now using a third refill and as I continue to write, the ink stream is fading.  Since most individuals highly rated these refills, I may just be the unlucky individual to get stuck with a bad set; but three refills in a row - I am note pleased.

I am beyond shocked buy this product. We have never have had an issue with genuine HP ink in my ever until now. This product did  not work at all in our printer. Same make and model we have used for the last few years with our problem. . After install it just keep coming up with an error message. wish i could give it less than one star.

I struggle to believe these are Real Post It Brand Pop Ups?  The notes are overly stuck to each other and they Curl way too much when pulled out of  the dispenser.  Been using Post its since they were invented, never had this problem.  Maybe a bad batch or Chinese fakes??  If this happens to you please also share.  I love and use Post-It Pop-Ups, 5 stars for them but this time something was off.  Too much blue this time?  Humm?

I ran out of old 3M exterior emblem mounting tape. I have now gone through 3 different double sided tapes, all without success, including by the way, 3M mounting tape. The old 3M tape lasted for 6 years before dyring out. This tape is of exceptionally poor quality. I'm stunned at all of the 5 star ratings because if this can't hold a simple phone mounting bracket to the dash, what are other people mounting?
I used this product to exfoliate my face, it does not work. Nothing happened, no black heads came out. I like the scent, that is about it. Save your money, all the reviews are a lie.

Absolute piece of junk.  The first one I bought from Staples about two years ago.  I use it to close bags of potatoes (which means it is only going through about five sheets of paper) but after two years (only two boxes of staples) it broke.  Would not finish the stapling process, the final click to close the staple would not happen no matter how hard you squeezed.  I bought a replacement here at Amazon, and after opening the box, the replacement will not staple, just clogs and jams.  Even when going through one sheet of paper.  Swingline makes their staplers in China now, they definitely don't care about their product name or reputation anymore.Well, after returning the product and having a replacement sent to me from Amazon I thought I would edit my review.  The new one worked much better than the first.  The first one would not staple at all, the replacement worked for an amazing run of 5 STAPLES before it broke!  I guess improvement comes in small steps.  I returned this one, but not for a replacement, I am getting my money back...  Amazon should not disgrace themselves by offering such a horrible product on their website.  If anyone here needs four boxes of overpriced special staples that this thing takes, I have them.
The soap looks like it will lather well but it doesn’t smell nice. Like mosquito guard! Not good. 2 stars.

This has to be the worst piece of office equipment I have ever bought. It was purchased to staple occasional reports that are 50 to 60 pages. Occasional means 2 to 4 times per month. This stapler worked wonderfully on two 50 page documents, then died. On the third 50 pager the staples jammed. I cleared it. It jammed again. I am very mechanically talented. I could not fix it. I sent it back and purchased a different stapler, also made by Swingline  Swingline High Capacity Desk Stapler, Reduced Effort, 60 Sheets, Black (S7077701)  but advertised to work for 60 page documents. If my new Swingline stapler lasts more than a month (that's about 6 staples worth of time) I will review it here on Amazon.

Awful piece of junk! After reviewing the how-to videos on Youtube, it still wouldn't work properly. After a bunch of tries and unjamming it several times, I got maybe four tags into the clothes properly before it jammed up completely rendering it useless. Now I have a huge pile of untagged clothes and need to figure out an alternative.

I am so disappointed that the overall rating of this product does not reflect its quality. It arrived today with corners damage - so I have to put some stickers to cover them. Assembly is not smooth. Also the wheels are not aligned properly. Overall it does not give an elegant experience - looks and works in a very cheap way!.
Apparently I should have read the reviews....shows a box of refills and you end up only getting one! Not worth the money. Total rip off

Decent scale however I am rating this as one star because the "lifetime warranty" is a lie. After a few years my scale started not going back to zero, and flickering up to .05 ounces which I have to account for each time, and only rarely goes back to 0 if you keep on messing with it which is very time consuming. But on start it is always over 0, and with no weight or dirt on top. I emailed the company several times about getting a new one and they never replied. So the lifetime warranty is a lie beware. If your scale breaks you will need to just buy a new one. Horrible customer service, or I should ZERO customer service. The scale does work still but always has that reset issue.
I bought it becouse of good reviews. But I had to return it in less than 10 days. The ringer stop working so I missed so many calls from my clients.

I have been trying several different brands of brush pens and these are the absolute worst. The hairs were falling out before I even used them, some of the brushes were split so they would never be able to make a single line. They are WAY to flexible and thin to do anything. I got them because the packaging made it look fancy and high quality, it's not. I returned them in a heartbeat. Since then I have been combing through youtube for brush pen reviews and comparisons, and surprise surprise, nobody even mentioned this brand. Because it sucks.

I have never seen anything like this in my life;even with the cheapest of off market printer inks. One was leaking in the package. Another, the locking tab was missing. But worst of all, following their directions and those on my HP printer, every single cartridge leaked profusely. I don't mean just smears, but large drops. The ink was all over my hands, the printer, the printer stand and the rug below.Making things even worse, the black cartridge did not fit correctly. It had to be forced into the ink head.Think I am exaggerating? Buy one of these products and you will be writing a review like this very one and cleaning ink off your hands and anything else within the vicinity of these poorly made and defective cartridges. Oh, this was definitely for my model printer. Nevertheless, the leaking began upon opening the packages.

This items appears to work well when you first install them, however goes downhill quickly.  I've reordered them several times and have seen the print quality and toner duration degrade over the years.  I have become frustrated with poor print quality as a result of the cartridges running short on toner only 1/2 way through their capacity rating.  You will replace this product 2 to 3 times more often than OEM.

Let me tell you about #1 Best Scale. It is heavy which was impressive. That is the reason I bought it. However, after one week of use when you turn it on you simply get a blank screen. No matter what you do, no matter what buttons you push, it remains blank. So, you have to unplug the head from the power cord and re-plug it back in and the thing works. So no, I don't want to have to power my unit up twice each time I wish to use it.  The only reason I did not give it one start instead of two is that it is heavy and appears to be a solid scale once you get power to it. But since there are serious issues with it and it obviously was not tested from the ultra-fast production line in China that never tests anything, 2 stars is it. I returned mine and will go with a more respectable brand. Don't waste your money on this.

I would give these 0 stars if I could. The colours were very dull and I had to press hard to get the lighter ones to show up. Definitely did not help for the purpose of which I bought (in conjunction with an adult colouring book to keep calm). VERY disappointed. Don't waste your money on these.

This is a flimsy product with  strips of magnetic tape not magnets attached. It does not adhere to my whiteboard and slides down other metallic surfaces. I was greatly disappointed  that the other reviews were so misleading. If anyone know of a good  protractor for a whiteboard let me know, this is not it.
If I could give no stars I would!  Bought this product for my HS student and it separated the very first week of school.  Had to throw it away, a total waste of money.
This is a scam, like many reviews have said, only 1 works.  My printer refuses to use the 1st one, but the 2nd one in the box works for a few prints before it stops.

Cheap, flimsy, position knobs do not tighten to keep the table from moving.  Cannot tighten the stand rod to stay straight.  I know it was less than a $100.00 but I Should have gone to Walmart instead.  Very disappointed and a waist of my money.  I should have read the reviews before I bought.  Lesson Learned

The 8570 prints gorgeous pictures, but when it breaks, it breaks permanently. We have gone through five 8570’s over the past 4 years, with each of them experiencing what I would consider low to moderate print volume. Before these 8570’s we went through several 8550’s which are basically the same printer, all with the same type of unrepairable mechanical failures. These solid ink printers are a reliability nightmare with their only saving grace being that fantastic print quality.I’m finally writing this review because I just had to decommission yet another broken 8570 (this one was 3 years and 2 months old), and I replaced it instead with a HP Color Laserjet that is more reliable and with cheaper supplies - even though the prints don’t look as good as the 8570.Most of our 8570’s end up dying after 3 years with a Print Head failure. We tried to repair them the first couple of times that they died, just to find out the cost of the repair exceeds the cost of a new printer by a few hundred dollars. So we bought new printers and trashed the old ones as they died off.Why keep buying printers that break so often? The artists love the print quality, and the ink is useless to any other device and an investment in it’s own right. Colors are vibrant, lines are sharp, they’re fairly easy to network, and they work fine on Macs and PCs. They weigh a ton but they’re not very loud. Even though it costs about $250 to get a full ink supply – yes, close to half the price of the printer - the ink does seem to last a while although it has a tendency to melt itself needlessly (as part of it’s cleaning process) if you don’t use the printer for extended periods of time.That’s the main reason we’ve kept replacing them with new 8570’s. It’s so wasteful but you’re stuck with the supplies and the clients love the prints.Ink is ridiculously expensive and difficult to find, so if you run out you can’t stop by your neighborhood Office Max to grab more. You basically always have to mail order ink. Generally, the 8570’s day to day reliability is fine. It doesn’t randomly reboot itself, it wakes up from sleep mode quickly, and has a web interface to change it’s settings.Just be aware that when it develops a hardware problem, it leaves you dead in the water and there’s no way to repair it without throwing good money after bad. Maintenance Kit is about $110 and you’ll need to get at least one before your printer dies in the next three years.We have only a couple 8570’s left in the office and with luck, we’ll get through enough of that expensive ink before those remaining printers die. We will not be purchasing any more ColorQubes and are basically just waiting for the remaining ones to die off, which at this rate will be a few months after their factory warranty expires.

The other reviewers were right - the pens fall off the caps before I even get to use the pens! The ball-chain clasps are nice and tight, but without the pens, what's the use? Also, yes, all inks are black. Don't waste your money.

I originally gave these pencils 4 stars. After using at least 10 of them, I am reducing g the rating to 2 stars.  The lead inside is broken, so when you sharpen, pieces of it come out causing you to have to sharpen sometimes a quarter inch of pencil to get a new point.  Every pencil has this issue.  Despite this, they write well when the lead is sturdy. Other issue is the end with white plastic requires my electric heavy duty pencil sharpener to get past the plastic.  Sharpen easier once past the 1st inch.  Eraser is great! Would rate much higher if so much lead wasn’t wasted.

So here is the real deal. All the bad reviews are because the product is fake. The one on the left is an actual Xacto. The one on the right is a cheap knock off. The blade holder on the authentic one keeps the blade lined up on the sliding mechinism. So when you tighten it down the blade stays locked in the correct orientation. The parts are all different in small ways, but the difference is a great product vs a cheap one that isn't even useable. It's sloppy, loose, and the blade ends up pointing sideways in the handle once tightened. If you look closely all the parts are slightly different. It comes in near perfect packaging too. So if you've never had the real one, you'd think xacto just made a piece of junk. The real one is awesome. I've had 50 different handles for craft knives in the last 40+ years. If you can get the real one, do. This one isn't it.
These pens are awful.. most of them don't work.. I wouldn't give it even one star but it asks for a rating....0000

I'm extremely disappointed with this product. I read the first review that answered the question I had, it was wrong, and now i have a paper weight. I'm not paying shipping to send it back."Q: Does this come with contact info cards that you can write on or is this strictly a business card holder?Answer this questionA: It comes w/plain while lightweight paper cards wrapped w/ plastic sleeves. You can either slip business cards in between paper & sleeve or write on paper and protect w/sleeve see less"Real answer "no. You have to order custom card slots to insert business cards. There's no point in ordering a higher card count to slip business cards in this stock unit knowing that."I'm not even satisfied with the less than typing paper weight of the stock blank inserts.

I do not recommend this product because of a few reasons. I bought this to help me in and out of bed yet it scare me to use it. Half the time when I try to use it to get into bed or get out of bed the stool will collapse on my. Another issue I found is that it sounds like is going to break any minute and I see the sides start to fold in some times when I hear the noises. This product is rated for 300 lbs and I am only 268 lbs so it should not be behaving this way unless the 300 lbs rating is a lie but I am unable to prove it will hold 300 lbs because I do not want to break it until I find another solution and more sturdier stool.As comparison my wife has a stool in the kitchen that she purchased many years ago, same style and also made of plastic like this one ans that one never makes any noises like is going to break and that one has never collapsed on me while trying to use it.one last note I had this device for a few months I really waited to review so I did it justice and made sure it was not just me being picky.

Didn't work in my printer. It let me have hope for the minutes it took to try and calibrate my printer head. Granted, I have an older printer- two actually. One the newer version that had wifi so my dad bought it for me. Two great Kodak printers that have been used maybe 10 times each. I saw this deal and said oh yeah! Here's my money!!! I received the ink quickly- totally will give the seller that. But, didn't have use for the ink until last week when I was trying to print the Christmas pictures. The printer frankly loaded with one of each type. Black and color. The printer tried to start and when I asked it to calibrate it said it didn't recognize the cartridge. Lesson learned. Just go spend the 40 on Kodak ink or load these cartridges immediately and test them out. It's been so long since the purchase I have no clue if a refund or replacement is possible. Just be careful. For me this was a loss. A deal to good indeed. One star because a sad face with a tear isnt available. 😢

Seemed like a nice product based on reviews, the wheels felt solid, but after six weeks one of the wheels lost its bearings, and a couple are slightly tilted. When I purchased a new chair I decided to try this product out, but I now see that I should have stuck with the other type of chair casters.I can not recommend this product based on my experience.

We purchased a number of these 20 pack Assorted Color Plastic Clothes Pins in May of 2014.  Within 4 months, over 90% of these clothes pins cracked and fell to the ground. The good: Great flow, fantastic colorThe bad: Not nearly as permanent as other Noodler's inksAfter being astounded by the quality (and permanence) of Noodler's Bulletproof Black, I was looking for a similar permanent blue ink to complement it, and decided to try Bad Belted Kingfisher. It's a good ink with amazing color, but lacks the staying power I was looking for. In water, a good amount of it runs and washes away. Other reviews claim that this smearing behavior is a "security feature", but Noodler's Black doesn't smear at all after it dries. When exposed to bleach or peroxide, Kingfisher fades a great deal. The remaining marks are still legible, but leave much to be desired.I returned Kingfisher and replaced it with Bad Blue Heron, with which I am much more impressed.
I SHOULD'VE GIVEN IT ZERO STARS.THE PRODUCT I RECEIVED WAS FAKE!

After breathing a lot of extra ozone from my laser printer, I decided to write a quick review about this product to warn others.  The paper will not load into the printer feeder and I have to try over an over until I get the right number of sheet in the hopper, take out and re-load, etc.  I have had my Samsung ML-1430 laser printer for almost a decade and it has been great, now with this paper, it will not load into the printer.  Maybe I was using 24lb before and this is too light, but I assumed "copy and print" meant it was general use.  Anyway, very frustrating as printing is now a nightmare.  If you have a laser printer, consider spending a few extra bucks on some heavier paper (just my guess at the problem).

Office Marshal Chair Mat for Carpet Floors, Low/Medium Pile - 36" x 48", Multiple Sizes - 100% Pure Polycarbonate, No-Recycling Material - Transparent, High Impact Strength After 3-4 months of daily use the mat cracked in multiple locations where my chair casters get positioned. These at first write beautifully, but run out of ink in a very short time (20 standard pages or so, compared to 80 or more from the competition). At that rate, paying full price for brand name Parker refills is actually a better deal. Won't purchase again.

I had a rubber stamp that I used monthly for about 15 years. I only ever had to add some extra ink to the pad every couple of years, but otherwise it was a workhorse until the plastic broke last month while I was pressing down on it. Searched for the exact replacement and found it here. Only this stamp is now literally half the size as my old one. (See pic.) It's going to be a lot harder now to actually write anything on those lines it's so small. Not happy with it. I give it two stars because it is usable, does give a clean stamp impression, and the ink tray is more accessible making it easier than my last one to add ink. This is the first time I have written a bad review, but felt I needed to warn other customers.  I received a bad batch of mailers.  There are small perferations in them and some of the sides are not sealed.  These bags cannot be used.  I understand that these things can happen (I have a business of my own), but there is a problem!  I am happy to return them, however VALUEMAILERS will not reimburse me for return shipping. I can't get a refund unless I return them and its not worth paying the price, so in other words "they ripped me off".  These mailers are going in the trash so I basically threw my money away with them.  DO NOT BUY FROM VALUEMAILERS!  They do not stand behind their products and they have THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!

My wife and I sing in the church choir and we use three-ring binders to keep our music in. My wife got the bright idea to put a pencil bag in the binders to keep highlighters and pencils it so I ordered these Omura pouches.They are well-made and colorful, but only two of them had the holes in the correct place to go in a standard three-ring binder. This is the reason for the 2-Star rating. You would think that someone making pencil pouches for THREE-RING BINDERS would know how to space the holes. NOT!  Therefore no matter how good the material, three out of five are useless. Look at different brands. Not Omura.........

I bought this for our RV medicine cabinet.. The adhesive does not stick to the wall. The strip keeps falling off the wall. The magnetic side barely holds small items like tweezers, nail clippers, etc. The reviews on this are inaccurate.

This binder sucks and is not at all what I think of when I hear "ultra duty", the outer covers are quite soft and pretty lack luster.The rings have very mediocre closing force, and the top ring on mine has a small gap that is just big enough for pages to catch everytime I flip through the contents of the binder.If this was a cheap $4 dollar item, I'd give it a good review. I normally don't write reviews, but I was very disappointed by this paper.  I never had any problem with my Brother printer until using this paper.  I had repeated jams.  I will not be purchasing this paper again.

Did I have to give it even one star.  It deserves minus 5 stars.  This black and silver Parker Pen came with blue ink, but it was not a Black and Silver.  It only looked Black and Silver through the bubble wrap. It was a Navy blue and silver gang color pen.  These guys are rip offs.  They should not be allowed to sell on Amazon.  They show a black pen, but they come in insipid colors.  It has some kind of goofy orange screw in casing to go along with it in case your dog or if you have a small child who might start chewing on it.  Then, you have a replacement.  For the price, it is a rip off.  I should have just bought a Parker for a more expensive price with the black ink and covering with silver because I would have been paying less after I have to buy replacement black ink.  They must be manufacturing these around midnight in some warehouse and dumping them on the unknowing public like me.  It was a roll of the dice and I lost.

Good concept, liked the freedom of having it retract or stay open.Except it broke in less than 5 days. Normal usage.The clip came out and the no tension stay stopped operating. Now it's just a regular retractable holder even if I tried the tension tab control.If the housing breaks this is getting 1 star.
These don't stick like they should. I have them two stars because my gran kids can stick them all over the place and they peel right off. They like the colors.

Got gifted for Christmas, read reviews for setup alongside a wired gaming headset, instantly put back in box. You NEED a Bluetooth transmitter if you care at all maintaining sound quality through your headset. Using this to listen to music with a wireless headset or earbuds might be great, but not even close to worth the price for what you lose in audio with a wired headset. Garbage.

I don't usually write reviews but after owning this for four months, it's broken.This product is not recommended for heavy use.  If you are going to use this product every day, don't waste your money.Spend more and buy a real stapler.

I would give this zero stars if I could.  Shortly after I started using this cartridge, after maybe 30 prints or so, the prints starting having a shaded look.  It looks like the entire page has been given a slight shading.  Can't return it because I, like most people, bought it ahead of time in anticipation of my other cartridge running out so didn't install it for a few months.  Do yourself a favor and skip this one...

I gave it 2 stars because when the printer works, it prints great quality photos, and did it in a very timely manner.  Unfortunately, I am returning my third machine today.  I am a photographer by trade, and have only used it for onsite holiday events.  It is not a reliable machine.  I am sad.

Bought this at Office Depot. I came here to see if perhaps I had a defective cart because the drawers constantly fall off track. Now reading the reviews, I see they're all defective... and, no, it has nothing to do with the weight of the items in the drawer, they fall off track even when empty!!Do NOT waste your money!

All the 96 color cartridges are used up so quickly that it's hard to give a positive rating.  I use these in conjunction with my Epson R2880.  The magentas, yellow and cyans are particularly poor.  Image quality has been great though.

Valuetoner:You sent me a replacement cartridge for the one that was not 'compatible' with my printer, great service. But the original cartridge that did print, barely gave me 10 copies before it went dry. The one star that I gave you, I raised it to 5 stars for the replacement cartridge, but now I'm forced to drop it back down to a one star for the cartridge that did work, but only gave me maybe 10 copies. What do we do now?_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________The first cartridge did not work, (incompatible window keeps popping up). The second one so far is working very nicely.* I've upgraded my original 1 star to 5. When I notified Value Toner of this, they were kind enough to send me another cartridge quickly and with no additional cost to me. They have my business for life!

Product works fine after I got the right customer service person to resolve my problems, which took a while. The instructions that came with it were wrong. I tried the service and figured out that was not for me; but then I had a very hard time cancelling the service. To understand what some of the problems are, I suggest that you google "how to cancel service for ooma" to see what kind of problems people have and that this is a problem for a number of people.  In general, the bad parts are:1. you cannot cancel on-line.2. You get a runaround when you call.3. It takes a long time on the phone to cancel.4. They push this idea of giving you a transfer number so that if you sell the device, the person will not have to pay activation fees.  The catch is, if you don't sell it, you get charged for all those months.  They are not very clear about that part.I'd give it a higher rating, as the service seems fine, but I felt like they were trying to trick me and cheat me.Also for the price that has standard features, you might as well get a cell phone from someplace like Republic Wireless that uses WiFi when you are connected, but uses the sprint network otherwise.  Its about $20 a month, including a gig of data on the wireless network.  Its less money and you can take your phone with you!

I much prefer the other water brushes I've tried, which are Derwent and Pentel.  They work well and the mechanism is intuitive.  Simply squeeze the soft ergonomic barrel to release water to clean the brush or paint.  The more you squeeze the more water comes out.  it's child's play.  It takes seconds to figure out how much squeezing is necessary.  Filling is a doddle too as you simply unscrew the brush on top and pour water into the barrel, very convenient for filling when out and about plus they hold lots of water so filling is not required often.  With the caps on I've carried these things here and there in a pencil case in my bag for years and never once had an issue with leaking.This Caran D'Ache water pen is a totally different animal.  It looks much more stylish granted and the brand name is known for high end quality so you might be fooled into thinking the product would be better, but think again.The filling mechanism is more trouble than it's worth and the click click method of applying water is a hassle. It's a case of click click click this will take me forever with the amount I need, click oh no, too much and then  I'm trying desperately to get rid of a big blog before it drops on my painting, too late!You literally have to stop painting while you do this clicking process with thumb and index finger also, and the buttons aren't necessarily in the position you would normally be holding the brush either so you have to rearrange your hand each time or permanently paint in an uncomfortable position.Cleaning between colours is an issue also.  With the other brands you can squeeze water out with one or two squeezes that will flush the paint out of the brush, so you have a clean brush between washes.  The Caran D'Ache is not so simple.  With the click click click method of drips you don't get the flush that cleans, instead you get drips that leave you with a dirty brush to use for the next wash.All in all, I would love to give a good review for such an ordinarily high quality brand, but this product has no redeeming features.  Buy the other items and steer clear of this one. It's not fit for purpose in my opinion.

I bought these because they had good reviews. But the first time people using them in the office that I work in they took chunks of paper off instead of making a clean cut opening a letter.  I am returning this product and finding something new.

This is is not working properly in my printer. I have changed all of the cartridges and everything repeatedly prints blue or blue and yellow.  I emailed the seller and did not receive a response.  I read the reviews before purchasing and thought that the ink would be fine. However,  I am extremely disappointed. This was not a cheap purchase

Product arrived quickly; folds flat very easily. However, there is a sticker on the front of the turquoise colored stool that very clearly says for up to 320 lbs, NOT 400 as advertised.  NOTE THIS IS FOR SITTING, not for standing on the stool. I wouldn't even let a child stand on this stool!  The "hinges" are not held with any kind of plastic or metal pins. Instead, they just snap together and hold with small plastic "bumps." Therefore, the stool can completely come apart under weight - and will collapse if you are sitting, or, heaven forbid, standing on it when this happens - very dangerous!  Also, the "non-skid" foam dots on the top surface are not especially effective because they are recessed slightly, so although they might provide some slip protection, this would only work if they were exposed so they would make contact with whatever is on top of the stool.  We will not be able to use these as intended at all.  Maybe for a small side table?????  If you are looking for a sturdy, 400-lb rated stool for a person to sit on, I would recommend you look elsewhere.

The cartridge did print, so I have to give it more than one star, but it prints extra stuff down the  right side of every page.  Printed pages are not presentable. Wouldn't buy a recycled printer cartridge from RT again based on this first purchase.
Just like every other review states, the bottom is bowed so the sticky pads dont touch the desk. I had to rip the sticky pads off and glue them to the edge of the product to make it functional.
Disappointed.  Looks like a kid drew these.  If you like simple, this is for you.  The best part is that it is hard back and spiral, that’s what the two stars are for.

I don’t give bad reviews like some people do as a hobby but everything about this pad is grade A crap. Terrible for any kind of mouse. Pad is tiny, wrist pad is not that soft, too high, and takes up a third of the mousepad. The sticky adhesive back is unnecessary and leaves a big bubble in it. Got a steelseries stitched pad for my magic mouse and gaming mouse, transportable, great grip and surface area for any mouse. 1000% better. There is no need for adhesive. I have no idea how this is top rated. I expected better from 3M. Stay away no matter what your setup is. Amazon top rated products are not reliable. Sometimes they are but this was not. Read other reviews and they will say the same thing.

Product would be amazing if it actually stuck on the wall. I should've heeded another reviewer's warning about it not sticking, but didn't. I'll be taking this off my wall, rolling it up and thankfully it's free to return it. Don't waste your money on this product.
The pen is a fake. I bought it to replace a real star walker I lost. Wrong weight, metal color and documentation. Also has a deep scratch.
This does not even deserve a star... you get one pen when the description clearly says 12 pens, if I'd known this when ordering I would've spent my money elsewhere!
Very cheap plastic sleeves that would rip in less than a month. Shouldn't even get 1 star.

I like the questions (hence 2 stars instead of 1), but this book is ineffective for me.  As an executive, frequently referencing my calendar of appointments is essential.  I could not have a book (especially one of this size) displayed on my desk with such personal information on its pages.It's unnecessarily large.  Not sure if there's a point to be made with having such a large book, but it doesn't work for me.I absolutely would not buy 6 of these, especially with the pitchy introduction.  I have to say that Mr. Buchard's hubris was annoying if not humorous.  In these pages he refers to himself as "the world's leading high performance coach."  Really?!?!I also question Mr. Buchard's testing of the product.  Clearly the sample size was not large or varied enough.  I'd also be curious to know if any of those people are still schlepping this huge book around?  Honestly, if Mr. Buchard was less full of himself and acknowledged that the idea of journaling and self-reflection (yes, that's all this is) (1) is not new or novel and (2) has already proven itself to be valuable over the course of decades (or longer).  One cannot honestly give all the credit to this planner.  Now, to say that this planner may have inspired someone (or compelled them) to commit to actually journaling daily may be a fair statement, but anything more is far too grandiose for a product so simple and poorly executed.Don't waste your money.  Google morning and evening reflection questions, find a few you like and print them out as a reference to guide your daily journaling.

The one star, is only because it has a space pen refill in it. As for using this pen as a stylus, that's not going to happen. I'm not sure what was used in place of the conductive rubber, but it sucks!! I would not recommend this item to anyone. This has a POS rating.

So I bought these originally to use with my Rocketbook and for my planner and I've been using them for 2 weeks now.First I tried it in my Rocketbook and found that they dry in a thick film.  Not really a big problem until I tried to erase the color.  I did wait a full 5 minutes for the color to dry then I tried erasing with the highlighter eraser and it was gummy and thick and difficult to remove.  I was able to take my damp Rocketbook cloth to wipe it clean away (all of it) but I find it difficult to lift the color off if I only make a small mistake vs erasing the whole page or larger section with a damp cloth.I thought maybe it was maybe the Rocketbook paper so I figured that I could still use them for my disk planner since I use highlighters in it often and if appointments got canceled or rescheduled then I could just erase the highlighter and pens (I use the FriXion gel pens for my planner) and erase it all.  I had the same issue in my disk planner.  tried it on a variety of different types of paper (notebook, printer, cardstock, heavy) and I found I have the same problem with all of them which is disappointing.  On top of that, some of the color doesn't lift out and leaves a faint coloring on the paper (not in my Rocketbook).  I really wish I knew what type of paper the users used in the review videos where they lifted the color off easily because I did not have that ease of use.  I still have them and I do use them, just only as regular highlighters.
I can't give it 0 stars, but that's what it deserves because of the condition it arrived it. The box is absolutely destroyed, covered in shipping labels, and to top it off it's broken!

Very much unlike Brendon Burchard to put out an incomplete/inefficient product. Brendon usually puts out super high quality stuff. I was surprised by this planner.  The first thing is that there was nothing mentioned on morning ritual. This is a very high priority for Brendon, yet it is absent here. I would have expected at least one page of morning ritual suggestions and guidelines and a spot to put these in the planner. Next I see a weekly review and a monthly review. You see these a lot with all kinds of productivity mavens.  Don't plan weekly AND monthly. Then you end up spending a lot of time doing two review session near the end of the month. It is way more productive to only do weekly reviews. Then when you want to summarize how you are progressing you can choose to take a 4 or 8 or 12 week period or any other period that works for you and review that and see your trends in the categories that matter to you. I changed the whole thing around to fit for me and put it all on a google sheet going forwards week by week for years to come.The main thing is intent (clarity) and the the follow up on that intent by producing on that intent and not other stuff. You can get that from the planner but you do not need this many questions at the beginning and at the end of the day.So while it is not necessarily a 1 star it just took me by surprise that this planner is far less informational and usable than I would have expected coming from BB. his fans will give it an unconditional 5 star but it is not up to par. BB sorry you need to get back to the drawing board on this one despite three years of working on it. I understand it needs to be generic for it to work for everybody but it could be more streamlined and more time efficient. You have to get to the key point fast and drive those. You also need a way to set aside all the distractions.  I keep an area to write down a one or two word note about a distraction item and then I put is away knowing it is written down and I can forget about it until I have excess time to go after some of the minor unimportant non-time sensitive details. LATER is powerful. NOW is even more powerful but only if these are your MAIN priorities. This planner won't get you there efficiently.

Very seldom do I purchase a product so poorly made that I feel the need to write a review. This is the cheapest, flimsiest, overpriced piece of junk I have ever purchased. If not for my need of it, I would return it. I purchased a similar product (different brand) a couple of months ago that was much more sturdy and cost less. I am very disappointed in the quality of this item.

I read a lot and follow habit trackers and other planner books/diaries. Based on the reviews I thought this will be a good choice. But I was disappointed when deliveredProblem with this plannerfront cover torn off - Please pictures two corners at left, I can see white inside cover coming from from black cardboard. I just opened the pack and found its not worth spending too much money and at the end we get defective piece.After looking at the cover (cardboard) in bad condition. I opened the planner. Join threads will be broken anytime if page is turned.When we spend more than Rs 1400-1500 we expect product delivered with care but this time I feel its not worth buying by looking at the condition it was delivered.It looked like someone has kept it for 4-5 years and than uploaded on Amazon for selling.Very disappointing with seller and delivery
My pen didn't work after I refilled it. I bought three refills and none of them worked. So you get a rating of P.P. that stands for piss poor

201 Pages of black ink printing is what was paid for.ZERO pages printed is what I received because ink cartridge is empty.These are expensive enough and yet a so called genuine company fails quality control.I am buying looky likies from now on. Cheap Yes, Work yes, Value for money Definitely.If I could give nil stars I would.Absolutely fuming causing further delays in work submission's.Thank You very much Epsom.

The wobbly collapsing legs at a fraction of movement make this bed table useless. There should be a locking mechanism for the legs. I wouldn't recommend buying this product, but I ignored the legs complaints in other reviews myself, so if you're like me you'll probably waste your money anyway because of the design.To be fair, the design is the only reason why this didn't get a one star rating. Great design concept, if you need a photograph prop for a Living & Home bedroom shoot. If you need a useable bed table--good luck with that!

I ignored the reviews that warned that cartridges weren’t recognized by the printer and bought them anyway.
