I played with them (along with some water) for about an hour, and that was it. They were frustrating, and I knew they weren't for me. So, they were passed on to my daughter, who has dabbled in water color painting lately. I had no doubt she would love and want to keep them. Even SHE said I should return them. And so I shall. Why? Briefly...First, the results differ from pen to pen.  One pen might write fairly dark. The next will be nearly dry. And on and on. Second, the tips are literally brushes, not nylon "brush" tips. They're impossible to control for hand lettering, unless you're a pro. Third, bristles were loose and/or falling out. And less important, but still a factor --the packaging, as some have mentioned, is terrible. And on top of being awkward and flimsy, the outer sleeve of mine arrived broken and somewhat mangled. This is possibly (read: likely) the fault of the shipping facility, so that did not factor into my rating.  Don't do what I did, in ignoring the other reviews. Save yourself the hassle of returning, and the frustration and disappointment!!!

Color Cartridge came pink color cover came out and was filled with some sponge..  Useless product and I have not used once..  Unfortunately, I didn't open the cover for long time as i bought as for spare..  Once I open Color cartridge was not printing and saw that the Pink cover was loosened and came out..  I am unable to return as the it was sometime back I bough this..  I am unable to rate in negative..  Wasted my hard earned money..  Never buy this and waste our money..

I bought this for business use as all the reviews said it didn't have the hallmark on the back. The paper I received had a different picture on the front, indicating it is not the same batch of products, as well as having the hallmark on the back. I understand there may be variations in the product as more batches are made. But it means I've ended up buying something that isn't what was advertised. This has delayed my ability to fill orders.

It just won't work in my hp printer and I can't find anywhere to contact this company to get my money back. I tried everything they said to do in the instructions as well as everyone's ideas in the reviews.  I get the message Ink cartridge problem the following in cartridge must be replaced.  I press ok over and over and the message won't go away so it doesn't print.
Love the pen! Getting 1 star because I ordered a black pen and got a red one.
Wrong size for the calculator.  So can not give rating.  I would like to return item

I ordered and have been using these cartridges for several months, now.  Initially, all of them worked fine.  But I began to see streaking in the colors that I printed, which was unaffected by running a cleaning cycle on the printer, changing paper, changing print quality, etc.  After some quick research online, I learned that a common cause of this is cheaply made toner cartridges.  After changing the cartridge, VOILA!  Smooth printing again.  I gave this two stars instead of 1 because, so far, two of the four cartridges (yellow and pink) are still functioning appropriately - it was the black and cyan that got streaky.  Regardless, I won't be buying again.

This is a scam, they came with mylar package but it was already open and resealed. its not even 50 bags..its less and the plastic is old and its poly comic plastic bags. it had the right label on the front, but again this was a scam..do not buy...they were sealed in another green bag and the mylar package was inside. I just opened these thats why I didn't write review until now...I'm super pissed.

I have bought 3-4 of these over the years. This one is junk; operates roughly causing the ink to smudge, font is too small, and the ink ran out much more quickly than previous products. Of these the small font is most aggravating. Look for one bigger.I usually don't give 1 star ratings, as there is often something redeemable in a product, but this one actually should be zero stars.
I usually do not write reviews, but this time I had to. The cartridge did not work for my Brother MFC 7860dn. It was twice smaller than regular cartridge. I would not buy again!

Based on the reviews, I bought this contact paper to stick onto a wooden table. The paper stuck okay to table. However, what is most disappointing about this product is that the dry erase marker is leaving marker/shadows on it. Every dry erase marker is leaving color. Even if the numbers/words are erased soon, it still leaves that color on the paper. I would recommend looking elsewhere if you want something that is going to come clean when you are using it.

Toners arrived poorly wrapped inside a bag(one for each). There was too much loose toner inside eah of the bags. After the very first print the Toner Low message appeared on the screen of my one month old MFC9460CDN. I delivered a last minute job to one of my clients that I couldn't charge for because of the quality. The color is very inconsistent throughout the print and it doesn't distribute evenly accross the width of the cartridge. Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this product. I bought this because it wasn't that much of a gamble. If your on a budget stay away from buying this.I posted this review because I couldn't get a response from the seller.
This case is not for a standard 5oz silver bar sa stated. It does not fit it is way to small for any 5oz bar.The reviews that say fits snuggly are FOS. Do not buy for 5oz bar.

So I'm pretty disappointed. While the product is cute and appeals to my Wonder Woman collections this was poorly made. Every sticky not comes off as shown in the picture and does not stick to anything. My sister got this and has no problems i'm Sure mines a dud, but regardless I'm disappointed and won't buy this again. 0 stars if I could.

read reviews thought it would be great scale my 6 year old daughter on keto diet for her seizures so scale we were using still worked but I wonted a better one so I bought this one at first it seemed great till I notice that my daughter urine test strips were getting lighter and lighter she was getting knocked out of her keto state and didn't know what was happening till started checking the scale with a different scale and seen it was not accurate at all. I tried everything and it still not right and even used the 2 weights they come with over and over trying to make it read right and it just doesn't. I need something that I can trust and this cant not read right

SUMMARYBottom Tube (#3) was cut too longWe're looking for support. I am a highly technical person and after an hour of troubleshooting, I have determined the "Bottom Tube" (#3) was cut too long.1. The Amazon Image shows the bottom tube measuring 17.9" - while photo evidence shows the tube is 18.3" (See image uploaded with review)2. The Instructions, Step 2, Shows Pols (#6) sticking out (longer) than Bottom Tube (#3) - while video evidence shows the pole does not stick out (shorter) than the Bottom Tube (#3) (See image uploaded with review)REQUESTION SOLUTION:Immediately ship us the correctly sized Bottom Tube #3Contact us. Thank you!

I feel bad giving only two stars since the unit feels strong, but the unit I received had only two of the thickest screw which the documentation clearly states should have four of them... and this is the size screw my TV requires. So it's not very sturdy and I am constantly nervous now.Maybe after reading this they will send me new screws and I can update the review accordingly.

I bought Liquid Bearings to use on my computer trackball.  When my trackball was new, it rolled perfectly.  Over time I've had to exert more effort to get the ball rolling, which results in jerky movement.  The manufacturer no longer makes my trackball or sells replacement parts, so I thought I'd lubricate the bearings to see if it would help.I first tried skin oil (like from my forehead).  It only helped for a few hours.  I had the same result with olive oil, coconut oil, teflon gun oil, and even polishing the ball with RainX.  Nothing seemed to work for more than a few hours at best.  I even made sure to thoroughly clean the ball between each test.Enter Liquid Bearings.  It received a lot of great reviews and they mention on their site that it's good for arcade machines.  Since many arcade machines have trackballs, I thought it might work.It doesn't.It didn't help at all.  In fact, it made it much much worse.  It also smelled.  They claim it has no odor, but it does.  It's not overpowering, but it's there.Since every other oil I tried worked better, but since it may still be useful for oiling hinges or other stuff in the future, I think 2/5 stars is what it deserves.  Based on reviews, it seems to work well for machine parts that rub on each other.  It just absolutely sucks for trackballs.

I ordered this for my parents and when received, they called to tell me that they got a "used" one and that the machine did not work. It rejected both fake and real bills. When called for tech support, the people continued to transfer them from number to number, and when finally tired of that and asked for refund, they continued to volley them from number to number, only to have the operator tell them that they will "call them back", which lead them to never calling them. My parents are now returning it to get their refund. I bought this from their website, but there wasn't a review board. Don't buy this, and this company's service is terrible, it was as if they were trying to rip over 200 dollars from my parents by delaying the direct call to a direct solution. Don't have purchase from this company. If I could, I would have given them no stars, because their service was just overall terrible.

I purchased this item in an effort to keep the original chair wheels from scratching the wood floors in our home. They started off great, but about a week or two ago one of the wheels rubber cracked and fell apart. You can tell it was a manufacturer's defect. I contacted SunniDog and initially, they were very helpful and promised to send me a replacement. I provided my address as they requested, however, they have never responded to any followup communication. I have tried to contact them again over a week ago and they still haven't responded. I will update this review if I ever get the replacements.

Product would not work in my Epson xp-440 printer....returned...according to other reviews Epson firmware update has eliminated ability to use cheaper remanufactured ink cartridges...will be dumping printer and never purchasing  model again...

We bought four of these. Two of them are great, but we sent back the other two due to the edge not lying flat. I'm going to wait a month or so and see if 3M finds someone else to manufacture them. If the next purchased one lays flat, I will change my review to 5 stars.

I purchased this item and the warranty is for 90 days (3 months). At 3 months and a few days it stopped working. I tried all the things recommended to fix it. They all failed.I phoned the company and was told the same thing obtech (see this persons review) was told.We can't fix it, we can't repair it, even at my expense. But they will give you a code to get 20-30 bucks off a new one.This item is fun and nice once you set it up, but the warranty is something the company needs to fix.At best a minimum of 1 year from date of purchase if it fails due to no fault of your own.This item was never dropped nor damaged.3 months, 100 dollars. 30 bucks a month for a grocery list.  :(I'd also recommend Amazon take this and any other "smartshopper" grocery list off their selling list til the warranty warrants buying it.Beware !!

I read some reviews saying it was easy to break, but more reviews said it was good so I took a chance. I’ve had it for a month and it literally just fell off my desk and onto carpet. The clip and the spring holding it to the board broke off so it’s no longer of use and I have to buy another one. It’s the first time it’s fallen so I was sad to see it immediately became unusable.

When trying to activate I could not.  Called ooma support.  They told me unit had charges on it  from previous owner.  I could not activate it till all charges where paid up.  I asked what charges where.  They told me to pay charges and then when they activated the unit they would tell me  the charges and after they had my CC number.Customer service rep. could no understand why I would not give him a open CC number.I asked for a supervisor and he hung up on me.  Believe all the reviews about customer service from prior reviews.Ooma has a good product , its too bad the customer service department ruins their reputation.Unit returned to Amazon
I loved the product; however I was spammed by continuous emails asking for a rate this product which I found exceptionally annoying and frustrating.

I trusted the good reviews and ignored the bad. Well, what a waste. This toner lasted no more than a week. I did a get 200 pages or so out of it, but that's it. I even set it inside the original Brother brand holder for the toner.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Just spring for the real thing.
These work great for the Pilot Colleto. +5 stars for writing experience, -2 stars because they run out very quickly, and -1 star because they’re expensive for what you get. Overall 2 stars

This is a seriously tiny cart.  It is very easy to put the wheels on, so that's why I gave it 2 stars.  It does not, however, carry much of anything.  Not good for laundry or groceries if you shop for too many things.  I realize this is my fault because I looked at a lot of carts and did not have a good sense of the size.  It would be very good for a little old person who cannot carry anything at all.  Or someone who would just shop for 6 things and wanted to push a cart instead of carry a bag.Also, it is made in China and the wheels smell like gasoline.

I had high hopes for this planner, and did extensive research prior to taking the plunge to the Cossac planner from Erin Condren, which has been my stalwart partner in productivity for many years. Unfortunately, despite having the exact layout that I’ve been looking for (separate monthly, weekly, and daily sections) and the exact daily agenda design that I wanted, this planner is incredibly disappointing. The pages are so thin that even the lightest pens bleed through. Unless you write in pencil (with a light hand) this planner is likely not for you. I’m using standard Flair pens, not permanent markers and I’ve never had them bleed through a planner like this. I was all in for this to be my perfect holy grail planner and instead, I’m angry because I wasted 20$ on a planner and then wasted planner stickers in it before realizing how thin the pages are. If I had not already written/used stickers in it, I’d be asking for a refund.If I could give 0 stars I would. Ideal layout is 100% overshadowed by crappy paper.

Note pad arrived with the magnetic strip adhered on the cardboard back at the geometric center of the cardboard (unlike some that I see in the reviews where the magnetic strip is positioned along the top edge of the back).  This makes the note pad useless to hang on the fridge since the cardboard is too light to remain flat against the fridge due to the weight of the pad (at least the magnet does its job).  Two stars.  Decided to tear the cardboard back off and keep the note pad on the counter.
Like others I used this in the past with 5 star results.  The quality is gone.  Print so light it's not readable.  Pages falling out.  Didn't make it half the year.

My daughter loves this calender and looks forward to updating it every month. However as a parent this product was shipped in bad shape. I should have had Amazon send another. This had to have been sitting around the warehouse for a few years. The boards themselves were very warped. The magnets with the years on them were for years 2009 - 2013. I bought this in 2011. A few weeks after getting this for my daughter we bought one for a friend as a birthday gift from a local store. The boards were nice a straight - no warping and the magnetic years started at 2011. The identical item but in much better shape. I guess I blame Amazon for sending something out that was in bad shape and apparently sitting around for a few years. If not for it being old and in bad condition I would have given it 5 stars.

The clips themselves are really nice but my pack was missing one. Wasn’t until close to the end of the project that I noticed. Now my project is incomplete and I still need a single clip but can’t buy just one. If the product had come as advertised with the correct number of clips would be 5 stars.

I really did not enjoy working with these pencils. I found them really chalky (pieces of lead were breaking on my page), the color didn't fill in or build up easily, and I personally did not enjoy using a triangular barrel. I honestly prefer Crayola over these, which are cheaper and easily found in most stores.I also found that the wood on these were very soft and would just peel back from the lead. I'm not sure if that affects anything, though it was odd.Overall I really did dislike these pencils.  I hate the page I started so much that as of now I don't plan to finish it.  I would never buy these again and I would not recommend them.  The pictures I added show some fine detail that I used gel pens for,  but mainly it is just the use of these pencils.  I hope you find this review helpful.
The ink quality is good, but mine broke the first time I used it. Will have to get it replaced before updating my review.

I love Amazon Basics in general, and I rarely submit reviews unless I feel very strongly about the product in question, but this purchase represents one of those very cases. All 500 envelopes have proven useless after discovering, like some other reviewers, they are each and every one sealed in the box. I tried opening 4 or 5 gently, threw a handful of 20-30 onto the ground in frustration, calmed down, grabbed another dozen or so, and tried more experimental methods, like heating the glue with a hairdryer. Now another 20-30 have been Gronk-spiked to my office floor. I regret to say, the entire supply is a loss, unless one counts their use as a victimless target of rage a catharsis of some value. I don't.

It was a cool looking calculator for very short money so it got two stars for that. But the display was very hard for me to read. Then after a few weeks the display lost parts of the numbers. But it didn't cost much so I didn't bother with return, and just tossed it. Oh well.

I am a teacher. Like many other teachers I find myself buying my own materials with my money knowing I will never see that money again. For that reason, I want what I buy to do the job advertised and to do it for a long period of time. This product arrived with a crease the entire length of the grid. No matter what I tried I could not get rid of the crease. This product will NOT static cling to a whiteboard. I gave it two stars because it is still a good tool to use for teaching. It is large enough for all my students to see and it is easy to erase. I have to tape and untape it frequently to/from the board which has caused damage and this will not last long. The company was sure to send a product catalog with this purchase. Based on the failures of this product I will not be using this company again.
Very disappointed in this ink.  I can’t even use it the color is so bad.  I didn’t even want to give it one star

One of these cartridges worked for a few pages, then I got a message saying the cartridge was not compatible with my printer. Another color ran out after only printing a few pages. I have purchased cartridges for lower prices than these that worked satisfactorily. If they worked reliably, I could give these a higher rating. Fortunately I found these problems while a refund was still available, so there's just the minor annoyance of shipping them back.

After looking through the description and reading the positive reviews, I was sold on this product and was excited.When I opened the card though, I saw what I perceived to be as dust on the inside.  But it had a green tint to it so I looked at it more carefully and it was all around the card and on the sleeve.  It turned out to be mold.  I wanted to like the card as I think the design is great and I'm hoping that I'm the only one affected.

2 weeks ago I ordered this set. One cartridge failed and the company is making me jump through multiple hoops just to get my money refunded. Based on the reviews, this product is not anything to buy. Stay away from them.

Prints fine, fits fine, as it should at nearly the price of the printer!  The product is virtually flawless.  It does everything it claims and, as such deserves to be "liked"  I also really like most Canon products in general.  My rating is a protest against printers becoming  a vehicle for selling ink at exorbitant prices.  This is not limited to Canon. the printer becomes throw away, the ink is the drug.

Definitely NOT 80 lb. paper as listed. Yes, the color is pretty, BUT the paper is flimsy, thus I had to back up every piece of paper with another piece of cardstock in order to make the banner letters....so essentially it doubled my work. One corner of each paper in the package was slightly bent. BOTH of these issues are mentioned by other reviewers (which I should have read before ordering!) It seems like Envelopes.com could fix these issues by correctly listing the weight of the paper and providing a better shipping container.

I read the reviews and figured people were over reacting about the smell. They were not! After using the product my arms smell like the pad through my shirt. It was strong enough that my cube neighbor commented on it. I attempted washing it hoping that might take the edge off, it did not. I was only able to use it for about 2.5 hours before I began to get a sinus headache.The pad is a nice size and thickness however it does not smell like any other rubber backed mouse pad I have.Buy this with EXTREME CAUTION!-well unless you don't have a sense of smell.
The planner was only stapled to a paper insert; it ripped out of the case with gentle use.How can this have received 4.5 stars??

I wanted to like this paper cutter but the blade wiggles and prevents an accurate cut.  Then I found out replacement blade is VERY costly to the tune of $25 per blade if you can find them.  Attached is a picture of a pack of 3 for $75 I found searching on Amazon.  On a side note: I chose not to buy replacement blades and instead bought the Fiskers cutter https://www.amazon.com/Fiskars-SureCut-Deluxe-Trimmer-152490-1004/dp/B0038F1A0S/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1517852140&sr=8-4&keywords=fisker+paper+cutter it has a triple track (no wiggle blade).  Replacement blades for this is only $6 for a set of 2. Hope this review helps you.

My initial review was as follows: They work great, and I really like that they make it easy to recycle the used cartridgesSince then, however, one of the cartridges has stopped working. I like Brendon. But this planner is a letdown. On the daily pages, it has TEN morning questions! And they are the same every morning. I think it might have been more effective to rotate through 2 of those per day for the week. And then there are six additional questions for evening. Again, same questions day after day. These two sections take about 40% of the two-page daily spread. Way too much, in my opinion.I do however like the weekly two-page weekly review. I'll keep the planner just for that.To me, this is not a planner. It's more of a prompt journal with a calendar awkwardly stuffed in the middle.

We loved this pencil sharpener until it quit working after 5 months. When I plugged it in today it would not even turn and I made sure the outlet was working. I've used this product for over a year on a daily basis. Over this time period, I must have gone through maybe 1,000 or more of them.  Based on my experience, this product has 30% defective rate, meaning that 3 out of every 10 are not useable. This is an extremely high number and not acceptable.  The common problems I see include visible scratches, imperfections on the plastic, and dirt on the surface. Every time I toss them away, I am literally tossing money into the trash bin.  I will continue to use it for now until I can find a better product from another company.

Wow. I never review products on Amazon but since this is such a scam figured I’d warn future buyers. We seriously thought it was a defect with our printer that had been working fine before. Turns out these ink cartridges are basically empty!!! The following is my review for this brand's toner that I purchased with the drum.  Since the drum and the toner work together and I can't pinpoint which of the two items (or both) are causing my issues, I'm simply copying and pasting my toner review here:"I felt compelled to write this review:  Sometimes when a see a couple of negative reviews, but the majority of reviews are good, I decide to take a chance and purchase.  This was the case here, but it was a mistake.  The other negative reviews regarding leaking are absolutely correct.  Here was my experience:I saw this brand on sale when it was the "Deal of the Day."  I have a Brother MFC-8950DW, so I purchased the matching toner and drum unit.  At first, the printing appeared nice.  However, the toner smudges VERY easily.  So, when I went to scan various documents, the toner smudged and I had to reprint almost 100 pages and then rescan them.  This wasted about 30 minutes of my time.  However, the worst happened a couple of days after installing the toner and drum...the toner began leaking.  There were blotches of toner over the paper.  Based on another reviewer stating that the leaking ruined his printer, I quickly removed the toner and drum and replaced it with the original drum and toner I had, since there was some life left in them.  The blotches continued for the next 5-10 pages or so, but then stopped...thank goodness!When packaging up the toner and drum to return to Amazon, the toner leaked out and covered my hands.So, if you are on the fence like I was regarding this company and their printer accessories, do yourself a huge favor and don't make the same mistake I did by taking a chance.  Stay far away!It's too bad because the Brother accessories are so overpriced.  I tried another off-brand toner with the Brother drum (this is the toner I was aiming to replace), but the printing is much lighter than the Brother toner.  At least it isn't leaking, though.  So, I still haven't found off-brand Brother accessories with quality equivalent to the Brother accessories.  At this point, I'm thinking about ponying up the money for the Brother-branded items since right now I'm paying the price of wasting my time and dealing with cruddy-quality prints in exchange for saving some money up front on the items themselves."

They need to change the picture... I didn't see the reviews until after I ordered. You get one tube with 5 small erasers. The box looks like 12 tubes, but that is misleading. I could have gotten the eraser on top of new pencils with lead for the same or cheaper price elsewhere.

I love rolleer balls and this brand had a solid review and I have had what I assumed was this kind before. What I like about the bold free flowing oe. Is the the smooth lines and ease they write with.  I am writing fast and need that to remain legible without breaking my stride. I also use these pens for art which includes watercolors that need definition and cartooning. They can be a joy to use. These werw not as bikd as I hoped and the ink tended to stagger early in. What makes me angry however is how quickly the ink ran out. This is a common issue with pens today. I don't pay $3 for a own to write a couple letters and throw it out. unfortunately, I had to change my initial 5-star review to a 1-star review. I have 12 types of pen refills, none of which fit this pen. I'm not going to scour the gd earth for refills, so this will sit in a drawer until the end of time once the ink runs out. The setup process was smooth, the unit integrated nicely with my network. Call quality is good, perhaps a bit tinny but better than expected. However, the service is not that great of a deal, overall. I paid for the equipment upfront, I pay about $6/mo in taxes and, to get the essential call-blocking features, I have to pay an additional $10/mo. The basic service isn't compatible with Nomorobo so there is literally no soft-option for call blocking with Ooma basic and that is really aggravating. I'll have to cough up more monthly fees or buy another piece of hardware. All considering, there are other VOIP providers who would have made more economic sense. Several well-rated VOIP competitors cost around $8/mo, offer call-blocking bundled in and provide the hardware free-of-charge.

One image on the item clearly indicates that there are 25 covers in a box - I thought I was buying a box of 25 covers.  Very disappointed with this purchase - not 25 covers and not sturdy.  I guess I should have read the reviews.

I regret buying this. I was swayed by the other reviews and was certain it would handle the New York City sidewalks like so many other carts do. But literally, the first time I tried to use it, the wheels kept coming off. I had to stop and put them back on about 15 times, and they would only stick for about 30 feet at a time. The mechanism for holding the wheels on is very flimsy; it was just a bit of plastic and a pin, and once those broke it was completely unusable. I'm depressed I even wasted money on this thing. I really would not recommend buying it at all. When it came apart at a busy intersection, I abandoned it because I couldn't take it anymore.

Would prefer to give it no stars.  A piece of junk.  Do not waste your money.  Pre-drilled holes did not match up and the metal connectors are made of a soft metal that they bend.  Don't bare any weight on this as it will topple over if it doesn't break beforehand.

This was my second one of these and now I am fed up enough to write a review. The product is a great idea overall, it is just not durable. The metal line and the sturdy feel are great, but the reeling component (the most important part) has broken quickly and often. After numerous repair jobs, my second one of these finally crapped out and I am done with them. The cheaper ones with thin string line last much longer. Do yourself a favor, save the money and frustration, just buy a cheaper one.

So I've only had two letter openers in my lifetime.  The long one where you just slip under the flap and this one.  I lost my long one so I needed another one.  This isn't a good replacement. awful. I ordered it b/c reviews said it came flat.  It did not.  It is also thin and develops dents you can't roll out of.
This review is based on adhesion and strength. Neither are up to par. We attempted to use this to hang a sign on a metal frame. The sign fell along with the adhesive.

I would never have thought I would have to write this review. I love this company, and I have ordered their beautiful calendars for many years. No more. As I was filling in the early part of 2018 and looking through the rest of the pages, I noticed that all the Jewish holidays were missing. I wrote the company, thinking that surely that was an oversight, since many holidays not even celebrated in the U.S.were listed. As I never got a response from the company, I called them. I thought surely they would need to do a reprint. I was told that I got the Catholic calendar, and that is the only calendar without the Jewish holidays. Now this particular calendar has Bible verses (which is the main reason I ordered it), from Psalms and Proverbs as well as the New Testament. I was floored at her answer. I said that Scripture verses are not exclusively Catholic, and that I am not Catholic or Jewish either, but I am appalled. She said they make over 70 calendars and that this is the only one without the Jewish holidays. I told her that she was not making this conversation go any better,  that I am the wife of a Messianic Jew, and we are both shocked and appalled. Anti-Semitism has no place here. From now on, I will choose another company.

I purchased two of these cartridges a little less than a year ago, so this review speaks volumes about the longevity of this product.When I initially installed and started using this product, I would have given it five stars in a heartbeat. It worked great for about 4 or 5 months, but then the issues began. I started getting streaking toner and what looked like low toner levels (after ~400 pages). I am a tech savvy grad student, so I did all of the troubleshooting including cleaning the cartridge, shaking it, reinstalling, etc. The cartridge had most of the toner remaining in it, but I could not get it to print without issues. Nothing worked.I finally gave up and installed the second cartridge. It worked like a charm......for about 4 or 5 months. The same issues with streaking and light printing started occurring with this cartridge as well. I print about 1000 pages per year, so these two cartridges should have lasted (theoretically) 5 years. In reality, they lasted less than a year.If you do the math, the price per page is equivalent to the Brother cartridge, which is disappointing. I am about to purchase a different set of non-oem cartridges to see if they work any better. I'll leave a review on those in a year or two!
SAVE YOUR MONEY THIS DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. I SHOULD HAVE TAKEN THE ADVISE OF THE OTHER REVIEWERS ON HERE.

We tried shaking the toner cartridge (age-old trick) and reinserting it a few times, but it just prints documents in medium gray.

Bought it twice and  two times the line broke. The first time I thought maybe a bad reel. The second one didnt even last a month. I'm only going to give 2 out of 5 stars. I counted the tabs to make sure I had over a 1000, which I did. While counting, i found random junk such as part of a can, a nail, a hair clip and some hair. I can assure you my hair is not short and black. There was 1004 silver tabs, 19 big random tabs, 92 colored tabs and 2 broken can tabs. I read in the description that these would have been washed prior to being sent. My fingers say otherwise. Please remove that part of the description if you aren't going to do it. If you don't care about size,color, dirt or the danger of nails, these are the tabs for you.
Didn’t buy it but it’s in my shopping list review?!

I thought I'd try to save a few dollars and get the "remanufactured cartridges", BIG mistake, I have the epson 446 and it has poor print quality and prints all of my pictures with a green/yellow tint, I wish I would have read the reviews first, instead of after my purchase, lesson learned, hopefully this review will help someone else, just spend the extra few bucks and get the actual epson ink

Unfortunately, I forgot to look at the reviews before my purchase. Spent hours putting it together only for the drawer to get stuck. The drawers do not glide easily and it is not a user error. I’m just disappointed I wasted so much time putting it together to have take it apart and return it. Time is money!

There is a great deal of difference between "Remanufactured" and simply filling an empty cartridge with ink. I do not believe that this company knows the difference. I  bought two cartridges. I tried both of them 3.5 months later. BOTH of them had dry and crusted ink between the printhead and stuck onto the rubber sponge in the holder. It was stuck SO hard that in spite of very slow removal, the printhead ripped the rubber sponge and tore part off. I wrote an honest and sensible letter to the manufacturer and told them of my difficulties. I was met with a FIRM "Those cartridges are only warranted for 90 days. You are over that. I'm sorry, but there is NOTHING I can do for you." Allrighty then! So much for THIS company and the member of their "customer satisfaction TEAM."My experience with MANY different printers and cartridges are that on a new sealed cartridge that is as old as 4 YEARS out of date that the cartridge performs PERFECTLY. One would think that a genuine REMANUFACTURED item would work out of the sealed container at LEAST 6 months later. Not so on these worthless items. It is difficult to believe that the company would not at least offer me a replacement set after I returned these. They refused to talk about these cartridges any further than they already had. Take a peek at the one star ratings. There are almost as many 1 ratings as 5 ratings. Perhaps they have two shifts? One shift with someone that knows something about refilling or REMANUFACTURING and one that is told to "fillerup".  You decide. I am relating ONLY my personal experience with this company.

The area that the laptop rests in is metal, so if you have a Macbook like I do, your metal edge will rub against the metal of that area. I am referring to the bottom section underneath the lip.Otherwise I'd give this 5 stars. It's light and seems pretty well made. A bit awkward to adjust, if you plan on using it in different places and positions it could be a real pain to adjust constantly.

I bought this in spite of the bad reviews as it was the only plastic file cab I could find.  Sterilite used to make a great one, but they discontinued it.  As others have noted, it tips over when you open it, which makes it hard to close again.  It is OK for just a few files, or maybe if you took off the wheels it wouldn't tip.

I've purchased several sets of nylon brush tip markers and these are by far the worst.  Im so disappointed and I've already set up the return.  Im uploading a photo to demonstrate my primary issues.  The first is most easily visible: the brush tips split apart.  Add that to the fact that some of the markers aren't very "juicy", and you get markers that aren't consistently useful unless you plan to blend them with a water brush every time.My biggest complaint is the ink.  It's terrible.  I swatched every color in the box,  and while some blend well,  many do not.  I read other reviews that said you have to use specific paper with these markers...i tried both the Strathmore 90lb watercolor visual journal paper and the Strathmore Bristol Smooth surface paper.  The performance was better on the smooth surface paper  (which is not the point of watercolor markers), but even then some colors like A188 wisteria purple just wouldn't blend. Don't waste your time or money on these.

I should have minded the reviews.  same thing happened to me.  I like the way the pen writes and looks. The problem is that when i put the cap on, it bent a thin guide bar in the cap that bent and i couldnt close the cap again. It Its a shame because I really like parker pens and its such an unnecessary problem and design flaw.

From the photos and reading reviews I was under the assumption that what I was buying was a quality dry erase calendar....what arrived was nothing more than maybe 1/2" thick and weighed hardly anything at all. Basically all you are purchasing is a very thin piece of cardboard with handful of accessories and the possibility of some functionality. Does not come with any kind of hanging device other than some 3M PERMANENT hanging stickers. THESE WILL TEAR PAINT FROM WALLS, you have been warned. Will be sent back to Amazon first thing tomorrow and I will spend a few dollars more for a board that's going to last a little while.

There is no measurement, which is fine, but at its widest point it makes 7.5" circles, not 8" circles, so if you're looking for a true 8" compass, look elsewhere. There are caps on the ends of of the center screw that prevent it from going to 4". When I remove those caps and put it to 4" the whole thing literally falls apart. It comes in a nice zip closure package and looks presentable, if using it for 7.5" or less it's acceptable. Hence, 2 stars. Not quite as advertised, but decent enough for what it is.

Ill admit to not having too much experience with fountain pens, but no pen should be this hard to write with.  The first time I received this it was completely dysfunctional.  The ink that came with the pen ran to the point of leaving a small puddle on my desk after leaving it unattended for five minutes.  My own noodlers ink however simply did not work at all.  After I got a replacement for this one thinking that it was just a one time thing I was only partially right.  While the provided ink still dripped like a water faucet my noodlers ink worked after almost thirty minutes of coaxing.  Since then I have only refilled it twice but it has never smoothly gone through a full cartridge without drying out for no plain reason.  I have a cheap little plastic fountain pen that so far works without fail and uses the ink cartridges that this pen couldn't without issue.  Based on other reviews I would say that my pen just has issues.  While it doesn't work like it should, when the ink does run nicely it is a great pen that I love to use... right up until it stops working again.
Finally, I realized that to save money and frustration review products hands on. Stop wasting my money on junk. Look for other options.

My wife has used this cart for a year now.  We are aware of the other negative reviews that said the cart can easily tip over on any uneven surfaces and we were careful about it.  However, last week, when my wife was returning home from a grocery trip, the front wheel tripped over a small uneven part on of the sidewalk.  She fell forward and landed on top of the cart.  She severely injured herself with large bruises on both legs.  I wasn't there and she was left by herself to limp back home with a cart full of groceries.  This cart is good when you're at the supermarket with level surfaces, but it can be treacherous when you use it outside.  Any small bump on the sidewalk would stop this cart and there'd be a good chance you'll stumble or fall.  We're not going to use this anymore and I'm going to look for a better alternative.

My mom bought this for me for Christmas, and I'm very disappointed. I had read the reviews and thought this would work really well for me. Right out of the box, one of the screws holding the leg to the desk fell out and would not be screwed back in. A few weeks later, the same piece fell out of another leg, rendering the desk useless. I'm really bummed out because I really wanted this to work for me, but I ended up throwing it away after only using it a few times. It was a great concept, but it just did not live up to what I had read about it. Overall, I would not recommend this desk for purchase.

This planner is infuriating. Did anybody in the design team realize that they should have put  “Month Ahead At A Glance” in the front of the book and then the “Monthly Review” at the end of the month. And the same layout for the next 30 days.Some of the things the ask you to record are repetitive. There’s also no section for just random notes you may need. It needs to be simplified.I appreciate what the book says but from a design background/perspective I can’t get over the layout. I wanted this book to feel like it was MADE FOR ME. This feeling that just hits my heart and makes the book feel like my personal assistant but they honestly dropped the ball.I really wanted to like this book. I hope someone from the design team sees this and makes a 2.0 version. I would buy it then I think. Unfortunately I already started writing in it before I realized it so I can’t return it. Maybe I’ll just make a copy of the month ahead and staple it to a page in the front so the book will work then. Idk.

I get bands from the bank all the time and decided to buy my own. The printing on the bands seemed like the company ran out of ink as they were printing these bands and the lines on the bands were not evenly spaced. I'm giving this product a star because at least the adhesive works. The picture I attached shows you the bands I bought from amazon vs the "official" bands banks use.

I opened the first cartridge and spewed ink all over my beige  carpet as well as all over my hands.  I printed two pages.  Neither printed well.  I started to print again today - my printer told me the ink cartridge needed to be replaced.  I took out the second cartridge, this time holding it over my computer desk - I now have ink splattered all over my desk, as well as some papers I was working on.  Oh yeah - my hands are covered again.  All I did was remove the orange tray they are shipped in.  I am beyond angry.  The one star rating is way too high.  I don't think there is anything that will take the ink out of my carpet.  When I tried to blot it up it just spread around.  If you buy this garbage my suggestion is to be VERY careful when you take the packing tray off.  Unless you don't mind having everything splattered with black ink.  And two pages per cartridge,  Give me a break.

Only reason why I am giving it a 2 star is because it worked right out of the box and installed pretty easy.  The trouble is that after no more than 5000 prints, it's now printing light vertical stripes to light streaks up and down in 3 column on every page.  It turns out that this is a COMMON problem reported by many Xerox ColorQube customers.  They walk you through a process of cleaning, running cleaning page, we even replaced the maintenance kit, check the debris tray.  We have done everything!  This printer is a piece of s***  People beware...again this is a common problem as we discovered but it's too late to return.  Oh, well now we've learned.  I honestly think they should recall this printer and swap out customers devices with newer & working Xerox color printer.  I have been loyal Xerox customers for over 20 years and now we're surprised to find these qualities is not representative of what the company and the brand have always stood for.

I almost cut myself putting it together.  The center pin and one blade broke on the first use. It left a jagged and obvious patch.  The only reason I am giving it one star is that I can't give it no stars.

I wouldn't buy this again.1.  The instructions don't tell you how to dump the shavings.  (You squeeze at the right place on the shavings bucket -- that's on upper corners.  There are no markings there -- you have to know.)2.  It doesn't work on normal size round pencils.  The hole is fractionally under 8mm so the 8mm ones (common colored pencils made in metric system countries)  have to be forced in using two hands and it's all but impossible to turn the pencil while sharpening as several reviewers recommend.In theory you could use a rat-tail file to slightly enlarge the cover and inside holes.  In practice the switch that turns the thing on sticks into the inside hole so if you file down there you'll likely disable the thing.Might be okay if all you have is the (smaller)  standard hex leadpencil.
I printed approx. 40 9x11  pages of  my toolbox inventory and got the low ink message!!!! Not near 315 sheets guys! Never again will I buy Ink online!  Your lucky to get 1 star. What a scam!

Purchased 2/7/15, date of review 3/23/15.  Wish I would have read other reviews before purchasing.  This sign is not 24X14.  It is 21X12, which is perfectly fine with me.  For the first few weeks I was happy with the overall functionality of the sign.  I like that is is oval and that the blue lights will create a movement to catch people's eye.  However, less than 2 months after purchasing the sign, it has malfunctioned.  The red lights do not stay consistently bright.  Sometimes the O and the P are dim while the E and N are bright.  Other times, the E and N are dim while the O and P are bright.  The chain that came with the light was not long enough for my situation, but I purchased a chain at a local hobby store that worked great.  Now, if the sign would just work properly, I would be happy.  Contacting the seller today to see what they are willing to do.  I will update this when I see what their response is.UPDATE 4/10/2015.  I was given a refund by Amazon for the 1st defective light, in late March.  Stupidly, I decided to give the light another chance, but from a different seller (as advised by Amazon).  The 2nd light, which was received from a different seller was received not working.  It also had 2 letters that would not light.  That seller sent me a replacement (making this my 3rd one!!!) and it was GREAT for a WEEK!!!  After just ONE WEEK,  the blue lights around the letters STOPPED WORKING!!!! I do NOT recommend this product!!! It should be BANNED FROM AMAZON!!!  Today, I had to file a complaint with Amazon due to the poor service of the company involved.  Guess I will be purchasing a sign locally for over $100.  Guess the old saying is true, "You get what you pay for!"!!!

To echo prior reviews, it is a gamble when you order these, as to how many cartridges will work for the long term.  The review should probably be 2.5 starts, since these are just okay, and we continue to order them despite problems.  I have purchased these several times through my prime account and through our office account, and have occasionally had the entire package of cartridges work, but more often one or two of the color cartridges fails / leaks / streaks or stops being recognized by the printer.  Occasionally the problem occurs right away after installation, but more often than not the problem crops up about one week into use.  LD is mostly pretty good about replacing a defective cartridge, but sometimes because we order the larger packs, we don't install the cartridges right away.  So, while the price is great (about a third of the OEM), the savings has to be balanced against the time lost to fiddling around with the cartridges and trying to clean them and get them to keep producing; the time lost dealing with replacing the cartridge(s); the time lost while the HP printer pauses and goes into cleaning mode (sometimes two or three times on a 100 page copying job); and the frustration of having the printer become useless when we have critical color print jobs.
DO NOT BUY IT, IT IS NOT AL-STAR.My pen has a plastic body, not aluminum as advertised. IT'S CHEATING!
